name: WalletHub
review: If you have good or excellent credit and a family member with a Disney affinity, the Disney Premier Credit Card could ultimately provide some magical savings. You’ll receive a $100 initial bonus for spending at least $500 within the first three months of account opening, in addition to 2% back on Disney purchases as well as at gas stations, restaurants and grocery stores, plus 1% back on everything else. Your earning potential therefore depends on how much you spend in those bonus categories. Your ability to redeem your earnings, on the other hand, will depend on how often you make Disney purchases or indulge in air travel — your only two redemption options. Considering that lack of flexibility and the impressive value available elsewhere in the rewards-credit-card market, even ardent Disney fans may find a non-cobranded card to be more to their liking. If you’re on the fence, you can learn more about this offer from our full-length Disney Credit Card review: https://wallethub.com/edu/disney-credit-card-review/25988/.

name: Adam McCann
review: Sapphire Preferred is the card of choice for people who travel frequently but not enough to pay the enormous annual fees that some luxury travel cards charge. Preferred's fee is manageable and is covered for multiple years by the initial bonus. In addition, this card rewards travel well while still having a decent return on non-travel purchases. The lack of a foreign transaction fee makes it great to use abroad, as well.

name: Alex Mackey
review: Beware, Chase Bank DOESN'T keep your money safe!A few weeks ago, a scammer wrote me a check for $23,000 to purchase a car with $8,500 going to shipping that car (along with a few others he was supposedly buying in the Florida area) up to Philadelphia. I deposited the check on 8/9/21 and Chase bank put a 9-day hold on it to make sure it would clear. I was actually grateful for that. I told the scammer that no car or money would be transferred until the check cleared.Nine days later, the check cleared and the money was legitimately in the bank. He had me send $8,400 to give to the "shipper". I sent the money to the shipper and scheduled the date for pickup. The day the car was supposed to get picked up I got an email saying the scammer's father, for whom he was purchasing the car, had died that day and could he have his money back. Fortunately I said no.ALMOST A WEEK LATER... on 8/27/21 I logged into my chase account to find every penny left in my checking account had been cleared out. I panicked thinking this guy had hacked my account somehow. It was worse...Chase had allowed TD Bank, (the bank that issued the check) to go back in and reclaim everything in my checking account.This was almost three weeks after I deposited the check AND NINE DAYS after the check had cleared!!What kind of bank let's their own customer's accounts just get cleared out long after a check has been cashed, had a hold on it, verified that it was okay and then three weeks later just lets another bank come in and take all the money left in the account?!DO NOT TRUST CHASE. THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS OR THE MONEY IN YOUR ACCOUNTS. THEY WILL GIVE AWAY YOUR MONEY AND LET OTHER BANKS JUST COME IN AND PILFER YOUR ACCOUNTS.MONEY IS NOT SAFE WITH CHASE AND NOW I AM LEFT WITH A ZERO ACCOUNT BALANCE IN A TIME WHERE I HAVE NO JOB BECAUSE MY AFTER-SCHOOL ART PROGRAM BUSINESS WAS DESTROYED BY COVID.Please share this story as a word of warning to others so they don't get scammed by Chase Bank.DO NOT TRUST CHASE BANK.

Their customer service reps are rude and could care less about helping you. They make promises they don't keep. There are much better options out there: Citibank and AMEx are two.

name: scottvincentmills
review: The following is a response I gave to a questionnaire sent to me after a meeting with a Chase bank representative about service fees Chase charged to my mother's checking account.'Your bank representative was great and he was as helpful as he could be.  I have POA for my 95 year old mother, Maxine.  Maxine banks with Chase Bank and has for decades.  Her living expenses are withdrawn from her Chase account monthly and her life savings are slowly being depleted over time.  A few months ago her life savings dropped below $75,000 and at that time the bank began charging her a $25 per month service fee.  I failed to discover the new fees until last week.  My recent visit to the bank was to ask your bank representative to change Maxine's account to a more appropriate plan that would not charge the $25 monthly fee.  I was told that her current plan provided her a slightly greater interest rate which amounted to a few pennies per month.  Therefore, Maxine, or any like customer, would receive no benefit for the $25 monthly fee.  I asked him if Chase would refund the service fees to my mother's account because I believe the bank has a responsibility to their customers to act in their best interest.  We are talking about a simple alert on each account to notify the bank when a customer's plan is no longer appropriate.  He said that Chase, by policy, does not refund service fees but he would ask Chase management for an exception.  He said that Chase would likely not make an exception though.  I wonder how many elderly people have failed to discover that Chase automatically begins charging new service fees when their life savings dwindle and fall below some arbitrary minimum amount that they agreed to when they set up the account?  I know that Chase's intentions are good, but this can be perceived as a deceptive business practice. It seems that by policy your customers are responsible to catch the bank when a plan begins charging such service fees and to request that the bank change their plan to one that is appropriate and fair.  It also seems that if a bank customer fails to discover that the bank is charging them exorbitant fees associated with an inappropriate and unfair plan; then too bad for your customer.You asked for my opinion and there it is.  I give your bank representative 8 stars but I give only 2 stars to Chase Bank.'

Several other customer service representatives have put me on hold for 20min, and then hang up the phone. Chase is absolutely horrible business to deal with. Local branch representative refused to get involved because they do mess with corporate. The government needs to stop bailing them out with our taxpayer money. Chase deserves to die.

review: This is a great card. I loved that I picked the date I want to pay and if I need to it can be changed to a more convenient date. Free credit monitoring is a plus!

name: mitchell2973
review: This is my favorite card in my credit arsenal! It’s my everyday card because of the 1.5% cash back, and they made it even better by increasing to 3% on drugstores and dining. It’s got a decent interest rate (but I try not to carry a balance on this card). I now have 3 Chase cards: Chase Freedom (with the rotating categories), Freedom Unlimited and now the Chase Sapphire. They serve different purposes in my wallet. The Freedom has the lowest interest rate so if I carry a balance it’s on this card. The Freedom Unlimited is my everyday card, and now the Sapphire has travel benefits and no foreign transaction fee (but a REALLY high interest rate!) I will take the time to surf around my spending to get the best reward percentage out of each card. It does take a bit of effort but I can’t stand NOT earning 3% back when I could be. And I always activate the “Chase Offers” for places I might shop. You get an automatic statement credit, with a percentage or a flat $ back. A lot of reviews complain that they were not approved for the Unlimited card even with high credit. I had a different non-rewards Chase card that I never used because it didn’t earn anything back. I called up Chase to ask if I could be upgraded to their Unlimited rewards card. Voila! The site and app is super easy to navigate, and I can easily see all my accounts at a glance. I like how you can transfer rewards easily between cards - earn rewards from Freedom or Unlimited, then transfer them to Sapphire for the shop through Chase bonus. It’s like Chase is paying ME to use their cards!

review: Great card and the points are well worth it and chase customer service is great. I would recommend this bank to anyone even being the largest in the world they go out of their way.

name: ole0754
review: They aren't clear and will make you run through hoops before they give you a closing response. We're in a pandemic and I have to work with a schedule to get to the bank. When I was there he acted like I was dumb and made me run back and forth between the bank and my house to close the account, they kept making people make needless appointments and sending people into their office for teller work. I was already in the bank when he sent me home with a number to call and told me to call a number that didn't work (1-866-965-9303). The guy that worked in there told me I had to call them myself but when I asked for the number he told me that he called an internal number and did not provide me with a number to dial. When I was in his office he told me my balance went to a third party and kept telling me it was in a revoked status when it wasn't. We had already discussed which accounts needed to be addressed but he still made it difficult to make the payment and zero the balance to close the balance. He made it so difficult for me to make my payment and sent me home with a number that did not work that I closed all of my accounts with Chase. They also don't pick up the phone and the automatic messaging system said that all the representatives are busy, it's not even a number on the back of the credit card. I called the number on the back of my credit card and I think he was the one that answered it too.

review: $3500 credit limit, over 4 years spent $3500 in interest, never missed a payment. I Paid off my card when the pandemic started and CHASE reduced my credit to $500. CHASE was the only bank of 17 to do this. Their back office credit department couldn't give a valid reason for reduction but zero interest in reversing their decision. The largest bank in the country and they run it with the ethics of a "boiler room" operation. CHASE BANK only cares about "high net worth clients", they are a horrible bank!! corrupt and predatory. A basic Google search will show the enormous recent settlements for discrimination and illegal business practices. Search how they treated small businesses during the pandemic who applied for PPP funding. The numbers speak for themselves, disgusting. If I had done some basic due diligence I wouldn't have ever done business with this company, I hope my personal experience helps others avoid this dishonest and unethical company.

review: Shouldn’t have to pay an annual fee for a Disney card; but if you plan on going, every point helps. They do have a decent interest rate and offer nice tools through their mobile app.

name: Aaron Ryan
review: The process started on a good note. The home lending advisor told us all of the good things that we wanted to hear with our mortgage and what our estimated costs will be. I was unemployed at the time (in May) so my wife and I added my father to our loan to help cover my missing income. We told them that he was recently retired as of late 2020 and they said it was fine and that his dividend / capital gains income will count. Turns out that was not the case and we only learned this about 3 weeks later because our first client care specialist disappeared and we had no contact for 3 weeks. We even called the original lender with no response. (we are now only 2 weeks out from the original closing date). At this point (early June) I returned to work so my income was included again but of course now my income won't offset my father's debts. They refused to remove him from the loan (citing chase policy) and had to start our loan process from scratch 2 weeks before closing. So the date had to be pushed back to July 9th which was within their 3 weeks chase closing guarantee. Throughout this entire process, I was given a whole bunch of empty promises and apologies of how they had given me wrong information but nothing no reassurances that they could take care of the matter in a timely fashion. I'm given a 2nd client care specialist who was unavailable more often than when she was present so I had to deal with her boss mostly and catch her up to speed about this long-winded process. Each day was this constant cycle of me saying "is there any more information you need in order to get to closing" they always said no we have everything we need (because all they did was look at my MyHome portal to see that I had no tasks). The next day there was always something else that they needed and the process was halted because they were waiting on said information. This stretched the process out until 7/15 when we closed. But only learned the day before that Chase's estimates for closing costs were $7000 more than what they kept telling me. They had this information for months but never bothered to update the actual mortgage disclosure documents to reflect what my closing costs were actually going to be. Even when I asked about missing information all they did was read back to me the unfinished closing document. It also doesn't help that the point people who are supposed to guide me through this process knew as little as I did and only regurgitated what information is given to them by their "specialist" teams who can only be contacted by email??? Your own departments can't even contact each other by phone dragging out an already long and difficult process. I will never use Chase for any services after this awful awful experience.

name: Herbert
review: Great rewards that are easy to use for airline tickets. Southwest Airlines provides a non expiration rewards program that is available for any ticket purchase.

review: I always wanted to have a discovery Alfredo card, can’t count for how long. And now I finally got it, so even though it’s a secured credit for now lol I’m just playing my part lol.

Once we received title approx 6month later we sold vehicle due to I can no longer drive due to I am disabled and Dr's have restricted me. This needs to be removed from credit report please.

name: Terry
review: I tried to get this card to report to the credit bureaus years ago. They would not do it. No big deal I have never been late in 17 years. Then the pandemic hit I lost my job which made money go away. I was late twice I think. It is all currently paid as agreed. But guess what they now report to the credit bureau because I was late. I called and tried to reason with them. They would not budge for any reason. So needless to say my credit scores have dived. Thanks Chase!

name: warddey
review: With a trip to South Africa in mind I dreamed of having it be "free" with credit card points. Like most everyone who applies for a points card, I did lots of homework on which is the best. I read all the glowing reviews of how great the Chase Sapphire Preferred and Ink cards are for travel points. I was especially convinced by the extra 25% in points value when travel is booked through the Chase Ultimate Rewards website. So I got both cards and my free 100,000 points and began charging everything on them paying 24.99% interest and annual fees to build those points. It's all a complete sham. When it came to booking my long awaited trip here's how it actually turned out: For the exact same dates and airlines, I compared the "price" at Chase Ultimate Rewards and Kayak. On Kayak I could book a flight from Salt Lake City to Johannesburg on Qatar Airways for $934. On Chase Ultimate Rewards it was $1,596.34 even with the 25% benefit. To be fair, I could have chosen the cheaper option on Turkish Airlines, which was the lowest priced option on Chase Ultimate Rewards. It was $1,584.94.So I charged up $26,795 and paid 24.99% interest for 2 years (=up to $13,392.14 interest)(depending on when you make your payments) + two $95 annual fees (=$180) (Total = up to $13,572.14) on the cards so I could get my "free" flight to South Africa.Still seem like a great deal?

name: sheabalee
review: I disputed a charge with a moving company that I attempted to cancel with and they were avoiding my calls. Chase had issued a credit, but the company then submitted a document saying that they my move was supposed to occur in April even though I just moved out of my apartment last week. Chase rebilled me and won’t give me a refund even though the moving company never provided the service and made false claims. Chase clearly doesn’t support the customer but rather falls into false claims by retailers who are not reputable. The annual fee should have some fraud protection, but doesn’t appear to be true. Go with Amex

name: Michael
review: Great product and services. Very pleased with Chase and would highly recommend their services. Great people and services. Have been a member since 1973.

name: Maria
review: Very happy with this company they gave me an opportunity with my credit card. I used in different places and was never rejected. The monthly payments that they require are low, I will highly recommend.

name: Chris
review: High apr but 1500 limit so that seems nice...

name: Fred Baur
review: The Chase people are polite and knowledgeable, I'd say, at a higher caliber than the employees at most banks. This account is great. I completed my required actions in the first two months, and got my bonus, lickity-split -- faster than promised. Make sure you remember that the $2,000 balance to avoid on-going fees is a MINIMUM, and not an average. Important difference. It seems a bit steep, but I can handle it. And, with all the services and branches they offer, I think it's worth it just to have a relationship with this bank. Thumbs are up!!

name: William
review: Arguably the best No Annual Fee Credit Card out there. It is ridiculously easy to get points. This card is best for people who know how to use a credit card and want to maximize rewards.

name: james_5602
review: This is a great card, started with an 18k limit, no interest and a 500.00 bonus.  Highly recommend this card!  Best of all.... no interest for 12 months.

name: Mary
review: Chase is a great company to do business with. I always get to speak with an actual person. They set up my autopay for me and always answer any silly question I have. Number 1.

name: David
review: 5/24 rule is a joke for a card that pales in comparison to my Amex Platinum ? this card is STRICTLY for people who want a high annual fee with little to no rewards or benefits, this card is great for 2 things, being STOLEN and hemorrhaging money via an absurdly rationalized annual fee

name: ramiz
review: Best card hands down for amazon prime users. 5% cash back everytime you purchase something from Amazon which is like paying tax for free.

name: Lorenzo
review: Nice and easy to use with great perks like rental car coverage and Visa concierge service like with all their other metal cards. And yes the card is made of metal!

name: Matthew
review: Great card,when I first received it I really didn't know all the rewards it had however now that they keep adding up its a great card to carry

name: Christian julian
review: If you are close to max your credit cards they will decrease your max amount, it’s was 1500dlls know it’s 500 dlls, but I will not cancel this card because it will my credit history

name: Beverly
review: Chase should not have been on my credit report it was in my bankruptcy so if you could please fix that it would be greatly appreciated

name: Kareem
review: Great credit card company I can't complain at all .. I would love to open another account.. is it possible to open more accounts

name: JAMES
review: The Chase credit card has been good for me but the only bad thing about it is I’ve had this card for a lot of years and they have never not once gave me an increase

name: Marla
review: Chase banks credit cards I was nice to have as a back up. People at Chase are very nice and they explain things very easily to you. Consider chase bank for all your financial needs.

name: Daniel
review: Excellent Mortgage Loan service. Friendly broker and very helpful throughout process. Helped make paperwork as easy as possible. I would recommend Chase mortgage

name: Gregg
review: Bad Service, Inaccurate Credit Reporting, High Rates. Went out of their way not to correct their mistakes. Overall, a nightmare experience. Chase Freedom Unlimited made sure I knew I didn't matter and they didn't care.

name: richard
review: great card with a high balance. Very convenient for all my vacations and large purchase. I rely on this card when its time to make a big ticket item.

name: Timothy
review: Very easy approval process and well-done integration with the dealership systems. The website is straightforward and easy to navigate. They're understanding of life's happenings and always willing to help and not penalize as long as you're upfront and proactive.

name: April V Black
review: Great loan that helped me get my dream car, and I only pay $296 a month on it. No extra pressure from the car dealership for me, just pay directly to the bank.

review: Just once, but enough to drive crazy a client that before to withdraw money from the CC in an emergency, called in advance for info and later on discovered that the issue was absolutely different than anticipated. Of course I paid that immediately and never again will use that "perk" from this Credit Card.

name: Brandon
review: Great card if you love amazon and have a prime membership. I use it all the time and earn points for every purchase. It really adds up!

name: Ajit
review: Great reward card for most convenient, every quarter different useful categories that save around year too I love this card so much

name: Alejandro
review: Receive 1.5% cash back on everything, and 2.5% on select categories. Cash back is first converted into a point system, then converted into cash (1 point = 1 cent). Cash back can be redeemed for statement credit, gift cards, or even be transferred as cash to your checking account.

name: Madison
review: Very pleased with the updated benefits on this card.   Nice to see that they are attempting to add value during the recession for the card holders.

name: Ellen
review: I get 3 points for all my travel and 300.00 a year credit toward travel purchases. I am not happy with the card yearly going up to 550.00 a year and still only 300.00 credit towards travel credit though and may change to another card.

name: Victor
review: "Amazon Prime Rewards Chase Visa Credit Card!"...  A # 1 Great card and great benefits!... Yeah, baby!.... I just love It!...........

name: Charles
review: Chase has been an awesome bank to work with! I have not had one bad experience with the Sapphire or Freedom cards. Above average credit limits. Would def recommend both cards.

name: David
review: Salesman was knowledgable and shared many details about operating car and did not play games but offered fair price. All personnel were very customer oriented.

name: Vashkar
review: This Chase Freedom Unlimited® credit card is one of the favorite among those who wants cash back credit cards, also the card may now hold even greater appeal for those rewards-savvy cardholders who are looking to get started with Chase Ultimate Rewards.

name: Beverly
review: Chase card not user friendly. I feel Chase charges high late fees and is quick to apply them. There are no perks with this card like cash back

name: shelp1227
review: I transferred $10K from Chase to PNC bank last Nov. The transaction failed for no reason and the fund DIDN'T go back to my chase account! I visited PNC and Chase bank to dispute the transaction and NONE OF THEM take responsibility! Now my money just gets LOST!! The most irresponsible bank I ever used! If you don't want lose your money, NEVER use them!!!

name: Sharon
review: my aim was to add this credit card to my Chase banking 'dashboard' but have not been able. Only access is through wallet hub. But I can accept that. thanks

name: Cyndi Smith
review: So far no issues.  Everything is going smoothly with online payments. I got a great interest rate, the terms I needed to keep my payment low and an approval within minutes.

name: Shirley
review: Chase interest rate is too high regardless of your excellent credit score. Bad customer service. Unreasonable when addressing customers concerns.

name: Dustin
review: The only bank I have ever truly used has been Chase, with their help I’ve been able to build my credit to nearly 800 points, actually save money for the first time ever, buy a house I hope to refinance at the same house with Chase.

name: John
review: The Sapphire Preferred is a pretty decent card. It was my first metal card so I felt like I had 'made it'. The sign up bonus on this card is CRAZY and everyone should go for it. The rewards rates at 3% for travel are pretty decent and compare to most other cards in this category. I would make the recommendation that after the first year, once the annual fee posts, downgrade this card to one of Chase's no annual fee alternatives(freedom cards). I just don't see this as a long term keeper card as I don't travel a lot.

name: gloriaacorbin
review: CHASE TRANSFERRED MY LOAN RECENTLY AFTER BEING WITH THEM FOR 16 YRS TO SPS WHICH IS ANOTHER COMPANY WHO DOESN'T WANT TO HONOR A DEFERRED PAYMENT OPT OFFERED TO ME DURING PANDEMIC. DON'T EVER TRUST CHASE FOR YOUR MORTGAGE NEEDS.

name: japrussin
review: I truly believe that Chase is absolutely the worst of the worst.  Chase’s so-called customer service is abominable (it should be called customer disservice) and its handling of its depositors’ money is extremely incompetent and sloppy, which is being generous.  It is my personal opinion that I have reason to at least question Chase’s solvency and Chase’s ability to meet its obligations to its customers.  I had two checking accounts, three credit cards, and a safe deposit box with Chase for many years.  To the best of my recollection, I never bounced a check or failed to pay my credit card balances in full each month on or before the due date.  Nonetheless, I received a letter from Chase stating that Chase had (past tense) cancelled all of my Chase credit cards, without any notice to me, at least seven days before I received Chase’s letter.  The letter also informed me that Chase was cancelling my Chase checking accounts and my safe deposit box.  The letter failed to provide any reason whatsoever for Chase’s draconian actions.  I made numerous calls and sent numerous letters to Chase to learn why Chase had canceled my accounts, but Chase has steadfastly refused to give me a reason for their bizarre cancellation.  The Chase staff at the branch I used was palpably shocked by Chase’s cancellation of my accounts because I was an exemplary Chase customer.  The Chase staff made several calls to get the reason for Chase’s cancellation of my accounts, but they could not get any information.  A couple of Chase’s staff guessed that the cancellation of my accounts might have been caused by my long history of making large withdrawals from my checking accounts.  Hence, it is my personal opinion and belief that Chase might have cancelled my accounts because my frequent large withdrawals, if continued, could have exposed an insolvency problem at Chase and an inability of Chase to meet its obligations to its customers.  Moreover, it took Chase over a month to give me the interest that had been earned on my two cancelled checking accounts prior to Chase’s closure of the accounts.  To make matters worse, I discovered that Chase made an unauthorized cash withdrawal from my company’s checking account.  To the best of my recollection, I have never made a cash withdrawal from my company’s account.  After spending numerous hours on the phone with Chase over two days, I finally got a copy of the withdrawal slip.  Neither the name of the account nor the account number on the withdrawal slip matched or even slightly resembled my company’s name or account number.  Moreover, the signature on the withdrawal slip did not even slightly resemble any of the authorized signatures on my company’s account.  Chase’s payment of cash out of my company’s account was inexcusably incompetent, and sloppy, and it resulted in another customer’s banking information (account number and account name and account holder’s signature) being shared with me.  I, personally, would not trust Chase with even one penny of my money because I, personally, believe that Chase might be insolvent and unable to meet its obligations to its customers and that Chase’s handling of its customers’ accounts is incompetent and sloppy.  It is my individual, personal, subjective opinion and belief, that Chase is incompetent, dishonest, and/or unethical and might have insolvency problems and be unable to meet its obligations to its customers.  The foregoing review solely provides my individual, personal, subjective opinions, beliefs, and interpretations.  Any individuals who may view this review, or any part thereof, should examine the facts and issues for themselves and form their own individual, personal opinions, beliefs, and interpretations.  I sent this review to Chase for comments and corrections before publishing it.  Chase refused to respond.

name: Salvatore
review: Never had a problem with this account. Thank you. I have had this account for 26 years and has always been a great help when needed.

name: Patricia
review: Great card. Very convenient.  I get many items on Amazon free with the cash back rewards. I use it monthly and pay it off monthly.

name: Lisa
review: online banking and depositing checks are easy to work with. Also zelle is a nice addition to the account. fraud department has saved me money also.

name: Dwight
review: Excellent service ! Always there to help and spend miles points for more than flying ! Just got an ice cream maker  and air fryer delivered last week.

name: Jonathan
review: I have financed 3 cars with Chase Bank and am completely satisfied. Great customer service and offers, I am definitely likely to finance my next vehicle with them as well.

name: Samuel Arroyo
review: Chase bank is stealing people's money, by accepting transactions even when an account is closed. And then denied that they have even accepted the money, even where there is proof.

name: Eric
review: This is a terrible financial institution and I am taking my business elsewhere in the future. They communicate to you via letter but dont provide any method of communicating back. They provide a secure portal for communication however they limit you to roughly 10 choices of why you are communicating with them. If your need doesnt fit one of those choices they have you call in to their main customer service line. That customer service line asks for a debit card, credit card, or username. None of the choices I tried to use work. I have been transfered 5 or 6 different teams and each one has a hold queue and each one is the wrong team. The people internally have no idea how to route calls, what team is the right one to fit my request, and so far I have been on the line for more than 90 minutes and have yet to speak to someone in the right team. I am done with this company, they are too big for their own good. Its time to do business with a small financial institution again.

name: Brielle Mitchell
review: CHASE BANK STEALS FROM THEIR CUSTOMERS! If zero stars was an option, I would have chosen it! I was a victim of debit card fraud in the beginning of June 2021. I reported the card stolen or lost, cancelled the card and spoke with the representative to assist me in finding any other fraudulent charges. They returned the money stolen from me and then 2 weeks later they withdrew the money and denied my claim. Several specialist in the fraud department told me that my money is not protected by the FDIC and that it is my job to secure my account and prove the fraud. Amber, the fraud manager, explained the same thing. Amber told me that if it was a Chase Credit Card aka "their money" then Chase would do everything in their power to investigate the fraud, but if it's a Chase Debit Card aka "my money" it's my responsibility. Also, 3 charges went through after the card was "cancelled" or shut down. How was my pin compromised and how were 3 charges able to post on a card that shouldn't exist. Why was I not informed about these 3 charges when I initially reported the claim?  I asked if there were anymore charges and the representative said no. If he can't see them and they didn't post on my mobile banking app, then where did they come from if the card was already closed? Chase has blamed me multiple times. I was informed that because I am a victim of what I can imagine is fraud by an ATM skimmer, and they didn't make several attempts on the pin, that it is not fraud. Also, no one at Chase has heard of an ATM skimmer. The fact that they don't know what an ATM skimmer is, a device that had been reported in the news since 2016 and been around since 2010, is unacceptable. This is terrifying and seems illegal what they are doing. In my research I found that I am not alone. Thousands of stories from Chase customers have had similar issues with Chase THIS YEAR! One story came from a customer at my work, where I am the Manager of a big retail chain. He stated that he is having the same issue right now. I would never treat anyone the way I have been treated by Chase Bank and Amber the Fraud Manager. I have been yelled at, blamed, and hung up on. How is Chase the number one bank in America and why is my money not secured by the FDIC? I can now see why their rating is a 1.5. RUN away from Chase and remember to record all your calls with them. They will try to scam you.

name: Mykcah
review: They are the worst company to finance with customer service is a doozy. I can’t wait to refinance they take their time doing everything

name: Sai Shashanka
review: Horrible customer service. Instead of a simple, they tried spam calling and the miscommunication  caused delays with the  payment system.

name: Sunny
review: Easy to make payments and enjoy the perks of money back that I reinvest. I always tell my friends about it. The recommendation feature has also been a wonderful feature that I use often

name: Debi Neumeyer
review: I applied and received my card. It offered 40,000 points and I only got 10,000, then the only information they had right on the card was my name and SS #.Everything else was wrong. Showing an address that I never had or know where the city is, wrong phone number, so this left me trying to straighten it out. That's when the fun began. Called the credit card company and was on the phone for 45 minutes being transferred to multiple different departments then cut off. I did this twice and both times I was cut off.  No one could help because my address did not match, nor did my email and neither did the phone number. So sorry we can not help you. Had to go to a Chase bank and she was able to get everything straightened out. Still no 40,000 points.

name: John
review: Was a little skeptical at first because I never heard of wallethub.com. Checked it out and found out it was pretty good. So far I got my credit score I am very happy with it.

name: Kyle
review: I enjoy this card. It has a higher credit limit and I seem to build up reward points faster than my other cards. I get 5% cash back on travel and 3% on dining.

name: myisha1103
review: Chase bank is having problems with cyber hackers I tried to dispute the problem treated with no respect  telling me they can't help me!!!!!

name: Gene
review: Easy pay option, the app is very easy to use. I have not had to work with customer service so that is a big plus. And I like the zero percent

name: Jason
review: Chase prime card. Buy from Amazon and earn 5% cash back. What else do you want me to say it is designed to be used with Amazon orders.

name: Sherry
review: Great card and you earn pts for Marriott Bonvoy and earn free stays at all Marriott hotels. Great customer service  plenty of benefits

name: nathaniel
review: I love this card!  It is my go to card now.  I love all of the benefits.  My initial credit limit is $30K. I will use it for my upcoming trip.

name: William
review: Chase has been helpful through this loan, no issues. When I applied for the loan they were quick to respond and supportive in our ventures.

name: Alliyu
review: You always messed up my credit and I want you to replace the 20 points you took off from my credit line. I have spoken with my creditors and they confirmed with me that they did not send any report to you guys. I hate the way you manage my credit score.

name: Mary
review: I enjoy using my Amazon chase Visa card it is a great card to have to buy items from the Amazon website I’m sure you can probably use it at other locations as well.

name: Sylvia
review: I use this card for travel. I fly to North Dakota several times a year and United is currently the only airline that flys to North Dakota

name: John
review: Love the card and the bonus points for my hotel. Interest rate is extremely competitive and this is my card of choice for all purchases.

name: Daniel
review: Very good bank and responsive customer service team. I not only use the bank for checking purposes, but also use their credit card. I am quite satisfied.

name: Deonte
review: I love Chase bank! Choosing them has been one of the greatest banking decisions I’ve ever made. I look forward to always keeping this bank as my favorite bank.

name: Cynthia
review: I've always had a positive experience with Chase. I recently reported to Chase that I was scammed. I submitted to Chase my BBB Complaint form. BBB gave vendor an F rating. I also submitted my online form to Federal Trade Commission-Fraud Division. Long story short my credit score went from 807 to 643 on my Chase Credit Journey. I always pay my bills on time. If I have a Chase bill of $500 and they ask for $40 payment, I pay $200. They deny that the plunge in score is connected to scam because I asked them to reverse the charge of $43. Federal Trade Commission said that they should do this with no problem. They said they would, but now my credit score is in the toilet. The only card I have is Chase. Experian had a another card attributed to me but that's false.

name: David
review: Good for Amazon purchases    I’ve had it for a long time.  When I had Amazon prime it made 5 pts per dollar but normally only 3 pts.   It’s mostly just for the Amazon purchases if not it’s just a regular card

name: Mark West
review: Good card but credit limit increases have stalled after the last 12 months. I do carry a balance of approximately 10-15% of my limit but requests for increases have been denied. Maybe that 5/2 thing is why-who knows?!

name: Roselinda
review: Coming full circle for me with this card. Started damaging my credit long long ago with high credit limits. Fast forward to now, we just got approved for this card with a 720 score, i initally wanted the Chase Preferred Card but settled for the no annual fee, since I pay dearly in annual fees with Amex. Overall a great card thus far, happy with the APR after 15 month startup since thats when i will be using the card the most.

name: Jenelle
review: All good. I paid off chase. My experience has been good. I will refer them to others in the future. This has helped me to build my credit.

name: Jeffrey
review: They are the largest bank on the planet so it’s a good idea to have a relationship with them And their credit cards are very well thought of and the customer service is usually pretty good

name: Ihsan
review: this credit card with Chase does not take into account your good relationship with them.  I have been a cardholder five years.  Never missed a payment. Always pay before due date. Frequently pay off the balance in full.  They have never increased my credit line.  I have other cards that show they appreciate my business. Chase does not.

name: Paulino
review: Good card to have really helps out traveling. Staying at a 5 star hotel has to be the best thing while out on vacation , not to mention the travel points

name: samsobkov
review: All these 1-star review are ABSURD! Let me tell you the total value you get when you get this card (06/2021): $300 credit for travel (including ubers and parking) + $429 value for premium airport lounge access literally anywhere + $100 to skip lines in airports (TSA/global entry) + $60 Doordash for FREE (statement credit) + $199 Lyft Pink value (15% discounts, faster service) + $900 worth of travel points if you spend $4k in the first 3 months. So let's add that up: 300+429+100+60+199+900 = $2,258!!! The annual fee is $550!!! I know people have had rough travel booking experiences but even between the signup bonus and the travel credit the card almost pays itself off double. You could literally transfer your travel points on Chase to the actual company (e.g., Delta Air) on a 1:1 ratio and NEVER use Chase's booking service and be winning big time. Don't let the 1-star reviews dissuade you from getting this card - it's WORTH IT!! From a guy who is overjoyed w his new card and confused by all these misleading 1-star reviews.

name: samsobkov
review: You'll note by reading the 1-star reviews they're all about COVID-related cancellations and headaches solving those errors - won't be an issue anymore!! Thanks vaccines!

name: Omar
review: Best credit card company around. I have several credit accounts with them going back 10 years and I have never had a single bad experience with them. They also offer some of the best rewards and benefits on the market.

name: WalletHub User
review: Recently started a business and opened up a Chase Business Checking account. Terrible decision. They send you a letter in the mail to call them on their customer support line to provide additional information about your business, 'otherwise your account may be frozen/terminated'. Yet, even after calling the support line, a 1 hour hold/wait time, and answering the questions, my account was still apparently frozen. I discovered this when I attempted to pay a credit card bill with the account, and alas, the transaction was denied by Chase with a reason code indicating my account was frozen. Another 1.5 hour phone call with 4 different Chase customer support representatives later, I was able to answer the 3 questions (Yes, 3 simple one word questions that were actually already asked in the first 1 hour conversation) to get my account unfrozen. NOTE: Nowhere on their website or in an letter/email did they notify me that my account was in a frozen state. Additionally, Chase said they were unable to do anything about fees/interest that were charged due to the failed payments, which I view as their fault based on the situation above. Consequently, I will no longer be doing business with Chase Bank, with their Credit Card services, or any other Chase Service. I recommend you find another bank/credit card company to use as well.

name: Christine
review: This is my top used card. Overall, this pays the highest % of the cards I have at this time and no annual fee. Pays more or less depending on category.

name: Marty
review: Have had one or two chase cards for years and love them.  We have always had no problems with these cards and chase has been very responsive to any needs we have had.

name: Jacek Swietochowski
review: Customer of theirs, ordered item from our store, then exchanged it at house, recorded video that he received something different, and then disputed the payment. Video was done very weakly, and it was visible scam. We did send evidence, that it was impossible to user receive wrong item, but yet, chase approved the dispute. Now we are filing police report.

name: Larry Paul
review: The Chase bank on 15th Street in Edmond is HORRIBLE. They are short staffed and the tellers they do have are very slow and make a lot of mistakes. Their manager doesn't care and takes up for them instead of the customers. The manager and other employees are from another country and they are hateful to American customers because they know they are protected by anti discrimination laws and can't get in trouble. Needless to say, my husband and I are business owners with three accounts at this bank and we will be transferring all of our money elsewhere as soon as possible.

name: seb_3
review: With an income in the upper 6 digits, Chase gave a $500 credit limit when I applied for the Freedom card and would not increase it when I called 6 months later.  Cut up the card, what a waste of time.

name: ashley_segee
review: Run from IHG! They could care less about their Elite members! They have still not made it right for booking us a stay in a hotel that hadn’t been in operation for over a year! Took my annual reward night for closed hotel and would not reissue.

name: Dax
review: Great experience, great app, good interest rate and since I have the Disney card and the rewards are kinda cool. No complaints for now!

name: Christian
review: Incredible benefits, great travel card. Usually gives higher limits (mine is 18K). Don't forget about 5/24, so don't apply if you've opened more than 5 accounts in the past 24 months!

name: kim
review: It was really nice it helped me a lot and will love to receive text messages and notifications on my account on my wallethub thank you

name: George Sanders
review: Stay away from their Home Mortgage. They delayed our closing and we nearly lost the house and our deposit. To make matters worse, they overcharged us for prepaid interest and refused to refund us. The Closing Guarantee is also a scam. We closed late because no one at Chase could be reached and now they are saying we don't qualify for the guarantee and tried to blame the tardiness on us despite the fact that they didn't reach out to us for 2 weeks! Completely unprofessional, sneaky, and rude. I don't understand how a well-known bank can be allowed to scam people like that. They are liars and cheaters.

name: chawkins
review: Just tried to open a bank account for my college freshman in Springboro, Ohio.  An appointment is needed but they will not answer the phone.  Staff are not helpful at the branch and frankly rude.  I am considering ending my relationship with this firm.

name: Mary
review: Hi I just recently received card, I can't wait to start buying and racking up my points. I shop on Amazon a lot so this card is great for me. Thank you

name: George
review: Great benefits including compassion pass. Rewards alone pay for more than the annual membership fee. I use it for everything. Great customer service.

name: Sheryl
review: This is my first car loan. I’ve never had credit. Having No credit is worse than having bad credit. Now that I’ve been given the opportunity to build my credit, which in today’s world is necessary, Chase has given me the best opportunity to do just that.

name: Kathleen
review: Not happy with this card. I enjoyed getting the rewards but they increased the amount of points needed to get gift cards. Very disappointing.

name: Lisa
review: Great card with multi-tier cash back and no annual fee. Lots of savings when used for Amazon & Amazon affiliates like Amazon, Woot, & Whole Foods!

name: tonydolbee23
review: While banking with Chase remember that they will automatically approve any autodraft payments be it from debit or ACH checking. They don’t offer overdraft protection, unless you're using your savings as collateral and they will absolutely refuse to assist in preventing overdraft either ahead of time or after. If you enjoy being hit with a 34$ fee no matter what. Bank with JP Morgan chase and watch your checking account charge you more in fees than any other bank known to man. The CEO literally pushed for a stimulus just so he could make money in interest off of stimulus checks placed on hold in your bank account. Chase will not ever early Direct Deposit and good luck on a bill not being overdrafted before you get paid just so they can make an additional 34$ off of you there too. Overall bank with someone else and save your time and X to the 1 millionth power by 34$ in overage fees. Sincerely the guy who pushed JP Morgan into financial security one Overage fee at a time

name: Michelle K Gardner
review: It was really nice when I had it! Wish I hadn't unloaded all of that debt onto myself in that period of time. Still struggling to pay this guy off but was nice while she lasted.

name: Valeria
review: Thanks for taking care of me when I am in a jam. When I have questions customer service is always polite and explains and answers all questions

name: Marquist
review: Great taste for my credit with low down payment. They also let me have a much lower interest rate for my credit score, even with a cosigner that had a much lower credit score and no income.

name: Dwight
review: I have had the best credit card experiences ever using this card from Chase.  They even raised my credit limit at one point without me requesting it.

name: Maxamillian
review: Good card with useful rotating categories that help maximize spend. Definitely would recommend to anyone trying to fill in their credit card rewards gaps.

name: Brenda
review: Let my homeowners insurance lapse. I have to stay on top to make sure taxes and homeowners insurance are paid on time.

name: CT Liotta
review: This is a great card for overseas travel, if you hop from city to city and like nice airport lounges abroad. Domestically, I've had mixed experiences - especially in airports like JFK where the Priority Pass lounges are in disconnected International terminals, airside.What galls me about the card is the "points are worth 50% more" promise. On Kayak, I could get a flight for $80. On the chase booking engine, the same flight is available for $120... or 8000 points. See the problem? I'm also a fan of ultra low cost carriers like Spirit and Frontier, and they can't be booked with reward points. Or, if they can, it's so convoluted it isn't worth it.I like the Lyft Pink membership and hope it's a keeper past one year. Mostly I use it for Priority Pass, to rack up fast points buying airline tickets, and to transfer Freedom Unlimited Points.Do I transfer to airline partners? Meh. Sometimes. I've never gotten great deals that way, and I'm not about to spend points to fly domestic first class.

name: Vickie
review: Love this card it has a lot of options would recommend this to everyone I also like it because there is no membership fee and it can be used anywhere

name: manuel
review: Over ten years with this card..csrs are great..my interest at 9....its a rock solid card known as the Slate card..and may not be offered as of late..if you get it..hold on to it....nothing but praise for this one.

name: bryang_51
review: Occasional use only. I always pay entire balance so as to not pay interest charges. It is accepted in many locations in the U.S. and when traveling.

name: steventrepasso
review: Love my Chase Card!! Highly recommend getting a Chase Credit Card when you build your credit up!! You won’t regret it!! Best Credit Card I have so far!!

name: mikescheel83
review: Horrid and useless phone help. And among other things. Signed up for a few things on chase and have to meet certain criteria in order to use.

name: Tammy
review: Excellent  experience with this bank and its accuracy.  They allow me to be flexible and they work with you with small payments system

name: Tom N
review: We were conditionally approved, but after bidding on a home and going through the underwriting process, they said we didn't have enough funds and either needed to come up with an extra $80k or they would raise our loan amount. How did we go from affording the home to needing that much more in funds? We didn't have that kind of cash on hand, so they raised our loan amount and now we have to pay $400 more per month for the next 30 years. Great way to make a quick million, Chase!

name: aoehero
review: Chase does not care about your complaints. You can do nothing to a financial institution! Good Luck suing them! They operate unchecked by any financial regulations.

name: Unhappy Camper
review: Their customer service is the worst. They are impossible to get a hold of and their Closing Guarantee is a scam. We closed late because no one could be reached to tell us exactly what documents we needed to submit, and then they implied it was our fault, took no responsibility for ignoring us for over 14 days, and didn't pay the Closing Guarantee refund. Report them to the CFPB.

name: Howard
review: It’s great. No fees and rewards are good. Only downside is I lost 35 credit rating points for having a balance even though I paid it off in full

name: Erin
review: Chase is my favorite banking institution, and the Southwest Rapid Rewards card was my first credit card ever. I’ve had nothing but a smooth and satisfactory experience with my card, online and mobile banking or customer service interactions. Chase is swift to get back to their customers and that’s something I’m gaining more appreciation for as time goes by. I recently opened a personal checking account with Chase due to the positive experience i’ve had the last 5 years with my rewards card.

name: Erin
review: This is the first credit card I ever opened and I’ve been very happy with Chase bank. In fact I can honestly say that out of all my banking institutions I trust in Chase the most.

name: chenellsings
review: As of May 18th 2021, chase bank refuses to give me back my personal funds, after they froze my accounts and closed them with no notice. Due to receiving a loan. In order for me to receive my PERSONAL FUNDS they say, I need to prove to them that I have a legit business. For personal funds?! In their contract, it says that they can only hold on to PERSONAL FUNDS for 10 DAYS ONLY! Well, we’re past that. This is nothing new with chase bank, they love freezing accounts with no valid reason. It’s on YouTube and Reddit, thousands of consumers robbed of their funds from Chase bank. There appears to be a pattern with this bank. Chase is using this maneuver to use consumers' funds without paying interest. DO THE MATH. They like to appear like they are a legitimate commercial bank, but they really are like a mafia.

name: pb3456
review: Been a customer with Chase for decades and this is the worst experience I've had with them. Had my significant other sign up for this for a sole proprietorship. It says clearly on the application that it's also for sole proprietorships. The paperwork requirements they have to get the card make sense for normal LLC, C, S corporations but make no sense are practically impossible for most sole proprietorships to meet. Then they won't let you withdraw the application, you have to wait until they deny you! Chase really needs to correct this before their reputation is tarnished with loyal/long customers like myself.

name: Paul
review: Great Second card after getting a starter card. With the 5% rotating categories and maximizing rewards through travel, it seems like a great contender to have in you wallet for a lot of you purchases.

name: Julie Yamamoto
review: Chase is the absolute worst! I had a car loan setup on auto-payment for three years with no issues. Then suddenly this year, the auto payments stopped. Chase claimed that I went into my bank account last Feb and changed it to a 12 month term, which makes no sense. Why would I change something that had been working fine for three years? The main reason I use auto-pay is so it is AUTOMATIC and I don’t have to worry about it. To make a long story short, the auto-payments stopped, which I didn’t realize until I saw my credit score drop like a rock because Chase reported it as delinquent (like after only one missed payment btw). I opened a dispute with the credit reporting agencies, the BBB and provided Chase with all the documentation they needed to verify my claim. Nothing changed. Big company stomps on consumer. End of story. Also, I was so fed up with Chase that I went ahead and paid off the remainder of the loan and have YET to see my car title arrive.

name: Martin Mekina
review: I had an auto loan via Chase auto. I was deployed to Iraq while my wife was making car payments. When I returned to US, I called chase and asked them to set my account on autopay since I was taking over responsibility for payments. Chase didn't do it and I ended up with 3 late payments accured in 4 months. I understand it's my responsibility to make payments on the time but if their customer service was able to do simple task you ask them to do I wouldn't have to write this review. Company has no understanding what it is to come back from combat deployment and doesn't want to take responsibility for their terrible customer service.

name: DEBORAH
review: I have been with Chase since 1998 and it has been a good solid relationship.  I have not had any issues with security and if I had a product refund issue , it was handled immediately.  I hope to remain with Chase for many years to come.

name: Kristin
review: Got the intro rewards bonus of $200. And it also gives you good rewards on travel. Only downside--i tried to book a flight with my rewards and it didn't give me the same flight options as it did on other websites.

name: Alexandria
review: Love it! You can download the rapid rewards shopping button to get additional points on various purchases online. You can also choose cashback options through the Chase website on additional purchases.

name: Ricardo
review: I have an Auto Loan with Chase and they are excellent.Their customer service is excellent and understanding. I will refer my friends to Chase

name: Unhappy Camper
review: Their mortgage department is horrendous. The Client Care Specialist ignored our file for weeks, then rushed the underwriting process and made a mistake counting our funds. They had to increase our loan amount by $75,000 on the day of closing in order for us to get approved. We ended up closing late because of Chase's careless mismanagement. They did not honor their Closing Guarantee refund or even apologize. Furthermore, they are impossible to get a hold of. Good luck getting any of them on the phone to help you during the underwriting process or to answer questions thereafter.

name: Cheri D T
review: Due to my medical bills I had to file bankruptcy. I continue to make these payments. Never missed or late. They will not report as paid to credit report. They are terrible to work with.

name: Meghan
review: I had never missed a payment I never used the full balance of the card when I used it I’d pay it off or close to it and then one day with no reason or explanation they cancelled my card. After more then 10 years of not being contacted by them after they decided to charge off the amount after a few months of no payments now they have started reporting and trying to collect. I just wanted an explanation and instead they took the card and didn’t even allow me to continue paying on it before they put a negative mark along with it. Rude

name: dancurtis07
review: terrible customer service, was a loyal customer for years, still a customer, but i have locked my cards and do not use them. I was sick was late on one payment and they dropped my credit Limit to 500.00 on all of my cards.

name: Mary
review: I have always been grateful for this card. Easy peasy. They are cooperative when money is short during the COVID-19 crisis. The SW

name: rani sam
review: Don't ever use chase plan, it is a scam. You will get charged monthly fees for nothing. The plan is unclear. You balance does not change after you make plan and actually it looks like you never made a plan. Use paypal plan instead.

name: james
review: Wonderful card to use as it started building my credit early on in my startup no credit faze thanks chase I will always recommend to friends

name: whuser67014786
review: I love this card because, well, let's just say, I love amazon! This is where I primarily spend and earn the most cash back! Well worth having this card it doesn't give you an otion for a credit increase, which I say is a bummer, but as with any card just keep your card in good standing and the increases just happen!

name: Richard
review: They cut my credit limit in half last summer, 2020, for no reason. They denied to increase my credit limit, and they raised the interest rate.

name: Richard Lecator
review: You lowered my available credit by $4000, even though I never been late with my payments. Because of what you did, my credit score dropped. So having your Chase Card and making all payments on time still lowered my credit score. Give me my $4000 back on my card.

name: wheelerkeshiawheeler
review: The good part was that I did get approved with cs of 730, the bad part is that I stay 3 hours from nearest branch, and they needed me to verify some info in person. If I would’ve known that I wouldn’t have risked the hard pull. I was really excited about the approval and then they rained on my parade a whole week later, and I had to contact them and remain on hold for 20 minutes for them to tell me this..Just keep that in mind when you apply..

name: William
review: Tried to pay off auto loan online and could not. Went into a branch Chase bank and bank confusion begins. Finally paid off auto with the teller and bank manager's assistance. After a few weeks of waiting and checking my online app, still showing I owe an interest payment. Went back to bank branch, teller looked confused and transferred to bank manager. Bank made mistake with payoff amount, manager said it was a good thing I was on top of it. Still no title at DMV, Chase Bank is terrible. Was not my choice, car dealer was and my wife and I have Perfect credit ratings. The bank manager even tried to push a credit card on me because of our outstanding credit, not with the Chase Bank!

name: carlykyle12
review: IF I COULD GIVE -5 STARS I WOULD. I have had the WORST experience working with the travel center through COVID. I signed up with a recommendation from a family member and the “awesome perks” but man, what a mistake.... I have lost $100’s of dollars with these “travel representatives”... just to name a couple out of the several bad experiences I have had over the last 1.5 years.. 1. I have booked a flight with the representative, showed up to the airport at 6AM and they booked the flight but did not ticket it which means I did NOT have a flight back home. This is AFTER I had spent an hour with them on the phone confirming that I had these flights the day before.. I was on the phone with them at 6AM and the “best” they could do was book it for 6 hours out... so they said they would open an investigation and reimburse me for my flight. Nothing happened. I couldn’t even call and inquire because everyone (8/10) are useless. 2. I have booked a flight with a credit from COVID and the representative told me that even though the flight credit was MORE than the flight I was rebooking the airline would reach out to me with a credit. That was a lie.. I called and they actually did open an investigation this time and “credit it back”... if only it were that easy.. the credit I should have gotten back was $80 per passenger and I was told that I was upgraded on my previous flight and only had $30 left on my credit (Which again is 100% wrong because I did not upgrade or sit in an upgraded section).... at this point I don’t even care how much money I lose and I cannot wait to never say the word “chase” again... My family member has this credit card and the ONLY way to go is if you will get this card TRANSFER your points DIRECTLY to the airline.. NEVER CALL THE TRAVEL CENTER OR YOU WILL EITHER CRY OR SCREAM OR BOTH.

name: Charlotte
review: Excellent can't complain wish it linked my cards to be about to use any of my cards from the app that would be better then signing into each app as needed

name: Lindsay
review: One of the best cards I ever used. Should increase credit limit yearly based on the spending and payments on time. Chase good company

name: Christina
review: Good bank to do business with. The customer agents and those in my branch office were helpful and courteous. I would recommend it to others.

name: FRANK R
review: For the 5% cash back aspect, @ AMAZON, it's great !!! Of course I've, like many others, with another new fresh credit card, AND for Amazon. I've been finding and buying all those strange odd things there for EVERYTHING !!! It's through Chase bank, which I also have the Freedom, Freedom Unlimited, & Sapphire Preferred, and now the MIGHTY AMAZON. My SL was $8800 @ 17?? Apr. NOT sure what Chase's Modus Operandi (MO) is, with their HIGH APR's, but I pay it off in full each month !!! I keep a clean file with over $100k other credit lines. Like any credit card, If you don't PIF each month, you will pay high APR fees. So YMMV. Overall I use it strictly on Amazon, but it also has 2% at Gas stations. My other cards, some are categories, and unless gas stations aren't in those quarters category, this at least gets you 2%, vs. my normal regular 1.5% cards. So I've used it for gas also. Getting that extra .5% is at least like NOT paying sales tax. So I've been also using it there periodically too. Also, you WON'T be getting your accumulated 5% cash back until that current statement closes. So it'll be there NEXT month !!! I usually just leave it there, and purchase more AMAZON stuff next month !!! However, you can go to the website where it appears with my other cards, and can have the accumulated cash back sent directly to linked bank account. It's also a heavy all-steel type card, like my Chase Preferred card. It's a heavier weight card, NOT regular flimsy plastic, ordinary type credit card. This one's thicker, stronger than the same olds. Has all the security features it's supposed to have, #'s etched on the back, etc, Nice touch !!! So 4 stars total, So what are you waiting for, go and get yourself 1. ???

name: Malachi
review: This is a Good credit card to have, I Like that there are benefits of cash back and that I Can use this card anywhere. Would recommend

name: Lester
review: They do not keep accurate payment records. They post payments late after the due date doing holidays and report that account payment was late.

name: Hylda
review: This card is great and I love that I can earn points every month that I can put toward Amazon purchases or toward my card balance.

name: rob
review: The largest bank by assets and only second rate bank in terms of pleasing your customers and your mobile app and website is far worse than second rate - they’re waaaay down the list.

name: Rachel
review: Great service, no problems. However it’s been 2 years and I’ve never been late, payments are always on time and I have a great income, but I have never received an increase. Other credit cards have issued me multiple increases without having to request the increase.

name: Marcia
review: I got it initially so I would have a card that I could count on in my pocket if I had an emergency that is all thank you very much

name: Marcia
review: I use it occasionally I just needed a good credit card so I went with this one it's a it's a good card it had a cash back at the beginning thank you

name: Alberto
review: Love the card very easy to use and straightforward system that has set in place. A lot of options to redeem your rewards which I really love.

name: Tammy
review: The chase card is easy to use, and I love that you get cash back from your purchases. I have used it a few times on Amazon purchases and it is like a nice surprise To get your purchase for less!

name: Kenneth
review: This account offers fairly generous rewards. My only complaint is customer service, It's very hard to get through to them, even to report suspected fraud.

name: amzamore
review: Terrible bank for business checkling. High fees. High minimum balances. No two step security. Difficult to reach on the phone. Branches are crowded and have officers that can't do anything. No interest paid. Go elsewhere.

name: Sherry
review: Love my Chase Disney card and the Disney dollars I accrue in monthly spending.  Always pleased with customer service.  Always pay my balance each month. My favorite since I travel to Disney 4-6 times each year and always have bonus dollars waiting in my account,

name: James
review: It’s been fine. Paying off my loan within the Chase app has been very helpful. I would recommend having this feature for future purchases

name: Ofilia
review: Chase is very easy to work with. Their website is easy to navigate. Never had a problem.  And it gives the first year interest free!

name: PM RE
review: Charged return lease fee that wasn't disclosed when returning car. I returned 2 days (yes, 2 days!) early and was charged a $2800 early termination fee.

name: Peter
review: The Chase Freedom Visa has been a good new credit card, offering a good credit limit & nice rewards. I would recommend the Chase Freedom Visa to anyone shopping for a new card.

name: Danyell Gatchalian
review: An honest-to-God review after the huge inconvenience this bank caused me. I don't usually write reviews but this was 'Unbelievable'. 1. I opened an account that is found to be invalid later on because my banker, Allan in Chase SD, didn't even try to contact me to via email or phone, when he sent me additional forms to my 'school address' where my account is, because he forgot to ask me to sign/provide my ssn and w9 form. So my card was locked for days then weeks and i received a notice later on that my account will be closed because of that.2. Do you know the minimum waiting time for calling customer service specialist with chase? weekdays and weekends its never below 30 MINUTES. And you're lucky if you had that because I've always had to wait for 50 minutes only to be rushed and unheard of with my feedbacks atleast. Talk about great customer service.3. I am a student so I don't have a car yet. I had to walk to a chase branch near me. The nearest branch I went into, where I walked 20 minutes, don't even have a private banker to accommodate my situation, and was told that they won't be back "probably" in a month or so. "probably" is the word I really needed that day. So they directed me to another branch, which was another 20 minutes walk.. uphill. Great.4. In this other branch in Sunset Blvd., I was accommodated by a lady named Melissa(Chase,LA), who took care of the 2 forms for me, asked for my ids and had me signed the forms. Told me it was all clear and should be ready in a day or two days max. Good news, right? Only it wasn't. But is that really surprising? 3 days later, my account is still not activated and I called her with the number she once called me with the day after our transaction to assure me she will be "in touch". Guess what, 3 days after, I cannot reach her via text or call, and when I WAITED 50 MINS, ofcourse, for a customer service specialist(because I don't really wanna walk 40 mins again to Sunset Blvd Branch), I was informed that my account was CLOSED and CANNOT BE REOPENED. The only option I have is to go to a branch and open another account if I wanted to. What's the reason? Well, they(customer service) asked me if there was any erasures in the form or etc, because it was a mismatch and had to be closed. I told them why is that my fault when I only had to give my ssn and passport and sign with Melissa? Apparently, with this bank, you have no choice. So my checking is completely closed and instead of feeling like I had to go open another one, I am much more relieved that I won't have to deal with this bank EVER again. Right as this moment that I'm typing this, I'm in the middle of the 50 MINUTE WAITING TIME-CALL with a customer service to receive the balance in that checking account, WHICH I HIGHLY DOUBT WILL HAPPEN SMOOTHLY. Maybe. Maybe not.5. I just got done with the call after writing number 4. cool. Like I predicted, IT DOES NOT GO SMOOTHLY EVER WITH THIS BANK. I wanted them to mail the balance to my current address and not my school address but guess what? It's been already mailed and is considered invalid now with my call, but I still have to call them back in 10 days from now to be able to resend another check to my current address because it's their "strict policy" even though i'm literally telling them right now that I have a new address and provided all identification. No options with this bank. Talk about customer centric service. Lovely. Even at the end, they have me waiting WHICH I LOVE DOING because my time is so INVALUABLE. so call again for minimum 30-50 minutes waiting time call in 10 DAYS and only by then will they resend the check 7-10 BUSINESS DAYS. I love this bank so SO MUCH.Do I recommend this bank:ABSOLUTELY NOT. SAVE YOUR SELF FROM ALL THE HASSLE. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME. I WILL NEVER EVER USE THIS BANK, AS MUCH AS I CAN. That's it for my review, Time definitely NOT wasted.

name: Dan
review: Honestly the worst for communication, they will make unilateral decisions due to algorithms their computers are running without any input from a real person. If you happen to have unusual spending habits of any kind , or don't pay off your card in full every month be prepared for a random closure with no advance notice and no appeal. It doesn't matter if you've made zero late payments over the course of almost 10 years there is "absolutely nothing they can do" if you trip the computer's algorithm

name: Brooks
review: Great experience with credit card.  Accumulates points based on purchases with credit card, which are later converted into a $20 gift card that can be used at any commissary.

name: Sharon
review: Very slow company to notify credit companies as to when your bill is paid off or monthly. Negatively affects your credit. If you pay off your credit card right away, they do not even bother to notify the credit companies until way after the next due date of the following bill cycle.

name: Roberta H
review: Chase surprised me a couple of years ago when they offered me this card with a generous credit line and decent rewards. I haven’t reaped the full benefits yet since I was carrying a balance monthly. I would recommend this card to anyone.

name: Yolanda
review: So far so good they almost doubled my credit limit in a matter of months and doubled my cash back for the past couple of months. This card is great so far. Looking forward to long great history

name: mia
review: I love this card and the benefits it offers along with amazon purchases I plan to keep this card for a very long time it offers great points of purchases and I can use my points for Amazon as well...

name: Chris T
review: Great CC company. I will continue to work with them in the future. I enjoy being able to earn cash as I spend money on things like travel, work, and play.

name: Ariel Nieves
review: So far the card is pretty good but, can’t spend the points on Amazon even though the card is already linked. Doesn’t show at check out.

name: Lance
review: Good service lots of locations with various hours of operation I can use my card almost anywhere and merchants accept my card and it helps my credit

name: Robert H Moore III
review: I’m not a fan of Chase bank. If I knew Amazon used J. P. Morgan Chase I wouldn’t have applied for the card. Leaving this VISA listed on Amazon as a payment source I started receiving more of the same product shipped to me than I ordered. I only list Capital One VISA on Amazon because I have complete control over this credit card.

name: Alan
review: chase has done a good job for me..I have had no problems.If I ever have another car loan I will be sure to try to use them.They keep me informed

name: Fernandral
review: Chase is a horrible card to have. When you use and continue to use they will lower your limit to match the balance, sending the wrong message to other creditors.

name: Ronald
review: This is an excellent travel card. Was initially declined, but after a call I was approved with a 10k CL. I got their 4k spend requirement completed in 4 weeks and have already booked a flight to Brazil with points

name: Peggy
review: I've been a member of Chase credit card and I could not feel safer. When I've had issues with companies trying to pull fast ones on me, Chase jumps right in and fixes things for me. I've been a member since 2016. Love it.

name: linda
review: After you spend $1,000 in purchases on your new Card in your first 3 months of Card Membership, You will receive the $200 back in the form of a statement credit

name: Zachery
review: just got the Amazon cc and I've already earned $5 cash back on my normal shopping expenses on amazon and at Whole foods. APR is a little high but no annual fee.

name: jaime E hernandez sr
review: Great ? credit cards so far they have always been there to help me with loans and credit when I needed it .only great experience with all chase credit cards.

name: marjan_mb11
review: Just wasting our time to close the account that we paid the car loan off over a month (Paying with a Wire transfer) and they chose the date to send the title after closing the account after a month. This is .........

name: Jonathon
review: Can’t complain.  It has a low rate and the app is incredibly easy to use. Although I wish I had gone directly to Chase, probably would have got better terms, didn’t realize the dealership was making money off the financing.

name: Jonathon
review: Really great default card, like if your not sure which card to use to get the greatest rewards this is a good go to.  Although it is difficult to request credit limit increases and the initial limit is much less than the similarly performing discover it rewards card

name: thamar_duval
review: Worst company anyone can go to. First off I had to wait 2 weeks to receive my card, may I remind you they were supposed to send it rushed meaning I was supposed to get it the next day, when I called to let someone know I was told to go to a branch, and they didn’t try to help me, then I end up closing my account the next day the following day my job deposited some funds into my account tell me why it takes few days to reverse the funds when the funds are available!!!!!! so that way my company can cut me a check, bad place to do business with, all my friends are closing their chase account cause it sets a bad reputation!!! Sad!

name: Mitchell
review: It's just a credit card, nothing to really glorify. I'm just using it to credit swap one of my loan without doing a balance transfer

name: Luis
review: thanks for your help with my application and my mortgage I need to lower my payments so I pay it off sooner and take some money out to upgrade my house

name: Grace
review: I love this card!  Cashback rewards are easy to redeem and having no annual fee is an added bonus that helps me put all of my rewards towards savings.  Just make sure to pay off the card each month so you don't negate your savings with interest payments.

name: Vincent
review: Excellent benefits. Provides monthly cash back which really helps keep my overall spending in check. Alerts are quick and efficient

name: Patrice
review: Ease of use. Billing easy to understand. Payment reminders. I can always get through to Customer Service if needed.  I can also use the Chat option

name: John
review: Credit ratings credit cards auto loans we’re all trying to build a stronger credit history and higher credit score.Thank you to Chase for the assist.

name: Nancy
