review: Chase Freedom card has exellent customer service no interest for the first 15 billing cycles. A great card to transfer your account to.

name: Alejandro
review: I really enjoy the card's perks I wish there would be more incentives with the card and also better credit score updates that are accurate with what I am doing with my own company they don’t always update their scores or payments you have done. Before the cut off date

name: Joy
review: Thanks for always being there to help the customers and the website is so easy to use and understand and that's important when dealing with money

name: MARSHELLE
review: Thankful for the great interest rate and to be a new customer of JPMC. Hoping for an excellent credit card from them soon! My credit score will continue to shine with Chase!

name: Chris
review: They cut my credit limit from $2,000 to $500. For absolutely no reason. So I'm cutting them out of my life, by cutting up their card. Good riddance, Felchers!

name: J vin
review: I pay on time and never late. Have never had an issue with the merchant. When I connect with them they have bee professional and polite

name: Michael Mann
review: I never intended to apply for a specific airline card because I didn't want to be restricted to just one airline, so I applied for the Venture card to have flexibility,,,all though the Venture card is a top travel card, I'm not here to brag about it...but the United Gateway card.  I thought I'd never be more satisfied with an airline card than this one.  There are various way to earn miles while you do everyday spending like groceries, gas and transit plus other programs to earn greater miles while dining and shopping.  This card is perfect for the infrequent flyer which is why i never applied for the Explorer card...I'm not there yet in my travels...but the Gateway card fits my spending and level of travel.  Those 20,000 bonus miles will go along way.  You really don't have to be a "big spender" to be able to earn miles either.  There are so many programs they offer to earn hundreds even thousands of mile with each transaction from everyday and/or needed spending.  If your spending and level of travel fits this criteria, i highly recommend this card...and if you are a satisfied traveler on United Airlines.

name: Elon
review: Great cash back card. When paired with Sapphire Reserve, effective 2.25% back! Also 5% (effective 7.5%) back for groceries in first year

name: Kelvin
review: These is a great travel card. I have a son in college and I’m going back and forth get him the things he needs and these card is great.

name: Ann Scherer
review: Great card great service. I've actually had this account for years, from Washington Mutual to Chase to Chase JPMorgan. I even encouraged my children to open up chase accounts. The card is accepted everywhere on our travels

name: Freida
review: I have been using Chase for several years and I have never had any issues with them and would recommend to anyone looking for a good and reliable credit card.

name: marian
review: Bumped my interest rate above 12% though I’m long term card holder w an excellent record. They refused to lower it.I’m looking around for better card

name: Cherie
review: Great card easy process and user friendly online statements. Was weary to apply and glad I did. Can use this card anywhere I used it for best buy.

name: darci
review: We did not receive our first statement. Therefore we did not pay it and our card was denied at a store and we were hit with a late fee penalty.

name: Jose
review: Amazing credit card company., always look out for people..,:,,really good for me in this momment I recommend it to all me friends y families

name: christlover7
review: They have an 800 number to call.  They answer right away. They are polite.  They did want they were supposed to do on a fraudulent out-of-state charge on my account and credited me back the next month.  They no longer need you to call them if you are making a purchase from a merchant in another country (Philippines) online.  The one thing I don't like is they donate to Planned Murderhood directly or through legal support groups which try to expand abortion.

name: Hannah Dixon
review: I have the freedom unlimited card and it's been good but their costumer service has been SO DIFFICULT!! It is so hard to actually get someone on the phone to talk to them and my husband applied for a card and was denied (even tho we have zero debt and good savings - we own our car and house and have never had a late payment on our credit card) - we have gone in circles for two weeks trying to get someone on the phone to figure out why he was denied and if we can appeal but still haven't gotten an answer! Just wish they had an email address that they respond to or phone number that a person answers!

name: Michelle
review: Informative and convenient. Their customer service is so helpful when I paid for my first payment! I may even switch over to Chase for my regular bank account.

name: barry
review: Seems good so far. Gave me a good rate on a previously owned vehicle.

name: abel
review: very efficient great rewards and offers no balance transfer however but I'm very much satisfied with the product and hope to explore more Chase products in the future

name: Ashley
review: This is a great card, the rewards are awesome. Only complaint I suppose I have is that it's so tough to get them to raise the credit limit, even tho we pay it off ever month.

name: Patty
review: Every time you make a payment they reduce your limit so that your score will go down. Keep all your cc limits down or they will screw you over

name: Geoffrey
review: One week after I paid my account in full Chase is still carrying a $51,000 balance and screwing up my credit. Chase is a crummy bank

name: PATRICIA JOHNSON
review: I recently started using this card almost exclusively.  5% back for travel; 3% back for dining & drug stores; 1.5% back for everything else.

name: Tony Odom
review: Great card, the very best of all my cards. They also are very generous on credit line increase, $5,000.00 -$7,000.00 at a time. Have received 2 increases in the last 3 years with no hard pull on my credit report. They have great rewards including cash back. Of course I do put between $3,500.00 and $6,500.00 in charges on this card every single month. I can't think of not 1 negative thing to say about this card or Chase. The most single used card for purchases. I wouldn't let a couple of negative reviews prevent me from owning this card after all there are always two sides of a story.

name: Felicia
review: Made a dispute on an order that cost almost 100.00 never received any package and they took back the money in the dispute. I paid for something I never received and I find that to be just wrong in every way.  I should not have had to pay for something I never received.  Not cool at all!!!

name: Teresa
review: Love my rewards .  Cash back is so awesome.  Recommend for sure .  I’m glad I got it for my future purchases .  Amazon offered and I accepted

name: sharon
review: My husband and  I have spent many hundreds of dollars at Costco, which carries this card.  We have been pleased very much with how many places we could use it.  This card was 'compromised' due to no fault of ours..so we had to get a new account since then.

name: Gina
review: It’s JP Morgan Chase. They always have great savings opportunities and allow you to choose which discounts you want to utilise for the month.

name: enya4ever
review: Annual fee has never been $595. That’s what the Palladium card used to charge, but then all the blogs incorrectly assumed the same for the J.P. Morgan Reserve. It’s $450 and was scheduled to be $550 this year  but rolled back due to COVID-19. Also, the card is not chip and pin, it’s chip and signature. There are additional benefits over the sapphire reserve, such as a hidden tradeline, no cash advance fee, soft credit limit (allows 3-4x over limit), United Club membership.

name: Louis
review: This credit card is actually associated with Amazon. I use it as my primary Amazon purchasing instrument. It gives me automatic payments, which I pay off completely every month. I love it!

name: nicciwallin
review: I currently bank with a credit union and have for over 20 years. I got a Chase account a couple months ago in addition to my other account. We deposited a check about a month ago and they put it in as a negative. The bank told me they were sorry and admitted to the error. It's been over two weeks now and our account is still negative that amount. We've called over 5 times and they admit that it was their fault but never fix it. If you're thinking about going and opening an account, don't do it.

name: Amanda D Dailey
review: Chase flex I recommend. No Hassle, good customer service skills. Great overall experience with Chase Bank. When I opened account it was smooth and fast.

name: Mark
review: This company has been part of my portfolio for some time now and have not had any problems to date.. on the contrary they have ;even a very reputable company.

name: lancegaulon_1
review: Its complete garbage if you only get 50,000 points a year for paying 500 fee. You can't even stay at the Ritz for 50000 how about getting your act together GM of this card??? Bonvoy should at least make you give 60,000 its pathetic really.

name: wendydavis12
review: It is so unfortunate that during these times Chase prefers to defer your payments and continue to add interest vs help you when you're trying to make payments during these times of hardship by lowering the interest rates. I called and they did not want to help. So unfortunate and hurting!

name: Carmen
review: I spend money in this credit card for get the miles and putting the bills higth for nothing I only get 50,000 miles in 2 years and using the card for nothing, now I don’t used I yes pay.

name: Kenneth
review: Credit score of 760, I have asked to refi and always get denied. Part of the house is a sectional and part is stick built with a 2 car attached garage with many expensive updates. They had no problem taking the loan initially but now they claim because part of it is  a sectional they cant do the loan, even though it is on a permanent foundation therefore nullifying it being anything mobile.

name: Kerri
review: The rewards back are fantastic. It really helps me save on my Amazon purchases. Using it on groceries and shopping helps rack up my points.

name: Jon-Michael
review: Great company to get a loan thru, we now have purchased a second vehicle with chase and both experiences have been fantastic, no issues at all.

name: Brandon
review: Amazing card, give you a lot of points for travel and good bonus points when you get it , looking to get more credit cards from chase

name: Robert
review: POOR UPDATING ON BALANCE PAYMENTS  Paid off loan continues to show a balance due a month later.  Was slow on mortgage payoff also but not as bad.

name: candacelynndyer89
review: Very bad company to go threw they screwed me over from a scammer and said that it was my fault that they did that the claims department was completely rude and disrespectful blamed me the whole time chase does not back there customers

name: Leslie
review: The app is easy to navigate and it looks amazing, the card includes tons of cash back offers and ways to save, I absolutely love it!

name: Kurtis
review: Chase auto is an excellent financial service source for providing fair rates. I appreciate the opportunity to do business with chase. I am looking forward to a growing relationship.

name: Damiani
review: Wish more purchases were 5% rewards rather than the 2 or 1 rewards points for other purchases but the payback isn’t bad compared to what other credit cards payback.

name: Shelby
review: I've had nothing but good experience with chase auto loans. They're convenient and I'm working on paying off my auto loan early with absolutely no penalties.

name: Dionte
review: Great intro bonus and travel benefits and protections when you use your card. The minimum credit line starts at $5,000 and you can transfer your points to other chase credit cards with reward programs.

name: Steven
review: Rewards are great and the introduction bonus was really nice. Quarterly changes will greatly help holiday shopping this year. Just wish it had more specific travel bonuses.

name: Sue
review: Great service always keep track if it appears somebody else is using your card never had any issues good customer service not fan of high rates if you get behind

name: Paul K
review: It's a good card.

name: James
review: Once loan repayment scenario was set up, runs on autopay and no further action on my part. Couldn’t be more simpler than that.

name: Robert
review: I have had Chase for years, no problems. Great Customer Service. I will use this card for every day purchases. This card will also help raise my credit score as long as I am responsible with it.

name: rockydfwm
review: More Hassles and Fees Than You Could Imagine!I have been a Chase member for over 10 years. The bank has declined in customer service to the point where I made a choice to recently leave the bank. It wasn’t until I left the bank that I released how archaic their policies and procedures really are and how they are fooling their customers.Here is a list of my experiences that forced me to look elsewhere.Overall Operations:-Chase corporate team is asleep at the wheel; they have no clue what is happening at the branches. Branch tellers are basically none existent with bank floor support kiosks 80% vacant on any given day-A teller once told me, “our corporate team does not care what happens at the branches. Branch managers are powerless and have no information to help you…we are only here to work the window.”-I regularly received misinformation across representatives. What the 1-800 reps told me was different from what the bank personnel told me which was different from what the corporate offices told me. Sometimes this was as simple as when a internal bank transfer would clearBanking-Excessive balances must be maintained to avoid account fees, not friendly to students or lower income households-I had to carry around and manage multiple bank cards to do everyday functions…way too complex-You need to be an information technology wizard to navigate and use their website or banking application-On a given Saturday (or other busy day) you can find 15+ people on line with 2-3 tellers behind the glass-Fees are everywhere you look, account minimums, withdrawals, transfers, and cashier checks and good luck trying to get them waived-Online tools are extremely limiting and trips to the branch with complex processes and approvals are a common occurrenceI’ll leave you with this troubling fact: it took me 3 days and 6 trips to my local branch to close my 5 accounts at Chase…….However, I opened up 5 new bank accounts, added all my payees and completed it all online IN ONLY 2 HOURS. I should have exited Chase many years ago, lesson learned.

name: Rich Alva
review: Absolutely horrible support. I'm not sure if it's chase or amazon on the other end but they are not able to help in any acceptable way. This is a co branded mess of a card and the 5% on amazon purchases seems good at first but after having to deal with who ever is suppose to be supporting this it is not worth it. Another card getting dumped in the never use again pile.

name: alikatz79
review: Whichever one is on the other end, does not matter. Customer support is a huge part of the problem with this credit card. I wish I would have stayed clear!!

name: ricksharmaone
review: I have been chase credit card member for more than 10 years or more and acquired several cards through them. I respect that but they never respected a loyalty even this COVID. They should be considerate telling customer for lowering their interest rate during pandemic. That way customer will stay with them and appreciate. I made more than minimum payments always. I have been receiving offer of balance transfer from other providers but never received from Chase since they are making money. Today I asked one of chase representative to lower APR on my existing balance and they said we don't have any. We offer for new balance transfer. That's the answer I received for being a loyal customer to them for over 10 years. They could have done 0% on existing balance than customer would have stayed with them forever. They are making millions or billion in credit card fees and loyalty means nothing to them. Just beware of this Giant money makers specially CHASE Credit Card

name: Ray
review: Great card no fee.  Good for restaurants and food delivery services.  No annual fee, and great combines with the saphire preferred or reserve.

name: Mary Janelle
review: Sometimes I forget who I need to call and pay this bill. Usually end up talking to both Costco & Citi. Kind of a pain with Covid in all. I like shopping there. Too bad they do not have a bathroom on both ends of the store.

name: Bobby
review: I am pretty satisfied with this card I like the fact that it’s a credit card and can be used anywhere and I’m not just stuck on buying from Amazon directly only

name: fchapel52
review: Chase credit cards are terrible products!  You hardly earn any points, and redeeming them is worthless.  Also, if there is a fraudulent charge on your card, the bank won't send you a replacement for a week! Chase has gotten too big for its britches.  Do not give them more business!!

name: Michael Mann
review: I currently have a Capital One Venture Card and use it for all my travel needs.  I got this one because I didn't want to be tied to one particular airline.  Since, I've flown with United recently I had a very pleasing experience all around.  As a result, I've been debating on applying for one of the United travel cards.  They seem to go everywhere I would want to travel to and have always been the lowest and most accommodating to my needs  This new Gateway card is just perfect for me...the occasional flier.  Provides me with all the potential miles I want and provides more of the categories I spend toward to maximize benefits in spending.  So when I purchase my flight with Venture, I'll use the miles on the Gateway for any upgrades/purchases.  The application process was simple easy and would have been quick if I would have known my Equifax file was locked.  Provided me with a credit line more than enough for me needs.

name: Dee Mcrumray
review: They really don't care about how ridiculous the rates are. I will only use this once a year for gas because they don't help at all

name: Gary
review: I like the app on my phone. I use it almost everyday to track transactions and pay any balances..I like that I can check my credit score for free.

name: Scott
review: No longer in posession of this card.

name: Polyana Fagundes
review: CHASE you’re supposed to be a TRAVEL credit card , yet when my flight gets CANCELLED you REFUSE to REFUND my money. I won’t be traveling with Chase anymore and neither should youAfter checking with Air Canada, they've confirmed that for any bookings where the terms and conditions indicated no refunds would be permitted, they aren't providing any exceptions. I was told that they were having issues with their system and on my 3rd call somebody from customer service told me that AirCanada is not even flying to Brazil until 2021. This is what they offered me: "For your reservation we have confirmed that the following options are available. 1. You can cancel your reservation with a travel credit towards a future flight. The flight credit is valid for 24 months from the schedule change date, 6 October 2022. Upon rebooking, the change fee will be waived and fare difference applies.2. You can transfer your ticket to a different passenger."

name: Timothy W
review: The card is issued by Chase and is an Amazon Prime card. No annual fee and I can either get money or purchase something at Amazon.

name: Etienne
review: Really love this card, it’s apart of my regular rotation especially since they added on to what you can earn back would recommend this card

name: STEPHEN SLUTSKY
review: 200 after you spend 500.

name: Linda Bolin
review: Thank u..are a big help.but i dont think i can ever hit 800..please tell me how to get there.i am never late..and never missed a payment.

name: Sk D
review: Worst bank. Did not get the Sign in bonus. They runfake sign in promotion with hidden terms and condition. Please abstain from this popular brand name. You will be cheated for sure. Customer service are the worst. Managers are completely useless and have no training or talent on their own promotion.

name: Georgina
review: Awards are an incentive to customers to spend. Chase credit card maintained that system. It was very useful to have used it for purchases.

name: Victor
review: I like the simplicity of the card and how I can use it for different areas. I don't like the fee Chase has such as foreign transaction fee but otherwise I like it.

name: Elena Barren
review: I would give them zero, they charge a 25% interest! I prefer discover they charge about 6% interest. I spent 1700 on my discover card and was charged a ten dollar interest. I used 300 dollars on my chase card and was charged the same amount of interest!! I will never Open a chase credit card again!!

name: Diane
review: Love being able to pay in the principal quicker.  Thank you for a good %rate.  I hoping I can continue this relationship with getting a 1st time buyer mortgage for a home In July 2021

name: Barbara
review: Love the car and zero percent interest is fantastic. Love Subaru, dependable car, dealership is extraordinary.  Friendly workers and COVID protected.

name: Steven
review: Been ok so far. Using as my every day card. 11,500 CL with 800 score. A lot of bad reviews concerning any sort of disputes so I worry about having any coverage issues in the future. Disappointed that several months after receiving this card that the bonus points went up 20k from 60k to 80k now.

name: whuser66840759
review: It's great we always shop at whole foods and amazon and this card d always does the job. I add an authenticated user to it as well so that we are both saving money

name: Frederick
review: Amazing rewards cards. Great customer service. Love their choice of properties and locations. Could not be happier with free night anniversary.

name: Daven
review: Amazon Card.  Excellent card.  Use it for all my Amazon purchases and get 5% back on all purchases...to spend on more Amazon stuff!

name: Angel
review: I love everything about my Chase credit card! Haven't had any problems with the use of my card or customer service! So Awesome! I had a car loan & Loved the Service with them as well! #chaserocks#

name: Robert
review: I’m debt-free I’m happy no more payment no more fees everything paid off. Good good good

name: Barbara
review: Easy payment and such a great company to work with. I will be using them when I buy another vehicle. The loan process was easy and quick.

name: imind
review: The Chase website is below average regarding user friendliness. Its password management is particularly frustrating. Discover card website is immensely superior!

name: Peter
review: It's a good card- get miles - points and travel awards - we pay it off and we are able to diversify our spending when we need different types of rewards

name: Meghann
review: The interest is way too high for that car, it should be around 4.5% but it’s 7%. Chase really takes advantage of low income people in fiscally irresponsible ways.

name: Josh
review: Chase is just an all around good credit card to have. They report to all three credit bureaus. They always offer the best rewards an are willing to work with you as long as you communicate with them.

name: Melana
review: Creditcard lied about apr 24% during covid-19  companies are getting rich @ people expense its just terrible and my credit score was@ 795  with 20 years on time payments. ITS  RADICALIST radicalist .I HAVE EXCELLENT CREDIT 795-815NOW WITH COVID-19 NO ONE CAN GET 850 or above with COVID-19

name: Alicia
review: Thank you for the loan approval for our new Subaru Outback. Plus the APR rating is not high at all. My husband and I are so greatful.

name: Tomas
review: Chase has always been a great card to have and to use, good customer service. The only difficulty with their customer service, is they use call centers outside of the U.S., which makes it difficult to understand them when they speak english.

name: Taylor Evans
review: Upon multiple recommendations I setup a Chase Bank account online. Everything proceeded smoothly and I had an account ready in a day. However, multiple problems occurred after this. First my account was locked over possible fraud because I tried to transfer money from my previous bank over via an external account transfer. I called Chase's support line and after approximately 2 hours holding I was told I needed to go into a local Chase branch with two forms of ID to unlock my account. Several days later I was able to do so, but now they told me they cannot unlock my account and had to call it in themselves. By this point both my checking and savings accounts had been deleted because my account was suspected of fraud. The branch representative said I then had to wait until their fraud department called me and verified who I was. So I waited several hours for this. Once that was done, I could return to the branch several days later to reopen a checking/savings account and setup a credit card with automatic payment.For a month things proceeded smoothly and no issues arose. However, I then received an email and a call saying that my credit card was overdue even though I had personally ensured that automatic payments were setup the day before my balance was due. Upon examining my account online I found that automatic payments had been disabled and I now had to pay a late fee associated with the card and said card was deactivated until I paid the statement balance. I tried to make a payment for that day, but an error occurred when I did so. I could only make a payment at a later date even with more possible late fees pending.Summary:- Do not create a Chase account online, do it in person.- Do not use Chase phone support services, go to a local branch.- Do not rely on automatic payments for a credit card, pay the balance yourself.- All the Chase representatives I met were very helpful and kind, even though Chase's digital services were glitchy.

name: Leslie
review: A large financial institution the staff treat you really great. One time I lost one of my cards. It was replaced in just a few days.

name: Thomas Schmidt
review: My wife was a scam victim by NTS computer services almost two years ago. Chase refused to stop the charge after several written complaints. All they needed to do was google NTS computer services or even the phone number (844) 208-2608 to know this has been a scam for years. I am still getting emails from these criminals and other companies who were sold my wifes contact. There is even a Trade Commission investigation. Chase says we'd rather have the money. Screw you!!!

name: gdombrow
review: Customer Support easy to work with . They report to the credit bureau on time . Most other credit card companies are sporadic when they report

name: kammanta
review: Don’t open an account with them. I was with Chase for over a decade, never missed a payment, and had excellent account history. Happily, at the beginning of this year, I paid off my cc debts. Now I pay off the balance each month. I made an extra payment when nothing was due, and their online banking system auto-populated the wrong payment account so it was returned. No big deal I paid from another account (keep in mind nothing was due and this was an extra payment). They closed my account with no warning. Beyond that the account rep who I was discussing it with stated “What don’t you understand, the account is closed”. They also don’t have the authority to do this based on the account agreement. They also stated they sent me a closure notice on the day it was closed, but in the letter and notice section in online banking has nothing listed where all other letters I have received have a copy here, this is a violation of Reg Z requirements of my rights to a notice as a consumer. This is an unconscionable treatment of a long-time customer, with excellent account history and credit, and proves they are only in it for the money. If anyone else experiences the treatment of this nature I encourage you to explore your legal rights as a consumer and to file a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau(CFPB), to their regulator (OCC), their insurer FDIC, and the NY Department of Financial Services (DFS).

name: Edythe
review: Chase  cards are just a so so/ ok cards, that is open nothing special.  They don't offer much  I use it for small things.  It doesn't really offer  or do much.  As soon as you use it they send you  lots of messages. I have never been late or not paid and my score is excellent  823.  It is a  card that has been open for years so I keep it active. I  don't recommend it for any thing.

name: Allan
review: Never a hassle and anything that goes wrong, you can call anytime.  Problems always resolved quickly.  Expensive to own unless you're collecting points for a good reason.

name: Charles
review: I enjoy using this card because I get points towards future purchases on Amazon. It is easy to access and monitor through my Amazon Prime account.

name: Heather
review: Friday staff very helpful and willing to work with you in alot of cases actually and seem to care about events occurring in life very impthedt.

name: Sohail
review: Love this card, has great rotating categories. Has great pairing with the sapphire products. In my top five credit cards year round.

name: Marc McGuire
review: I myself didn't get instant approval either.  Chase said it needed further review before approval.  I was just saying oh well to myself but then couple days later when logged into my Chase app to make a payment to other UR cards I noticed a new card popped up (freedom flex).  Clicked on details and got a CL of $21,000.   I knew I was under the 5/24 rule and credit is excellent arourd 780.  It maybe during these times it needs manual second review to be sure of consideration.

name: Warren
review: I think it also helps approval if you already have a World Elite Mastercard. To my surprise my Capital One SavorOne card was a World Elite Mastercard. So I knew about the additional benefits coming in. But SavorOne only give you 3% back on dining and entertainment, soo it's pretty basic. I know that Mastercard requires certain criteria in order to issue a World Elite Mastercard, soo you have to meet Chase's requirements and Mastercard's for approval for the Freedom Flex. With Capital One, if you don't meet requirements for World Elite, they'll just issue the same card as a Platinum, Standard or World Credit Card.

name: Warren
review: Applied online but was not instantly approved. It said "application is under review". But not to worry because Chase isn't doing a whole lot of instant approvals right now. So I called the reconsideration line to see if I could speed things along and was then approved over the phone with a $8800 credit limit. They pulled from Experian and Equifax with 772/769 FICO scores. I had just under 3% revolving credit utilization, had no new inquiries for past 12 months, and was clear of the 5/24 rule by just 1 card.This is by far the best rewards card with no annual fee ever offered by any credit card company so I made sure to have all my ducks in a row going in to the application process.Here are the benefits:-5% cash back on groceries on up to $12k for the first year..that is $600 in cash back for the first year-5% on rotating categories on up to $1500 in spending per quarter..almost the same categories as the discover it cash back rewards card but in different quarters. that is $300 in cash back assuming you max out each category-$200 welcome bonussoo we are at $1100 in cash back for the first year soo far.-3% back on dining-3% back at drugstores-5% back on Lyft-3 free months of DoorDash Dash Pass and 50% off the following 9 months...that is $45 for an entire year of dash pass($120 value)But this is just the beginning of the benefits. The Freedom Flex is one of a few zero annual fee cards that is the top tier World Elite Mastercard and the benefits through MasterCard are substantial. To name a few:-cell phone insurance(damaged or stolen) on up to $800 per claim.-Price Protection and Purchase Protection extended to 120 days.-An additional year added to your warranty on any item you purchase with 3 or less years-for every 5x lyft rides you take in one month, you get a $10 lyft credit once per month-and the list goes on and onThis card combines the benefits of the amex blue cash everday for the first year, the benefits of the SavorOne indefinitely, the  discover it cash back rewards card, and the original Freedom card. This is a no brainer

name: Alfredo Santos
review: As my Prime bank account I'm very PLEASED. Also, I get good customers service and a chance to buy and trade in the stock market !!!

review: This is actually my daughter's card and I am an authorized user. I have NEVER spent a single dime on this card. We are listed on each other's things in case of an emergency.

review: I love the miles I've earned.  We'll all travel again someday.  ✈️? My Chase card will be the only card I need, everywhere I  go.

Paid back the whole amount before the promo period has ended. As soon as I did that, they dropped my credit limit from $10.000 to only $500. Just save you some nerves, don't bother and get a credit card from a different bank like Discover or Capital One, much better service.

So they got their card back and I wouldn't recommend or use them again. I even got hung upon and was never given a confirmation for the account closure how unprofessional they just keep getting. They have all my money and I have read that this is a frequent occurrence of them shutting down good peoples accounts and holding their money without good reason or explanation. This is surreal. I’m so behind on bills with COVID going on and was so happy I was going to be able to get caught back up and now this. I do not recommend anyone banking with Chase!

review: Chase does an awesome job with home mortgages. They’ve always had the best interest rate when we were looking. They’re very efficient and make the process easy to deal with!

review: in regards to the "refer a friend to open a checking acount and get $50". i opened an account for my daughter, from my account i got a link to send to her email and once she opened it and opened her account i would get the $50  10 days later. since she doesnt check her email she suggested i link it to my other email which i did. i never received the $50 dollars so i called , i finally got a retuen call from someone with such a heavy accent i couldnt even understand. what he said was that the $50 was sent to someone elses account because my daughter used someones link and not mine. bull..... i opened it from one email to my other. Bottom line they are liars

name: Patricia Iwasaki
review: We've had checking and savings accounts at our local Chase branch for over eight years.  In the past the branch has notarized documents for us as a courtesy; so today when we needed a single signature witnessed by a notary in order to move $100,000 from a 401K to our Chase savings account, we headed to Chase.  The branch was virtually devoid of customers, and there was a notary present.  However, the person who greeted us told us Chase will only notarize Chase documents now.  I explained that the purpose of the notarization was to move $100,000 into our Chase account.  The person who greeted us did not allow us to talk to the notary, but kept running back and forth as intermediary.  He kept coming back stonefaced with a variety of excuses.  Finally he told us that the type of service we were asking for--witnessing a signature--involved "too much liability", and that was why it could not be performed.  All that was required was to look at my drivers license, look at my face, and watch me sign the document.   It took two minutes for the notary to do this for us at the UPS Store (for a fee).  The Chase branch certainly has our signatures and other information on file in case it wanted to further verify our identities. Apparently that is too much for Chase Bank to provide as a service to its own customers.  I've a good mind to find someplace else to deposit that $100,000!

name: IYAN MCFALL
review: After 10 years being a royal customer without any branch nearby, they still charge $6/per statement X 4 months, after closing our accounts due to the permanent move (10 hrs driving distance to closest branch) . Will NEVER GO BACK!

name: Charlott
review: Love it. I am saving up my Amazon points to use for travel once all of this covid mess is over. We plan to take a nice weeklong vacation with the whole family.

review: DO NOT TRUST CHASE!! They will close your account or dramatically lower your credit limit whenever they want and will not put anything in writing when you ask them to. Recently they couldn't even tell me if a payment was due even though there website was stating so and I had already made 2 payments that billing cycle.

review: Great card for travel and hotel and car rentals. I always use it when I travel I love to earn RR points to pay for airline tickets

name: Tammy
review: Great company.  I have 3 cards with them,  they’ve even credited an interest rate to help our,  willing to work with you & suggest different things

name: sheiwig
review: I started this process in May. It's now September and we still don't have a closing date. Here's why I am rating this a 1 star:My Details:Income: 175K+Home Value: 300K+Mortgage Balance: 129K+Rental Property Mortgage: $360/moOther/Revolving Debt: $0Savings Account Balance: 12 Months of Living ExpensesRetirement & Other Investment Balances: 500K+This should be a slam dunk, but nope. They need to verify that my 22.4K HELOC with another bank won't take me above underwriting's DTI guidelines. Submitted the HELOC contract with my previous customer service rep (CSR) twice. First time it was too dark. Second time it was lost due to CSR leaving Chase. Second CSR has asked me to resubmit this contract and other closing related documents.Chase's refi volume, like other lenders, is way up; however, their processes are out of control. If you need a quick turn, I'd go somewhere else.

review: Good card. Customer service is great. Intro 0% for 18 months allowed me to pay down some significant debt by consolidating other cards.

name: David
review: Thank you for giving me the opportunity to be part of your good group of people, I am getting ready for the offer of the times are you ready?

review: I’d give 0 stars if I could. I have TWO chase cards with high credit lines. I made a lump sum $4400 payment on 1 card and $2000 payment on the other card. Three weeks later, I receive a letter for both cards that my credit line has been reduced. The reason: balance owed on revolving accounts is too high. I was mortified! I JUST paid a lump sum of  $6400! So, this creates a huge problem because now, it appears I have an extremely high balance on both cards which means higher minimum payment amounts. NO LOYALTY to their customers. I will pay off my balances and will never use them again.
