review: Simply worth it even if only using for amazon purchases cash back rewards are the best plus a very generous initial credit line ?

name: billyboy0823
review: I stopped using my Chase Credit cards for 4 main reasons. (1)  You can no longer get statements from them through BillPay. (2) They provided a 12 month 0% transfer offer, but after accepting, they made 1st months payment equal 90% of the transfer amount. Basically, I paid a transfer fee and had to pay the total transferred to avoid interest.  (3) No matter how many times I've asked, they will not stop sending me junk email. The emails contain NO opt-out links and going to the site and un-checking all marketing options does not work. (4) Their Fees for transfer are much higher than most any other card. They have gone from a 5 star Card provider to a one star in about 3-4 years. I recommend Discover or AMEX rather than Chase for Credit Cards.

name: Sara Ahrens
review: Honestly I’m in hard times and they did help  but then they couldn’t do anything more , I’m sorry when my account is in good standing and something finally goes through a few days later that was only 10 dollars and I have to pay 34 overdraft charge for I feel is ridiculous.  Plus I feel if you made over 1000 dollars off of me probably on overdraft charges in the last year I’m sure you can waive some more so a single mom can feed her children Now I’m drowning , can’t buy food or pay rent but don’t worry I just kept getting hit with overdraft charges till my next payday . Now it’s payday and I’m still negative . Worse experience, I’m leaving this horrible bank once my direct deposit changes over . I’ve never left a bad review in my life but when a bank can officially make it where I can’t pay bills, rent or buy food this is just ridiculous.

name: Douglas
review: Don’t owe .01 to Chase but they keep showing a balance!!!!!!!! Where do you get your info?? Now I’m told that my review isn’t long enough!!!! Needs to be at least 130 characters.....what the hell is going on?

name: Carole
review: Well I guess after reading all the reviews below, I should be surprised by what happened to us. My husband and I were given a almost $7000 credit limit which we utilize for our once a year disney cruise, but because we have not utilized it on a regular basis they cut our limit by almost $4K. This hurt us more ways then one, 1: Potentially hurts us from being able to pay off our next vaca, 2: both my husband and I credit score was hurt significantly, I was told by the lending center of  course this is never their intention and they can understand how this may seem personal, but to assure us it is not... REALLY? That's exactly what it is... We are penalized for not using your card on a regular basis no matter that our payments are consistent, on time and above the min.   We do not use this card all year till our vaca then we take that year to pay it off, we have always been on time and make more then the minimum payment... the past several months substantial payments... very disappointed.  We did not even receive a fair warning that this cut was coming... We will be looking for other avenues for our future vaca, They will not get any other business from us.

name: nmmetsfan
review: Terrible customer service despite a consistent history (never a late payment on my entire 20+ year credit history). Serviced by Chase, so don't expect any level of responsiveness for any issues. There are better options.

name: lmalashock
review: Never had a worse experience with a bank! Started trying to move 5 business accounts from PNC to Chase FOUR months ago. I had to continually follow p with the Vice President of Business relations, Ashley T. Her communication was terrible. Blaming Covid constantly for all the problems I decided to give up today and cancelled all my applications and will find a bank and employee that wants my business. The JP Morgan does went great with all my personal accounts but I will move them now as well. What a disaster. Think twice before moving to Chase!!!!!

name: Bernard
review: I am writing this only because you insist on me writing 130 characters in order to submit this card. I believe that writing 130 characters is ridiculous

name: Patrick Brown
review: I have 3 credit cards with Chase and them inconsiderate numb nuts decreased all my limits on all 3 cards, now instead of 55% usage it's at 95% credit usage so now when they report to the credit bureau I have maxed my cards out and my credit score will decrease considerably. During a pandamic when everyone is struggling this is what they have the balls to do, I have not asked them for a deferal and I pay my bills on time on each credit card. I will not use there credit cards ever again and I'm going to close my 2 checking accounts and when these cards are paid off I'm going to cut them in a million pieces and send it to Chase inconsiderate Bankers.??

name: Angel
review: Flexible and accurate  to satisfy needs. One of the best cards in market. Love to expand my business with this type of credit and vintage

name: sublu121
review: Chase is the best bank out there. I've tried others, but Chase has been consistently honest and doesnt charge hidden fees like so many others.

name: John
review: 100,000 offer to open the card.  I travel a lot and prefer to stay at Marriott properties anyway.  Chase website and Marriott websites are both easy to navigate.

name: John
review: The refinance process was really easy and saved me a point with cash out for home improvements.  Website is really easy to navigate to make additional principal payments, check escrow balances etc.

name: Patrick Brown
review: I have 3 credit cards with Chase and them inconsiderate numb nuts decreased all my limits on all 3 cards, now instead of 55% usage it's at 95% credit usage so now when they report to the credit bureau I have maxed my cards out and my credit score will decrease considerably. During a pandamic when everyone is struggling this is what they have the balls to do, I have not asked them for a deferal and I pay my bills on time on each credit card. I will not use there credit cards ever again and I'm going to close my 2 checking accounts and when these cards are paid off I'm going to cut them in a million pieces and send it to Chase inconsiderate Bankers.!!

name: ellis_a_yang
review: Terrible service. I tried calling multiple times and all were big fails saying that my pinned in info was incorrect. i spoke to a customer service and they didn’t do anything but ask me random questions then hung up

name: MARTHA S
review: GREAT CREDIT CARD TO USE SO EASY TO PAY OFF TOO HAVE USED IT TO BUY SO MANY THINGS THAT I NEEDED FOR MYSELF AND REALLY ENJOYED USING.

name: serolal
review: Absolutely distrusted bank. Could change any rules in any moment.  Offered opening saving account with very questionable benefit and than blocked all my account without any explanation and warnings.

name: johnnyh_30
review: I really like my chase card, the rate is just too high,  I am hoping to find a card with a much lower rate, I will continue to shop for a lower rate card.

name: gtocquigny
review: We currently hold 2 Chase Sapphire Reserve cards, (yes, that’s $900/yr. in annual fees) which we primarily use for travel outside the US.  Recently, I decided to try purchasing an Air France ticket using Chase Ultimate Rewards, but unfortunately we had to cancel the entire European trip due to Covid.  Since this particular ticket was within the EU, it was not cancelled by Air France.  When I called Chase Travel to cancel and seek a refund, they first gave me a different number to call with no explanation as to why, and this was after going through all of the security verification questions.  At the second number, I was placed on a “short hold” for a total of over 16 minutes while the rep “called the airline.”  I understand that Covid has caused much confusion and policies are still changing, but the answer she gave after talking directly to Air France (supposedly) was “Chase Travel can issue a travel voucher, but if you want a refund, you may apply directly on the AF website.”  I chose the latter, and promptly received an email reply from Air France stating that I must seek a refund through my “travel agent.”  There are so many things we love about the Sapphire card, not the least of which is the travel insurance and Priority Pass airline lounge benefits, but I have little confidence in Chase Travel.  I’m convinced that it’s a totally outsourced operation, and the Sapphire customer service folks want nothing to do with it, based on my conversations with the credit card side of the house.

name: Jerome
review: The interest rate for this loan is to high 13 % or 30 % if I carry the loan to term. To pay the interest upfront with little going toward the principle place me in a difficult position. It’s ridiculous that our government will allow this type of financing . This will cost me 10,000 on a 30,000 vehicle. I wish I be turn this car in after my lease period ended.  Never will I do this again.

name: ezeis04
review: This credit card was decent until chase decided to hurt people during a global pandemic. I have a credit score over 800, never missed a payment on ANY credit card, and make $250k a year. Chase decided that since I was keeping a high balance on a credit card for 2 months because of uncertainty during a global health crisis that they would punish me and my credit by significantly reducing my credit line. This was a balance that was paid off in full after 2 months. I have 19 credit cards between business and personal and have a $0 balance on any of them at this point. In order to reinstate my credit line they need to do a hard hit on my credit. Shocker. Predatory company. Terrible ethics. Will not be using any of my chase credit cards ever again!

name: e_blazjr
review: Review is based on customer service, not checking - specifically the automated system and waste of life waiting to speak with someone only to be disconnected or transferred to someone else - ridiculous amount of prompts and menus and time spent trying to speak to a customer service rep - then the obligatory "I'm sorry, I understand, we hear it all day every day" response - THEN DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT - I wish I could recommend a bank to send you to, but in this case I can only recommend which bank NOT to use if you value customer service

name: jcopus2469
review: Has the best rate and wide use capability of any card on the market. It also comes with a $500 bonus add initial issue. Bonus points can be converted to cash on demand.

name: spartancretan
review: You're just a number with this card. I rarely write reviews, but the customer service with this card, is uncaring and could care less about their customers. I've been a customer for years and paid off my balance every month, with a very good credit rating. They made a mistake, which they won't admit and lowered my credit line, despite my excellent rating for years. With sooo many other options, don't make the mistake of getting this card.

name: jgjohnson32
review: I want Chase to know the amount of value that Lindsay Sonner provides for the company in Las Vegas (8174 S Las Vegas blvd). Yesterday I went in with an idea to open a local bank account after relocating from out of state. I was immediately seated with Lindsay as there was an open time slot and she went through the process with me. I have been in a lot of financial institutions in the past and never have I been treated so well by a banker before. Lindsay was very thorough with everything. As a former employee working in corporate compliance, her level of service in regards to the compliance side of banking was top tier! She was extremely thorough in me understanding the account itself along with anything that could happen as a result of options I chose for myself. This experience was a huge treat to work with her! Words cannot express my gratitude for her service to the people in that branch. She is definitely without a doubt thee highest level in consumer interaction I have ever found in ANY industry. Everyone I know that is not currently a Chase customer needs to be one. Chase in my opinion blows the other major players in banking out of the water. Thank you so much Lindsay and Chase Bank for creating what will be a long term financial relationship!

name: Matt
review: Interest rates are too high for my credit rating. I switched to a different card. ..................................................

name: Marvin
review: They are not good for consumers. Untrustworthy inaccuracy and lies to their customers. Not looking for the best interest of their customers.

name: irena prager
review: Worst service - 90% deterioration in customer service since 2019.I am Chase customer for over 20 years I have multi million dollar loans and business accounts with this bank.It is over 3 months since we opened out new company Uvilite account with Chaise @ 8150 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, Naleeka is the bunker - and account is still not functional. It is continuously under review for different errors that bankers made filling out the information  Confusing CFO and SEO of the company, etc..  making sure address is not a P.O. which it is not. Next issue is that there are 4 company owners (at 20%+) and only 2 people on the account and it allegedly  has to be all shareholders of over 20%! That is a complete lie.In between all these issues it took DAYS and WEEKS to get hold of bankers of that brunch and our company is unable to function.

name: David
review: So far so good. I havent used any points yet but they are adding up. The application was simple and received the card promptly. Overall quite satisfied

name: Steven S
review: Be forewarned my fellow small business owners, this credit card company is brutally coldhearted in my opinion; I also say this opinion as a Ph.D. in Business that’s quite familiar with small business, marketing and operations. In sum, I created a new start-up last year and while opening a business checking account for it at my local Chase branch, a “relationship banker” seduced me into opening a Chase Ink Unlimited business credit card as well, via the promise of a $500 reward if I spent $3,000. I agreed, knowing that I’d overextend my capital/operational expenditures by a 1/3 more than I could really afford or quite needed at that time, but thought I’d be a fool not to get half of that overextension back in just a few months. After months went by with no reward, I contacted said banker to inquire as to why? Despite getting the credit for opening the account, he referred me to call the number on my card, noting it was my “simplest option”; gee, thanks for the personal customer service…I then called customer service and it was a polite and sincere experience, to give credit where it’s due. I explained my situation and asked what was wrong. In response, there was a pause and a slight gasp before she quietly replied that I had spent $2,996 and change, under $4 shy of the promotion. I repeated that I had overextended myself to get the offer and that my opening has been delayed due to the pandemic and asked, how could I be punished for such an insignificant amount after spending so much? Paraphrasing her engaging comments, she sadly and subtlety inferred (very clearly as if terrified to be overheard telling the truth to a customer) that she’d clear me for the promo offer if she could, but that she’d have to send a request for approval from some internal marketing/promotions department. She then subtlety alluded that they were very tough/unfavorable on customer decisions no matter the situation, but left me with some hope that, “they sometimes will just ask you to spend a few more dollars”. Though she didn’t sound very convincing I was touched by her genuine compassion. She knew what was right and wrong.    While waiting to hear back about my ruling, I scrutinized my records to see if I had made a mistake and eventually figured out that I had and by the $3 and change amount noted. I bring this up because ironically, my problem was that I inadvertently added in an expense from a personal credit card to my chase card accounting totals spreadsheet, with the real kicker being that this was because the Chase Ink card was delayed well past when my “banker” said I’d get it. The delay happened because the credit department had needed info that banker hadn’t collected initially (not sure who was at fault). In short, while I do take responsibility for my $3+ error, I was in fact put in this situation because of a previous service failure at Chase Ink that caused a second failure in getting the card later than needed and being forced to use another card until then.A couple days later, I received a cold unsigned form letter from Chase, noting in a single generic sentence that I had been denied my $500 reward because I didn’t spend enough. I was stunned that Chase could be so cruel for a measly 3 bucks and change. It’s pure speculation, but from all my marketing experience, I have to assume said decision makers are incentivized to minimize costs, as any reasonable and decent human being couldn’t be so inhumane otherwise, but I guess that’s how JP Morgan & Co rolls. After being a good paying business customer that’s spent thousands, I can’t imagine a banker in person looking me in the face and denying a claim over $3.Though I doubt anyone in power will bother to read this, my final words are to the Marketing managers and Marketing/Promotions department at Chase Ink that make these rules and decisions. In short, as a decades long professor and business practitioner, I say you all need to go back to school as well as grow some ethics and a conscious. You all may save Chase some money and perhaps hit a bonus/target for yourselves up front, but at the cost of future business and the nontrivial ill-will that an action like this causes. Furious like any red-blooded American would be, I will share my experience with all who will listen and it’s a pretty compelling evil corporate story that Chase Ink would treat a small business customer like garbage for spending $2,996.04 versus $3,000. Conversely, can you imagine all the good will and positive WOM marketing it would have created had I been able to brag about my relationship with Chase, boasting that you had done the right thing; my review would have been quite different. It’s Marketing 101 and more profitable in the long run, beyond being the right thing to do… Moreover, treating a fledgling small business like this and especially given all the suffering from the current pandemic, it’s simply unconscionable. That money could be the difference on whether I’m able to stay afloat long enough to actually open to the public. Thanks for nothing Chase Ink and putting me in a financial bind.

name: Reinaldo
review: Great Customer Service and Amazon Rewards.  I have never had any unresolved questions or issues.  I also really like the breakdown on charges and categories.

name: Mark Cafiero
review: Opportunistic.  I found myself overdrawn during COVID.  Immediately made deposits, but they held for a week to collect more overdrafts. They would have held it for longer. I eventually called in, waited on hold for 45 minutes and had to express my frustration before getting my deposits released. I hate when banks capitalizes off of their customer's misfortunes like that. I also went into a branch and asked if they would PLEASE DECLINE all transactions if my balance can't cover for it. They refuse. They want those overdraft fees. They promised I'd get notifications via text if my balance hits zero. Nope. Be careful if you choose Chase. They like taking advantage of their customers in their most vulnerable moments.

name: Timothy
review: Love this informative app. Offers you plenty of saving options. Give you the opportunity dispute errors on your credit reports. Thanks!

name: Dd Bar
review: Zero stars. I deposited $1450 at the ATM outside Chase Oxford, MI 7 days ago, and it has not yet been credited to my account. I have followed every direction to call different numbers, create a claim, visit a branch with an open lobby. I have received ZERO communication from Chase about my deposit. DO NOT use the ATM at Chase Oxford for a deposit. Their customer service does not exist.

name: Gilbert Villanueva
review: No introduction offer. This card charged me interest right away. Did not give me a zero interest introduction offer. Not good for me

name: Khemra
review: One of my favorite cards to use. Reward wasn’t too bad. I used this card pretty much for everything from making small purchases or big purchases.

name: Brittany G
review: They put a hold on a check for a week and a half even after I waited on hold over an hour and asked for them to release partial funds as I have been waiting for unemployment and have bills to pay they said there was Nothing they could do. So here I wait another week for the check to clear so I can pay my bills. They don’t care about customers at all!

name: Wayne
review: Like the 1.5% cash back, no annual fee, and $200 bonus offer features of the Chase Freedom Unlimited Visa credit card. Since I use Chase as my primary bank, easy for me to monitor my checking and credit card accounts thru same website.

name: Albert
review: Chase bamk has excellent customer care service, I would like to highly recommend their service to all new and established customers as an alternative to adding another means of a secured and reliable banking institution and service

name: Kawika
review: Bad credit card. 2 Lounge pass is not worth it. United has the worst lounge out there. United recent change to their elite system makes this card worthless. Avoid at all cost caveat emptor!!

name: john
review: We recently paid off the mortgage on our home.  Chase was an excellent lender. I hate to be forced into saying more than I said in the first place.  That is why I never fill out these rations.

name: Shawn
review: I have a zero balance but they will not negotiate a lower rate.  Even though I called to ask even with a zero balance.  That’s not good business

name: trevor
review: this was a goodncard i was just bad at paying off my debts every month but the support was really helpful and they let me use there stuff

name: Aubrey Long
review: I'm waiting now on the phone 1 hr 14 min & 44 seconds!!  NOT HAPPY.  Take my advice and get a different card.  I have all the evidence for this undelivered product to be a credit back to my acct for $162.42 and that is almost 5 months ago.  They have sided with the smooth talking crooks over my physical evidence!!!

name: Lisa
review: I'm getting a new card  lost the first one  I  I called chase for a new one  my score was better then I found it crazy. I enjoyed having a better score

name: Sreve
review: I like my chase freedom card and always pay it off every month. Do I get cash back on auto parts? And it would be nice to get cash back at Walmart .

name: Anthony
review: I use the Chase Freedom Unlimited card for my business expenses. Great way to earn cash back rewards on all purchases. Plus there is no annual fee.

name: john_althen
review: I went to log in to my chase account today which I usually just put chase in the title bar and life is good. Today I apparently put it in the google search. I didn't catch it but I clicked on the first Chase that came up which was online banking log in. It took me to a page that looked legit and I put in my user name and password and a window popped up and said that due to recent activity my account has been suspended and to call this number with this reference number which I am not an idiot so I did not do it but rather went to chase dot com and changed my user name and password. I then went back to investigate what happed and found that what I clicked on to was under "AD" so shame on me! I was just in a hurry to pay my cable bill :-) I went through the steps and took screen shots so that I could forward on to Chase fraud. I collected my screen shot and talked to a gal by the name of May who explained that there was nothing unusual on my account but should be fine. I said I wasn't worried about my account as I changed my user name and password immediately but I was just trying to help Chase help other people who might get suckered in to calling the number they provided. She then asked if I saw anything that did not look right. I told her that she was not understanding me, my account is fine but I have screen shots of what is being done to commit fraud against their customers. I said if you have another fraud department that is not credit card fraud. She said they have identity theft and fraud departments but there is no fraud on my account! I said I understand that I was looking to give them information to save 100s of thousands of peoples lives disrupted because of these people. Then I said that she is just not understanding me and to please pass me to a supervisor! She replied that there is no supervisor available, REALLY, 3 PM and you have NO MANAGER TO SPEAK TO A CONCERNED CUSTOMER!! I said don't worry about it, I will deal with my local manager when I go to withdraw all my money because I don't trust them to protect my money!! Find another bank

name: Tiffany Howell
review: My husband has excellent credit, he was approved for $5000 they had a promotion going spend $3000 get so many points equal to $600 so he did. He has had the card over a year , never missed a payment, never late, well with everything going on in the world he decided to pay it off in full. As soon as he did that they DROPPED his limit to $500 !!!! That's 10% of what he had. And again I state, never missed, never late, excellent credit.... So he called them and the lady couldn't really help so he said ok I've been loyal you just did me like that I'm done, I have other credit cards I don't want you no more. The lady became so rude he had to check her and out her in her place. ( He's a really nice guy so it was out of character she had to have been really rude ) He never really cared for the card for 1 reason anyway, every month he would get this charge on his card, it was almost $100 every month and it was from them. All it would say is... Transaction fee. He never figured out what it was. Mind you it's only supposed to be $99 a year. Anyway, just beware you may get approved and get a decent amount of credit line, but make sure you don't pay your bill on time, make sure you miss payments and make sure to never pay it off inadvertently gaining yourself bad credit if you want them to keep you. Do not be a loyal model customer !

name: Nicholas Sanchiz
review: Do not waste your time. The benefits seemed compelling but even with a 749 credit score I was declined on the spot. First ever credit card I've ever been declined by. I've never missed a payment and have a myriad of other credit cards with similar benefits. Wanted this for a large purchase - but it was a total waste of a hard credit check.

name: James
review: I think if you have more than 5 lines of credit or more than 5 credit cards in the last two years you get automatically declined!

name: Kiisha
review: Long hold times! Hard to dispute items. Agents are never clear on things and can never answer questions. Inconsistent answers to questions.

name: Derrick Miller
review: They will lock your card while you are out of town. Pray that it isn't a weekend or after business hours because their Fraud Prevention Department is closed! YES! CLOSED! The only department that can unlock your card and make your funds available to you is closed! Really sucks when you're out of town trying to get gas and nope, not till tomorrow. So have a different account available to you NOT another Chase account. In no way is my second account tied to the my primary but YES! THEY LOCKED THAT ONE TOO! So unless you don't want access to the money you work for everyday or enjoy being in rough predicaments like unable to put gas in your vehicle, unable to buy food, or purchase lodging, this is not the bank for you. Horrible.  Even after verifying my purchases through their Fraud Prevention text messages and emails both of my accounts are still locked. Even after calling every department at Chase no one can help me and I've been stuck at a gas station for 4 hours. Chase Bank is not your friend. These people will screw you first chance they get. Customer since 2010. STAY AWAY!

name: raycullings5
review: Terrible service. Beware of their poor service. People who run this institution are not in it to service consumers ratherto support fraudulent merchants.

name: Cassandra
review: Pleasant experience... they were courteous and payments were reasonable. They worked with you if you needed more time. Chase also does goodwill if you have a stellar history minus the exception. The only hiccup was the final payment was quirky and they said I had a small balance. I disputed and they zeroed my account. Good creditor overall

name: Andrew M
review: My son has Lyme disease and treatment has been very costly over the past couple of years so we’ve had to utilize our credit lines to fund those expenses.

name: Robert
review: Chase recorded a missed payment that was not missed. this loan is payoff. this needs to be corrected. This incorrect reporting has damaged my credit score which prevents me from buying a house. no one is taking responsibility for this error.

name: dorothy
review: I don't recognize this credit card/ I don't have a chase card/ tell me the details of this please .  I didn't open a credit card and don't know how this got a $130 balance can you please explain

name: Anne
review: This card has a 0% transfer rate during promotional period. There is no cost for the transfer. There is a substantial time to pay off w/o penalty for early payoff.

name: Jose
review: The bank employees are courteous and caring anytime I call. Always find a solution which favors me and that is double appreciated now that I am down with Covid19.

name: Ruben
review: We use it for travel and for hotel perks.  It seems a lot easier to use it when you know you're going to get back.  If you like to travel this is your card !

name: Scot
review: I do a lot of shopping at Amazon. I couldn’t ask for a better option for cash back. It also gives the same cash back at Whole Foods.

name: Jennifer
review: The website is very easy to find out about my account. Always fix any problem I may have when I call. Also enjoy the money back benefit!

name: nistransport1
review: Poor chase never there for customer , I was charged interest rate after I paid off my account in full , I will not do business with them anymore

name: Demetrice
review: Amazing opportunities ahead when you use Chase! From building credit with reasonable percentage rate cards to car loans. It was an amazing experience

name: Michael
review: Should have passed, I knew the rate was high. Not even a month later offers to refinance down $75 a month. Will be refinancing by next month

name: Samson
review: Great for point earning! Also, discounts at stores, restaurants. I have used points for hotel rooms and they have awesome customer service. Highly recommend!

name: Sophia B
review: I have had a terrible experience with dealing with a canceled flight that I had booked with Chase Sapphire Reserve points. I had to cancel an international flight in April due to COVID travel restrictions. A refund was not possible, and I got flight credits. I am being asked to use my credit by August 1, 2020, and that the trip must be completed by September 30, 2021. The original flight was from the US to the UK, through Aer Lingus, an Irish airline. This is completely unreasonable that I am asked to book a flight right now, while my state (California) has still not fully reopened, and most of Europe has travel bans against the US, or at the very least a 14-day quarantine upon arrival. Nobody is thinking about traveling internationally right now in the near future. I keep getting told that it's up to the airline to decide the policy, but it is Chase's job as the travel agent to advocate for its customers. Talking to a travel specialist online takes million years and the connection gets silent dropped sometimes, which makes me wait for half an hour before even realizing no one is on the other side, and I get reconnected to a different agent, and have to explain my situation all over again. Chase Travel has been just terrible.

name: Albert
review: Great company good service for many years for us. Have used for 0 interest many times. Will continue to use for banking and debit card puchases

name: Kenyatta
review: Chase was quick with their process and the service was good. As a Chase Private Client, I also received 0.25% off my rate, which is a real savings.

name: James
review: This credit score system is easy to understand. So thence I will be continuing  with it to hope it will be the right vehicle to get my score over700.

name: Terry
review: Great people very professional and friendly. They are able to answer your questions without hurrying you to spread faster. They seem to enjoy helping you.

name: Daniel
review: I always try to stick with chase cards because of great deals and service . We’ve been banking with chase for years so it’s very convienient for us. If there is ever a problem the customer service is top notch and handles it all quickly.

name: jasonf_99
review: I bank with chase and love how I can pay my balance instantly. I've had this card over a year and my credit is 700+. I'd assume my credit limit would have gone up by now but it hasn't...

name: Austin
review: Great card. Highly recommended. Love the points and the initial bonus. Will be singing for travel when safe to do so. Easy to use and great customer service.

name: Angelina
review: Love my car. Chase helped me defer my payments during Covid 19. Don’t have much experience with them other than that. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Jackie Thomas
review: Chase Customer Service for the Southwest Rapid Rewards card is very poor; they refused to reimburse the annual fee they charged me even though I clearly was not using the account, and the online system to find transactions and manage your money is VERY limited.  I had not been using the card for the last year and thought I had closed the account. They refused to credit the $69 annual fee although it's clear I wasn't using the card anymore.  If you want to search transactions or find payments from a previous year, you have to download all of the statements (month-by-month) and manually search. A company like Chase with the massive systems and IT infrastructure should be able to "store" your transactions in a database, so you can search and report on your spending.

name: jeffrey
review: Good some times accurate some time not but it’s live and I enjoy my app and the notifications are pretty much instantly alerting me with updates

name: tony c
review: They are TERRIBLE at lending credit and accepting credit cards approvals. They only want the perfect credit score customers.  They dont care how long you have banked with them, how perfect your payment history is with them, if they find 1 single bad item in your credit report they will deny you credit increases or a credit card.  I have a 700 credit score and with 100% on-time payment history across all credit cards, but they found 1 bad item from a 1 yr ago and they denied for $500 credit card. Im only $300 total in debt with no derogatory marks. they dont care about that. They love denying people.  Worst bank to me.  Highly recommend other banks like Front.

name: Kristen
review: Status quo, nothing great, nothing terrible. Their app is easy to use. But they also like to just hike up your credit limit without asking and will not reduce it, I am sure all CC companies are the same way though.

name: Phai
review: Haven’t had issues with the card.  Seems to be one of the most consistent company on reporting to credit bureau. Own the card for 8 years and NEVER been late, but yet to lower the 22 percent interest rate (even with me asking).  Won’t close because of credit length.

name: Bobbie
review: I had a thin file, so little to no credit.  Had been member of Chase bank for few years. My husband got 2 credit cards from Chase and we had a joint account. My husband maxed his card fixing up our home. I thought there is absolutely no way I they would consider me a candidate for a card. Banker said"Try anyway,all we can say is not at this time!" In approximately 10-15 mins, if that, i walked out with the largest credit card i ever had. It might not be much to you to you but $2000 was major to us! Customer service is the BEST! They work with you in all financial issues.  Very best bank I ever used! Recomend Chase for ALL your financial needs.

name: markh_221
review: Wish they took debit card payments over the phone. Would save monthly trips to the post office and save $1.50 per transaction. Thnx

name: melissa_bickerman
review: Will not be continuing to use any Chase credit cardsI am extremely disappointed in my experience with Chase and their Sapphire Reserve Card. I booked a hotel through a third party company, Secret Escapes (SE), to visit Jamaica in late April. Due to Covid the hotel was closed during this time and my trip had to be cancelled. I tried to receive a refund from the company but they repeatedly stated that they act as a broker and that my contract is with the hotel. I confirmed with the hotel that they received no payment from SE and therefore SE is illegally holding my money for services they did not provide.After exhausting my options of trying to work directly with the company, I filed a dispute with Chase. Without contacting me or validating any of the facts provided by SE, Chase closed the dispute stating it was a valid charge because I had cancelled the trip. This was of course blatantly false. After calling multiple times (twice where I was hung up on mid-call), I was informed that in order to reopen the case I would have to either mail or fax a letter stating my request to reopen the dispute. In addition to the letter explaining the situation, I provided evidence of SE’s terms and conditions stating that in the event a booking was cancelled by the hotel they would provide a refund and proof that SE did not pay the hotel. I tried faxing 3 times but the number they provided did not connect. I then mailed the documents. After no word for two weeks, I called to check on the status. I was told the documents had not been received and to call back in a couple days. I did so, having to wait on a long queue to get in touch with someone. Again I was told the documents had not been received and to call back in a couple days. I then went into a branch to talk to a representative directly. After 2 hours, they were able to fax the documents on my behalf. A week and another phone call later, Chase finally reopened the dispute.Two weeks later (and almost 3 months after the initial dispute was created) I received a response from Chase stating that while I may have a valid complaint with the merchant, this is not a billing error and concluded the charges were valid. However I was not claiming that this was a billing error, I was disputing on the grounds that this was a fraudulent charge for services not provided. Other credit card companies found similar cases with SE as fraud and returned the money to their customers. With the amount they charge for this card and the fact that it is supposed to be a travel card marketing perks of travel protection, I am less than impressed and will be looking for alternative options once my annual fee is up.

name: Kelvin
review: Assume card to have and customer service was great .  You cant go wrong with this card . My experiences have been wonderful and easy site to use when making payments .  A++++

name: David
review: Great card, extra points and frequent special offers, nice online portal for management and payments, nice adjunct to my Chase Sapphire card

name: stevend_130
review: Very informative and easy to use. I love getting cash back for the purchases I've made. A great card to use anywhere.  Good customer service

name: roger harmon
review: This is probably one of the best credit cards that I have ever had. I enjoy all of it’s perks and great rewards of a lot of places that I generally shop.

name: Bruce
review: Card is used as needed, customer service and care is top notch , I would recommend this card for usage to anyone,  good card for person's wanting to increase their credit score

name: jhmcgrew70
review: WOW! I had a bank account with Chase. After I deposited my paycheck through Mobile banking they came back and my signature didn’t match what they have on file so they consider it fraudulent and closed my account. I never done any business with Chase in the past. Shortly after the closing of bank account not one but two Chase credit cards pop up on my credit report, one with an $11,300 limit and the second one...$40,000 credit limit!. Now I have never had a credit card before in my life. What gets me is that I personally can’t have a checking account with Chase. I personally can’t get a credit card with Chase but Chase has no problem giving out credit cards with extremely high limits to whoever using my credit score and my personal information. Yes I have called them and I see these cards are still very much active even though they say they’re taking care of it. And to top it all off ..... found a third card that was just opened 4 months ago with a $10,800 credit limit.  But I can’t have a credit card or checking account??.? Something seriously wrong with this picture!!!!!

name: ygilad9139
review: Such a pain to have an account with chase.  Every elementary  operation gave me a very hard time with them. They will randomly  without any reason hold your money without letting you know why and just respond with a generic  answers like "we have to verify". Have three different accounts with them. I think that I have had enough being with them for four years. Super bad costumer experience. Going to move my money and close my accounts. Will try Schwabs.

name: shellyh105
review: Chase is stealing unemployment from their customers. They took just about $750 from me. During this time when we need feel secure with our banks and trust that we are in good hands, chase is taking advantage of the situation.I am canceling my account and hope to warn others. Don’t let them handle your money

name: David t
review: This is kindof a nothing crap card not really worth the bother. The amex amazon prime card is more useful. I definitely do not recomend it. It is a waste of pocket space

name: Cynthia
review: I loved my Southwest cc! I tried very hard to keep my payments on time. I was never late until hurricane Harvey put me out of work. I called Chase and explained I was out of work and if they could work with me on my payment. Their positive response made me believe they were willing to work with me. I missed a couple of payments and then they closed my account! I guess I was wrong. Thanks for nothing.

name: Someone Somewhere
review: So I just opened a Chase account 3 weeks ago. Put money on it the next day. When my direct deposit hit yesterday, it's showing pending until today. I went to the bank to withdraw money because I haven't received my pin number for my debit and they were asking me for my business license. First off, I opened a personal checking account and why am I being asked to provide business license? I can't even use my own money that I worked hard for because they're insisting I show proof of my business. This is **.

name: Tosha
review: Love the card... hate the annual fee. The card is too good to have this type of fee. Makes me not want to use the card at all. Hopefully the fee will go away.

name: Vathiyar
review: Good credit card. I have it more than 10 years. No problem at all. Some time I go over the limit and they are very flexible with me

name: Fagga Hdjdjd
review: They say 5% off purchases and monthly payments for big items but it is all untrue. The 5% can take up to two months to take effect. You still need to pay the full amount of the item with your card before for big items and then the monthly payment is charged to the minimum amount each month. Basically keeping a balance on your card subject to fees. Would not recommend at all

name: jacquelorraine
review: They were fine until I put in a claim for extended warranty and item damage that they promise. They do not want to honor their contract. Had the product for just over 2 months. Not honorable company and do not recommend.

name: Linda Ferguson
review: My computer was recently hacked and they gained access to my checking account.  This fraud was reported to Chase and the affected account was closed.  Today the bank has charged me back for the fraudulent activity making me overdrawn by 97!  I have opened a new account at a different bank and my Chase account will be closed, after 30 years, once my social security check is deposited to the new account.  I will never do business with Chase again and will not recommend them to anybody .

name: Alice
review: Very good service.  If have a problem they have been very helpful ang have always solved problems.   Rewards are good. Use this card 95 percent

name: Wayne
review: They purchased the mortgage, and have a great website with vert useful options. I like the ability to integrate my credit cards on one screen

name: Jay Roth
review: Having been a Chase Bank customer for decades with much satisfaction, getting the Chase card was a no brainier and, as expected has been a great card

name: ADEM KARAPINAR
review: Due to coronavirus I am unemployed and I got some interest charged. I thought the bank was going to help me but they did not do anything about it. I am really frustrated. Because other banks helped me a lot.

name: Oleg
review: This card has unlimited cash back + you can transfer it to Sapphire card, so it’s effectively 2.25% cash back when used for travel.

name: Norma A
review: I like maintaining how much I spend and how often I shop.  the credit points help a lot too. I can see how much I can save while shopping.

name: Andrew
review: I like all the reward points and cash back options. Also, shopping through Chase offers great deals. The discounts that are offered through various vendors are excellent.

name: Lonnie White
review: Chase has turned it's back on it's customer during this pandemic by by arbitrarily reducing available balance by 50%. Which will negatively affect customers credit score. Great job!

name: Martha Arnold
review: Not my favorite.  You can't call and ask for an increase or interest rate reduction like you can with other cards. They're supposed to review your account every 6 months for new offers.  I've had exceptional credit, never late with them. And yet in 4 years i never got any offers. I tried reaching out to them to consider me for a credit limit increase.  That's when they explained how they work and denied me.

name: Jeff
review: I have ad them for over 7 years and they still have me APR at 24% and work lower it for me or work with me in it. But other then that it’s a great card but be careful when you’re at your limit you can go thousands over if you don’t pay attention

name: Christina
review: Love it so far, good rewards, easy to use, sleek card, great travel benefits and card amenities. I'm very happy to have this in my wallet.

name: John D Bentley
review: I have paid this card in full, but it still shows on WH. Please confirm, this is hurting my credit rating!! Some other agencies have corrected this error. Thank  You!!!!!

name: Marcio
review: It is a very good credit card. I really love it! Practical and convenient. One advantage of it is the possibility of having some cash back.

name: Beth
review: Instead of dinging my credit scores you could have just texted me!!! Not very happy about that!!! If someone’s not taking paper bills like my other cards all do not to mention all the utilities...

name: Alex M
review: This is hands-down my favorite credit card in the one that I use the most Marriott Bon boy points are the most easy to use in there the best value. One of the other things that I like about Marriott Bonvoy points is that there are things that you can use those points to redeem them on that you can’t do with other points or companies out there.

name: Stephen
review: I have had a great experience with my card. The rewards great and transfer easily. Once i qualified for the card others seem yo follow and approve me as well.

name: Ryan
review: I really really love Chase and their Sapphire Preferred card...the experience was so good that I actually moved to them as my main bank (Checking, Savings, Credit Card). It's been really great!

name: Mary
review: No complaints. This is a great credit card. I always receive my bill in plenty of time to pay on time and rewards are nice, too. I don't use this card for much.

name: Justin
review: I have never  got a Chase card from Chase, therefore; I have not used a Chase card at all so I do not know why it is even showing on my credit report. If they want to send me a card to use that is ok, if not it should be removed.

name: Kathleen
review: Concert tickets were charged on the Chase account. The concert was canceled and I was given the option of getting a full refund or a credit from Vivid Seats. I chose a full cash refund and I did everything I was supposed to do when I was supposed to do it. My account was credited by Chase and then charged back and I am now in the process of a redispute. It has been a long tedious process. I had to fax all of the correspondence and then re-fax it and they claimed to never receive it either of the times. I was finally given an email to send all the correspondence/back up to which the customer is not given until they’re really frustrated (I asked for an email address initially which they would not give me, so I had to go to Chase bank locally twice to fax all the information again with them claiming they never received it) I was told by vivid seats that my full cash refund was coming and after months I still have not gotten it. This has NOT been a good experience and I have been going back-and-forth for a long time. I have done everything I was supposed to do and I’m still being charged for an event that was canceled, never happened and never will happen so I am due $160.70 back.

name: singersinger60
review: During a global pandemic and riots, they closed my accounts . I lost my business due to riots and after already being closed for 3 months due to Covid.I received a sketchy email from Chase saying that “I” removed my phone number from my accounts?!I did not and immediately feared fraud. I was right, in a way. Chase blocked all of my access to my funds and financial records! I was told my accounts were closed (due to suspicious behavior, aka, Gofundme contributions).I am still awaiting an alleged check for all of my money that I don’t have access to,from them!Are they serious! I’m going without food, let alone 2 months behind on my rents for my home and office! I’m simply stunned! I’ve always meticulously maintained my accounts, being careful to follow their requirements and never causing issues. I simply cannot believe that this type of business is practiced anywhere in the world, let alone, America.

name: dianacast1330
review: Horrible customer service. Went through the drive through because of covid to deposit cash and request a new debit card. Lady at the window deposited the cash then gave me my id back and told me to have a good day, completely disregarding that I needed a new card. I told her I needed a new card and she said I would have to call and do it over the phone or app. Long story short it was a short argument between me and her. I ended up leaving and days later they closed my account!!!!!!!!! I will go gladly go somewhere else.

name: Frieda
review: Wallethub said I had a very good approval rating for this card just to be turn down with a credit score of 734 I could have waited if I knew this would drop my credit score My FICO score was 723 Do not apply for this card

name: Sam
review: Quit blaming wallet hub. You are in charge of your own credit. Quit being a little B

name: Judith Lavezzi
review: If the card is through chase  I wouldn’t have it. I was going to get the premium one today, and then found out it’s issuer is the dreadful Chase. I just cancelled my two credit cards with Chase as they have become a terrible company to do business with. The staff remains handicapped by their policies, and lack of staff. Sapphire concierge services are gone too.

name: Ronald
review: I'd like to thank all the guys and girls at Chase for all these years of service!! I know I'm hard to deal with sometimes and for that I'm sorry. Thank you Chase For these wonderful years.

name: kendriver2982
review: So since this thing out east started with the reprirations chase has stopped me from taking money from my account. Pretty sure the are afraid of folks turning on them and withdrawing their money. Customer service is shit and they have effectively shut my business down for the weekend costing me thousands. Go somewhere else and bank.

name: Very Cool
review: Had to cancel a credit card due to COVID - Chase refused to issue a prorated refund for the annual fee paid just a couple months before. They don't care about their customers - think twice before opening a credit card with them. There are better options our there.

name: Adolfo Prieto
review: I called Chase Customer Claim number for a double charge transaction I have on my account to dispute the charges; I was told that in twelve hours, I would have a credit in my account to cover whatever transactions were going on until they conclude the investigations for the disputed transaction. Since I have a check wrote already to pay for some of my business expenses and services, I need this money to be available in my account. Twelve hours later I have to call them back because the credit was not showing in my account, this time I was told that it could take from 12hrs to 48hrs for the credit to show in my account. After more than 48hrs and no credit showing in my account, I decided to call again, and they just told me that I still have to wait until the end of the day. Now is more than 72hrs and still, no credit shows in my account, the check that I wrote out before the disputed transaction claim started has now been declined because there's no available money in the account. I still don’t understand why they LIE to customers that way and that much if they are not going to provide any credit at all. Now when I call and start telling my issue, they just hung up on me. WORST SERVICE EVER.

name: Laura
review: Love the “one touch”  verifone feature. Works great during these COVID disinfectant times. And it isn’t much, but cash back is a great feature as well. Every bit helps.

name: mgobluegrl21
review: Chase Bank received money from my Zelle account. It went to the wrong person. They would not give it back. Disgusting customer service. Stealing money! Deserves 0 stars!!

name: John Donohue
review: Chase is s a proactive Issuer always taking measures to protect me and the account. While the brand of the card is Disney I will always use Chase

name: Kenta
review: The 5% rewards options quarterly are very useful and the choices are ones I regularly use. The redemption on Chase Ultimate Rewards is easy and at a fair rate.

name: Kenta
review: Subaru financing via Chase was super easy and the Chase mobile app makes it easy to keep track of things. Seamless process and I love the car too!

name: George
review: Great Card, No Complaints! Top of the Line Premium Card! Customer Service is very helpful and courteous. Whatever they can do to help you, they will. I had gotten behind because of a FINANCIAL CRISIS due to a Major Spinal Cord Surgery I had and eventually LOSS MY JOB, therefore I got behind in the consistency of my payments. But! now that things are getting BETTER, I have stepped up to the plate and have PAID my card COMPLETELY down to  $0.00. I love the CHASE FAMILY AS WELL, although they Decreased my Credit Limit substantially, I didn't like that, but accepted it and have now PAID the CARD OFF to $0.00. HOPEFULLY one day they will INCREASE my credit limit again. Prior to the Financial Crisis, they can see I was a responsible person making ALL my payments. I hope they will SHOW MERCY if I decide to ask for my Credit Limit Increase again. I HAVE PROVEN I AM A RESPONSIBLE PERSON IN MANAGING MY DEBT. LOOK AT MY CARD CURRENTLY!

name: Carolyn
review: They closed my account and claimed it was no no activity, but I never received a notice. They said they sent notice. I did not receive it. Rude supervisor. This is not how a person with good credit should be treated.

name: amsjaa
review: Like every other loan. Out to make there money and get the interest off the loan . Apply little to principle and all towards interest

name: MARTY
review: Great card, awesome perks for travel. Convenient and accepted everywhere. Alot of my friends have this card which prompted me to get it. Ive traveled often for free based on perks.

name: Larry
review: Chase decided to lower my credit limit because I don't spend enough. Even though I am never late on a payment and have a 826 credit score. Shameful.

name: Kreangsuk Jodd Mongkolkasetarin
review: I enjoyed using my Chase Freedom Unlimited Credit Card for just about every day purchases when I’m going out shopping for groceries, movie theaters, concert venues, and etc... Plus, I get to earn cash back as well. Great credit card to used also for online shopping to earn points as well.

name: Jennifer
review: High credit limit with No fees and I earn points on certain purchases that I can convert to cash back on my balance. Improves credit.

name: James D Capps Jr
review: I'm not sure why this credit card is on my credit report. I do not have it in my possession and that I do not use it. It must be an old card when I was listed as an authorized user. I'm no longer authorized user

name: Christal
review: I haven’t started using the card yet. But the online setup was a challenge. I had to call Customer Care twice just to be able to access my online account, because the website was giving errors. Not the best experience so far. Hopefully it gets better, now that I’m setup online.

name: Kenneth
review: Best to pay in full.  I have no more words except we have about $2,800 in award dollars sitting in the account now that might apply to balance .

review: ;165464168413616871687361871681687186716876871kmmjiugx f  yu lgui uihui gui giugh iu hgiuh igiug hi blxfhdr th5717296 th rhted+2 8+

name: Sherri
review: Has a sports button to excel.....excellent gas mileage....hugs in the curves.....excellent Toyota model....Recommend the Toyota brand

name: Scott Zerwas
review: Worst bank ever!!! My wife and I have been banking for many years and have never had issues like we did with Chase. Out of the blue the froze our accounts and said they no longer wanted to do business with my wife.  Couldn't get any answers as to why. They said they would continue the relationship with me, but not my wife. We had a substantial amount of money in both of our accounts at the time as well. Bye bye Chase. I wouldnt bank with you if you were the last bank on earth.

name: Lisa Cline
review: I have had absolutely no issues with this credit card. Enjoy the perks.  My bill is correct and I try to pay it off every month. The interest rate is a little high so I only awarded 4 stars. I have lower interest rate cards that I can carry a balance on so that factors in my usage.

name: Danielle
review: Excellent company great customer service to work with always there when you need help very friendly and helpful I recommended them to anyone.

name: Melinda
review: It was great until they said they are closing my account for "reputational reason's " and they wouldn't tell me why. I spent a total of 7 hours on the phone and Chase c.s. was 0 help. It's a fantastic card on paper, I accrued $40 in points in a month. I'm an avid prime user. I alway's paid my card off in full. Somehow my solid credit score and consistent payments caused them to close my card with no way to remedy the situation. DON'T USE CHASE THEY ARE CROOKED.

name: james
review: So far they have been a blessing for me at least!!!just hope it stays that way.so thumbs up for now.may add more of there services down the road,,playing safe for now .but they do have a easy payment process.

name: Clifford
review: Whenever I contacted them your employees have been courteous and professional I also like the system they have in the way they show your balances payments etc.

name: Leonardo
review: Excelente servicio, me encanta la tarjeta chese. Gracias por siempre brindarme sus servicios y mantener al cliente satisfecho. Thank

name: Kathryn
review: I had fair to good credit when I was approved for this card, they gave me $1000.credit limit, ever since then, they continue to raise my limit without having to ask and my credit is now excellent!!

name: Daniel
review: No Problems with obtaining loan car,But lease paid off month early with less than 29000 miles,Car came back brand new! As lease agreement gave me 60000 mile maximum 4 years.still waiting for Chase show 6 months later and updated paid off!

name: baxam8014
review: If I could give 0 stars I would. I had been building my credit and looking and multiple cards for a few months. I decided to go with this card an was pretty excited when I was approved. 2 weeks with my card and I woke up to showing they closed my account. I called and they said that they did a random check on my credit and I had a new balance that was higher than it was when I applied for the card. I explained I had bought furniture and then paid it right back down. They didn't care and closed my account in literally 2 weeks. Nothing was even due yet as I did not have the card long enough. With this being said I DO NOT trust chase and I  will NEVER apply for a card through them again. Basically I got a hit to my credit for nothing. Go with capital one they are much easier to pay and work with. I wish I wouldn't of wasted my time or credit inquiry with this company.

name: Linda
review: Thank you for your kind and helpful guidance when I need you. Your attention to looking for fraud is exemplary which I depend on everyday.

name: Lizzie
review: We have a good relationship with Chase. They have handled our mortgage for a couple years now and we look forward to working with them indefinitely.

name: Gerardo
review: Chase card should be lower with the apr.  lowering the apt will be great. Apr is very important besides that chase is a perfect card to have

name: Geoffrey
review: The card was a valuable tool for me and family and my economic use over the years. Now that the balance is paid it will remain in my credit accounts as a tool for use in the future.

name: Aaron Nam
review: Very straightforward bank. They charge a monthly fee but have very easy ways of avoiding it such as keeping at least $1500 in your checking or having a direct deposit of $500 or more from your job. For saving, all you need is to set up a autosave program where it transfer your checking money to your savings. Chase for me, seems like they charge fee but they find positive solutions to help you waive the fee by enabling you to build good habit and save money. Every time I go to the bank, they are always professional and nice, or at least the person I had was great. Their app is very straightforward and helpful. I just like Chase, they're the most convenient and simple bank I had so far. In terms of credit card, I never could get accepted because I have zero credit which is reasonable. There are other credit card company I can always turn to anyways. So far, just positive experiences, but I shouldn't jinx myself yet.

name: peterbbell
review: I use to be happy w/ this card and rarely called customer service. But when I have had to call it's been concierge styled service... but that's all disappeared... before or during the virus? I don't know, I haven't called in about a year. But when my card was rejected 2x on a Sunday I called to find out why... closed... call during business hours. WHAT? I called during "business hours" and, after the range of robo efforts hung up in frustration. I called the International number and got a nice fellow who explained they hadn't received payment. Fair enough, I'd mailed full payment on May 9th for the May 21st due date.  He offered to wait and see if it arrived following the weekend mail or pay part now to free up the card now. I thought waiting for mail another day wouldn't hurt but the local post office advised otherwise (I was filing a missing mail report). Dreading the call back process, that didn't change but ultimately did get a human being via the robo route.  Her diction was less than terrific and when I asked her to please repeat her name (I take notes) she hung up on me!!!  Back to the International number, I got a nice gal who processed part of the payment but wouldn't take a second payment for the balance until tomorrow. WHAT? You have a "live fish" on the line and you won't take 2 payments for the one cc account?  It took 3x for her to listen to "I have 2 separate businesses, each with their own separate checking accounts, but I use this credit card for both businesses.  I diligently post each expenditure to each separate company account and mail Chase a check from each account (that's 2 checks to pay the bill in full)... company A and company B.  "Oh, she said... I misunderstood... we can take that account info when you are ready"  but by now she was a bit frosted.  And I was none too happy either... when your customer experience literally falls off a cliff from a concierge styled experience to what I went through today... "sad" ... and it's the only time I quote "him."

name: James Bethmann
review: I applied and got the card but the card transfer fee was for 5% when I got the terms and conditions...should I try to make the transfer and then argue that the advertisements online when I applied stated $0 and 0%.

name: Raymond
review: i had surgery in my head in the hospital and i was late for a payment by some days but payed the gave me a late payment even when i have talk to chase about they wouldn’t take it of i have be a good customer with Chase for a long time and they wouldn’t listen

name: Kenneth
review: Chase Bank report accurate information each month and therefore, I feel as customer this is what i expect from a creditor to do to for their customer. I have notice some creditors report only ever two or three months which allow incorrect accuracies of your credit balance.

name: Ronald
review: Thanks for such a good program and all the updates. People should try your program I've been using it for years and it's helped keep me on track

name: Selena L
review: Do Not Bank With chase they will not protect your money they will not care about there customers time and money, I bought an item from a company returned the item and did not get my money from company back I disputed the charge with chase showed chase proof I returned it With email confirmation that business received it and business claimed chase still has funds from dispute but never gave me my refund? Chase does not care about customers they will not have your back even with clear proof of transaction dispute. Do not trust them with your money. They deserve negative ten stars

name: coryscallions
review: I love my card I’ve never had one problem with Chase bank for the card itself also have a checking account and a savings account with Chase bank. The company that I work for also uses Chase as their main banking.

name: bcillustrations085
review: I’m so disappointed with this company. My Husband and I chose this company because of the travel opportunities it offered. We used this card for big purchases to send our parents on a cruise this month through the travel rewards it offers. Instead, COVID-19 happened and the flights were cancelled and our elderly parents will never fly again. Instead of refunding OUR CREDIT, MONEY, BLOOD, SWEAT AND TEARS  I have been informed we can only use those flights in the original names- never mind it WAS OUR MONEY that paid the bill. Chase, you and the airlines should be ashamed. ALL Americans are feeling the pain of this pandemic and instead of keeping customers, you screw us over. My husband and I never miss a payment. We are responsible savers, a doctor and businessman. I assure you, won’t be customers of yours for long. I’m highly disappointed in your policy and the airlines policy. Honestly, you are no better than common thieves benefiting on the misfortune of others. It’s NOT THE CUSTOMERS RESPONSIBILITY TO BAIL YOU OUT.

name: Ema
review: Love the rewards, 1% and 2% back on regular purchases, with 5% for Amazon + Whole Foods. Always pay in full for zero interest. Love this card!

name: hcoulombe
review: We had submitted a request as usual to our bank on April 24 to send an eCheck [5 business days] to Chase by the 5/3 due date; with some delay, as 5/3 was a Sunday, it showed a 5/4 due date.  We started getting reminders starting 5/4 that my payment was overdue. As of 5/7 BB&T put in a stop payment on that eCheck, but it seems Chase thought they'd posted it the same day!  But clearly it got cancelled, as they kept trying to post that and several other payments.  COVID has allowed any direct contact with either Chase or the Disney Visa folks with no direct communication available that would have resolved this instantly!On 5/16/2020 Chase finally realized there was a problem, and sent a RE-INSTATE AN ACCOUNT FOR ELECTRONIC PAYMENTS request.  We complied with all the required info FAXed to Chase the same day, including a replacement payment from another bank account. No acknowledgement of the completed steps were ever received.  Then we discovered that Chase had closed the account without calling or emailing us; instead a snail mail letter was sent that still has not arrived [5/28/2020].  Subsequent conversations with "Chase Customer Service" indicated that it looked like Chase had been using the wrong Bank Account number; also we were told that no managers were available.  Pretty strange for folks who have been big time customers for 15 years, through Disney managing the card and at least  2 different banks before Chase.

name: Nancy
review: I could not be more disgusted by my Chase credit card.  I have tried many times to move to a different Chase card.  Have been told to open a new Chase card.  Cannot transfer balances to other Chase cards.  I have no need for a Southwest card - I no longer travel and would prefer a different card.  Can't be done!

name: Candyce
review: Great credit card company. I i’ve never had an issue with them and they increase your credit limit overtime as you pay on time and keep it within good standing.

name: Emily An
review: Oddly the very most important aspect of this company should be a place to apply for a credit card but there isn’t? So what if someone is satisfied with all of the information and wants to apply for a car, where do they go?

name: ginabug101
review: TERRIBLE! On the phone opening a new card for over 2 hours!!!! Was transferred to 6 different dept. over a creditline increase. I will CLOSE my chase card just because of this. If customer service is important to you.... do NOT open with chase. Spoke to one American women and 5 ethnic people who had BARELY understandable English, NONE of who were able to help me. Chase has the worse customer service I’ve ever experienced.

name: Darrell
review: A very great card to have!!! I would recommend this card to anyone there’s really serious about doing great with a credit thank you Chase!!

name: Tammy
review: Great card an helps build ur credit an you can see ur credit score anytime check it anytime of d the day I love being a chase card holder

name: carolync_59
review: Oh my goodness.  How dysfunctional is Chase Bank? Let me count the ways.  On 5/20/20...1.) I  go to Chase Bank on Mason Road in Katy, to find out they closed at 4pm. 2.) I find out the Chase Bank on Katy Fort Bend & I-10 opens at 9:30 AM. 3.) I arrive there on 5/22/20 early and find the  Lobby Door locked. I knock on the door. 4.) I look inside and a woman motions me to go around back.  I’m Now FIFTH in line in the drive through.  I time the first car and it takes 15 minutes for THAT FIRST CAR, to get through the line. 5.) I have a funeral to attend and it is now 10AM AND IM STILL HAVEN’t BEING HELPED.6.)  I call the bank, I’m asked to call800-935-9935. They can't help it or correct it. They say my amount can't be returned or claimed in this situation and I have to settle it myself , they keep speaking technicalities. For any new customer please don't enroll in this bank.

name: lisa6215
review: I got this card because of the bonus for using it to book travel with Chase Travel.  But trying to get a refund for an airline-cancelled flight has proven extremely difficult.  It took 2 weeks for Chase Travel to deny my request for a refund (I had to call 4 times, especially since they erroneously sent me emails meant for the airline in response to the airlines request for info).  They denied my refund on April 16th, saying that the airline had refused a refund and would only give credit.  So I checked the airline policies and it turns out they had publicly posted their policy on April 9th saying that I was eligible for a refund, which I had to request through my third party travel company.  So I called back first thing on April 17th to question Chase Travel's reasoning.  The first person said that I could only get a refund if I called the airline.  I explained multiple times that I didn't purchase from the airline, so the airline policy said the refund had to be issued by Chase Travel.  Finally, he transferred me to a manager because they said they had to check with the airline again and start the 2 week process all over again, and the manager had the ability to send emails.  After talking to the manager for awhile, the manager abruptly said, "we'll give you a refund."  And I got an email from Chase Travel saying they were refunding me.  But that was in the morning on April 16th and as of the afternoon of May 5th, the refund has still not posted (though Chase Travel said it would take 10-12 days).  I'm tired of dealing with Chase Travel, who clearly tried to do all they could to try and get me to take credit over a refund.  So I called Chase Sapphire Reserve to dispute the charge from Chase Travel.  Chase Sapphire Reserve told me I had to call Chase Travel and there was nothing they could do (though I've already called Chase Travel 5 times).  Interestingly enough, a friend of mine had her flights cancelled and her non-Chase travel agency wanted to charge a $200 fee to process a refund, so she called Chase to dispute the charge for her airline tickets instead and she was given a full refund of the purchase price the next day.  So clearly, Chase has different policies if you are working with an non-affiliated travel agency.  This is so frustrating.

Keep your receipts, take screen pictures of your balance on your accounts. They are doing it because they think no one is paying attention. I have all my proof and that I have sent to 10tv eye witness news of the fraudulent activities chase is not doing to the customers.
