review: They just literally up and closed it. No reason. Bankers dont under either. Waiting on letter. Had 11 yrs. Never late! Always paid off. We all are still scratching our head. Was a GREAT CARD. till they left us hanging with NO NOTICE.

name: msfrancis
review: You would think a $600 annual fee reserve credit card would offer some service and some customer support.My family and several other families had planned a trip to Canada for mid May.  Obviously, no one is currently traveling and Canada has banned non-essential travel, so cancellation should have been easy.  During the Covid-19 epidemic, you cannot speak to a live person unless the travel is within 72 hours.  The idea that you cannot call your card services about anything seems a little unreasonable, but I understand these times are somewhat unprecedented.  As such, we cancelled through Chase on-line, as we cannot communicate with our card any other way, despite trying multiple different service related phone numbers.After submitting our cancellation of a reservation at the Fairmont Waterfront hotel in Vancouver, we wait several weeks to confirm the cancellation.  During that time, our friends that booked with the hotel called the hotel directly and received full refunds, even though they'd booked non-refundable rooms.  After several weeks, we receive an email from Chase Sapphire Reserve that says our hotel reservation was cancelled, but no refund of money or points would be given.  The email had a link to contest this decision.  We contested and waited several more weeks.  After two weeks, we get a response that says:"we reviewed your request and ADVOCATED ON YOUR BEHALF WITH FAIRMONT WATERFRONT, but your travel dates are not covered by the latest waiver policy issued by the hotel."I immediately called the hotel and was informed the hotel was waiving any non-cancellation policy for any reservation through May 31, 2020.  This was the same policy applied to my friends' non-cancellation reservations that received a full refund.  I was told my credit card merely needed to call the hotel and ask, and a full refund would be given.So one of two things happened. 1) Chase never even asked for a refund or did not want me to get my points back, or 2) Chase obtained a refund from the hotel and pocketed the money and lied to me.Either way, I find this unacceptable, particularly from one of the more expensive and supposedly exclusive travel cards and programs.  I would take this up with Chase, but there is no one, anywhere, that I can contact with Chase.

name: polocowboy250
review: Chase is absolutely the WORST BANK IN THIS COUNTRY. They will Steal your money and then blame it on you. They will send erroneous info to the Credit bureau and then refuse to fix it and also blame that on you. Please NEVER NEVER use Chase Bank. They will screw you and tell you that you asked them to. Liars and cheats. That’s  all they are

name: Michael
review: This Chase FU is pretty much my everyday “go-to” card for my typical daily spend. I have to reach out to their CS offices for help twice - once for an erroneous double billing and the second, for a damaged card.  Each time my issue was resolved timely and with one one phone call (and follow up email or paper letter confirmation).  Sure, I wish they didn’t do HPs for a customer-initiated CLI and that they didn’t have their unofficial 5/24 rule, but those issues aside, the FU card is quite good and to me it’s a solid everyday spend option.

name: Joseph
review: I love this card for its flat rate rewards and Chases excellent customer service. I’ve had no problems with this card since account opening. When I had to dispute a charge around christmas time, Chase took care of it for me. Unlike my other cards like Cap one I’m able to transfer my cash back to actual cash back in the form of my Checkings account rather than applying it all to my account as some sort of credit. Payments were swift and easy, and instantly credited to my card. No usual 3 day wait times. This card reports on time to the credit bureaus, the same way I pay my bills on time, so I respect that. Not all card companies are made equal, and Chase is the best and most well rounded that I have in my wallet right now. I can’t say that I can rely on every card company I have right now, or that I trust every card company I have right now. EXCEPT chase. The only reason this card falls short of being my primary card is that the rewards rate is just 1.5% and I have a card that gives me 2% flat on everything. If chase can make this happen I have no problems bringing my main business back to them. Other than that I do highly recommend.

name: mkleczkajr
review: Be careful with their statement balance policy. We pay our statements in full. In January our account told us we had a $0 statement balance because we paid ahead, but had an amount of money leftover for the next statement, which we paid in full a few days later. They charged us $90 interest fee, then another $120 the next month, same kind of fee. When I inquired about it, they said it was a technicality in their agreement. They wouldn't budge on removing the fee or working with us. Their customer service was lacking, especially with the way they rotate their agents with every response I sent them. It's a very subtle, abusive policy. If you are smart with your money management, I would suggest going with an honest company.

name: David Gold
review: After 10 years with my Chase Sapphire Preferred card, I finally had to make a claim for a television I purchased with that card under Chase's warranty "protection."  The third party company that handles these claims for Chase resorts to every cheap trick to keep from processing and paying your claim.   First they denied receiving my claim, and when they were called out on that dishonesty, they demanded I produce the original receipt, even though I provided a duplicate receipt from Best Buy.  When I escalated that issue, they dropped that demand, and then  refused to accept the warranty info that I forwarded to them from the TV manufacturer, requiring instead that I provide them with the 140 page user manual.   They are now insisting in more documentation, and when I asked a supervisor why I wasn't told at the beginning why the info I provided was insufficient, I was met with hostility and derision.   It's clear that their tactics are designed to force you to give up on your claim,.  When I spoke with Chase about the behavior of their warranty adjustors, I was told there was nothing they could do.   The credit card is great - just don't be fooled into thinking you actually have warranty protection.

name: Sonya
review: So the whole card got one star just because of the Warranty protection, that isn't helpful. That's not helpful at all. How is the actual card? I get it, the warranty protection sucks, but you've said nothing else.

review: I started out with a $1700 limit when my score was less than 700. However, I started out paying off my entire balance. My limit is now $3200. My interest rate has not gone down. It is an amazon prime card. My balance got high when I had several emergencies. I'm still making my payments on time. This is a great card. I highly recommend it if you can get it.I have had one huge problem with this card. I had the fire stick and had many apps on my service. However, my den tv fell off the wall and broke. Therefore, i cancelled my firestick in feb for all video apps and requested that no video charges be accepted on my card. From feb to this month of july they were still charging me.  My bill was going up month after month even with me paying nearly 3 times the minimum payment for 4+ months. I finally got someone to take me serious and work to get this corrected. His name was miguel. I believe this will correct the problem. He is cancelling my old card and sending me a new card. He is also adjusting my account from february thru july. My new card will be here today or tomorrow. I had tried getting this done for months with 6 or more reps to no avail. Thank God for Miguel.  I'll let you know if I get my new card. Thanks miguel.

review: They are awesome credit card company. I got a $600 increase on my credit card without evening asking for it  I made a couple of payments on my card way before the due date and I looked  around and my credit limit has increased by $ 600 dollars.  Pretty awesome if you ask me. ??

name: robertwoodcock001
review: I have a sever problem with the bank. For those that do not make a whole lot of money. The bank will make ever attempt to over draft the account! Today I woke to my account being overdraft with two monthly  payments! I went back last month too see when the monthly payments are charged to my account. So I could switch accounts from chase to my two rideshare accounts! However, because my account hit $3 and change- they charged my account earlier than normal! Forcing my account too be over drawn! I was going to close the account this week. Ubers debt card doesn’t charge any fees what so ever nor does lyft! Nor do they wait days to process charges unlike chase. Plus the cards give money back rewards to users for using the cards at participating merchants and gas companies to their drivers. They do not charge monthly banking banking fees like chase does- $12.00 nor $34.00 for overdrafts! Finally, Chase will process daily income last after all charges, something ive noticed to make it difficult to track. It may take up too four days for Chase too process charges the same for direct deposit from uber or lyft!

name: Floyd
review: I purchased this card primarily to use on Amazon because of the 5% cash back, but I also use it for gas and restaurants because I get back 2% whenever the card is used for those purposes.  I'm not excited about the interest rate, but I typically don't carry a balance which negates the rates.  I got a gift card as a sign up bonus.  The application process is rather simple and only took a few seconds to receive a response, and the card was readily available to use immediately at Amazon, then other places once you get your card.  I got the card in the mail in about a week!  Downloaded the Chase app which was pretty straight forward when setting it up!  I would recommend this card for anyone who DOES NOT carry a balance!

name: Brian
review: This card is connected to my Amazon prime account, very handy, good credit builder. I use it all the time for almost everything and always pay balances immediately.

name: James
review: i have had a good experience with this card  my purchases are for my small business and it has work well  because i pay it off and make purchases often all transactions are done in real time

name: Hillary
review: I love our Disney rewards card.  It helped us tremendously when we took the kids to Disney last year!  I highly suggest it for people with littles.

name: Michelle Boucher
review: We paid our credit card bill on time for years. I saved up a few thousand dollars and paid the entire balance over the phone and closed the card because we are trying to not be so inclined to charge things. Chase read some loophole statement that they will bill me if I charge anything else or owe anything else. They do not tell me that they calculate the interest over the previous months and I will definitely get a bill, which they should know. Fast forward one month and I had a bill for interest, but I did not open it right away. (I had asked them to send me a closed account notice and in all honesty, it just was in a pile for an extra week....when I opened it we had already paid bills. A small error in an otherwise perfect pay relationship I had with them for YEARS.) Ended up paying after one payment cycle and three days...so I paid it off entirely mid October, paid the surprise interest payment less than 60 days later, but they put a ding on my credit. I called and they reviewed the pay off call and will not remove the ding as they did not make an error. So a loyal customer pays late for the first time after YEARS of timely payments and you put it on their credit for 7 years!?!?!? We are talking about $80 max in interest that was due in November 6th and was paid December 10th! It is nonsense and awful business! I am so upset.

name: Jane BRADSTREET
review: I’d like a much lower interest rate given my credit rating and the fact that I pay on time every month. When I had bad credit these rates were understandable, but I’ve had good credit for some time now.

name: Hilton
review: Thanks too I hope I will get my card soon it's cool and so when do I get it I hope so soon became I have so many things to get done

name: Emily
review: High interest but gave me points for my business purchases. It served its purpose and helped me out of a bind when needed. Great customer service.

name: Stephen
review: The card is great. It helped me pay off a debt with high interest. Now i have no interest for a while. Its a good card and i will keep.

name: caralish3
review: Credit card was good. It's JP Morgan that suddenly closed my account without an explanation until after I had made a few payments. I will never go through them again

review: I have had this card for years and I love it. Great credit card for southwest miles. I haven’t paid for an airline ticket since I’ve had this card.

name: Janet
review: Have been a chase formerly chemical bank user for over 42 years in good standing. Zero balance. So why does my credit report suddenly report “credit dispute by consumer” which o DIF not initiate!  Please remove ASAP!!!

name: Mike
review: On auto payment, never late and they turn me in to the credit bureau for being late and lowered credit score 73 points over $35...

name: Doel
review: Great starting card with 1.5% cash back on everything and offers 10% cash back on selected and different places each month which are for daily uses.

name: Abdul Yakub
review: Great card love it and have used the card for traveling and paying for tickets events to shows and sports and ither expenses auch as

name: Daniele
review: CHASE FREEDOM UNLIMITED: I love this credit card.I've had it a few years and I've never had any issues with it, or the company.I only charge to it what I have in cash, so I pay in full every month and get 1.5% back in cash rewards, that use to buy little extras.  And oh my goodness, the credit score boost has been enormous.I'm not sure why my interest rate is NOT rock bottom. In my opinion it should be, but I don't carry over a balance, so it doesn't effect me anyway, I just think it should start out at the lowest and go up if I haven't proven myself.CHASE FREEDOM: I also have the Chase Freedom, I love this one just as much as my Freedom Unlimited. The 1% cash back IT makes is lower for daily spending, but I get 5% back in different categories every month, and I DO take advantage of that.Like my Freedom Unlimited I pay in full every month, but I try to exclusively use it for the bonus categories so I get much more back for items I'd already be buying.

name: Ro Troia
review: Chase sapphire Reserve has the worst travel consultants, I booked an airfare to london using the chase travel consultant and she booked with my incorrect name, not the name on my passport!  I have called chase 7 times to get my name corrected, being kept on hold sometimes as long as 2 hours.  they are clearly overwhelmed and incompetent in travel and appear to be using Expedia to book travel.  To date my name still has not been corrected after sending them a copy of my passport, still has not corrected the ticket.  I am furious and want to warn anyone thinking this chase card is superior when it comes to travel.  fyi, when i call the travel dept i have the pleasure of repeating my story over and over again with no resolution.

name: Patricia
review: Extremely satisfied with Chase, they really stay on top of all as I have been hit with scammers several times.  The minute something happens they call me immediately.

review: Muito bom! Pretty good! Muito bom! Pretty good! Muito bom! Pretty good! Muito bom! Pretty good! Muito bom! Pretty good! Muito bom! Pretty good!

review: NEVER get financed through this worthless place. I've been an outstanding customer for over 3 years and I have never been treated like one. Get a loan through JP Morgan if you want to be screwed in every orfice of your body. Terrible customer service. The people you talk to barley speak English. Also they will not work with you on anything over the phone, I was told today-"youll need to make your payment at a off branch store or mail a check." ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!?!?! TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE.

name: Cassie
review: I get great cash back with this card! If you refer people you get that much more in rewards. Love this card. Helps put money back in my pocket.

name: Eric
review: Interest rate is high. Points aren’t bad but it’s not worth having unless you’re flying a lot. We used to but now that we’re not there’s no point

name: Kenneth
review: I never knew that a bank has the right to withhold funds from a check deposited into an account. Recently, I deposited a rather large dollar amount check from an investment account into my Chase savings account. I discovered that Chase put a hold on the funds for seven business days. I checked with the investment company and found that the funds were transferred on the date of my deposit. I spoke with Chase bank representatives, both in person, via secure online messages, and via telephone. Even though I provided proof of the transfer, not one person could provide a reason for the bank holding the funds. I've been a Chase customer for more than twenty years. Because of the above, I will be moving my business to another bank.

name: Jannie
review: I just love my card, keep it paid up, website so easy to pay. I just love my card.  One of the best card that I have. I useless pay it off in full most of the time.

name: lylac82
review: We are ideal customers.  We set up auto pay so we don't miss a payment.  Then we wanted to help pay off the car earlier, so we added money to the principle each month.  For some reason, this caused it to skip the auto pay that month, without informing us.  Then we started accruing late fees because of the skipped payment.  As I said, we use auto pay to avoid these issues and we use paperless so we were not getting notified of the issue.  So we called to get it straightened out, and at the end of that call it was.  Or at least we thought, but as it turns out, nothing was fixed.  And now after a second call, they refuse to fix it and remove the late fees, even though the mistake is theirs.  My advice would be, do not deal with chase bank.  They are unreasonable, and their customer service is one of the worst out there.

name: jwill28521
review: Not a good company. Never been late. Never paid just the minimum. Had someone open a couple cards in my name nothing to with them and they closed my account. Not a good company to do business with do not use this conpany.

name: Carl
review: APR is too high, benefits/rewards are great. You must be an AARP member. Reward / points add up quickly if you keep the card paid off.

name: Lennis
review: The card is helping me to learn how and when to use my credit card so I can start working on buying a home soI need to get my credit score to start going up

name: Daryl
review: Very good to begin my credit experience my credit score was on 0 and whith this credit card in just 1 month i got 622 in my credit score

name: Antonio
review: This card is great to get rewards and maximize your spending for the entire family and household and save while you shop at every store

name: robert
review: I have five Chase cards and a mortgage through them.I know its overkill but I guess you know I recommend them.Service and products both.

name: Michelle Wolsak
review: I love the card. They gave me a decent limit to start and have almost doubled it in less than a year. They aren’t my highest cash back rate but they also have good perks. My only issue has been that they changed the day they report to credit bureaus. This has caused my credit score to drop because I wasn’t aware it was changed. I make sure to keep my balance at $0 the week each credit card is reporting so my score stays at it’s highest. I switch to using a different card when one is getting ready to report.  I would highly recommend this card.

name: Donna Lavoie
review: All of my other credit cards were approved instantly.  Since this one said I would recieve a letter in the mail after the application I was pretty positive that I had been denied,  however about 10 days later the card and paperwork arrived in the mail.  Approved for $8500. Scores were between 750 and 760 respectively through the 3 bureaus. This card does have an annual fee but if you travel a good bit then the card actually pays for itself.  They offered a sign on bonus of 60000 miles(points) if I spent 4000$ in 90 days. I did not put myself in debt to get the bonus so instead of shopping to meet the bonus guidelines,  I used it to pay my property taxes. So I've spent it and paid it and I see the 60,000 pts will be on my next statement. A few things that weren't my favorites:This card does NOT give a time of 0 apr and has a very high rate. Also, the yearly fee was billed the first month. So your paying before you even use it.  Overall,  JPMC gave me my second highest cl and has AMAZING travel features among other things.  I do travel enough to offset that annual fee,  but if you're someone who doesn't maybe it would be better for you to take the more affordable Chase Freedom instead of the Sapphire. Oh ... and the card itself is pretty awesome,  a metal card. Good luck and be smart. ?

name: Ernest
review: I use this card often when buying from Amazon and it is a good convenience.  I also like their online account that includes my Amazon Prime Video.  The interest rate is okay but they could do better by lowering it to 10% or less like my amazing Barclay Card which has an 8 % interest rate.  Come on Chase I use your card often but I might start using my Barclay Card instead so that I pay less interest.

name: keonfuego
review: Worst bank EVER! Buyer beware! Whatever you do stay away from purchasing a Southwest Airlines credit card from Chase bsnk. Chase has no loyalty to customers and will turn on you in a dime

name: Michael
review: Love this card. The rewards are awesome they are easy to use with amazon or transfer as cash to my bank. The customer service is also Fantastic.

name: Deborah
review: We love our chase bank! It’s addresses all our needsWhether it’s a loan, car financed, savings account or other banking issues they certainly are the best

name: Rachel
review: Prequalified for this card and 0% on purchases for 15 months is a great deal, especially during the holiday. It’s affording me some leeway while my husband gets his new business up and running. Very high credit line to start with with and a decent APR when promo expires. 800 number has always been helpful when I have called about my other cards. No complaints.

name: Chin Pang
review: Love the 5% reward points when shop on Amazon. It also has no foreign transaction fee and rental car damage insurance as one of the benefits

name: Aaron
review: This is a very helpful tool here. It helps me manage my money easier and I can also she how much money I have for my grand kids and my daughter

name: Karl B
review: Do not apply for this card. J.P. Morgan is not as accepting as they may seem. Yes, the card looks good (both financially and cosmetically), but all you should expect to receive is a supposedly polite response telling you that your application has not been accepted. They don’t care much about your TransUnion score. They primarily judge based upon your Fico score. So if you do apply for this card, check your Fico score first and don’t apply if your score is below 750. That is just my advice to anyone who might want to acquire a card from J.P. Morgan Chase.

name: Sam
review: Perhaps transunion is the only credit bureau not reporting all your bad accounts therefor you favor them. There’s a fico score for a reason to avoid the loophole of having good credit with one agency and crappy credit with the other 2. Shame on you and you, Now go riot and protest your score. ?

name: James
review: Wow i NEVER expected to see so many negative comments, but I must say that (a) you do NOT need a 750 or better FICO score before applying - NOT. EVEN. CLOSE.; (2) your TransUnion score IS one of your THREE FICO scores (Chase uses principally Experian, then TransUnion, in the Northeast)... TO BE SUCCESSFUL with Chase you need to ESTABLISH A RELATIONSHIP WITH THEM FIRST, as in, for example, SETTING UP A CHECKING ACCOUNT.... Yes Chase IS more difficult to obtain, but not THAT much... Last December I opened a Checking Account with the intention of applying for a CC after a few months (I added Direct Deposit from my job to the account)... and at the end of my Checking application, I saw a Credit Card application icon at the bottom, and i was invited to apply for their card, and, BOOM i was ACCEPTED!!  And I only had FICO scores in the LOW TO MID 600'S on all three agencies, and only a Capital One Credit Card with a sorry $300 line!  So, yes, they WILL accept you, but will start you with a very low line (mine was $500), but after 6 months or so of perfect payments, you should start to see additional offers for other cards or an increase in your credit line (they sent me invitations to apply for one of their higher end cards)... Good Luck!!

name: Hung
review: Nice card for member hotel Nice card for member hotel Nice card for member hotel Nice card for member hotel Nice card for member hotel

name: IrisSpring
review: Between my husband and myself.  Great place to shop.  Many purchases each month.  Easy to get needed things for ourselves or our home.

name: Kevin
review: Always use your points towards your credit card payment. This way you pay your bill and then get more points when using it. If you waste your points on Amazon.com you don't get any points for those purchases. Also make sure to login and add all the offers. I always add everything and occasionally I do shop at those places and get money back.

name: John John
review: Done with this loan and I’m debt free! Now I can focus raising more my credit so that I can get lower interest when purchasing a new house for my family.

name: Nancy
review: I use this card to get miles from United and it also allows for one free checked bag and priority boarding. I use the card at a variety of businesses.

review: Dependable and top service at Chase Banks. Impressed with their customer service and follow up. I had many questions and issues answered quickly regarding my POA for my mother’s account.

review: They will not stand behind customer refund on a fraudelent seller. They lie. They said they would not, however, they did then billed me anyway. Impossible to get refund.

review: This is perfect! And my score is improving very well I cannot wait to get I and my family a new home!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

review: I love that when I had troubles, they worked with me. Now, I am back on track and back to responsible shopping and living. Thank you, Chase!

review: Loan itself was a great deal. The people involved at Chase were awful and were changing paperwork up to, and during, the signing. Our loan officer when out of town the day we were supposed to close and didn’t tell us. Nothing was ready. It was a nightmare.

review: no problems so far, got my bonus quickly and customer service good. Only gave me a 1500 with all my credit scores around 730 and no derogatory marks ever so thats really my only complaint

name: mail2rajasekhar
review: I have applied for Chase freedom credit card lately as I got a useless preapproved mail.After a week or so I got a mail requesting for additional documents. The letter states either I can fax them or visit a branch to submit in person(as if they have a branch in every street) within 14 days. Neither I have access to a fax machine nor a branch nearby, so I decided not to proceed. They did not disclose that these documents can be submitted online until I specifically asked the customer service after 20 days. Later, they sent me a link to upload the documents which I did the same day.After a couple of days, I called the customer care again to check on the status. To my dismay I was told that the application has been dead as I did not follow up within 48 hours after uploading the documents which sounds so stupid. The utter part is that I never got any response stating my application has been dead until I called them up.I just got pissed off badly due to incomplete information they provide and decided to refrain my family from using any of their products ever.

review: Chase credit card has always been useful when we need it. They are good to work with on purchasing big items. They also monitor card activity and notify when it’s an unusual purchase

review: Awesome card for getting back 2 miles per dollar at restaurants and cafes, and it helps you save on baggage fees, and why turn down the Global Entry. United Lounge and being able to purchase tickets via United is ideal.

review: Insane rates. Better off going through a guy (who tells you at last call) that he “ knows a guy”, who knows an honest guy....who just opened a new loan service in “that” shady ally...with a P.O. Box..... and GREAT APR’s!!

name: Geary
review: I have two cards with Chase and have made payments on time. I have received credit increases on both cards. I like chase and appreciate the credit that’s allowed to me.

name: Chris
review: I was going to write a review but I usually don’t post reviews. This thing requires 130 characters at a minimum, so i guess I’ll try to do that.

name: erinkknight
review: Banking client for approx 12 years. The reps are the kind of people who would not leave without providing a full resolution.  Best

review: This was my first credit card, while it has no real benefits like cash back or anything like that it did help me build credit. I would recommend it for a first-time credit card

review: SHOULD HAVE A 'NO STARS' OPTION!  NO STARS!!  Credit card dispute unresolved after nearly 3 months of letters, forms, documents, emails, phone conversations! BEYOND FRUSTRATING!  Hours and hours of useless effort!  Customer service takes 24-48 hours to respond, but they called me on Thanksgiving Day and required that I provide a document to them by the next day or the dispute would be closed!!  THIS IS NOT HOW TO TREAT CUSTOMERS!!

review: Chase has proven to be outstanding and a clear leader in lending. With exemplary customer service they are head and shoulders above their competitors!

name: Cris
review: Yes, my experience has not been good I should have received a much better interest rate than I got. I wonder how long it’s going to take for them to report the new balance.

name: Eric
review: Promotional rates and balance transfer offers would be nice. Good rewards though and promotions for additional rewards help.  Interest rate is kinda high, so pay your card off every month.

name: John
review: Greatest card I have in the wallet. You get cash back on every purchase and can use those points automatically in making purchases on Amazon. Too simple.

review: Really solid card. Need to travel a decent amount in order to redeem points most effectively. May not be worth annual fee based on your monthly charge rate.

name: Keith P

name: Jorge
review: They sold our loan to no name bank after almost 11 years with them and now they throw us like nothing happen ......................

review: Best 5 percent rotating balance along with discover.has chase pay too.easy to redeem cash back rewards.Note this has foreign transaction fees.chase pay can be used in Walmart pay too.

name: SABRINA
review: Always there to help me when something goes wrong I was just received housing and now im in need of a little help with getting things together so I asked for an increase in my limit to help with Christmas for me and my gandkids this ......

name: Teresa
review: I have not been on this card for years it was my ex husband who was late or non payment. We've been divorced for over a year. Your customer service was great in getting it fixed for me.

name: Lisa
review: I'm completely satisfied with my Freedom Chase Credit Card.  After working hard at cleaning up my credit file, and raising my credit score, Freedom Chase is the first card I applied to and I know now that I made a great choice.  I recommend them highly.  Thanks so much.  -Lisa

name: Sandra
review: Great card experience.  Terrific customer service.  I will recommend this company to all of my friends and share on Facebook.  I truly enjoy this card!

name: Bernard
review: I enjoy earning 1.5% cash back on purchases.  In less than a year I have earned over $200.00 in cash back. Pay all your expenses with the card then pay the balance in full each month

name: Tina
review: Easy application through the Subaru dealership. Great low interest rate. Great terms and length to pay. Wonderful experience with the whole transaction

name: Gregory
review: Great card, generous credit limit, bonus points for opening account, rewards on every purchase, and 0% APR on balance transfers.  This card has it all!

name: Abhisek
review: Good for amazon and Whole Foods purchases giving 5 percent return. Recommend this card to all amazon and Whole Foods buyers it’s a good card for them

name: ronneishah
review: Poor Customer service and this card is supposed to be the best that chase bank has to offer The card is great  The customer service department very rude

name: Michael
review: convenient, accepted in many stores we shop on regular basis with excellent cash back program & ease of transfer of bonus point rebate

name: Thavadech
review: I like how Chase works with military by offering just 4% APR under the SCRA program. Since retiring from active duty, I'm back to regular APR (17%) which is outrageous. The only time I would carry a balance on this card is during promotional 0% APR balance transfer periods.

name: Camille
review: By far, My favorite card.   The rewards are generous and they quickly rewarded my use and payment history with a credit increase.  The app is also the easiest you use and understand.  I like that you also get a pretty detailed weekly report.

name: Alexander
review: Great benefits easy to use portal for hotels cool perks and upgrades when using the portal. Free rental car insurance is no e as well!

name: Nasar
review: Great service excellent rates the best intereste car loans and service every thing is great excellent especially car loan this is second time loan I’m so happy

name: David
review: Was not able to negotiate credit issues with them.  I have not had an active Credit account with them for over 3 years but cannot get card taken off of my credit report

name: Nunya Business
review: Yeah...don't believe the hype.  Chase offers this card in a way that any reasonable person would assume it's a good option to transfer over balances from other cards and get a free short term loan as a result.  As can be seen in numerous reviews, and I have now experienced first-hand, they will only approve you with a low spending limit.  I have exceptional credit, house is paid off, no car loans, over $600k in assets, etc.  I have a few other cards with limits in the $15k to $20k, so I was expecting the Chase card would be approved for the same.  Nope.  They gave me a $5000 limit.  Based on other reviews it seems like this is actually a high number compared to others.  I was only even applying for this card as a very short term solution to some credit card debt I wanted to wait a few months to pay off.  Now I've taken a hard pull on my credit report for a credit card with a limit that is far below what would reasonably be expected.  The ability for anyone to get approved with a high enough limit to actually utilize a balance transfer up to $15k that they advertise is a fantasy.  For anyone with good credit, I would recommend just getting an unsecured personal loan from Lightstream instead.  Yes, you will be paying interest, but it's a very low rate and at least the terms are clear and they aren't just playing games with you like Chase.

name: Gerald
review: Thanks for the candor.  Years ago Chase cancelled one of their gas credit cards to allow issue of a new one.  I wasn't told, found out when I tried to charge gas.  Had to call form the station and negotiate to keep the gas card while reducing the credit limit on another of their cards.  Left a bad taste in my mouth.  Unbelievable that they would do that.

name: Jane
review: Amazon, by way of Chase Bank, granted me a sizable initial Credit Limit, then, doubled it within months, sans request.  I am grateful.  It would be wonderful if more credit card companies were as generous.

name: FRANK R
review: Good card If you travel Alot. I got it for the spend $4k in the months deal, and did get the $500 bonus, That was sweet...!! I keep it in my wallet for whatever. The $95 yearly fee would pay off more if I used it for traveling more, but I personally don't do that. But If I did, I would get some of the perks it has withit, So makes it Good... High interest rate for comparable cards, If you don't PIF at the end of the bill cycle. Customer service is in India somewhere?? I had to call, and they answered my question satisfactorily tho. Heavy solid built, feel card, not like other regular plastic credit card.... So overall 3+ stars.

name: William Diaz
review: Had a couple disputes and they handled effectively. Never had credit limit re evaluated in 5 years despite excellent payment history including payoff of balance transfers and having checking account with them for 3 years. Had other recent bank credit cards provide 40% increase in limit without a banking relationship. Don't feel the love.

name: Frank
review: Chase Bank gave me a high limit credit card even though I was early on in trying to reestablish my good credit and did not cancel me after I got maxed out partly due to wife being a victim of a car accident.From my experience with them I highly recommend  a banking relationship with JP Morgan Chase Bank. They sometimes even offer 300 cash bonus for starting a new checking account with direct deposit of your payroll check (not an option at my job)

name: Rhonda
review: This works for me to travel with points with Southwest airlines and to use for my mother in law and grandkids to visit or we can see them

name: calvinking357
review: I had fraud on my account and everyone admitted that the account was fraudulent they froze the account but still let my check go through and chase says there’s no way at all to reverse my money. So I call back to make sure nothing else goes through to that account chase says that’s not possible I ask for the supervisor the customer service rep kept asking for a reason why ( in my knowledge of being in the call center before if someone continues to ask for a sup you have to do it) do I told the lady I was going to fail her on the survey that’s when she finally shut up and got me a supervisor

name: Kris
review: Love the transfer balance options.  Great card if you are looking to get a lower interest rate and to save you money over time with this card.

name: Davidson
review: Wonderful credit card and from a wonderful bank that care about it’s customers in heart. The best credit card and the best bank ever

name: Mina
review: Thank you so much for all your advices and updates on my credit score increase or decrease. It really helps me monitor my transition.

name: Frances
review: I’ve been with Chase for 3 months now and I must say the customer service over the phone is outstanding. I must also comment on the customer service in the bank itself was also outstanding, the rep took her time to explain everything to me and answered all my questions and my concerns. Upon opening up a checking account I was pre-approved for the Chase Unlimited VISA Card and was approved, was not expecting that and I was very happy with my line of credit.

name: melissa
review: I am paying card down asap since Chase refuses to lower APR. No worries. They did me a tremendous favor. Balance will be $100 soon. Govt appointed loan sharks.

name: Raymond
review: Everything has been good with this credit card co. for many years, since 1995. With 24 years of doing business and no problems is quite a  compliment to Chase.

name: Mary
review: I use the skirt as a back up card in case of emergencies and generally maintain the card strictly for that purpose.  i’ve had this card for a very long time

name: joannek_12
review: I have been enjoying Chase for a while now.  I've got excellent credit so I'm not sure why it went up on me.  I have a brain injury, I have no short term memory.  I think I had forgotten to pay on time, I think maybe 1 time due to short term memory.  I can't find a place time text back to you.  Hope u receive it.  I have the same prob.  I was late and I called them and explained the guy said that he will mark it in the computer and I will not be marked late again.   Give it a try, I think that it's great they do this first people like us!

name: David
review: Allways accepted and easy to use app. They replace mi credit card when I lost it .. And Chase have a good Spanish service I would recomended to any of mi friend.

name: Alison
review: I use this card to make purchases on Amazon Prime. I often get free postage in addition to good discounted rates. This card is a winner.

name: Steve
review: Glad to have such a low and fair interest rate.  Almost like getting free money. Easy to set up auto pay and not have to worry about ever being late on a payment.

name: Charlotte
review: Great service. Always very helpful and ready to assist. Employees very knowledgeable and patient whenever I have needed assistance.

name: Donald
review: This is a necessary card for travel especially car rentals. Just make sure you pay it in full by month’s end to keep from paying the high interest rate.

name: Jonathan
review: Good card ao far we have had it for a very long time and never had any issues or problems with using the card or with customer service

name: Vishnu
review: Good travel rewards card with five digit limit. Chase travel portal for points travel points redemption is awesome , they got a 24/7 service for travel bookings!

name: Jennifer
review: Love this card! Will most likely upgrade to CSR when year is up. Will most likely be international travel by then. Thanks Chase Bank! Superb customer service!

name: dennisa_51
review: It's take them 5 days to update a transaction. I think they do that for is the try to catch you count low for they can charge you a transaction fee. Citibank don't do that to me

name: William
review: So far so good. I make the payments early and they report that. I have two accounts through Subaru and both are good. +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

name: kristinemiller2
review: Excellent service! Great card to have. Would highly recommend using Chase. Always willing to answer any questions or help find extra benefits you are missing out on.

name: jtabuck62
review: Great card and great company. Glad to have it in my wallet. Very generous starting CL and balance transfers available. Rewards redeemable for cash or balance credit.

name: Phillip
review: Arrogant Staff.  I asked for this to look at a better rate, and they said in so many words. no way.  We don't care if you even leave.  I have paid off account and will be dumping them shortly.

name: deadpixel1998
review: Unlimited cash back is so easy to get. A 0% APR intro rate is very very nice. Wish more places would do this. Overall this is my favorite card!

name: Terrell Washington
review: Love the card and also got a auto increase at 3months, i now have had the card for 6 months now and have made some good cashback thank you chase

name: Alexandria
review: Extra points through the southwest button and select purchases selected through the website. I love earning free airline tickets and travel!

name: Clifford
review: Great service, professional and friendly loan officers that helped every step of the way with my home loan. I highly recommend Chase

name: William
review: You can get a chase car loan for $35K pay it off in a year but cannot quality for a chase credit card?? I have both the American Express Platinum Card and US Bank Altitude Card but Chase says NO CREDIT CARD FOR YOU.

name: Tony
review: All cash backs and points are always accurate . Chase is the best credit card if you want cash back and points for from all purchases

name: Mark
review: Definitely a plus if you do a lot of pending on Amazon. One of my favorite cards for sure. The rewards make this card a no brainer to apply

name: Amanda
review: I love that spending money builds points for flights....and was able to bring my niece home from college!  It was a helpful resource for my family.

name: Mark
review: My chase credit card was issued through Amazon. Great customer service, very easy to take any concerns to. Very happy to have this card

name: Hillary Marek
review: Recently my purse was stolen with all of my credit cards in it I had to cancel them but didn’t know the numbers because I pay for all of my bills directly out of my Checking account so I don’t have to deal with them, that way I never forget to make a payment. I couldn’t talk to a customer service representative at three different credit cards because I didn’t have my credit card number to enter in as soon as the automatic voice directory comes on all it asks for immediately is the last word it’s of the credit card number however because I had to put it in a stolen and a new credit card of been issued I know the last four numbers not of the new cards I didn’t get them yet. So to add insult to injury I was now going to crash my credit score because I couldn’t make any payments on my cards. When I called Chase a real person answered right away and was very kind very understanding and talk me through everything that only that but I didn’t realize I had another credit card with them through a store department store credit cards I had taken out a while back and I don’t think I used it maybe once. So they helped  me with that card as well. I’ll tell you what you have no idea what a big deal it is to be able to talk to a person until you need to talk to a person. I like having the option to avoid dealing with customer service if I choose to but I really really really like the fact that if I need someone there going to be there.

name: Gary
review: Good company to deal with. They are responsive when asked questions and resolve issues. This card is linked to my Amazon rewards account.

name: Kathleen
review: Best experience ever. I would definitely recommend them to everyone.It has been a great experience, a great app to check on your account and to keep track of your payments.

name: Jeannine A Fitzmorris
review: thank you for being the very best, always there when I need you, helping me if I don't get something. The very best when I lost a card.

name: Chris
review: Chase dropped my credit limit after making a large payment to them. I have been with them for almost 2 years now and then they decided to do this to me.  I guess they don’t like it when you get out of debt.

name: Paul
review: Terrible company.Repeatedly lied to me about their products and procedures.  Reports dishonestly to credit bureaus.  Would never do business with them ever again for any financial service.

name: DENNISw T White
review: I love this card the payment terms are so relaxedand the most confortable thing is the interest I love this card the payment terms are so relaxedand the most confortable thing is the interest I love this card the payment terms are so relaxedand the most confortable thing is the interest I love this card the payment terms are so relaxedand the most confortable thing is the interest

name: Phil Holt
review: Absolutely horrible when it comes to actually giving you the rewards you're supposed to obtain from signing up for accounts. They sent my Sapphire card to the wrong address, getting it lost in the mail for a month then didn't give me the $600 in points for spending $4k within the first three months because the month they lost my card in the mail apparently counted as a month I should've been spending...even though my card wasn't even yet activated.Fast forward a few months to opening a checking account there to receive a $300 sign-up bonus, and not receiving that bonus because I didn't use a coupon code, according to the rep. A coupon code which was supposed to be auto-applied when I followed the link from my Chase dashboard to set up this checking account.

name: estrada0820
review: They lost my replacement card and 7 business days later still no card! I am not able to pay bills nor access my money! I have contacted customer service 3 times and still no resolution. I will definitely be closing my account with them!

name: Ryan Carson
review: Well, after reading all these negative reviews, I decided to give it a shot.  I have excellent credit and wanted to move over $15k to a zero interest card, but unfortunately was only approved for $4200 at an astronomical 23% interest rate.  I'll be paying this card off immediately before the 15 month cut-off.  Disappointed!

name: Winslow Arizona
review: The Chase Freedom® card was a great starter credit card for me. I got it in college and used it for many years after that. It was an easy way to build credit, and the cash-back program was a useful perk.

name: Winslow Arizona
review: This isn't the best card for everyone, but it works for me. I've found Marriott staff very accommodating when I have issues or questions about my account. The APR is alright if I keep my debt in line.

name: cddevils
review: Very disappointed. Had the Marriott Bonvoy metal credit card for many years and ‘uograded’ to the Boundless version and the card and is plastic! Has anyone else had this problem? Extremely dissatisfied. This site indicates it’s metal. I wonder what happened?!

name: jermmiedavis762
review: They closed my account !!!!! and I receive a phony letter from chase saying they are closing it because I don't have enough credit information on file and later they also claimed it fraud .... I never been late or went over my credit limit ... this bank is a joke and I hope they go out of business don't apply

name: blue  jay
review: HI get a free credit report closeing an account cause of not enough credit info isn't a reason to close a account you could have been a victim of identity theft not no it.

name: kevinday804
review: This card is so bad I have been trying to get rid of it for 4 months spending many hours on multiple calls with Chase/Amazon. Month after month they say it is closed. Month after month I get an email saying I owe more due to interest on a certain period or interest not calculated or interest deferred. Now have got a demand for 12 cents! Never get involved with these people, they will suck your spirit dry.

name: Lisa Reed
review: Worst travel customer service ever..expedia has taken over and they are horrible.  Only used my points twice with travel and each time problem and on hold for over an hour waiting to speak with someone and then transferred three times and never resolved.  Will not renew credit card ...just awful!!!!!!!

name: Christie Matherne
review: I've been a Chase customer for years now, with credit and more recently, checking account. I like their wide availability and the functionality of the mobile app. I rarely end up at a Chase branch for anything. The terms are clear and I haven't really had a problem with them.

name: Cake Banks
review: I've had an account with chase for over 11 years and I'm finally fed up with them and closing it. They've started charging overdraft fees out of nowhere. If an overdraft occurs on your account but you head to the ATM and pay it before a fee occurs, youve satisfied that balance right? Wrong! According to chase representatives their system takes time to update and even though the account has a positive balance, they still overdraft for a $35 fee and it's not a one time fee it's a reoccurring fee. Yes you get charged daily!!! For the same charge.  I'm switching! Chase is flat out stealing from their customers and the representatives are clueless as to how to solve the problem they just keep reading whatever script they rehearsed at the time of training for hire to deal with you and its annoying and frustrating. The best bank to go to HANDS DOWN is BANK OF AMERICA I've had an account with them about the same amount of time as chase and have NEVER had a problem.  When they were talking on the news about Banks profiting off of charging customers ridiculous overdraft fees believe me you they were talking about JP Morgan SPECIFICALLY. From someone with experience take my advice bypass Chase Bank. The "bonus" they claim to give you when you sign up will be taken back through fees. Also think about it, why would a great bank need a gimmick like "we'll give you $200 to sign up"?

name: caquino00_ca
review: My mother and I opened a chase bank account of which I was her POA (power of attorney) on the account. My mom had stage 4 cancer and was very weak. I was getting things and doing things for mom to make her comfortable. The following month she receives her debt card. Unbeknownst to us I could not use the debt card. I found out when i went into the branch and was told the account was frozen. The nightmare begins with Robert and Michael from Chase fraud department they claim they would do an investigation and release the hold several times and weeks after I pleaded with them to release the hold at that point my mom had already drew up a trust leaving her granddaughter her assets because they didn't release the hold I was not able to transfer the funds. Now her children including myself will divide the funds. Her sole beneficiary will not receive anything. All of this while grieving your loved one. Chase bank is a heartless institution. I would never recommend them to anyone. CA- nycMore

name: chunkandbean
review: Worst credit card ever for travelling.  Do not get this card is you need a card for travelling.  The "verified by Visa" system that they use is the worst.  You cannot buy anything without calling Visa and having them verify the charge so if you are trying to book tickets and you have a time limit then forget it.  Get a different card that is not Chase!!!  Chase claims it's not their fault but it is absolutely their fault.

name: ardmoresalon
review: Waste of time. Applied online for a $15,000 balance transfer. Credit Score over 770, perfect credit history 35+ years. DTI total (home, auto, credit card) is 25%. SMALL amount of debt relative to income and was approved for a meager $3,900 balance transfer. I had recently done a large scale remodel, paying most upfront, but charging the final portions, which I was hoping to transfer to the chase card at 0%. Not so. I immediately called and requested to have the balance transfer reviewed and increased. Chase denied the increase of limits. Makes no sense.... You can apply for a mortgage at 28% DTI, 36% total DTI. Who DO they give $15,000 balance transfers to??? The other irony.... I just finished paying a $32,000 auto loan to chase... and paid it off a year early. I will take my business elsewhere. I just took a credit hit for no reason.

name: Vernon Joiner
review: Just got approved for this card with a 17,000 CL. My scores were 750 EU  775 TU  758 EXP. I'm excited to start my journey with Travel Reward cards. If you apply for this card remember chase has that 5/24 rule. This means if you have opened 5 or more accounts (from any Credit card company) in the last 24 months, Chase will AUTOMATICALLY DENY YOU, PERIOD! Don't waste a hard inquiry if you don't meet the 5/24 rule!

name: holly_1987
review: how long does it takes to get approved

name: sztencelkarl
review: I went into the Chase bank in Green Valley, AZ to set up an account. I wanted to setup my account and a linked account for my son. There were no people in the bank and several employees doing absolutely nothing yet I was told that they only had time to set up one account. On top of that they were rude about the whole situation.

name: jerrym1971
review: Never had a card from them and never will. I applied for the Amazon card about 5 years ago when I first got Amazon Prime. Chase has been running my credit just about every month to every other month since. I have contacted all 3 bureaus and Chase themselves and it keeps happening to the point I had to lock all 3 of my reports. Nothing is getting done to rectify this by them. I even moved 6 months ago and the recent applications are showing my old address but Chase won’t stop the autopull of my report, stating they were author applications.......not by me!

name: Kavon Williams
review: I like Chase alot, they were the first company to give me a limit over 1000, it was 2000. That was a year ago, they are stingy on giving increases though. It'll probably be easier to get a higher limit by just applying for a new card altogether

name: perryah62
review: Did the online deposit with checks. Even a payroll check. Sometimes it works in 2 days sometimes it takes two weeks. In the meantime they pay the auto pay but charge you 35$ for over draft even if it shows you have the money in the account but because they sit on it for two weeks you get screwed. Never have deposited a bad check and you would think they would treat customers better. And yet I'm a dummy cause I stay loyal to them. Find a bank that will treat you right

name: vince
review: This card's consumer purchase protection is an absolute joke.  I had 8 small purchases totaling $40 from a vendor for product I did not receive. I filed a dispute. The Chase rep, who barely spoke English, called me and told me he would authorize credit for 3 of the 8 charges, or $15. When i told him I was not interested, he acted irritated.  This was before even investigating the dispute with the vendor.  Terrible customer service.  I used to spend $30,000 plus a year with them...not any more. My Discover card is so much better in every way

name: Bobby Jones
review: So far, I've really liked this card. I'd wanted it for a long time because I travel a lot with United, and the perks are just what I need; however, I was ineligible for a long time because of Chase's 5/24 rule. Once I was below 5/24, I had to wait a couple weeks until the first day of the 25th month to apply. I was approved with a initial limit of $18,700, which was surprising. What I don't like is that they pulled both my Equifax and Experian reports. My Equifax score FICO was 715 and my Experian FICO was 700. My utilization was at 7%. Keep in mind that to get the free checked bag and priority boarding on United flights, you must have booked your flight with this card. Just recently, I got behind a guy at the airport who was irate with a check-in agent because he had booked his flight with another card, but because he had a United Explorer card that he could show her, he expected to be able to check his bag for free and board early. Unfortunately, it doesn't work that way. That's pretty much on par with all travel rewards cards.

name: julieparis
review: After using Chase for 16 years for business and personal checking/savings/credit cards and always having a stellar credit rating, I was treated terribly recently by both the JP Morgan Chase offices and our local North Knoxville branch, and will be finding a new bank or savings and loan for all my personal and business banking and checking needs.  After being charged fraudulently by a company online for $149.95, Chase and Chase VISA refuse to back me after spending millions with them over all these years.  This company has been reported by many people on BBB as a fraud yet Chase backs them over me, their client. If I could give a 0 star rating, I would.

name: shaunajani
review: DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS TRASH. With my stellar credit, I wasted a hard credit pull for $500 credit line. Don't waste your time. I can't believe this card is getting five stars. For What??? For a 21% rate on a $500 limit. If you have good credit, apply for the Bank of America card, where I got a $5,000 credit line.

name: sandra826ken
review: Awful. Customer service was terrible. #1 I transferred a small balance in January from Slate to another card, received a confirmation number, yet it never went through. #2 I decided to pay off my credit card last month to find out I got charged interest AFTER I paid off my balance. The 2 agents I spoke with, Kellie L288662 and a manager, Whitney U448624, had me on the phone for 45 minutes. I was disconnected and they still could not reverse the charges despite the first agent agreeing with me that I should have had a zero balance. Makes no sense whatsoever. Apparently, I was charged interest after I paid off the entire balance. The manager (Whitney) even hung up on me after she asked me about my experience. Never again will I use Slate Chase. Horrible customer service, waste of time to try to rationalize.

name: chuckschroeder82
review: Chase Bank has removed all Tellers ( traditional tellers they say), and replaced with Teller Advisers. There is no cash access for the Tellers, just there to guide you through their new Boutique Design, Data Center Bullshenter.Check out my real life experience:Unknown to me, my Debit card chip is malfunctioning.  Also unknown to me is Chase sees the malfunction and it triggers a fraud review, placing a hold on my account. The hold goes into effect Saturday morning with no text or e-mail advisory to myself.  Essentially the weekend is a loss.  I find out about the hold when I actually call CHASE at the ATM in their local office, now a teller-less autobot, too large for the space they rent, indoor volleyball court.  now I am in the know that my card has been placed on fraud review hold and it will be removed and good to use almost immediately.NEXT DAY.....Card is no good because chip is the real problem.Monday, I show up at Data Center Bullshenter...they cannot issue any cash because the castrated Tellers have no access to something like cash.  I am told to walk 1/2 mile to the next CHASE location where they can help me.  with a vacation three days away and the need to have a replacement card and cash for the weekend......off for a long walk in the rain I went.New location was able to issue me cash, order me a new card, apologize for the useless Bullshenter 500 feet from my house.Finally, if I would do everything on my phone, never-mind I presently do all of my banking on line, but not good enough, they insist on phone apps, which I choose NOT for personal security reasons.  The Bullshenter would help only if I went phone app.Here come the robots folks....RUN!!!Number one goal upon return from vacation......NEW BANK!!!

name: Terrell Washington
review: First of i want to Thanks Chase for approving my first Unsecured CardI hope my Review Give hope to those who are new to Aquiring Credit LinesFirst off i Got My First Credit Card Ever in January this year I did not have a fico score or a Credit Karma Vantage score 0.the Capital 1 Secured and a Self Lender Loan same month which accumilated a credit karma score 628 Transunionand 666 equifax then in Feburary i got the Discover Secured card for 200 and in March i added 800.00 to the deposit and made my Discover 1000.000 and that Gave me 33 more point on Trans Union and Equifax..same month in March i was Added as a Authorized User to a Family Member Capital One Savior Card that was 4 yrs and 5 months old Perfect payhistory and 0 Balance of 3000.00 Boom.Now i have generated Fico Scores in 3 months 705 Experian 745 equifax and 747 Transunion Fico8This month April my Capital 1 secured turned 3 months old along with my Self lender Loan 3 months. i got another 39 point Boost all 3 Bearuswhich today my scores are Exp 744 Trans 768 Equidax 766.So Finally this Saturday that just Past I checked The Chase site for Pre qualifications offers and for the first time out of a 100 tries in 3 months i was pre approved for 4 Chase Cards The Slate, Freedom, freedomunlimited, chas saphire preferred.Then I thought i Should not apply Cause my Experian Had 7 Inquiries 5 of them withn a year, My Transunion Had 5 Inquiries and Equifax had 3 inquiriesSo I said what the hell give it a Shot, I went to a branch Sat with my Banker and he told me to follow my Preapproval Link and apply on my Phone its probably best so I did while sittin there at the Branch and I wasnt approved instantly so He picked up the phone and made a call to quikend the application process they spoke for a minute and then they told the Banker to Tell me to call the Fraud prevention Number on Monday toda because they where closed on weekends.Now Im thinking Im Denied..Nope he said, its most likely to Id verify you..so Today i went back to the Branch I Been Banking at for a Year and Had the Banker Make that Call..I was nervous a Little but he spoke to them told them Yes he have a Checking account and then He passed me the phone i gave them my Cell number and they texted me a Passcode and repeated it to them and i was Approved for 1000.00  not much but more Importantly Im In The Chase Credit card family . So If you just Started Building Credit Here is My Complete 3 month Process to Obtaining a Chase Card and i didnt have a Credit Score at all 0 back in January. i hope my Review Help and give Hope

name: westlove30
review: Seems like to much work for just a 1000 credit limit !

name: Danny Riggs
review: On my Chase account, a pop up appeared and asked to update my income. Upon completion, another screen said "Since you're already a customer, this won't affect your credit score" so I clicked again and immediately I checked and sure enough they popped my credit for two points. I protested to the company and their response was "We don't feel we should remove this because you had to have known it was an inquiry". I am not happy but will have to bear this for two years. Unfairly treated.

name: andie Armstrong
review: Like seemingly all credit card offers that seem too good to be true, I got approved for an amount far less than my requested balance transfer. Called and no one could see why I would not have qualified based on my credit score and application. Just a needless ding to my credit and a waste of time.

name: barry_2
review: I have an 805 credit score, less than 10% utilization, never a late payment to anyone ever, 100K parked in their bank and I get a measly $10K credit line.  I explained that this is not even enough to buy airline tickets and hotel for my family (it is after all a travel card).  They just don't want to budge.  I got  a higher credit line and more rewards from Capital One Savor.   I don't intend to keep this card.  It's been a huge waste of my time, plus TWO hard pulls!

name: Chiara Petrachi
review: I got approved when my score was less than 700. They didn't approve me right away as they needed to verify some information, so I gave them a call, and was approved right away. No annual fee, cash or point bonus for spending a certain amount within first three months. I use the card for large and medium purchases. PIF. Love the app too. Customer Service is wonderful.

name: Joe Fejeran
review: I have tried to link my chase liquid prepaid debit card to Postmates for quick payout of my earnings but unable to do so as I keep getting a message that it is a credit card and can only use prepaid debit cards.

name: Nathaniel Belteton
review: I can assist you with that. Do you have number to be reached

name: Jane John
review: The online travel booking is horrendous and frustrating. Save yourself time and don't get this card. I have had three horrible experiences on the phone with customer service repeating myself and my plans. They can't seem to book a simple hotel and they tell me that their website is updating. It has happened multiple times, months and days apart so how many times can a website not work in the year 2019 for a big company like Chase? THEY SHOULD BE EMBARRASSED!!!!

name: Nathaniel Belteton
review: How long have you been banking with them

name: guru0112
review: There’s an inquiry in my credit I’m in the process of trying to buy a house didn’t apply what can I do now!? Can someone contact me ASAP??? I need help please! I need this removed from my bureau ASAP!

name: Nathaniel Belteton
review: Do you have contact info for us to discuss solution to the problem you experienced?

name: lila8229
review: I would actually give them a zero. I have been a customer for over 30years and went to get my end of year statement for taxes. Without informing their customers they have decided to get rid of the site. Their IT specialist told me that if I wanted my year's spending, I could go in and download each statement for the last year and print it. Chase needs to hire real IT people who actually know what they are doing, improve their customer communication ie. inform their customers that they will no longer offer a service and not do this just before tax season. They sent a misleading email on Jan. 23, 2019 that they had a new and improved year end summary to find out they just got rid of it. DO NOT GET A CHASE CREDIT CARD!!

name: Nathaniel Belteton
review: Do you like their bill pay?

name: Benita Mitchell
review: My credit score is 714 , my approval odds were Good and they declined me,go figure. So now there will be a hard inquiry on my report...thanks a lot WalletHub!

name: ARCHIE  CONWAY
review:
Credit card approval doesn't depend entirely on your credit score. Chase have some specific application rules (like 5/24, 2/30, 24 month rule, etc.). In addition to those, too many recent inquiries, recent negatives, loss of job or bad credit utilization can make approval difficult. They will inform you what were the reasons that stood behind that rejection.

Don't worry about the hard inquiry. The score effects are negligible and short-term.

Chase also has a reconsideration line at 888-270-2127. Call them and calmly make your case on why you believe you should be getting this new card. There's no harm in giving it a shot.

name: Nathaniel Belteton
review: How many years have you been banking with them

name: mairita C
review: I have excellent credit as many reviewers here.  I decided to open a amazon credit card since I buy a lot of stuff there and thought about the points rewards program would be perfect.  They told me it would be 16.49%.  I didn't like it but I went for it hoping that they would lower it in some time.  Its been a year or so and its still the same. I called and they told me that its the lowest they have and can not lower it.  REALLY??  I paid $40 of interest last month for a few reward points?  NAHHH, I told him I will pay it off and never use it again.  She then told me that I can't pay it off because there is already a payment pending..... REALLY????? So I am not allowed to pay off my card?  Tomorrow is the 3 day waiting period. After that I am not ever using it again.

name: Heather Hoffhines
review: I went to the Chase prequalified site & saw I was prequal for Freedom, Freedom Unlimited and Slate. I applied for the Freedom Unlimited. I called the automated approval line to check my status and go the dreaded "you will be notified in 7-10 business days in writing" which normally means a denial. I got the denial letter in the mail less than a week after I applied. The letter had FIVE reasons listed why I was denied, the credit report pulled was transunion- my score was 633.. The letter also stated that I have acquisition risk score v2. I called the reconsideration line. I explained to the rep each reason why - gave more information regarding my application and situation & that I had been a loyal chase customer for 5 years. The rep placed me on hold & gave me a credit limit of $500. I couldn't believe it!!!

name: Sherri Hand
review: My husband's Chase Freedom accounts are old and do not have rewards. His credit score exceeds 810 and yet, his APRs are more then 29%. We only keep them to occasionally take advantage of the balance transfer offers and because we know his score would drop slightly by cancelling the accounts. We just make sure that we never carry a balance subject to that horrendous APR.

name: kjk35
review: Scammed. Received an offer to have the annual fee waived for the club card. Thought that is what I signed up for on their website, but when the card arrived the materials did not reflect the waiver. I contacted Chase & they said the offer was not available on my card, even after I sent them a copy of the offer! Their customer service team is horrible. Must be all the former customer staff from the cable company.

name: littleikobear
review: Credit Score of 815, will not offer a better/lower interest rate than 16.24%Will not even provide a review of APR but 2 twice a year. Hides behind APR rates increases when prime rate increases, rather than addressing these are two separate increases. Not very transparent or consumer friendly. Been with Chase for 20 years, they choose this 'product' of the Freedom Unlimited.Rewards are decent if you remember to enroll in the quarterly 5% choices

name: Brian Herzog
review: Applied for a HELOC through Chase and it was a poor decision.   Loan rep asked multiple times to send documents that I had already sent in.  She never knew what was going on.  She would also ask where documents were that she never even told me to send in.  The final straw was they wanted a Certificate of Trust even though I already sent in a notarized one.  There was 0 difference in the documents other than the fact theirs was on Chase Bank letterhead.  Will not use again.

name: haiden_dodd
review: The transfer to expedia booking platform is going to bring CHASE rewards to their knees!The mismanagement of the transition to the Expedia’s booking platform has led to a HORRIBLE customer experience. I was once an avid promoter and provider of monthly referrals for new chase reserve customers. Not anymore. Chase management needs to seriously reconsider and challenge Expedia on the deplorable committment to customer service and their ability to successfully transition technological platforms.Chase has now stooped to the level of other major credit card providers with hurdles and restrictions to reedem travel rewards. Congratulations!

name: Jane John
review: Thank you for your spot-on review, halden_dodd! Chase Sapphire Reserve needs to figure out their website functionality. IT NEVER WORKS! I specificially have the Chase Sapphire Reserve card for travel but everytime I try to book a hotel or flight, the website doesn't work. It has happened to me numerous times until 2 hours later, I am red in the face, calling the travel number, pushing buttons, put on hold, repeating my mother's maiden name, repeating the flights I want , repeating the hotel dates  & raising my voice in frustration, told to call back in 2 hours when the website may work again.  IT NEVER WORKS WHEN I CALL BACK  - it happened in October and it happened again last night and today, March 17, 2019. GET YOUR ACTS TOGETHER CHASE SAPPHIRE  - you advertise as a great travel card and you are NOT WORTH IT!

name: gen cullen
review: DO NOT sign up for this card. The points I earned never showed up in my Marriott account, and the customer service reps were incompetent! I signed up to get the 75,000 bonus offer, and was so excited about getting a card that would get me Marriott points. I earned the 75,000 bonus offer (plus an additional 8,000 points from purchases) and it just never showed in my Marriott account. I called Marriott customer service and they said it's because I must not be entering the correct rewards number. I read them the number on the back of the card. She goes "huh, well that number isn't showing up for me, that's weird. I don't know why. You should call Chase." I'm on hold with Chase for 10 minutes. Representative tells me he also doesn't know why my points aren't showing up. He tells me he put in a request for the points and it will take 6-8 WEEKS to show up in my account. Absolutely absurd, because we needed these points to book our vacation! I ask him if he knows why this is happening and how to avoid it in the future. Will I have to call every single month to request my points and then wait 6-8 weeks? He tells me he doesn't know. I ask him to transfer me to someone else who might know. He says that he looked into the problem and there is no apparent reason for this, and I'll just have to call every month. HA. I'll be waiting my 6-8 weeks for the points I earned (that I will HOPEFULLY receive then...) and then closing the card. SO disappointed with this extremely stressful experience.

name: kjcasey0
review: Absolutely HORRIBLE bank! I was given a $1,000 check from my Mother and took it to her CHASE bank to cash. Since I do not have an account at the bank, they told me that there would be an $8 charge. That is ridiculous in itself, but then the teller comes back to tell me that they can't cash the check. My mother has over $40,000 in the account, yet they wouldn't cash the check for "her protection." What a bunch of BS. She called the bank and regional manager, and all they said was "well, he can deposit it at his own bank". Needless to say, that would result in a 5-business day hold, so that isn't the best option! What the hell good is CHASE BANK if they wont cash a $1,000 check?? Absolutely pathetic. You can bet that I WILL NEVER have an account at Chase. You can also guarantee that I will tell people about this asinine policy for a long time coming. What a worthless business.

name: Bryn Turner
review: Stay away from banking with Chase.  It was 100% wrong when they played Big Brother with my bank account when in Mexico for 30 days & they added a NEW $100 withdrawal limit. I asked who did this = huh?

name: AJ Pickrel Sukonm
review: They take forever to approve you when I called about my application they said the fine print States could take 30 days, I can purchase a home in less time. I answers the questions they said where the reason for the hold up (different phone # and email) than previous accounts  and she still said it could be 7-14 more days. American express approve me immediately less than 2 minutes and Wells Fargo was timely. If I every get the chase card I'll use it for promotion and then through it in a junk draw.

name: boblab6
review: Gas station billed my card twice for the same purchase of gas. Chase told me to contact the gas station and would not refund the additional charge. CEO needs to be charged with contributing to theft. You are not selling a product, you’re contributing to the theft of funds in a persons bank account. Remove your money from Chase immediately. I can only imagine the scams they are running.

name: Mark
review: Chase Sucks!!.
