I applied for a Amazon/Chase Visa Card  and received a letter from them today Stating that they need to verify some Information.So i called them and they did not ask me anything new, just wanted to send me a text message to verify my identity, then they put me on hold for about 4 mins.long enough to pull my credit report for the second time in 2 months. then they said that the current application was a duplicate of the one last month that they denied. well if they denied the one last month then why pull my credit report again?. they are sneaky and just plain bad people. and you can forget about filing   a dispute with trans union or experian  if you try they say it can't be done online.

name: Jeff Carr
review: Didn't deliver on promotional balance transfers as advertised in very costly ways.  Try to imagine anyway your use of credit might temporarily go up significantly (on any credit cards), such as for finishing a home improvement project before refinancing your house, or for the cost of repairs before trying to sell a car or your house. Chase will reduce your credit limit without any email, text, or phone call warning you.  Chase will even freeze your card late one night while you are traveling; right when you have to change a flight; or if you have to extend a hotel stay for a week on a business or mission trip; or when you must rent another car because of a missed flight or an extended trip -- again without any email, text, or phone call warning you.  If cancer strikes a loved one, and your bills temporarily mount up, Chase will be the first credit card company to cut your Credit Limit severely, with no warning even if you have never been late on a payment, and even if you have home equity enough to draw on to cover those increased bills.  After doing all of the above, with no remedy to you, Chase will also be the LAST credit card company to restore your Credit Limit, and the last to restore to you the privilege to make Balance Transfers to pay off higher interest credit card debt with low promotional offers from Chase. BUT, if you do get to utilize a Balance Transfer Offer, Chase service people tell you "any amount paid over your Minimum Balance Due will go toward all your higher interest purchases first, and then toward our promotional balance," which sounds optimal, but Chase people don't tell you that if you charge $4,000 in purchases in a month, AND you then make a $4,000 payment RIGHT AFTER those charges post to your account, so you don't forget or spend that cash elsewhere, Chase will apply the $4,000 toward your 0% promotional balance, and then begin charging you interest on the purchases you made for the month even though you paid them off as soon as they posted to your account.  Will they correct this?  Heck No!   American Express, Citibank, Discover, US Bank MasterCard, etc. have never pulled any of this crap on me, but Chase did and Chase is the card I've had the longest.  "The customer is always right," means nothing to Chase, nor does customer loyalty.

name: Devlin English
review: Look... you Pay it off and they tell the Credit Bureaus .... The way it SHOULD BE... CITI, Nope they don't do that.... Discover hard to get them to do an Update... Capitol One FUGEDABOUIT....  Chase is the Place

name: Larry Adams
review: I applied for a $75,000 mortgage with Chase. My credit score was 820. My assets were approximately 1 million dollars. The underwriting dept Controls the entire loan decsion process.  They declined my loan. Terrible experience.  If you want to secure a mortgage, I would seriously suggest using a small mortgage company.

name: mariecheveres2
review: I dont like the fact i deposited a check now im waiting 2 weeks for my funds... never again will i do that again. Had I would of know that I would of never did it. I've been emailing then and no reply buck from anyone.... not cool... waiting for my own money

name: monie295
review: Going thru this now never again

name: Tyler Reed
review: Signed up to receive 50,000 bonus miles and after I meet the 3,000$ requirement I contacted them after my last billing cycle and was told that I don't have the offer what a scam. Also you only gain access to select United lounges not all.

name: wprothe4
review: The same thing happened to me! How is this even possible? They advertise for this sign up bonus but then claim I didn’t check the correct box to receive the promotion?

name: Bryan Tobias
review: Signed up for the 50,000 bonus miles, and thought having club access, and free checked bags would be nice also. After meeting all required spend limits, was told the offer i signed up for did not include bonus miles. If you go to Chase or United websites, every offer includes bonus miles. In the United Club, the card is advertised everywhere with bonus miles, yet somehow I managed to not qualify.

name: Michael A Strickland
review: I had a consolidation company buying them minimum every month as of last month I paid chase the total was $945 I paid them off completely so this has been rectified it should show up never missed a payment if I did the consolidation company was in charge of all payments from 2016 I saved money until I could pay them off it was taking way too long and it was hurting my they are I have receipts paid at a branch thank you

name: donsaxton
review: Chase recently rejected my 780 credit score because I had “too many hard inquires in the past year”. I have one.               Additionally, I have positive personal credit experience with them.  Really chase?

name: aschulz15
review: Do NOT put your money into Chase Bank! This bank, even compared to Wells Fargo and BOA, is on another level of unethical behavior. I had thousands of dollars stolen from me and this bank had non-existent fraud protection as well as no coverage for the fraud whatsoever. And it was their fault I was compromised as they had information stolen from them. I spoke to many people higher up in the company who openly admit to their unethical business practices that they only care about their own interests and profits (even if they must use loopholes) than to look out for their customers. THIS BANK ABSOLUTELY WILL STEAL YOUR MONEY AT SOME POINT IN TIME. I was scammed and will never use this bank or any national bank again until the government actually puts together laws that prevent these scammers from using loopholes to profit off their customers.FYI, if you have even 1 cent stolen from your account and then your account drained exactly 60 days later, this bank will refuse to help recover your funds. This means, don't just review your statements, make sure you log in every single day (or just don't use this bank) to see if even 1 penny was fraudulently drawn from your account. Chase will say its been sixty days since that penny and won't help you. Additionally, if you even recover the funds yourself, they'll refuse to allow the funds to go into YOUR bank account (even though it costs them nothing). Completely unethical!

name: Paul
review: A weird bank. They gave me my first regular credit card, Freedom Unlimited, although I had a checking account with them for almost two months. I product changed that card around 3 months in to a Freedom. Then they wouldn't budge for another account until I had about 10 months of credit history for an Amazon Prime card. Another thing, they doubled my sub 1000 CL once, but wouldn't auto CLI it again, yet they gave me a grand worth of credit when they issued me my second card.

name: Danielle Gaydos
review: Chase Bank makes almost everything as easy as Apple.  The online user interface and corresponding phone app are built to navigate and thorough – making everything from paying bills, to transferring or sending money and depositing checks, to communicating with the bank, simple to do without calling or visiting a branch.  On the occasions when I have gone in person, the staff has been knowledgeable and attentive with suggestions to grow and manage wealth.  My checking and savings are free, and the only time I don’t use the Visa / Debit card I have with them is for foreign transactions, for which they do charge a fee.

name: William Mnatly
review: So far I am very happy with this account. From reading the reviews on this site, I think this account is miss understood. THIS IS NOT A PRE-PAID CREDIT CARD!!! Please stop comparing Chase Liquid to them! It's more of a light risk (for you and the bank) checking account. This account does not act like a credit card. I doubt they even report to the credit agencies like credit card's do. If you are considering getting this account type, please be informed. This account is not to build your credit. Its to get into Chase and have of there great features with a poor banking/credit history.

name: Erik Villanueva
review: Hola mi nonbre es Erik villanueva tengo aproxcimada mente 17 años con chase y nunca avia tenido problema con este banco asta ase unos dias atras llame pidiendo alluda aservicio al clinte y que in satifecho co el servico que me diero nose porque agaran personas sin experienci niguna para poder alludar ise unpago de liquilacion de un carro lo ise /8/16\18 lo page al wellfargo y todavia no lo anrecivido porque mi banco chase no lo apagado lo tube que canselar por que uno delos representante no me dio nin gun detalle de los 6,331.05 que yo pague de las tres personas que me allufaran nadie pudo alludarme me gustari saver el nonbre delas dos personas que me alludaron con la persone que able se llama gaby no quiso dar de talles de las dos personas que me alludaron dos supuesta mente superbisores del servicio al clinte y ninguno de ellos tinen la capacidad de poderle alludar alas personas que servio mas inutil pues nada mas queda de cambirme de banco atenta mente Erik vilanueva

name: ssario
review: Phone and Chat support non-existent! When signing up for this card they created a new rewards point number. In order to combine accounts you have to call them. Well after being on hold for 40 minutes and never talking to a live person, I gave up. Turns out this is very common and no way around it. STAY AWAY FROM MARRIOTT!!

name: russbloomer1
review: I have a 750 credit score TU and EF and they are not willing to lower my apr under 24% highway robbery for someone with excellent credit i will no longer keep this card i will be terminating it shortly.

name: henriqueg
review: Great service, both in person and through the phone. When I had a credit card stolen, was able to cancel and order a replacement immediately through the app. Unfortunately Chase doesn't have branches in the DC area yet, but it is announced it will open up to 70 branches around DC, MD and VA. Overall, highly recommended.

name: Rafael Pereyra
review: I recently got the Chase Sapphire Reserve and it is now my go to card. The steep $450 fee was rapidly offset by the $300 travel credit, which I used mainly in UBER rides and airfares. Withing the first month, I received my Priority Select Pass for airport lounges access. This is going to offset some heavy costs in snacking, WiFi at airports, and the pain neck I usually suffered from trying to find a way to sit or lay down on the gates' chairs. I would suggest calculating the minimum spending required to breakeven from the $150 net fee of this card to see if it will fit your lifestyle.

name: Rafael Pereyra
review: Customer service at one of the Columbus (OH) branch was excellent. The officer guide me through the whole process with a very welcoming attitude. I have not had any issues with the Checking Account until now, except for the facts that fees when not meeting the requirements might be a little steep. Also, their online banking platform might not be the most user friendly compared to other banks.

name: Carlos Laiz
review: We just switched to the Chase Sapphire Preferred to replace our American Express Platinum card. We were lured by the many benefits and low annual fee ($95/year, first year free). We have had the Sapphire Preferred card only for a couple of weeks, and today (6/29/2018) we received notification that they are gutting Chase Sapphire Preferred card benefits. They cancelled (effective August 26, 2018): Price protection, return protection, lost luggage reimbursement and travel accident insurance. Also, they cut back trip cancellation/interruption insurance to $1500 per person and $6000 per trip. This makes it about the same as other travel cards with $0 annual fee available from Bank of America and others, but Chase Sapphire Preferred charges $95/year after the first year. Extremely disappointing. It only took two weeks of having this card, and after the tedious operation switching many automatic payments online from Amex to Sapphire Preferred, they completely gutted the benefits. Extremely disappointed with Chase as a whole.

name: Bruce B
review: DO NOT GET THIS CARD. We maintained a fairly low balance, then when we made a $2,000 payment the money exited our checking account but payment credit was held up by Chase because \"it was more than half our balance.\" We were told nothing of this. Zero communication. Then when my wife went to check out of a hotel on a business trip the card was declined. Problem. Embarrassment. Flight potentially missed. When I got on the line with the Chase agent, they insisted they had to personally call my bank to double-check on the funds--even though the payment went through to Chase 6 days ago. Nonsensically, if we had put $1,000 on the card instead of actually paying Chase more money, the payment would have gone through with no problem. Chase made no effort to do anything aside from explain their previously invisible policy to me. DO NOT GET THIS CARD. It will leave you embarrassed and in a fix at the worst possible moment.

name: Sonya
review: Uh many banks do this. Especially when you make multiple payments or if your payments are large and then you make large purchases. Many banks will do this.

name: happyellie777
review: I was excited about the card and pleasantly surprised when they raised my limit (without asking or telling me), but to find out that the interest rate is over 24% when I always make higher than minimum payments and always pay on time was disappointing. I will pay off this card and not use it anymore. Especially after calling and talking to 2 different reps who told me “unfortunately” there was nothing they could do to get me a lower rate. What!? Ridiculous. I guess if their goal is to get people to cancel their cards then congrats.

name: Sam Barr
review: My credit scores are Ex 655, Tu 626, Ef 670. I have.. countless cards. Never carry over 30% on any of them. No bankruptcies. No charge offs. I do have two medical bills I refuse to pay because I had insurance. They turned it into collections . Other than that. Nothing bad. But I had a $500 credit limit on my Amazon. Used it a lot, paid it off every couple months. Out of the blue they lowered me to $100. At the time I had $90 outstanding on the card. I paid it in full and won’t touch it again. That’s the only card that has ever done that to me. I dont care if they close it. I figure if we stop using he companies that do this they will stop doing this. This whole credit score thing is bullshit. I make 98k a year, I do have a lot of student loans but I pay them. Who makes up this BS?… read more

name: donnatorelli
review: I made a purchase on Amazon using my rewards dollars.  I paid 5.99 for next day delivery. It never came for the next 2 days. I called Amazon they sent me an email saying 4 cents will go back to my credit card and 5.95 will go back into my Amazon rewards to use on another purchase. 3 weeks later no refund back. Called Chase 3 times and spent about an hour each time on the phone. The last time the supervisor said I have to contact a special department because they showed it refunded. That’s just terrible customer service.  Their mistake so me the customer has to do all the foot work.  I said if it’s refunded then why can’t I see it.  That was over two weeks ago.  I’m ready to close out my credit card and just use my Bank of America credit card and earn my points on that one. I believe it has better earning power anyways.Amazon uses Chase for their credit service and neither company knows how to refund their reward dollars back into the Amazon rewards bank so you have immediate access to it to use for another purchase.

name: keithe_22
review: Do not get this card just want to let you know I like Amazon and shopping on your site, but after applying for the Amazon credit card by Chase bank getting approved. Then a week later finding out they just closed the account without warning. Makes me think Amazon needs to consider using a different bank for that kind of service as Chase was very unhelpful with why it got canceled and in addition now has tarnished my good credit by bringing my score down. This happened to me and another family member we have excellent credit and pay our bills on time and they go ahead and do this.  Chase is a terrible Bank and their customer service is terrible.

name: Sherry  Benjamin
review: Walmart MasterCard did the same thing to me

name: Sherry Britton-Susino
review: My son had a college account that was linked to may account.  My son had his student loan money direct deposited into his account.  Chase said that I owe them money--not my son owes them money.  They took all of his student loan money and used it to pay my bill.  This left him stranded all the way across the country with no money.  They took every last dollar out of his account.  He has no money to pay for his books or any other college related expenses.  He is failing his classes now.  I sent him all the money I have.  I told them it was clearly his student loan money.  They can see where the money came from.  They refuse to give him back his money until I have completely paid the bill I owe--which i do not have the money to do otherwise it would have been paid in the first place.  It really sucks that they took his student loan money and he is failing his classes due to something that has nothing to do with him.  I always thought it was illegal to use student loan money for anything other than educational expenses, but chase says that it is legal for them to use my son's student loan money to pay a bill they claim I owe.  3 hours on the phone with chase got me nowhere except they hung up on me 3 times and no I did not swear at them.

name: cellooch15
review: Why do I need to maintain $1,200? That\'s a rediculous amount!  I can understand 50 but not $1,200. I\'ve been account holder at Chase and already want to close both accounts because of it.  I\'m unable to keep that much in there, it\'s almost like you have to be rich for it to work out.

name: Josh Wallace
review: Or have direct deposits totaling at least $500 a month.

name: Michael Shilcrat
review: do you not know how to read? total checking requires either that or $500.00 in direct deposit a month. Its your own fault if you dont read!!!

name: jdubzz71
review: please don't be mean to @cellooch15!'

name: Robert Spengler
review: The benefits really are easy to use and make this basically a $150 card. The priority pass alone will offset most of your fee if you travel at all no matter which airline you use. I use Southwest most of the time but the food credit of $28 a person at the restaurants they offer in various airports add up quickly.

name: nic christie
review: First..your group is way off on Slate..You state my chances are very good..not true..Chase turned me down this day. Lost points on the hard pull. Everyone listen up..you will not get cards based on a high fico..each company has their own playbook.

name: Still Learning
review: This is also one of my frequent users, love the 5% and choices to use points for, They have been a good bank to deal with as far as my 2 accounts go, the problems are their policies on CLI and APR reductions that is where Chase fall behind AMEX and Discover...A few changes could be winners for them.....I did have the pleasure of dealing with the fraud dept on this card as someone use it to order tickets,,I had to deal with them 3 times to get them to realize it wasn\'t my useage... They cleared it up and we went back to being friends....lolAs far as the freedom card goes I do love it and recommend it to others....

name: Still Learning
review: Love the Sapphire was great for dining and travel I liked it when it was one APR. instead of the range thing,but times change and even though they have discontinued this one I still use it and carry it,, interesting to see how much more they downgrade the benefits to the point of either upgrading to preferred or letting it go remains to be seen, I really like it back when I got it.. I hope it doesn't get destroyed completely....

name: Still Learning
review: My experience with Chase for last 4-5yrs has been pretty good. They've been friendly and helpful on questions I've had. I've had no problems with accounts but if anything they could improve upon it would be the way they are with APR. rates, pretty much whatever you get @ approval you're stuck with until you close and open a new one,,this is silly, and hard check CLI's  is another unnecessary hoop I think customers could do w/o. As far as the products I like the 2 cards I have w/ them and plan to keep them.**Dec 2019 UPDATE- Surprise Christmas present as Chase gave me a 5K CLI 2 days after statement cut, I was very shocked and thankful as this is my only CLI w/ them...

name: Tan Le
review: After spending more than $2,000 in my first month of having my credit card account open, I never received my $150 bonus for spending more than $500 in my first 3 months of account opening. I called Chase and they tell me that the $150 sign-up bonus was not part of my credit card. The $150 sign-up bonus was a big incentive for me to sign up for Chase Freedom Unlimited and I was not eligible for it. Very disappointing.

name: Michael Shilcrat
review: " have not received a new cardmember bonus for this card in the past 24 months." clearly posted and that clearly would be the case so your complaining is not valid!!!!

name: Logan Kincaid
review: WARNING!!! DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS CARD!! THEY DO NOT HONOR THE AGREEMENT. If you are like me you will find out after your credit has been pulled, and after you have met (you think) the spending requirement that there are many broad categories of purchases that are included toward meeting the spending requirement. In my experience the Chase customer service team was very rude and dismissive.

name: robert_p2
review: Terrible Customer Service.  My wife and I charge between 5,000 - 8,000 / month using our Chase Marriott Rewards Card.  For this, we get charged a credit rate of over 17% and hit with an annual fee.  Bye Bye Marriott.  After trying to get an adjustment in our interest rate to match my Bank Of America travel rewards card, I found Chase could care less.   Now my spending on the card is around $200 / month and will be zero when I remove two recurring charges and transfer to BoA.   Having dealt with Chase before, I should have known what to expect.  Too bad, as Marriott is a fine brand and one I would welcome earning rewards points with but their card partner is the worst.

name: mannotw
review: This review is based on the absolute inability to get a live human when I needed assistance setting up autopay.  The robotic phone system kept me going in circles, and I\'m still not sure I accomplished what I set out to do.  Chase wants to save money, but if I have to run to a branch office every time I need to talk to a human being, it\'s going to get old fast.  Unless this service improves, I may look elsewhere for my business CC needs.

name: Liz Marquez
review: *** BEWARE OF UNITED MILEAGE PLUS CARD ***Paid with my United Mileage Plus Explorer Credit Card for kitchen and bathrooms cabinets to Kitchen Classics in Pleasant Hill, California, a company who after a few months of false promises didn't deliver the cabinets and closed for business.  After notifying United Mileage Plus Card about the closure and the fact that numerous customers have been defrauded, I requested a refund but this card declined my request and doesn't want to reimburse several thousand dollars I had paid them.  BEWARE, United Mileage Plus Credit Card will not stand behind it's customers and couldn't care less about consumer protection

name: jplav21
review: I have had this card for a couple of years. I initially loved the card and used the anniversary night certificate which is a great bonus. However, late in 2017 Marriott reviewed their hotel categories causing virtually all hotels in cities to become higher categories. This means that you CANNOT get a category 5 hotel in any popular city anymore (your free night is only good for category 1 to 5). That is a real downer and I am now considering closing the account.

name: Robert Barnes
review: I applied because credit sesame said my approval odds were gd and was turned down but recently was,approved for a house and have another card that stays paid immediately.don't waste your time going by a site like credit sesame use credit karma before they ruin someone else's hard work to get ahead

name: Long Dinh
review: I bought many things from Amazon using this card. My building caught on fire and those items have gone. I want to file claims using the purchase protection function of the card. The only allow a maximum $500 per claim and they only allow 1 claim per incidence. Basically, they only allow $500 claim PER INCIDENCE. That's just not enough in my case when I had many things got burned during the fire. They said the maximum amount of claim is $50,000 per account. Therefore, are they assuming that a customer will have 100 incidences during the lifetime of the account and it's crazy. I like Chase credit card but I would say it's a very bad way to mislead the customers about the purchase protection benefits.

name: lemke202
review: Numerous reviews littered with complaints about this card. Some may be valid but here's why most complaints should be ignored. I have had this card for 3 years. I have a $35K limit. My CS is 775. My high balance on it has been $19.7K. In 2016, I charged over $75K on the card and paid ZERO INTEREST. In 2017, I charged over $110K and paid ZERO INTEREST. In 2016, Chase paid ME just under $2K to use their card. In 2017, Chase paid ME well over $2K again in rewards/money. So over the last two years, I have charged just under $200K and have not paid a single dime in interest! Moreover, Chase has paid me thousands to use their card! How? Simple! I PAY MY BALANCE OFF EVERY MONTH! And that's the best part. You get 5% rewards on Amazon which is AWESOME. And you get PAID to use the card IF you pay it off every month! Note: Customer service for me has been excellent.

name: alikatz79
review: Sorry, I do not believe you. I paid my card off each time I used it too and I NEVER had your experience! I am very responsible with my credit and own my own home and also have loans for schooling. This card has never done anything to help my credit and they have never been as helpful as your review states. But Hey, if you like it good for you and enjoy! We'll be here when you receive your kick in the credit score like we did!

name: Quincia Berry
review: Pretty reliable bank, better than checking account, but love the rewards and the credit limit updates. Credit reporting could be better which is why i didnt give perfect 5, but i guess between credit bureaus and banks, communication can be better*

name: David Reynolds
review: We have had this card for 2 years now. I am still paying for trips a year and a half ago! The interest alone is killing us. I make $400.00 a month payments. Double the payment amount and I see that I am still at $15,000 a almost two years later! So, $267.98 goes to interest. $132.02 goes to the balance. Interest is applied to the membership few, and with the annual cost of $95.00 IM DONE! I tap out! This last summer me and my wife paid cash for our trip and it was so nice to not come home with HIGH scamming BILLS waiting! Chase is a scam. A bunch of extortionists!! You can pay for your whole trip by cash and use your debit card to rent cars hotel, and flight tickets. Hold onto your money and run away from these credit card companies!

name: User Name
review: Scam alert!The referral program for this card is a scam.I referred two friends to signup for this card, and over the course of a year I've contacted Chase numerous times in a failed attempt to have them issue me the promised referral bonus. In my final contact with them today, after putting me off for so long, they said too much time has passed and they could no longer issue the referral, despite it being their fault that so much time has passed!Avoid like the plague.

name: jaime E hernandez sr
review: great credit card if you use it in usa only ,they charge3 person use it out side the usa i like the 150 i got back .n olso the rewards that goes with this card.only i dont like the 3 percent out side the use when i travel.i have a onether one for that purchase now

name: Lynda
review: Terrible dealing with then have a credit score of 750 they said   I had to many cards I wish I never had applied for card wallethub recommended it I travel a lot would never give chase my business

name: iluvs0sjc
review: Worst customer service in the world! Someone stole my card and I closed the account immediately and opened a fraud investigation. 6 months later I'm still getting billed for the stolen charges and late charges!!! Now they are telling me the investigation is closed and I have to pay $600. DO NOT GET THIS CARD. Better to take your business elsewhere, where they know how to treat you.

name: Beelat Kahang
review: On the Chase reserve online wesbite - Trip cancellation/Trip interruption insurance states that "If your trip is cancelled or cut short by sickness, severe weather and other covered situations, you can be reimbursed up to $10,000 per trip for your pre-paid, non-refundable travel expenses, including passenger fares, tours, and hotels." Even with the valid documentation including signed physician reports, Chase eclaimsline.com - did not honor what they advertised. They denied the claims and refused to honor what they initially promise they would cover.  It is totally not worth paying an annual fee for.  Even if you have excellent credit, the APR is one of the worst.    It was only exciting in the beginning with all the perks and advantage they claim to offer plus the sign up rewards.  Once you put the card to the test, you get nothing they promise!  Even the Global entry/TSA pre-check was not reimbursed.   Total Scam!

name: Jane John
review: AGREE - - I've had such trouble with the travel support through Chase Sapphire Reserve that I found myself looking up on the internet if the card IS a scam! Completely serious - I had to find out if I was the only one who was getting NOWHERE with travel plans on their website and with their customer service reps - - AWFUL - - I hope this message is read by SOMEONE at Chase who cares!

name: facetsjd
review: READ YOUR PAYMENT CONDITIONS!!For a year, I loved my Chase Amazon CC.  It was so easy to have thecash back applied to my Amazon orders.  Then I really wanted something that I knew would give me an account balance I wouldn't be able to pay off for a couple of months.  I felt it was worth it, especially with the cash back.  I had more difficulty paying down the balance to zero for several months, so I read the terms on my statement and found this:  "Calculation of Balance Subject to Interest Rate:  To figure your periodic interest charges for each billing cycle when daily periodic rate(s) applies, we us the daily balance method (including new transactions). !!!!!  Who does that???  When I thought I was paying interest on $400, I was paying interest on $1000.  Their seemingly low interest rate is not so low.  This card only works if you plan to pay it off every month.

name: Gera B
review: Service is poor.  The points is a good feature however the service is so bad that is not worth it. Dispute department terrible (used twice) and the benefit center even worst, they take months to resolve a claim.  ANY debit card with no min balance has much better service. I filed one trip interruption claim and Citi solved my case in only 4 days after I presented all  paperwork required and it has been two months and no response from their benefit center, I keep calling and they say they are still reviewing.  I opened a dispute with a purchase in internet for a hotel reservation I canceled back in April, we are October and they are still reviewing???  Service is the WORST. i rather stick with Citi. Yes, I have a lot of points but more $ spent thinking their benefit coverage was protecting me. Definitely canceling is not worth it and It is very frustrating deal with them.

name: Angela Ervin
review: High decline rate when you try to make large purchases and slow inefficient customer service. Had to call them twice because even though they said they would okay it when I tried again it was still blocked!

name: dlmoffitt1
review: I charged a Disney $300 hotel deposit to this card.  We were not sure we were going on the trip so I only paid $100 on the current statement.  We did go on the trip the next month and I charged $1,100+.  When I received my statement I was charged 14% interest on the $1,100 current charges.  They call this "residual" interest because i didn't pay off the last statement completely.  I can understand charging interest on the previous balance of $200, but NOT on the current charges which I intended to pay off as soon as I received the new statement.  Regardless if all credit card companies practice this, I am cancelling the Disney card and I will be sure to watch that "residual" interest on any future trips on my other credit cards, although I never saw this type of charge in the past.  Can't figure out why Disney/Chase feels they are OWED interest money for current charges.  No courtesy credit for being with Disney/Chase for 10+ years either..

name: Anonymous Anonymous
review: I'm 60 years old, so I've been through many banks and credit unions. CHASE is a no-nonsense bank with accounts that pay low interest and will sock you with high monthly fees unless you follow the rules. It is a bank for everyday transactions-pay in, bills out. If you want to earn 10%+ on your deposits, look elsewhere. 11 years ago I had to break a 6-month term CD with them (for a mortgage deposit)-they charged me the full $3k penalty; I complained loudly but there was no exception, no nonsense. Without parallel, CHASE is the best walk-in brick'n'mortar bank I have recently used. Like Citizens Bank, Santander, BoA, and others, it has great sign-up promos-use them (have to keep the a/cs open for 6 months). In the 3 times I have signed up with CHASE in VA, IL, and CA, it was with very knowlegable and competent female reps. I've had no problem with the CHASE online services, including QuickPay, and currently have my pay direct-deposited and use their online bill pay. There are no brick branches here in south NJ, so I drove 40 minutes up to Trenton for some counter checks and then to close the CHASE accounts. On this Saturday morning, the branch manager, Chelsie Medina, was quietly and efficiently processing the Spanish-speaking and English-speaking customers on a first-come basis. It was impressive to watch. When my turn came, she helped me out quickly without needless small talk and suggested a cheaper money ordaer alternative for one amount. She also indicated that south NJ would get a branch at Cherry Hill in a few months time. Because of this news, and her impressive efficiency, I am holding back shutting down my CHASE accounts and moving my (working) $20k balance elsewhere. CHASE, thank you for your service over many years.

name: David Oxmix
review: My application was accepted and I was issued a credit card. I though the application process went smoothly, but two weeks later they looked at my Experian report and decided I didn't have enough personal credit history (most of my previous credit was jointly held with my wife who passed away recently). Even though they had my telephone number, email address, and could instant message me through the app/website, they chose to simply close my account without notifying me. I found out the account was closed after my kids and I ate a meal at a restaurant and I couldn't pay for it with my credit card. It took multiple messages and calls to their customer support department before they would even explain why the account was closed (I assumed it was an error or something up until that point). Customer service was rude and evasive every single time I talked to them.I closed my checking account with Chase before this because they were terrible, but I really wanted an Amazon card because I love Amazon. I have learned my lesson that everything Chase touches is awful.

name: alikatz79
review: " I have learned my lesson that everything Chase touches is awful." is perfectly stated!!

name: roberge
review: Do not get this card if you are in Canada. Getting statements is unreliable and Chase is a terrible bank to deal with if you are Canadian.  I so loved the idea but the execution is terrible.  I wish amazon Canada had a deal with a Canadian bank.

name: JELENA P
review: The sign up bonus is great but you get screwed when trying to redeem points for travel. I have not once had an easy time booking anything through the rewards site. Either the price is much higher then other sites, the price increases as I'm booking, or what I'm booking is all the sudden not available. I like that I earn points a bit quicker then my other cards but when you can't use them, it's not worth it. Don't waist you time with this card. I also have capital one venture and I would recommend them 100% over this card.

name: Thomas H
review: Venture over CSP ? Dam must really hate Chase

name: Anonymous
review: The card is nice and the sign up bonus is great, but don't expect them to have your back.  If I'm paying $450 a year for a card I expect them to have my back against certain things.  This is not the case with this card.  I rented a car in advance in Costa Rica.  When I got there the pushy sales man basically forced me to aquire their car insurance, even thought I told him my Sapphire covered it.  After about 2 hours there of arguing and asking for higher ups  I was forced to sign because he would not release the car without me taking the insurance.  I figured  I'll pay with my card and dispute this forced transaction, well I was wrong.  Chase denied my claim even with all the evidence I had to prove otherwise.  Yes I could have walked away lost the money for the car rental and ruined my vacation, but I have a high end card and expected much better treatment.  Chase has lost my business.  I will continue to use American express instead.

name: charles tunis
review: It's a good card to have. The only negative is having to deal with Chase bank, especially when opening the card. ChaseBank is a bureaucratic nightmare. As long as you don't have any problems with the card, and don't have to deal with Chase, you'll be fine

name: Anonymous
review: Chase stole my money...I deposited funds into a chase ATM and the machine malfunctioned. Upon filing a claim with their claims department, they denied my claim stating that they were not able to locate the funds... even with providing video footage from their ATM and CCTV from me depositing funds into the ATM they are finding me responsible for their machine malfunction and their teams incapability of locating my funds...I will never be banking with chase again and recommend that you do not as well

name: Al Jan
review: I applied for the card because of a $40 incentive on an Amazon purchase.  As soon as I received the card I set it up for auto pay of entire balance due on due date.  Later I found that I was charged a $25 late fee plus interest for a missed payment.  When I called about this I was told that it takes one billing cycle for the auto pay to be effective!  Outrageous!

name: Araceli Miguel
review: I just received my denial letter and when I called to see why I was denied when I have a credit score of 750. I was told by the rep that I only have personal loan credit but no credit card credit. I have not wanted to get a credit card but now that I do they will not give me one because I don't have credit card credit haha.

name: mohakhan king
review: Chase is very smart when it comes to the balance transfer. when you apply for new slate card they won't be sending any checks otherwise you will do a balance transfer. Even though chase slate says 60 days 0% transfer + 0% APR blah blah,they try their best not to issue full limit of 15000$ in BT. in order to use whole 15k use first need to have upto 17-18k they say only 95% amount they will allow the customers to use. I have 13800 limit so I had to transfer my credit from another chase freedom to chase Slate. Let's say somehow you got 17-18k on chase slate. then they will allow only upto 15k BT with 0 fee. once you request them it will take forever they do take 10-15 days and they send manual checks to your xyz(other institution say BOA), they won't do electronic payments to your other cards from other institutions. this process is very time consuming and the end card may get interest charge if you have less time.such a hassle to just use the promotion.

name: shariar G rahimi
review: Excellent card for those with decent credit score level, it is brilliantly made rewards & support.

name: claude setzer
review: Disney credit card is a complete fraud. They never gave me the promised $200 reward and took almost 90 days to get me my card, which came with a $65 charge and penalty for not paying the bill they had not sent me. They refuse to cancel card and refund my charge, then billed me $49 again after one year. Never gave $200 reward promised. Basically manager told me their policy is to give 30 days to reverse charges, then they "have me." Even though they took 90 days to notify me of the charges. Had similar experience with Disney Cruise lines, in which they repeatedly tried to trick me into paying fraudulent charges, at least they returned them when i complained, but still very bad experience. Feel sorry for poor Walt Disney turning in his grave for current graft and corruption in his company.

name: donnawood31
review: It is very difficult to obtain and use most of the benefits. I had to call 5 times to get a agent you understood that I wanted the Ritz Carlton Club level access. There reimbursement for emergency dental or medical coverage is a joke at best. Get ready to spend hours getting the documentation needed to get the expense covered, after submitting many pages to verify the emergency, finally it goes to a reviewer who does not use any standard medical criteria to determine if it is emergency or not.  I chipped a front tooth on day 1 of a 14 day business trip and it is not worth the time it takes to get reimbursed. The reviewer is paid to deny your claim,

name: Zoe Caldwell
review: Can't use the free night.  So while they tell you when you renew at $49 that that entitles you to a free night anywhere, anytime, it does not!!  It only works if the hotel where you want to book as not given their nightly allotment of free nights.  I wanted to used it in August in Yellowstone, and there are no free nights for the whole month.  I will not renew next year.

name: Britany Long
review: so far i have no complaints! 0% balance transfer is great!

name: Theo  frank
review: How's customer service?

name: Nora Anaya
review: Don use this card, I was hesitant to use, but unfurtunate I did, Some crook got a hold of my card # and spent $108.49, after a week calling and they having the knowledge it was a fraudulent charge, Chase refuses a credit in my account, I will never use this card again is going to the garbage, dont want bussines with a bank this lazy and dishonest....even knowing the source of the false transaction...I do not recomend it at all, if you have one card like this get rid of it ASAP.

name: Yelena Gordiyenko
review: I've had a Chase checking account for many years, and in the last 2 years I've also had a Chase savings account, which I'm planning to cancel. My chief complaint against their savings account is the unreasonably high ($10) penalty fee I have to pay each time my account balance falls under $300. This is very inconvenient for me since I use my savings account primarily as a short-term emergency fund kind of account, and so I end up withdrawing from it regularly. I put my real long-term savings in a money market account. I've decided to cancel my Chase savings account and to instead open a high-yield savings account from Sallie Mae, with whom I already have my money market account. This will save me a a ton of money in fees, and I'll even earn a few dollars every month.

name: Eric Hutcheson
review: Don't bother applying for Chase Liquid if you have any negative reports in your  Chex systems file. Chase runs a Chex file review for it's prepaid card unlike other prepaid cards. You also have to go into a branch to apply which is inconvenient.

name: Tyrions  always SR
review: I give it a thumbs up to this one

name: imedjoanna
review: This card is a rip off. The companion complementary "free" ticket is a fiction. The sits are never available and if they somehow are you pay way more in the fees and taxes than for a regular airline ticket. I was using it for hotels, but got ripped off for $800.- I booked a hotel partially with Avios and my card, but had to leave the hotel two days sooner for a documented medical emergency. The hotel would refund me on spot, but could not, because I used this British Airways Avios "reward" program. They referred me back to the card customer relations unit, which did nothing to refund me neither in avios nor cash. I got simply penalized for using this card and lost not only vacation, but money.

name: patrobinson653
review: I give it a thumbs up

name: Tyrions  always SR
review: I give it a thumbs up too

name: Suzanne G
review: I have no problems banking with Chase.  They have a functional mobile app, online banking, mobile deposits, and deposit-friendly ATMs.  Most importantly, Chase is found in most parts of the US, so there's not a problem when I'm traveling and need a fee-free Chase ATM.  I have yet to understand why people provide low ratings/reviews because Chase charged them an overdraft fee.  This is the norm for ALL banks in the US.  This isn't anything new.  Big national banks, small local banks, and credit unions all charge various fees like this.  Yes these fees can seem unfair at times, but if you make the decision to use a financial institution to hold your money, then both parties (you and the bank) are expected to the follow the agreed upon terms and conditions.Also, just a bit of advice for the ones that do not have direct deposit and/or can't financially maintain $1500 daily balance per month to avoid Chase's $12 monthly maintenance fee, I would suggest you find a local bank or credit union that typically has a free checking account with no minimum balance.  You could also try an online bank if you do not regularly deposit cash.  You may lose the convenience of having a Chase ATM or branch almost on every corner, but I'm sure will save more money in the long run by getting a totally free checking with a local bank or credit union.Overall, I hate to see people bash Chase because they can't seem to have a handle on their finances to avoid the many fees that are disclosed in writing upon opening your account, as well as publicly posted on Chase's website.  This actually goes for pretty much all banks and financial institutions.  Ultimately, it's all business...  And yes, I have been charged overdraft fees in the past, and I also incurred those fees due to not properly tracking my finances and spending.  Not once did I blame the bank for my lack of monitoring/planning.  I now am simply more responsible and monitor my finances to prevent the banks from making money off of me.

name: HOWARD PAUL SHORE
review: I Just Received Great, Outstanding Service From Johana Gabriel!Back on Thursday, September 8, 2016, I was out in the Long Beach area and needed to get to a bank and luckily just by using my google app, I was able to find the closest branch to where I was which was just a few short blocks away located at:  940 Long Beach Boulevard, Long Beach, California  90813-4420  (562) 951-1315.I was received and greeted by Johana Gabriel who is a Qualified Personal Banker who took really good care of ME as her customer by sitting me down at her desk and taking my banking deposit as well as helping me to get verified for the United Airlines Mileage Plus Credit Card which operates under the Chase Bank and helping me to find out about getting my Credit Line Increase for the Chase Freedom Unlimited Card, including setting up my Chase Freedom Unlimited Card to be able to debit my checking account in order to pay the bill in full each and every month so that I am Never Late In Making A Payment.All of the work and tasks performed by Johana Gabriel were done with patience, kindness, diligence, respect and I was Not Feeling Rushed, nor Pressured as well.I more than Highly Recommend Johana Gabriel to anyone seeking out Only The Best In Chase Banking Services.Thank you very much Johana Gabriel for your time that You had spent with me on that day!Sincerely yours,Howard Paul ShoreLoyal Chase Bank Customer For Over 10 Years/HPS

name: dvelazquez07_88
review: I recently opened my chase bank account, and I must say that it was a breeze. The person who assisted me in the process was so polite and friendly. She made an effort to get to know me and some of my interest which is an obvious plus! That was not what set a great impression though, as I sat there with her, I noticed how many customers walked in, I would say about 6 customers walked into the bank during my visit and she greeted them all with a smile and by name. She knew every single one! If she in anyway is a representation of how Chase works let me tell you she set the bar High!

name: Gary Rokuta
review: I already for 20 yrs plus have been using  chase visa credit card. They're okay but today, I got inconsistent information from yesterday and today. So I don't have to go looking for the best credit card services, maybe somebody can tip me off. I have excellent credit.  I want to change my primary credit card. When I have the time, I will. Chase customer service and fraud operations wasted too much of me and my golden retriever's time 2 days consecutive. I don't have that kind of time to listen to BS.DISCREPANCIES, inconsistencies. ...

name: thomas  friedman
review: Did you get this sorted out?

name: Michael
review: Discover my friend!! I have only had them for a yr. and they give consistent credit increases without question!

name: Debra Floyd
review: It all sounds great to me

name: Michael Palethorpe
review: Don't use this card. Amazon/Chase are only interested in taking care of merchants, not customers.I charge 1/2 of a large transaction to my amazon/chase credit card and 1/2 to my USAA credit card. After the merchant didn't deliver on the services I asked for, I disputed the charges with both credit card companies.Chase/Amazon didn't refund my money, even after 3-4 attempts to provide them with my point of view and documents that proved the merchant was in the wrong.USAA refunded my money, no questions asked.Conclusion...don' use Chase credit cards or banking. USAA is the best bank, credit card and insurance company I have ever worked with.Needless to say I cancelled my Amazon/Chase credit card after they refused to refund my money on a fraudulent charge.

name: Mike Carter
review: I like chase platinum visa because it is a good card and i have been using it for a while now.It really help me to fix my credit and to get loans when i need them at times.I choose this bank because my mother use it and so do my sister,they been using chase bank for about 5 years and they never had a problem with then so i decide to give it a try.I highly recommend chase bank credit cards and chase bank.

name: Greg Minerowicz
review: They give me a high spending limit and it really comes in handy when I have to pay some bigger bills. The rewards are not always relevant to me but when it is the right quarter for benefits this can be a very useful card. I haven't had any problems with customer service and I will continue to use this card.

name: Leila McDowell
review: This card cost me over $60 after a merchant double billed me.  Unlike great cards like Discover, they would not take up the dispute because it was not posted in 60 days.  They made no effort, kept me on hold forever and basically said tough luck.  Discover on the other hand will take up a dispute anytime and make sure it is investigated without any bureaucracy or hesitancy.  I closed my United account.  The customer service was also horrible as they always kept me waiting for inordinate amounts of time

name: Daniel Laurie
review: What is the point of having miles and then you book a rewards flight upgrade only to be told at the gate you did not get the upgrade? This is a really terrible system. Flying with BA or Virgin if you book an upgrade you get it. I will be taking my business elsewhere it really is a waste of time.

name: Robert Castillo
review: I like this card, but the details of your rewards points(from Southwest; not from Chase) are not disclosed.  You will receive promo offers from Southwest from time to time(for example 2x rewards points if you buy from Home Depot or 3x points for purchases at Sears).  What this means is you will get 1 point from Chase for every dollar spent and extra points will come from Southwest. When you sign on to the Southwest web site to view the details of your RR points, it will only show total points per category(i.e. - retail, credit card, other) for that billing cycle.  In other words, you are trusting that you got all the bonus points you should have,  because that detail is never disclosed by Southwest.  You can't verify that you got all the points for your 2x,3x, etc.. purchases.

name: Shawn Snaples
review: I got this card for the no international transaction fee on international purchases.  However, the card is not capable of handling a PIN number which is practically required in many international countries.  What's the point of an "international" card that won't work internationally?  I'll be canceling it just before that $95 annual fee...

name: Anthony
review: Sounds like you just didn't have personal accountability within that regard

name: Mary Rowle
review: I got a Chase freedom card because I have been using the Chase bank for a few years now, and they are really easy to use. i get notifications when I have a low account balance, and I can withdraw a lot of money at one time. They pay my bills for me when I need them to, and I also do not have to worry about a whole lot of unnecessary fees or annual costs. The main thing that I do not like is that if my account goes into the negative and I do not pay it on the same day, I will be charged a late fee of 34 dollars. This is a lot of money to me, and I think that it is too much. If this fee were gone, or less, I would recommend this card to my friend, but since it is so much, it makes it difficult to use the card and like it. The customer service is always great, and it is very useful for the people who need and use the card.  It is designed well, and works well too.

name: Justin McGinnis
review: Nice sign up bonus and great ongoing rewards.  Nothing bad about this card when used properly.

name: Mary Meemards
review: I've been using the Ink Cash card from Chase for the last 2 years. The first year was great with 0% interest and the regular rate of 13.24% is very good compared to most cards. We use it for everyday purchases with our business and that usually works out to 25-40 purchases a month. This has been a good card for me so far with no problems at all.

name: johnp123
review: I love this credit card because it allows me to earn cash back rewards on all of my amazon purchases. I originally got this card because I shop on amazon so much and wanted a card that I could be rewarded for doing so. I also got the card because it gave an introductory offer with a certain amount off my first order. If I could improve anything, I would improve the customer service because when I have called to correct things I am put on hold quite often and have to wait a while for a representative. I would recommend this card to others because it is a good deal for getting cash back. Like I said earlier, I would make sure that the customer service is improved because it can be slow.

name: Eric
review: This credit card was my first credit card which I applied for in my life. I originally applied for it to start building credit at a young age and have had it for many years. I was approved for a generous limit initially that has since went up and would definitely recommend it to anybody looking to get their feet wet. Chase customer service is superb. I have lost my card and also had fraudulent charges placed on my account due to losing my information buying things on the internet and Chase was very quick to replace my card and freeze my account while they took care of the fraud charges. Overall I have had a great experience. If I could improve one thing it might be the rewards program. It is certainly not as good as some other cards out there but they do offer promotions where you get extra points buying certain categories of products like gas, groceries etc.

name: benjakimba
review: I got this card initially for the 80$ Amazon gift card that you received for signing up. I sat down and did the math on how much I spent on Amazon last year, and decided that with the rewards offered by this card it was worth putting all my amazon purchases on the Chase card and paying it off at the end of the month. In the past I never bought anything from amazon that I didn't have the money for on the spot, so I haven't built up a balance which has been nice not to worry about.

name: Devin
review: I got this card mainly for the flight perks. I travel a lot so it's nice to get perks for spending money toward flying. At 50,00 points for a $600 flight or so, it's basically a steal. The points towards food is also very generous at 1 point per $1. If I were to need it there's always 24 hour customer service waiting to till but it's rare for anything to actually happen. The rare time I needed to call service was quick and painless. There isn't really anything I would improve as it's feels like I'd be asking to much. It's a solid card and I'd recommend it to mostly anyone.

name: Nicole
review: I got this card because they were having a special bonus deal where you earn $200 back after you spend $500 in the first 3 months. Who doesn't want to be given $200 extra bucks?? I love the fact that I got to go 15 months without getting charged any APR, it seems like most credit cards only give you a year, so those three extra months was nice. They don't charge an annual fee, which is great. The only thing I can think of that could improve is giving more bonus categories that can earn you more money back. I've never had to use customer service for this card, but I would assume that it would be just fine. I've had no issues using this card and I would definitely recommend it to others, and already have!

name: Cass
review: I've had a great experience with Chase Freedom. I'm a frequent shopper and the cash back bonuses I can accrue are wonderful. They occasionally have higher cashback days/months, or with specific sites and many of them have been ones I already use. I find that its fees are easier to handle than with other cards I've used. Overall, I love the service and would recommended it to others seeking a credit card.

name: Maddie
review: I got the Amazon rewards credit card because I shop on Amazon.com a lot. I have never had a problem where I needed to contact the customer service in the two years I've had my card. The $50 gift card when signing up was nice and went through instantly without any problems. I would recommend this card to other people if you shop on Amazon often since the rewards points add up quickly.

name: Humner8080
review: The Chase Freedom credit card is one of the best cards out there in terms of rewards. Not only do you earn 1% cash back on ALL of your purchases, but there are also specific categories you can earn all the way up to 5% back on. The increased percentages are on purchase categories that are staples like groceries and gas so it's not some obscure things that have no practical use and just sound good to say. I've never seen another credit card that offers 5% cash back on ANYTHING! 5% back is really good, almost like an investment sort of. You are also eligible for some huge benefits by switching over to Chase Freedom like getting $150 back after spending $500+ the first three months of opening an account. This is the reason I switched over from my previous card to Chase Freedom. I've never personally had any issues with this card whatsoever so I can't speak to the efficacy of the customer service if and when problems arise, but being that Chase is a large well known bank I feel like I am in good hands in that regard. I most definitely recommend people switch over to the Chase Freedom card. The one thing I would change, if anything, is I wish there were ways to opt out of the smart chip. I don't trust smart chips.

name: KK Smith
review: I got this credit card because I fly across the country multiple times a year in order to visit family. I always choose Southwest, because I like the open seating policy, the fact that bags fly free, and the staff is always very nice and friendly! They are often also the cheapest airline option. This card allows me to earn miles for the things I purchase, and then use those miles to reduce my traveling costs. This is very convenient for me. The annual fee is low and well worth it.

name: Maddie
review: This is a very nice card if you are planning any sort of Disney trip. The rewards you get for Disney are nice. If you aren't planning on a Disney trip however, there are better cards with better rewards. The $50 statement credit after your first purchase is good, but you only get 1% back. There are better rewards out there, but if you plan on using the card at Disney locations, the bonuses might be worth it. These include 10% off dining at Disney world and Disney land.

name: freebird
review: I got this card because it offers a good cash back deal. You also have the option of getting points to purchase things on the the Amazon site. You get 3x the points for purchases made at Amazon, which is a really good deal for people who shop there a lot. It adds up to a big savings over time because you get free stuff on Amazon. There isn't much to improve except the APR is kind high, 15-22%. It doesn't effect me because I pay my balance every month. But if you carry a balance over time, the APR will wipe out the savings from the cash/points back. This is only a good deal if you pay off your balance every month. I would recommend it to anyone who pays their balance every month. If you don't, you are better off finding a card with a lower APR. I've used the customer service chat a few times and they were friendly and answered all my questions. I love this card!

name: R. Elite
review: I was drawn to this credit card when I was making a relatively large purchase on Amazon. The popup indicated I can receive $80 immediately off my purchase so I jumped on the deal. After looking into it a bit more in detail, I noticed that I receive a consistent 2% cashback on restaurants, gas stations and grocery stores. This was at least 100% better than my other card which was a flat 1%. I would love the occasional extra % cash back on valid retailers or perhaps more bonus cash back for spending a certain amount in a pay period. I would overall recommend this card to people who shop at Amazon very frequently as you do get 3% cashback on anything from Amazon. I haven't had to deal with customer service yet so I can't talk too much about it. Overall, I've never had any problems with Amazon. They have always had stellar service.

name: gman42
review: The biggest draw on this card is the 0% APR balance transfer for 15 months, which is one of the better offers you can get in the current climate. As for day-to-day use, it's fairly pedestrian, if you have anything with any kind of rewards program you'd be better off using them than this one. Was able to get my FICO score for free at one point which was nice; not sure if that's still offered. Only had to deal with customer service once (for waiving a late fee after paying two days late), and they were reasonably responsive and courteous.

name: Frank T
review: A bit over 3 years using my Chase Freedom card, and the bonus's/reward's have all been very pleasing and lived up to my initial expectations when choosing this credit card! The rate has stayed steady and acceptable, and the online services provided, really simplify everything, and create one less frustration for me to deal with every month!!

name: mefordogs
review: I have had a Chase SLATE card for several years now. They gave me a $1,200 limit. They've never raised (nor lowered!) my limit. I've been late here and there. They don't really hound you about being a bit late. Of course they charge fees for it. The interest rate is pretty high if you mess up and go late on it. The Customer Service is fine. The card is easy to pay online. I don't think they send payment reminders, at least I've never gotten one. Wish they would! I would recommend not having any credit cards to others - however, the Chase Slate isn't too bad if you must use credit. Just pay it off in full every month - so the interest doesn't eat you alive.

name: ralphie845
review: I got this card because I was just in the process of doing a balance transfer from a high interest Discover card. Absolutely no regrets! This card had a very easy and a very cheap transfer fee and it also provided some cool incentives with it's cashback rewards program. I also received the card very quickly after filling out the painless application. I've had the card for a couple of years now and it's still one of my go to cards!

name: Zack  Jarfas
review: You can request an APR reduction from Discover.

name: Josh Turner
review: Chase is usually a great company to do business with and this card proves that. Fees are low, and they gave me a nice bonus for signing up. I feel like the APR can be found better on some other cards, but I'm happy because of the customer service Chase provides and they don't seem to be hiding anything ever. Great service overall!

name: Princess
review: I have enjoyed this card from the very start of getting it. I've had it for four years and I use it sparingly now, but it used to be my daily card. The feature that most impresses me about the card are the bonuses. I really enjoyed the $500 bonus after the first three months of using the card. It really came in handy with my spending. This card is excepted virtually anywhere. I traveled with this card to many states and never had a problem. I would definitely recommend it to friends and family. Not only did I recommend it but I also added a family member for the $25 bonus that they offered for the first authorized user. I've only had to call customer service a few times that they were always very helpful and nice.

name: Tanzina A.
review: I got it automatically after being a member of Chase for almost 4 years. I like the card because although its simple, it gives decent rewards. I get 1% back automatically and every few months, it will give me 5% back based on changing categories. Best is when I get 5% back on Amazon, as I use Amazon.com constantly! They also raised my credit limit by $1,500 a few years back, which really helped me out a lot. Customer service is good and they caught thieves using my card before, refunded my money, and gave me a new card without me even realizing what happened! It's a good, basic card. Nothing fancy but very reliable.

name: Shiffy
review: I got the card because I wanted a credit card that gave me cash back. Amazon through in a bonus gift card and I often shop online at Amazon, so I figured they would be a good choice. The only thing I would improve is the online payment system. It can be a little annoying sometimes trying to pay until you get used to the site layout, but overall it's not bad. I would certainly recommend this card to others, especially if you use Amazon often. The cash back is higher if an item that is purchased is shipped from Amazon, so you're getting paid to shop! I've only had to contact customer service once, but they were nice and extremely helpful. They are one of the few places that I am not dreading if I have to call them!

name: Dawna P
review: As a frequent shopper of Amazon, I was intrigued by the Amazon credit card. The 3% back on Amazon purchases really caught my eye and I decided to go for it. It's been a great way to earn more back, rather than just getting 1% with my other rewards card. It also has 2% back on restaurants and 1% back on gas, but I don't really use it for that, as I get a higher percentage from another card. I don't really have any complaints. If I could improve anything, I would bump the 3% to 5% back to compete with the 5% I save with my Target debit card. Haven't had to deal much with customer service so I can't really comment on that. I would definitely recommend it to frequent shoppers of Amazon. I'm saving up my cash back to pay for my Prime renewal.

name: Happymouth
review: I started with the Chase Freedom card as it was recommended to me from my bank. It has a lot of advantages including 1% cash back on every single purchase. It also has multiple ways to earn higher cash back and bonuses with money spent. It has no annual fee and has smart chip technology making me feel more secure about my credit. I would definitely recommend this card to others. I've only had to deal with the customer service department once or twice but I remember their service being adequate. Not exceptional but nowhere near lacking either.

name: Daniel Fernandez
review: Any one had good luck when asking for the annual fee to be waived for the 2nd year?

name: Frank Thomas
review: A bit over 3 years using my Chase Freedom card, and the bonus's/reward's have all been very pleasing and lived up to my initial expectations when choosing this credit card!  The rate has stayed steady and acceptable, and the online services provided, really simplify everything, and create one less frustration for me to deal with every month!!

name: Rambo
review: I mainly got this card because I had planned on doing a lot of traveling and wanted to see what type of rewards I could earn while doing so. I would like to earn a bit more for each dollar spent. I think 3 miles would be fair. All of the fees are affordable and fair. I would recommend this card to anyone who likes to travel and spend money while doing so. If you like rewards I would recommend checking this card out. The customer service is great, I only had to use it while setting up the card, though.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: Some cashing check places offers prepaid reload cards not worth it . Get the liquid is fast convenience and 4.95 a month that's nothing and it's super convenient .

name: Caitlyn Werly
review: I live at  Grant. Al and i couldn't find the card any where. What do you advice?

name: jonny21
review: The Chase Freedom card is great.  I've had this credit card for several years and I never had an issue yet.  The customer service is good.  The credit card provides great bonus points where you can earn points on every dollar you spend.  Then you can use these points to get a gift card to Amazon or any other store.  If you do not want a gift card, you can choose to get money deposited into your bank account.  It's really nice because it's like bonus money.  Also, every few months they have special categories where you can earn extra points depending on where you shop.  It's really nice.  The web site is also top-notch.  They also have a great app you can use on your phone to check your balance.  It's very user-friendly.  I would highly recommend this card.  There is also no fee to have this card, so that's a huge advantage of this card over others.

name: Babygirl1901
review: The reason why I decided to get a Chase Freedom credit card was because of my dad. He has a Chase Business card for his business and he said they are a really great card. I really like the fact that this card has bonus incentives and also the APR is 0% for the first 15 months. It is hard to find a card like this nowadays. I think the only thing I would improve on is the cash advance fee. I realize that it is 5%, but when you need cash in a hurry it really seems to add up. I am very impressed with Chase customer service. They seem to be very friendly and helpful. I never have an issue when I have to reach out to them. I would definitely have to recommend this card to anyone who is looking to get a low APR card. It is really great!

name: Laura Lemons
review: Have had a  great experience with this credit card. Got a nice sign up bonus after spending over $500. Fees are not high, interest wasnt crazy. I have had bad experiences with a lot of cards but havent discovered any sneakiness with this card

name: Perfect card
review: This was the first credit card I ever signed up for, and I feel it was a perfect first choice. This is a fantastic cash back rewards card. This card offers 1% cash back for every purchase made on the card, no matter what. However, there are also categories that qualify for 5% cash back that change every quarter, and these categories are usually something very general that just about everyone qualifies for, such as gas, Amazon, grocery shopping, or Starbucks. Cashing in rewards is easy, too. Every 100 points is worth $1, and you can cash out to a bank account of your choice or receive a check in the mail.

name: workingworker
review: I got this card because it was a little easier to qualify for when I started building my credit. I would like this card more if it offered some rewards for continued use but the positives outweigh the negatives. Overall this is still a great card that I would recommend to others because it has no annual fee, a long grace period, and no balance transfer fee. The customer service has been good, they are helpful and informative when I have questions and I've had no issues.

name: thousandarms
review: I got my card because I am a regular shopper at Amazon.com and wanted a card that would give me rewards for using it. Amazon.com's Chase Visa credit card fits the bill. It gives me 3 points for every $1 I spend on Amazon.com, 2 points on every $1 I spend in drugstores and restaurants, and 1 point for every $1 on any other purchase I make. 100 points equals $1.00, and I can use the points on future Amazon.com purchases or redeem for a cash reward, which is really nice. The only thing I wished it also does is give me 2 points for every $1 I spend at a grocery store, instead of the 1 point I am getting right now. I would definitely recommend this card to regular shoppers on Amazon.com. That's not much I can say about the customer service because I have never had issues with the card and thus have never contacted their customer service support before.

name: LJ Decker
review: I signed up for this card based on a 50,000 mile offer if I spent $3,000 within the first three months.  To my surprise I got a letter after already nearing that limit in the first month (I have five kids) which stated that I was not eligible for the promotion.The very promotion that enticed me to sign up for the card.  This is known as fraud.  I was fraudulently induced into signing up for a credit card, which I then set up for all my auto bill pays and such.  I would not have signed up for this card absent the bonus, so I cancelled it today after the customer service rep (in a fairly rude fashion) told me there was nothing he could do.

name: cfl
review: I just got it because I needed a credit card, it's been so long I can't really remember more. They do have some cash back offers which are good. Overall I'm not pleased though because the rate is so high (29.9%.) After having the card for years, I called them with a credit score of 810 and minimal balance, and they refused to lower the interest rate. To me this is an example of how credit card companies take advantage of consumers. Other than this, I haven't had any specific problems with it.

name: Anna Quan
review: We used Chase points to rent a car through the Chase travel website, for which they tout primary rental car insurance as a benefit. Then they came through! Chase sapphire actually covered us for a >$4700 charge from a rental car accident (not our fault). Our accident was in England, but Chase still covered it.  Chase card services were quick with communication, and although it took a little while to sort, they paid us back within 3 weeks of the charge to our credit card. It's miraculous to me that a credit card company actually stood behind one of their insurance benefit claims.  Chase was already my favorite card, but now I'm their biggest fan. Thanks, Chase!!

name: DrPhill77
review: I absolutely love this card. While it might not be the best there is their customer service absolutely makes up for it. I had my wallet stolen without noticing and somebody started going off on a spending binge and Chase put a stop to it before I even realized my wallet was missing. A CSR called me up and informed me off it and told me that their system noticed an unusual spending pattern and they locked it down. After I told them my card was indeed missing they went ahead and cancelled that card and got me set up with a replacement. At no point did they make me feel guilty like so many companies do. They realized I'm human, I make mistakes and that I wasn't at fault for this and treated me like the valued customer I personally feel like I should be treated as!

name: Melissa
review: I initially got the card because Chase was doing a promotion that I would get a $300 credit if I spent $1000 in 3 months. This seemed like an absolute deal since its essentially $300 for free. Now that I've used it for the past 3 years, I would love to see the quarterly 5% cash back items stay on more useful topics (i.e. restaurants and grocery stores). When I get 5% cash back only at stores I don't shop at, I feel jipped and look towards my other cards instead. Overall, I would definitely recommend this card to my friends. The occasional 5% is great and the 1% cash back on all things is standard but a nice touch regardless. The few times that I had to contact customer support, my call was always answered within 10 minutes and I got everything resolved very fast.

name: Ann Girad
review: Chase will charge you interest on the membership fee just after they post it to your account and that is during your billing cycle! so FEES on FEES! disguised scam, and I am sure they put it in the tiny lines nobody reads.

name: UKWildcatsFan
review: I'm actually a pretty big fan of rewards cards now. Being able to actually have one in my name is a reward in and of itself, for completing the process of pulling myself out of a deep credit hole.
