I chose the Chase Freedom card after a lot of deliberation and found that it offered the best array of rewards and, as someone who uses my credit card to build my credit more than to buy things I can't afford, I found myself enjoying my bonuses rather rapidly and the cash back options kind of pour in as a result. I've never really had any trouble using the card, paying the bill online, etc. A positive experience all in all, and definitely worth considering if you're in the market for a rewards credit card.

name: Juan P Ochoa
review: No rewards at all, but it has one of the lowest APR available (~10%) and it sends out 0% APR balance transfer checks frequently.The lack of an annual fee makes it useful to have in the drawer in case you do have to roll a balance for some reason and don't feel like paying 20-25% as with a regular card. That said, I do not recommend carrying balances on credit cards ever. It should be a measure of last resort.

name: Juan P Ochoa
review: One of the best in class for rotating categories. Highly comparable to the Discover it, but because it is on the Visa network it's accepted everywhere.The card usually comes with very good cash bonuses and 0% intro APR.The account can be managed along with other Chase products in one single website.No annual fee makes it a good candidate to add to your credit card portfolio.Not good for traveling due to their 3% foreign transaction fee.Discover and Capital One products offer better customer service.

name: TurkishGamer
review: There is no monthly charge of using this credit card like there was on other credit cards. I would highly recommend it. Chase really works with you to make sure you understand under which conditions the best card for you is. A few times there were breaches on my cards, but I got emails that my card was being used for a possible fraud and I was able to tell them it wasn't me that bought the card and everything was handled pretty well. I wouldn't change a thing about it. Even the sturdiness of the card seems a little better than the other cards I have had. Overall I would really recommend Chase and this credit card for mostly first time credit card owners.

name: Tony Serrano
review: I've had this card for almost 3 years now and have had no issues at all. So they charge $4.95 a month, big deal. The flexibility and customer service I receive are worth it. Plus the fact that I can get documents notarized for free at my local branch because I have this account when needed is great. On top of that, they've started using the security chip on the card as well. I'll take this card over any other prepaid card any day.

name: Alexandria Santos
review: I have it my husband got it also and we love it.  I have had no problems the use is easy, everything is explained up front .  I had unauthorized purchases and they called, texted and emailed as soon as it happened

name: Monica Rochinski
review: Have been a Chase customer for decades and I charged a fortune on the Freedom card and always paid my bill down to zero. However they refused to work with me on a $161 interest charge when I was a few days late on payment once. They were more interested in moralizing about "fairness" than keeping my business and when I told them they lost a good customer they didn't seem to care. I've never had a credit card behave this way and will no longer be using the Freedom card.

name: Stefanie Janowski
review: I am very disappointed with this. I looked and did research as to when I would have to pay the annual fee and I couldn't find anything.  I got the credit card because it was -200 for the flight, and just having a baby, that would really help...and we are lucky to even be able to get to take a trip. Of course I read the small print with a 99$ fee but I couldnt seem to find when that would be applied...at the beginning, at the end of the year, etc. Well it was put on in the beginning. of course I wouldnt have gotten tge credit card if the flight was only -$100. That makes no sense. One of the supervisors said they would reverse the fee if I paid it off at the branch. Went to the chase branch, had to call again and another supervisor said no id be stuck paying everything.  Waste of my time. Fraud. Yes it has perks, but with a new baby, I cant specifically say if and when I'm going to be avle to travel.

name: JadeLhyn Khiel
review: I was extremely satisfied with this Chase Freedom Card. I love bonuses! And this one offers the best bonus and rewards! Spending Five-hundred dollar on my first three months, I received A hundred-fifty sign up bonus! And looking forward to get more rewards. Overall, this card deserves a two thumbs-up and a four-star so far. I will make it a five-star sooner or later. We'll find out soon. ;)

name: Mike Jones
review: As a lover of all things Disney this is a great card. It didn't hurt that it came with a great sign up offer which more than took care of the annual fee. You earn points that you can then put on a gift card for use at WDW, at least that is where I use it. One drawback is that there are a few places that will not accept the gift card - but they are usually the non-Disney owned merchants in Disney Springs. Otherwise this is a great card.

name: Jerry Burnett
review: The Chase Freedom card sets a high standard.  I received a $150 sign up bonus (after spending $500 in 3 months).  During this past Christmas season they also offered 10% cash back from Amazon.  Which means that for the approximately $1000 I spent at Amazon, I received $250 cash back.  When coupled with the lack on an annual fee and 0% APR for the first 15 months, it's a hard card to beat.  The reward categories/merchants do change quarterly and are normally 5%.  For Jan-Mar it's gas stations & Apr-Jun is grocery stores.  Far better than some of the categories  that competing cards offer.

name: Mike You
review: Really love this card, First I have to state this was an extremely smooth process to get qualified for had my card in the mail within 2 weeks.  What really appealed me to this card was the fact that it has 0 percent apr for the first 15 months, its the main reason why I obtained it.  Another reason I love it was because chase is my bank and it also has 0 percent annual fee, this is my top card in my wallet!

name: kevin greene
review: Chase Bank does not accept CASH. I went to deposit cash into my sons account. Since I do not have an account- they would not accept CASH.. It was only 2000.00 Not like I was depositing 10 grand or something.I will never use Chase. I think it means Chase away potential customers.

name: troy mcbrair
review: So here is why i like this card and why i have continued to use it. I initially did a balance transfer over from my freedom card after I had my roof replaced, but then i found myself using this for all of my travel expenses. What is great about this card, is the ability to get your free FICO score. I still do use my freedom card, but this card is always in my wallet in the event i need it. Overall, it is a very solid, what i could consider "basic" card for whatever life throws at you.

name: Jeremy Koch
review: The Amazon.com Chase Credit Card is an amazing card for people who like to do shopping online. I use Amazon.com for a large chunk of my personal needs and fun shopping and by using their partnered card with Chase, I earn points that can be used as money on Amazon when I shop. I've never had any issues and the customer service is great!

name: Mike Jones
review: I use this card all the time. It is in fact my #2 card when going out to buy things like gas and groceries, but for online shopping it is my go-to card. I use Amazon.com every month so having this card is common sense. I've never had any issues so I can't commend on the customer service aspect. The rewards are great - especially for an Amazon shopper! I would & have recommended this card to others.

name: Brandon Pyser
review: I've had my Chase Freedom now for about 5 years.  I use the card for all of my personal purchases.  I love the fact that there are different categories for cash back rewards that change every quarter.  I'm only rating this card 4 stars because I wish they would let you personally choose the categories you want for the 5% Cash Back instead of them choosing it for you.  Often times, some of the categories they offer are things I don't usually purchase.  Still, regardless of that, I get 1% on everything else and I'm pretty happy with that.  I have earned a lot of cash back already and am looking forward to earning so much more in the future.

name: Mike You
review: Very good card, easy application process,  I love the fact that there's no transaction fees abroad, because I do alot of traveling. The interest rate is really low for me around 15 percent, the chase account management online is really smooth.  I think this is one of my favorite cards hands down, especially for traveling.

name: Suzi Page
review: This is the best credit card I have ever used. The APR is 0% for the first 15 months. I love the rewards you could earn with this card. We buy literally everything with this credit card and we always shop where we can get 5% rewards and then the 1% in addition to that. We have made as much as $70 in reward money in one month. The rewards never expire, so we can let them build up as long as we want to. Over the course of a year this is better return than I can get investing in a CD or savings account!

name: Stephanie Castillo
review: I look forward to using this credit card because I am a shopaholic and I love the fact that it has Purchase Intro APR and Transfer Intro APR  0% for 15 months. And it has none MAX PENALTY APR . The Chase Freedom Card maximum late fee is only $37. I will be able to earn $150 while spending on my first 3 months. So i'm really looking forward to start using Chase Freedom Card.

name: Carl Strange
review: I very much enjoy using this card! It allows me to rack up points that I can spend on things I want and need. Amazon is a great company and I highly recommend this card.

name: Cesar Mitchell
review: The people who work for Chase Amazon Visa are very rude. They discriminate against disabled people. You e-mail them and they never respond. Took 4 weeks to get a card that didn't work. HORRIBLE experience.

name: Myrna Goodliffe
review: I agree

name: alikatz79
review: They definitely do not provide customer service in any way positive.

name: Ankit Maheshwari
review: Amazon credit card is my go to card when I buy stuff from amazon. The 3% cash back on purchases at amazon.com is a good deal. I've been using this card for an year now and I am quite satisfied with this. It requires a good credit score which might be a problem for some but other than that its great. I signed up for this when I was shopping on amazon. I've some issues a couple of times with transactions not going through. I contacted the customer services and they resolved my issues in no time. The customer service is prompt and courteous. They make sure that the problem has been solved and follow up on that. Overall a great experience.

name: Dantei Roloute
review: I have been using my Chase Freedom card for a little over 4 and a half years now, and I can honestly say that I love and trust my Chase freedom card. There have been little to no problems so far, and if I do have a tiny problem, then all i have to do is call up my local Chase bank, and they will solve the problem in no time. They are very fast and efficient, and I always enjoy doing business with them. I am very happy and satisfied wit the whole service, and will continue with them in the future.

name: Maria Hiles
review: I have had my Chase Freedom card for about a year and I'm quite pleased with it. The intro APR at 0% is to be expected, but what I really liked were the rewards you could earn with this card. If you shop only with your credit card, you can earn so much back. I always like to shop where I can get 5% rewards and then the 1% on top of that really helps. I also like that rewards don't expire, so I can save up for an entire year or even years if I wanted to for a vacation or a big purchase item! And no annual fee also makes this card a good deal. I'm definitely satisfied compared to my old card.

name: John Vinzon
review: Some how I got a negative balance on this chase liquid and they put me on checksystem wtf prepaid card supose to prevent u from using money j don't have of getting a nsf

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review:
Always make sure if your balances. It's your job not the bank itself . 
Have control of your finances. .

name: Coty Flanigan
review: This is one of the first credit cards that I had. It is a pretty good card. Unfortunately I wasn't able to take full advantage of the point system because I don't travel that frequently. Aside from that, it is a great card and it helped me get some car repairs at a reasonable (compared to other cards) interest rate. It also helped build my credit. The customer service was quite good and answered all of my questions.

name: LaTrisha Love
review: I like what everyone is saying about the card what I have read but your company needs to put what location have this card at so people can get it

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: Every chase branch bring only 2 id and the 25 dollars to open it

name: Kirk Davis
review: Overall the Chase Platinum Visa is a good credit card and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a new card.  The grace period is very generous and helpful if I am a little late paying the bill.  The customer service has been helpful with some minor issues.  The cash advance rate is pretty good for small advances if you forget to bring your ATM card.

name: Jaya Balaji
review: Freedom was one of the most exceptional designs of prepaid cards that i have very used.It considerably increase my liking to wards varieties of design cards and I'm grateful for the card designers for giving such a great opportunity to become a part of it in the list of members using the card.

name: Shubh Shukla
review: This is regards to my latest order with Amazon- I have a complaint about how you are trying to trap the buyers- I had placed this order and on checkout I was shown this message- "YOUR COST WOULD BE 52$ INSTEAD OF 82$. If you apply for Amazon Rewards Visa Card Now and you'll get an Instant 30$ off." Now if you understand it in english that means your current order will be 30$ off when you apply for the card. And I fell into the trap, I did apply, it opened up a a pop-up it discounted me 30$ dollar but When I came back to my main screen, My order was still pending and of 82$ not 52$. I placed it to try and see if I get an ""INSTANT"" 30$ off. Which from what I understood by now that you'll get only when you buy your second order, you can use that 30$ card later not an ""INSTANT"" off as they mislead you.My concern is why is misleading language used on checkouts. Why is that ""INSTANT"" off. And I really don't want this card now. You can keep it. I contacted Chase but they say they don't cancel once applied.They even had a hard inquiry on my credit score which effects my score badly. I am really really not satisfied with this way. Please stop misleading and let me know how do I cancel my Visa card application without my Credit score being effected. And When I call Amazon care they say Chase will give 30$ off. Chase say they don't do it, Amazon pays you gift card. What a fraud.  They won't cancel your card, won't give you off. What a poor way of earning money and business. I'd rather stick to other online stores. Thanks amazon for forcing this card on me for nothin

name: Joshua Rowlett
review: This card has helped me so much in the past. I have ran into many problems that called for the use of this card. When i had to pay a bill for a grip, this card was able to save me money and along with having no late fee was also an extra treat that made me happy to own this card.

name: Ian Goodwin
review: If you travel and frequently choose Mariot hotels then this card is simply a "no brainer." The rewards are great. It's also nice to know that you can have a free stay somewhere, which makes an impromptu trip or vacation a little less strenuous on the check book. The rewards are simple to use, and I have never had a problem using or activating them. This is a great credit card!

name: Scott Molly
review: I got this card about a year ago. The 0% APR for 15 months was pretty awesome because I got it around Christmas time last year, I was able to use it for all my Christmas shopping. I also got 100 dollar bonus which was really awesome. I like the rewards categories also, there is alot of stuff my wife likes so it keeps me happy. All in all , this is a great card and I couldn't recommend it enough.

name: Ian Goodwin
review: I really enjoy this card but it is not my "go to" card. It all depends on which rotating purchases provide the most rewards. If gas or groceries are up for a greater cash back than my other cards, then I will obviously use it. Unfortunately that is not always the case so I find myself utilizing a different card for those purchases. The initial bonus is nice if you can afford to reach it. I'll never turn down $100 for things I am buying anyway! This is a great card, but you really have to watch the rotating rewards.

name: troy mcbrair
review: I've been using this card for a few years now. Overall, its a very solid card, especially around the holidays. the 1% cash back on everything is nice, however there is always a 5% cash back option like gas, Zappos, Kohl's, or Amazon. Amazon is always around December, so it fits my shopping habits very well. Overall, the card is very solid in its offerings and it comes with no annual fee which I was even a bigger fan of.

name: Michelle Lane
review: I signed up for this card because of the sign-up bonuses that came with it. I didn't have much expectation, but I have to say...of the 6 credit cards I currently have to choose from, Chase Freedom is the only one that I use! The 0% APR for the first 15 months got me out of a bind and the cash back bonuses are absolutely amazing! I can't believe how much cash I've earned on this card! I have recommended this card to many of my friends and family and I am completely satisfied with my decision to choose this card!

name: Ella Lee
review: This is a wonderful card to use, especially if you like rewards. You get 1%  on every purchase, which is nice, and 5% back on rotating categories. The categories are usually always something that you can use, and throughout the year I get a lot of money back this way, on things I would normally buy regardless. The statements are very clear and easy to understand, and their customer service helpline is always very informative and understanding.

name: Joshua Fraim
review: my feelings are mixed.  they give incentives for balance transfer and even keep their promises even when i paid late once (which i thought meant automatic removal of 0% apr).  i have no problem paying for anything with my chase card, which is more than i can say for my new chipped bank debit card.  i've never been charged unnesesary charges.  never had fraud charges appear.now for the bad part.  this is the 3rd chase card i have had in 4-5 years.  each time i've had low income and yet they gladly gave me 1000+ dollars in credit.  stuff like that is partly why the economy crashed in 2008 and it's troubling that the lessons haven't been learned.  yes i know it's not 100% their fault. they didn't force me to apply for a credit card (although with all the ads and mailings they didn't make it easy for someone like me that is addicted to credit).  but they aren't completely blameless anymore than a bar selling drinks to a known alcoholic.i guess if you want easy money and you have decent credit then chase is there for you not that it's a good thing.

name: Michael Hilmer
review: I like this card because it's a great way to earn cash back for beginners.  With quarterly bonuses that double that cashback, I feel like I'm making a wise investment in myself by using it.  The first 15 months come interest free, so it's a great time to build up significant cash rewards before you have to worry about avoiding interest charges.

name: _holdaway
review: I had a grandfathered Western mutual checking account and savings account. Both have been closed and I had to reopen over the past 15 years. The checking Account was closed by them because I didn't use it for a couple months in 2006  and this year I had to clear out my savings and when I went to put money back in after tax return they said sorry it's been empty for 61 days so it's now closed.  After getting the accounts with new restrictions and fees there is no such thing as no activity for 60 days because you get a fee every 30 days OR meet their requirements,.

name: Ron Fritzsche
review: If your flight originates with a United partner airline (Eg Star Alliance or code share) you will not get the free baggage allowance.  You will pay.

name: Collin Komplin
review: This card is great.  I got 590 dollars cash back after I spent 4k and added an AU to my account.  That along with the 1% cash back, yielding me essentially 20% back on my 4k of spending.  I love it, I can not complain.  I will cancel the card when the AF comes up.  Only used the card for the sign on bonus.

name: Thaines Haines
review: This card has been awesome with no APR for 15 months and the regular APR at 12% which is not the best but no the worst either. I use this card any time I want to make a large purchase and I'm happy to have it. It's one of my favorite cards so far.

name: Nate Wilson
review: I was pleasantly surprised to get approval with my 640 score. I mainly wanted this card so I could use it with Samsung Pay on my phone as I didn't have a compatible card. Sure enough I was approved and now use it with Samsung pay. It works slick as a regular chip card too, but that's not my main use for it. The interest rate isn't terrible either. My only wish is that my Credit Limit was higher but I'm sure that'll come with time.

name: Dee Wall
review: I really love the Chase Freedom card because of the great benefits I get by using it. They have rotating categories throughout the year that give you 5% back on everything you purchase in those categories. You also always get a guaranteed 1% back on every other purchase that you make. I get a lot of reward cash back each quarter and it is a great perk for money that I am spending anyway!

name: Kirchner Antolin
review: This has to be the best credit card I've ever gotten. The customer service is outstanding! I think everytime I call, the wait time is pretty much instant. The point system is awesome and the coverage for usage is well worth the annual fee. No more worrying about fraud, car rental insurance, or foreign transaction fees.

name: Christeen Oellrich
review: Totally agree.  An authorized card sent overseas with a simple request.

name: Kevin Velia
review: This is the first credit card i've ever had. I've always been weary with cards but as I get older I realize i need to improve my credit score. I liked the points back in the beginning, which gave me almost $300 in cash back, but I'm not getting any points anymore even though I continue to use the card frequently. I also love the 0% APR for the first 15 months. Other than that, it's pretty easy to use so far..

name: Thomas Santell
review: I just applied and was accepted for the Slate card about 2 weeks ago. I found it appealing because of the free balance transfer with 15 month interest free payments. I had another card that I had a good amount of debt on and I wanted to transfer it to this card so that I could save on interest. I am happy with this feature. The card is also good in other ways. It has a lower interest rate than my Wells Fargo card. And it also has 0% APR on purchases for the first 15 mnths. I am happy with this card.

name: James Moore
review: I really enjoy this card. It gives you 1% on all purchases and every quarter it gives you catgories that give you 5% cash back. Some categories are: on gas, movies, amazon, restraunts. Just depends on the quarter. I would highly recommend this card.

name: Joshua Rowlett
review: I have had a Chase Freedom card for a few years, and I think it is great. It is really easy to transfer and withdraw money to and from the card. I only had a problem with the card once when I was trying to buy something from the store, and my card was logged out . I was a little frustrated and so I called them about the issue, and they solved it right away. i was very satisfied with the whole thing.

name: Bridal Kaleidoscope
review: I have 2 cards. I'm primary on one and secondary account holder on another. Was so disappointing with not having priority boarding and paying second time this month for checked bag. Not worth to pay 95$ annual fee and not have any advantage of that. It's plenty of other credit card around. Will cancel them.

name: Sydney Nitz
review: Free bag checks are good for international flights

name: Kara Mia
review: I have had this card for 3 years and find it pretty reliable.  I like that it gives me points every time I buy through Amazon, and I have been able to cash those points in towards hotel rooms and other Amazon purchases.  I'm not so crazy about the APR (21.99%!), but that is why I only use this card for Amazon purchases.

name: Kent Nuttycombe
review: The great things about this card were the initial 0% apr and the cash back. Unfortunately it can be a bit confusing to manage the cash back categories and the way the points are redeemed; I wish the way this program works was simpler.  However, if you take time to really understand it, the potential cash back is one of the best of any card out there. The APR tends to be on the high side after the free period expires, so that's a downside. It's definitely a card for people who have a habit of paying their bill (or most of their bill) every month.

name: Brigette Petrovich
review: The card itself offers cash back during the entire year. The categories switch every season. However, the categories are for everyday purchases like gas stations or grocery stores. Overall the card is what you would expect from a big financial instituion. It gets the job done, but it is nothing special. One can expect the usual features and protection from a big banking instituion.

name: Vi Kathern
review: Using this card is not a good idea. i thought i was saving money and i got a bill that cost me twice as much. Your advertisement was completely misleading and I am strongly recommending that nobody get this card.

name: Willaim Foster
review: I have just applied and been accepted for this credit card.  I was sold on the fact that I will get a $50 credit after I make my first purchase and i'm taking my family to disneyworld in may so this card has some great discounts associated with disneyworld.  I should be receiving my card in a little over 10 business days,  I can hardly wait.  I also like the fact that there is no annual fee, and the APR% is alot lower than a few cards that i'm currently using. If you plan on going to disney and you want a good, fair credit card, I would highly recommend giving this one a shot !

name: omarm1
review: Overall a very good bank, as well as checking account. There are some limitations to the amount of money that can be withdrawn within a day, but as a college student using this as a day to day checking account, I have never experienced a situation in which I need to withdraw/spend more than this limit. Very good customer service provided by Chase, they alerted me and canceled my card when my its information was stolen and being used falsely before I even noticed the charges!

name: Susan Feterman
review: I've had the Chase Freedom Card for 12 years and it has gotten increasingly better as it has continued to offer the highest cash back of any card that I've seen.  If you pay your balance every month you will profit from using it for every purchase.  They also provide excellent customer service.

name: Nene Mathis
review: I have had a saving account with chase for about 10 years when i first got the account i really didn't  know much about banking the rep was very helpful in helping me understand the difference between checking and saving accounts and what steps i could take to save the most money over the years any time ive had questions or concerns all my needs have been met and my questions answered they have even help me save money with other accounts that i have with them and answered my questions about credit i doubt i will ever switch banks i have no complaints

name: Matthew Taylor
review: I first opened my savings account with Washington Mutual back in 2003, prior to the bank being acquired by Chase in 2009.  Chase made the transition smooth so I didn't feel the need to look for another checking and savings account elsewhere.  Over the last 12 years I have never had a bad experience with the savings account, although the $5 fee and minimum balance required to avoid it could be a hassle to some people.  In order to avoid this it is very easy to set up a monthly recurring deposit of $25.  Because it is easy to go online either at home or on your phone and transfer money between your savings and checking, you don't necessarily need to keep that $25 in your savings account.  Their website is very intuitive and the online savings app only takes 3 clicks after signing in to transfer money back and forth from your savings to checking, or vice versa.  Overall I would give it 4 out of 5 Stars, knocking off a half a star for the monthly fee and minimum balance required to avoid it, and another half a star for the low interest rate the savings account offers.

name: شيوا شيوا
review: I applied for a Chase Freedom card in mid-October, I got a call a week after and was asked couple of questions and then they said I got approved for the card then I got an email saying I should get the card in 7-10 business days, more than 2 weeks passed I didn't get the card, called to see what has happened and they said the card has been closed because my address has not been deliverable!!!!! How come my address not deliverable only for Chase now? Who is responsible for dropping the credit score for opening and closing a card? So annoyed! Have been on the phone with customer service for more than 20mins and still waiting to see what can be done! Don't get this card

name: Jacoby Greene
review: The Chase Slate card isThe Chase Slate Credit Card is an excellent addition to any wallet; particularly if you have a credit card where the interest rate is anything over 7 percent. The Chase Slate card offers an amazing 0% balance transfer for 15 months. On top of that, there is absolutely no fee to transfer your balance from another credit card. The Chase Slate card also has no annual fee, which made it a no-brainer choice for me when coming over from one of my first credit cards that had a rather small balance but a super high interest rate and annual fee to match.

name: Terri Hutchins
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card sounds like a great option if you are not able to get your own checking account. When you compare this to a normal bank I am not charged a monthly fee to put money in the bank where as this card charges you $4.95 a month. Now, I do like that the $4.95 is waived if it is linked to a qualifying checking account. I would use this for my kid in emergency situations.  This is not a credit card, so, the only money that will be on it is the money that you put on it. A good thing about this card is that you are not charged for signature or pin transactions. With this card it only cost $25 to get started compared to my bank which cost a $50 start up fee. I really like that this card has text banking so you can track your card uses if you send somebody to pick something up for you. You will know if they made any pit stops. Zero Liability Protection for any unauthorized card transactions is also nice. I had my bank card stolen once it was a nightmare. It is also free to reload money onto  this card. All together this is a good card if you do not have a bank.

name: Sharon Pan
review: I've had this Chase Sapphire Preferred credit card for over a year now and I love it. This is one of the best rewards program that I've come across, especially since I love to travel. Not only do you get 40,000 points after spending $4000 within the first 4 months, but these points are redeemable for $500 in travel when booked through Chase Ultimate Rewards, or $400 in cash. What's great about the Chase Sapphire rewards program is that they have partnered with a number of hotel and airline companies. This means that the Ultimate Rewards points are transferable 1:1 to their partners' rewards and miles programs. I've flown a number of times on my points by transferring them to the Southwest Rapid Rewards and United Mileage Plus programs. This is a great card and even though there's an annual fee, I think the rewards are worth the cost.

name: Michelle Ann
review: How many points would transfer over to a domestic flight in the US?

name: Justin Anderson
review: The Chase Slate card is good addition to any wallet.  First, its large selling point is its offer of a 0% balance transfer rate for the first 60 days.  It is a card that seems to be focused on serving its customers.  It has no annual fee.  It gives a 21 day grace period and offers you a monthly credit score.  It seems to want to offer a respectable service but not cripple people with fees and inflated rates that do not use a credit card as properly as they should.

name: Robin Nyles
review: I love my Amazon Visa Credit card!! I earn points for every single dollar I spend! I do sooo much of my shopping on Amazon and get triple points there. I received a $30 Amazon gift card just for trying out the card!! I can use my 21 grace period to pay off my entire balance each month and so I avoid interest charges. The Amazon Visa card also comes with no annual fee. I love this card, I use it whenever I can and have already earned a trip with my points!! Love it!!

name: Jennifer Cunningham
review: The initial bonus is awesome!  However, look closely at your interest rate because on this card it tends to run really high.  While 5% sounds like a really high cash back rate, it rotates to different stores quarterly so it isn't that great if you don't happen to use those stores in that quarter.  However, you could potentially get 5% back which is awesome, especially since this quarter one of the stores is Amazon and that's where I do my Christmas shopping!

name: Robert Dingle
review: My deciding factor was when choosing the Slate Card from Chase is that I wanted a card that I can used anywhere when I am traveling and want to rent a car or shopped  around the world. I knew the the slate card from Chase would gie me that opportunity. I contacted customer service when I first received my slate Card with a ton of questions and all my question was answer by a live person. Questions such as how do I create my password for cash advances. I was able to create my password in less than 5 minutes. for cash advances there is a 24.99% charge. I was approved for $1000.00 with a $200.00 cash advance.With the slate Card members have a zero balance transfer fee for the first 60 days. Members are giving 30 days before your first payment due. Slate card has a built in chip. You can monitor your credit for free and make monthly payments online.

name: Carlos Mena
review: Beware of the 5% cash advance fee and poor customer service.  I've been a Chase Slate customer for 17 years with a total credit limit of $30,500.  I recently made 3 cash withdrawals and got slammed with a $40 fee per transaction.  Granted they clearly state those fees online and in all the papers that you get from them, but when you're in front of the ATM and there is a $3.00 fee that you have to acknowledge and agree to before getting the cash advance (charged by the ATM owner) you forget about the 5% cash advance fee.  Chase is very good about sending you text reminders for a lot of things.... oh, but God forbid they remind you about the 5% fee at the time of the withdrawal.  Sneaky if you ask me!To add insult to injury... I called customer service to inquire about the fee and after politely asking if she could waive those fees taking into account that I've been a customer since 1998 and with two Chase credit cards on my name, the representative flatly stated the she couldn't waive the fees because they were legitimate.  I asked if she could transfer me to the customer retention dept and she said that there wasn't such a thing.  Obviously frustrated and upset at the poor customer service I just closed the account.

name: Leon  Denerus
review: Cash advances are pretty expensive on all credit cards. I'm happy with their customer service so far.

name: Shauna
review: Overall Chase has been a great bank. I hardly need to utilize customer service, but when I do, I find it challenging that their call centers are overseas. I find the language barrier very difficult, and especially with something as serious as dealing with my accounts and my money, I want it to go as smoothly as possible. I have found myself frustrated a time or two with phone calls into their customer service line, that I end up having to go into a local branch.

name: Ashley Cornelius
review: I have a 752 Credit score and I got approved like I knew I would for 12.99% APR. But I wasn't expecting to only get approved for $500. I was blown away. I have never been late on any of my payments with anything. I've seen people post reviews saying they have a poor credit score and make no money and still get approved for over $2000. I don't need the card for a balance transfer at all. I just wanted another Credit Card to keep my credit score high over the years. I have one Credit Card previously to this one that has over $3500 limit. I had one car loan that has since been paid off and a les schwab tire credit that has since been paid off. For being 27 and having credit for almost 10 years, I was just surprised by the low limit.  I wanted it for the low APR. I don't care about rewards or miles programs on credit cards, that why I chose Chase Slate. Now, if i want a higher limit I have to go through another hard credit run which will lower my score for the time being. I did my research on this card and was just shocked by the low limit. I feel like I'm 18 and my parents gave me a $500 Secured credit card. Thanks Chase Slate for nothing!

name: Chad Pattan
review:
Don't feel bad, the same thing happened to me years ago. 

Applied, they turned it down because they wanted Experian, the one bureau that contains the most invalid information, and the one bureau I purposely blocked for that reason.  Called Chase, told them to pull Transunion or Equifax, don't care.  After arguing, they pulled Equifax and "approved" it, but under the terms that the Experian pull would have given had it been approved.  

From my best guess, if your Experian report is not pristine, Chase throws you in the lowest bucket.

name: Conkie Joe
review: I feel like the Ink Bold Business Card would be a nice addition to my company's credit options, as the rewards system they have implemented would work perfectly based on my current monthly spending. The 95$ annual fee after the first year might seem steep when compared to some of the other ones out there like Capitol Ones Spark. But when you consider Amex can charge upwards of 250$ yearly for their business cards, Ink Bold seems like a deal. Plus we easily absorb that annual fee through rewards on the amount of travel and lodging we currently budget for.

name: Anne Moran
review: I have been with Chase since I moved back to Houston thirteen years ago.  The customer service I receive is always impressive.  I love the mobile access to my checking account, but my favorite feature is depositing checks via my cell phone.  There seems to be a Chase ATM within range of where ever I am in the area.  The overdraft protection plan has also saved me on occasion.  I have banked with others in the past, but Chase, by far, offers the best options and customer service.

name: lisa nyangau
review: Been banking with chase for over 5+ years and I absolutely LOVE IT. I first had chase as a highschool freshman and still have it as a college student. their customer service is quick and incredible and NO monthly fees for college students. chase online is quick and simple and chase QuickPay allows money to transfer immediately.4 stars because chase is not in the state I stay in for school.

name: Angelinamicon
review: Do you Need a loan? If yes search no further for here comes a reliable lender who helped me with a loan when i had nothing. You can reach them at gordys_loans@yahoo.com.

name: Jon Mitchell
review: ATM fees are large, and overdraft fees hit immediately, even when there's pending deposits. Unless you go in person, deposits also take a long time to clear.However, Chase has pretty good customer service, and the people have been pretty nice. No major complaints on that front. Also, they have excellent electronic service for transferring money between accounts, even between accounts at different banks and/or between different people.

name: Kaixiang Zhang
review: good and heavy card. I like it

name: James Moore
review: I have had a savings account with Chase for the last 13 years. The bank is akways friendly and very helpful with any questions i may have. This account is linked to a checking account and the online features make it very easy to transfer money between the two accounts. It is also cery easy to setup recurring transfers, so you can have money put in savings everytime you get paid. The one downside to chase is that the interest you are paid is very low compared to what other companies pay you.

name: Kyllein MacKellerann
review: There are actually TWO cards for the individual:  One is paper (rather flimsy paper) and is a Revolving Credit  system.  The other is a Visa card, plastic, and can be used for other-than-Amazon purchases.  I recommend the Revolving Credit since the interest is around 25% and you can do better-interest wise-elsewhere.  Both cards build your credit.  Both cards are good for anything Amazon offers up to your credit limit.  For someone seeking to raise their credit score, I recommend the Revolving Credit card and a few purchases paid off in two or three months time.  That will boost your credit without tempting you into Cash Advances or Groceries, which the Visa is capable of doing.  As long as Amazon's people see y o u are a regular payer and they get some money from interest, all will be happy.

name: mike
review: My experience with Chase bank has been great. I have both checking and savings accounts with them. I like that they do not charge a fee for transferring money to an external bank account and the representatives at my local Chase branch were very kind and helpful.I recommend chase bank for who ever is looking for a good bank.

name: daniel jasbon
review: i opened the college checking account with chase when i got a mail coupon that offered me 200 dollars for opening the account, after a while i found them not to be as willing as other banks to work with me; if for some reason i was on the negative there was no grace period to bring the balance back to positive.

name: art haya
review: Customer service was terrible when I needed them. They charged me for an overdraft that never happened, and I had to yell to get them to fix it. Other than that, everything else has been alright. There are many locations by me, and their card works everywhere. I am able to deposit at any time of day.

name: Angelinamicon
review: God bless everyone that cares to listen and take the right part in getting his or her loan and not fall victim. why am i saying this, i am saying all this because there are many testimonies on the internet which are either true or false but i tell you today, after all i have passed through in the hands of scams i will not fail to announce this God fearing lender who helped me out of my diverstating condition when i lost my Job and couldn't pay my children's fees, after been denied loan due to bad credit by loan sharks and other credit unions i visited, my bills where behind and we were about to be throne out of our house but as God will have it i logged on my Facebook to seek for help from friends and family members all to no avail. while still on Facebook i saw a testimony by one Celina wheels who once had similar problems and got her life transformed by this same lender. Immediately i email them at: gordys_loans@yahoo.com and behold i received my long desired loan within 48hrs of processing and i am grateful to God almighty for bringing such a lender across my way.

name: Joshua Rowlett
review: I have been using my Chase Master card for about 6 years now. I really like the pint system that the card provides because those points can be redeemed to get free gifts. I am also pleased with the customer service that the company has provided because I did have a problem with the purchase of an online product and when I returned it to the original owner, the person did not want to give my money back. I fixed the problem by calling up chase and they refused the purchase for me so I could get my money back.

name: tkyoung08
review: I have been with Chase for over 5 years and recently got a car loan through them. I have had lots of medical problems and surgeries over the past few years and as a result my credit has suffered a significant amount. I was in desperate need of a good running car and had trouble getting approved for a loan but Chase gave me a chance. I was able to make the payments the first year on time but last December I became disabled after emergency back surgery and started falling behind once again. They have been great about giving me payment extensions and have been very helpful during this tough time for our family. Most banks would have given up on us but they continue to be there helping us all the way.We will continue to use Chase bank for all our future banking needs.

name: Olga Dolgicer
review: Stingy and high interest card. 1 day late - and late fees will not be waived, as if the prime rate interest they offer is not enough for Chase.

name: DaveMy Vegas
review: Don't be late!!

name: Eric Rothman
review: This card is great if you travel a lot.  Unlike chase or the BOA cards that I have, the rewards are more focused on travel.   The interest rate of 15.99% is pretty good compared to Chase, etc.  All of there other fees such as late fee, cash advance, etc are good rates.

name: Jack Beanstock
review: I travel the world so many times and I figured that I need this card.  I required a reliable card that was able to give me excellent and great rewards. I searched all over and then decided to get the wonderful Marriott Rewards Premier Visa card. During my first year, the annual fee was not charged and I received a huge 50,000 bonus points and an unexpected free night at the hotel. Every year the also give me a totally free night even when I do not expect it. This is usually very nice. The $85 annual fee is not high compared to others, the free night is definitely worth more than the $85 and so it's definitely worth it.

name: Sheila Sanders
review: If you use British Airways, this is a good deal. The big downside that I see is that I don't typically use British Airways so this will make it harder for me to get points. However, you only have to spend $2000 in the first 3 months for this deal. Most of the similar deals require you to spend $3000 in the first 3 months. Also, if you think that you can spend $30k in a year, the travel together ticket is a nice bonus on top of the points that you earned.

name: kikim1
review: I have been with Chase Bank for over 5 years. I have my primary checking account there, and also a credit card. And I do not plan on leaving any time soon! The tellers at the bank are always helpful and informative, and someone is always available to sit down with me and answer any questions I might have. I don’t, however, go in to the bank very often because chase.com is so convenient! I do all my banking on line nowadays. I also have the app which is easy and secure and the BEST way to quick pay someone. I use quick pay multiple times a week now. Chase makes me feel secure and cared for. I even got a personal phone call once when my card was compromised, and I received my new credit card the next morning, via overnight UPS. Chase is the best!

name: Tyler woods
review: I've been generally happy with this checking account! I have been with chase since it was WAMU, and been holding this checking account through college and admittedly beyond. I currently pay no fees, and have probably taken its straightforwardness for granted, but thats how well it has worked for me. No complaints here! However, make sure you have a good supply of backup money in the account, because the overdraft fees, as others have mentioned, are a little steep.

name: Michael Wiseman
review: I signed up solely to get the signing bonus. When I did it, I think it was $100. The rewards were not really that catchy except for gas one. Honestly, how much can one spend at home depot in a quarter unless he is a contractor. Apart from the signing bonus, the only good thing is that I also have a Chase account so I only have to log in to one page to pay the bill.

name: Jeff Veasy
review: Not my main card at the moment but it's my preference when in a pinch. The rewards program and cash back are a huge bonus if you play your cards right and the APR is more than manageable once you pass the year of no interest.

name: Ashley Michelle
review: This card is pretty good. It is simple, nothing really surprising or different about it. I did very much enjoy the 0%, only wish it would have gone on for longer than 15 months. My new interest rate isn't too bad, but I've had better.

name: Jason Reinbold
review: I have had this card for a few years now.  The terms and conditions are normal, the rates are right around industry standards. I enjoy the card throughly and often cash in my points for cash.  The only negative I have the card is the annual fee after the first year, I do wish this were about half of what it is.

name: taylor
review: So despite it being a "no fee" account, if you don't maintain a minimum balance in the account (or a larger balance across all Chase accounts) you are charged a $12 monthly fee. Furthermore, if your account is overdrawn you're charged a fee after three days. There are so many hidden fees with this account I feel like it's almost not worth the "benefit" of the so-called revolutionary mobile banking system upon which Chase prides itself. The transactions are never up-to-date, which means you could go into the negative without ever knowing it and then charged fees! What's more, the email alerts are sent days after the actual event about which you are being alerted occurs!

name: Susan Zelley
review: I have been using the chase freedom credit card now for 5 years or more. I have recently encountered a problem with a software purchase and called to cancel the payment after 1 day. Not only would Chase not honor my request their dispute department told me I had to prove to them that I no longer used the service and I needed the billing date sent to them for processing. They have my statements and billing info but have denied my claim because I can't send them proof of the 1 day service I received that ruined my new computer. Their service personnel are arrogant and hold themselves better than their customers. I do have an 827 credit score and have Never been late on a payment. The treatment I received from this company is appalling.. If you have no issues you'll be fine, otherwise, good luck to you. I'm going elsewhere..

name: Reagan Morrow
review: This card offers a great $50 reward after the first purchase! Past that, points can easily be redeemed at a Disney Vacation, which if you have children is always a great time. There are a ton of discounts available through using the card, including on select guided tours. And other experiences. If you want to get the Disney experience from home, you can even use the card to receive an extra 10% discount when shopping on the Disney store website!

name: Silvana Graf
review: I like the card because of the rewards via Amazon BUT I hate that the credit card statement is not itemized with what I purchased on Amazon or some minimal reminder word. Since they have the info on Amazon, why not put it in the Statement?

name: Kyllein MacKellerann
review: That is available as a separate field.

name: Katherine Iacuone
review: Don't bother with this card. The points are hard to use. I wish I had just used one of my cash back cards all year instead and I would have had enough to cover my whole stay. Instead I have points that have can't be used when I want to travel.

name: Patrick Yercich
review: Chase has been excellent for us. After having bad experiences with Wells Fargo and Frost Bank, we were about burnt out on the banking process. However, Chase made the application process simple, their customer service is great, and unlike the other banks we tried, they are willing to work with us on things like minor overdrafts. When we overdrafted by five cents a few weeks back, Chase waived the fee for us, and I have sincere doubts that our past banks would have done the same. Great experience so far; looking forward to using them for years to come.

name: Kathleen Lynch
review: I have had a savings account with Chase for over ten years.  I find they are always friendly, courteous, and have answers ready for my questions when I have them. I enjoy going to the branch office in town the most, since they don't push a lot of offers and contests on me designed to sell me products I can't use or can't afford. That's one of the things I like best about the local Chase office, where I put money into my Chase account, is that they treat people fairly, whether they are big or small investors. Chase savings accounts also allow you to transfer your funds electronically, which is a big convenience in today’s busy world.

name: Chris Molina
review: I have had chase since I was in high school and I enrolled in the Chase College account right when I got to college. It is by far the best fee wise and you of course cant beat chase customer service. They are on top of it for everything; their was even one time when I got my card stolen and money was taken out of my account and they replaced it! I plan on keeping my chase college account as long as I can and will enroll in a normal account once my college one expires.

name: Kyle C
review: I have used Chase Savings Accounts on and off again since I was in college. For the most part, I have had a good experience with Chase. Though still positive, I think their savings accounts are the weakest product they offered that I have tried. I never saw the point of having to have a fee so the bank could hold my money when it is the bank that benefits from the funds as a company. I also didn’t have any money in my savings accounts for a few months (online my checking account) and they closed the savings account without giving me any notice. I don’t really miss it, it would be nice if you have money but it’s a bit of a chore if you don’t.

name: Laura A C
review: I opened up my Chase Savings account about a year ago when they were doing a promotion that if you deposited $1000 or more of new money into the account then they provided you with a $200 account credit.  It took me less than 5 minutes to open the account online as I already had a Chase Checking account and simply had to transfer the money from my pre-existing account to the new account.  Although I do not maintain the $300 minimum each month, I get the fees waived by having a steady automatic deposit come from my checking account on the same day each month.  I have never had any problems with the account and find it easy to utilize.  The only thing that I already keep my eyes out for is that I don't exceed the 6 withdrawal limit each month because once you exceed it Chase charges you a $5 fee per transaction over 6.  Transfers between my Checking and Savings account are instant so that's good too

name: Dave Smith
review: Overall, the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is a pretty good card.  The late fee is standard within the industry at $35.  The interest rate is pretty standard also at 15.99.  It does offer rewards in the forms of points and a very solid 40k as a promotional bonus if you spend 4k in the first 3 months.  I am personally a fan of the Chase Marriott Rewards card as I am a lifetime platinum member of Marriott but if I wasn't this card would be at the top of my list to potentially use.

name: Christian Younginer
review: The Chase Slate card has quite a few benefits. Rewards are not one of them. This is a deal breaker. There are many other cards out there will no annual fee, 15 month intro 0%, and grace periods. This is an excellent card for a younger person who may need the grace period for forgetfulness. But as the cardholder grows older, he or she may want rewards or concierge services. I'v got the Citi Double Cash card which has all of the same stuff that the Slate Card has, but also 2% cash back. Just something to keep in mind when buying. Don't just think about what you need from the card now, but think what you may need in the future so you're not switching cards a bunch.

name: Michael Chong
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid card is a decent card but there are definitely better options. For example, the Bank of America Cashpay Visa Card will be eliminating their monthly fees at the end of August while this has a $4.95 cost. I also notice that compared to some other large banks, Chase is not as convenient for withdrawals or deposits because the number of locations is less.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: Bank of America tricky bank ! Had it and closed it .

name: Linda Crews
review: It is also hard on some, I would have to drive 45min just to get the card because of locations and they will not let me get it on line

name: Dayana Jaoudé
review: At first I opened my Chase Sapphire Preferred Card because of the bonus they were offering. I got 40,000 points for traveling by simply opening the card which was great for me because I travel a lot. I was able to get my free airplane rides and for every dollar I spend I earn one point which gets me cash back. I am very pleased with my card and plan on keeping it!

name: brett payne
review: I like my Chase savings account because it is a place for me to set aside funds that I may need to access at a future date. As an investment the interest rate is way below the national average but as a rainy day fund it is a great place for me to access my emergency funds without penalty or long waiting periods. The rewards have been helpful and the locations in my area are plentiful. Their online mobile app also makes management a breeze and transferring between accounts is always right there on my phone.It's a simple place to sit your money that is it.

name: brett payne
review: I avoid most of the big box stores and I live in a major metropolitan area so I can even take advantage of things like same day shipping. The rewards program earns me points on items I already buy plus I even earn points on purchases not made on Amazon. If you're using subscribe and save and prime and any of the other Amazon services you should be using this card and getting cash back.

name: nate
review: I have been a customer with Chase for years and have been on time with my payments for years. All in all, I am a great customer. I recently made a large payment though a few days late and requested customer service to waive my late fee. They refused because back in April they waived a late fee. Are you kidding? After all the customers that don't pay? All I am asking for is a fee reversal. Then, I spoke with a supervisor and she thought she was some type of high and mighty individual. If you are a loyal customer and pay your bill on a regular basis, companies should make special arrangements for their customers. But not Chase! I say forget them and find another company.

name: Mona Chen
review: The most they will even do is waive one late fee. So this is your second time late? And you give them a 1 star rating because they wouldn't waive it the SECOND time? Are YOU kidding?

name: Mona Chen
review: I don't even know why you're even complaining about it the second time..You should have learned your lesson from the first.

name: Mona Chen
review: Not all companies will even waive it the first time.

name: Emily Davey
review: This is by far the best bank to deal with in every aspect.  Their customer service is phenomenal.  If you call in, you will get a real person that you can understand, who will be caring and compassionate. If you go to the branch, they are quick, friendly and efficient. My wallet was stolen.  Every single person at Chase was helpful and compassionate when I came to them for help. When I called in, the rep was very sweet and worked quickly.  I went into the branch to have a new debit card issued and the branch told me that they will typically give you enough money to replace your ID in the event that yours is stolen.  What kind of bank does that?  I love them.  I have never had a single issue with this account.

name: Halida Nikolic
review: Do not get this card!! This is a scam! After doing my research about which card to apply for, last night I applied for Chase slate. It seemed the best deal for saving money, offering 0% APR for purchases and balance transfers and $0 fee for balance transfers for the first 15 months. I applied online and got immediately approved for $3200. I created an online account and, after I logged in, I saw that I have 22.9%APR. This morning I called customer service and was explained that I did not get the promotional offer of 0% for the first 15 months! They said it is probably written somewhere that the offer is not guaranteed and that they could switch it on you as they wish. When I read through that mile long fine print letter, there is a place where it says this: Rates, fees, and terms may change: We have the right to change the account terms (including the APRs) in accordance with your Cardmember Agreement. This is a classic case of bait and switch! Do not deal with these crooks!

name: Mervyn Biggleswade
review: The Chase Sapphire credit card is definitely a great card to consider.  The sign-up offer is hard to beat – 10,000 points after spending just $500 in the first 3 months, which is $100 in rewards!  And, after that, you get 1 point for every $1 dollar spent, and 2 points when dining out.  Also, there is no annual fee or expiration date on the points.  It’s a win in my opinion!

name: brett payne
review: I actually don't live near a Chase any longer but I still won't get rid of the account lol! Their Chase pay service is really convenient for sending money to my friends and family. I have also been saved by their 24 hour grace period on overdrafts more times than I would like to say. Mobile app is easy and great to use plus their rewards cards offer great deals!!

name: RCJ
review: I have been using the Chase College Checking Account for about 3 years now. I have never had any issues with this account nor my savings account. I have no monthly fees, a withdraw amount of $500 a day, and I don't need to maintain a specific balance to keep the account. The only issue is the overdraft fees can be a little ridiculous. They will charge you $35 dollars even you have -$5.00 in your account or more. Some people may seem that to be reasonable. On the bright side, if it is over -$5.00 they will not charge you. I am happy with my account nonetheless.

name: Laurent Tshisekedi
review: Chase has been my go to since I started college back in 2012 and it never seems to fail me. Given the fact that I have limited knowledge of how the banking process works, I find it incredibly easy to keep track of my online balance and converse with the representatives of the chase. I actually just got a new card this past week and the process was incredibly seamless. I've yet to attain a credit card but chase is probably my number one option right now. Chase does a great job of making the process of opening a checking account easy and painless. Highly recommend going to chase.

name: kailey thorpe
review: I opened a chase checking account about 3 months ago, and I have had the greatest experience so far. I received a $200 bonus for setting up my direct deposits with them. Their online banking is far superior to any other bank I've ever experienced, and love how important good customer service is to them. I haven't ever tried calling in to Chase banks, but so far, the service I have received has been excellent from them.

name: Helwa Chawla
review: I have been using the Freedom card for about 4 years and never had a single complaint against it. There is no over limit fee and the max late fee isn't even that high. So even when I am making heavy purchase on my wallet I don't worry much if I miss a payment. Not forgetting the online management system is awesome.

name: Hawk Bird
review: I have had this card for several months. I dumped my Barclay Card for the chase freedom and have already saved a lot of interest charges. The cash back benefits are what really brought me to it. I love knowing that not only am I saving on interest but I receive CASH back not an unusable gift from a catalog or credit toward some other purchase that I will probably never buy. The cash back on quarterly items like gas od an additional 4% has really helped my finances. Glad I changed!

name: Scotch Tape
review: This is one of the best hotel credit cards that is out there. I love using it every time I go to an Marriott Hotel. Most of the times now days I am traveling a lot since my kids are not going to school and it is the summer. Since there is not a foreign fee when I go abroad I don't get charged extra money for swiping my card. Also the cash advance rate is high and that makes it easy for me to earn money as rewards for travel. Overall this card is the best and I love it.

name: Randie Cairo
review: A few months ago I switched from TD bank to Chase Bank.  I have several accounts and decided to switch all of them to Chase for my banking needs.  The sign up process was so incredibly quick and easy.  I went into the bank and didn’t have to wait on a long line.  The woman who helped me was so amazing and understood all of my needs.  She was so genuine and very helpful.  Everything from the Chase Mobile App to their actual website has been so easy to use and better than other banking apps.  I would absolutely recommend Chase to all of my friends, family and colleagues!

name: Randie Cairo
review: A few months ago I switched from one bank to Chase for all of my banking needs.  The sign up process was so incredibly easy and the person who helped me so genuine and helpful.  Everything from Chase Mobile App to their actual website has been so easy to use and better then most other apps.  I would recommend Chase to all of my friends and family!

name: Peacenow Peacenow
review: Chase Visa will not protect you from unscrupulous internet sellers. Extremely indifferent to law breaking internet scams. They'd rather support scammers than their card customers.

name: Brandon Oscar
review: I have been with Chase for many years, even when they were known as Washington Mutual. They are a bank that always takes care of their customers no matter what. I recently made a mistake and was hit with some overdraft fees. I called their customer service phone number and they immediately reversed all my fees, no questions asked. Every time I go into the branch, the employees there are very helpful as well.  I also like the fact that you can have a free checking account with them as long as you have direct deposit going in. Most other banks charge a lot of money on a monthly basis for an account, so this is very refreshing.

name: Julio Bass
review: It's a great card.  The security features and online access are really top notch. I have easy access to my account, and I have yet to have it compromised. The customer service is also really helpful and the website is easy to deal with. I've had much worse times with other major credit card companies

name: AlcoaTN
review: I have been using the chase freedom card for about a year now and I really like it. The rewards are really great, especially when they have 5% back from amazon. My favorite thing about this card is that you can have your cash back credited as a statement balance instead of having to use it to buy something. All in all this credit card is great.

name: Kellie
review: I have banked with Chase for almost ten years now, and opened my first savings account with them about three years ago. I have never had any complaints, which I think is saying something (considering the horror stories I’ve heard from friends about other banks). Their online interface and app make my banking SO easy. You can view how much is in your saving’s account and make transfers to and from savings. No matter how many different types of accounts you have, they can all go on the same page for you to see. When I went in to set up the savings account, the bank clerk set up an automatic transfer of $25 from my checking into my savings every Friday. You could do that any day of the week, multiple times a week, or fewer times per month; it’s up to you. This allows you to avoid any of the fees (I’ve never actually been charged a fee for anything I’ve done with Chase). Definitely highly recommended.

name: Ames Garnett
review: This was my first CD that I opened. I figured it would be hard to do or I would get overwhelmed because I don't know anything about Savings or CDs but Chase made it easy. I am a new business owner so I am already with Chase. They even called after I was all signed up to make sure all my questions were answered. So far, I've seen good results from Chase. I wish it had more of a return but I can update that in six months when my business is more profitable.

name: Latisha Humphres-Robles
review: Bad company and bad customer service they stole over 800$ from me and my family they transfered my awards with out knowing what was going on .. Customer service wasn't helpful and have to hire a attorney to get my money back from chase . please be ware before getting this card .

name: Sam Roberts
review: You charge an international transaction fee.  I would take your card in a minute if this was not the case.  Many others do not charge this fee.

name: Amber Blackwood
review: I've been a customer of JP Morgan Chase for going on 5 years now. I typically visit three different branches, use their mobile banking application, and have called their customer service line numerous times. I've never had a complaint about their customer service. My wait times have always been reasonable for the request (waiting to make a deposit was obviously much faster than waiting to see a loan adviser), the employees have always been kind and courteous, and my questions never go unanswered. I've also applied for a loan through Chase and the process was easy and well managed. The bankers I have worked with in the past have always walked me through any large decisions that I was making (choosing a credit card, loan applications, choosing to open a savings account) and answered my questions patiently and, sometimes, numerous times. I especially enjoy the mobile banking applications, which makes depositing checks much easier for me, and the customer support related to the application has always been pleasant.

name: Shamika Ellis
review: Although Chase is an okay back, one of my current issues is their overdraft fees and the scarcity to find a Chase back when traveling within the Atlanta Georgia area.  There are many Chase users and when visiting a city like Atlanta you want to have the convenience of being able to access your checking account anywhere and at ease.

name: Justin Snowden
review: The Ink Bold Business Card seems like a perfect card for someone who is on the go. If you travel a lot then the gas and hotel rewards will be worth the $95 annual fee. Plus, since the rewards are for cell phones, landlines, internet, cable tv, online purchases, travel and gift cards I could see a lot of fathers with wives and kids finding this card to be a very attractive option.

name: Dylan Settles
review: i had already had my bank account through chase so they asked me about getting the chase freedom card and told me about all of it's benefits. What really stuck out to me was the cash back rewards and the no annual fee aspect of the card. Overall those 2 benefits are what got me to accept it. That was a year ago and my limit has already been doubled from $1,500 to $3,000. If you have any questions the support team is very easy to get ahold of and easy to understand while quickly resolving all my problems.

name: Zachary M Lang
review: I signed up for a Chase College Checking account when I first started going to college, nearly four years ago, and I have never had a problem with their services. They have one of the best mobile banking apps out there, one in which you can deposit checks. It is very easy to transfer and receive money transfer from others ones you sign up for this service. One problem I did encounter when signing up for this service is that it has to be from an actual desk top/lap top. You cannot sign up for this service from your cell phone.

name: Shannypoo Milam
review: The card is ok minus the fact that I can't use it to make a payment to my Chase automobile account. If I have a liquid checking account with Chase and a vehicle loan through Chase it doesn't make sense that I can' use my bank account to make my car payment...Same bank...

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: Yes ! But you can go to the branch and ask for a cashier check and Mail the payment

name: Jack Miller
review: I have had an account with Chase for over 10 years. No big issues with them. The online banking is really easy to use. They are always helpful when I come into the branch. Only reason that I got a 2nd account with a different bank is because I moved to a town in Texas where the closest Chase was over an hour away. There was a Chase ATM near my house so I could withdraw money without paying an extra fee.

name: jenn chancellor
review: I am a longtime Chase customer and I have had a Chase Plus Savings Account for several years. I have never had a problem with it. I do wish the interest rates were more variable -- it is the same for between $1 and $49,999. I feel like there should be a different denomination at some point, like the halfway mark. Overall, the account is easy to add to, especially online, and there isn't a fee (unlike their checking account), which I find to be a big plus. I think it would be a nice incentive to earn rewards based on how much you deposit into checking in a year or six-month period.

name: jenn chancellor
review: I have been with Chase since before it was even Chase, and I prefer their old checking account options. In general, I like that it is easy to find an ATM and that you can order checks for free. However, I do not like that there is a monthly fee to have a checking account; their old ones were free, and I think it is kind of shady to change the terms and tack a fee on. I also see that Chase offers a monetary incentive to people to open this type of checking account, but offers nothing to current customers who got switched. I am not a fan.

name: Logica Denille
review: Do not get this card. The second my promotional period was over, they reduced my credit limit without notice, thereby making my credit to debt ratio worse and hurting my overall credit rating, regardless of the fact that I was current on my payments on all my accounts (Chase or otherwise). I didn't know that this had happened, and, thinking that I had at least $1500 available credit, I was caught off guard when I went to make a purchase and my card was denied. Additionally, even though my promotional balance was paid long ago, they still charge me interest on the purchase balance that was not paid before the end of the promotional period. On top of that, my husband has two slate cards, and they somehow are regularly compromised. In the last three years, he has had to have 5 replacement cards sent. Also, Chase had been charging him for years for their account protection service which they never informed him that he was enrolled. On top of that, they screwed up their legal obligation to handle his accounts according to the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act (Yes, Chase, you can't even get it right for those who fight for your right to be idiots). Needless to say, Chase has cost my family thousands of dollars, diminished credit scores, and a lot of stress and  unhappiness. Their card sucks. Their customer service sucks. Their entire attitude sucks. The 0% APR and 0% Balance Transfer Fee isn't worth the hassle if anything unexpected happens in your life and you have to handle something dire and reduce your payments for a couple of months (and I am sure I am not the only one in the world who had to burn through their emergency funds - almost 2 years worth of pay set aside -, stop contributing to their retirement funds, and go a little too much into debt because of health or other emergency issues). Maybe some day we will get lucky and Chase will no longer be considered a "Too Big To Fail" company and they will just disappear off to wherever evil is caged.

name: Scotch Tape
review: I have been with chase for almost about 15-20 years and I absolutely love their service and customer support. Their credit cards and debit cards have really good credit limits and don't effect your credit score negatively. I like to use this card mostly when I am traveling because its benefits are great for example it has to fee when you do foreign shopping. The reason why I don't like this card is because it had an annual fee of $95 and is only good if you travel that much.

name: Megan Zuchowski
review: I obtained the Chase Freedom card in November 2014. And I have to say so far I really like it! Before having a credit card, I used cash for pretty much everything. But with using a credit card like Chase, you gain access to a lot of perks and benefits that you simply can't get with cash only. For example, since I charge everything each month to my one card I usually have quite a balance. But I pay it off in full to avoid any late fees and interest spikes. Each time I pay my card, I get what is called "Chase Rewards" points. In fact just for signing up, there was a special $100 offer after I think I spend $500 or so in the first 3 months. It was great. So that money got instantly credited to my card and I can use it to pay off a part of a bill or I can use the money to purchase things on Amazon. It's pretty cool. Overall I have earned a couple hundred "free" dollars which is awesome. If you have to spend the money anyway you might as well get something for it. I love that there's no annual fee too. As long as you pay off your balance each month in full it's completely free to use!

name: Lauren Baldwin
review: I really like the card- it was my first (and only) credit card. I've had it for a year and a half now, and it's been bumped up from $500, to $1000, and now $2000. I like the cash back rewards, but I do think they could be a little better.
