The months that the 5% cash back is Kohl's or Amazon.com I don't get nearly as much back as when it's gas, groceries, or restaurants. Overall it's a great card though, no annual fee, and easy to pay off right from my bank account page.

name: Emery
review: I have banked with Chase for a while now and recently opened a savings account in addition to the checking account I already had there.  What I liked about the process was that the account was very easy to open and all my fees were waived.  There is also no fee to having the savings account as long as you link it to a Chase checking account.  What really attracted me to the savings account was the good interest rate offered.  In addition there have a really good online banking and mobile banking interface.  This makes it easy to transfer money to and from your savings account, as well as keep yourself up to date on how much you have in your account.

name: Kevin Honold
review: I signed up from United.com after seeing the ad.  Got instant approval.  Clicked pay for my flight.  Error.  And that's where the fun starts.  Called United's customer service and wait an hour.  They say I can't pay using the card since I don't already have it (the ad on United's website says you can pay and use it right away).  They send me to Chase's card assistance.  Which in turn sends me to Chase's customer service.  I finally learn that I've been charged for the full value of the flight without actually getting my flight.  Now I have to call United back and wait another hour.Thanks guys.

name: Randie Cairo
review: I recently switched my checking account to Chase bank and have been completely satisfied thus far.  I was getting charged a monthly maintenance fee which was my primary reason for looking to make the switch.  As long as your paycheck is direct deposited into your account, Chase doesn't charge any monthly fee!  There was an amazing promotion of giving $150 to any new customer account opened, so I was basically paid to open an account with them, which i was going to do anyway.  The customer service has been amazing and the people are always so helpful and quick.  I recommend Chase bank to anyone and wonder why it took me so long to make the switch and save money on the monthly fees I was paying!

name: Robert Fitzgibbon
review: To be honest, Chase is the worst Credit Union I've ever gone through. Fees are high, and their are tons of hidden fees as well. My worst experience came when I over drafted on literally, $0.25, and they charged me $36 for this. I refused to pay that, and they closed my account, and sold my debt to a debt collector. I will NEVER open another Chase account, they have HORRIBLE customer service and problem resolution!

name: Hannah
review: The Hyatt credit card is a great deal if you like to travel like I do.  It's easy to earn points for spending at all, and earning extra points for restaurants and Hyatt hotels.  Since I'm travelling a lot anyway, it's like I'm always getting free rooms.  Other credit cards I've had seem to have rewards that it takes forever to actually earn.  With this Hyatt card, I can count on actually being able to take advantage of the perks of having it on a regular basis.

name: adam
review: The British Airways Visa Signature card can definitely come in handy. The main thing that I like about it is the 50,000 bonus miles. Another really good thing about this card is the low APR. One thing I do not like about this card is the high annual fee.

name: Melanie Presha-Little
review: I used my card for car rental in UK. Ithe car was damaged - trying to get them to pay out is a nightmare. I have sent 30 pieces of documentation to date and am still waiting. They keep asking for more, yet debited my credit card immediately. Don't use this card for international rentals.

name: Chuck Foy
review: Chase College Checking was a great account for me to have since I was able to avoid the monthly fee by just having a direct deposit get put into the account. The other perk for me was not having a minimum amount to open the account which was helpful as a struggling college student. Chase is a great company to start your financial future with and I am happy I chose them.

name: Josh Quick
review: I do a lot of traveling so this card would benefit me greatly. It also would not be hard at all to get to 1000 dollars. Especially with in three months. The only thing that bugs me is the annual fee and transaction fee. That would hurt me in the long run because right now i am using a card that is cheaper for me to use. Right now is not a time for me to raise my budget fees.

name: Monroe
review: I have used Chase as my primary bank for a little over a year now.  My direct deposit splits between a joint checking, personal checking and the standard Chase Savings account.  I appreciate the convenience of having most everything in one place, and the ease of transferring between accounts using the Chase mobile app.  This  account doesn't have a fee so long as you have autodeposits set up, which I really appreciate.  It does, however, charge you if you transfer out of it more than 5 times per month. This is not something I've had to do more than once, but felt like charging for transfer was a bit of a ripoff when they sell the product as not having a withdrawal fee.

name: Patrick Eagens
review: I've had this card for the last 4 years and I like it a lot. The 1% cash back is okay (seems about average) and I've not had any issues with late fees or anything like that. The one time I had to call customer service the representative was a bit slow, but they ultimately succeeded in helping me with my issue so good there!

name: Clint Dee
review: Chase is a huge bank and you can find an ATM for them almost anywhere.   Thats pretty much the only thing that made having them convenient.  They charge you for whatever they can and have a monthly fee on their checking account.   Their interest rates for loans are not great.  When I went to close my account and tell them I was moving to a credit union they tried to talk me out of it and told me they only had low loan rates because they were desperate for customers and I should leave my money in their bank because it would be safer.  Overall Chase is a decent bank but their services are quickly overshadowed by their ridiculous fees and the incentives to go with an online bank or a credit union are very enticing.  If they want to compete they are going to have to do better.

name: Jessica Mcnally
review: I've been a member of Chase for a few years now and have really enjoyed banking here. I love the convenience of the locations. Customer service is decent. Haven't really encountered any major issues while banking with them. When I lost my debit card it was really easy to call them and have my lost card deactivated and a new one sent out to me.

name: Lindsay Marks
review: My checking account at Chase is pretty simple and easy to pay through and check on. I am able to quickly pay friends via email, even friends that don't have account at chase so it makes splitting the bills with my roommates pretty convenient. I also pay my rent and credit cards through one portal they have for all my accounts with them online so overall it's a one step process for most of my transactions. They also let you set up an option of a low balance alert and an alert for when you spend over a certain amount that you decide on.

name: Bryan
review: I have had a checking account for about 3 years now.  I like it, good customer serice when I opened the account.  However, very few human terminals, most are computerized self help terminals. If I go into a branch, I like having a person to see. There are ways to reduce fees with direct. I suggest talking to your banker to get your fees reduced if your fees are hiking up.

name: Patty Camerota
review: I have made 2 trips using my United Airlines Explorer card. Both trips I had to fight to get one bag checked free even though that is the terms of the card. Also forget about Priority Bosrding.  Not happening!  Trying to get a refund from United Airlines for $50 for first bag checked has been impossible.  Web site not accepting information. Tried 3 times.  Took 8 calls to corporate offices to finally connect with a name I pulled off Google. Still no word.  We will be avoiding this airline going forward and cancelled the card yesterday saving $95 of agony down the road.  Your rating system should include taking away stats!

name: Matt Clark
review: I've been using this card for around 10 years, and have never had any problems with it. The rewards system is pretty standard, I think - you get 1% cash back, with 2-3 rotating 'bonus categories' such as restaurants or gas stations that will get you 5% back. There are no fees associated with the card, so as someone who pays my balance in full every month, I don't pay a dime to use the card. Over the years, I've only had to call customer service a handful of times, and they've always been very helpful. I like that I can schedule as many payments per month as I want, and don't have to wait for a billing cycle to end if I want to pay something off a little early. Highly recommended!

name: Justin
review: I signed up for the Chase Total Checking account back in October when I moved to Texas for job-related purposes. I really wasn’t sure which bank to open an account with, but I received a promotional coupon from Chase in the mail just a few weeks after settling in Texas. Chase was offering a $125 credit for opening a Total Checking account. The coupon was very detailed in describing the terms of the credit agreement. Additionally, Chase was very clear about the requirements of the checking account, such as keep a monthly minimum of $1500 in the account, or having at least $500 direct deposited in the checking account to avoid the $12 monthly service fee. I have been very pleased with my decision of opening up the Chase Total Checking account.

name: Tammarra Campbell
review: Disney Chase is a nice card. Especially the fact that you can earn $50 after your first purchase. It would help a lot in paying for a trip to Disney World, since you get discounts and special rewards if you use it there. The 1% back isn't as good as some other cards, like the Quicksilver card, but it's better than nothing.

name: Faith Rossworn
review: I have been very happy with my Chase checking account.  I started out as a Washington Mutual customer, so I was a little nervous when Chase took over.  But, I am pleased to say that Chase has been great.  Their customer service is always friendly and they seem to go out of their way to help you.  Their branch locations are very convenient and their terms and conditions are very straightforward.

name: Kyle Cherryholmes
review: This was my first high limit credit card and it has been a life-saver. I was interested in going with the United Mileage Plus Explorer’s Card for a few reasons. First, the card is done in partnership with my bank, Chase, which boosts it’s credibility and familiarity. Also, it is a Visa that is done through United Airlines. I travel to and from Europe and this card has come in handy with some of my expenses. The APR is very reasonable and the mileage point/rewards are great!

name: april george
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid card is an OK card.  I had to go into the local Chase branch to set it up and they make it like its a checking account to set it up, but you dont get a credit check ran on you.  I dont like the fees per month either and the fact that you have deposit $25.  There are other cards that do just the same and you dont have to put any certain amount on at once.  It is what it is, just a typical pre-paid card.

name: Dee Monroe
review: This is the answer that I needed, because I used to have an account with Chase and owe them money, so I figured that they would have declined me in getting this card, but I do miss having Chase & I would most definitely go in to get this card

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: True but hidden fees ! I have the excella card and it's kind of confusing they don't post the transaction on time and it might get you confuse when you ge the message that your balance is $1.15

name: Emery
review: I have had my Chase checking account for a few years and have been pretty satisfied overall with it.  The best thing about it is that it is always easy to find a Chase ATM location nearby and the people who work there are friendly and helpful.  However, one of the major drawbacks of this account is the heavy fee they charge you if you do not meet their monthly requirements for an account balance.  This was difficult for me when I was in college because money was tight and I did not have a job giving me direct deposits so that I could get around Chase's monthly balance requirement.  I think the fee is expensive and ridiculous because they are essentially charging you to use your own money.  So if you are low on cash, or in college, or do not have a job with direct deposit, then be vary wary about the extra fees that Chase can add on by you having a checking account. This is the biggest problem i have had with this account, but overall it is a decent beginner's checking account.

name: Aaron lentz
review: I recently signed up for this checking account and have been using it for about two months now. Other members of my family use this account and they all recommended this bank and checking account for me. Now, I can see why. This account is laid out very straightforward and doesn't come with any surprises. I have had no issues so far. The customer service is great, the various fees are average compared to others, but most importantly you get what you see. No hidden fees just a pure checking account. Just what I needed.

name: Kristin Krerowicz
review: I was banking with Chase for over 7 years when I finally decided I'd had enough of the back and forth. On multiple occasions, they applied withdrawals before deposits to ensure that I would have an overdraft fee that kept building and building. When I confronted them about it, they essentially confirmed that it was their standard practice so I decided to take my business elsewhere.

name: Denise Tutor
review: I was introduced to this card by my bank...obviously, Chase. I was hesitant to stop using my Southwest Airlines Visa but soon realized that Chase Sapphire offers better rewards and faster. The one dollar for one point can add up quickly and with no expiration date, that is very useful. The initial 10,000 points if you spent $500 in the first three months is better than I've seen in most reward programs. The interest rate and late fee charges are about the same, they make it daunting enough not to want to take a chance on making a late payment. Overall this is one of the best offers I have seen on a rewards card. A bonus...if you eat out more, you get more points. What a great excuse to eat out more.  All in all this is a better card than most I've seen.

name: Kristin Krerowicz
review: I have had other Chase credit cards that just did not compare to the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card. The initial 40,000 bonus points are a great deal, but of course that deal may cost you in interest if you don't get that $4,000 paid off quickly. All things considered, the terms of the card make it attractive to anyone looking to rack up points quickly on everyday items.

name: Kristin Krerowicz
review: I have had this card in the past and I have found it to be a pretty run-of-the-mill credit card. They didn't offer great points for purchases or any of the other "extras" many cards do, but the APR is reasonable if you have good credit. If you are looking to build points, try a different card.

name: Elixir TheEnigma
review: I have enjoyed my Chase Freedom card the past couple years I have had it.  The rewards aren't too big, but they do reward you with cash.  I think you get about $100 for every $500 you spend during the beginning of having this card. You get cash back and can earn bonuses.  There's no limit how much you can earn or redeem.  Its nice to have this card, because there's always something I'm getting back from every purchase that I make.

name: adam
review: I really like the idea of this credit card. The fact that you get 30 dollars instantly just for signing up is really nice. The points system is also really cool. The interest rate seems very reasonable also. Overall I think this would be a really good card to get.

name: Melinda Cope
review: I have been using Chase bank for a number of years, they are fast and friendly whenever I have to go into the branch, the app leaves some room for improvement, it seems that it crashes a lot on my phone.  The website is a bit confusing as well, it could use an update.  They work with you if you overdraw your account, and have text alerts that can be sent to your phone if you get below a specified cash available amount.  I think that I would recommend this bank to a friend or family member who was looking for a new bank.

name: Michelle Elizabeth
review: I left Chase after 4 years as a customer.  I really like how convenient the branches are.  It seems that no matter where you are, there is a branch nearby.  I also like the amount of services that the bank provides.  Many places give discounts if you are a Chase member.  I ultimately left because of poor customer service on a local level, however.  The bank can be great, but if the people working there are awful it doesn't really do me a lot of good.  We had issues with our debit card being used fraudulently online.  It took ages to get the money back, and we had to jump through a lot of hoops. I understand the procedure, but the branch manager and tellers were all very rude during the whole process.

name: Michelle Elizabeth
review: I love cards that provide bonuses and cash back.  I feel like you might as well get some kind of reward if you're going to spend the money anyway.  This card has, by far, more features and benefits of any other card that I've had or seen.  In addition to the cash back opportunities, the Chase Freedom card gives you a lot of discounts at retailers and companies simply for being a member (any Chase card does this, actually, but why not use this card and earn cash back?) I really like the no annual fee aspect.

name: Danielle Elgin
review: Chase has been my bank for over 10 years. I left BofA to be with Chase. When I first joined them, my checking account was free. About 4 years ago, they went to a monthly $10 fee. if you don't use direct deposit or if you can't maintain an average $1500 monthly balance. Unfortunately, we can't do either, so for the past few years we've been paying this fee. Once again, the little guy gets the short end. Overall, with the exception of the monthly fee, they have been a reasonable bank. We don't overdraw, so we haven't had the problem of paying expensive fees for overdrafts. Their branches are in abundance where we live, so that has been convenient as well. There customer service in branch is second to none. If online banks were not available, I would be content with Chase. The App works great most of the time. It has been a great convenience to be able to deposit checks from my phone.

name: Kyle C
review: I very much like my checking account with Chase. They have always been great when it comes to customer support. My account is easy to manageI originally banked with Washington Mutual until they were bought by Chase. They have always been super helpful when I’ve called Customer Support or gone into my local branch. They are good about sending my checks, I bank online and it is easy to use. They have even helped me when I had a mistaken over-draft and refunded my money. I would wholeheartedly recommend Chase to anyone for their banking needs.

name: Myles Lindeburg
review: The Ink Bold card sounds like it has an awesome reward structure, with the 5x and 2x points categories. However, with an annual fee of $95 hovering over your head each year you would be better off with a reward card like the Barclay Card that doubles your points on groceries, gas, and utilities with no annual fee. Also, if your a business who purchases a lot then the 50,000 cap could be reached very quickly. There are many other cards out there with zero zap and zero annual fee.

name: Dave
review: I have been a member of The Chase Disney Rewards Credit Card for almost ten years. I earn 1% back on all transactions except for balance transfers. The 1% goes to a Disney Cash card that I can use at the parks, Disney stores or even the Disney Cruise Line. It has paid for numerous cruises already. Additionally if you book a cruise or park vacation and pay in full with the card you get six months no interest for the purchase. The customer service has always been outstanding. They also have automatic notices you can set to alert you by email when a transaction has been submitted. My only complaint is the rate could be 3-4% lower.

name: Dave
review: I have been a member of The Chase Disney Rewards Credit Card for almost ten years. I earn 1% back on all transactions except for balance transfers. The 1% goes to a Disney Cash card that I can use at the parks, Disney stores or even the Disney Cruise Line. It has paid for numerous cruises already. Additionally if you book a cruise or park vacation and pay in full with the card you get six months no interest for the purchase. The customer service has always been outstanding. They also have automatic notices you can set to alert you by email when a transaction has been submitted. My only complaint is the rate could be 3-4% lower.

name: Wade Fuller
review: I got the Chase Slate credit card around this time last year. I used applied because the Introductory offer was just too good. I transferred a balance and saved a ton of money with the 0% APR for 15 months. My card has been easy to manage with Chase's website. It never seems to be down for maintenance and is quick to update.

name: Sarah Burton
review: Chase has been a very easy to use bank. There are locations all over the place and are easy to access. The Chase Total Checking account has also been easy to use. The fees are $12.00 a month. However, those fees disappear if you have direct deposits that amount to at least $500.00 a month. When I opened my account the banker was friendly and understanding of my needs. In addition, when there was an issue with the account Chase was quick to respond to my concerns and corrected the issue.

name: Chett Elderson
review: My partner and I do a lot of flying and have saved so much money with the British Airways Credit Card. It's got a really low interest rate and you can earn a ton of points, very easily, through their rewards program. This program lets you redeem the points towards flight tickets and other travel goodies. Plus, there's no foreign transaction fees when you're overseas which is a nice bonus.The only knock I have against the card is there's an annual fee after the first year but if you use the card a lot it's still worth it. It's similar to the priceline credit card but it's points are for a specific airline rather than a travel website. They're pretty comparable though so you can't pick wrong.

name: Chett Elderson
review: First off, I am frequently going on trips and staying at hotels so the Hyatt Credit Card is perfect for my needs. It's got a really low interest rate, low fees, but where it really stands out are it's Hyatt rewards. If you spend 1000 in the first few months you get a free 2 nights at a Hyatt (a pretty good value), you get lots of points for Hyatt hotels and other restaurants and this really lets you cut down on the cost of travel over time.This card is super good if you stay at hotels a lot and is still pretty good even if you don't. It's hard to recommend anything else (American Express, Discover Rewards, etc) over this when the interest is so low and the benefits so good.

name: David George
review: This is the card I use when we go out to eat for the cash back rewards, it's kind of a no brainer because I'm going to pay for dinner either way so why not use the card, get the 5% cash back, and then pay the card off at the end of each month. Nothing to lose, 5% to gain!

name: Ric Buckner
review: Beware of this Chase crowd.  They will eat you alive on "late fees" and interest.  The way to avoid these sort of charges normally is to set your computer to automatically pay a chunk on the 2d of the month to always cover the minimum, and then always pay the balance by the 30th.  I have successfully used this system for years with BOA and Lowes.  So, I very carefully followed this procedure with Disney Chase until, four months later, late charges and interest start hitting, "because of the way their system works".

name: Mitch
review: We do a lot of travelling and the Marriott Credit Card is perfect for that. There's a lot of great initial rewards plus continuing benefits which really add up over time. Throw quick emergency card replacement and other-travel related benefits and you not only have a card that's great to travel with but can be relied upon in an emergency.The interest rate is not only low but fixed as well which is a great plus compared to a lot of cards. Compare to a contemporary Mastercard or Discover which might have good interest but it'll balloon up and down. This is a great card not only for travel but general use as well. You'll be hard pressed to beat it's features, benefits, and low interest rate.

name: Ryan Oarwell
review: I am normally against any credit card that charges an annual fee, especially a large one such as this one does. However, the benefits of this card allow you to travel like a 1st class passenger at the airport which is a BIG DEAL these days. You get to use the 1st class entrance at the airport without buying a first class ticket, saving you an hour or more in line each flight. Two free premium drinks (cocktails, beer) every flight. As long as you pay off your balance every month to avoid the APR, these benefits far outweigh any "cash back" type of cards. Think about how much you'd have to spend to make up the different in airline fare for a first class ticket? Impossible. You are also always boarding A-List, so you never have problems getting access to overhead bins. This card is a MUST HAVE if you travel as much as I do and I would highly recommend it.

name: Andrea Janczyk
review: The reason I got the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card was for the amazing bonus offer. I opened the account to receive the 40,000 bonus points for traveling. I paid my grad school tuition with the card within three months of opening the card and received the 40,000 bonus points. With the points I was able to buy two, two way plane tickets to Los Angeles for free. I also really like the 1 point per dollar spent bonus because in the eight months between opening the card and going to California, I was able to get over $100 cash back.

name: Desiree Cochran
review: This is such an awesome idea for people who are planning to take a trip to Disney parks! I love the introductory idea of a $50 gift card after the first purchase. My current credit cards don't offer anything close to that big of a reward for the first purchase. Plus the rates are much cheaper than my credit cards that I currently have.  The fact that they also offer discounts at the parks and stores is definitely an added bonus. I love the fact that I can earn rewards dollars for items that I purchase daily. The only downside to this card is that after the Disney trip is over with, I really don't see any added benefits except the interest rate for using the card.

name: Tom Doorknob
review: I was very pleased with Chase bank when I was a customer there. I ended up getting USAA through the military and this is the only reason I switched. My only complaint is that they were not very clear about their overdraft protection policy. I was under the impression that my card would decline if there were no funds available. I was very surprised to see several overdraft charges on my account! I called and they refunded them all but I was still a little bit perturbed that I had to go through the hassle of calling them and having them reverse the fees.

name: dexterm1
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is quite attractive and seems particularly useful if you're a traveler.  The 40,000 bonus points ($500 travel equivalent) is a really nice incentive for spending $4000 in the first 3 months (if you're planning a big purchase or trip, apply for the card beforehand and take advantage), as are the 2X points for travel restaurants, and the point transfer for frequent travel programs.  The clincher for me, however, is the 0% foreign transaction fee.  That coupled with the other incentives for travelers is a great combination.  My USAA Mastercard charges 1% on foreign transactions, which I tolerate but don't like.  And I've seen plenty of cards (Wells Fargo, AMEX Hilton Honors, etc.) that charge 3% or more for foreign purchases.  This Chase Sapphire Preferred Card definitely has some nice incentives if you travel abroad.  I'm going to look into getting one.

name: Michelle Woody
review: The Chase Slate Card is a FANTASTIC card for anybody working on paying off small, high-interest debts. The 0% APR for 15 months allows you to transfer your debt onto the card and stop accumulating interest, at least for a year and three months. Obviously this course is only for the fiscally responsible, and could hurt the credit score of someone who wasn't conscientious about paying off the debt and just let it sit. One drawback is the lack of a rewards program; if that's something you need out of a credit card, I can understand your hesitance in signing up. But for someone like me-- working to pay off small debts that are already accruing interest elsewhere-- the Chase Slate is an awesome solution.

name: Charles Tidwell
review: Chase has always been a good company to me and fair.  I have a Chase credit card and have never had an issue.  I also use Prepaid cards to do online shopping so that my bank account is safe and secure.  I am not to happy about the e$4.95 monthly fee but it is a good company so I can over look that.  I also use my prepaid to pay for new local stores that pop up in my town as you never know when some your info might go missing.  I love that it has direct deposit because with most direct deposits you can have a percentage go to another place so i put 60% in my checking account and 40% on my prepaid card so that it is there the same day as i get paid.  And then like I said do my online shopping. Of all the card companies Chase I think is one of the best.

name: Syed Hasan
review: I've had this card for over 5+ years. It's probably one of the best cards out there for its cash back %. This is the only card that offers quarterly promotions that change to what’s relevant. The Freedom card also has a one-time promotion of receiving $100 depending on if you’re a new client with Chase. When you redeem the cash back you have different offers either transfer the points into cash or if you’re an Amazon shopper you can redeem it on Amazon. I would highly recommend it to anybody that uses other cards to really look into this one.

name: RobRob Rob
review: Chase Sapphire CardPros:- 10,000 points if you spend $500 in first three months.  That is higher than any other credit card offer I can remember seeing.- 2x points on restaurants is great because that is where I used credit cards most often.- No expiration date.- No annual fee.Cons:- 5% cash advance fee.- Balance Transfers (I've had the Chase Freedom card forever and I've never been allowed to do a balance transfer in at least 5 years and I have a $25,000 credit limit.)- No mention if there is a cash back limit you must meet before you can redeem.  I have frustration with several credit cards where you have to accumulate a certain amount before you can touch it.  For instance, My PayPal is the worst where I need $50 before I can touch it.  Discover just changed their policy and now allows me to redeem any amount at any time.  I just tested it with .19 cents and it's in my bank now.

name: Sherese Rodriguez
review: I love, love, love Chase's total checking account!!!  It's super easy to sign up and set-up!!!  I received pleasant, cheerful, expert help from my Chase banker.  She carefully guided me through the process.  She treated me fairly, and with kindness and respect.  She started to build a relationship with me by asking about my children.  And, that encouraged me to ask about her life and she readily shared with me.  My Chase banker did excellent building a rapport with me.  And, to top it off, she quickly opened my account and helped me set-up online banking.  Overall, it was a wonderful experience!  I love Chase!

name: Michelle Day
review: I was offered a Chase Freedom card last year when I was taking care of some banking issues at my local Chase bank, and I'm very happy that I decided to apply for the card at that time. In particular, I find the cash back feature to be nice, and I like that I can apply the points towards purchases I make on Amazon. However, I wish I didn't have to sign up for these points every three months, and I wish the cash back products were for every purchase I make and that they didn't change their categories every three months. But other than that, I haven't had any problems using the card. People seem to trust the Chase Freedom card, because it is through a very well known bank.

name: Matt Hartman
review: The Amazon card is one of the better cards you can get these days. You get an immediate $30 just for having the card approved and with decent credit you can get a very reasonable interest rate on future purchases. Another bonus to the card is the lack of an annual fee. Overall I would definitely recommend this card as it is one of the better cards I have seen, however I still prefer my Wells Fargo Cash Back card just because I get 1 or 5 % cash back on many different purchases.

name: Colby Phillips
review: This is a great rewards card! I like that it gives you 5% back on certain categories! The potential for the extra $125 is a great incentive as well. The 1% cash back on all purchases is normal for any credit card anymore. I'm not sure how the total cash back would compare to those who use a card that has stacked percentages such as 3% on Gas, 2% on grocery, 1% on everything else, but this is the highest cash back I have seen in a category before. The only downside is the high APR like any other card, but I normally pay mine off quickly so it's not a concern for me.

name: Laura Jacobs
review: The Ink Bold card is ok. There's an annual fee of $95 after the first year. I tend to avoid paying an annual fee if I can help it. If I do pay a fee, it's because I get a great benefit from the card, and I don't see how that's possible with this card. I suppose if you are spending a lot of money per month on the card, you'd get a decent amount of points that could be redeemed, but I typically shy away from the gimmicks of points, etc. Card companies can always change the terms of these programs and I've been burned. The last rewards card I used abruptly quit their points program, and when I went to cash out what points I could, there was absolutely nothing left to choose from. So be careful!

name: Lindsay Nicole
review: I absolutely love my Amazon Rewards card. Their interest rate is low and there is no annual fee. The points really do add up quickly which is great for any card but even better when there is also no annual fee. The points show up automatically on your amazon account and you can use them with one click to purchase almost anything in the Amazon store. It's so convenient!  You can also purchase gift cards with the points once you have at least $25 accrued in your account. The only drawback is that you are unable to purchase Kindle books with the points. Overall, this is the best credit card I have ever had. Thank you Amazon!!

name: Darlene Hurley
review: I have had this card for a very long time, and I especially like the Chase Freedom card because of the extra 5% quarterly rewards. The categories change every time, and you can get rewards for buying groceries and gasoline. It adds up fast. I use them as a credit on my balance. The only thing that I don't like is that you have to remember to activate it every quarter to receive the rewards, as it is not automatic. I wish that would change.  The card also has no annual fee.  The customer service is always great, they answer quickly and are very helpful.

name: Mitchell Hengesbach
review: The Chase Freedom card gives customers a lot of great rewards with no annual fee to worry about. I have been a member for several years and have earned thousands! I easily earn $200 each year by using the 5% cash back categories strategically. You also get 1% back on all other purchases, but the 5% is where you can make a lot extra money depending on the category! It really is a great perk that you don't see anywhere else without having to pay a very high annual fee. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a new credit card!

name: Asad Hasan
review: It was when i went in to deposit a check. I was heading towards the line and just wanted to deposit my check. One of the sales representative decided to help me. Surely, you know they offer you some offers they have. I always turn them down but this one i remember about being charged yearly on my account which i didn't authorized. Then later found out couple months ago about the guy who i sat with decided to sign me up without my permission. I wasn't to happy about it so i went back in and decided to get it removed. I wasn't to happy he did it.

name: Austin Martin
review: I have been with Chase now for a little over a year. The only issue that I have had with them, is that sometimes their mobile banking site is down temporarily over the weekend. Granted, I don't do a whole lot of banking on the weekend, but it is necessary to view my account balances. Other than this, I have been more than pleased with this account.

name: Michelle Rodriguez
review: Chase has always been an awesome bank to do business with and their saving accounts offer a lot of benefits including being able to make good money because of their interest rate.  Their customer service whether at the branch or over the phone is impeccable. One time I was depositing money into my savings account with their ATM machine and the cash somehow got stuck. I called them, they said they saw the ATM was now down and they credit me the amount plus $100 dollars for my inconvenience. No other company has ever done that and I really appreciate it. I no longer bank with them because my nearest location is about 20 miles away so that is the only issue but that really has nothing to do with the service. I recommend Chase to anyone who is looking for savings accounts s well as thei many other products.

name: Riley Hottovy
review: This card has treated me so well as far as getting perks! I've really enjoyed the Marriott hotels that I've stayed at as well so that's a plus. The APR is manageable, but I don't pay that anyways since I pay the card off every month. Overall, I'd suggest this card to anyone who travels frequently and needs a hotel, and would like to rack up some great rewards in the process!

name: JD
review: I initially got this card to receive airiline miles to use on United when traveling frequently. The bonus points and and perks that came with card were worth it for the first year, and I saved a ton with no baggage fees. Now that I travel less internationally, I fine it is not as worth it to pay the $95 annual fee for the one time a year I travel internationally. There are other reqard programs that are just as good or better and you are not limited to only using United airlines.

name: Kate McCarthy
review: The thing I like best about my Chase Bank is that when I walk in everyone knows me, whether I stop in or make a quick call. They know my name, ask how my kids are, and understand my financial needs. The bank manager is always polite and smiling, and has offered his help to me with investment information, opening student accounts, and notarizing documents. I have stopped by other branches throughout the city, and have usually had a good experience with the service I received as well. The people who work at Chase make banking much more pleasant, and that makes a world of difference.

name: Kate McCarthy
review: I enjoy the Chase Total Checking account. It is quite simple to manage. With a minimum of $500 deposited each month, the service fee is waived. There are not really many bells and whistles here, just a basic account to manage money. I can easily keep tabs on my money by using the Chase mobile app. They give you an available balance directly after each transaction, so it becomes easier to keep from over spending.

name: Dianna Carter
review: I love my Chase Freedom card. I usually earn about $150-$300 yearly just for using my credit card. I go through the Chase Ultimate Rewards (log on through your Chase.com from your computer not mobile) and purchase airfare. My husband and I combine our rewards together and take awesome trips. In August of 2014, we purchased tickets to St. Lucia, to go to a Sandals resort in the Carribean. We have also have other Chase cards as well like the Sapphire Preferred. Every time we call Chase for any reason regarding our credit cards or combining our points together, they have never given us a hard time and have always been accommodating. We also recently purchased Las Vegas tickets to spend our wedding anniversary there with all our points! So worth it! The Freedom card is well worth it and it's free. Just remember to activate your 5% rewards every quarter. And just know that all of your purchases you will get 1% back no matter what. Maybe next year I will consider getting gift cards as gifts or cash back to pay any balances I may have.

name: Valerie Artrip
review: We have had this credit card for several years now.  Before signing up we looked at many other options and we felt like this card gave us more perks than any other card. Chase Freedom also have very low interest rates if you are not able to pay it off each month.  We love the points that we earn and the rewards of a gift card or being able to apply it to an amazon purchase.  We have never had any problem with it and feel like carrying the card and putting major purchases on it has given us major benefits.    We can't say enough great things about this company and look forward to many more years of "cashing in" on rewards.

name: Sonal Gadkar
review: I was recommended by a lot of my family to use a credit card with Chase. I have a pretty small outstanding debt on my other card which I needed to transfer balance on, and I applied for this card. Although you need to have good credit, I dont think that this is a big deal. What I liked the most about this card is that there was no fee, there's no annual fee (which my Amex has) and I loved the 0% Apr for 15th months. My debt was pretty small so this card really did help me in paying it off. Considering that I have also been a victim of ID theft, the smart chip made me feel even safer. One of my older cards, from which I didnt the Balance Transfer, didnt have a chip and that was the card that was attacked. Just like most cards, there is a late fee and I was late once because I was out of the country and honestly forgot to have someone access my account to pay it. I sorted it out with them and I got no trouble at all. They even waived the fee. I did start with a decent limit on the card but was able to increase it. I wasnt really interested in any rewards or anything that this card had to offer in terms of perks, but my main thing was about the balance transfer which worked out perfect. All in all, its a decent card.

name: Trevor McGovern
review: The two free nights after spending one thousand dollars in three months is a great deal for using my Hyatt Credit Card. On top of that they give me one free night every year on the anniversary of opening my card.  This is the card that keeps giving. Other cards I have do not have any offers towards total year spending like this one does. I think that is an interesting and unique offer.

name: Max Jetts
review: I love the Chase Freedom credit card. It has a low interest rate anywhere on the scale and comes with a great variety of rewards. It's great to make a big purchase with because you can get 100 back initially if you spend more than 500 in the first three months, 5% cash back from certain retailers between now and may, and unlimited 1% cash back on purchases. Those really make a difference over time. Contrast that to something like the Visa Rewards Credit Card and it has rewards but not as significant as the ones on this card.Plus, Chase's customer service is always friendly and extremely helpful. If you have any issues they can and will clear it up in a friendly and effective fashion. Plus you have a great intro rate. It's just a fantastic card all around.

name: Tyler Corelli
review: I signed up for this credit card while at Downtown Disney. It took only a few minutes to sign up and I was accepted on the spot! They created my card right at the kiosk. The $49 fee is a little pricey but it is worth it. Just for signing up you get a $100 Disney gift card. Over the past year I have ranked up close to $50 in the form of another Disney Gift Card. Other benefits of this card include private character meet & greets, exclusive Disney discounts and exclusive card holder events. This is a great card for starters.

name: Skip Harris
review: While overall I have no axe to grind I see a trend with computer programs in the banking industry I had a low balance and a recuring charge which I honestly forgot about no big deal it was onl 9.99 so i came up three dollars short as a few days went by i noticed it was being held in pending limbo well much to my dismay a credit was reversed on a dispute i had and moved in front of my 9.99 transaction so after 2 more days in pending limbo it hit and incured a 34 dollar feeGood news they reversed the charge without one question or hesitation so my advice is Never run your balance down and keep track of all your receipts cause sometimes merchants drag thair feet All in All i WOULD recommend Chase!!

name: David Harkey
review: I've been banking with Chase for almost 6 years now, despite their closest branch now being two states away. Being mobile with Chase has been fine, as they have allowed remote deposits for some time, and I rarely need to use an ATM. The only issue I've had with them is when their system erroneously locked my account for potential fraud, and I couldn't get it resolved for over an hour in the store.

name: Sonal Gadkar
review: I have used Chase for about two years now. It was easy to open and I was able to waive fees. The main thing I was drawn to was the fact that with the savings account you're able to make good interest on it. The website was very good with keeping track of your savings. There was no hassle and if I needed to tap into the savings to pay bills and what I noticed was that there was no limit in the amount you needed (from what I was told at the actual bank) to keep in the account to keep it active. I also was told (and I saw it first hand) that there was no penalty to close the account. They are one of the most secure accounts that I have had. From what I heard from other customers, they had fees to pay once they transferred a certain amount to checking but I never had to face any of that. All in all I think its an awesome savings account and I think its great to have for those people that have just started working. Saving early will always come in handy!

name: Erin Wilkerson
review: At first glance, the Marriott Rewards Credit Card seems like an excellent card to have. The 30,000 bonus points after $1,000 spent in your first 3 months plus the additional 2 free night stay is very tempting. But I don't think I will apply for this card, simply because the annual fee and the variable rate are both a real turn off. The Capitol One card I'm looking at has no annual fee and a fixed rate at 20.9 percent.

name: Natosha Tilmorn
review: The Disney Credit card has a lot of good benefits. I like that you can earn extra Disney dollars that spend just like cash. The introductory 0% Promo APR for purchases is great allowing you can pay for your Disney vacation over 6 months and not all at once. You can even use this card at restaurants while on vacation. However, the apr is middle of the road for this card, but still lower than others I have seen.

name: Tommy Cabral
review: I like that you are able to sign your direct deposit up to this card as well as use the card to make payments for bills or purchases just like regular credit card. I do not like that there is a $4.95 monthly fee unless you have it connected to a checking account and do not like that there is a $2 ATM transaction fee when there are no "Chase" ATM's available.

name: Andrew Moran
review: Overall, I've been satisfied with my Chase savings account. Nothing to necessarily put it above or below any other savings account from any other large national bank. I will say their service whenever I have a question has been excellent in person. There have been a few times where I've been hit with unexpected fees, but that hasn't happened in years, so I assume they've gotten better about that. Their online interface is for the most part positive and easy to use, though I occasionally have trouble finding the right option or form online, and the search option doesn't seem to have much functionality. I have ended up recommending them to friends when they've been looking for a savings account to open in the past, and will probably recommend them again at some point.

name: Kate McCarthy
review: The Chase Sapphire card has an excellent rewards program, representing great cash back potential with no expiration date. A card like the Citi Simplicity is lacking in this department. Neither card has a annual fee. Citi might tote nice features like no late fees, and a smart chip, but they also have an unpredictable APR, which can fluctuate between 12 and 29%. Meanwhile, Chase holds steady at and APR of 15% and a $35 late fee. All in all, the Chase card may look like it has higher fees, but a responsible consumer may have a better experience with it.

name: Tommy Cabral
review: When reviewing the Chase Slate credit card, there was one thing that I saw that made me really want to get this card specifically. The card offers 0% APR on purchases and transfers for the first 15 months and after that only between 12.99% and 22.99%. This is great for someone like me who has multiple cards that have high balances and high interest rates as I can just transfer the balance to this card and receive 0% interest for the first 15 months.

name: Tommy Cabral
review: One thing I like very much about the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is that you have a 21 day grace period. A lot of credit cards that I have looked at have a grace period of 10 days or less. One thing that i dislike about the card is the fact that there is no online response. I don't like that if I were to apply for the card that I would not be able to get an answer immediately and would have to wait for a response in the mail probably 7-10 days later.

name: Patricia Garci
review: I have had my Chase checking account for about 7 years now and I have never thought about switching to another bank! Their customer service is great and they definitely stand by everything they say. A few years ago someone stole my debit card information and made some purchases. I immediately called Chase and made them aware of the situation. They told they were going to investigate and not to worry about it. Within a few days the money was back in my account! They definitely had my back on this one! This was definitely one of the many excellent customer service experiences that I have had over the years.

name: Patty Garcia
review: I have had the Chase Freedom credit card for the last 4 years and I am very satisfied with it. I already have a Chase checking account so it is very convenient to link both of them. The bonuses and the 0% intro rate are great. You always get 1% cash back anywhere and they offer 5% cash back on different categories.

name: Shawn Urang
review: My parents and I have the Chase Freedom Card and we love it! One really good part about signing up for this is you get a free $100 after you spend your first $500 . The catch to that is you must do it in the first 3 months of opening your account. I like that you also get 0% interest for the first 15 months. If you are really looking to get a project done at home and need the money now because you dont want to wait, you should sign yourself up for one of these cards today!

name: Shawn Urang
review: I love that there is no annual fee for this card. I also like the rewards that you get form it. I love anything that will give me free money! The fact that you get points will really be good if you use your amazon account all the time to order things. Most things that is Amazon is usually going to be great! This AMAZON.COM Credit Card is amazing!

name: Kyle Jackson
review: Compared to my Discover It Student card, the Ink Bold Business card is severely lacking. I'll compare some main details of each card:Ink Bold:-2x points on gas-1x points on everything-No foreign transaction fee-$95 annual feeDiscover It Student:-2% cash back on gas and food-1% cash back on everything-No foreign transaction fee -No annual feeThe foreign transaction fee is important to me, as I plan on studying abroad. Overall, I think my Discover card is a much better choice.

name: Josh Quick
review: I really like this card because of the cash advance rate. It has helped me countless times in my business. Also The low late fee is nice on the months i don't pay. I would recommend this to my friends and family. Also the company has excellent customer service.

name: Shayna A
review: I have this credit card and am mostly  happy with it.   When I got my card I got the Receive 30,000 bonus points after $1,000 spent in your first 3 months from your account opening offer along with the  2 free night stays upon account approval.  I was able to use these free nights when attending my favorite science fiction convention which I loved.  The 3 points per $1 spent at Marriott is a nice deal.  I don't actually travel much beyond my various con forays.  The 1/$1 for all purchases is pretty standard.  I wasn't overly impressed with the APR and whatever you do, don't end up with the penalty APR.  I'd prefer not paying an annual fee but this is pretty standard for rewards cards.  I'd recommend this card for folks who travel and stay at Marriotts at least 3 or 4 times a year if not more.

name: Shameka Banks
review: I've been Banking with Chase and using their checking account system for about 5 years now and I'm so happy I switched from Wells Fargo; I absolutely love banking with Chase. It was supper easy setting up my checking account; their customer service in my opinion has always been exceptional, their always so attentive. I never felt they were hiding any hidden fees or misrepresent themselves or what I was signing up for. Chase has tons of option, if your a college student, a business owner or just a regular old banker like myself. They also have different incentive depending on your monthly bank total amount. Chase has a excellent security fraud system; as soon as there seems to be any unusual activity on your account they quickly send you a text or email, depending on the option you opt for, notifying you and letting you know there has been some suspicious activity on your checking account. You can also opt for the overdraft fee protection, which come's in handy..being that Im traveling around Asia at the moment and with all the different exchange rates, it can get confusing so sometimes I may go a bit over but with the over draft fee protection that keep me on track. Speaking of over draft protect, with their customer loyalty the couple time's that I have gone over they have always reversed the overdraft fee , they also reverse any fee's or monies from any unauthorized payment's...And that's what I Love best about Chase is just how they treat their customer's...My mom and sisters all bank with chase and I will be with them for a long time...

name: Andy Brizendine
review: I have been using the chase freedom card for about 2 years now. I got 100 cash back after spending 500. I now use it as my main way of buying things and get 1%-5% on everything I buy. I am a huge fan of the rotating categories. The cash back system works great and they have an auto pay system that lets you fully pay off your bill so that you never get charged interest.

name: Sarah Frey
review: I have had this card for several years, and have enjoyed redeeming the points for cash back or credit to my balance. I also have benefit from their fraud protection service - at one time I attempted to purchase designer boots from a web site that turned out to be fraudulent. Chase did not allow the purchase to go through, and I received an email (promptly) to call Chase to verify this purchase or to cancel it altogether. I appreciated that as I would have been out of several hundred dollars (or worse, had my credit card # compromised).

name: Virg Prit
review: The interest rate is higher than hell.

name: Zena Marie
review: It's your standard saving account. Basically it does what it's supposed to but nothing else. I'm specifically thinking of the 1% interest rate. I mean, your money is actually going to lose value sitting in this account if you take inflation into account and I do so it's sort of slowly bleeding you dry actually. But, the minimum to avoid the 4$/mo fee is low enough. If you have a checking account with chase you can seamlessly transfer money between the two which is lovely and is 100% instant. They issue you an ATM card with the account, that's cool in a pinch. With everything I like about it, I'd switch to another savings account with a higher interest rate in a heartbeat but for the time being, it isn't bad enough to make me switch either.

name: William Lantz
review: I have had my Chase Total Checking for 8 months. The $12 monthly fee is cheap. If you have direct deposit the monthly fee is waved which I like and is helpful, because I find it hard to keep the $1500 mininum balance. I like that there are no fees to pay my bills online with my checking account. The Chase branch and ATM locations are convenient.

name: Randi Kurliak
review: Not a terrible savings account by any means, but not a great one either. I've been happy with my checking account with Chase, but I've been wanting to close my savings account. First off, you get a fee if you transfer more than 6 items in any given month. That's for each transfer mind you. Also, if you don't keep an average balance of at least 300 dollars in your savings, you get an automatic fee of something like 15 dollars taken out of your checking. Since this is averaged, you have to have 300 or more in there for at least half the month.

name: Rebecca
review: I opened my Chase account because they offered $100 for a new account. However, they didn't disclose that you would be charged monthly fees on the acct and that $100 was gone basically before I had it. It would have been nice if they would have disclosed what all needed to be done to not be charged fees.

name: Sonal Gadkar
review: I have had this account with chase for years, but I was drawn to it because my parents have always used this Bank and loved it. I started out with this account about 5 years ago when I started with my part time job. I had to put my mother's name on my account (as was told to me by the representative) so that I could waive a lot of the fees. That was the main thing that drew me to this bank. They were willing to help me save money because with a part time job, they knew I wouldnt be earning that much. They tried to minimize all of my fees either with maintaining the account and or with other monthly fees. They have an awesome app so that Im able to check my checking account on the go and its totally secure. I have had no problems at all and I make sure to recommend this checking account to anyone.

name: John Williams
review: I have been banking with Chase for about 10 years. Recently I had an overdraft and the accompanying fee. I am paid monthly and was therefore unable to place money in the account before a week had passed and was charged an additional $15. I called the customer service number and discussed with them my situation. I agreed that the $35 overdraft fee was all on me but asked that they remove the extra $15. They agreed without a problem. Also, because it is a nationwide bank, it is always easy to find a branch or ATM where ever I travel.

name: Randi Kurliak
review: I had a pretty good experience with Chase. The monthly fee is waived as long as you direct deposit 500+ in your account every month. The overdraft fees are a little crazy at 34 a pop, but those only happen if you overdraft over 5 dollars. Luckily, Chase will refund 3 of those overdraft fees a year! I would bank with them again.

name: Rebekah White
review: This card is a great card, depending on what exactly you are looking for. I especially enjoy the rewards programs, as it makes it much easier to fly. My biggest complain is that it is difficult to find flights that I am looking for when I want them--though this isn't really a complaint of the card directly, more so for the airline itself. I would highly recommend this card to anybody I know because it is easy to use and accepted pretty much everywhere in the country that accepts major credit cards. Signing up and getting approved is also very easy.

name: Shalita Trulove
review: This card has produced a very satisfactory experience.  I have had little issues with the customer service and have always been provided accurate information.  The interest rate was reasonable for someone who had limited credit experience.  They also have a great fraud protection program.  I had random unauthorized charges from a completely different country on my card.  Chase contacted me immediately to remove the charge from my account.  The opportunity for balance transfers is a nice benefit as well.   Most have an introductory rate of 0 percent for the first 12 months and easily accessible.

name: Alicia
review: I typically use the Discover IT card. Compared to the Discover IT card, the Hyatt Credit Card seems to have some great offerings. First of all, the Hyatt card offers free 2 nights stay after spending $1,000 within the first three months. This would be easy enough to do if you use your credit card to pay bills. This would be great for anyone who likes to travel. Compared to the Discover IT card, however, it doesn’t seem to have the same incentives for those who just like to earn rewards for purchases such as gas, department stores, etc. The Discover IT card offers different earning potentials quarterly in different categories. The Hyatt card is focused more on on earnings for hotel stays. This, however, would be great for frequent travelers.

name: Andrea Janczyk
review: I opened the Chase +1 student card because I wanted to start building credit. I applied for another Chase card with better benefits and was denied because I didn't have a credit history so I signed up for this card and was accepted. The rewards aren't great since you can only redeem the points for things like music and movies rather than cash back or travel points, but it is a good card for getting started. The application process was simple and there is no annual fee. The late payments are average so just make sure you pay it off in time. If you are eligible to get another card because you have good credit then don't get this card, but if you don't have credit or it isn't great, this is a good card to start building credit with.

name: Ritu Choudhary
review: i am using chase credit card from almost three years and i just love this card. it give 5% cash back on purchase of different items on amazon.com, gas station and restaurants so this card can be called money saver card. it gave me $100 bonus on $1000 purchase in first three months from account opening. This was easy as you would easily spend that much on a card. You will have to wait for the offer in the mail to avail this offer. The customer service of this card is really good they fix your issues as soon as possible. of all the credit cards i have this card have the lowest APR and it give 0% APR for the first 15 months. there is no annual fee on this card and plus your reward never expire as long as you don't close your account. it have a foreign transaction fee so i just remind myself to leave this card at home while traveling.

name: Anne Taenamyr
review: This is a great reward program.  The incentives are nice, and the amount of points per dollar is very attractive.  And with no limit on earning or redeeming points it makes it a go to card.  The rates and fees seem to be average with other credit cards, but the anal fee seems to be a littler higher than some other cards.  In general it seems like it would be a good card for some one who travels a lot and uses Marriott, but if you do not plan to travel often there may be other options that don't have such a large fee attached to them.

name: Michelle Handy
review: I have had my Chase Freedom credit card for two years now and have never had any major problems. I do online banking and I find their site really simple to use. What's more, I travel internationally regularly and have always found it super easy to call and put a notice on my card so that I can use it abroad. In some countries, you need a pin number rather than a signature if you would like to use the card and Chase Freedom details how to set that up for American card holders when asked. My card has never been refused anywhere, especially because Visa is a widely-accepted card.  Their terms are reasonable and I haven't had any complaints yet.

name: Martin Williams
review: All the fees listed with this card and benefits appear to be standard within the industry. This would be a very valuable card for someone living near a Disney resort or a family with young children. It would be wise to take advantage of the 0% APR for the first 6 billing cycles (usually months) if taking a Disney vacation, which would be the ideal time to apply for one of these. I'm not sure how useful this would be outside of a Disney vacation however, so I would just use it and pay it off before the end of the 6 promo billing cycles.

name: John Leverette
review: D O N T G E T

name: Patty Garcia
review: I like the Chase Liquid Prepaid card because it is a Visa so it can be accepted pretty much anywhere. Also the card can be linked to a Chase account which is super convenient especially for me since I have been a Chase customer for so long. The zero liability protection is an awesome added benefit as well because not every prepaid card offers this.The only disadvantage I see is the $2 ATM fee and the monthly service fee if you don't have a Chase account. My current prepaid card Netspend does not charge a monthly service fee but its ATM fees are similar to the Chase Liquid Prepaid. Also Netspend does not offer a large variety of ATM locations likes Chase does.

name: Cason King
review: Having been a Chase credit card holder for years now, I was very interested in the Chase Slate card.  It has no annual fee and competitive interest rates.  Then I realized the card offers no rewards.  Are you kidding?  Even the most basic credit cards have some kind of rewards program.  If you’re not interested in rewards, this may be the card for you, but you’re really wasting your effort because there are plenty of no fee cards out there that offer rewards (including the Chase Freedom card).

name: Chatana Krebs
review: In shopping for another credit card I would not choose this one. Currently I have the Capital One Quicksilver card which I love. I enjoy getting straight cash back on all purchases that can be used whenever and wherever I want, rather than a confusing point system like the sapphire card. I also do not like that there is a $95 dollar fee after the first year. After reviewing this card it will most likely not be the one that I choose.

name: Roberta Wright Lantz
review: I have had a Chase Total Checking Account for a year now, and I have had no customer service problems. It has been hard to keep the $1500 minimum in the account, but Chase is the most convenient bank to deal with. The bank and ATM locations are frequent and easy to find. Almost any town you go to has a Chase bank. And all of the personnel I have met are kind and helpful.

name: K K
review: I chose to open a CD through Chase because I already do my regular banking through them. I appreciate that, if I have an issue, I don't have to sit on the phone with customer service and endure long hold times--I can just go down to my local branch and speak with a customer service associate in person. When I first opened the CD, I did it in person and had a lot of questions. I think there's a higher level of trust when you're looking someone in the eye, and you have their business card in case you have problems. Overall, I've been very happy with the CD and the service Chase provides. I recommend going to your local branch to open a CD  in person so that you can get personalized service and have all your questions answered at once.

name: Dexter Garner
review: I've had this account for almost 10 years.  I was not always charged a fee but when you are, $12 can really sting.  It's not easy to maintain over $1,500 in a checking account.  With that said, living in New York City without a Chase account is just asking for a hassle in a town with so many other things to hassle you.  I like the convenience of an ATM or Branch location just about everywhere so I NEVER pay ATM fees.  In the time I've had this account and I actively use my debit card I have been fortunate to not have been hit with double purchases, or heavy fraud.  Chase's customer service also goes above and beyond to rectify any issues I may have had.  I've gotten a few Overdraft fees refunded and balance text alerts are truly life savers.  I guess in regard to the high monthly fee, you get what you pay for.

name: Colby Phillips
review: The potential up front bonus on this card is really good. An extra $125 for purchases I was already going to make and and adding an additional authorized user. The APR rate is also lower than most other cards. However, after the initial bonus, the reward rate isn't that great. It would take awhile to rack up many points at this rate.

name: Colby Phillips
review: The rewards of this card are very attractive. I don't know of another credit card that will give you money as soon as you are approved without any other stipulations. A free $30 right off the bat and cash back for any other purchase. If you use Amazon a lot, this card will rack up points quickly. The reward point rate is a minimum of 1% cash back, which is in line with other top credit card rewards. The APR is also lower than many other cards that I have used.

name: Kyllein MacKellerann
review: No annual fee, yes,  Appx 25% credit interest, yes.  Remember, there are two versions, the Rewards card and the Store Card.

name: john
review: I am very happy with my Chase Total Checking account. My account manager has been very helpful since day one.

name: George Baumgartner
review: I have had my Chase Freedom credit card for years.  I have found their terms to be excellent.  They often have offers to borrow money for a year at very low interest rates.  The cash back and rewards program has been easy to use and to redeem the awards.

name: Danielle Davis
review: This card has been great for us. We always pay it off before we pay interest, but because of the mileage points that you earn, we charge almost anything we can on it. We've had it for about 2 years now, and have saved up almost 4 round trip tickets, which we will use to go to Hawaii. We have never had any issues with this card, and would highly recommend anyone needing to fly occasionally, to use this card...and save up your miles! Using any other charge card is just wasting your time. Earn miles, it's the way to go!

name: Meghan Harrington
review: I have been a Chase customer since 2000. I never had an issue with this bank until recently. They always had superior customer service and I had no complaints. Recently, however, I have been very disappointed with Chase. For the past 3 months, I have received a six dollar fee on my checking account. I called them and it is because I did not have the appropriate amount of money ($1000) in my checking account. I am very confused because I have never had $1000 in my checking but have never been fined before. I will be closing my account this weekend and moving my money to my other bank, Bank of America. I wish Chase had been more transparent about their apparent fees.

name: Alex Karabinis
review: I love the fact that there is no annual fee, those days are hopefully over.  The APR is pretty good and the cash back amount is amazing.  I love the various categories and how they do not change.  The fact that I can use my cash back rewards and put it back in to the balance is great because they do not limit how much I can use.  It could be $1 or $100 they don't care.  Free money is great.  They are quick to up your limit if you need/want and their customer service is fantastic.

name: Roberta Wright Lantz
review: I have used my Chase Freedom credit card often and have never had any problems with it in stores or online. The customer service is informative and courteous. The fees and apr are affordable. The cash back and rewards programs are not hard to achieve so you feel like you get something back! I will continue to use this card in the future, and will recommend it to anyone who asks me about credit cards!!

name: Miranda Matuszewski
review: I had both a checking and a savings account at Chase back when I lived in Denver and they were one of the better banks I've done business with.  Their customer service was (aside from maybe one or two phone calls) always fantastic  (especially at the branch I visited most frequently where "my banker" worked) and when I would go into a branch, I was helped in a quick, efficient, and respected manner. As with most businesses, their in-person is always better than over the phone, but that was generally good with Chase, too. I wasn't told of the monthly fees that I was to incurr with my accounts (as a matter of fact I was actually given the wrong amount I would be charged when I was first inquiring about the fees); when I went in to find out what the fee charge was and why it was so much, the banker was unable to reduce or remove the fee despite my being misled.  Though that was a bit of a pain in my side, those were really the only issues I had with Chase, and I would go back if it were as convenient for me (location wise) as my current bank.

name: Khan Khan
review: At 15.99% the APR is what most cards are offering. The really bad part is the Penalty APR, almost 30%. So if you miss a payment and get subjected to the penalty rate almost 1/3 of your payment would be interest. This card has chip and sign which is a good security feature, should virtually eliminate unauthorized transactions. This card has an annual fee which is terrible.  However if you travel often, the card might be worth it to you, Since you earn towards free airline tickets.

name: Maria Francesca
review: If you are a traveler, you need this card. Even if you don't travel often, this is a good card to consider having because if you work the card for the points, for example use it at restaurants, and spend $2,500/year eating out (approximately $200/month which if you have a family isn't unreasonable) that will give you one free room in addition to your anniversary room. If you spend $5,000 over the course of the year on other items, then you have three free rooms and can make a mini-vacation out of it. Hotels in the NY metro area are expensive and where I live in NJ, a Hyatt room can go for close to $200/night. So the room benefits are definitely useful. The downside on this card is the interest rate and annual fee. If you pay the card off in full each month, you'll avoid the 16% interest rate, but for many people that is impossible. The other downside is the $75 annual fee. American Express charges a similar annual fee, but they have many more opportunities for earning points and you have to pay the full balance at the end of every month so you aren't stuck with a looming interest-accruing balance. Overall, this is a card I would keep in my arsenal of credit cards, but I'd have to work hard to make it a benefit for me as I don't travel often.

name: Dane Jespersen
review: This card works at every retailer.  We have had no problems with it being accepted.  The rates are not bad, and the rewards program was giving us cash back for a while, which was really nice.  We'd hear nothing about it for a while, and then redeem our points and get $200 back, which felt good, and so we'd keep using this card.  We got rid of our other cards.

name: Sean Hurley
review: Just out of curiosity,  why only 3 stars?

name: Logitech Scotch
review: The first time when I looked at this card I thought no way! A chase card for bard credit. I like the fact that it didn't have an annual fee so I didn't have to pay anything every year. Also I liked that the card was so small and easy to fit in my wallet compared to other cards. But what I hate is the smart chip. It almost never works when you need it. Also all the minor stores don't have coverage for the chip so it is basically worthless.

name: joseph owens
review: I'll be honest, some of the incentives are pretty nice, like the 6 free nights.  The bonus points are a nice gesture too, but all in all it's nothing special. I know the hilton rewards credit card offers the same incentives with increased points (which are more valuable), and a full week of free nights, immediately upon approval. This card is good, and I'm not saying don't buy it, but it isn't the best.

name: Jane Schaeper
review: I recently opened this checking account with Chase as I had been dissatisfied with my previous bank. However, I cannot say my experience has been pleasant by any means. Like many have noted I did not realize you would be charged a maintenance fee for keeping the account open if you did not have a certain amount in direct deposit. I do solely freelance work and typically get paid in cash or personal checks so while I thought these deposits would count they did not and I have been charged fees just to keep the account open. At this point I feel stuck until I can find something more reasonable for someone in my situation. Also I have at times struggled to find ATM machines in easy to access locations, this is also very annoying.

name: Lakeisha Morrison
review: I had this account all 4 years of my college life. I never knew that it was charging me monthly prices just to have the account open. After the 4th year I realized how much money they were taking out each year and I could of saved it. When i signed up for the checking account they never told me about charging monthly fees. The fact that I had to have $1500 just to not get charged monthly is crazy.

name: Jonathan Corona
