review: Having a Chase savings account has been a pleasure for me ever since i stepped in the bank and opened up an account last year. First of all, their ease of use and top of the line customer service makes it a no brainer to go with them and get started. Second of all, their security is top notch and they will help you with just about any issue you have no matter how difficult it may seem. I love the mobile banking and the low monthly rate which makes having an account with them a breeze. I have been a loyal customer of Chase and will continue to be because of my great experience with them.

name: Jonathan Corona
review: I have been using a checking account with Chase for over a year now. They are a great bank to use if you ever want a reliable checking account with little to no issues. The biggest issue i ever had there was once when i went to withdraw money, and the ATM machine gave me exactly $200 extra without deducting the charge from my account balance. It felt pretty sweet to receive extra free money, but i returned it regardless in case it was going to cost me later. Anyways, having a Chase checking account is very convenient and hassle free for the most part.

name: Tim Doherty
review: The Disney Rewards Visa card sounds like a good idea for those who always use their credit card to make purchases. The 1% reward for every purchase is quite good as is the 15.99% standard APR rate. As a bonus to those with a family, you can use to redeem towards a Disney vacation. As an additional incentive you get 50 bucks in your pocket for your very first purchase. Seems like a good card with pretty good benefits and low rates.

name: Jessica Blankemeier
review: This card is a great option for folks who aren't ready to open a checking account, but would like a way to pay bills online and shop with a card instead of cash. The backing of Chase bank means you get the protection of Zero Liability for any unauthorized card transactions and you can reload the Chase Liquid Prepaid Card at Chase banks and Chase ATM's. The $4.95 monthly fee is lower than other Prepaid cards like the READYdebit Visa and will be waived when you are ready to open a qualified checking account with Chase. The only drawback is the $2 ATM transaction fee. Make sure you plan ahead to reload or get cash by going to a Chase bank during business hours instead of using the ATM. The good news is that there isn't a signature or PIN fee, so you don't get charged every time you shop unlike other prepaid options.

name: Dana C Gibson
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is a well-known company that has been around for quite some time.  They have good interest rates and offer excellent benefits.  I love the fact that there are no fees for foreign transactions.  The only thing I don't like is the fact that there is an annual fee for the card after your first year.  I don't like having to pay for a credit card, even one that has great benefits.

name: Jamie Bruno
review: My first Chase card was the Chase Slate card when I didn't have great credit. I was surprisingly accepted but the credit limit I began with was only $1000 which was really low. The rewards aren't anything great but it does have some decent features such as the $0 annual fee and the smart chip is awesome however, not all stores have the smart chip reader so then you have to swipe the card defeating the purpose. A card that is way better in rewards is the Chase Freedom. The rewards are awesome and the introductory bonus is if you spend $500 in the first three months you get $100 cash back. Definitely prefer the Freedom card over the Slate card if you are looking for better rewards since you also get unlimited 1% cash back on all purchases.

name: Rod Waldrip
review: I have had a Chase card for over 15 years. My experience with this card has been extremely good. I have never had a error in billing or an incorrect charge to the card. The interest rate is competitive, however there are no rewards offered. Just a good solid credit card. Service has been excellent with knowledgeable representatives. I have appreciated the care shown when traveling recently without notifying Chase. They contacted me to confirm unusual charges immediately.

name: Nora Busmane Gillis
review: I got this card for the benefits with United and it's definitely been great for that. The premier boarding was very useful before I got status and free bags definitely make a difference for family trips. I love that they added the free foreign transactions feature since it's the only card I have that offers that. Getting Untied Club passes once a year is not bad either even though I usually find my experience at the clubs not so great. Haven't had any major issues with them at all.

name: Scotch Tape
review: I really love this card. The rewards program for this card is so benefiting that sometimes I forget to even redeem my points. What I really love about this card is its customers service toll line since other credit cards such as the Capital One card which has a very horrible customer service.

name: Melissa Mitchell
review: This is a great card to have to receive points for purchases. Unlike the Amazon Store Card, You get a $30 credit to use right away vs. a $10 credit. The APR is potentially lower than with the Amazon Store Card depending on your credit. The point system is great to have. You earn 3 points per dollar spent on Amazon, 2 points per dollar on gas, restaurants, and drug stores, and 1 point per dollar spent on everything else. You can't go wrong with this great card!

name: Simran Kaur
review: I have had chase cards ever since I was opened my first back account in Chase. I have used the Chase Freedom, ink, slate, blueprint and others. But out of all the cards I found this card very weird. The credit limit for starters is really low for this card if you have so-so credit. Then there is the application process. It takes forever and is so frustrating that I had to call customer care to cancel my request. I filled out the application again and all I got was a card with a $1000 limit. That is nothing compared to other cards. The only thing I like about this card is the rewards program which is alright if you make purchases everyday using this card.

name: Jonathan Corona
review: What i love about having this credit card is that the customer service is unbeatable compared to other banks i have dealt with in the past. Another thing that i like about the Chase Sapphire credit card is that there is no over the limit fees in case you spend a little too much without knowing. There is also no annual fee for the first year which is an added bonus. This is a credit card you will love.

name: Gabriel Davitadi
review: I APPLIED AND RECEIVED THE CARD WITH $500 CREDIT LIMIT (MY CREDIT SCORE 760) AND LATTER FOUND OUT THEY PULLED CREDIT REPORT FROM EXPERIAN TWICE FOR SAME APPLICATION. THEY REFUSED REMOVE SECOND INQUIRE. "BY APPLYING YOU AUTHORIZE US TO PERFORM HARD INQUIRIES AS MANY TIMES WE NEED" THEY PROCEDURE TO PULL 2 TIMES FOR VERIFICATION PURPOSES. AFTER ALL I GOT 2 INQUIRIES ON ALL CREDIT BUREAU USELESS $500 CREDIT LIMITS PLASTIC

name: Sara Hash
review: This is a great card.  I do a lot of shopping on Amazon, so the rewards were especially appealing to me.  When I signed up, I got a $65 bonus Amazon gift card to spend immediately.  The reward system is hassle-free, unlike many other cards.  Each month, your points are converted into a dollar reward which can then be used immediately toward Amazon purchases, or you can wait until you have $20 accrued and apply it as a payment toward your credit card balance.  Very convenient.  And the rewards are nice.  3% on Amazon purchases, 2% on gas, dining, drug stores, 1% on everything else.

name: Alexa Haygood
review: I have been using the Ink Bold Business Card for a few months now and I love the rewards I get from it.  I travel frequently so the 2x rewards is nice. I also have a Capital One Quicksilver credit card. With that card I get 1.5% cash back. So I like the cash back with the Ink Bold Business Card much better. I shop a lot on Amazon, so getting rewarded for doing that is just another extra bonus!

name: Joann Frazier
review: I have been a chase customer for over 7 years and they have been a great bank to me. With free checking and savings, you can't go wrong.  Additionally they offer loan services and credit card services, which I have taken advantage of. My credit card introductory rate was 0% interest for 12 months.  I did a balance transfer on to the card and it has saved me a lot of money in the last 6 months! Their customer service is great too! They have representatives on the phone available 24 hours a day for your convenience.

name: Ryan Ruiz
review: I recently signed up for chase savings about 3 months ago and have had no problems since signing up. I signed up to the basic savings account which anyone can sign up for as long as you are a member of chase bank. The interest rates are not that good and there are fees you do have to pay unless you meet certain requirements to have the fees waived. One of the requirements is having at least $300 in the account or have at least one automatic transfer per month into the account. If you do not meet these requirements there is a $25 fee per month till you do. Regardless of the fee's I would still recommend opening a savings account with Chase due to the fact that there are Chase banks almost everywhere in the Chicagoland area and every branch that I have been to has always been very helpful.

name: Ryan Ruiz
review: I have been banking with chase for about 5-6 years now and I have never really had many issues while banking with them. The most serious issue I dealt with was back in December of last year when my debit card was stolen. Chase quickly notified me that there was unusual activity and quickly canceled the card. I received a new card that same day. All in all I would say if you live in the Chicagoland area, your best bet is to bank with Chase.

name: Simran Kaur
review: I really believe that this is the most useful card out there. It has a really nice credit limit so when you own a business there is no problem for spending a little too much money. The other thing that I like is that you get 5% cash back and a bonus for spending $4999 in your first 4 months.

name: Logitech Scotch
review: I really love this card. The rewards program for this card is awesome. The best way to make use of this card is to make it your everyday use card. You can make really easy points when you buy coffee in the morning and pay with this card. Also you can use this card when making heavy amounts of purchases.

name: Jennifer Franco
review: This card is alsome l like it

name: Danielle Alonzo
review: I haven't had any problems with Chase or the Freedom card and I have been happy with my choice. I was offered the 0% APR for 15 months and I am close to coming to the end of that promotion. They do offer 5% cash back rewards on different types of purchases each quarter which is an added bonus. This month alone I've earned about $25 just for using my card at Starbucks where I usually pay cash. I do know the interest will be quite high once my 0% is over so I am not looking forward to that but overall this card is a great credit option.

name: Bonnie McCarty
review: Chase’s Disney Rewards Visa is a great card for Disney fanatics!  The actual rewards for using the card are fairly typical, with 1% of purchases being returned as a credit on a reward card to be used toward Disney vacation package, park, or store purchases.  However, the Disney perks make it a great card for Disney lovers.  If the card has no balance and you charge your Disney vacation package to it, you receive 6 months interest-free financing.  When you arrive at Disneyland or Disney World, be sure to take your card with you since you get some special perks with it: They offer a special character meet just for Disney Rewards cardholders, and you even get a free print from it!  You can also receive a 10% discount on purchases of $50 or more in some of the stores and restaurants there, and a 15% discount on some of the park tours.  It's definitely a card worth having, to help you save for your Disney trip and then get some nice benefits during the vacation!

name: George Green
review: This card is mainly for those who travel a lot in a given year. Which is perfect for me. The points seem to add up quickly, and there are various way to use them, and other bonuses that make the unfortunate annual fee after the first year well worth it. While my Marriott Rewards had a much larger bonus point allotment for signing up, the over all value of those points don't add up to the value of this card. That and interest rate is much better.

name: Jaron Castilleja
review: I signed up for this credit card initially because I only had 1 before this and I needed a balance transfer. Mint recommended that I sign up for Slate due to a 1 year no interest deal, and I decided that I would pay it off in full before interest kicks in at the end of August of next year. So far I am well along in my goal and it seems like I will actually be able to pay it off before accruing any interest. If there is a downside to this card I would say that the interest fees are kind of high.

name: Sarah Bolton
review: I think this card offers some good rewards but for a very specific user. If you are one to frequently use British Airways and travel often, then the miles accumulated with the card are nice. The bonus miles when you spend $2000 in the first 3 months are nice, as well as the basic miles rate. The Smart Chip technology is a great feature, allowing you make chip based purchases unlike most cards. I think the interest rates are a little high considering the average purchase amount of an airline ticket, but otherwise, the rewards are nice for a frequent user!

name: Ian Goodwin
review: The Mariott Rewards Credit Card is a great credit card. The bonus for spending $1000 in the first three months is virtually unbeatable. The rewards benefits are great too, especially if you are a frequent traveler or are staying at hotels often. This card is also widely accepted at almost every location. While these are great, there are some downsides like a high APR, so be sure to be responsible when using this card. Also, an annual fee kicks in after the first year, so if you do not like the card or you are not using it to take advantage of the bonuses; cancel it!

name: Jackie Fillinger
review: I opened up a checking account after I divorced my husband to start learning to deal with debts etc. Chase Total Checking gave me peace of mind/ The customer service was very friendly and helpful.I didnt know where to start because my ex always took care of these things.I was so pleased knowing I had help. They are in my eyes, the best bank there is. I am still a very happy customer and now that I have a child in college, I plan on continuing with this bank and start her own checking account as well.. I am very pleased with the overall pleasure Case has given me and my family. I would truly recommend Chase Total Checking to anyone and I brag to all those who will listen.Thank you for making me feel like a valued customer

name: Jackie Fillinger
review: The Disney  Credit Card was a blessing when I took my family on vacation this year. With children and grandkids wanting things and such. This card is a must have if you love Disney as much as I do. You get a reward for purchasing at Disney, their merchandise and meals. That alone is amazing. First off with the Disney Rewards Visa Card you get Get a $50 Disney Gift Card after first use of the Disney Rewards Card. How cool is that!! The only thing I will say is that it does have a high interest rate. My suggestion would be if you purchase something, pay it off as soon as you can. Other than that. I think you be just as pleased as I am. Thank you!

name: Anna Dukes
review: I have only recently started doing business with this bank, but I have had a wonderful experience so far. My only complaint is that the interest on the cards seem to be a bit high. But the application process, payment options, and website have all been made very user friendly.

name: Amanda Gerry
review: I actually owned this card when it first surfaced into the bank market.  I really needed to build some credit for myself and figured prepaid was the way to go.  My family uses chase so I figured I would give them a try.  I signed up for the Chase Liquid Prepaid Card more as a last resort to help my credit.  The monthly fee for me was a killer especially because I had to pay a two dollar transaction fee every time I went to get some money.  I kept with it for a few months but after awhile I just closed it and moved on.   Although it didn't work out for me the card itself did have some good points.  You could pay your bills, receive direct deposit, they have a zero liability plan, and you could get cash back.  So who knows maybe it'll work for you.

name: Brandon Olson
review: Well, I typically mind my own business with blogs and reviews but I HAVE to comment here. I am one of those people who owes a bank from old overdrafts (embarrassing) a few years ago. I have not been able to open a regular checking account since. Lets be real here everyone, I think the comments throughout these reviews regarding a 4.95 monthly fee being too high is outrageous. For 4.95, those of us with bad bank history that need an account for DD, branch check deposits, ATM (with no fees), and he use of your Visa EVERYWHERE are getting quite the deal. Not only that, but who cares if the bank allows overdrafts, all that does is cost money, lots of money. Thank you CHASE, finally an option that works for me to do my banking, without overdrafts, and the embarrassment of trying to open a  account at a bank and get denied.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: This card won't help rebuild your credit history it won't show in credit reports not even if you have a million dollar in it

name: Simran Kaur
review: I really love this card. It has 0% APR for the first 15 months on a purchase. So when ever I buy something expensive this card helps me payback but with no tension . I love the fact that my reward points never expire meaning I can save up and use them for something big. Somethings that I would change are the card design. The design has been the same for quite a long time and it looks very boring. The card should be made out of steel. Overall this is an excellent card.

name: Sherman MooMoo
review: As someone who travels abroad often I like the fact that this is a chip card.  I know others are starting to roll them out but having recently been in Malaysia without a chip card, it made things difficult and frustrating.  I am a fan of the 0% intro rate and transfers for 15 months and no annual fee.  While a max APR of 22.99% isn't great it's still better than half the cards currently in my wallet - and that's the high end of the spectrum (assuming you don't trigger the penalty APR).  A rewards card would sweeten the deal but otherwise this is a good card for those looking to add to a card portfolio.

name: Jessy Smoote
review: This Chase Sapphire Preferred  card has a lot of good things to it (if you can qualify). Customer service is good which leaves a lot to say for other cards that answer in India?. There is no over the limit fee. Which is good for forgetful people. Cash advance is okay. No foreign fee.Cons: Can not get a response online. The APR cash advance is high. The late fee is $35 but I guess that's normal.Can't play with paying the card late. And only a 21 grace period is okay.

name: Jimmy Lussier
review: Very good card if you shop at Amazon a lot. The $50 Gift Card they give you is very nice and I'm already racking up the reward points. If you shop at amazon often you have no reason not to have this card unless you're forgetful and don't pay your bills on time.

name: Zack Tonch
review: I really enjoy using this card. With the lower interest rate and fast approval, I was able to get the textbooks that I needed. Also, the rewards that come with it are great. They are instantly loaded to your account and are able to be used right away. The only downfall is that the rewards are readily available on Amazon instead of just cash, so it would be nice to have a cash rewards option.

name: Kevin Gilbert
review: My Chase Sapphire card has been pretty good to me. I try to stay on top of my payments with auto-pay but it’s nice that they extend a longer grace period than most institutions (despite it being a moot point for me). The penalty APR is not particularly friendly however (29.99%) so it was a no-brainer to put auto-pay into effect. I also found the customer service to be very helpful when I went abroad and they gave me a pro-tip to avoid foreign transaction fees (always ask to be charged in US dollars). All in all, a very quality credit card that’s been helpful in building my credit even further.

name: Lisha Broome
review: Shipping with added incentives seems to be one of th most popular ways to keep a business alive!  The application incentivethrough Amazon is quite attractive.   As attractive as the added points per dollar and having a seperate card for online transactions gives me more added security while spending onilne.    Amazon shipping and services have been amazing through this last holiday season and am excited to spend more next year through Amazon.com's amazing nework!

name: Sabina Hunt
review: I have been using Chase slate card for the past 2 years and it has served my needs really well.  It offers great APR and the 0% for 15 months is just a life saver.  I had my bag stolen from my work place and my credit card was used without my authorization.  I placed a call to Chase and they cancelled the card immediately and wrote off the charges that was not authorized.  The customer service is great and it gave me confidence when using this card!

name: Jared Peterson
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred card is a fantastic credit card. It does have an annual fee of $95 after the first year, so I can only recommend it to people who charge a lot of money to the card. Another bonus is that it doesn't charge fees for transactions in other countries, so if you travel a lot, consider this card. I have had excellent experiences with customer service for this card. I have received calls within the hour of there being  questionable transactions and if I approve of them or not.  I also have had my wallet stolen and I was able to call to cancel the card with about a 5 minute phone conversation and the new card showed up in the mail in about one week. Overall pros: Great customer service, high credit limits, good rewards program, chip embedded card is convenient for certain scannersCons: Annual fee. The chase freedom card could be a good suggestion if you don't spend the necessary amount of money every year to consider the annual fee to be negligible. Verdict: It's 4 stars to the average consumer who uses the card for groceries and personal items because the annual fee is too much. It's 5 stars for business people, travelers, and people that spend a lot of money. The card security is great, the rewards are great, and the credit limit is high.

name: Harald Hecklemen
review: This credit card has been useful while I have been in college. Typically, I have used it to purchase my books at the beginning of the semester. I try and pay it off as soon as I can. I have never had any problems with poor customer service. Also, I have never been late on a payment but the late fee is not awful. Overall, I highly recommend this card for any student.

name: Khan Khan
review: Like most credit cards there is a rather high APR for purchases and cash advances. It has excellent rewards program. The signup bonus is basically a 20% cash back reward. Which is the highest I've seen recently. Unlike other reward cards that only give you 1% cash back, Chase gives you 5% back in selected categories. You just have to remember to enroll every 3 months. This is an excellent card so anyone who can pay off their balance in full every month. If you are able to do that Chase is paying you to use the card.

name: Anatoliy Anchakov
review: I really like that there are no Fee's for the first year and then after the first year there is a $95 fee for every year. I also like the rewards program. Any purchase you make is 1 point for every $1 spent and then 5 points back on selected items. Late fee is $39 which seems reasonable. Overall a great card for a business!!!!!

name: Sean Clancy
review: I've had my account since 2008. When I got the account it was with Washington Mutual and my account was automatically switched to Chase after Washington Mutual collapsed and Chase aquired the assets. One problem I've had is it seems like the level of customer service has declined since the Washington Mutual days.  Also when I had to dispute a charge because a restaurant charged me twice, Chase made it very difficult to do so. I kept getting passed from person to person on the phone and it took me over an hour to get the issue resolved. Also the phone operators were very rude. Everything else about this checking account is just average. Make sure not to have an overdraft because you'll be smacked with a thirty five dollar fine. If I remember correctly when I got this account there was no monthly fee, but now there is which is disappointing.

name: ASLDF
review: I’ve been using the basic Chase Savings account for a few years now and I couldn't be happier. Because of the .01% interest rate,  I enjoy that my money I actually making money. I’ve set up a money transfer every week which keeps my savings account free and worry free. This savings account is also connected to my regular savings account so I can easily transfer money back and forth between the two. I also received an ATM card so I can access my savings at any Chase ATM. I love using this savings Account and what recommend my friends and family to do the same.

name: AJ Becquet
review: I love my southwest card, customer service is been great so far and you only have to spend $2,000.00 to get 50,000 points which is very easy considering I only use it to pay bills. Highly recommend this. You do have to have excellent credit though so it may be harder for others.

name: Brooke Jackson
review: My Chase Savings account has never given me any issues of any sort! I'm really not a fan of the low interest rate but considering the fact that I can go without paying the $4 fee and there are no hidden fees it's just a small issue in a pool of excellence. I love the simplicity of transferring money from my checking to savings account or vice versa. With just the click of a button online my money is where I want it to be. If that isn't convenient then I don't know what is!

name: Brooke Jackson
review: I love my chase total checking account! There are no hidden fees and thanks to my direct deposit I'll never have one. Also, when I joined the bank I was offered a promotion where they gave me $150 for setting up direct deposit. What an awesome deal! I'm so glad I switched to Chase and love my Disney card for discounts and promotions with Disney!

name: John Smith
review: I opened an account with this card for the specific reason of booking a few business travel trips with it. I am very happy I did that because it paid off to use the British Airways Visa over my regular visa card issued through my local bank.  The 50,00 bonus miles were a huge boost and I was able to put the miles towards a major trip I took which would have been impossible without the rewards miles.

name: Selena Edwards
review: Well this card definitely has some Great pros going for it. I really like the ability to earn points and the free hotel stays. I travel a little bit more these days than I ever used to, so these perks may come in handy for me. I like the fact that the points have no limits and can continue to accrue. I love the fact that it doesn't have a foreign transaction fee that is a major benefit. No over the limit fee is great as well as the 21 day grace period. Also, the 15.99% is a pretty good rate these days. In the past, I used CaptialOne and Hyatt card definitely offers benefits that CapitalOne does not.  However, Hyatt card does have some cons CapitalOne did not have balance transfer fees or no annual fee.  But all in all, I think Hyatt is a great card for people on the go that like to flight, travel and stay in hotels. You would definitely benefit from the no foreign transaction fee, I think it's worth it to get this card just for that benefit alone.

name: Nick Stojsavljevic
review: The Marriott Rewards card sounds like a very good deal to me, but it seems like a card for a big spender. I currently use a Capital One credit card for all my needs and it suits them perfectly. The Marriott card would be very good for someone who travels a lot and wants rewards for extended stays,  but the APR is a little high to use as an everyday spending card. The late fee is pretty low on your payments which would be good if you are a forgetful person.

name: Timothy Steele
review: The biggest complaint I have about my service experiences with Chase would definitely have to be the headache I received dealing with overdraft fees. The $35 charge in my opinion is pretty excessive and should be lower. Other than that, I have no real issues that I would consider notable. All in all I'd say Chase is about average on service and quality of customer care.

name: Julie Springate
review: I opened this account after I graduated college, but was able to not pay the fees because I am still a graduate student. I have always had a pleasant experience with Chase. I have this account, a savings account and two credit cards through Chase and have never been less than satisfied. I like the fact that Chase has a reliable mobile app that allows me to use my checking account to transfer money into my savings account or pay my credit card bills.

name: Joshua Peckham
review: The Disney Credit Card has a lot of potential to be a really good credit card. Right now it has a couple of desirable benefits, such as the instant $50.00 Gift card after the first purchase with new Credit Card,  the benefit of the 10% discount you can receive on certain merchandise, and the 15% off non-Discounted selected tours. But even with these benefits is the same as most credit cards, the cash advance rate is pretty steep for most and same with the late fee. These amounts are pretty expensive for the benefits you will be getting out of the credit card itself.

name: Simran Kaur
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred card has a lot of benefits for the purposed business person. It is an excellent card because it has no foreign transaction fees which is good if you work out of the country. Another good benefit that I love is the 24 hour a week service which is very patient. The people who work at the service center really help you out and never force you to do anything. Overall I love this card and it really gives you the best rewards that you don't get back from other cards since it has a really good cash back percentage. I love this card!

name: Teresa Hoffman Johnson
review: I have been very happy with this card. I like how easy it is to spend the rewards right on Amazon. I do have another card I prefer over this one, just because it is more flexible in what you can use the rewards for. I have had a credit on my account for over a year, and I would like it if they just sent the money instead of keeping it there. Overall though, I have been quite happy with the card and the service.

name: Cobra Mustang
review: This card is a real great money saver. I get 5% cash back on every purchase that I make. So I know that when I spend something I get something for shopping with chase. I really love this card and its a keeper.

name: Eric Hill
review: I was a Chase customer for over 7 years until I'd finally had enough. In 2005, shortly after unexpectedly losing my first job, they stacked the order of my checking account purchases in such as way as to cause the maximum number of overdraft fees when my balance ran into the negative (i.e. if a $0.50 pack of gum, a $2.00 comb and $20.00 worth of gas were purchased, they would deliberately rearrange the payment times so that the largest amount got withdrawn first, so that the maximum number of overdraft fees charges would be incurred). At first, I though it was my own poor luck but then, years later, I was notified of a class action settlement in which Chase was determined to have done this deliberately (and illegally) to THOUSANDS of customers. This is a TERRIBLE bank. Do yourself a favor and avoid them.

name: Cobra Mustang
review: I really love this Chase slate card. It is the perfect credit card for me. I expected it to be less worthwhile than the Ink Plus Business Credit Card by Chase which supported my style better since I own a private business. There are a lot of benefits available in this card. One is that the max late fee is very affordable. Some of the credit cards I used to have a really high fee. Another feature that I really liked was the security of the card. The smart chip in the card is a feature that I love in all of my chase cards. It protects my identity when I swipe at any store. This credit card is only made for those people who have really good credit and have a clean credit history. The result of this is that not everyone has this card meaning there is a less chance my credit card will be counterfeited.

name: Chris Dumly
review: I used to be a member of Chase for their checking account a few years ago. The banking itself wasn't bad, but compared to other services it just doesn't hold up. I consider free checking, as in, no fees at all, mandatory at this point. Chase offers free checking, but only if you have over $500 in your account I believe. At the time I didn't have that much in mine, so I had to pay a monthly fee, which really sucks. If you don't mind the monthly fee, Chase is a good bank to consider.

name: Jonathan Corona
review: I love the Chase Freedom credit card because it shows that you have an excellent credit score if you are carrying one around. I also like the $100 bonus you receive after spending $500 worth of purchases during the first three months of opening your account. Compared to other credit cards i have, i seem to use this one more than others as it also has 1% unlimited cash back on all purchases which makes me even happier. Also i never had a bad experience with any of their employees at any branch and all seem to be extremely friendly which is an added plus.

name: Joely Arias
review: Did you call for them to activate the $100 bonus or did it atomatically go in your account? Its been 3 months already since i applied and havent gotten no $100 bonus.

name: ASLDF
review: I've been using Chase bank as my main checking out for a few years now. I have been satisfied with the customer service over the phone and online. My questions are always resolved within the hour. My only real problem is the fact that you have to pay a monthly fee too use the checking account services, which I feel is unfair. Over all Chase is a good place to have a checking account. My money transactions are always easy & worry free. I will defiantly be staying with Chase.

name: Haley Martinez
review: I transferred to the College Checking account from my High School acount when I graduated from high school and turned 17. I don't incur the monthly fees because I am still in the 17-24 age range and have thus far been very impressed with the costumer service provided. There have been a couple of times now that either from my own error or purchases not going through on time, I have become overdrawn and hit with the automatic $34 fee. Each time this has happened I have been able to call the support line, explain my situation, and have the free removed. I do plan on staying with this account for quite some time.

name: ASLDF
review: I like the Chase Slate card. After doing my research on several other cards the 0% APT for 15 months sold me. Compared to my MasterCard who only gave me 6 months with 0% APR. I like the Grace period is 21 days instead of the 6 days i get for my MasterCard. I have seen other cash advance rates as high as 10%, so the Slate card's 3% was just another reason to sign up. I'm glad I did because i was approved within minute, with my card being delivered within 5 days. All in all i would recommend this card for people looking for a stress free experience with no hidden fees, or hidden percentage increases.

name: Kyle Taylor
review: Compared to similar cards like the American Express Bluebird prepaid card and others the Chase Liquid Prepaid card's qualifications seems a tad "stiff". A monthly fee of almost $5.00 plus a $2.00 a pop ATM Transaction fee? Of course the way around that is to get your cash back when making a purchase. The Zero Liability Protection and the ability to pay bills online is a nice bonus, but isn't that pretty much standard issue now? Actually a lot of the bonuses they tout are pretty much standard fare with cards now days. I don’t know of anyone that charges you for customer support anymore. If they ever did.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: There's no atm fee at chase atm they only charge you if you take money out of an atm not chase own. And all the debit cards charge you if you don't use the same bank that issue any card prepaid or not

name: Tony Lau
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred card has great potential for the right customer. First and foremost, people must be aware that although the first year is free, each subsequent year has an annual fee of $95. For the casual shopper, this is something you will not make back in rewards points, as opposed to something like the Capital One Quicksilver with 1.5% cash back and no annual fee. However, if you are a frequent traveler or a big spender, the earning potential as well as the up front bonus of 40,000 points can make it a great card. Furthermore, the lack of foreign transaction fees also is great for the frequent traveler. Finally, if you are someone who carries a balance on your card the APY is a decent option. Although not the best amongst cards, it definitely can be worth it over the Quicksilver, who's rates run more in the low to mid 20% range.

name: Justin Lyons
review: I've had my over two years to build bank credit so I could get a real account. Was told after one year of using them I would be Albe to upgrade . I havnt Ben allowed to and when I ask why they say " I DONT KNOW" me personally I believe it's bc they make 120$ a year from fees and when I take my money out at a atm ( there atm) I am charged also. This is a scam to charge you to use to your own cash. I left here and went to wells Fargo. Have same kinda build credit account but no fee or atm charge.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: In New York there's not that many Wells Fargo branches so if you use the card in other bank there will be fees to be paid no matter what and no liquid card won't help you build credit history it bank trust

name: Matt Brooks
review: The Chase Saphire Card is a great card to consider when looking to register for a new credit card. The rewards that are offered are an excellent way to benefit from everyday purchases that you already make. The reward that I am most fond of is the “2X points on dining at restaurants.” I love to eat out at restaurants, so the ability to earn twice the points while doing so is a huge positive for me. That, mixed with the fact that there are no limits on what you can earn and redeem makes this card a clear-cut winner in my book. I have to say that I could not be happier with my decision to choose this card.

name: Jim Fiene
review: I like Chase Bank in general, and especially this card. I agree with many of the other reviewers on the 0% rate for 15 months. I transferred my balance from another banks card to this card without any problems. Depending on the percentage rate I get after the initial 15 months, I will probably stay with Chase.

name: Jarett Crump
review: I've had the Chase Slate card for about a year and I have ZERO bad things to say about it thus far.  The opportunity to transfer balances for 0% APR for 15 months was great for me, and the rewards system it employs is very beneficial for how my wife and I shop.  We pay on the card every month, so we have not needed to utilize the 21 day grace period, but it's nice to know that it's there if we need it.  The icing on the cake for me is that, unlike other cards, there is NO ANNUAL FEE!  If you're looking for a card that offers a great balance transfer offer with good rewards, give Chase Slate a shot.

name: Casey DiMauro
review: I have a Chase freedom card and it has great fraud coverage and a great interest rate! I have had a card with them for two years now and my apr is only 14% which in comparison to all the other out there is a steal. I don't have to pay an annual fee for not using the card  much either which is nice because sometimes it sits in my purse for months. I am currently getting 5% back on my purchases and it does ad up. You don't have to read between the lines with Chase they are pretty up front with you. If you need a credit card this is a serious con-tester.

name: Carl Hafer
review: I love the card too.  My favorite hidden gem is that I can use the reward points directly on amazon.com.  It happened to pop up when I was making a purchase.  This is a great credit card to have, any credit card without a rewards program is just leaving money on the table.

name: Skip Harris
review: I opened a checking account recently and could not have been more pleased. The manager was so helpful. Ihad a previous charge off from six years ago which I had forgotten about well he was very courteous and was totallly professional about an embarrasing situation. He proceeded to help me straighten this out and reestablished a relationship with me.So needless to say I am now the proud owner of a Chase checking account it is easy to pay bills online check my balance and with direct deposit and paperless statements It is free of monthly fees.It is also easy to transfer money online thanks again Chase for your courteous and professional staff!!

name: Mark Webb
review: I've had my account for many years now and I like them.  They were one of the first accounts to add check deposit from their Android app, which makes it so I almost never have to go to the bank.  That's one of the benefits of going with one of the larger banks is that they're often the first to put money into new technology like that.  The one complaint I have with the service is that their online banking experience could be better. When I want to search for transactions that happened more than a couple months ago it can be a pain.

name: Amanda Jepson
review: I have been with Chase for about 6 years they have been great.  The checking account I have is free, as I was moved to Chase when they acquired WaMu and WaMu had free checking.  I have never really had an issue with any aspect of Chase's checking accoounts.  I also have a savings account and some credit cards through Chase.  Any time an issue has come up, it was promptly and politely handled by a Chase customer service representative.  There was an issue of a fraudulent charge on my account and it was handled very quickly and the money was back in my account within 2 business days.  I can't ask for a quicker response than that.While, I generally don't think they're the best in the business, they are certainly adequate and their checking account products meet my satisfaction.  I would have no problem recommending Chase to friends or family.

name: Zena Marie
review: So I had an account with wamu before it was chase that got automatically switched over. I'm probably a little biased. Wamu didn't charge anything whereas with chase its a 10$ fee each month. I guess I'm just not used to it and I didn't like that they didn't notify me beforehand. I also don't like that I cant link my chase account to xfer money over to ING which is where I had my savings account before. The chase savings I had to open had a way lower interest rate. I do however appreciate knowing that there's always a chase nearby. And its super convenient being able to deposit at any chase ATM.

name: Isabel Ongpin
review: I’ve just received my Chase Freedom credit card about a month and a half ago and I absolutely love it. I’ve had their Amazon.com card for several years now but wanted one more for everyday use. Aside from the aesthetics (the blue is so vibrant!), the rotating categories each quarter makes this a great go-to card for many different occasions. For this quarter, I have designated this card for grocery purchases to fully reap the 5% cash back rewards—which in turn has transformed me into more of a homebody as I’ve found that I cook at home way more often; that alone has saved me a substantial amount of money from going out to eat, which I used to do on a nearly daily basis.Another thing I liked about this card was the $100 cash back reward offer upon spending your first $500. It’s a solid credit card for everyday purchases, and it’s nice being rewarded for things you’d have to pay for in the first place anyway.

name: Haley Chase
review: I really like my Freedom card. Chase gave me 16 months of no interest use initially and a starting credit limit of $200. I wasn't to happy about the low credit limit, but I was young and had no credit anyways, so I understood. They have sense bumped up my credit every 6 months, now to a reasonable amount. I have had no issues with them and their support line is easy to navigate and the costumer service was really friendly. I have on a couple of occasions had to call in and request overdraft fees be removed (I honestly incurred these fees) and they always worked with me and removed the fees.

name: Janet Fufu
review: I love the Chase Sapphire Preferred card because it has all the benefits that I need! I got it because I travel often and it has no foreign transaction fees.  I also use the points that I earn while I travel for more travel! I can transfer the points to my airline easily.  For the first year, they don't make you pay the $95 annual fee.  The annual fee is pretty steep.  i was originally going to cancel it after the first year, but I like the other benefits too much.  It also is a very nice looking card - I get a lot of compliments on it!

name: Zach Vandenberg
review: The Chase Sapphire Card is an excellent yet simple rewards card.  I definitely like the points system because you can get more bang for your buck than a lot of cash back systems, especially if you dine out often. The best part is that the points never expire unlike the PNC Bank Points card for example.   The incentives of gaining bonus points after the first 3 months of having an account is great.  Things that I don’t like about the card include the relatively high APR max penalty and the multiplier of the bonus points is only related to dining out while other cards include groceries and gas now. However, those are small negatives and the points system is still an overall positive.  I also like that there is no annual fee on the card.

name: Dena May
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred card has great benefits. It's easy to earn 5,000 points right away! We found that it wasn't hard to rack up points if we used it for vacation and the appliances we didn't expect to buy right after Christmas. The interest rate is higher than I would like but all credit cards are getting that way. The transfer rate is really good. I like that we didn't pay an annual fee the first year while we were trying it. If you like it then you pay $95 per year. It's one of the things I do dislike. All is all, this card is great for the points and easy to use with easy access 24/7 if you need to reach someone about your card.

name: Amir Şervatdjoo
review: In my opinion, this credit card is the biggest rip off of the century. I've had it for a few years now and have collected over 200,000 miles. Now, I went to use it for travel, but British Airways charges some absurd amounts in fees. For example, a round trip from LA to Dubai on British Airways costs $1080.42 if I pay cash, including ALL fees and taxes. However, if I use my miles, they will charge me 90,000 miles plus $785 in cash for taxes and fees. Are these people crazy????? So they're charging me 90,000 miles for less than $300?? I just went to Kayak, and I can book a round trip flight to Dubai on those very same days for $775 total. In the past 4 years I paid $400 in annual fees and used this card more than any other card. Now feel like a complete idiot and completely robbed. Please do yourself a favor and don't get this card. I guarantee you will regret it. I will leave this review everywhere I can so others don't make the mistake I did.

name: Sanjay Khanna
review: Could you use your points on American Airlines? Please reply.

name: Caleb Kurtz
review: You can book with partner airlines on BA.com and not pay fuel surcharges or extra fees. IE: you can book a flights from LAX to HNL for only 25,000 avios.

name: Justin Alexander
review: I had had Chase a number of years ago, and absolutely swore I was never going to use their services again, after they had played a series of shady tricks to wring an incredible amount of fees out of me.  Fast forward a few years, and they've done a complete 180 with their business practices.  I now have a savings, checking and car loan with them, and I could not be happier with the level of service they provide.

name: Andrew
review: Chase College Checking is something I'm really glad I'm enrolled in. As a broke college student, I am happy to have zero monthly payments, Chase quick deposit, the best customer service and convenient ATM locations open 24/7. Even their phone support is the best I have seen. I feel like the employees truly care about my experience.They have helped me through a couple fraudulent transactions as well and reimbursed me for the losses. A+ Chase and I would highly recommend this service to all young people and college students as well.

name: Joe
review: I've been using Chase for about 3 years now. They are very fair. There have been no real interest rates but they do have a monthly overdraft protection fee of $10. That is so long as you deposit less than $500 a month into your account. There have been errors in the past made by them but they have always rectified the errors in a timely manner. They make quick depositing for friends and family easy if you share the same bank, so I enjoyed that. Overall I think they are a good choice if you're decent with money.

name: Nate Goldstein
review: The Chase Slate is a great card for just about anyone. They start you off with zero percent annual percentage rate for fifteen months or so. This includes transfers and purchases. It also has no annual fee at all. They also have a 21 day grace period which is really nice too. The foreign transaction fee is reasonable and the rates in general are reasonable. All in all, this card has some really great benefits and is worth giving a shot to if you want a good card with good benefits and a really nice cushion with the grace period.

name: Jim Fiene
review: I like Chase Bank in general, and especially this card. I agree with many of the other reviewers on the 0% rate for 15 months. I transferred my balance from another banks card to this card without any problems. Depending on the percentage rate I get after the initial 15 months, I will probably stay with Chase

name: Mirelys Perez
review: This card is good, if you have no credit or owe banks money because of over draft fees and they won't give you a card. It is VISA so you will probably be able to use it anywhere cards are accepted, unlike AMEX prepaid cards. But the $4.95 monthly fee is terrible, I personally wouldn't. You can find similar VISA cards, with the same benefits, and with no monthly fee. I also dislike the linking of your debit card to the prepaid card, it makes me uncomfortable. The only good thing is that Chase does have many ATMs and you'll probably never pay any fees on that. They also have excellent customer service.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review:
4.95 a month ? 
Not bad I think we spend more money if fancy coffe at Starbucks lol

name: Christopher Chartier
review: Overall very pleased with this credit card.  Rewards are competitive and can be redeemed as a credit on my monthly statement.  Only complaint is the rewards have been overall reduced since we first opened the card. (i.e. used to provide a bonus for waiting until cash back accumulated to $200 to redeem).  We never carry a balance or pay interest so cannot speak to competitiveness of interest rates or late fees.  We also take advantage of the quarterly bonus rewards categories.  Have also had very efficient and quality service when needing to dispute a transaction as well as impressive communication from Chase both during and after the dispute process.

name: Justin Sharick
review: The Marriott Rewards card sounds appealing, but I am skeptical.  The max penalty APR is VERY high, not to mention that after your first year there is a $45 annual fee.  I would be worried signing up for this card.  I do not have any hotel rewards credit cards, but I've heard great things about the Citi Hilton Honors card.  It has no Annual Fee and a similar APR.  The rewards sound just as good, if not better than the Marriott card.  I am currently looking for a credit card with rewards similar to this since I travel so frequently, and in my research so far I believe I would choose the Hilton card.  The Marriott card would be as competitive if it wasn't for that annual fee and high APR.

name: Kimberly Giles
review: Love, love, love this card!! I was originally debating on between this card and a Barclay card. After reading reviews on the sapphire, I decided to go with it. After adding an authorized user and spending over $3000.00 the first 3 months, I received $505.00 deposited right back to my bank account by paying for things I would have anyway. I love the benefits and also that there are multiple ways to get your rewards back, not just one way. The points add up very quickly and there is no limit to the rewards like some cards have. Highly recommended.

name: Martin Reed
review: This is a good credit card to have if you remember to activate the cashback bonus prior to each quarter. If you have other cashback credit cards that offer 'revolving rewards' like this one, it can be difficult to remember which card to use for certain purchases. Of all the credit cards I have, this one has the lowest standard APR (although this may vary for others). Unfortunately this card does have foreign transaction fees so I make sure I leave it at home when traveling abroad. I would particularly recommend this card for Amazon shoppers since one of the quarterly cashback periods usually offers 5% cashback on Amazon purchases.

name: Olga Zhuravleva
review: I currently use a Capital One card but because of my work I have to travel a lot. The Marriott Reward Credit Card is so much better when my Capital One credit card. There are so many bonuses for the business person who travels a lot. All the extra free nights you can get and plus you can use it in foreign hotels. The penalties are a little high but my other credit card has higher penalties and less rewards.  Over roll The Marriott Reward Credit Card is a very good card for a business professional who travels a lot or people who like traveling.

name: Amber Hallum
review: I was forced to switch to Chase when we moved to Denver because Bank of America doesn't have any branches in Denver. I was really surprised by that and couldn't believe they didn't!   But I chose to switch to Chase because they are large and have branches and ATMs all over the place.  I have never paid an ATM fee because there is always one nearby.  The customer service has been excellent and I love Joe my local branch.  Everyone has been great.  I'm actually happy that we switched.

name: Jessica Ely
review: Would give them 0 stars if I could. Worst credit card company ever! Paid a credit card bill and they claimed they never received the payment checked with the bank and check was cashed. They would call me every 30 minutes starting at 8 am and would end at 8 pm.

name: Robin Alexander
review: Although I don't like monthly fees. It sure beats putting your money into a regular account where they charge you $35/day if you accidentally overdraft and that is per domino. People aren't perfect, and I'd rather know where my money is going and they also offer directdeposit. Other money cards make you pay just to load money on the card and charge you per use and a monthly fee

name: Milly
review: The Chase Freedom card is a great standard credit card which offers a good amount of rewards versus the cards of competitors. The initial bonuses available are particularly appealing, specifically the $100 bonus if you spend at least $500 on the card in your first three months. The long-term rewards, set at 1% of all purchases and 5% of a rotating category, are quite appealing. These are nearly identical to the rewards offered by my Discover card, which I currently use. It's a great system and the 5% reward rate adds up quickly, especially when the category includes all major grocery stores like it currently does. With potential for the APR to be as low as 13.99%, this is quite a solid deal for a credit card. This is a lower APR than most I've used in the past.

name: Gerda Scheuers
review: Using the Disney rewards credit card for out next family vacation will be a great deal.  The $50 bonus up front will allow us to buy some great Disney memorabilia once there.  I'm sure the 1% rewards will add up fast and being able to get a 10% discount with select purchases and meals once at Disney world will make the vacation even better.  We will also take advantage of the 15% off guided tours and recreational experiences.  If we did forget anything during our vacation we can take advantage of the 10% off online purchases at DisneyStore.com  Using the cute mickey mouse card just makes sense when heading to Disney land resorts

name: Joseph Broski
review: While cards with flyer miles seem to be a dime a dozen these days, there are still some that stand out above others. You have your typical fees like you would on any card, but they are very reasonable. What makes this card special is how quickly you can accumulate the points and the variety of things you can spend them on. Let’s look at a few Pros of this card.Pros:- If you spend $2,000 within the first three months of owning the card, you get a bonus of 50,000 points right off the bat. That’s enough alone for a vacation right off the bat. It practically pays for itself immediately. It’s quite an impressive offer.- Point redemption isn’t limited to just flights. You can use them toward car rentals, cruises, hotels, and several other carrier flights.- You can get gift cards using the points. That’s right, you can get gift cards using these points. How many other airline cards let you do that? That alone is a huge plus for me and enough to earn its own bullet point.- No earn or redemption limit on points. Some cards will only let you store a certain amount of points at a time rather than let them accumulate. What’s worse is some cards actually have points that expire, which is just plain ridiculous and unfair. If I get cash back that never expires, so why should my points? Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Premier Credit Card gets it.- No over limit fees is another great feature of this card. Most cards will try to squeeze every penny they can from you, but this card has a little forgiveness. Be warned, you will have to pay a fee if you tell them you’re going to purposely go over the limit.- Reasonable late fees in the form of tiered late fees. Depending how much you owe from your bill you can owe a different amount of late fees. For example, if you owe $100 in late fees, then you will owe them $15. The max late fee you can owe is $35.- No foreign transaction fee is probably the one feature every airline card should offer. You are going to be traveling and they want you to travel. They even offer two points per dollar when you buy from them. Why would any airline card try to prevent you from spending money while overseas?All of these features sound great, but there’s some that might be a kick in the rear for some people.Cons:- Excellent credit is needed, so they’re very picky about who they’ll hand this card out to. They do like to force it upon you at the airport, though.- An annual fee of $99 can be a deal breaker for a lot of people. It seems to be one from a lot of the comments I’ve read.Final VerdictAs you can see, there weren’t many cons since the APR of 15.99% is standard. All of the comments I’ve seen indicate the card has great customer service and you receive your points very quickly. Others and I would consider this can excellent card and one everybody should consider.

name: Sara Baker
review: The Chase savings account I have is the most convenient and helpful one for me. Like most banks, they can have a fee associated with it but they offer very easy ways to avoid this. You can either always keep $300 in your savings account, or have Chase automatically transfer $25 each month. Its very helpful and also has the overdraft protection in case your checking acccount is overdrawn it will pull from your savings!

name: robert anderson
review: Chase is the big Inter-State bank around here.  I need them because they work well with the various sources of income and expense I have.  I would give them 5 stars but they do have a balance draw if my balance gets too low.  They usually do well with Direct Deposit which is a big concern of mine.  The customer service is high-quality, I always have a good reaction from the Chase reps I work with.  The large number of physical locations means I always have a live Rep to talk to, I don't have to use the phone.

name: Matt Lowder
review: I've had this credit card for about four years now, and I love it!  It's hard to beat 1% cash back on everything along with 5% cash back on rotating categories like restaurants, grocery stores, and gas.  They also offer 5% cash back at Amazon around November/December, which really pays off when I'm shopping for Christmas presents!  I choose to receive my cash back in a lump sum about once a year, usually during a month when I've been hit with some unexpected costs, so it's always nice to have that to help out.  I think there's only been one time unauthorized purchases were made on my card, but it was super-easy to cancel the purchases, cancel the card, and get a new one.

name: Andrew Cretella
review: This card is alright. I think it's mostly good for those people who shop at Amazon frequently, since you earn 3 points for every dollar spent instead of 1. Even at that rate though, I don't think it's that special. You still need to spend quite a bit of money to get enough points to get a reward. I actually just get cashback/a statement creditIf you don't shop at Amazon a lot though, this card probably isn't really better than other, similar cards on which you can earn reward points through purchases. You earn 2 points for gas and dining. For everything else, you earn 1 point. If you only earn 1 point for every dollar, you need to spend 5000 dollars to get 50 back.

name: Marshal Trimble
review: I have had this card for three years. I've called customer service one time and was pleased to get an issue resolved. I've received around $500 cash back each year. 1% back on daily purchases and 5% back on fuel and food. I utilize auto payments for certain transactions.

name: ALexis
review: I liked this Chase Slate to start with, but I have since decided to cancel it. the balance transfers really made me reconsider. I really was apprehensive about it because my initial transfer was denied. I just didn't want to go through all the trouble of trying to figure out what was going on so I decided to cancel. I will admit that the card has really good benefits, especially the extra cushion of an extended grace period. I'd recommend it for more patient people than I am. I simply could not be bothered with getting customer service on the line every time I needed to complete a transfer. The Capital One Venture has a lot of similar features, but it has superb customer service and is much easier to navigate. If you're impatient like I am go with the card instead of Chase Slate.

name: Shelley Leppert
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card is another product designed to separate you from your money.  While we all know that credit cards are bad for us, at least a regular card does not rip you for monthly fees!  Not so here.  While they generously allow some free fees, as shown above, I note that it's a $4.95 monthly fee and a $2 ATM transaction fee.  So let's say you use this card for one year, and, conservatively, use an ATM twice per month.  That bumps your monthly fee to $8.95.  Use that for a year and you've dropped a whopping $107.40!  I don't know about you, but to me, that is real money, folks.  It is absolutely not worth it, at all.  Why does the Chase Liquid Prepaid Card deserve that much of your hard-earned money?  I do not believe they deserve it.  They say they will waive the fees if you add your checking - OK - seems fair enough, right?  Maybe, but if you have a checking account, I do not believe you need their prepaid product at all.  In that case simply use your debit card.  This type of product makes me very angry.  I don't see a need for it, and I believe it's marketed to people who are not sophisticated in their use of credit.  Please educate yourselves, and stay away from credit cards as much as you can.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: There's no fee to take money out of chase atms . Ever

name: Frau Wicce
review: This card has been excellent for saving up points for flying (my husband and I don't fly often). However, I do wish that this card was available through any other bank but Chase. Not a big fan of Chase Bank. Also, my card expired last May and I have not been able to get a new one through the mail, even though I've notified both Southwest and Chase. This has been frustrating.

name: Laura L
review: The best part about using Chase College Checking is that there are no monthly fees. I also like how there are so many Chase ATMs around the United States. That way I can withdraw money very easily using my debit card and for no extra fees. I like that I can deposit checks directly using the ATM. No need to actually stop by a branch! The online interface for managing your money is also very easy to use and you can see all your transactions clearly.

name: Janet Wolk
review: The Marriot Rewards Credit Card is amazing. We use this card when purchasing everything. We’ve been able to cash in points to hotels in Vermont, New York, Connecticut, and more. My most pleasant experience was when we got 1 night free at the Marriot located at the center of Time Square. I also feel very important when I carry this beautiful card around. I seriously feel like I own an American Express business card or something because of the heaviness and beauty of this card. I would recommend everyone to get a Marriot Rewards Credit Card. If you use a credit card to make your life purchases anyways, why not use this card??

name: Justin Sharick
review: I applied for the Chase Slate card due to an awesome Balance Transfer promotion which allowed for no APR for 1.5 years along with no transfer fees.  I was able to use it for this and it helped me reduce my debt on another card.  Unfortunately, once the promotion ended, my use for the card declined as the APR I have is pretty high at 21%.  I now only use the card for absolute emergencies, and even then I tend to try to avoid it.  It does have a low minimum monthly payment, but I tend to pay off the card whenever I can in one payment to avoid the high interest rate.

name: Kenneth Browne
review: I've been with chase almost 6 years now and banking with them is incredibly easy.  They have lots of ATM's all over NYC, which is very convenient.  Their banking app is very easy to use, checking your balance, sending your friends money through chase quick pay, and paying bills.

name: Colin Stone
review: While there seem to be some excellent rewards with this card ID take issue with a few things and have a few suggestions for improvements.  First off while the bonuses seem generous many of these are not very useful for your average person, especially ones such as myself who tends not to travel very much.  As an improvement I would suggest adding in some additional rewards, perhaps some applicable to a sedentary individual.  Vouchers for restaurants and alike would be nice.  The second issue I take it at the point system seems very convoluted at first glance, and a bit of clarification in this regard would be very useful to me and I'm sure other people.  While I'm not sure there's much to be done about this aspect, the high credit rating required to obtain this card could be prohibitive to some, and if there's any flexibility in this regard it would be welcome.  As far as the positives go, for a traveling man this card would be inordinately useful, especially in regard to the nice hotels it offers and a generous rewards related to travel.  In short a bit accessibility would be nice to improve this card but for the people who find useful, this would be incredibly useful.

name: Brian Gantz
review: This card, based on the information in this link, is a unique one.  It offers good rewards compared to most cards, matching reward points and airline mile benefits extremely well. However, I feel these good qualities are outweighed by the exorbitant APR and Cash Advance rates (15.99% and 19.24% respectively). Both of these percentage rates are extremely high, and often are found on cards given to people with poor credit. However, the poor credit crowd is not the target of the card, given the upper limit of the amount needed to achieve bonuses (for instance, $2000 in the first three months to earn a good amount of bonus airline miles). By the interest rate alone I would reject the card being an average consumer, but I could see this being useful to someone who both travels and uses their card frequently.

name: Nigel Sothers
review: Our Chase Checking account is GREAT – but don't really love this Savings account.  I opened it mainly because I was opening a Checking account, and currently only use it as a security measure for short-term transfers - to move any large deposits out of my Checking account. Drawbacks:  1) Interest seems relatively low compared to what some other banks are offering nowadays (at least as of last time I checked). 2) Ideally this account would have no monthly fee - if I transfer at least $25/month into it... But since I don't usually do that, it just ends up being another unnecessary expense. Fortunately it's not a lot, but it's still not as good as "free".

name: Nigel Sothers
review: I've had a Chase business checking account for just over a year, and so far it's been great! I first switched from Citibank to Chase due to odd/unexplained issues with my debit card transactions (i.e. some transactions being randomly rejected by certain card processors, for no apparent reason).  And frankly, I didn't expect much of a difference between Citibank and Chase since their both massive global banks. But I've found that Chase's online account management website IS slicker - and Chase DOES seem to provide a bit more personalized service.  For example, when I signed up for my account, I was assigned a specific local account rep who periodically touches bases to see if there's anything they can assist with, and who can *personally* assist if any issues arise.

name: Gail Kahn
review: The rewards provided on the Chase Saphire Preferred are a great reason to join. I also like the fact that there is no over limit fee! The introductory annual fee of $0.00 is also another compelling reason to sign up for this card. I have had other cards that don't offer that. The no foreign transaction fee is yet another great advantage! I have been abroad using a credit card not knowing that I would have to pay additional fees for every transaction. The balance transfer fee of 3% is also fair, almost 0%! I will be telling family members of the benefits of having a Chase Saphire Preffered card.

name: Dawn
review: Besides the bonus points for adding an authorized user, this reward program seem to be just like their Freedom card. Both cards have the same base rate but with the Freedom card you get bonus points in your top 3 categories not just on dining. Also, I believe the starting APR for the Freedom card is 13.99% so this one is higher. I can't say that I am to fond of the terms on this card.

name: Roshan Jackson
review: Right now I use a navy federal card and I am thinking that I want to obtain a new card and I heard that the Marriott Rewards credit card may be one that I may choose. I like how the card gives me bonus points towards hotel stays because I always go to the marriott once a year in october and sometimes in march. I like the late fee will only be $35 and the grace period is also almost a month. The difference that I would not like is that navy federal gives me a very low balance late fee and the 45 annual fee does not sound to bad.

name: Joshua David
review: I got 12.99% AFTER 0% for 15mths, the best rate. Thank you CHASE. No annual fees, easy international usage with CHIP+Signature. Use it everywhere.......I have no use for BT due to none or low-balance (but OTHERS may take advantage of BT.)..

name: Roshan Jackson
review: I like that I can avoid the monthly maintenance fees and how I really have access to all my money there is no minimum that I have to keep in my account I also enjoy how they make it simple for me with my transactions and how I can actually make my pin number something that I want. They also have a feature where if you were referred by someone else you and them both get 25 dollars for free in your new account.

name: Izzy Pieniądz
review: Great for college students since there are so many locations and ATM's everywhere. The phone app is great and the phone deposits are super helpful when I can't make it to a physical location all the time, I've had the account since 2009 and they used to give rewards, but they stopped that a while ago. Other than that complaint I love banking with Chase. You can also sign up for mobile alerts when your account balance gets too low and that's helpful too if you can't always get online.

name: Joao Carlos
review: when it comes to the Disney rewards card there is really nothing that can compare to it. I love the 50 dollar bonus I get after my first purchase. I love when I use my card I get 1% on any purchase I make, I love the fact that I can Redeem my points  for a Disney vacation, or at the Disney store and Disneystore.com. I love this card that I can get 15% on select guide tours. I love all the duscounts I get. Like I said before when It comes to the Disney reward card there is nothing that can compare to it,

name: Kay TC
review: I got the Chase Slate card 8 months ago and so far I am pleased with it.  Easy to apply for, approved within minutes and I like the introductory offer of 0% APR for the first 15 months. I really like Chase's mobile app so I can pay my balance on the go, and their emails reminding of a payment due.  I like this card’s interest rates better than my Capital One card.

name: Luis Bonilla
review: Unlike the American Express Bluebird prepaid card, this card has a monthly service fee of $4.95, which I really don't like, but the fee is waived when linked to a qualifying checking account.  Since this card is a Visa, it would be accepted almost everywhere.  The Bluebird is only accepted where American Express is accepted, which is limiting.  Initial load of the card is only $25, which is nice and low.  Reloading looks easy.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review:
And do you Know that american express prepaid its not fdic secure? 
Chase liquid protect you up to 250,000

name: Krishna priya
review: I have had this card for several years now . I think its most exciting feature is 0% rate for 15 months . Its better than many other cards available in the business . Also the minimum monthly payment is  considerably less to keep you going . It does not offer any rewards so you are not really attracted towards more and more shopping . I happily use it to clear off any of my year end debts each and every year . Thinking about the ease of payment makes me feel relaxed .The credit history is one thing that people should think of before getting it , because for them it should be really clear.Also whenever I travel out of country ,  I can use it frequently without really worrying about high transaction rates .

name: Ruth Batres
review: I mainly got the Chase Sapphire Preferred for the sign-up bonus.  So far I have been pleased with how my points are adding up quickly.  Since I regularly use travel mileage cards for flights, this card's bonus of $100 was attractive enough for me to get it. I like that I can combine my points from this card with other Chase credit cards getting free flights even quicker.  Since I also have the Chase Freedom card I can double up on getting my miles quicker. I plan to continue using thus card as my main credit card for now and use my other cards as secondary cards as I'm wanting to build up my mileage taking advantage of Sapphire's reward plan.

name: Martha Geiger
review: Great for a college student who has little income and keeps a low average balance. Not having to worry about fees means I can focus more on school and saving. The customer service at Chase bank is outstanding. They're almost always kind and helpful. ATM's in most buildings on campus means I'm never far from a withdrawal or deposit when I need one. Their office is really close, too. Just a few minute walk from my apartment. Chase's College checking is by far the most convenient account I could have.

name: John Johnson
review: I really overall like Chase as a commercial banking company. They provide the latest, most innovative forms of modern banking in the form of several different services. I had a Chase Checking account before and although it was very user-friendly and high-tech, it was kind of expensive. I really enjoyed the ATM feature they offered at several of their local branches. These ATM's would allow you to deposit cash into the ATM which would be counted and uploaded to your account instantly to be used with the checking debit card they provided. This was a very neat, and useful feature not found commonly where I live. Overall a cutting-edge service at a price.

name: Clarissa Earwood
review: My husband and I currently use a Capital One card, but we are thinking about switching to a card that offers better travel rewards. I like the point system with the Marriott Rewards Card, but I think the $45 monthly fee is a bit extreme. Our current card has no monthly fee at all so that is the main reason we may not switch.

name: Vincent Leclr
review: Worst experience possible for foreigners arriving in the country : they took the check I gave, took the money and blocked my account because the check was "suspicious" (not enough not to have the money transferred from the check maker's account). They want to call the check maker but only on an US number.
