In the end I lost 8 hours of calling, waiting, raging for nothing : the only solution they have (part for asking the maker to take a plane accross the world) is to recall the check (here is your fee) and find another solution. I shall add that it was not possible to recall the check anyway.

name: Natasha Curry
review: This is my preferred credit card. I do all my banking with Chase, and I like the fact that I can review all my accounts on one page. There is no annual fee, which is important to me. I particularly like the cash back offers, and the fact that you get a reminder to sign up for this from the ATM as well. I've needed to contact customer service a few times for various reasons, and I've always had great service with a real human being, rather than having to speak with a machine.

name: Broc Hite
review: Chase Sapphire is one of my favorite credit cards, for a number of reasons.  First, it's one of the best cards for building points that can be converted into United Airlines points (among other airlines), and Hyatt Gold Passport points (among other hotels).  Second, it is a way to be able to convert points earned by the Chase Freedom card, which has rolling 5x category bonuses, into Chase Rewards points.  Most people these points as worth anywhere from 1.5 cents to 2 cents, which is more valuable than if you were to redeem the points for cash at 1 cent a piece.  Third, it is one of the few cards that always offers double points on several categories, including flights, hotels, and restaurants.  It also has no foreign transaction fees, which can be stacked on top of some of the aforementioned benefits.  It's a great card to have!

name: Patricia
review: This is a great card for frequent travelers. The points accumulate quickly and you can use them for hotel stays and rental cars as well. There is also a nice bonus of 50,000 points when you sign up. The rates are reasonable although not as good as some other cards. Overall I am quite pleased with this card.

name: CP Sweeps
review: I LOVE my Chase Amazon credit card. I originally got this credit card because a friend highly recommended it, and five years later I’m still recommending it to anyone looking for a new credit card. For my shopping habits, the rewards program is excellent, and I appreciate that it is easy to use ie. no rotating reward categories. I feel like annual fees are a bank’s way of squeezing more money out of consumers, so that’s one more reason why I like this card – no fees! In addition, I live in Los Angeles, the credit card fraud capital, and though my number has been stolen before, Chase was very quick to resolve the issue, cancel the old card and send me a replacement card. And if you love shopping on Amazon, this is definitely the card for you!

name: Dee Engelhardt
review: Chase and I have a strange relationship for a few years now. I started banking with them when they were still Washington Mutual. I stuck it out for may years, as branches closed and reopened- until eventually becoming Chase. Their customer service is outstanding, and i do like the fact you can always get a human in the phone. What I dislike though, is there is no free checking with out strings. Sometimes you don't always fit the criteria for "free Checking"  The fee is not that horrible, but I wish there was a better option for this type of checking account.

name: Jake Peral
review: As far as commercial banks go, Chase isn't that bad of an option.It's a simple matter to sign up, you just sit down with a banker and they'll walk you through it. The people working there are generally very nice, I've never had a negative experience.There are account fees that you can get around but depending on your financial situation this might not be easy.They also have a pretty thorough mobile app which makes it easy to do your banking/checking on the go.If you can, I'd still suggest finding a credit union but if that's not an option for you Chase is a pretty good alternative.

name: Ruth Batres
review: When I signed up for this card it gave a bonus of 50,000 miles.  I have used this card for several years and have found the miles useful for our travel, although I have other credit cards that offer better miles and double miles for every dollar spent.  Overall, I have been pleased.

name: irina kuznetsova
review: I like their bonus program that adds extra cash-back on your purchases

name: Lisa McDonald
review: The Ink Bold card is a great option for those with excellent credit who spend a lot (and can pay the full balance) in a month.  The rewards (5X and 2X) are awesome for those who pay bills and travel with their cards.  The $95 annual fee seems high, though.

name: warren johnston
review: I have had A Chase savings account for several year now.  The best thing about this account is that it is a good place to keep emergency money if you have any other chase products.  The savings can easily be transferred to your checking account with chase with their easy to use website.  The interest rate is lower than average but that is OK if you are just using the account for emergencies only.  Chase has also recently redesigned their app and it is now very efficient and easy to use.

name: Tejas
review: My only complaint with the Chase Savings Account is the minimum balance requirement; however, I knew that when I signed up with them so I cannot lower my review for them based upon that. They made their requirements very clear for those looking to sign up with them, being listed very clearly on their website. My favorite thing about the Chase Savings Account is the ease of transferring between my checking and savings, which consequently allows me to easily take advantage of Chase Quickpay to send money to my friends and family. It is also easily synchronized to make payments to my Chase Freedom credit card. Any issues or qualms I have had with them in the past were cleared up quickly by their very helpful customer service team. I rate them 5 stars and would recommend.

name: Kelly
review: I have mixed feelings about my Chase savings account. I do not like the minimum balance requirement and I hate the fees if you do not contribute. But, for convenience reasons with the ease of transferring funds to another account (like my checking account with Chase), I do really like this savings account. The website is super easy to use and it is really easy to save with this account. I have an account with direct deposit with Chase that is linked to the savings account, so that every time my check goes through a portion of that check is automatically transferred into my savings account. Super convenient!

name: Abbie Johnson
review: This card got me thru college! After paying my tuition each semester, I had enough Amazon rewards to buy all my used textbooks for free. You receive the rewards quickly, and they really add up. The interest rate is so-so, but I pay it off early so it doesn't matter.

name: Alison Spencer
review: This card seems pretty good! I use Amazon a lot so I think I would like using it. The best features are the Amazon gift card ($30) and the cash back rewards. Regarding the $30 sign up bonus, while that's nice, it is a little smaller than some other cards like the Bank of America cash back card ($100 bonus) or the Chase Freedom card ($200). The 3-2-1 points systems seems really reasonable; it reminds me of the Bank of America cash rewards card (3% for gas, 2% for groceries, 1% for everything else). The only negative things I would say are that the APR is a little high, and I wish it had a smart chip on it.

name: Carissa Mckinnie
review: The one I got in the mail this month did have a chip. :)

name: Micah Kelley
review: The Amazon.com credit card has many great features. One of the biggest features that I like is that I receive a $30 Amazon gift card upon my credit card application approval. The second feature of the card that I like is that I earn points based on how much I spend and where I spend my money. However the MasterCard offers the Fuel Rewards Network. After signing up the rewards, all I have to do is go to participating restaurants and grocery stores and make a purchase. I am able to save on fuel at any Shell gas station. The one drawback of that though is that I have to pay gas at Shell and there may not be a Shell gas station everywhere. Although this is the only drawback of the MasterCard, I would give it more consideration in comparison to Amazon when looking at the ongoing rates. Amazon’s ongoing rate is 14.24% - 22.24% while for the Upromise MasterCard the ongoing rate is 12.99 or 20.99%. Both credit cards are good and should be weighed evenly.

name: irina kuznetsova
review: I have my checking account with Chase bank for 8 years and primarily using it for deposits and automatic billing - a great experience! They don't have monthly fees and hidden charges, their customer support is excellent - I had all my issues resolved quickly, within one phone call, I'm pretty much satisfied. I also enjoy using their online banking and mobile app - the interface is super intuitive and I have all information I need at my fingertips; moreover, they allow depositing checks via mobile app (although the limit is $2,000 - I'd like to increase it).  Another thing to mention is they notifications - with timely alerts, I don't worry about extra charge on my account. Fraud prevention program is a bit annoying, but I'll go for it - I like they're keeping eyes on suspicious transactions.  In overall, it's 5 stars - highly recommend!

name: JD
review: I highly recommend Chase Total Checking if you are looking to open a new checking account. Their website and online banking feature is very easy to use and accessible. Statements are available online and in the mail and I have always found them to be very accurate. I also use the direct deposit feature, and therefor do not have a monthly surcharge. There are Chase branches located all over the country so it's very easy to find should you need a service such as a replacement card. Their customer service is also very good. I have had Checking accounts with two other major banks and this is by far the easiest Bank to deal with.

name: Laura Hysong
review: I am pretty pleased with this card so far. I've been using it for a little over a year. I chose this card mainly because I could sync it to my bank account which made making payments easier also no annual fees and the rewards they offer. I especially love the 5% back on gas and groceries! Customer service is pretty decent I'd have to say better that. Most I've dealt with in the past. This card has been accepted everywhere I have tried to use it so far. I don't have a ton of cards to compare the Apr too but it seems a little high to me but by far not the highest I've seen.

name: Javier Orellano
review: One of the things I like about this Chase Freedom card is the $200 bonus. You get it after spending just $500 during the first three months, now that is a sweet deal. The 5% cash back from purchases on Amazon.com is also going to be very beneficial to me. I am getting most of the gifts for my kids that way so that is a sure savings right there. This card is much better than the Capital One VentureOne card I was using before. The benefits are just much better and the interest rate is very acceptable.

name: Courtney Hayes
review: Did you receive your $200 cash back? I only received the $100 cash back (which is what they have changed it to recently). When I signed up for the card and spent the $500, it was still $200 back and actually called about the bonus. The customer service rep told me she would put 20,000 points on my card and I could redeem that for the $200...got my statement and only 10,000 points was added. I WILL be calling in the morning about this. Very disappointed in this.

name: warren johnston
review: The checking account is useful and efficient as there are many branches and atm's all around the country.  Their website is usefull and their mobile banking app works good as well.  The downside is that there are so many random fees that you would not expect and likely not notice unless you checked your statement.  My card works well overseas but their customer service is difficult to deal with.

name: Brett Gunther
review: This is my current, main checking account.  The monthly fee is a little high, and I think a little unreasonable, especially because many local credit unions offer completely free checking accounts.  However, the online access and mobile apps that this bank has in conjunction with the checking account are fantastic.  Being able to access my account information and pay bills, etc. through my computer or iphone is amazingly convenient.  Also, being able to do Chase to Chase checking money transfers online is simple and very useful.  All in all, I am satisfied with my Chase checking account, and even though I have thought about switching to another free checking account, all the convenient features keeps me put.

name: Anthony Pangilinan
review: I am very pleased overall with my checking account at Chase bank.  I have always received great customer service and they always help me if I'm not sure what is going on in the activity of my account. I like how I always get paperless statements regarding how much I have in my account. I can always check it when I am on the go with my smartphone.

name: DeLacy Healey
review: I find this checking account to be full of hidden fees. It seems like every month, they are hitting me with a new fee, a new problem, etc. I am just a single mother, that works really hard and it's crazy that a bounced debit for 50 cents can cause several hundred dollars in fees and a chain reaction. I would not recommend this account. However, it is not a one, because other banks are worse.

name: Sabina Hunt
review: I have been using Chase Freedom card for more than 5 years.  They offer you 5% cash back during different times for things like gas, groceries and shopping at certain stores and 1 % back on everyday purchases.  Redeeming the points is so easy, you can even redeem the points at Amazon during checkout!

name: Rachel Martin
review: Out of all my credit cards, this is my favorite.  The 5% cash back is great and just a little something extra that you don't have to think about.  I've had the card for about 3 years now and they are always the most on top of possible fraud.  Chase also provides great customer service.

name: Brett Gunther
review: I have this card and have used it as my main credit card for over 6 years.  All in all, I am happy with this card.  It is linked to my Chase checking account so it is easy to make payments online through the online banking.

name: Daniel Beck
review: I thoroughly enjoy my Amazon Rewards Credit Card. I have made a couple small purchases (Under $30.00) purely from Amazon Points. Easy to earn and the rewards are a great bonus!

name: Billy Spangler
review: I travel a lot, mostly for work.  There are times when i do leisure travel, but it seems anymore those are few and far between.  However, one thing I have learned to enjoy is having this card in my wallet for those times I decide I need to get out of town and know that I have some bonuses stocked up through my regular usage.  One thing I enjoy about the Hyatt Credit Card would be the max late fee and inclusion of a smart chip.  There are times I would prefer to not swipe a card, be it a shady organization or distant locale, and would prefer to be able to just use the chip.  In addition, using my free nights and accumulated bonuses have never been easier with their customer service!  If you're a world traveler who enjoys having the ability to rack up some free nights for when you're traveling just for using your card on a normal, daily basis, this is the card for you.

name: Korina Gravley
review: What I absolutely love about this card is the amount of bonus points you receive in comparison to the amount you spend. It is so nice knowing that you have bonus points that you can spend on a wide variety of things, I also like the fact that you are awarded airline tickets. Traveling has always been a favorite past time of mine and this would be incentive enough for me to open this card. This particular card reminds me of the features on my Citi Bank Platinum card where I have a points system that builds on a rather quick basis and has proven to be very useful to me. However unlike my Citi card there are a couple of things I dislike about this card. For one the interest rate is almost sixteen percent which I feel is very high and secondly you do not have an annual fee the first year but there after you will be paying $96 per year, I feel that is extremely high!

name: Jessica Williams
review: I currently have the Citi DoubleCash card and I am thinking of switching to the Marriott Rewards Credit Card after reading about the terms! I love the fact that with the Marriott Rewards Credit Card you receive 30,000 points after spending your first $1,000 dollars. I also like that you get 2 free night stays after an account approval. That is a really excellent value, especially if you have an upcoming trip planned. Getting a point for every dollar that you spend on all other purchases is great, too. You can redeem your points for night stays at hotels, airline miles or travel and leisure items. I also have a US Airways MasterCard and you can only redeem the miles you earn on airline miles or magazines. I like the idea of having flexibility with what you choose to redeem your points or miles on. The only thing I do not like about this card is that, although the first year has no annual fee, it is $45 dollars per year after that. I hate paying annual fees for credit cards! Overall, this card seems like a great one for people who are planning to travel or already do a lot of traveling.

name: Carl Hafer
review: Great card, especially in the quarters where gasoline is is a 5% cash back category.  I also like how if you use the card on Amazon, you can easily redeem your points for Amazon purchases through Amazon's site.  I'm very happy with this card.

name: Charity Tryst
review: This card has a rather high monthly fee in relation to other comparable cards. You can link to a checking account to have the fee waived but then what you basically have is a debit card, which is available from most banks for no monthly fee. There is no activation fee, and no cancellation fee, which is a plus and they do offer a direct deposit option. If you have poor credit this card might be helpful in rebuilding your credit score. Otherwise, I would pursue other options that do not charge a monthly fee.

name: Erwin Zipfel
review: I like the most of the characteristics of this Chase Slate card, especially the $0 introductory balance transfer fee, although I do wish it were longer than 60 days, maybe 90 days at least. The cash advance fee seems a bit high given the good to excellent credit rating one needs for this card, so I don't think I would get too many cash advances with it, but you never know so it is good to have it just in case. In contrast to my Citibank card it is much better though. I think the best thing about this card is probably the smart chip that adds security to it which has been a big concern for me since I had some shady charges placed on one card last year. I wish they would put this on all cards. Overall, I think applying for this card is a very good idea.

name: Joe McGoo
review: I use the Ink Bold Business Card and I love the rewards I get from it, especially since I travel a lot the 2x rewards comes in handy. I use the Capital One Quicksilver credit card as well. I only get 1.5% cash back. So I am much happier with the Ink Bold Business Card. I get rewarded a lot more for making purchases that I would have done anyway. I love redeeming my rewards on Amazon. I buy a lot on Amazon.

name: Jacob VanDam
review: This is my current checking account. The online banking is convenient and easy to use and the customer service has always been great, no matter what branch I'm at. It's the best I can expect without a minimum balance, which I can't afford. The fees aren't ideal, but they don't charge you a monthly fee if you're on direct deposit or if you make frequent paycheck deposits. I soundly recommend it for anyone who, like me, doesn't have enough cash to keep a high minimum balance.

name: Jen Schuler
review: I used to ignore the Chase Freedom offers, figuring they were too good to be true. Then I married someone who banks with Chase, and I realized what I had been missing. Now I use Chase Freedom for everything, and we love with the customer service—especially the fraud coverage.

name: Katie Douglas
review: I love this credit card! By putting most of our expenses on it, we have managed to rack up many travel points. We are definitely planning on using them for a trip overseas! We applied and were approved very quickly. The service is pretty easy and we haven't had any issues.

name: Marianne Grubbs
review: When I moved to this area, I opened a checking account at the branch on Trenton and McColl.  The staff there is very professional and courteous.  Even though I went during my lunch hour, I waited only about five minutes in the lobby before someone came to help me and the whole process took about twenty minutes.  Since then I have had no problems with my checking account and I'm completely satisfied with the services and products at this bank.

name: justus jackson
review: I've had different Chase checking accounts through the years, but closed them out due to low interest rates. Last year, they offered $100 to open a new checking account (with several stipulations). The banker who helped open my account was extremely helpful--the whole bank was swamped, but he took the time to answer all my questions, and make sure I was comfortable with all the details of the deal.

name: John Barrowton
review: This is an amazing card. Great rewards (200 bucks if you spend 500 or more in the first 3 months!), great interest rates, and impeccable customer service. If these qualities matter to you at all, get this card. You won't regret it.

name: Justus Jackson
review: I opened this card back in college and have been using it for about 8 years now on and off. I think the rewards program of 1% cash back all the time is pretty decent, but I find that the 5% offers that are good for 3 months at a time could be better. Sometimes they are for movies, department stores, and home improvement stores which I don't visit frequently enough to value the rewards. Other times though, they will be for gas, hotels, and flights, which is really helpful in saving money for large transactions, even if it is only 5 cents per dollar.

name: Matt Tolster
review: The Hyatt Credit Card appears to be the ideal credit card for the world-traveler in us all! I currently use my Capital One Platinum card for most of my purchases, but the perks of the Hyatt Credit Card blow it out of the water. Who in the world would not want 2 free nights in a Hyatt, simply for making $1,000 in purchases in the first 3 months you have the card? The 15.99% standard APR is very fair for both the experienced and new credit card users, and the 3% cash advance fee is very gracious for those times you are caught without cash!

name: Topanga Elliott
review: This British Airways Visa Signature card truly has a lot to offer. It has an extremely appealing bonus offer, and compared to the other ones like this one out there it is a lot better. I love that you can get additional miles for just using the card on other purchases. Comparing the British Airways Visa Signature Card to most other offers of credit, this card has a reasonable interest rate and associated fees while still offering you, the customer, something back.

name: Kay Smith
review: I love that I earn rewards to use back on Amazon, and basically pays me to shop.  My only complaint is that this card has a higher APR, and despite having a perfect payment history for 2 years, Chase will not lower the APR.

name: Brent Homer
review: Who doesn't want to shop on Amazon.com?  A lot of cards have rewards that you never really get a chance to use, but the Amazon.com rewards come often enough that you feel like you are actually getting a worthwhile reward.

name: irina kuznetsova
review: I should say my experience with Chase Bank's savings account is excellent. Interest rates are above the national average and can easily transfer to a checking account if I need to. Transfer rates are faster than other banks I currently do business with.Another thing I should highlight is the navigation - it is very intuitive, I can easy access all my information via portal. Their UX designers did a great job.Thanks, Chase!

name: Brigit Riordan
review: Overall Chase has been a great banking experience for our family.  We have been customers there for several years and have been impressed with their friendliness, excellent customer service and overall professionalism.  I would like to see less time for transactions to appear in our account when using our debit card.  It sometimes takes several days for a return or credit to show up on our account activity, however debits show up minutes afterwards.  Even with this, we are very pleased with Chase and hope to continue working with them in the future.

name: Alexandria Nicole
review: I like how this card has rewards that can be used to go towards Category 1 hotels. It seems like you are getting a really good deal if you open this card and use it. Also, the rate is pretty good at only 15.99%. However, I do not like that there is an annual fee after the first year of $45. Also, there is no smart chip on the card, which is another thing that I do not like. This card is very different from the Discover that I have, which lets me use my bonus points towards any purchase and has no annual fee.

name: Jon Baker
review: I liked this card because of the 0% interest on the balance transfers.  It was helpful to give me some time as I worked down debt that I accumulated during college.  I wasn't a huge fan of the transfer fee but I understand how/why it works.

name: chris g
review: I really like the Chase Freedom Card because it is simple, straightforward, and has no fees. I use this as my everyday card for purchases on everything from groceries to gas to dining out. Additionally, you can earn 5% cash back on this card, and that is a really nice perk. I typically use that cash back towards paying off my balance.

name: Nicole Baker
review: I have had a Chase Total Checking account for the last five years. In that time, I have been very satisfied with my services. My banker converted my debit card to a Disney card, which I enjoy for it's perks and special offers. My only dislike would be the additional $2 charge on any non-Chase ATM transaction. That is in addition to the charge that you get from the ATM itself, which can make the total fees for using a non-Chase ATM be anywhere from $4 to $10 depending on where you are.

name: Dan PG
review: I've been a member of Chase for 8 years.  Before that, I had always held my checking account in a small private bank in Milwaukee.  When I moved to Chicago, I found it was really inconvenient to have a checking account with a bank that had branches only in select locations. Chase is everywhere.  Their Chase Premier Plus Checking account has provided me with cost savings as I travel internationally; their branches are accessible and customer service always personable.

name: Parrish Smith
review: My business consist ofremodeling houses painting building walls plumbing electricity that's what I do for a living I would like to start my own business doing the same thing just need a small loan to get on my feet

name: Stephanie Stocklas
review: I applied for the Chase Freedom Card over a year ago and it is one of my favorites cards. I have earned quite a few rewards by using it (even just by applying) so it was a great investment. I got the card quickly and have never had an issue with Chase.

name: Ray Josephson
review: I have had my Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Credit Card since the beginning of 2014.  Their initial offer of 25000 miles after $1000 in purchases within the first 3 months was a huge incentive.  Upon reaching the milestone I was pleased by the options available.

name: Bill Alvarez
review: I actually have this card, and I must say that the Rewards program is pretty generous, and I've been able to buy things from Amazon (or take some dollars off of purchases) a few times. The sign-up bonus was very nice to get too. However, I'm not using it as much at the moment because the promotional interest rate expired, so now I get hit with close to 20% interest if I'm not able to pay off the balance quickly. If you can pay it off as you go, though, the rewards rack up quickly and it is a great incentive.

name: Luke
review: I am very happy since I switched from a small local bank to banking with Chase. I love that I can make deposits at their ATMs and that their online banking website is so easy to use. Chase has also been very prompt in responding to any questions and problems I've had.

name: Sam Pa
review: As far as getting perks such as free nights at selected hotels, reductions this card is close to perfection and almost second to none, except perhaps the Citi Sapphire. Of course, it's only ideal for those who travel at least 3-5 a year and/or make a point of staying at hotels every time they travel. I would agree that it's not easy to initially couch up +$270/night each time one travels, but I honestly think it's 100% worth it. I've traveled, and used the card 3-4 (each time staying 3-4 nights)  times  since I enrolled 9 months ago and I've already gotten 2 coupons for free stays and I the last trip I took I think booked completely with my points.

name: Tony
review: We travel all summer long to our daughters lacrosse tournaments, and make sure we stay at Marriott and use the rewards card.  By the end of the summer we have enough points to get  the next two nights free. We have always stayed at Marriott whenever we travel.  Now having the rewards card makes it a win win situation!

name: Joshua Watson
review: I have been with chase for almost 6 years now, they have been a excellent bank. A few time I overdrew my account and they charged me $25, but when I called them they removed it with no problems. So far Chase has been a great bank and I plan to stay with them for years to come.

name: Florie Qosja
review: I signed up with Chase College when I first started working back in 2007. They also signed me up with a very low balance credit card. It's been fantastic thus far. I do not pay a fee, I get reliable customer service, and there are ATMS anywhere you go. Best part is, they call you if anythings look fishy or fraudulent which is great for me becuase I was subject to identity theft. . They try their hardest to  keep your account safe and secure. If you're just starting out, Chase College Account and Savings is a great account.

name: Regan Williams
review: This Chase Sapphire credit card takes rewards to another level! Every time you spend a dollar or more you earn points, and the best part is that they never expire.  When I had a credit card through American Express I was always worried about using all of my points before they expire, but with Chase Sapphire my mind is at ease. There are so many different things you can use your points for, unlike American Express and other credit cards.

name: Steff Rainess
review: I love my chase savings account. Chase has wonderful customer service and I feel like I can always count on them. Its very simple to use and I can transfer money easily. The android app is extremely helpful when I am on the go and need to make a quick transfer, and the website is very user friendly as well. I do not dislike anything with this savings account and would recommend it to anyone!

name: Jim
review: I think the Chase Freedom card is a very strong card option for someone with excellent credit,who is looking for a cash - back credit card with average APR interest rates. Personally, unless you are trying to carry a balance I think most people would be better off with one of Chase's many Rewards branded cards, such as my favorite the Chase Sapphire Preferred which is a fantastic card for traveling and eating out at restaurants and gets to use Chase Ultimate Rewards which is a great tool for booking travel and utilizing rewards points.  Good rule of thumb, if you're EVER going to carry a balance get a cash back credit card, if you're not you can get great benefits out of rewards cards.

name: Joe Krall
review: I signed up for this card with a 50,000 mile offer bonus. We also took a flight with United, so my wife and I got free baggage checks, saving $100 roundtrip! I signed up for this card with a 50,000 mile offer bonus, but 30,000 is still pretty good.

name: Troy Snyder
review: This is not a card that I would get or use.  Don't get me wrong, if you want the convenience of a credit card but have trouble getting one due to your credit rating, or if you just don't like the idea of owing money and paying interest, a prepaid credit card is the way to go.  At first glance with the free activation and free transactions this would be a good card to get, however, the $4.95 monthly fee seems excessive when other cards have none.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: Theres no ducha thing as none fee. Trust me . All cards have a fee or even at atm if you use a none branch ATM

name: Patrice Williams
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred card is pretty handy to have compared to other cards. The interest rate is more reasonable than others. I travel quite a bit so not having foreign transaction fees is an added bonus. I’ve used several other cards when traveling and this is the only one that’s been pretty much hassle free. Their customer service is great. Any time I call they answer promptly and are extremely courteous.  The only negative thing is the annual fee of $95. I would think that they would have left those in the 90s.

name: Troy Snyder
review: "Pay less interest. Save on balances and new purchases" - seems legit.  Taking a glance the no charge for balance transfers and 15 months interest free make this a great idea for anyone with any kind of interest fee or credit card balance.  I find the fee for balance transfers after 60 days odd, my current card has no such fee.  Additionally, the interest rates after the first 15 months are high and a bit confusing.  Which rate will you be given?  And it says that they are variable but only give three rates... I am considering using this card but mainly for the first 15 months of interest free use, my current card has a much better fixed rate.

name: Matthew Anders
review: If you're spending several thousand dollars in the next year, there is no credit card I'd recommend more than the Ink Bold. You'll be rewarded for paying bills via credit (big plus for me) with 5x the amount of rewards points you usually get while earning 2x the amount of points traveling. Unlike other rewards earning credit cards like Capital One Quicksilver, you must have better credit to earn the Ink Bold, but if your credit's good, it's worth it.

name: Carmine Picarello
review: I signed up for this card specifically for the $0 balance transfer fee.  I spoke with a live representative on the phone to set up the balance transfer.  I told them that I wanted to transfer a balance from my business line of credit with my other bank to the card.  I specifically informed them that this was a business line of credit and not just a credit card.  I asked if this was ok and they said it would work.  So I waited and waited and I never saw my balance transfer.  I called Chase to ask what the status was and THEN they tell me that they denied the transfer because it was a business line of credit.  So this is totally messed up.  I was pretty much lied to.  There is nothing in writing about this policy of theirs when you sign up, and even the representative on the phone didn't say anything.  I tried speaking to a manager and explain how unfair this all was.  And he just told me it was a "business decision" to decline the transfer and they outright refused to tell me why it had to be that way.  So I guess I'll find a plan B and figure something out.  But I will certainly never give them any of my business again and I strongly encourage that you do not either.  I would only expect them to pull something like this again.

name: bob broshack
review: I like this checking account because of the quality customer service that Chase offers. Some of the perks of this checking account are not the best and you can find much better elsewhere, but that is not the same with the customer service. Whether online or in person at the bank, they treat me like I am number one. A few things I do not like though are the monthly fees or the charges for non-bank ATMs. I think these are big detractors.

name: Samantha Grant
review: I've had this savings account for about two years now and am quite happy with it. It's very easy to maintain and it's easy to transfer money to so that I can build up my savings. Chase's website is easy to use and extremely user friendly. I also like how their app is easy to use and lets to do the same as their website, such as transfer money. The also have options to waive the monthly service fee which is quite easy to do.

name: Samantha Grant
review: I actually have two Total Checking accounts with Chase and really like their services. I've been with them for over 2 years now and they make it quite easy to order checks, transfer money, and set up bill pay. I've had bad experiences with other banks before them and am really happy with the decision I made to switch over. The only issue that I have with them is that there is no physical branch close to where I live because it is a smaller city. However they do provide ATM's and their customer service is great.

name: Nicole Jones-Retkofsky
review: We have had Chase for a long time now, 9 years to be exact. They have always been very eager to help with any issues we have had (which haven't been many). We also have direect deposit and online bill pay, which is a life saver. It automatically will send my landlord a check for the rent each month even. Overall, Chase is amazing and their customer service is amazing as well.  Would highly recommend! We are also looking into a few other services from them.

name: Lewis Garrol
review: The Chase Slate credit card is an amazing option for those who have fallen a little behind on their bills and need a quick solutions to provide them with what they need.  I say this because it offers a very competitive APR and the late penalties aren’t too bad either.  I also like the fact that the minimum monthly payments aren’t too high.  They are pretty good about allowing you to increase your credit limit after you have made your minimum monthly payment on time for several months.  Overall, this is a great option for those who want a basic credit card.

name: d g
review: I have the Chase Freedom Cash Back credit card, and it is really fantastic. It’s so easy to earn cash back with the 5% redemption rate. This is really a card I can use every day, and I use the card for my all my purchases, large and small, so that I can earn the maximum amount of cash back. Additionally, I can  earn cash bonuses when I spend a certain amount of money The customer service is also really great. I always get my questions answered quickly and efficiently both online and over the phone by customer service representatives. This is a great card to have!

name: Yasmina Rivas
review: Freedom Chase credit card is about average to other credit cards but I am happy with their rewards program and offer various bonuses. For example $25 bonus dollars after you add a user and $100 dollars when you spend $500 in 3 months. The customer service for this card is reliable and helpful. They guided me through all the Credit card policies and gave me tips in the event something would go wrong. The Freedom from Chase is accepted in virtually any place. Good for travel, shopping or dining out. .No annual fee and rewards never expire.Use it and get rewarded. I would recommend it.

name: Christina Basso
review: I love Chase Freedom for the flexible rewards points and great credit limit.

name: Rasmi Anugu
review: I recently opened a Chase checking account when I got places in a company and I took chose direct deposit too. I should say Chase is the US best banking system.The way they responded when I walked in for opening an account is really good. They helped me to open and provided me with all sort of documentation and offers they offer. They have lot of offers to people who start using their direct deposit concepts, like they provide you an option or offer to deposit some amount of money to get $50 or $100 as reward which I found very attractive, over all I rate them 100 for their banking and customer service.

name: Dawn
review: A couple of years ago I decided to consolidate my student loan and a credit card account onto my Chase Rapid Rewards Visa. I had received and amazing offer of 4.99% Apr for the life of the loan. I jumped on the chance to lower my interest rates which in turn lowered my monthly payments. Everything was fine for about two years but then suddenly I got a change of terms notice from them stating that I had two options. The first option was that I could keep my current low Apr but I would have to pay an extra $15.00 per month statement fee. The second option was I could Raise my Apr to 6.99 %  for two years then the balance would go to my normal purchase Apr.(Which was considerably higher). I chose my own option which was to transfer the money out and close All of my Chase accounts.

name: Beth Marie
review: My experience with my Chase checking account has been more negative than positive.  Some of the reasons are my own doing and some of them are from Chase's policies.  I, like many Americans in today's day and age do not make enough money to make ends meet or live the way I want to live etc.  Chase has a policy on this Checking account regarding the overdraft policy.  They will approve the overdraft's several times to where each time you receive a fee of $34 plus what the total purchase was.  This policy was good for me at first because it helped get me through from one paycheck to another.  However, after time, I ended up abusing to the point where by the time I received each paycheck through direct deposit, my account was already negative 200 or 300 dollars.  Chase will allow the overdraft up to 4 to 5 times or more, depending on if you have direct deposit or not.  In addition to the $34 fee everytime the account allows you to overdraft, every 5 days they slap you with an additional $15 fee for having a negative balance.  Unfortunately, due to this overdraft policy from Chase it got so bad that when my paycheck was deposited, I wasn't going to have any paycheck left so I had to direct my deposit to another account and now my Chase account is overdrawn by several hundred dollars.  Chase has made hundreds of dollars off of me due to this policy.  If you are terrible with money like me, do not get the option to allow them to let you overdraft your account.

name: Julie McIntyre
review: I will NOT ever apply for a Chase Slate Credit Card. From my husband’s experience, he has had this credit card for over 12 years. When we got in a spot we really had to use it (his mother passed away and she didn't have insurance and we didn't have the money on hand for her funeral), the balance was over 12k. He has called numerous times trying to get interest rate down and they would not. He's paying 24% interest. We finally got it down to around 8k. So we got an equity line in Sept. and sent a check to pay off the balance shown on the most recent statement and it cleared 6 days before the actual due date. This month we received a new bill saying we owe them 86.68 in interest. I don't know about you but I find this ridiculous! They are saying it is residual interest and we owe it to them. In my opinion we do not because I paid off the balance from the latest statement before the due date. I believe the world should know how they will treat you when you pay off a balance. They will bill you for interest on zero dollars and tell you, you have to pay it! Chase has basically told me they falsify their statements to make you believe that’s the amount you owe by the due date and they will not reverse the fee. BE VERY CAREFUL WITH THIS COMPANY!

name: Tin Le
review: Chase Saving account is my first saving account I owned when I came to U.S. I opened this saving account for three years. Overall, I quite satisfied with this one, Recall the time I opened the account, I will rate 5 stars for Chase's Application Process, I came from Vietnam. So I had a litte bit trouble with speaking English. Chase offered me a Vietnamese interpreter right after knew that I am a Vietnamese people. The process is very simple and go smoothly. It is finished in about 20 minutes and I clearly understood everything about my account.

name: Andrew Frisch
review: Chase provides a fairly good banking experience.  Their ATM's and branches are seemingly everywhere and they have a lot of ways to avoid the fees typically found at major banks.  Their member services are also very helpful.  The few times I have accidentally over drafted my account they reimbursed the fees for me.  If you are a veteran they will provide free money orders/cashiers checks, and a small safety deposit box, and no minimum balance.  They also have a great app that provide you daily balances and transactions, check depositing, and bill pay.  Another  great thing about Chase's system is if you are over drafted you can deposit money that day and not get any fees.  The only downside to their bank is that their accounts pay almost no interest.

name: Greg Kita
review: Chase has been an absolutely terrible experience for us. I'm used to community credit unions, which are ALWAYS helpful, friendly, have reasonable fees and legitimately care about their members.Chase, on the other hand, has proved to us time and again that their interests lie purely in exploiting their customers for monetary gain through exorbitant fees and penalties.From monthly service fees (which to this day I can't figure out what service I'm getting for the $10-$12/month) to industry high NSF fees and negative account fees (which are daily, unlike other institutions), Chase really knows how to make a buck (or tens of billions).Typically when I've had to contact customer service, they've been under trained and incapable of resolving even minor issues without escalating to a supervisory level. This is a huge issue when dealing with federal banking regulations that most Americans don't understand or haven't truly been advised of.

name: Dara
review: I love our Chase checking account so much! All of the employees are always so friendly and helpful. Our local branch is just awesome. It has such a small town feel to it, where employees actually seem to care about you as a person instead of just being another customer to get through. The Chase mobile app is great for making deposits on the go or transferring money from your connected savings account to your checking account.

name: Andi Delu
review: I use direct deposit so I don't pay fees for my checking account. I have had a great experience with Chase and their customer service. After having terrible experiences with other national banks, this is really nice. I trust them and appreciate their customer service, locations, etc. The only thing I dislike is I feel they lack some services I'd like to use. I'm trying to rebuild my credit after paying off all my debt and unfortunately, they no longer offer a secured credit card. However, they did recommend one to me that they're not affiliated with just to be helpful. Also, I wish they still had credit monitoring, which is a service they no longer offer. Otherwise, great bank!

name: Jamie Bruno
review: Chase Sapphire Preferred is one of the best credit cards I have ever owned. I signed up after doing some research on which cards provide the most points for travel and I read about the 40,000 point bonus when you spend $3000 in the first 3 months. As I had my grad school tuition bill coming up, I opened the card and paid for my tuition using it. I received the 40,000 points and was able to book two round trip tickets from New York to Los Angeles California, for free. My friend who I am going to California with also opened up the card and is going to use her points to pay for our hotel rooms, and rental car. So an entire trip to California for 10 days will be free thanks to Chase!! The $95 annual fee isn't bad and if you travel frequently pays for itself with all of the points. Great card, easy set up and approval, great customer service, and easy to deal with.

name: Keith Cross
review: This Disney Rewards Card is a pretty solid offer overall. The instant $50 bonus gift card after your first purchase is very nice introductory offer. The 1% reward bonus on all purchases is very good. Some cards of this type don't offer that cash back on all purchases across the board. The only truly negative factor is the penalty APR being so high, almost 28%. You'll have to keep a close eye on your payment schedule. All in all this card should provide you with some nice Disney bonuses!

name: Aletha Roach
review: I don't like the fact that the Ink Bold credit card requires you to have excellent credit, yet you have to pay the balance in full each month. Yes you may be earning rewards but to me that defeats the purpose of a credit card. Also after the first year the annual fee of $95 seems excessive to me. I have several credit cards, none of which has an annual fee or requires me to pay off the balance each month. I am also able to earn rewards with two of these cards.

name: Angelica Pickles
review: I originally got this card because it came with a reward balance on your first purchase. I started using it exclusively with Amazon purchases because of the points you earn and the majority of things, besides food and gas, are bought through Amazon. It is very easy to use your rewards. The best is the ability to just apply your points as a credit on your next statement. I also like the ability to pay for new Amazon purchase just using the rewards you have already earned right as you check on on Amazon. Once i saw the rewards stacking up, i started using this card as my every day card, putting all my purchases on it since any purchase earns you at least 1 point, gas earns you 2, and amazon purchases earn you 3. So far I have had my amazon card for about 4 years and plan to continue using it for years to come. I would highly suggest this care to anyone, especially students who are looking to save money. You can generally find anything you need on Amazon anyways and the prices are usually better than anything you can find in stores. So you save money and earn money at the same time. The interest rates are fair, and there is no annual fee. You can use the card as little or as much as you want and not have to worry about keep a certain balance or paying weird fees.

name: James Thompson
review: I have been banking with Chase my entire life and still use my original checking account from when I was in High School. It has been an amazing experience. I have had my debit card stolen and the issue was resolved in less than one hour along with getting my money back. I have over drafted and have had the fees reversed because I was going through a hard time, or because I put the money in my account to cover the overdraft quickly even though the fee's already posted.Chase is a great bank and I can see myself keeping this checking account for a very long time.

name: Stephanie Izzo
review: I have had a pretty good experience with Chase bank.  I decided to discontinue my accounts with them due to the inaccessibility of ATMs and bank locations in my new area.  The customer service is excellent.  They always helped me.  I think I actually like them better than Suntrust, who I am with now.  The reason being is the customer service.  Customer service is a big deal.  Chase definitely has this down right.  The fees are a little high.  My mother worked for Chase for many years and absolutely loved it.  If Chase was available in my area now, I would probably switch back to them.

name: Robert Dingle
review: I have been  a  Chase Premier Plus Checking member for years. When using my card there are no withdrawal fees. Chase is the bank that i have been banking with for years that offers the  chase Premier Plus checking card. As people may not know, but there are not many chase banks in the US. Chase is one of the most trust bank that i have ever bank with. With the  chase Premier Plus card there are no checking fees. Safe offers low credit rates on loans. For every purchase using your chase card he or she earned points when you chose the option credit instead of debit. Chase members can redeemed their points at any time for all types of rewards. If one chose cash, chase will deposit your funds into your checking account within a few days with no questions asked.

name: Michelle
review: I find that Chase has very convenient services and a very easy to use mobile app and web sources to access my account. They have excellent customer service that is always willing to help you with any questions you may have. They are there to work with you not against you and always try to encourage the best out of my account. I had to pay a checking account service fee of $12/month. Which was a bit high in my opinion. I was a bit mad about this in the beginning, but I customer service kept reminding me that if I use direct deposit for my my pay checks then my account is free. So that's what I did and I am fee free. It was very little hassle to obtain my checking account and all I needed was a minimum of $25 to open it. Any issues you have regarding the use of customer service, dont hesitate.

name: Kristi Shafer
review: The Chase Freedom offer seems OK.  There are several perks to it that I appreciate, however I'm not sure I like it as well as my good old Amex card.  They say you earn a $100 Bonus after you spend $500 on purchases in your first 3 months from account opening.  That doesn't seem to hard to do so, FREE $100. Earn a $25 Bonus after you add YOUR FIRST AUTHORIZED USER and make a purchase within this same 3-month period. This is another free $25 bucks if you have someone else on your card with you.  You also get 5% Cash Back on up to $1,500 in combined purchases before December 31, 2014 at Amazon.com, Zappos.com and select department stores.  This can be great for the Christmas purchases.  That's like an extra 5% coupon just for using your card.It seems as if they change the categories around every 3 months for what they give your the bonus cash back on.  That kind of stinks for me as I don't want to have to keep track of my rewards that closely.  I just want them to show up on my statement without me thinking about them.  It says, "You'll enjoy new 5% categories every 3 months like gas stations, restaurants and Amazon.com. It's free and easy to activate your bonus each quarter!"  Sounds like there is work involved with getting my rewards and I don't like that idea one bit. Then there is the unlimited 1% cash back on all other purchases.  Now, that I understand.  I spend money, they give me 1% on all purchases. Sounds like no work involved, my kind of bonus.There is no over the limit fee, which is good.  I have gotten caught with that charge before and it stinks. There is a late fee of $35 dollars which seems pretty standard now days and you get a 21 day grace period. What would really eat my lunch on this credit card is the cash advance fee.  They are charging 23.99% interest on cash advances and a penalty APR of 29.99%...OUCH!   At that rate you might be better off with your neighborhood loan shark.

name: Edward Smith
review: I have never had a problem with Chase. It was very easy and painless to sign up for a checking account. Anything you need to do can be accomplished by either calling them directly or visiting their website. They offer many tools as to accomplish what you need to get done. Everything I have ever had to do with Chase bank has always been resolved positively. I would highly recommend Chase to anyone considering them.

name: Jay Steve
review: I had a very good view of Chase and was very happy with my checking account until I had a deposit held for verification out of the blue. I never had this issue before and was not expecting it then. Needless to say I had a number of bills that were due to automatically be paid and due to the hold they weren't which put my account in the negative by $500 with the overdraft and negative balance fees. I was credited for two overdraft fees and had to absorb the other two which I felt was unfair. I still use the account but have been looking for a more understanding bank.

name: Victoria Lewis
review: Chase is a great bank and opening my checking account there was fast and easy.  Customer Service in the branch itself was great and I really have rarely had a problem.  The most serious issue I've ever had was with a claim I submitted for a charge I didn't believe I should have had to pay and the claim was denied.  I've submitted other claims that were not denied so I really don't have anything negative to say about this bank.

name: Grant Hendrix
review: I have used this as my secondary credit card. I do not like the company because for one thing they do not have a high enough credit limit. $1500 is nothing. I decided to start using it and they called me to say I have not paid my bills. They have a frustrating online web service to pay your bills. I like the credit card companies that allow you to deduct the minimum payment automatically. The woman said I could call another line to start this. I think she was rude because she could not help me do this or connect me to someone who would.

name: Jon C.
review: I opened a Chase total checking account about 4 months ago during a promotion where I open the account and deposit $100 and after leaving the amount in the account for 10 days they would match my initial $100 deposit, adding an additional $100 dollars into my account. I was in need of a bank account for direct deposit of my paychecks from work and this offer seemed to good to pass up. Also the the amount of branch office locations and ATM's in my area was a deciding factor. The $12.00 monthly fee seemed reasonable also. I opened the account at a local branch office, deposited the $100 and after 10 days as promised they deposited $100 into my account. Everything was good, started getting my direct deposits, and an ATM card within a week. After a month of having the account I took a trip to LA. During my trip I went to make a purchase at a department store and my card was declined. So I got on the phone with the bank.After about a half hour I was able to get an actual customer service rep on the line. I was told my account had been put on hold and all funds were on hold. I was asked many questions that I could not answer at the time like exact. Questions like, what were the exact amount of the last 3 deposits made into the account. I was on vacation and had no documents to answer all the questions being asked of me. I was eventually Told there was nothing she could do and that I would have to come into an office and bring a long list of documents to prove my identity,residence, and other things. I could not do this while out of town. So I was forced to cut my trip short due to the fact I could not access MY money. Upon returning home I went to the office with documents I was asked to bring.  The bank guy never did give me a reason as to why my account was put on hold to begin with. He told me after showing all requested documents that the hold would be lifted within a week. 17 days later the hold was lifted.That same day I went and withdrew all of my money and opened an account with Wells Fargo, which I am still with today. The free $100 was totally not worth the hassle I went through. I still don't know why my account was ever put on hold. Will never use Chase bank for my banking needs again.

name: DeLacy Healey
review: If you are looking to maximize your buying potential, the Chase Sapphire Card is the way to go. I really appreciate how quickly the points add up every time the card is used. I dine out often, and this card gives me two times the points those restaurant purchases. If you're like me, going over your limit is something accidental that can happen. With this card, you can go over your limit without a monetary penalty.Because I have gotten so discerning in my card selections, I dislike the apr on this one. It seems to be a little steep compared to other cards I have used in the past. However, the cash advance fee is lower, as is the balance transfer fee. So, this card rewards much better than my Citi Hilton HHonors card and never results in an over-limit fee. I plan on switching my balances over to this card!

name: Ashley Lockwood
review: I originally applied for this particular card because of the balance transfer option.  The annual percentage rates on my other cards were getting outrageous, and I was looking for a credit card that offered a lower rate.  I did a lot of research on credit card rating web sites, and the Chase Slate card looked ideal because it offered fifteen months of zero percent annual percentage rate charges--which applied to all balance transfers within the first few weeks.  So far I have had the card for about four months and have been able to pay down a lot more of my debt than before (when I was paying an arm and a leg in interest fees alone).  I would definitely recommend the Chase Slate card to anyone who has high interest debt that they need to pay off quickly.  I haven't had any difficulties with this card since getting it.

name: Matt Morgan
review: The Amazon.com Credit Card is perfect for earning rewards to spend online at Amazon.com. The card earns points based upon type of spend. For Amazon, you earn 3 points. Gas, restaurants and drug stores 2 points. You also earn 1 point for every $1 spend elsewhere. These points really add up to buy great products and merchandise on Amazon.I highly recommend this car, because of it's ease of use. Many cards require certain purchases at a specific type of store to earn any rewards; however, this card pays out for any type of purchases.This is also the perfect starter card for a student. The interest rate is very fair, and it is quite easy to get approved for with decent credit.  The Amazon.com Credit Card is usually my 'go to' basic card, because I get rewards no matter what. Many of my other cards end up in my drawer because of this.

name: Walter Plucinski
review: The Hyatt Credit Card is a wonderful deal for the traveler. Hotel nights stack up with normal spending, and for those who use Hyatt on business trips, the extra points can be considered "freebies". Many other hotel chain rewards cards, like Marriott Card do not offer as many points per dollar spent. This card also has a pretty good APR in comparison with most these days.

name: Gustavo Scalzo
review: I've been with Chase since 2009 and absolutely love them. The best thing in my opinion is the new mobile app that was recently released. It allows you to not have to visit a branch until you actually need to have money in your hands. i deposit checks, make transfers and hardly ever have to go to a branch as i use the debit card to make all purchases.

name: Robert James
review: The Chase Slate credit card is for those with excellent or good credit (660 and above FICO score). I think it's a great card for those who  fit into this credit range, as the interest rate for purchases is 0% for 15 months, and the regular rate afterwards can be as low as 12.99%. Some cards can start at 18%. There is no annual fee, and the grace period is a fair 21 days. However, there are no rewards.Because this card is for those who fall into a lower credit score, the fact there are no rewards is a good thing, because there will be no enticement to make purchases simply to get accumulate rewards. Ultimately, the benefit of the card is that it is standard and allows you flexibility without any unnecessary extras for new card holders.The card also offers 0% interest on Balance transfers, which is a optimal for paying off any other credit card on other higher interest cards. This is also the only nationally advertised deal with no transfer fee. The max late fee is $35, which is very fair, and just enough to cause new card holders to want to avoid the charge again without too much a punishment. Some cards can charge as high as $50 in late fees. The card has good customer service, and online transfers are easy to do as well. Payments can be made using the Chase app also. There are text messages and email alerts which remind you to make a payment. An interesting point to note is the vertical card design, as opposed to the standard horizontal one. I think the look of the card affects how people perceive and use the card, and because it's not as typical-looking, and perhaps not as aesthetically interesting otherwise, it may deter people from using it as much, which may be a helpful thing if you're trying not to spend but still need a card. It's a psychological connection, but worth noting.The Chase Slate also has "Blueprint," a budgeting tool which helps you save money on interest and stick to your goals of paying down balances quicker. Just by having the card, this is completely free. Chase claims that customers who set up their plan and and stick to their “Split It” or “Finish It” Blueprint plan usually pay their balance two times faster compared to their other cardholders. This obviously saves a lot of money over time, and is a unique tool.The Chase Slate card is good for those who are looking to build up their credit, or simply don't need a card with any extra bonuses. It is helpful to have in case of emergencies, and with the 0% introductory rate, you're not paying interest for the first year, which means you don't have to pay off the bill right away, a nice perk for those who do pay in full and on time. Even though there are no rewards, the simplicity of the card and how it encourages you to work to get better credit is the real reward of the card.

name: Daniel Conti
review: Don't fall for the credit card scam. Why they haven't been sued or prosecuted is beyond me. They get you to sign up for their United Airlines credit card card by promising that your baggage fees will be waived if you use your card when buying your tickets. When you get to the airport there is no record and they act like they have no knowledge of the program. So you have to pay the fees. When you complain after the fact they play dumb and you get a run around. When you file a credit card dispute, they lie, play dumb (something they do quite well) again and you are left paying the charges. It's a scam plain and simple.

name: Nick Soleman
review: This is why I print out the itinerary and/or boarding pass, making sure the ''baggage fees will be waived'' portion can be easily read.

name: Jorge Rodriguez
review: This was my first card out of high school. I used this card to help build my credit history, and also got points on Amazon. The Chase customer service has been outstanding, they even work with you if you fall behind on payments. I definitely recommend this to anyone looking to establish credit, just use it responsibly! I kept my balance to 30% of my total limit and saw an improvement in my FICO score pretty quickly.

name: Adam A
review: This has been a great card for me. I have used it for over 10 years now. The rewards alone have been worth it while they are always actively searching for a lower rate for me. I built my line of credit with this company and will continue to use it as my main line of credit in the future. Now that my family has expanded it has really come in handy to allow me to purchase all my newly needed baby items and with the low rate I feel confident that I can provide for my family now and in the future.

name: Miranda Price
review: I have had this card for several years and have been very pleased with what it offers.  The 0% interest for balance transfers up to 15 months is generous.  They offer this as the introduction rate but also from time to time for existing customers.   The BluePrint features really help you to pay a balance down faster, avoid interest on specific purchase types and track all spending so that you can better manage your money.  Nice card to have overall.   The only reason I am not giving it 5 stars is because there is no rewards program.

name: Ryan Boubelik
review: Chase has been very good to me over the years. I have been banking with Chase ever since they took over Washington Mutual. Whenever I have had any problems with my account, I would either call Chase or go to my local branch and they would be sure to accurately resolve my issue to the best ability they could. I have been the victim of credit card fraud in the past and Chase was quick to catch the fraudulent spending and contact me to confirm the charges and after they were correctly identified to be fraud, they quickly cancelled the card and sent a new one to me asap. I would highly recommend Chase.

name: Michelle Bradbury
review: I love this card!!!!  I love the zero interest for 15 months and the free 60 day balance transfers. You can do balance transfers easily online, and the customer service is fantastic! I would recommend this card to everyone, it's worth it's weight in gold just for that alone. LOVE IT!

name: William Cowhey
review: Chase has been very good to me, I haven't had any serious issues with them.  They've been prompt in solving any problems I've had such as lost credit cards, and they don't charge any ridiculous fees or anything similar.  In my history with them (almost 8 years now), I've only had one minor issue, and that is the length of time I've had to receive new credit cards.  I've lost a few in my time, and there have been a few times I've had to wait more than a few days or weeks past what was expected to get issued a new one.  However, this is a minor complaint over what has overall been a very satisfactory experience.

name: Kyle Maddox
review: We had an issue once with our Chase Checking. One of our deposits took longer than expected to process and some charges went through during this time. This unfortunately resulted in some overdraft fees.However, we called up Chase, talked to them about the situation, and they very kindly removed the fees completely.Customer service was quick in identifying the problem and fixing it for us. Would definitely recommend them to people.

name: Austin Reedy
review: Opened an account in 2008 for checking and savings, never had any problem retrieving any of the money in my account and all transactions and payments to it were quick to process as long as they weren't over 250+ dollars. I intend to continue using chase as my primary bank due to the reliability of their employees. Personally I feel safe with all of my money in their hands, and trust the caring employees at Chase to continue to please any and all customers that have the pleasure to sign up.

name: James Jasso
review: I mean what can I say I have had this card for a while and all I can say is, this card has never let me down. I mean everyone knows about the amazing ARP and the 0% intro rate, but its the other things that make this card great. Like the max late fee is only 35.00, the mobile apps, and the easy application process. Overall this card is great my only major gripe is that there are no rewards programs, which is a mainstay now of almost every credit card these days. I am very happy with this card overall I feel like this was a great investment and I also like having this in case of an emergency. Thanks again !!!!

name: Robert James
review: The Chase Freedom credit card is a great option for those who have excellent credit (a FICO credit score above 720). The rewards of the card are fairly competitive, with a $100 bonus after spending $500 in your first three months, a very easily-obtained bonus and a major selling point. Not only do you get that, but once you add an authorized user to the card and make a purchase during that same three month period, you get another $25 bonus. A total of $125 for simply signing up and using the card! With 5% cash back on different categories every three months, such as gas, restaurants, and Amazon.com, and 1% cash back on all other purchases, there's really no reason not to choose the card. While the standard 1% is competitive among cash-back cards, other cards do offer above 1% on all purchases; however, those cards don't have the 5% categories like the Chase Freedom card does. There is a limit to the spending that qualifies for 5% back, but it's high (up to $1,500 in category spending per quarter when you sign up). This means you can earn 5% on up to $6,000 of spending every year.In 2014, the Chase Freedom 5 percent cash back categories were Q1 (January 1-March 31, 2014): Gas stations, Starbucks, stores, and movie theaters, Q2 (April 1-June 30, 2014): Restaurants and Lowe's home improvement stores, Q3 (July 1-September 30, 2014): Gas stations and Kohl's, and Q4 (October 1-December 31, 2014): Amazon.com, Zappos.com and select department stores. As you can see, gas appeared for half of the year which is a great reward for a common purchase.Some cards come with high redemption thresholds (you have to redeem a certain amount of rewards to get the cash), and as a result, the cash back you've earned will not be usable until you've reached the threshold. To redeem cash back you have earned with Chase Freedom card, you need a minimum of $20, which is not too high, and shouldn't take too long to earn considering the nature of the rewards of the card. The money can be used for statement credits or direct deposits. Additionally, you always get a full 1-cent-per-point value, which means your rewards do not lessened when you redeem for cash back. The cash back can be used for travel, merchandise, concerts, games, gift cards, and paying off your balance.As someone with excellent credit, I think highly of this card because it rewards me for being timely with my payments. The maximum late fee is $35, which is not bad, especially if you pay your bill in full and on time. There is a grace period of 21 days, which is also helpful, and a nice cushion to have. There is no annual fee, and you can let your rewards add up without worrying if they will expire. There are also no inactivity fees. They also have excellent customer service, and if you have a Chase checking account, payments are even easier to make. Monitoring activity on the card is also just as easy.

name: Jillian Scroggs
review: I love the rewards you get with this card! I have already made back over $100!

name: Josh Howe
review: Great introductory APR, term and balance transfer offers to get my finances moving in the right direction...thank you Chase!

name: Chris Kurtoff
review: The Chase Liquid prepaid card is overall a great way to put your cash into something that you can use to make electronic purchases.  That can help a lot if you don't have a bank account and do not want to walk around with a bunch of cash on hand all the time.  Compared to other prepaid cards I have had in the past, I like the fact that there is no activation fee for the Chase Liquid.  I do not like, however, the fact that there's a monthly fee and a fee every time you use it at a non-Chase atm.

name: Rbl SmartAzz
review: The Chase Slate card offers a great balance transfer rate, 0 % for the first 15 months. After the 15 month period the new APR is 12.99%, 17.99%, and 22.99%. This is a great option to have for those with higher APR's on other cards. The Chase Slate card  is also offered to those with good credit instead of just excellent. Another perk of this card is that the is $0.00 annual fee for holding this card.  If you happen to be late on a payment the max late fee is $35. In other cards I have seen as high as a $50 late fee.

name: Peggy Shannon-Baker
review: Even if you aren't a Chase Sapphire Preferred card holder, you hear enough about it! I always see commercials for this card! I really like the 40,000 bonus points for signing on. If you like the point-based system on credit cards, this is the one to pick. While I don't like the annual fee ($95 after the first year!), it is typical for this kind of card. I travel a lot, so pairing the purchase of the ticket with their point to mileage setup is really ideal for me. Similarly, I also really appreciate the lack of a foreign transaction fee. Those always get me with my other cards!

name: Donna Mizuba
review: Accepted in virtually all places and easy cash back activation via text message! Great for people who like to travel, shop and dine out a lot!

name: Bryan Vanpopering
review: Overall this is a pretty good card. The APR is very reasonable. Would recommend to other people

name: Malcolm Colcord
review: Chase is a pain. The hidden fee's, not to mention the customer service, really have changed for the worst. In one situation, my wallet was stolen, and I didn't have any money to get a new one. The bank I normally go to, where the tellers know me and have seen me, act as if they'd never seen me before, they treated me like a criminal who was trying to pull a scam. Even worse, they were there the day I opened the account. They new I had more than enough money, but refused to give me what I needed because they said I need an ID. Exactly why I was there in the first place

name: Scarlett
review: My experience with Chase has been mixed. They have hidden fees everywhere you turn. It is almost impossible to get an actual representative on the phone. And whenever you want to withdraw from your checking account to you savings, you have to remember multiple passwords and codes. One good thing about Chase was that they offered me a secured credit card to help me build my credit, and it did. All in all they were reliable, if pricey.

name: Join Anonymously
review: The customer service representatives are absolute fantastic at Chase.  I work as a contract nurse so I frequently work in a different state.  Due to my constant relocation, I've always been concerned about the security regarding the use of my credit cards.  On one occasion, I called Chase to make a payment.  During the call, I voiced my concern about the security of my credit card.  The very helpful customer service representative offered me a solution in the Chase Identity Protection (CIP).  With CIP, suspicious transactions will be immediately declined and an alert sent to my mobile phone. I feel much more secure knowing that no one will ever fraudulently use my Chase card. Thank you, customer service representative.

name: Emma Fraser
review: This card is great! It's so simple and has no annual fee. It also has a great auto pay option that I find really helpful.

name: Arjada Bardhi
review: The BA Visa Signature card has an extremely appealing initial bonus offer, compared to other similar travel-based credit cards (such as for instance, Lufthansa Miles & More Premier World Mastercard that offers only 20,000 miles upon initial purchase and an extra 30,000 for a much higher qualifying purchase).
