I like that a user can get additional miles just for using the card on other (non-BA) purchases; for instance, if you spend $800 a month in such purchases, that translates into 1000 miles a month, which in my opinion is really good. Another great feature especially for people who spend a considerable amount of time abroad is the feature of no foreign transaction fees. For all these features, I think the British Airlines Visa Signature credit card is an amazing deal for frequent travelers and others.

name: Annmarie Elizabeth
review: I think that the Hyatt credit card would be a great card to have especially if you travel.  The rewards seem decent and I do like that you can earn points for every dollar spent  at restaurants and and on airline tickets and with car rental agencies.  I do think the grace period seems a little short and it's disappointing to see that there is an annual fee.  The APR is 15.99% which may seem a little on the high side, especially if you have excellent credit and you would be expecting something lower, but when compared with other cards, it is actually average and isn't so terrible.

name: Lafawnduh Sammi
review: I have really enjoyed using my Amazon credit card. I love that there are NO fees! The absolute best part is that I am earning credit on Amazon and I am always needing or wanting to buy things from the site! The credit card is through Chase which has also been satisfactory. The online interface to check and pay balances is easy to use. They offer paperless statements which is always a must for me.

name: Blake Cooper
review: The Amazon.com Credit Card has a sign-up bonus of $30 which is applied to your Amazon account upon approval. The rewards are competitive with most rewards cards and earn 3% at Amazon, 2% at gas stations, restaurants and drug stores and 1% on everything else. The Quicksilver card gives you 1.5% on all purchases but you miss out on the slightly higher rewards for gas and Amazon purchases.

name: Colton Young
review: best card I've ever had, it gave me a great interest rate along with rewards for using it! I don't think a company could do better for its users that this one.

name: Brian Stiehler
review: I like the Chase Freedom Visa card because of the special 5% cash back rewards that are available each quarter.

name: Katie Hall
review: The Chase Freedom Visa has several different perks. The cardholder has the ability to earn a $100.00 bonus for spending $500.00 within the first three months of owning the card. The cardholder also earns unlimited 1% cash back on purchases. Compared to the Discover It card, it has the cardholder in mind. The Chase Freedom Visa has many perks that would allow cardholders to earn cash back as well as earn bonuses, while the Discover It card does not. It only allows you to earn a percent back on purchases during specific months of the year - after that time has passed, you can no longer earn cash back on those types of purchases. Other than the high interest rate, which becomes active after fifteen months, the Chase Freedom Visa seems like a great choice for a credit card.

name: Jill G
review: I like this savings account as it is very easy to maintain and you can avoid the monthly fee as long as you have it linked to your Chase checking account, which I do. It's easy for me to transfer money from my savings account to my checking account, it can be done right online via the Chase website which is extremely convenient. The only problem I have is the limited number of monthly transfers, as I am constantly transferring money from one account to the other and to run out of available transfers is a big inconvenience.

name: Kyle Maddox
review: I got my Chase savings account when I first opened an account/checking account with them years ago. At the time it was part of a promotion to avoid fees but I've come to really appreciate my savings account.Every pay period I have a little bit transferred into my account and I leave that money alone. It's a great way to save up some extra money without even having to worry about it.The people there are very helpful, very nice, I've never had a bad experience with Chase, whether it be with checking, savings, or any other service they offer.

name: Brendan Williams
review: Honestly, I never really used my Chase Savings Account and I think I only opened it to receive a promotional cash offer that was given to me at the time (something like 4 or 5 years ago).  I do not like savings accounts, or any accounts, with fees associated.  There are just too many competitors that can offer no-fee accounts.  With that said, I did also have the Chase Checking Account, and a Slate credit card, and didn't really have any problems with them.  I am an online mostly customer, and so I don't find myself really needing a brick and mortar bank to go to.  Again, I recommend one of the online banks, for savings accounts included, and don't think anyone needs to bother with a savings account that has a $4 charge associated, like the Chase Savings account.

name: Kyle Maddox
review: Since I started College I've been using Chase Checking. For me it's been fantastic. Low to no fees (depending), reliable customer service, and convenient branch and ATM locations anywhere! We just moved from the city into a rural area and our trip times to the bank haven't even changed.They're also great for fraud protection and keep your account safe and secure. If you're a student looking for a new Bank/Checking Account, Chase is a great place to start.

name: Sunshine McKinney
review: I have had this card for several years ago to buy flooring for my house.  Because of the 15 month 0% intro rate, I was able to pay it off with no interest!  I did not use it regularly, because I like to avoid debt, but the next time I did, the rate had gone up to 15.99%, but I called Chase and asked for a better rate, they ran my credit, and gave me the 13.99% rate.  I was pleased with this.  I also like that they have rewards.  I have recently started to better my credit, and because I use Amazon frequently, the points system has been a real plus!  I would recommend this card to anyone who has good credit, and wants to keep it up.

name: Rebeca Morales
review: I applied for the Chase Freedom card and I was approved for a very low APR after I would use it for the first year. They have excellent customer service and every time that I give them a call they are polite and go above and beyond to make sure that I am satisfied with the service. This credit card is excellent because I have a Chase checking account so payments are really easy for me to make. The no annual fee and rewards are excellent as well.

name: Ade Hackington
review: This card never lets me down, using it everywhere is a breeze without issue. You can also get cashback on many purchases and there is an awesome point system. I can't imagine using anything else. The customer service for this card is also some of the best I have ever seen. They helped me prevent issues and told me what I can do in the event of problems. So far no problems!

name: Elle Bezzina
review: I started my relationship with Chase when they sent me an offer in the mail for a $200 bonus for signing up for a checking account. I was able to sign up online and was given the bonus even though I was initially skeptical. This was the start of a trusting relationship, which to me is important when it comes to a bank. The checking account itself follows industry standards, so no monthly fees if my balance is $1500 or more, or if I have direct deposit. I also pay my bills online, which has a quick turnaround and has never failed me. Good product!

name: Owen Nason
review: I signed up for the Rapid Rewards Visa Premier card in April when they were running a promotion to get 25,000 bonus points when you spend $1000 or more your first 3 months of having the card.  Instead I only got 11,758 points and I called to see what the problem was. The operator at Chase card services said the promotion I enrolled in was not for the 25,000 bonus points that were advertised to me, but instead for just 10,000 bonus points if i spent $500 or more within the first 3 months.  This is wrong, like a bait and switch scheme.  I feel like I was slammed with a worse promotion.  The operator said he would open a ticket with the marketing department to investigate but it has been a week and nothing was done to resolve my issue.

name: Daniel Feldt
review: I don't have the best credit in the world and had issues at other banks getting a savings account. I figured I would give Chase a try as a last resort and I soon found out I should have used them in the first place. They have some of the friendliest staff I have ever met and they go above and beyond to make you feel welcome even in my situation. The only downfall of their savings account is the low interest rate but that is to be expected with the group the account is aimed at which is young people who do not have a lot of money such as myself. Give them a try if you are in a similar situation, you won't be disappointed.

name: Mahmoodreza Soltani
review: I am totally pleased with Chase saving account. Chase staffs help you genuinely and appropriately toward your demands and disclose whatever you might need to know to open a chase saving account. If you would like to have saving account definitely I recommend chase saving account. The only defect might be the APY of chase saving that is just a typical amount and you can not name it exceptionally high APY saving account.

name: Yasmina Rivas
review: Chase Liquid Prepaid card has very attractive features and makes it great for people who want to rebuild or build their credit. You can open it with only $25 dollars and use it to make your purchases.I use this card to avoid the low balance fee of $15 in my bank account when its low. The Liquid Chase charges only $4.95 a month so it is more of an option in emergency situations. Think about the Chase Liquid prepaid before trying any other prepaid cards that could be fraudulent. Chase can offer you zero liability protection for any unauthorized transactions and is accepted almost everywhere.I recommend it highly.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review:
This card won't help with credit or banks history 
Read the card rules and regulations.

name: Yasmina Rivas
review: The Slate Credit Card from Chase offers a 0% introductory rate for 15 months. The application process is very smooth. They also have a below average percentage rate than other credit cards. I would recommend to others consumers. It also offers $0 annual fees.

name: Kennady Collins
review: Since I fly literally all the time, this card is perfect for me.  I like that I can use this on separate Southwest accounts, since sometimes I purchase tickets for family members who have different accounts. The interest rate on this card is also not bad, considering it is pretty average for this type of card.  I've saved probably $300-400 since I first got this card, which paid for approximately two free hotel stays. I would recommend this card to anyone who travels a lot.

name: Kennady Collins
review: Since I shop at Amazon pretty much all the time, this card is perfect for me. Since I receive  5% cash back on those purchases, it has earned be over $200 over the past few months, which is awesome. It took me a while to qualify for this card, since it does require you to have very good credit, but I swear it is worth it. The low APR is also a great incentive to get this card, seeing as it is lower than a lot of comparable cards.

name: Michael Kastner
review: What I do not like about the Ink Bold Business Card is that it has a 95 dollar annual fee after the first year. Instead of getting this card I can keep my credit union card that has no annual fee.

name: Lori Siccone
review: I love my Chase Freedom credit card. You get cash back on your purchases, up to 5% if you sign up for the quarterly categories and shop in those stores. They start you off with a lot of points on your cards, which is a big plus, not to mention the long introductory period with no interest. This is the first and only credit card I've ever gotten, and I couldn't be happier with my decision. I recommend it highly.

name: Jess McCulloch
review: I have been banking with Chase now for about 5 years.  For the most part their checking is pretty straight forward.  I do however have some issues.  I get paid via personal check from my employer.  If the check is less then 3k it clears the next day.  If not then it takes a week.  One time my employer even called and the other bank said it cleared on their end so it was Chase just holiding the money.  I know now if my check is more then 3k to have my employer write 2 separate checks (even if deposited together they both clear the next day which is dumb). Also their mobile banking app should let you deposit checks more then 2k.  Other banks do.  its annoying since I freelance and get a lot of checks.

name: Liz Morgan
review: Chase Sapphire credit card is an excellent choice for someone looking to maximize their reward points! It offers many more rewards than my other favorite card, my AMEX Blue. You earn 2x points on all dining at restaurants and 1 point for all other purchases. These really add up quite quickly for some awesome rewards. I also enjoy to use my Chase Sapphire card because it offers a fair apr of 18%. I recommend this card to my friends and family who are looking to receive as many rewards as possible from their credit card.

name: Valerie Moreno
review: I have had my Amazon Rewards card for about a year. I decided to get the card because I was purchasing a large item and they offered me a good deal. I, of course, still use it and love getting the rewards from it. I have contacted customer support with Chase to send me a new card after my wallet was stolen and the service was great. Just don't forget to use it or make a payment and it will be a great card for you.

name: Robert Pipas
review: The British Airways Visa Signature card provides a higher mileage return of over a mile per dollar spent compared to Jet Blue. The mile limit is set pretty high so many miles are available to build up. A great card if you are a flyer of British Airways.

name: Kennady Collins
review: Since I am in a relationship which requires a lot of traveling, this card is perfect for my life. After spending a set amount of money, you accumulate points which can be redeemed for a variety of different things. The APR on this card is sort of unfortunate, but as long as you pay your bills on time there shouldn't be a problem. Great for people who travel a lot and stay in hotels.

name: Jason tripp
review: I have had a checking account with chase for five years now, ever since they offered 100 dollars for opening a checking account.  I thought that some catch would eventually catch up with me but it never did. Chase has been a great bank and being a college student, I constantly needed a good bank for college reasons.  I look back and realize that I picked the best bank for my checking account and I would do it again the same way.Jason

name: Rafael Guerrero
review: It seems like the Hyatt Credit Card is  overrated card that would only be useful those who like to stay at Hyatt hotels. Also never liked annual fees for a card. Thats the reason why I canceled a few cards.

name: Andrea
review: I've used my Chase College Checking for all 4 years of college. It is a very reliable service, and there is almost always a Chase ATM within 5 minutes of wherever I am.  I appreciate the options for alerts, and I was able to set it up to text me whenever I spend over $120 at once, or my account drops below $25. This is great for security and budgeting.

name: Michael Chauvin
review: This Disney Rewards Visa card is definitely a card I’m considering.  The $50 bonus and Disney rewards are very attractive to me.  I’m a little concerned about the Penalty APR being so high, but as long as I stay on top of my payments it shouldn’t be an issue.  I’m looking for a card offers some sort of rewards because my current card doesn’t offer anything and what could be better than Disney?

name: Colton Young
review: The Chase Slate card gave me a great 0% intro APR and balance transfer, so I could transfer my higher interest cards over.  Not only was the introductory period great, but the actual fixed interest it gave me was 12% much lower than my other credit cards which had around 18%.  This is the best card I have seen or had for anyone wanting a low interest card with great standard benefits.

name: Samantha Chauvin McKee
review: This is a pretty easy tool to use to make some savings passively. IF you have the money in the first place. I had gotten a small amount of money from an insurance settlement so I put some into this savings CD at Chase. It was easy to set up with very little paperwork. I could call or check in online to see how my money had grown and the withdraw paperwork was easy as well. Customer service at Chase is always great no matter what you are doing and this was no different. What I wasn't too thrilled with is that there isn't really a good tool to use if you aren't a current customer. I wanted to check other banks and in order to do so at other places and even Chase to get actual info they want you to call in and talk to people. I don't always want to . That's why I have the internet! Haha. But overall an easy process and made me a little extra cash :-)

name: Amy Reinhart
review: Until the British Airways Visa Card has a pin to go with the chip, and has customer verification method (CVM) set to 1. pin 2. signature, then this card is of little use to anyone traveling to Europe or most of the rest of the world.Avios are tough to use economically as BA charges very high fees and fuel charges ($700 on a $1000 flight). A better use is with Aer Lingus, a BA codeshare partner, which has much lower fees. However you have to book by telephone, and convince the person waiting on you that they should waive the telephone booking fee, as it's not possible to make this booking online.

name: Crystal Lombardo
review: I have been banking with Chase for just over two years now, and I will never switch banks again!  The people at Chase have been helpful, friendly, and accommodating every time I have been into a branch. When I went through some personal struggles with my finances they did their best to help me understand my options and how to get my account back on track, and never once did they make me feel bad about the situation. Besides that, their website makes it super easy to do most anything I need to without leaving the comfort of my home.  They also have a wonderful phone app in which I can do most of my banking quick and easily on the go.  I feel that their level of service is just heads and tails above the rest and that's what keeps me a loyal and happy Chase client!

name: Karlie Madden
review: I've had my Amazon credit card for over 7 years now. I love the rewards and the fact there are no annual fees. I am an avid Amazon shopper so the points I receive from using my card on their website is great. It's my ONLY go-to credit card.

name: John Danger
review: Chase has probably the best customer service on the planet! I started with bank of America and sometimes I'm not very good with my budget. I went over by a few pennies and was charged 30$. At this point I did not know I was over. I bought 1 pack of gum for .75 was charged another 40$. The next day an ATM fee went through and they charged me another 40$. I owe bank of America 120$ for something that should have only cost me 3-5$ I called there customer support and no one would do anything. I have over drafted my account with Chase about 3 times since I've been with them. I call their customer support and BAM they returned the overdraft fee since I would have the money in there on payday. They have always been super helpful with everything I have ever needed. Another banks ATM malfunctioned and Chase got on top of it and got me my money back. Chase is the best bank I have ever used.

name: Dann Day
review: I have had my Chase Premier Plus checking account for 6-plus years now and plan to stick with the great service it offers.  I like the fact that I can easily link this account to my other accounts and transact business online so easily between the accounts with transfer features.   The convenience of the online features notwithstanding, the overdraft protection, free checks and lack of monthly fees are also a huge plus compared to others out there.  I also appreciate the good customer service I've gotten banking with Chase from day one.  This is a good service and I recommend it.

name: Brian Clark Ignacio
review: I have this card, and I love it. Since I love to travel, this is what I rely on every time. The bonus points was what got me to enroll in this particular card, and I did avail the 40,000 bonus points within the first 3 months of use, and I had no problem receiving it. Customer service was friendly, and always available, any time 24/7. The setback I would say is the annual fee of $95. I almost forgot about that, and was wanting to complain. As for interest rates, and late charges, they are about the same as most of my other cards I have, which isn't a huge deal for me.

name: dakota Pendarvis
review: I've had Chase College Checking for about 2 years now, and have been nothing but satisfied. I've had numerous charges go on my account that I did NOT make, and they took care of them instantly for me. The customer service is nothing short of excellent. My biggest problem I've had is a time when I had someone steal my identity on eBay and make $100 + purchases from my checking account, using an E-Check. I called Chase and immediately, they took action and canceled every transaction and refunded me, plus reinstated a bounced check fee from the transaction. I would definitely recommend Chase to anyone and everyone!

name: Carrie Smith
review: The Chase Sapphire offers much more than my Capital One Card.  First off it offers this great point incentive.  Anyone who spends like me is all but guaranteed that first $100. in travel rewards.  And for a single person who eats out a lot, I would definitely benefit for the double points at restaurants.It is great to receive points that for something that I love---traveling.  And even better that I am receiving points without actually doing nothing except living my own life!

name: Jesilyn Kent
review: I love my bank. They are very helpful and informative. When I have any problems with deposits, withdraws, or any other financial need, I can call or stop in and speak with a banker. The bankers are always nice and respectful and they try every avenue they can to help you with your financial concerns. One time I had lost my bank card and I needed it express to me a.s.a.p, the customer service representative helped me get a new bank card and expressed it to me, without me even saying anything to her. I would recommend this bank to anyone who is looking for a bank that is reliable and trust worthy.

name: Wilson
review: I chose to start banking with Chase because I was so satisfied with their credit cards. The bank was offering a good promotion a couple of years ago, so I went for it, and I've been very satisfied. They are especially strong in customer support. They always remember my name when I come, and I like the modern feel of the space. These little things really count!

name: Dayana Jaoudé
review: The Amazon.com Credit Card does not have any annual fees which is really great. Also the point system is very elaborate and rewarding. I can earn points spending money on Amazon or at some gas stations and restaurants which gives me great flexibility to earn rewards. This credit card is a catch!

name: Jill Tado
review: I signed up for the Chase College checking account some time ago. It's pretty good for the most part. I enjoy how they make direct deposit easy. If you have an issue with your account go into a branch. Their telephone advisors are pugnacious and aloof. Overal I say yes to this checking account/debit card.

name: Jill G
review: I was having trouble maintaining my minimum balance with my previous Chase checking account, so a representative suggested I switch to the total checking account. It is quite easy to keep the relatively low balance in my account most of the time, and for those months when I dip under, the fee is not so astronomical that I suffer much from it. I use my checking account for everything so it is also not hard to avoid the monthly fee with lots of transactions. Excellent service.

name: Joseph Mognon
review: My favorite cash back card...

name: Susan Reed
review: This is an excellent card if you have excellent credit. I love the introduction of no interest for 15 months also no annual fee. The fact that the rewards never expires gives you ample time to build points for special holidays when you can really use them. Chase Freedom offers many other bonus and cash back options.

name: Caroline Guo
review: I've run into problems with my checking account several times.  Because I have a College Checking Account, I should be exempt from monthly maintenance fees.  However, at three different points in time, I've been hit with fees for no apparent reason.  Each time, I've had to go to a Chase Bank location and talk to the teller.  Three of the four tellers I've talked to have been nothing but helpful and were able not only to ensure the issue didn't occur again, but also to refund the maintenance fees charged.  At one location (a Chase bank attached to a ShopRite), the teller informed me that his hands were tied and nicely told me he was sorry he couldn't do more.  I suspect however that he simply didn't know how to resolve the problem.  I say this because when I later visited the location by my house, the lady there was able to refund my fees very easily.All in all, I've had great experience with the customer service in the Chase banks, which is the only reason I've kept my account there.  The ubiquity of Chase ATM's have made it a great convenience.  The online checking is very easy to use, and recently, they've upgraded a lot of their locations with electronic tellers.  These machines are just like ATM's, but have more capabilities, such as accepting checks and cash deposits.  That means that most of the time, there's no line to go through.

name: ashley
review: All my experiences with Chase Bank have been stress free. From opening my account 6 years ago until now. Three years ago I was attending a concert and came out to the car to see the car had been broken into and my purse from under the seat was gone. After getting police involved i had no choice but to go home. I called Chase Banks 24 hour line to get my card canceled and was told someone bought $200 worth of gas right before I called. I assured them it was not me and they put the money back in my account and sent me a new card that week! I have never felt shocked, scared and relieved in one evening. I was impressed at how Chase Bank handled it and calmed me down.

name: Peter Dennis
review: I have had a Chase checking account for about 6 years now. It has served me well. I have never had issues with deposits not showing up or long wait times for deposits. I like the fact I can make check deposits from my smartphone. I plan to keep this account for quite some time.

name: Danielle O'Neill
review: The Chase Freedom card is a pretty good card. The rewards are very useful, especially the opportunity to get 5% cash back on certain purchases. I like that they continually increase my credit limit, but the APR is on the high end.

name: Elena
review: I have gotten the Amazon card to get a good discount on the first time purchase with this card on Amazon plus a free shipping. I don't shop on Amazon too much, but the toy that I was buying for my daughter as a gift was almost $45. With this promotion, I only paid about 12 or 15 dollars for it. I rarely use credit cards in day by day purchases, so I think it is good to have it just in case. The rate is reasonable, and if you do not overcharge on it, it is very manageable.

name: Dee Black
review: The Marriott Rewards credit seems like it would be a great card for frequent travelers.  There are many perks for those who travel, including free nights at hotels worldwide, airline miles, and travel and leisure rewards.  There is no limit as to how much you can earn, which is great for those who travel frequently for business.  The regular APR of 15.99% seems comparable to other cards, such as the Chase card that I currently use.

name: Subconcious Being
review: I'm a HUGE amazon shopper so this card is very well put together. CHASE has done it again

name: AL Diaz
review: i don't like the fact that this TRAVEL card has a FOREIGN TRANSACTION FEE.............CAP ONE Or B O A are better in that sense

name: Patrick Shanley
review: they are stupid and do not listen.  i have written the most insulting emails and they do not respond.  the service suck and they suck.

name: David Daly
review: Perhaps they don't reply BECAUSE your emails are insulting !!

name: Sue Brown
review: I am not sure I am thrilled with this card at all. I thought it would be a good one giving me 30, 000 miles after spending only 1,000 dollars the first 3 months of use. But now, when they say i have enough miles for a free RT ticket.......when i go to book, it says that there are no flights available.....not sure how they can state use your miles on ANY united flight without restrictions!!! WHAT???  think this card is a big mistake!!!

name: David Daly
review: Have you tried Customer Services?

name: AL Diaz
review: The Chase Freedom Visa is a good credit card, it gives you $100 if you spend $500 in the first 3 months and 0% interests for 15 months plus if you have a Checking with Chase you get and extra 10% Cash bonus reward, it is NOT the best card but the best thing about it, is that you can get it with a FICO in the 600s...

name: Nigel Woodfork
review: I initially accepted this card for the $30 gift and it has been useful because I shop on Amazon.com all the time, so I like to use the points to make me feel like I have free expedited shipping.

name: Michael Robinson
review: I feel as though the Hyatt Credit Card isn't that bad of an idea. It allows one to gain as they spend money. I've only truly ever dealt with Chase's Marriott Rewards Premier Credit Card, and I don't believe their rewards are worth the money that you'd spend to get them. You only get an annual free night stay with the Marriott Rewards Card. Also, Hyatt has no resort fee's on the free night room's that one receives from using the card.

name: Tien Le
review: I have been with Chase for over 10 years (mainly a credit card customer only). I recently opened a Chase checking account about a year ago. I can't be any happier. Customer service is impeccable. Every time I call Chase, my problems or concerns are resolved. I had an incident when my employer was not able to direct deposit a payroll check and I overdrew my account. I immediately called Chase and explained what happened and the fee was lifted. When I opened the account, I received $200 as a bonus offer. There is a $12 monthly fee, but it will be waived with a total minimum direct deposit of $500 monthly. My paycheck is direct deposit int my account, so there is no worries about the fees there. Chase has locations all over the United States and I don't have to worry about the $3 fee charged for using another bank's ATM. I highly recommend Chase Bank.

name: Kelly Apodaca
review: I have had my Chase account for about 7 years.  I have never had any problems with them whatsoever.  As a matter of fact, their customer service is amazing.  I got a fraud alert once, saying that someone had made some suspicious charges with my account and I panicked!  I called Chase and told them I had not made these purchases, and just like that, they fixed everything.  From then  on, when I had made purchases that are not like my normal purchases, they have e-mailed me to clarify that it was actually me making those purchases.  I feel safe with Chase, and when things have gone wrong; they have always fixed them without any stress at all.

name: Nicholas Tucker
review: I like this card very much and have had it for about 6 months.  It may be especially useful if you have a lot of kids around and are often buying disney stuff!  The maximum late fee is low at only $35 which is more than reasonable, however there is a maximum penalty APR of almost 28% which is really high.  However, I really like this card.

name: Karen Shroyer
review: I have been with Chase for sometime now.  I have had no real issues with them.  They do charge high fees if you do not have direct deposit, or do not keep a very high limit.  Thankfully for most people employers offer direct deposit.  I like that there are so many branches around, this makes finding an ATM or if you need to do face to face banking you more then likely have a bank within 15 miles.

name: Casey Hester
review: When we moved to a new state,  our current bank was not available. Chase provided excellent service in helping us start up a new account. During the process of cancelling and opening the new account our funds from the old to the new account were not available and the new account was till waiting for funds to be processed. Chase expidited this for us ensuring us that we would have funds in case of emergency.

name: Yoan Rodriguez
review: Chase College Checking is probably the greatest Checking out there for soon to be or current college students. It offers no annual fee, no monthly fee, no monthly amount, and no minimum amount of money to open the account. This is a great way for a student to start entering the real world with a reliable bank. The card is good for about 4 years or the term most students are in college but watch out for those over draft charges students they will bite you hard if your irresponsible. I myself used this card for 4 years and Chase helped me every time I had a question and they were even kind enough to reverse a few overdraft fees when I pleaded my case, absolutely great customer service.This is an exceptionally great service for a broke college student just trying to get by and pay for college, really appreciate them.

name: Jeremy Martin
review: This credit card seems like a decent if you plan on spending a lot of money to build up points. The points structure is relatively complex to achieve any status... also, the $95 fee after the first year is outstandingly high. All in all, if you're looking for a basic start up card to build your credit, I would not go with this one. I would look elsewhere unless you are going to use this card for many expensive purchases.

name: Lisa Lamphere
review: Prior to banking with Chase I was with a local credit union. There are a lot of good things to say about credit unions, but the fact is, Chase has exceeded all my expectations. The switch to Chase came due to a direct deposit timing issues with my credit union and Chase has never once had any issues with this. I thought that was good enough, but the care they have for their clients who have to work paycheck to paycheck is outstanding! Sometimes there are just not enough funds, but Chase does not make it worse like so many other banks. They give you until the close of day to get out of the negative, so you are not slammed with fees, amazing! Also, I had a fraud issue and they were quick to resolve the issue and the local branch manager followed up to make sure everything was okay. The only negative is the fee from Chase for using an ATM other than theirs (you get the fee from the other bank and one from Chase), but there are enough Chase banks that it has never been a big problem. Overall, the pros outweigh the con and I highly recommend banking with Chase!

name: Lisa Shon Felise
review: Would I qualify for a United Explorer card with a Fico score of 700? I received an invitation only offer since Ive booked 4 trips with them to travel between Oct and Jan...

name: WalletHub
review: Your credit score seems to be close to the “acceptable range”, however, no one can tell you for sure whether a credit score of 700 is sufficient to garner approval. The reason for that is because while your credit standing is a very important factor it’s not the only one. There are other variables that may play a role such as outstanding debts, your job status and income. Since you were already preapproved my personal assessment is that you have a good chance of getting approved for the card if you apply.

name: Latasha Harmon
review: The Chase Slate credit card has a great 0% introductory APR that sets it apart from other cards, like my capital one rewards card. The application and approval process was quick and painless, and their customer service is very friendly. I wish they offered a rewards program, but the other perks make the card worth it. No annual fee, no balance transfer fee, and most importantly no over the limit fee.

name: Kami Danna
review: I like this card, but it isn't the best credit card I own. My interest rate is fairly low. The customer servicer is available 24/7, and that is convenient for me being that I work late nights. The annual fee is a killer at $95 after the first year. The rewards add up fast!

name: Jimmy Lussier
review: Excellent card option, I was a first time card user when I first picked up this card and was amazed how helpful the staff were whenever I had a question or issue The Chase staff will always be around to help you if you need it, they actually service the customer unlike most other companies nowadays. Just be logical and pay your monthly bill and everything will be fine. You wont regret getting this card.

name: Ashley Neumann
review: The Chase slate card has a reasonable APR.  I've had this card for a few years now and they are easy to work with.  Payments can be made right from the chase app so it's convenient.

name: William Selmi
review: I opened this account about 4 months ago.It was easy to open -- did so on their website; I already have existing checking with Chase.I linked this account to my checking to cover over draft and for ease of transfer in both directions.I think this setup would be fine for most users.My one complaint: they converted it to a checking account.Apparently there is a regulation limiting the number of transactions you can do with a savings account. They warned me this was possible after they converted it. I think the intent was to tell me before but it didn't work that way.To summarize all good but faster communication from the bank would help.I do use the android app and they have my email info -- seems simple enough.

name: Kyle
review: Opened a Chase savings account after Bank of America was giving me problems nearly every month.  While I have enjoyed my time as a Chase customer, they did not handle the transition very well.  They promised to mail me a debt card within two weeks, yet I ended up having to go into my local branch office to get one.  However, since then everything has been relatively smooth.

name: Katelyn Woodhouse
review: I like that this card offers a $30 gift upon approval and with decent credit the APR isn't too high. The only thing that seems to be a little difficult is amassing points. However with no annual fee it kind of makes up for that. This reminds me of a premier bank credit card because you can do cash advances with a slightly higher APR. Overall I'd recommend this card to heavy online shoppers.

name: Lizzy Check
review: I think that this card has the best rewards out of any card. I have received cash from chase more than a couple times. Really easy to use.

name: Albert Cano
review: Like that this card has plenty of bonus opportunities.  Also like the fact that the intro APR is 0% for 15 months.  I also like the fact that the balance transfer percent is a low 3%.  I also like the fact that there are promos like the shopping at Khols and getting 5% cash back.  Anywhere you can save is good to me.  I would have a hard time choosing between this card and the Capital One Venture card, but the intro interest rate would sway me towards this card.

name: Blythe Passanando
review: The annual fee on this card is obviously high, but the low APR, and AMAZING card member benefits totally make up for that! 50,000 points is worth hundreds of dollars, and they come really quickly in relation to the time of opening the card. I highly recommend this card if you fly British Airways (or want to).

name: Chad Counsel
review: The Hyatt credit card offers great reward bonuses for those that like to spend a lot. As mentioned by others, the 2 Free Nights from spending $1000 in the first three months is a great offer and is almost enough to make me want to get this card alone. On top of that, the bonuses for eating at restaurants and traveling via airplane are both great deals that I can see being very useful to most people. Overall, a great card.

name: Lisa Morgan-Appleby
review: Cute card... What I also like are the rewards.  $ 50 Disney gift card with first purchase is nice.  I also like the Disney dollars 1 for every 100 spent.  What I don't like is the high interest rate.  It shows 0% for 6 months but then goes up to 15% after that.  So for every $100 I spend this card charges me 15 dollars, not cool.  Plus its Disney, you would think they could be a bit more generous on the interest for this card.  Also $35 on a late fee is a bit excessive, most people who have to be late on even a minimum payment clearly could use a little slack.  Looks like the companies that are promoting this are not any better than any other card I've seen, except that it's cute to look at.

name: Brian McClay
review: It is always zero interest if you don't carry a balance, and you still get the rewards.

name: Jamie Droddy
review: My husband and I opened a savings account with Chase right after we got married. We chose to bank with Chase because of their locations across the country. Having been customers for 3 years now, we are very glad we made this decision. We love how easy it is to access our accounts online, even from the app on our phones! This makes transferring money a breeze! We are also appreciative of the credit cards  we have been approved to get because of our savings account through Chase. We have received nothing but great customer service!

name: Jackie Lage
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card is a good option for someone who has a variable income or inconsistent paychecks. The monthly fee of $4.95 is not that great when it comes to credit cards, especially secured credit cards such as this one. My secured credit card with Bank of America has a $25/yr fee. However, when you compare it to the monthly charges that Bank of America charges on their Checking Accounts , which is $15.00 when you have a low balance, this is a great alternative. I would recommend this type of card to someone who wants to build their credit and can't get approved for un-secured credit cards. You get the added benefit of using it at any Chase ATM for no charge. I think that is a great benefit since Chase has many locations worldwide.

name: Ian Harris
review: The Liquid card doesn't build credit, nor is it a secured credit card - it's a prepaid debit card, powered by a bank.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: This car is prepaid it won't rebuilt credit is a debit card anyways why many people here call it a credit card I don't know

name: Bronwyn Caroline
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is the card my husband is using exclusively right now as he travels for work. The annual fee and interest rate is too high, but his company reimburses us so we are not affected by that negative. The initial gift of 40,000 reward points makes the card most attractive. With all of his and our family's traveling it is easy to accumulate additional points, which we redeem often. In the long run, saves us money.

name: Michelle
review: I have the chase slate credit card for the past 4 years. I have good credit so my interest rate was is very reasonable. There fraud protection is wonderful as a few months ago someone tried to use my credit card online and input the wrong expiration date. They immediately notified me asking about the purchase and sent me a new card the very next day in the mail. They were helpful and I highly recommend them for anyone looking for great customer service.

name: Brian Dixon
review: Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is a card that can be used throughout the world and it has a great rewards program. If this is the card you use predominately and if you like to travel, it is easy to accrue points that can be converted to traveling dollars. Unlike some other cards you might get, the 1 point earned for each dollar spent gives you the ability to accrue points easy. On top of that, while traveling you can earn 2 points per dollar when dining at restaurants and most traveling expenses. For those worried about introduction fees, the first year is waved so you get the opportunity to try this card without having to make a “dollar” commitment. The customer service is fast and friendly. If you travel a lot, this is the card for you.

name: Indira White
review: I opened this card when I anticipated a large expense. It had 12 months interest free and a bonus opportunity for spending a $500 in the first three months. I already knew I would spend this and was able to earn that bonus of $100! I love the quarterly categories and I use my card only when those categories apply to me to maximize on the 5% back received. To redeem cash back earned you need a minimum of $20, which is not bad and understandable. Typically I take this off my card balance using it as account credit and lower my bill. It feels great! I think the interest is pretty high, but I'm not concerned since I do not spend more than I can afford. I love it when categories for airfare, vacation, hotels and cruises fall right when you need them too. Huge saver! I recommend this card!

name: Pipk Sau
review: From the first days of working, I have opened up a Chase Total Checking account. Even though Chase is not the best company because they charge high fees and in general have a lot of fees, it is the most convenient bank. Everywhere you go you see a Chase Bank, usually even 2 of the on one block. I believe have a bank always by your side is the most important thing because you always need cash. Within the years of having a Chase Total Checking account I had never had a problem with them. The customer service is also really good at all of the Chase branches. If they ripped people off a bit less it would have been a great bank.

name: Robin Spatola
review: I have traveled to Europe with this card twice now and what I like about it is the ease of use worldwide combined with zero foreign transaction fees.  In contrast, someone I was traveling with had a different type of credit card which was hardly accepted anywhere.  Most cashiers we ran into hadn't even heard of it.  So I am happy to travel with a Visa and feel confident that I will be able to purchase what I need anywhere.  I also like the huge variety of rewards offered although I have opted for the statement credits which helped pay for my trip to Europe!The downside is the annual fee and the high interest rate after the introductory period but if you pay it off each month and if you use the reward points for statement credit, it will pay for itself.

name: Brittany Nichole
review: I have had chase for about 5 years, I love the card and have had no issues. I love that you get 5% cash back and you get a good interest rate. The zero APR when I first signed up was the seller for me. I think that this is one of the best credit cards I have ever had, considering I close most of the others.

name: Pipk Sau
review: Since I am moving into a new location, it is important for me to have a 15 month interest free credit card in order to purchase all of the necessities that I need for my new home. After searching around for different credit cards, I have came across the Chase Slate credit card. The Chase Slate credit card provided me with a reasonable regular rate and gives a 15-month 0% purchases interest rate, which I was extremely happy. Since I was approved I could now purchase all the essentials without having to worry about acured APR.

name: Connie Cordell
review: This sounds like Chase Sapphire is offering a lot for it's customers. I'm not too sure I agree. The yearly rate is much higher than the $35 I pay for my Capital One MasterCard. Also I notice that they charge a fee and a higher percentage for cash advances. I also get charged a higher interest rate on cash advances but that does not include an additional cash advance fee %.

name: Robert Stephens
review: As others have said I really like this card as well.  Redeeming rewards is quick and easy.  They also have a wide variety of 5% cash back categories.  The interest rate is competitive and I got a great introductory offer ($100.00 cash back when I spent $1,000 in the first 3 months).  I can use the card anywhere, and hell, it even looks snazzy.  Also, since I have a Chase checking account, scheduling a payment for this card or monitoring activity on the card is a snap!  Also the only time I had to call customer service for this card, I spoke with an actual American who was actually quite friendly and understanding of my inebriated state.  I do wish this card would have other cash back incentives that are somewhere in between the 1% and 5% categories.  I also wish the after-introductory interest rate was a little lower but all in all I am very happy with this card.

name: Brian Dixon
review: I have been a member of Chase Banking for several years now. They are always professional and very helpful. When I decided to switch banks, Chase convinced me the very first day in their offices. The representative found ways that I could open a new checking and savings account without paying maintenance fees. Through her questions, she found that I was former military and because of this she was able to enroll me without having to worry about maintenance fees if my account didn't have a certain amount of money in it. That first day I was hooked and I have never regretted by decision.

name: Danielle O'Neill
review: The Chase Liquid is a great prepaid card with a reasonably monthly fee of $4.95 and I like the fact that the fee can be waived when linking to a checking account. Why would you  not get this card? The fact that this card is associated with one of the most reputable banks in the country is another huge plus, and the direct deposit feature is great. Would highly recommend this card if you decide to go the prepaid route.

name: Danielle O'Neill
review: The Chase Slate card is pretty good. The fact that you have 0% interest for the first 15 months is wonderful and a strong incentive to pay off quickly. The regular APR is kind of high but even more reason to pay off within the 15 months. Also great that there is a 0% intro rate for transfers and $0 annual fee. Would recommend this card.

name: AMANDA
review: I had a higher interest credit card that I wanted to start paying off.  Chase Slate offered 15 month no interest on balance transfers along with no balance transfer fee and 0% APR for the first 15 months as well.  When the 15 months is over, the APR would be considerably less than my other Discover Card.  So far everything has gone great.  The Application process was easy, I was approved right away, and they transferred my balance without any additional paperwork.  If you are looking to transfer your balance for $0 then this is the right card for you.

name: Aaron Hinkle
review: While the Chase slate card does not offer some of the interesting rewards that a lot of modern cards offer it does have a great 1 year 0% interest introductory and Chase customer service has always been prompt and very helpful, I would highly recommend this card, especially for it's awesome 1 year 0% offer.

name: Kyle Schwab
review: Used to be ok but now uselessDo not get this cardI have it!

name: Kate Mecary
review: The 50,000 bonus miles are a good incentive to apply for the card. The penalty rate is pretty high at 29.99%!

name: Devin Sahr
review: I have absolutely no complaints when it comes to my Chase savings account. I have had this account for about a year now and it's perfect! Basically the way it works is I avoid fees if on the designated day of the month that I set up (mine is the 20th day of every month), they just pull $25 from my checking account and move it to savings, it's that simple! You can make withdraws from your account 6 times a month and for the average person that is PLENTY! Over all I've never had any issues with Chase on either of my accounts, especially this one. I am so glad I didn't go anywhere else for this account.

name: Tien Le
review: The Hyatt Credit Card has great rewards for people who travel a lot. The 2 Free Nights after $1,000 spent in the first 3 months is easily worth over $300 dollars depending on what hotel you stay at and where it is located. I, on the other hand, prefer the Bank of America Better Balance Rewards card. I get $25 added to my credit every quarter for making at least the minimum required payments monthly. So I can get $100 every year for the life of the card. The Hyatt Credit Card gives a free night on every anniversary, but at a cost of $75 (the annual fee). Bank of America does not charge an annual fee.By: Tien Le

name: Michael Perry
review: I have used Chase Total Checking for years. They have excellent customer service, their mobile app is perfect (very easy to deposit checks remotely) and I've also had loans with them. Chase is an excellent bank and you account comes with a free savings account and very little in terms of fees.

name: lisa adkins
review: I have been a Chase customer for over two years and love it. I have never had any problems with direct deposits, transfers or the mobile application. Great customer service no matter how I contact them by phone or walking into my local branch. I earn points by using my debit card and that is also a perk. I have been with many banks over the years and Chase is the only bank that meets all my needs for banking!

name: Christine Brown
review: I have a Chase and checking account and I love it! The customer service is awesome! We have our pay checks direct deposited, so we do not get charged the monthly fee. A couple of years ago we were moving and we had notified our cable company and they ended up double billing me for my final bill, $450! Moving is expensive enough without getting billed twice for a service. I called Chase and they gave me a courtesy credit for the extra bill while they investigated with the cable company. I never heard anything else about it! It was Great!

name: Alex Hendry
review: Pro's of this Disney card -It has simple rates and rewards. There's not a lot of "You get THIS, but only if you spend X amount." Those kinds of gimmicks are never as awesome as they seem, so I'm grateful that this is straightforward. Modest bonus, but not one you have to fight for. 1% rewards. It seems pretty clear-cut. The rate is actually pretty low compared to other cards I've been looking at.Also, it's Visa. I've used a few different brands, and Visa really is accepted more places.  Even if a merchant says they accept Visa & say MasterCard, the Visa is less likely to malfunction or deny your card because you're in a different state.  (I really think MasterCard looks for excuses to not pay for stuff) Anyway, Visa is probably the most universally accepted.Last pro -DISNEY! That means you can use points on a vacation, which is pretty typical, but even if you're a more modest spender and don't rack up enough to buy airfare, you can still use rewards for Christmas presents and such. It's a pretty versatile brand for this card to be paired with.But there are some downsides.  That $50 bonus isn't going to go far in a Disney store, and definitely not in a park. So keep that in mind. Also, that 10% is only on selected items, which means stuff you probably have to coaxed into wanting.  The DVD's, toys, and games that you want probably won't be discounted.The last thing to consider is that credit card companies really are into loyalty.  Their faithful good customers get expedited treatment and unexpected perks. Eventually your kids will grow up, and you'll want a card that give rewards for things like gas or textbooks as opposed to a deluxe copy of Snow White.  So the drawback is that while faithfully paying your bill on time will still build good credit, that goodwill with the company will be lost when you inevitably have to get a new card.

name: Sonya Torres
review: Have had this card for a little over a year. Approved quickly, 5% cash back is wonderful! Easy to use and understand. Keeping this card for a while!

name: Andrew Nelms
review: Using this card has been quite a pleasure. The low late fee is nice for the months where I forget to pay.

name: Corbin L Huffman
review: This card has been in my possession since last year and I absolutely love it. Chase gave me a high limit with a low APR%. The zero APR for the first 15 months really swayed me to apply for this card. Their cash reward promotions are excellent.

name: Kimberly
review: I opened my current checking account with Chase in the beginning of 2012 and have not even thought about switching since. One of the biggest pluses with Chase, for me, is their website interface - it is insanely easy to understand, which makes me track of my money fool proof. They are also faster than any other bank I've used in terms of accepting deposits. Another great thing about them is that when I over drafted a couple of months ago and couldn't afford the fee, they got rid of it for me since it was my first time since opening the account. I have nothing but good things to say about them.

name: Dara
review: I cannot say enough good things about Chase! We received a free checking account with Chase because my husband is a vet. We also get up to free savings accounts that we can link to that checking account. We travel a lot and have gone to different branches throughout the country, and have never had anything but great things to say about their customer service. Chase really is top notch!

name: Derek Jenson
review: This card is great for people that use their credit cards to pay monthly bills.  Yes the annual fee is high, but the rewards are big. This card is definitely not for everyone.  Only get this card if you plan on using it a lot and paying the entire balance monthly. Good for rewards, bad on fees.

name: Victor Diaz
review: The Marriott Rewards credit card is an amazing choice for the business person. It offers a great point based reward system which can be used for travel and stays at Marriott hotels all-round the world. When looking at fees it does have a forty-five dollar annual fee but when looking at the benefits gets paid for tenfold every month if you are the type of person that travels frequently for work or even pleasure. Take a good look at this card it really has benefits for every type of person.

name: Anthony
review: This is the best checking account for any student in America. I got the account when i joined college and they told me it was good for four years. The greatest thing about this account was that you had access to all the services other customers with regular account got but at NO FEE which is fantastic for a regular college kid with little or no income. There were no minimum balance requirements but overdraft fees were very steep. Generally its a great account considering it comes standard with no fees

name: Latasha Harmon
review: I love the Chase Sapphire card!  Having access to customer service 24/7 is really helpful since I travel a lot and may need help late at night or early in the morning. The rewards are great too, and being on a budget makes me appreciate their no annual fee.

name: Lori Bennett
review: I have had this card for the last 5 years. It is a great card. I love getting the cash back. It is nice that they allow the cash awards towards a payment. The rate could be a lot better and am not a huge fan of the late fee. It is not not to have a yearly fine though. Overall I feel that it is a good card and does have its benefits to using the card.

name: Bill Ryan
review: I received this card in February and have been pleased with the service. I earn 5% cash on gas, restaurants, Kohls, etc. depending on which quarter it is. In addition, I was able to get $200 after purchasing $500 within the first 3 months of receiving the card. That is a nice added bonus! Overall I like the card but the customer service could be a little quicker when I call in. Sometimes I wait about 20 minutes before speaking with someone.

name: Caitlyn Zay
review: I really like the fact that the Chase Liquid pre-paid card allows for direct deposit, so I can get my paycheck automatically put on the card to spend right away. It does however annoy me a little bit that there is a $4.95 a month monthly service fee, since many cards like debit cards allow for no monthly fee if you have a direct deposit. I already have a Chase checking account that I opened recently, and just found out that when you link a chase checking account the $4.95 fee can be waived. So if you can do that, then this card is worth it! I know this works good for some people that cannot get any checking accounts, I don't have that problem but I like to keep my money in separate places other wise I over spend! I like it much better than the Mastercard pre-paid card!

name: Charm EL
review: Hello Caitlyn. Enlighten me on this please

name: Karen
review: I have a Chase Freedom card that I've used for many years, so when I was offered the Chase Slate card, I took it. The 0% introductory offer helped, though I really didn't need it at the time. Still, it was nice to know that when I used it, I wasn't going to be paying any interest -- which meant I didn't have to pay off my bill right away. I never put much on it, so when the interest rate increased eventually, I didn't have a balance. Even without the 0% offer, the rate on this card is reasonable. I've only had good experiences with Chase, so I'm keeping this card for emergencies and occasional splurging.

name: Ashley Raybuck
review: This credit card is a nice one to have. The rewards are certainly worth it provided that you can keep up with the monthly payments and pay it off each month. The interest rate is a bit high, however if you only use the card for what you know you are able to pay off each month, it really helps to boost your credit. This card is especially ideal for those who use Amazon to make online purchases quite frequently.

name: April Michelle
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card offers many perks in comparison to some of its competitors of a similar type.  40,000 bonus points can be earned by spending $3,000 on purchases in the first 3 months.  Add a preauthorized user and make a purchase in the first 3 months and that is another 5,000 bonus points!  However, if a person doubts they can spend $3,000 so quickly and their main enticement for enrolling is bonus points, then there may be better options.  The Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card by American Express offers a slightly smaller bonus point of 30,000, but there is only a requirement of $1,000 being spent in the first 3 months after enrolling.The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card has a competitive APR of 15.99% (V) after the enrollment period.  Other similar credit cards have slightly higher APR’s and the Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card offers an APR of 15.24, 17.24, or 19.24 based on creditworthiness.  The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card also offers a better APR for cash advances of 19.24% compared to the Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card’s 25.24%. Sure there is an eyebrow raising annual fee, but that isn't until after the first year.  For credit cards with perks like these, annual fees are completely understandable!

name: Joshua Coty
review: I got this credit card because of the introductory rate.  It was 0% for an entire year, and I really do love this card.  They offer text message and email alerts so that you always remember to make your payments.  The interest rate after the introductory rate is a little high, but it is totally work it.  It also helps that this card also just looks cool with it's vertical design and matte plastic material.

name: nate
review: Ink Bold Business card is only a fit if your a big spender. For small business owners like me, it does not reward well. The annual fee of 95$ after first year is entirely to high. However, when I purchase the card and was planning on a vacation, the credit card came very handy as when you spend big dollars, you get rewarded big dollars. However, it does not mention anywhere on here that they charge you a fee to drop their services. It surprise me, and put me in a slight debt. Even through the card no longer fits my needs, I wouldn't hesitate to acquire it again when I decide on my next vacation trip, because of the travel rewards.

name: Brian Johnson
review: 2 hours and still counting!!!!     Waiting to talk to someone on the phone

name: Chris Samuels
review: My chase freedom card has been great for the 2 years that I have had it. The cash back option is great especially since they have a few area that they switch between that offer 5% cash back instead of the standard amount. Also having no annual fee is really nice because it has some extra perks that cards with fees have.

name: Sylvia
review: I love Chase!  Every branch I ever visit is very friendly, competent, and professional.  I always feel protected and they are on my side.  If ever I've lost my debit card, they are quick to respond with locking it down and sending out a replacement.  There are also several branches and ATMs located for my convenience.  I also love the app.  I really never have to do much banking other than online.  Also, QuickPay is AWESOME!!!

name: Jiuxu Zhang
review: I have used Chase for over 2 years now for my checking account and I absolutely love it. Chase is provides convenience by offering 24/7 online services to access my checking account and also local branches to answer my questions. The representatives at my Winter Haven branch are always professional and informative. I have also tried the phone customer support a month ago to resolve my checking account problem. Their response was prompt and very helpful as well. I do not have had any problems with my account recently. I have to say, Chase has superb customer service and Chase is by far one of the best banks available to me!

name: Jack Yasger
review: My wife and I have used Chase for over 5 years now and love it. Chase is one of the most convenient banks to have an account at because they have locations everywhere. The tellers are always pleasant and helpful at every branch that I have gone into. Their over the phone customer support is very helpful as well. We rarely have had any problems with our account, but when there has been an issue it was corrected right away. I have accounts at other banks but Chase by far is the best bank for my needs, and I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Kristen
review: I have had Chase checking and savings for years now.   I find that Chase is one of the easiest banks to bank with because they have locations everywhere and with online/mobile banking you never have to step foot into their bank if you don't want to.   Their checking account has no fees if you sign up for direct deposit with your employer.  I wouldn't pick another bank to take care of my checking needs.

name: Kathy Holobar
review: The first thing I saw was you needed an Excellent credit rating for the Hyatt Credit Card.  Only a certain number of people would qualify for this card based on that.  However, what I like about this card is that if you are a travel kind of person, this card offers some excellent benefits...2 free nights after spending $1000 in 3 months;  earn a free night on your card menber anniversary.  The $75 annual fee after the 1st year is a little steep, also.

name: Kathy Holobar
review: The interest rate is reasonable.  My biggest problem with this card would be that I would have to do a lot of travelling on British Airways to make the miles for rewards.   Additionally, it is doubtful that I would spend $30,000.00 in any year on new purchases, including airfare.  The cash advance interest rate is also quite high.  If I were wealthy, however, the British Airways Visa Signature Card would be a worthwhile card to have.

name: Brittany Matteson
review: I have been very happy with the decision to switch to the Visa Hyatt card.  I was able to earn 2 free nights at any Hyatt worldwide after just 3 months.  The free night that you receive on your anniversary more than makes up for the $75 annual fee that the card has.  I love the that this particular card has a lower interest rate than many other cards out there.  The fact that your can earn unlimited points and the points do not expire is also an appealing feature.  I have been able to save enough points for a family vacation and won't have to worry about the expense of the hotel.  You will also really start racking up the points whenever you stay at a Hyatt hotel.  You earn 3 times the points at all of their hotels on anything that you purchase.

name: Beth Grant
review: I signed up for this credit card because they offered a 0% interest balance transfer rate, with no fee for transferring my balance. That is amazing! I haven't seen any other bank offer anything close to this. And it was 0% interest for an entire year! I made so much progress on paying down my debt as a result of signing up. The only reason I would give them four stars instead of five, is that once the grace period ends and the standard interest kicks in, the interest rate is higher than the other credit card I use.

name: rachelle
review: My husband and I have used Chase for the last three years since we got married and have just had wonderful service from this company.  Lately, we bought out first home and they were so prompt and friendly when we came in to get our cashiers check for our down payment.  If I have ever had issues with my checking account, they are taken care of very quickly.  Lastly, I use their online bill pay option and love the freedom and savings in time I get from using this service.  This has made managing finances so much more simpler.

name: Matthew
review: I had this account while I was in college and I wanted to check how the rates are currently compared to when I had this account. So I used the Wallethub search toolbar to find this account. I simply typed in Chase College Savings in the search tool and was immediately taken to this account page. It was very simple and easy to find the account I was looking for. I didn't need any additional information or need to filter through categories. The Wallethub search tool is fast and easy to use with quick results.

name: Crystal-Rose Meilander
review: I have been banking with Chase for four years now. Overall they are a good bank. They were extremely helpful when I lost my debit card and they offer once a year fee forgiveness if you overdraft your account. Any time I have called Chase I've been greeted by a friendly and helpful person. My only complaint is that they charge me twelve dollars every month just to use their services. I don't appreciate having to pay just to have my money in an account, and since I'm a poor college student every penny counts!

name: Allen Gainer
review: There are several things I do not care for with the Marriott Rewards card. First, after the first year there is a $45 annual fee.  There are too many FREE choices for this to be beneficial.  Second, I prefer CASH rewards instead of points.  While it is nice to add up to free nights, having cash that you can use for any purpose is better.  For me, the Discover It card is a better choice, with no annual fee, cash back rewards (5% in rotating categories, up to 1% on other purchases), a portal offering shopping at 5-20% cash back, free FICO scores on your bill and an introductory 0% interest on purchases and transfers for the first 14 months!  The Marriott Card may be good for frequent travelers, but give me the It card!

name: Dianna Wheat
review: My family chose this savings account since it is where we have our checking account. In the beginning we were told we would need to have a minimum $300 balance OR have $25 or more being directed into our savings account monthly to avoid the service fee. I thought this wouldn't be an issue and chose to have $10 added weekly so we met this requirement and had the teller set it up. the following 2 months I noticed the service fee being taken out and finally called to find out what was going on. I was told that the fee had to be taken out in a chunk ( a one time deposit of $25 a month) versus several small installations. That even though we deposited more then was required, it was not in one chunk and would not be accepted in order to waive the fee. This wasn't explained to us at the time and though we could do it, I am extremely upset that I basically was being told how to spend my money. At this time, we are considering other banks for this reason for our savings.

name: Ian
review: I have had a Chase savings account for a couple months now and so far I love it. It is linked to my checking account and I can make instant transfers whenever I want to, right from the Chase app. Plus the monthly fee is waived if you meet the minimum balance, which is pretty low. The interest rate is not great but about what you would expect from a basic savings account. Overall I am very satisfied.

name: Brittany Matteson
review: I have always had a very good experience with Chase.  I have several savings accounts through Chase and I feel that that are always looking out for my best interest.  Throughout the years I have had to visit several Chase locations for assistance with my accounts.  It does not matter which one I go to, I always get great service.  The banker that I work with helps me to select the best account to fit my needs.  They recently helped me to move all of my savings accounts over to new type of account that would give me a better interest rate.  This is something that I would not have know about had I not visited the Chase location.  I would highly recommend anyone with banking concerns to visit an actual Chase location.  They are always more than willing to help and to go above and beyond for their customers.

name: Kim
review: This savings account is better than other ones. Chase bankers really push you to open this account for free when you're in college. They transfer about $25 every other week from your checking to your savings. I can't complain about the fees or anything, because it was free for me. You have to get used to the transferring of money though. A good thing about this account is if you are overdrawn in your checking account, the money in your savings account is automatically used to cover it.

name: Reuben Hinman
review: I had this card for a long period of time. The only reason that I had to give it up was because there was no chase bank in my area. But for as long as I had the card, I never had any trouble with it. The fees on the card were not that bad, even though I hardly ever incurred them. I really enjoyed the card when I had it. There were a lot of really nice rewards that this card offered and it always made my shopping convenient.

name: Riley Pyro
review: The Amazon card is a good one to use, if you can commit to using it for all your purchases and paying it off every month. One time paying the late fee of $35 will eat up the points you accumulate on $10,000 of purchases (and, paying interest on a carried balance will do the same). We use it for all grocery, gasoline, restaurant, utility bills and online purchases. Do NOT redeem your rewards for an online amazon.com purchase. You get 3 cents/dollar spent on amazon you charge (the highest tier of rewards). Instead, charge your amazon purchases and then use your redemption rewards to 'pay on the card balance' later.

name: Amy
review: I love my free Chase checking account.  I was given $100 just to open the account.  My account is free of charge as long as I either maintain a minimum balance or make a minimum amount of transactions with my Chase debit card.  If I don't make the minimum amount of transactions then my fee is still only $6.  It's a nice, easy-to-use checking account.

name: Danny Lee
review: Because this is the best prepaid card that I've been searching for.But I really don't like those other prepaid cards because they have some fees like reload, withdraw & replacement.

name: DCore Gonzalez Orengo
review: Yes this is the best card

name: Dianna Wheat
review: We started out with prepaid accounts and once we became comfortable opened the total checking accounts. It was very simple and the banker walked us through the entire process including explaining things in great detail to us. He made sure we understood and how everything worked and went the extra mile to transfer our funds into the new account as well as a savings account that we also set up at that time. Later we had an issue with our someone taking money out of our account that we did not authorize and the customer support over the phone IMMEDIATELY replaced (reversed the charge) the money and shipped out a new card to me which I received the next day. Overall our experience banking here has been wonderful.

name: Pamela Gorichky
review: I like this card.  The interest rate has always been fair when it was necessary for me to carry a balance.  One time my payment fell down between the seat and the console of my car and was not mailed on time.  I called them and explained the situation and they removed the late fee.  They have always been fair and I am very happy with it!

name: Dustin Weir
review: This is my main day-to-day credit card. I've rarely been charged fees, I've been able to keep my interest rate low, and the rewards are as good as any other card I've found. Being able to transfer the points directly to the account balance is the main reason I went with it.

name: Alyssa Oxenreider
review: Have been a member for 8 years and have never had a problem. Earn money on purchases you will make anyways and use them for Disney. Easy to get your reward points and the card is reloadable. Everyone is pleasant and easy to deal with. Love this card.

name: Matt Kleinman
review: My Chase Freedom card has always been excellent. The constant 1% cash back with rotating categories of 5% cash back (changing each quarter) may not be the absolute best rewards, but for a free card with good online support, it's perfect!

name: Anthony Chavez
review: If you have gone through some crap and your credit sucks and can't obtain a regular checking or savings, this card will get you through it! There are Chase branches all over Las Vegas and I have yet to be disappointed with this card! The branch manager helped me sign up for mine and also let me in on a little secret.... After 6 months they review your account activity and decide whether or not they would like to invite you to open a regular account and help you get back to where you want to be... Blows my mind that such a large bank is willing to give us a second chance! But I think that is the most awesome thing! I would highly recommend Chase Liquid to anyone trying to get back on their feet!

name: Kymberli Calloway
review:
Thanks Anthony,
