Seems like you were reading my mind.

name: Justin McManus
review: This really is a great card for those who travel, and also those who enjoy great customer service.  I was recently traveling with school to New Zealand/Australia, and the "no foreign transaction fees" was huge, as I had to make multiple purchases that were then expensed.  In addition, I'm absolutely satisfied with the customer service I get whenever I call the customer service line.  A human being always answers the first time, with no computer menu whatsoever.  The annual fee is a bit much, but I believe that it's worth it for the high quality rewards, lack of foreign transaction fees, and great customer service.  I completely recommend it!

name: Ashton
review: This account is not a bad one for the money required. It's a good place just to store money if you don't want to be spending it, as they will charge if you move too much out of the account too often. I think you're able to move money from this savings into your checking a maximum of 3 times a month before you're charged. No fees, so long as you have a continuing transaction of $25 from your checking account, or a minimum balance of $500, if I recall correctly. I never had any outstanding issues with the account that weren't caused by my inability to make money. Would use again, and I have recommended it to many other friends. Chase has always been a good banker.

name: Jay Lowrey
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred card is good overall. I like how you are able to get a large number of points very quickly and that the points are a one to one type of transfer to another point system with a company. The big problem I have with this card is that it has an annual fee. I know it is only after the first year, but it is hard for me to justify spending all this money on a card when there is very little chance that I will make back the needed number of points to justify this cost.

name: Cindy A.
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card is a good card for anyone who doesn't have a checking account and unable to have a debit card. There are some great features to this card such as the direct deposit and the no cancellation fee. However, the downside to this card would be the monthly service fee of $4.95 waived if  which is a bit high I think. The only way to waive the fee would be if you linked the card to a qualifying checking account.

name: Jay Lowrey
review: The Slate card from Chase looks like it is a pretty good deal. It has no annual fee which is always nice, and its rate is also fairly low even after the introductory period. I like that there is no interest on transfer for the first year too. This would help someone pay off their debts more quickly, and I can see how this might be helpful for me in the future. My current card is from a credit union, so it has a much better rate. I realize that this rate is unrealistic for most people, so I feel that the Chase card is good for many out there.

name: ruppe angela
review: I love my Chase Freedom card! I was allowed zero interest on all transfer balances for one year when I initially signed up. Plus, I get to sign up for extra cash back at placed that I already shop, like the gas station or pharmacy. It is not a lot of money back, but every little bit helps and let's face it, free money is money we can all use!

name: Alan Brommelhorst
review: The Chase Sapphire Card is an amazing reward-based credit card that has no annual fee. I really like how the do not charge you to have this credit card. Also, the interest rate is quite low for a standard rewards card. Discover's rate is closer to 24%. Also, I like to dine out, so it's nice to get 2x the points for these purchases.

name: Mike Randy Green
review: Once I was emailed by Chase and told that there had been extra charges to my credit card that were suspicious because of the large amounts and strange locations. They handled the situation promptly and assisted myself without any delay. I think they have an excellent support system and I also enjoy the benefits I receive at restaurants which help add up all the points I need to travel via air when the urge takes me. Would recommend.

name: Bianca Hernandez
review: This card requires Excellent credit, so if your score is “Good”, don’t bother applying. 13.99% interest rate is great, plus they allo 0% for the first 15 months on purchase and transfers. There’s no annual fee, which is rare these days. They allow a monetary bonus when you add authorized users and give you $200 when you spend $500 within the first 3 months. Every few months they have different categories where you can get cash back at gas stations and restaurants. Harder to qualify for than the Chase Slate card, but still a great one.

name: Bianca Hernandez
review: You have to have excellent or good credit to get an Amazon.com Credit Card. Pay your bill on time to avoid the $35 late fee. The rewards program for this card is aimed to be taken advantage of by people who shop on amazon.com a lot. you can earn 3 points for every dollar you spend on their website. That adds up really fast and you can use the cash redemption option to use those point for more amazon.com purchases. You can also get 2 points for ever $1 you spend at a gas station. The rewards program for this card is great. If you have the credit and use Amazon.com frequently, apply for it and use it!

name: Kristen Kula
review: I really like this card. Being young with not a lot of time to build up my credit score I was thrilled to get a card that was a Visa that also had no annual fees or anything like that. I earn points quicker than I did with my Discover card I used to use, so that was awesome to realize when I was able to get a statement credit within a couple of months of using the card. I love Amazon too, so it's great to earn extra points when I buy all the random stuff I get from there! The bonus money at the beginning was good incentive too for getting this card. Overall, very happy.

name: Tracy Gorman
review: I shop at Zappos and was excited to see this credit card offer. If you signed up and used the card for your purchase you received a $25 credit on your order!  I bought a pair of nice sandals and athletic shoes and the credit appeared on my statement.  Can't beat saving $25!

name: Bianca Hernandez
review: I only got this card because I was unable to open a checking or savings account anywhere else. You can't do ACH debits from this, but you do have a routing number and account number to receive deposits, just as you would a bank account. You can't transfer from it though which I have found to be very inconvenient.

name: Kymberli Calloway
review:
Good points Bianca.....and I do lots of ACH debits as well transfers.
Thnx

name: Bianca Hernandez
review: I've been using Chase for my savings account and am very happy in all areas of service. My only complaint is their lack of pending deposit notification. I've used multiple banks and credit unions before and because of a joint account holder, those accounts were closed due to NSF charges. Chase was the only bank that would allow me to open a checking/savings account and be a member. Other banks will show pending direct deposit dates but Chase never does. You can even call in and speak with a representative the day before you know it's going to be there and they won't be able to see anything. They say it all "goes on in the background". It would be nice if they kept up with the other banks features and provided a little more information on direct deposits.

name: Katelyn Chase
review: I have had a Chase college checking account for a few years now and I love it. I love that I am able to transfer money easily online from my checking to my savings. The people who work at Chase are always willing to help when I need it. Being a college student, very rarely do I have extra money for needless things, such as service fees with a bank account. Chase does not make me pay any fees to keep my account. Every time I have had a problem with my account, I am able to call Chase and speak to someone right away about it. Their customer service is impeccable.

name: Brandy Lee Rodney
review: This morning, I realized I was running low on checks - I panicked!  I went to my nearest branch to see if I could order some expedited checks (and hoping that they wouldn't cost too much) - well, expedited checks are expensive, but instead of expedited checks, they were able to print me out a couple pages of emergency checks (that look just like the real thing) and even better, the teller waived the fee for the checks for me!  I am pretty pleased with my experience today!

name: Taylor Launchart
review: Definitely one of my favorite cards.  They do bonuses on and off when you open he card.  When I was approved, I was given $150.00 for spending $500 in the first two months.  This card has great cash rewards.  It's 1% on everything, and then randomly they will give you additional abilities to earn up to 5% cash back on specific purchases, such as gas or groceries.  Chase also has a great customer service calling office.  Very easy to deal with.

name: Ashley Parker
review: I have a chase college checking account, and I love it! There are no fees for this account, because I am a current student. This is great because as a student I do not always have a constant amount of funds in my account. I have no problems with the online banking either and I really love the app that allows me to monitor my checking account via my cell phone. I've banked with chase for all of my college years and will continue to do so!

name: Michael Ortiz
review: Chase is pretty good for the most part. The only problem I had was one time I was written a fake check for over 2 grand. I didn't know the check was fake, and it ended up bouncing, not only making me lose two grand, but an addition fee of around 30 dollars. Chase wouldn't work with me on this, and therefore I had to make a new account. other than that, my experience with chase has been pretty good.

name: Yah Nah
review: Overall the marriot reward card is a pretty good solution for small credit needs.  Much has been made of the annual fee...and I agree it'd be better without it...but that's how they keep the interest rate down so it really isn't so bad.  The customer service is great...I called in about an unauthorized charge and they helped resolve my issue very quickly!  I am definitely looking forward to enjoying the free nights that I've earned! This card is one of the better ones out there in my opinion.

name: Carla Plumb
review: The Hyatt Credit Card has been great in that it allows me to earn unlimited points, where other cards cap out and make having a reward program pointless. I love the fact that you are rewarded for the anniversary of your card with the free night. In combination with the 2 free nights are provided this card is completely worth it! This card also comes with a very good grace period. We all know that things happen sometimes and knowing there is some time to make the payment without penalty is a huge bonus.

name: Becky Bruns
review: The British Airways Visa Signature Card is a decent travel rewards credit card.   It does have a high annual fee, but this common on travel rewards cards.  As long has you travel enough to earn enough rewards to surpass the fee, it is worth it.  The interest rate is again high, but this is common with travel cards.  Reward card users should be paying off their balances to maximize their rewards anyways.

name: Sarah Johnson
review: Chase has excellent customer service. It seems to me that they have a lot more rules and regulations than do other bank chains. I have has issues cashing paychecks because I didn't maintain a minimum balance. I use my checking account to pay bills. I generally keep a very low balance. If you do the same you may want to choose another bank.

name: John McFadden
review: Chase is excellent when it comes to banking.  I've had a chase checking account for many years. The quality of service is second to none.  My chase checking has always given me the flexibility to take care of matters simple and easy. Chase checking is updated with all the latest technology so I have access to my money and account just about any and every where I go. I see my self staying with chase for a very long time. Thanks for all that you have done Chase, best banking every.

name: Nancy Lee
review: The Disney Rewards Visa card is a great card for parents with small kids. If you are planning a trip to Disney or go to the Disney Store it's an excellent rewards card. On the down side, beware of the interest rates and make sure you pay off your balances within the 6 month grace period.

name: Michael
review: My very first account was opened here the day after I turned 18 years old. The amount of advice/guidance I received was second to none, and to this day, if I have any sort of issues, the representative who helped me open my account is my first point in contact (unless its after hours, of course), and he does everything that is possible to resolve my issues. I've had my card stolen and a hefty purchase made, which resulted in a gross overdraft charge, and, though it took a lengthy period, they made the effort that the charge was reversed and the incident was reported to the proper authorities.

name: David Carrol
review: Chase is a pretty good banking option for people if your looking for an average checking account that will meet just about every ones expectations. The customer support that I went through got the job done by a pretty reasonable time once it was found. After having to deal with the fraudulent purchase It was taken care of with out any problems. I haven't had any major problems at all with Chase checking at all and would recommend.

name: zach radach
review: This savings account is okay... if I remember correctly as long as you can transfer 25 dollars per month to your savings from checking, there is no fee. But, it's easy to forget about that which makes it inconvenient... it's good for people that make a lot of money and get direct deposit into their checking but aren't good at savings, sort of forcing them to save, but, overall I think having a fee to have a savings account is silly... aren't they already making money off of your money? Anyways, the risk of over-drafting with the savings account debit is silly... if you overdraft you will likely get penalized... from one bank account to another within the same bank. That is nonsense.

name: zach radach
review: This particular bank is okay, but, doesn't have a LOT going for it as far as checking goes. The minimum balance is a bit too high (1-500 would be more reasonable) and the fees are also a bit too high. I was hit several times with the 12 dollar fee because I went barely under the 1,500 dollar mark... in their particular situation, if for even 1 second, you go under during a month you get the bill. That seems unethical to me. An average over the month seems more fair. Something arbitrary could easily trigger that, such as 5 different merchants deciding to debit something from your account on the same day putting you at 1493, costing you an additional 12 dollars for essentially no reason. It gets one to want to put in 2k or more, but, wouldn't that cash be better put in a bond? Or how about under your mattress? My mattress's monthly fee is a lot lower than 12 dollars...

name: Tiffany Johnson
review: I really like my Amazon card.  I have been able to earn a number of points, which I have been able to use as cash through my Amazon account.  Additionally, it makes using Amazon Prime extremely simple, as the One-Click purchasing option saves me a lot of time.  It is easy to make payments and access information about my card online.  I would highly recommend this card, as the ease of use and the ease of access to information regarding my account go above most of the other cards I have used previously.

name: Crystal Harris
review: A couple of weeks ago I got an overdraft fee from chase. It was due to an account balance that was -9.98, once I found out it was negative I contacted them to resolve the issue and avoid paying an additional fee.  Chase rep explained there was nothing they could do to get the amount of fees I had to pay to go down. For under $10 dollars I paid almost $100 bucks in late fees. I never knew my account was in the negative because this isn't an account that I use a lot. I signed up for overdraft protection but without an saving account thought them it is pointless. Overdraft fee are expense and banks should give customers a longer grace period during economic down fall periods.

name: Anunay Sinha
review: Chase Slate card has been a great addition to my wallet about 6 months back. I tend to use this card more often as compared to other credit cards I have. This is primarily because of the 0% APR offered by Chase on the Slate card for the first 15 months. Moreover, there is no annual fee once one qualifies for the card. This is really nice as I avoid paying the annoying annual fee when compared to other credit cards even when I don’t use them. One thing which I don’t quite like about the card is the 3% foreign transaction fee, which is a little higher than other credit cards I have. But, then I resort to those cards – so, it’s an acceptable compromise for the benefits the card offers.

name: Peg Fisher
review: If you have to travel for business, Chase Sapphire Preferred is a very useful card, offering 40,000 bonus points when you spend $3,000 on purchases. You need to do that in the first 3 months of accepting the card, though, so get it right before your next trip. Your points translate into $500 in travel savings when you turn them in through Chase Ultimate Rewards. For a business traveler, this is a good benefit.For myself, I'm not that frequent a traveler these days. I think I'd prefer the Capital One Venture Once card, because it lets me travel on my day of choice, with no blackout restrictions. This will help me with holiday leisure travel.

name: Kory
review: Although I originally used Chase College Banking for a few years (and loved it), I was recently told that I had to switch over to another type of checking account under Chase.  I assumed that this would be a long, drawn-out process that involved a specified deposit amount.  Because I was doing poorly financially, this brought me great anxiety.  However, the woman who set me up with my account linked my old debit card to my new account within fifteen minutes.  That was about five months ago, and I have not had a single issue with my banking.  I receive alerts about my balance on my phone, which is amazing.  The Chase website is also very user friendly, and encourages use of my checking account without even leaving my house.  I would highly recommend Chase Total Checking to anyone.

name: Nick Faust
review: Definitely one of the best cash back/reward cards out there.  5% back on gas 6 months out of the year, which is great.  The 5% rotates now and then but you get 1% back on everything else all year and no annual fee.  You don't need a Chase bank account but if you do there are extra rewards that I think make it worth looking into.

name: Stephen LeMaster
review: The Chase Freedom card has been an excellent credit card for my wife and me. The enhanced cash-bask rewards (5% at selected merchants for each quarter) can actually be quite substantial. It is also very easy to redeem the points for cash. On the few occasions I've needed to call customer service, they have been very accommodating and easy to work with. I highly recommend this card.

name: Erock Contreras
review: Chase is a quality banking institution that has many locations across the country which is convenient for those situations where you need to find an ATM. They are also located in Walgreen's which gives them a larger reach. most branches provide quality service. One thing that can be improved is to replace the old ATM's with the newer models that give back any cash amount requested.

name: John Political
review: The 60,000 point bonus looks inviting until you see that you have to charge $5000 in the first three months of obtaining this card.  If you're planning a trip and need $5k worth of stuff anyway, the points would come in handy for travel expenses.  Being a pay-in-full card, this offer isn't any better than using a standard bank or credit union debit card.  The $95 per year fee, after the first year, is something to consider as well.  The $39 late fee is something to pay attention to if you are an individual or company that has those issues.  The ability to provide cards to employees at no charge is a plus.

name: janick serrallonga
review: I have had a checking account with CHASE for the last 7 years and it has been a great experience. They know how to value customers and how to solve problems whenever we need it. Sometimes, when my account goes to a negative balance, they charge me an additional $35 , but with a simple call explaining why that happened to me, they go and right away refund those $35. Great bank.

name: Jessie Ellington
review: I was grandfathered in through Washington Mutual and had Chase College checking throughout my college years (although they tried to kick me out into the "regular" checking account which I would've had to pay a monthly fee for). Being a college student, I would occasionally overdraw my account. Also being a broke college student, the $35 overdraft fee was often a painful ding in my accounts. Every time I have called Chase customer service they have refunded my overdraft fee (granted, this has only happened 2 times over the years). I have been very impressed with the high level of customer service, probably some of the best customer service I have ever experienced. That is one of the reasons I continue to bank with Chase.

name: Leah Oswalt
review: With the Chase Student Savings account, I've been able to maintain a minimum balance in my savings without penalty. However, when my student account expired, Chase charged me for keeping a below minimum balance in my account. As a broke new college graduate, this was a serious problem for me that almost made me switch to another bank. However, upon returning to school, and taking to an associate at a branch, I was able to switch back to the student account with a fee-free savings account. They were extremely helpful with this process. I plan to keep this savings account once I have a job, because of it's ease of access and it's connection to my checking account.

name: Leah Oswalt
review: I had a Chase Student account that eventually expired after 5 years and switched to an automatic account. Unfortunately, I was still in school and really needed to continue using the student account. Upon visiting a branch, the customer service was superb. They completely understood that I was attending graduate school and offered to renew my student account for two years. The woman I spoke with was very honest and extremely helpful with my situation. Chase also has great accessibility! There is an ATM EVERYWHERE, and if I can't find one, I just use the ATM locator on my iPhone.

name: Leighann
review: I have had a Chase total checking account for about 3 years now, and this is a checking account I will keep forever. The local branch that I deal with is nothing but helpful any time there has been an issue, which are really few and far between. Also, additional services I can tie to my account are a major selling point to using Chase for all my banking needs.

name: Bryant
review: I love this card. I order a lot of stuff from Amazon, so this card is amazing. 3% back on all orders, which, with the amount of things I order, is a major amount back in my pocket. Not to mention that it still gets 1% and 2% everywhere else. The APR is decent for such a high credit limit which makes an balance due not incur too much. There's no annual fee, which I love. This card is a must get for anyone that uses Amazon regularly.

name: Tim Lawrence
review: Working with Chase through my company has been great, I get a lot of free perks with my personal checking because I do my business banking with them. The bankers and tellers have always been helpful and observant of my time. I have had a couple of problems and the manager has always taken care of the situation and made sure I knew how to get a hold of them if everything is not up to my satisfaction.

name: Chelsea
review: Chase has been good to me with this account; I really can't complain about much other than the fees, those are unfortunate but I knew those were part of this account when I signed up so I made my own bed! Chase customer service is great if I ever need help or a question answered and they're always extremely helpful and kind. I've had this account for quite a while and will be continuing to keep it.

name: Chelsea
review: I have a Premier Plus account and I think Chase is excellent. I've never had an issue with Chase and they even let me off the hook once when I accidentally over-drafted. Their customer service is excellent as well. The only downfall is that monthly fee, which seems to be a little too high in my opinion; if they lowered that, I would be a bit happier with this account. Other than that, I have nothing bad to say about Chase!

name: Gabriela Estevez
review: I love chase bank . I use it for all my accounts including my savings . I have my entire family using bank and almost all of my Friends have a savings account also . I opened up 3 more savings account for each one of my children at chase bank . I love the customer service in person or over the phone . I am very pleased . Thank you chase !!

name: Lynn Rostie
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card offers many of the same features that other Prepaid Cards offer like no activation fee or ATM fees (in network). The $4.95 monthly fee is much higher than that of the AMEX Serve Card which is $1.00. The monthly fee is waived with AMEX if you have any account direct deposited into it. The AMEX Serve Card also offers the AMEX Fraud Protection and Purchase Protection as well as other AMEX Cardhlder benfits. The Chase Card offers reloads by direct deposit only while AMEX Serve offers reloads free at Wal-Mart, CVS, and Seven Eleven stores too. The Chase Card does offer benefits over other Prepaid Cards but not all of them.

name: Andrew Markham
review: Chase Liquid can be reloaded for free at any Chase ATM.

name: Katherine Hirose
review: I reach for this card every time I make a purchase.  The rewards are easy to rack up (1 point per dollar that you spend).  It's like making money every time you make a purchase!  The points are easy to convert to rewards.  The APR is fairly similar to other cards available and it's a fair rate.  Plus, there's no annual fee (unlike some of the other cards).  I would definitely recommend this card to family and friends and it is perfect for both first time card holders and those that have been using cards for years.

name: ANDI LORENSON
review: This is a great frequent flyer card!  I have had this card for over two years, and have been extremely happy with it.  They give a generous bonus when you sign up, and also on your yearly anniversary.  You have the ability to earn free flights with your Rapid Rewards points, as well as gift cards, hotel stays, and other travel. When you use your card to purchase flights, you are awarded double points.  I would highly recommend this card to anyone who flies very often.  Since it is a VISA card, it is accepted all over the world.  Rates and balance transfer offers seem to be comparable to other cards.

name: Theo Kaisa
review: I love using my Chase Freedom card. Since I am a frequent user and use it for just about everything I am always reaping the reward of the points. I really think it's one of the best cards out there for this reason. 1 point for every dollar spent? you can't beat it. If you use this card a lot like I do, you'll be loaded with points in no time. This is definitely my go to card and it gives me freedom in every since of the word. If you are a frequent credit card user, this is the card for you.

name: Dorothy
review: We have always had good experiences with Chase bank. Their customer service is great. Every time we go in they make sure to get everything done fast and accurate. They have helped us with checking, savings and investments for us and our children. They have always worked with us to find the best options for investing and saving for the future. I never have a problem finding ATMs or locations if I need them. I would highly recommend Chase Bank.

name: Michael Molenaar
review: I prefer Hyatt when I'm abroad because I know that I'll generally get a western standard of hotel even when the surrounding city isn't exactly 1st world. Because of my frequently business traveling I do use this card in order to accumulate rewards, and it's kind of addictive seeing how many points you can rack up. Also, I like the card itself, it's an impressive addition to the other cards in my wallet, makes me feel dignified.

name: Christie Bradley
review: When looking at the terms of the Hyatt Credit card my first thought is that the rates seem high.  There is a 3% fee for transferring the balance, and worse, a 3% cash advance fee.  Most people use ATMs often and with a 3% fee this would be very expensive.  I do like that there is no foreign transaction fee but other cards also have that feature.     At least you can get 2 free nights stay after spending $1000 in three months, which could easily be achieved by using the card to pay for all of your normal expenses (groceries, water bill, etc) for  a few months.  The main reason I can see for choosing this card is if one stays at Hyatt resorts very frequently.  If you are like me and rarely get to travel, this would probably be the wrong card.

name: Sarah Slazer
review: As a family with relatives outside the country, this card is actually very helpful. We have family in Sweden, Canada, and Ireland, and we're close enough to all of them to at least visit once in a while. We applied for this card because they waive the out-of-country purchase fee, and when you're picking up a pack of gum in a foreign checkout line for about $1, the last thing you want is to see that you're actually paying thrice that amount because of some unnecessary fee. We don't really use this a lot, but that's not the point; it's not about what you can get at the store right now, but about what you might have to get while out of the country.

name: John McFadden
review: My experience with Chase has always been a good one.  But there was one particular time when the service was just excellent.  When I came in the door it was a hot and sunny and dry day. I was not very cheerful because the heat was intense.  I needed to withdraw money out my checking account, but when I walked through the door the staff changed my whole mood. Inside the bank was so nice and cool, I wanted to move in. All the bank tellers greeted me with a smile, and when i walk through the door I notice they had cold refreshments set up for customers who needed something nice and cold on the way out into the summer heat. This was my best banking experience ever. When I left, my whole attitude was different. Chase was very quick in servicing me. I don't think I will ever change banks.

name: Alex Jachym
review: I currently have the Spirit Rewards card and have strongly considered moving to the Chase Sapphire Card. The incentives are great. I rarely go into debt with credit cards so the high interest rate is not a concern to me.

name: Emily Pfefer
review: This Chase Freedom card provides a very fair deal for rewards that seems pretty comparable value-wise to what I receive from the my Visa Travel Rewards Card. However, I don't like that it carries a 3 percent foreign transaction fee, which my Visa Travel card does not. Living abroad, this is a critical benefit that would quickly override the value of any rewards program.

name: Zylo Smedley
review: So far this card has worked out really well for me. When I first signed up through Amazon, they offered a $50 rebate. I was buying electronics at the time, so that $50 really helped. I'm also a frequent Amazon shopper. Most sites I can use a third-party app or site to get rebates or rewards for shopping through them, but Amazon doesn't allow that most of the time. The credit card is an easy way to get rewards that aren't offered anywhere else just by using it. I've used it several times now to get Amazon gift cards to use for purchases. The credit card page itself is easy to navigate and pay. The only problem I've had so far is my card getting hacked, but I think that way my computer's problem with security as other accounts were affected too and not this card.

name: Daniel Waite
review: I've been very happy with the MileagePlus Explorer card.  While I haven't had the opportunity to use the free one-time club passes that cardholders receive annually, the free checked bag benefit is great, and if you fly United even a few times a year you can recoup your annual fee on that alone. The best part about the card, though, is the miles you earn. First, the initial bonus for getting and using the card is generous and gives you a great head start. The miles also add up quickly with purchases, though, and I try to use the card as much as possible to earn more miles, including the 10,000-mile bonus you receive when you spend $25,000 or more on the card in a year.  In addition to using the miles for air travel, there are a host of other ways to redeem miles.  With MileagePlus shopping, for example, you have access to a wide variety of products at pretty reasonable redemption levels. I have also been happy with the customer service.  I received a credit limit increase within the first year, and there have been no hidden fees.  When my card number was once used fraudulently, it was no hassle to get the charge removed, and a new card was sent very quickly.  Overall I've been very pleased with this card.

name: Andrew Black
review: When I originally applied, I didn't think I had a chance of being approved. However, I was, and with a $500 limit. This is the only thing saving the rating. I fell behind on payments, but not for too long. I managed to get it paid back without too much hassle, however, the card was still closed. I was not able to get it reopened either with a lower limit or anything. Overall, I'd a decent service, but there is much better.

name: Napier Jason J
review: My chase savings account has basically just been a place to put money for near term use for me. The interest rate is rather insulting compared to what's available else where. The fees every time the balance goes below $300 regardless of how much is in my linked checking account are also unfortunate. The only good thing I can say about the account is that your money won't disappear but that is more about the FDIC than anything Chase does.

name: Napier Jason J
review: Chase checking is alright overall. I appreciate that they don't call me to "talk" and are not obsessive about declining transactions in unusual locations. Given their size the service is not personal but it is competent. Personally I don't like when banks pretend to be my friend and so I will tolerate the fees and such in exchange for size and access.

name: Wendy Damske Gabrysiak
review: Disney Rewards Visa is a great card to have if you have kids. While the onetime $50 Disney Gift Card after your first purchase is an added bonus. The fact that it can be used anywhere and you get to save 10% on select merchandise after you spend $50 at the Disney store or online is huge for kids and families that are big into Disney merchandise. It also doesn’t hurt to be able to pick your own Disney character design for your credit card. While their is no annual fee the only down side is that the interest rate is more like having a true store credit card. I still love mine.

name: Cindy Rodriguez
review: I recently had to contact Chase bank because I was late on a credit card payment. I recently lost my job and i've been going through a rough financial hardship. The banks automative service is not very user friendly. It very tough to navigate through the system. All I wanted to do is speak to a live person. I wanted someone to hear me out and help me with a fee reversal. I've been a chase customer for over 10 years and I felt like I was just another number to them. They refused to waive the fee and apologized for my inconvenience. This was the first time in over 5 years that i've been late on my credit card. I just thought they lacked empathy and don't really care about their customers. I was transferred numerous times and I felt that no one really wanted to take control of the call. I was so frustrated to the point that I no longer want to continue my business with Chase. Their representatives lack empathy, care, and the ability to provide one call resolution. I canceled my credit card with them and I refuse to ever bank with them again.

name: elijah hughes
review: Chase checking isn't bad for the most part. The biggest issue I have faced with them is the $12 monthly fee. I have overdrawn my account quite a few times because they sometimes take the fee and some months not, and they don't consistently take the fee out on the same date every month. I have had to call them and fight a few times just to not have to pay the overdraft fee. While, they offer good services and benefits for using their account, unfortunately I had to do business with another bank because a few times they did make me pay the overdraft fee stating that it was my fault that I overdrew it. I don't have enough money anyways to be paying $35 a pop for their mistakes.

name: Amy Owens
review: I applied for a car loan with a couple different banks when shopping for my car in 2011. Chase is the only bank that gave me a chance to explain my situation with my finances. At the time I was a waitress so it was difficult to show my true earners since I made most of my money with tips. Chase was very understanding and approved me loan when they really shouldn't have. I have never had a problem paying my payments and I have never had a problem with my chase account. I definitely will be working with them for my next car or house loan! Thanks!

name: Mark Jordan
review: Overall I think this is a pretty good checking account.  However, I have had this account for 15+ years, always having enough in it to avoid the fee.  Recently things have become a little harder for me financially and I can no longer consistently maintain the minimum balance to avoid the fee.  This is irksome.  I spoke with Chase about waiving the fee or if there was another option without a fee and was told 'no'- there are no options.  I know most banks have fees based on minimum balances and that seems wrong to me. Despite my long relationship with Chase I'm now considering moving banks to find a no-fee checking account.

name: George Zhao
review: if you are looking for the credit card with substantial cash backs, then Freedom is as good as any. Discover may have the same quarterly cash back benefits, but Freedom is more extensively used with Visa network.

name: Dan PG
review: Chase is great. They provide discounts and incentives for those in the military. My partner is a veteran so they linked our accounts together and I was able to benefit with some of the perks of their free checking accounts: overdraft fees waived, no transfer fees, and no charges for using ATMs outside of Chase. Plus Chase is everywhere. Great international service.

name: Logan
review: Chase freedom is the best card in this category for a large number of reasons. First of all, the point for every dollar you spend (with bonuses for TONS of other uses, like gas or groceries) add up really fast, and before you know it you can get some free stuff. It gives you text aloerts and email alerts which is great for smartphone users, and the Apps work well too. Interest rate isn't awful too as long as you haven't ruined your credit before...i'm a student with not much credit to stand on and I'm looking at a rate my parents are jealous of!

name: Joe Ferguson
review: Chase has always been a mediocre bank. They have a so/so customer relations and their credit cards are kind of blah. Their interest rates leave something to be desired. On the plus side they have branches all over the place and their online banking works pretty smoothly. Also, I didn't get hit with fees or anything too often. Just be careful of over-drafting with them. They will nail you eight ways to Sunday if you overdraft your account. If you have a small bank account, I would suggest banking elsewhere.

name: Dan Kim
review: It’s a nice no frills savings account that I have had for a very long time.  Even though interest rates have been practically 0% for the past couple of years, I primarily keep this account to keep my savings in one area.  I also maintain a minimum balance of $300 to avoid the $4 monthly fee.  All in all it’s a great no frills account to have if one wants to have a savings account.

name: Shane Bradford
review: This has been a good savings account.  It was actually the first savings account I signed up for when I was in High School.  I have had a good overall experience with chase and I will continue to use their products in the future.  No fees but the only complaint I have is that the actual walk in banks are decreasing in the areas around me.  Other than that Its a good little savings account to have.

name: Larry D
review: I have banked with Chase for almost four years.  My banker at my home branch has always gone the extra mile for me and is someone I can call on regularly with any need.  After a collection agency drafted more out of my account than I had authorized, he was quick to immediately help me by closing the account and opening another one, so that they wouldn’t have the number.  He worked with me to try and recover the unauthorized money, and while not successful, he had a genuine interest in helping and the customer service was really great.  Highly recommend banking with Chase.

name: Gabriela Estevez
review: I've been a chase customer for over 7 years and I can truly say that chase bank is the best bank ever !! My whole family has chase and most of my friends . I enjoy being a part of chase bank . The deposits clear really fast and they are chase banking locations everywhere !!

name: Chassity Still
review: Chase is an excellent bank. They employ very professional and courteous people who are willing to help you with anything. Prior to opening a savings account, I wasn't too knowledgeable about bank accounts or anything to do with them, so naturally I had a lot of questions. They promptly answered them and didn't treat me like I was  unintelligent. There are lots of feature son their app that I use daily, and ultimately I trust my money with them.

name: D
review: I have absolutely no complaints about Chase. They really have their stuff together when it comes to their mobile banking, ease of use, etc. Even the app is aesthetically pleasing. My savings account has been fee-free since I opened an account with them in 2007, and I love that I can text them for my balance anytime of day and get a response text instantly. Also, the overdraft protection from my checking to savings is awesome. It allows me to make my purchase and then asks me to do a transfer right away to get my accounts in order. I wish I could say that I'm naturally smart with my finances but really I think it's just Chase taking the guesswork out of it :)

name: Kelly MataMelgoza
review: I have this credit card and I try to only use it for emergencies because the Interest rate is too high. I know it's based on our credit score, but our credit score as increased yet I cannot get a credit line increase or my interest rate lowered. I give it 2 stars.

name: Judy-Gene Duran
review: I like the $50 that you get to sign up for this disney rewards visa card.  I do not have children right now but am planning a family in the near feature.  I have always wanted to go to disney land as I never got to go as a kid so maybe once I start a family I will get this card to help ensure that we make a trip that's affordable.

name: Brendan
review: I have had this account since 2010. I think it is great in the Greater New York City area because of the large number of ATMs and branches. I can deposit cash or checks right into the ATM and many of the new ATMs are offering the ability to withdraw any denomination bill that you want. It is great to not have to break a $20 every time. I like that I can pay my bills online, I rarely have to deal with a person, I can do my banking 24/7.

name: Scott Johnson
review: I have had a checking account with Chase Bank for approximately 8 years.  Although this is not my primary checking account, I have maintained this account for miscellaneous use.  With the minimal interaction I have had with Chase bankers, I will have to say they are very professional and have excellent customer service.  They have more ATM locations than any other bank in my city.  Furthermore, they offer all of the same benefits as many other banks.  If you are looking for a bank to open a checking account, I would highly recommend Chase.

name: Judy-Gene Duran
review: I personally enjoy this card because of the reward points.  As a constant amazon shopper it is important to me that I have a credit card that helps me earn free stuff.  I have got a baseball glove and other items totally free with this reward system.

name: Erin Tummons
review: This is the Marriott rewards credit card. The annual fee I a bit of a hassle, but I love the fact it has rewards. I feel like if you are a person who stays at Marriots often, it would be a great card. The APR is a little high for my liking, but that is made up by the free nights!

name: AJ Cox
review: This card definitely helps out for that upcoming vacation with the family. There's a great introductory rate that gives you time to pay off your discounted disney stuff, and you know that a Visa card has a reputation you can trust.  Even after the introductory period, the rate stays low and you can enjoy the peace of mind that you have 6 months to pay off the transaction during the intro period.

name: Christine Morrison
review: The biggest problem I have had with the checking account is the monthly fees. I was told when I opened the account that since my husband was going to be doing direct deposit of his paychecks into the account, that the monthly fees would be waived. Some months they are, some months they are not. I have basically given up on trying to get this remedied. When we receive the fee and I call the number on the back of my debit card about it, they have refunded me the $12 with no problems. It is just the hassle of having to call them.

name: Ryan Stanley
review: I have just started using Chase Checking.  I came from Wells Fargo which are terrible.  The only problem or unforeseen circumstance that I have noticed is the high charges and the way they handle charges when using other banks atm's.  They charge you a fee for using the other bank as well as the bank atm that you are using so its like a $10 fee at times.  Other than that I have not had any problems I really like them and love the automated text messages that I get from them when my account is below a certain amount.

name: S. Batterbee
review: The only issue I have had with my checking account is that I have fees every other month but yet they did not tell me that I would be paying the fees every other month when I signed up. I assumed it would be every month. This leads to me forgetting about it and having my account overdraw all the time. I hate the fees. I don't get a lot of money and I feel like the fees are too high for the average working person. Overall I am satisfied but I wish the fees were less.

name: Logan
review: My biggest issue I have had with this checking account was the mandatory fees and the nearly impossible ways to eliminate them. For somebody who does not move around large amounts of money, meeting any condition in which monthly fees are waived is nearly impossible. They require a large balance or 15+ purchases (depending on your account) In addition, ATM fees at other ATM's are very steep, and Chase likes to "Double-Dip", as in Double charge, you for doing so. Overall, however, the services are good, and there are plentiful ATMs. Just take a few fees down and I'll be a happy customer

name: Charles Baker
review: I opened up a Chase account right before I moved to a new city. The reason? Their ATMs are EVERYWHERE. I was sick of getting nailed with service charges for using different ATMs. My local bank has excellent customer service too. They have their representatives standing at the door in case anyone walks in needing help. This was especially useful to me when I lost my checkbook. The provided me with another booklet on the spot and promised to flag any checks in the sequence I lost for possible fraud. I feel really good about doing business with them.

name: Christina
review: Hi I have been with Chase bank for over 5 years. I have never had any problems with them of any kind. Chase bank is always polite and prompt when assisting me with an issue.  I have had my property stole and chase bank always reacted quick to help me retrieve what was mine. If they are so great why 4 stars and not 5 stars you may ask.  Well that's because no bank is perfect.  They have made errors on my account, however, when I bring the errors to their attention they always handle them and assure that they were at fault.  The customer services is so much better than a lot of places. Customer services in America, that's a completely different issue.

name: William Smith
review: In December 2013 I received a promotional advertisement from Chase to sign up for a checking account and get $150.  At the time Bank of American wasn't doing anything special for me so I decided to switch.  I switched at the same time the whole Target data breach was happening so there was security panic among debit card holders.  The first thing the Chase banker said to me was that they were reimbursing all of there customers money and they had been open Saturday and Sunday to help address issues. I thought that was above and beyond, which is the type of service I have received ever since.  After I moved my company direct deposit over I received a $150 dollar bonus and I pay no monthly fee because I meet the direct deposit criteria.  It's a great account with superior customer service and I would recommend it to anyone in the Lake Mary Florida area.

name: Princess Apache
review: Of course, I was highly impressed with the Hyatt credit card from the very beginning! I was sold.  First off, I frequent the Hyatt chain almost everywhere I go now.  So, it was only natural that I gave this card a shot.  I am very impressed and delighted by the free nights offered.  The ease of use is great with this card as well.  I'm steadily racking up for full benefits of the card!

name: Princess Apache
review: I really enjoyed this British Airway card! I received my card through Chase Bank.  I must say that the ease of use with this card is excellent.  I have used it in 2 different foreign countries for all transactions and NEVER had a problem! I highly recommend this card, especially to those who love to travel and don't wanna fool with cash ( exchange rates).

name: Christopher Kirsch
review: I’ve been using the Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Plus Credit Card for over five years now and I love the perks and benefits it provides. As I travel often for my job, I’ve been able to accumulate a number of free flights and hotel stays by using my card regularly to rack up the points. Because Southwest’s fares and prices are often much lower than many competitor airlines in my area, I get the most bang for my buck using my Southwest card. Highly recommended!

name: Belle Starr
review: I recently reviewed a Visa card on another site, and it paled in comparison to what this card offers. The rewards offer alone would make me want to apply for this one over any other Visa card. I really like the 0% introductory rate for 6 months. That is a pretty long introductory period. The icing on the cake for me is the 10% discount at Disney store online and locations. With everything they offer, this card is well worth applying for.

name: john
review: I have had this bank for years and will have it for more years to come. Not only is the customer service spot on, their atm locations are very convenient. Its basically a free checking account once you apply your direct deposit into it. I currently have checking, credit card, savings, and car loan all on one account and can pay all on one account. Super convenient and super customer service. When our of town, I buy something for more than $10, I get a text from chase saying whether I made those transactions from out of town or not. Very secure bank and solutions. Get your account now!

name: Karl
review: This is one of the best brick and mortar accounts you can get. I opened this account at my local branch and my personal banker was great! He was very respectful and courteous even though I have had some banking issues in the past. He explained all the fees to me and told me all the ways I could avoid them. The process of opening the account was quick and easy. I got answers to all my questions and felt very confident in my understanding of the account. I have had the account for 5 years now and plan to keep it forever. Although I do most of my banking online or at ATMs, on the occasions that I have interacted with bank staff I am always treated respectfully and professionally. They are always able to help me and answer my questions. I would recommend this account to anyone.

name: Dana Miller
review: I have had my Chase Checking Account for almost 6 months and I love it. Many banks I have dealt with in the past force you to order checks. Chase did not do this. My personal banker was very knowledgeable on their accounts and assisted me in selecting the best one for me. He also called me a few days after opening the account to see how things were going and to see if I needed any other assistance.  I am extremely happy that they have ATM's in the majority of the Speedway gas stations in my area as this allows me to take money out without traveling to an actual Chase bank or incurring ATM fees for using an out of network ATM. Not too happy with the monthly fee, but I have only incurred it once since opening the account and utilize direct deposit to avoid it.

name: Benjamin Carter
review: I personally have been with chase since they switch all the Washington mutual customers over.  What I like most about chase is that they give me the benefit of the doubt at least.  I can put a check in my account and get a portion of the check added to my available funds immediately.  The next business day my money is available to me.  Even when I take a picture of my check for a remote deposit it's the same process besides giving me a portion of my deposit from the app.  The mobile app experience is great.  I always get treated with the utmost respect which ever branch I go into across the country when I travel.  I have gone into multiple chase locations and had a great experience every time.  With Chase having multiple locations throughout the  US it feels like I'm in good hands and I have bank power.  I do all I can to maintain my relationship with chase.

name: John
review: I've had different Chase checking accounts through the years, but closed them out due to low interest rates. Last year, they offered $100 to open a new checking account (with several stipulations). The banker who helped open my account was extremely helpful--the whole bank was swamped, but he took the time to answer all my questions, and make sure I was comfortable with all the details of the deal. Not only that, but he called me a week later to follow-up, and to make sure that my Chase debit card for this new checking account. Excellent service overall!

name: Kay Achuro
review: By far one of the best frequent flyer credit cards around! I've had this card as well as the business card for the last two years, signed up when Soutwest was offering 50000 reward points. I use my premier card exclusely for purchases and airfare. There are many opportunities to gain more reward points as Southwest has teamed up with many partners such as Marriott. I'm planning two trips this year on my accrued points, doesn't get much better than that! My interest rate is just under ten percent but I pay in full each month. Very easy to check balance and in addition after accruing  a set amount of dollars and or one way trips, a borrower could be eligible for a Southwest companion pass ( companion flies for free).  I love flying no frill Southwest anyway....no baggage fees and many routes to use.

name: Daryl Andi
review: While the Chase Liquid Prepaid Card has a slighty higher monthly fee, $4.95, it offsets that by allowing you to use any chase atm without any transaction fee. I personally use the atm often so not having to pay a fee every time saves me quite a bit each month. Also they have no cancellation fees and they have a direct deposit option. These are all things you look for in a prepaid card. The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card is the perfect solution if you're unable to get a checking account for one reason or another.

name: Dakota Doerr
review: awesome credit card,chase is extremely reliable plus i get rewards on every single item purchased, i use it on amazon a lot so i get 3x the points. It's so nice getting money backawesome card.

name: Andy Garcia
review: I really like the Chase Sapphire card and have considered opening one up recently. The 10,000 bonus points reward is fantastic and the qualifier really isn't that difficult to achieve. The interest rate isn't that bad either compared to other similar options.

name: Jeremy Larkin
review: I was previously a customer of Chase Bank. I am no longer a customer, because they voluntarily closed my account, without my notice and reported me to check systems. My girlfriend had given me a check to deposit into my account from one of her other accounts. She had not noticed that it was from the account she had recently closed. When I deposited the check  at the ATM, it went through with no issues, so I had no idea. All of a sudden a week later, when I am out of town on a family vacation, I go to use my card and it's declined. When I went to the local branch where I was vacationing, the manager there was very unhelpful and almost accusatory that I had intentionally done this. Needless to say, they had closed my account and I am no longer a customer of Chase bank.

name: Becca
review: When I first opened this account in 2009, it wasn't so great. Even though I had over draft protection turned off, they continued to pull money from the account, eventually ending up with me being about $300 in the red. After I was able to pay the account back up to a positive balance, I talked to some customer service to ensure that this wouldn't happen again. Since then, I have had no issues whatsoever and have also been helped when my debit card was stolen; the new card got to me within about 4 days!

name: Kenny pilger
review: I currently have a Chase Premier Plus Checking account and couldn't be happier. I have never had any issues with the bank. The one time i did overdraw my account they were able to waive my overdraft fee within a minute of being on the call. Also, on my debit cards with other banks the magnastrip always wears out and never swipes right. The Chase debit card I have had for 1.5 years and it swipes just as clear now as it did from day one.

name: Cassie Miller
review: After graduating from college and getting a good job I decided I wanted to open a second checking account. I wanted to use this account for my personal funding. I shopped around for a while and came across Chase. I went into a branch and they said they would give me a hundred dollars just for signing up. How could you beat that, not only did I already want a checking account but they were going to give me money for doing it. Everyone was friendly and I have not had any problems since I started my checking account with Chase.

name: Samantha
review: I have had my savings account since before Chase bought out Washington Mutual several years ago. While I appreciate that Chase has locations all over the place, I've never been thrilled with the interest rates (my interest rate dropped dramatically after Chase bought WM). At this point, I keep most of my savings at another institution with a much higher interest rate, but I do keep a small emergency fund through Chase so that I always have quick access to my cash if I need it. I like the convenience of online banking, local branches, and ATMs. Their customer service has been better than other major banks that I have tried to do business with, so I am generally happy with my Chase savings account.

name: Ronny Guy
review: I signed up with Chase after having issues with other banks. The main reason I did it was the convenience of sending money to my spouse who also has chase bank. I love that there are no fees if direct depositing, and I also love the quick pay feature. Quick pay sends money instantly to another person with a chase account. I've had no problems and will continue to use the checking account!

name: Krystle Baetiong
review: I have had Chase Bank for my checking account for about eight years and they are absolutely wonderful.  Their bankers are very knowledgeable about their products and are always willing to help.  I have had an instance of my checking account information being stolen and they managed to take care of the situation in less than 24 hours.  Also, they have an excellent overdraft protection program whereby they forgive an overdraft once a year.   Their website is easy to use and I am able to navigate through the links and take care of my personal banking needs.  They also allow you to sign up for alerts through your e-mail and phone.  They will notify you of any security breaches or suspicious activity on your account.  I would definitely recommend Chase to anyone, especially students or young people who are setting up their first personal checking account because it is so easy to use.

name: Kurt
review: I've had my Chase checking account for about 7 years now. I also use their business checking as well. I love the fact that I can take a picture of any check and deposit it using my smartphone. I haven't had to actually visit a branch in years -- and that is a good thing.The checking account allows me to transfer balances easily to my other chase accounts and it even allows me to link my account to my daughter's accounts.I do wish there was some way to create a "virtual" checking/saving account with them though that would allow me to call it "Vacation Funds" and then designate funds to go into it, but beyond that I'm very happy with Chase.

name: Hope Wells
review: I have been with Chase bank since they bought Washington Mutual and my account was transferred. I REALLY loved WaMu and by comparison, Chase is not as great. (It could be partially that I did not choose Chase Bank on my own. I was grandfathered in as part of the sale/transfer). The customer service is fine, both in person and on the phone. The web services are pretty good, but very much secondary to ATM or branch transactions--I have had problems where a software update over the weekend wouldn't allow me to make a deposit. I was trying to make the deposit using my smart phone (we were traveling out of state), causing an NSF on Monday morning. Grr. Also, this has happened twice now.

name: Evan Ferrell
review: Chase is one of the few banks I have where I live that fits my needs. I deal with a lot of online transactions that most local banks won't accept, so to be able to have Chase around is great. I have never once had trouble with their customer service. They are always there to help, I lost my debit card which is never good. Chase customer service was there to help me cancel and issue a new card, which showed up in the mail way faster than I had thought it would.  I also enjoy the banks' extended hours. Overall I would recommend Chase to about anybody, especially if you do a lot of work online and receive payments through online means.

name: Nancy W Woodward
review: Chase has very friendly, sincere employees.  At the branch I use, the banker addresses me by my first name.  When completing my service, I am always asked if there is anything else that needs their assistance.  When I opened my account, the process was handled efficiently.  The availability of financial advisors was discussed and how to make an appointment.  When my debit card was misplaced, the bank was very helpful. Since there was a waiting period for the new card to arrive, the banker explained ways to access my funds before my new card arrived.   The transition to a new bank was facilitated because of the pleasant customer service.  I had been with another bank for over 20 years before choosing Chase.  It was a smart decision!

name: Heather Thomas
review: I held a bank account with Chase and I had someone get into my bank account take my money and Chase did nothing about it. I had funds removed from my bank account without my permission and Chase did nothing about it. They actually made me pay the fees that were being charged for over draft and they didn't even do an investigation on what was going on they just punished me.

name: Brittany Matteson
review: The most serious issue I faced with this bank was when my account was possibly affected by the Target hackers.  The bank notified me that they would be sending out new debit and credit cards.  I didn’t need to do a thing.  The cards arrived within a day and I activated them promptly.  It was nice to have the peace of mind that Chase was on top of the issue and I didn’t need to do anything in order to resolve it.  I have never had any problems with this bank and they have always been extremely helpful.

name: Katherine Muller
review: Chase saved me from hating banking. I had a terrible experience at a bank that I used to love when they started charging me $8 a month to just have an account. That was the DISCOUNTED rate, too! I went to Chase and not only is it free, but they also gave me money for opening an account and having direct deposit. They have always been kind, quick, and efficient, and I see no reason to ever use a different bank. Just recently a hotel put a hold on a LOT of money in my account, when I hadn't even ended up staying there, and had supposedly "refunded" my money. It was a pending charge, and customer service actually released the hold on the money so that I could pay my bills on time, without any proof of the refund happening, and with no questions asked. The charge ended up never going through at all, and all my bills were on time (thanks also to their amazing online bill pay!) Loyal customer, especially after that, for SURE.

name: Matt DeBlouw
review: I love Chase Freedom Card!!! One point for each dollar I spend and then up to 5% back in selected categories that change quartly. It's nice that I have the ability to make money with this card just on the rewards alone!! I can use this card whenever I want and It also has alerts that are sent directly to my phone which allows me to watch my spending and this is very useful with being a college student. Great stuff here!!

name: Tyler
review: My Chase savings account is awesome. There's nothing you lose when you open up a Chase savings account. Your money is there, kept safe. There are no fees. Just free! The people at Chase awesome, they will help you with anything you need to get started with your savings account. Try it out, I also recommend opening up a checking account. I received a great credit card from them as well!

name: Rachel S
review: I was excited to get this credit card as I shop at Amazon all the time! It has come in handy for gas and grocery purchases. I try to use this mostly at Amazon's website since you get more reward points with those purchases over everyday purchases.  I have already received notification of my rewards points that are available. I appreciate them giving me a choice of how to spend the points, along with no expiration date. The choice of using them for my Amazon purchase, apply as a statement credit or another reward choice is great for me! When I was first approved, I received a $30 Amazon gift card deposited into my account for future use- how awesome is that!

name: Robert Middleton
review: I have had a Rewards Visa Card issued by my local credit union for years and I like the way the Visa reward system works.  Thus, for me, the Disney Rewards Visa would be an appealing additional card, especially since it is backed by the great reputation, friendliness and excellent customer service of Disney.  As everyone knows, these folks know how to create world-class products and attractions and to maintain an extraordinary level of customer loyalty.  I'm confident that the same will apply to their Visa card.

name: Alexander
review: I have been with chase ever since I got out of high school. The fact that they have branches everywhere is extremely convenient. I mostly use their online banking though and rarely have to actually go into a branch store since I have direct deposit with work. I never had an issue with any of their services and I am overall happy with their service. I would recommend Chase to anyone especially if you always find yourself trying to locate your branch.

name: Summer Yandle
review: I have been with Chase since it was Wachovia back in New York. I love the fact that there is a Chase branch in nearly every state so I never feel lost without my bank. I've never had any issues with checks being held or deposits taking a long time to process. I would recommend Chase to anyone looking for a wide range of checking needs. I'd also like to add that the customer service has been extremely helpful during times of mixup with my account. I can't thank them enough for that!

name: Amanda Taylor
review: Although this card has an annual $45 fee, it is a good deal. No fee for the first year, 4 free nights initially, 2 more free nights once your account is approved, and the ability to earn more points for rewards after that. Perfect for the traveler.

name: Leslie Jeffcoat
review: I gave Slate from Chase a four out of five stars. It is an above average credit card. I didn't give it a full five stars because they do not offer a Rewards program. I like the Introductory offer of 0% APR for the first fifteen months. They also offer 0% interest on Balance transfers, which is a great way to pay off any other credit card debt you might have on other higher interest cards. The interest rate seems to be in the standard range for credit cards these days. It's not great, being above 12.99%. However, it is about par for the course when compared with other credit cards. There is no annual fee, which is great. Overall, this is a good card if you take advantage of the Introductory offer and pay off your balance in full every month after the Intro period. I have a Discover It card and it's pretty similar - 0% APR Intro offer, no annual fee, etc. My card does have a Rewards program, though.

name: Vera Thornton
review: I love the chase sapphire preferred credit card. It's perfect for traveling and I love the point system. 20% discount on travel? Heck yeah sign me up for that. We have a big trip coming up and this card is going to be my savior. The only downfall when it comes to this card is if you are not a frequent traveler. You would lose one of the sweetest benefits, which would be that 20 percent discount. Over all though, the chase card is pretty good!

name: Mike Borg
review: I HATE Chase! I'd give them negative stars if it was possible, but I had to select 1 star or else my review would not get posted. Chase has charged me the 12.00 monthly fee even though my avg daily balance was over $ 5K. Their literature states that your avg balance needs to be at least 5K for the monthly fee to be waived. I have already had to go to the bank to get the charge reversed once. But the very next month they charged me another 12.00 again. I’m going to have to go back to the local branch and raise a ruckus… Stupid bank they can’t even get their fees straight. They have tons of fees. It seems every little thing you want them to do, there is a fee–there is even a 25.00 fee for closing each of your accounts if it has been open less than 90 days. That means if you hate their service like I do, you still have to wait 90 days until you can get your money out. Basically they hold your money hostage or extort you if you want to take your money out and put it into a better bank. I will be closing my accounts once that minimum number of days is up and never doing business with them ever again! Steer clear of this bank! It's a hassle to keep having to explain and re-explain to them that they are charging me erroneous fees and getting them credited back. You have been forewarned! Use Chase at your own risk!

name: Chris Obermeier
review: I opened a chase premier checking account because of a very bad experience with another bank.  It was easy to open and everyone worked with me to even help settle the problems I was having with the previous institution.  On top of it since I was a military veteran I was able to get a free upgrade to the “premier plus checking” without any extra monthly fee.  It’s been a great experience so far at chase and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

name: Pi Reference
review: I don't like annual fees, but the Marriott Rewards card is definitely a good deal, as the rewards far exceed the yearly $45.  It's perfect if you are a regular Marriotter.  The initial reward points are enough for 4 nights, that's worth a lot of cash!  I use Discover during travel for the cashback, but this card would be better.  The emergency cash and card feature is a lifesaver, believe me if you have ever been out of town and gotten stuck this will save you from a real hassle.  Same for the free auto collision insurance, definitely a nice freebie.

name: Julie Mihm
review: I love my Chase Freedom card. I pay off my balance each month so I can't speak to APR or anything like that. I use it for everything and then reap the reward of the points. One point for each dollar I spend and then up to 5% back in selected categories that change quarterly. Usually the categories correspond with times of the year, like over the holidays it was all retail stores. I actually make quite a bit of money with this card from rewards alone.

name: Chris Obermeier
review: The chase slate card is one of the most favorite credit cards I have ever owned.  If you have any credit card balance you are trying to pay off you should use this card!  Contact them, see if you qualify, and they will transfer a remaining balance from another card to them and give you over a year of interest free APR.  I paid off an entire card's debt and saved thousands by using this card.  Very highly recommended.  The best card experience so far I've had.

name: Christiana Tuason
review: I absolutely love this credit card. The miles that you can earn are amazing. Within the first three months I received the bonus 30,000 miles and I am planning a trip to Asia very soon thanks to it! The only downside for me is the annual fee of almost $100. However, this is easily overshadowed by the cool perks (free checked bag, United Club passes, etc.). I would definitely recommend this card to any traveler or anyone who flies.

name: Sara VanIttersum
review: Chase is very convenient. They have branches almost everywhere and I use the online banking daily. I also like the low balance alerts that you can set to message you at any amount. I like that their products are linked -- we set up a savings account to start saving an emergency fund and can transfer money easily between the two.

name: Matt
review: Chase was one of the first banks I started working with and I am so thankful that they had straight forward rules, regulations and they were honest. Their customer service is always available, and is extremely helpful. Easier to access my account whether it was on my phone in their App that is so simple, or their website. I love their App because of the simple fact that anyone can use it. People working within the store are as friendly as I have ever seen, maybe it's where I live and the bank I go to but they are always helpful and caring people.

name: Nick Payne
review: The Hyatt Credit Card offers 2 free nights which is nice and spending the required $1000 to get them shouldn't be hard to do in three months. They waive the $75 fee for the first year so the 2 free nights really are free.However, the additional rewards system isn't particularly generous; it is about the same as a standard hotel rewards card, and I think many are better which is why I gave it 3 stars. Nothing wrong with this card it just seems about average.

name: Heather Payton
review: The British Airways Visa Signature Card is a fair card. The interest rate is in line with other cards. I really like the sign on bonus and the points systems. For every $1 that you spend, you receive 1.25 points. So you can really rack up the points quick. The only draw back to this card is the $95 annual fee. This is high. So overall I like my British Airways Visa Signature Card. It is easy to apply for and receive this card.

name: nikoya barber
review: i love chase. i have not had any overdraft fees since i joined. they have great customer service and so many locations to choose from. the bank tellers are always kind and generous. they always notify me if my account is low, either by email or text message which is very convenient.

name: Amanda
review: This is a great idea for anyone with little kiddos. I stumbled across this and decided to give it a quick look.  If you are planning a trip to Disney in the future, this is a great card to have.  I currently have the Capital One Reward Card and it is nice, but this would be super nice, plus you get a $50 gift card with your first purchase!  Who does that?!?

name: John Hoe
review: I've seen commercials for the Chase Sapphire card and I like their bonus system.   However compared to other credit cards, the interest rate on this is a tad bit high, I'd recommend shopping around first before you settle on the Sapphire card.

name: Rigo Rivas
review: So far it's been good. The bank doesn't ask for much. I have had identity theft issues and the bank has responded every time. I get the money and they do play with the balance but after asking them what was happening. They told me how to avoid it. It helps a lot to ask. You have to know how to use the debit atm to your advantage. This bank taught me all the ins and outs. I can't ask for more. I'm a military veteran and they give me the Chase Premier Checking account because of it. I think the world of this bank. And Gladly recommend it.

name: Sarah Schiavone
review: I opened a savings account with Chase as well as a checking at the same time.  I had some money saved up so put 2,500 dollars into my savings account.  The interest rate is generous and I enjoy watching my money grow at a nice rate.  The only down fall is I can't withdraw below 2,000 dollars before I get hit with fee's etc.  Besides that it is a nice savings account if you can leave your money put.

name: Corey
