review: The Chase Freedom card is my go-to card whenever I happen to come up a little short on bills or other credit payments for the month. I also use this card to equalize my credit balances through their balance transfer system. Obviously I don't want to be above 30% or so of my total credit limit on any account, so I use this balance transfer system often to redistribute some of this card's balance to another account when I think it gets too high. I usually pay off the other cards first, because of their higher interest rates. Chase's balance transfer system is pretty easy to do on their website, and only takes a few minutes. I'd definitely recommend this card for anyone who closely watches their credit and wants a quick way to move between their credit balances.

name: Wi Ci
review: I am delighted.  The terms and low late fees are affordable.  The cash advance fee is just enough.  The grace period of 21 days is so polite.  The regular rates are extremely low.  The no annual fee is brilliant.  The balance transfer fee is so low.  I like how there's no max overlimit fee.  I like how there's a cash advance rate.  My old credit card had none of those features.  My old credit card had no grace period.  The amazon credit card is definitely something I'm looking forward to signing up for.

name: Evan Ferrell
review: Chase has always done right by my standards, this card is no exception. The rewards compared to other credit cards are astounding. The interest rate is nothing to be worried about, because it's so low you won't be constantly stressing.

name: Dustin
review: This card is great, Chase has always treated me well, so it was no surprise to receive the same treatment and quality with this card. The rewards are great, I love the APR, and the cash back bonus is an excellent motivator to spend more money, haha. This has quickly become my most used card. Thanks Chase.

name: Jordan
review: Chase has wonderful checking accounts available to all, even college students. They are quick and efficient. I had my account compromised once and they called within an hour of it showing unusual charges. There are plenty of ATMs around major cities to use and avoid fees. Overall my experience with Chase has been excellent and I will continue to use them for many years to come.

name: Katie Hales Smith
review: My husband and I opened a Chase account a few years ago. We're happy with it. The customer service is prompt and efficient. The website is easy to navigate. I'm usually weary of accounts with monthly fees but Chase makes it easy to maintain an account balance without getting caught up in fees. Chase is easy to work with and it makes our lives a little easier. It's always important to know your money is being handled appropriately.

name: Becky Schulte
review: I love my Chase Freedom card! I don't use it that often but already have points built up. I never have had an issue with this card. I would recommend this card for someone that is new to credit cards and wants to build up their credit!

name: Jenny Satterwhite
review: I love my Chase Freedom card!!  The rewards are great!  We use our Chase card for everything and collect the reward points to use for traveling.  I love that they give us the option to have auto bank draft so we never miss a payment!  Highly recommended!

name: Sam Wood
review: The Marriott Rewards Credit Card looks like a pretty cool card. 3 bonus points for every dollar you spend at a Marriott hotel is very attractive. Marriott hotels are great places to stay and the rewards you get are the icing on the cake. Although there is no intro rate on a transfer, the standard rate seems very reasonable. I also love the fact that you can earn four free nights at a category 1 hotel in your first three months as a card holder.

name: Hal Perry
review: I have been able to accrue a lot of FF miles by using this card.  Mileage Plus is an excellent rewards program with lots of opportunities to earn extra miles using this card.  I only give it 4 stars instead of 5 because recently United has started to limit the opportunities to book flights with Award Miles that don't involve more than one stop or ridiculous itineraries.

name: Laura Cordes
review: I've had a Disney Rewards Visa for a number of years and have always been happy with it.  The customer service line is based in the USA and is always helpful.  The rewards are redeemable at any Disney location - including the online Disney store.

name: Evan Peterson
review: Thanks to this card I got a really nice hotel room in Chicago using the points I had built up. The points earned are fair. This is a great card for travelers. This card along with my CapOne Venture card are my go to when I'm traveling abroad. Also, the United club passes are really cool. Unlike my other credit cards this one has more features than any of the others. I would highly recommend this card to frequent travelers!

name: Adriane Winters
review: I have been pretty pleased with this credit card. I shop at amazon quite frequently so I like the fact that I can rack up points and use them to buy stuff on amazon. I wish I could get more points, or an equal number of points on everything that I buy, rather than a certain number of points for gas, groceries etc...I've had no problems with using their online bill pay, and the mobile app (through chase) is one of the best.

name: Janet Bishop
review: I really like this card.  The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card seems like a terrific deal!  No activation Fees, Transaction Fees, Cancellation Fees, etc., is great.  I really like the free Live Customer Support feature too. The $4.95 monthly fee is the only thing that I don't like about this card. I've seen other Prepaid cards like the Prepaid Visa Net Spend Card, which charges a $5.95 Inactivity Fee, up to $2.00 Transaction Fees, depending on whether you sign for purchases or use a PIN and up to a $9.95 monthly fee, depending on which plan you have with them. The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card seems to be the way to go!

name: Liz
review: I have been pretty happy with my Chase account!  While, with other banks, I always felt that they were trying to get as much in fees out of me as they could, I have never thought that about Chase.  Perhaps this has to do with the "level" of account I have or the number of years that I have had this account at Chase, but I am actually often surprised at the services they have been willing to offer completely free of charge, such as a free Liquid Debit card.  I would recommend this bank account!

name: Jenna Bot
review: I have been banking with Chase since 2005, and I have never had a problem.  The only issue I did have once was with overdraft charges due to an unauthorized withdrawal from my account.  I contacted Chase, and they were able to remove the overdraft charge and set everything straight.  Their customer service is always available, and is extremely helpful.  Living in New York City, they have so many locations, that they are definitely the most efficient banking option for me.  I would not go anywhere else!

name: Jon-Paul Brown
review: As someone who doesn't care as much about the "rewards" a card offers as much as what the card costs, the Hyatt Credit Card is about average.  I would much rather take into account the amount of interest and fees I'll be paying, because if I'm paying a very high interest rate on a credit card, it would be cheaper to just pay for a night in a hotel.The regular rate of 15.24% is average or even less than other reward cards.  The Venture Capital Rewards card can be a little less at around 14% all the way up to 20%, which is a huge interest rate to pay just to get some airline miles.  So, the Hyatt Credit Card has a fair interest rate for what you are getting.  They also have no annual fee for the first year, but it jumps up to $75 each additional year.  Depending on how much you travel and spend, will the higher interest rate and annual fee for a rewards card really benefit you when it comes to having nice accommodations when you travel?  Or will you do better with a straight forward credit card with no reward?  For me, not really.  I will probably pass on this one.

name: wes
review: The British Airways Visa Signature Card is a very enticing offer. The card has great benefits, including the "Travel Together Ticket" after spending $30,000 in a year with the card. One drawback is the balance transfer fee, but it is still relatively low compared to other cards. Another great aspect of the card is the no foreign transaction fee, which is awesome when traveling internationally.

name: Laura Hilton
review: I have had my Chase account for about four years now. There are no monthly fees, and I always get a text when my balance is low. I've always had great customer service when needed. The biggest issue I have ever had with them was regarding their outrageous fees on account transfers. Making deposits and transferring from other Chase accounts is so simple. But, when I transferred my financial aid refund into my Chase College Checking account, I was charged a fee of over 30 dollars! I guess I didn't read the small print! Just make sure you keep a close eye on fees.

name: Keisha Maldonado
review: I've had my College Checking Account with Chase for about 2 years now. It's the first bank account I've ever had, so I can't really compare it to other accounts. It's perfect for a college student! I don't have to worry about monthly fees or minimums! The only problems I've had are with overdraft fees. Sometimes I wouldn't know that I had overdrawn my account, but that's more my fault than Chase's. I have noticed that the option to automatically pay bills every month doesn't really work for my account. The payment wouldnt go through and I would have to do it manually.

name: Ryan Brinkman
review: I love Chase, and I can't say enough good things about them.  I first joined chase about 6 years ago when I moved to a new city and my credit union didn't have a location up there.  I have moved home and continued to remain through chase because of the great experience.  I love their online banking and enjoy the ease of managing my credit cards through chase and being able to see any of my activity through their app on my smart phone.  What's even better is they just built a branch 2 minutes from my house last year.  I'm always greeted when I come into a branch, I know almost every staff member, and almost never have a waiting time.  I originally joined because I got an offer in the mail for 100 dollars for opening an account with direct deposit.  My only negative comment is having to use my debit card 5 times a month for purchases to maintain free checking.  It hasn't been difficult, but seems unnecessary.  I still give them 2 thumbs up!

name: Scott Struzik
review: I opened up a savings account with Chase Bank a few years ago.  I no longer have the account open however this is not due to any negative issues with the company at all.  As a customer I was treated very well.  Their customer service department was excellent.  Very smart, thoughtful and easy to talk to when I had any issues.  The only reason I switched was because I was offered a better deal with a competitive bank.  Lower fees and such.  Over all Chase was good.  I would definitely do business with them in the future if good opportunities came up.

name: Justin Pina
review: I have had this chase savings account along with my checking account since I first started banking with chase several years ago. I was cautious at first because I was just a poor college student that didn't have much money to even deposit at the time and I wasn't impressed by the interest return. But something is better than nothing right? There aren't many bad things I can say about it. It gets its job done which is to save my money and slowly gather interest. The only thing I didn't like was the minimum amount I had to have in there at all times, but that's expected.

name: Meagan Minard
review: As someone who stays at Marriott hotels, this card is fantastic in regard to using them. I love the rewards that I get for doing so. The high fee is the only kicker for the card, so definitely watch for that. Otherwise, this card is great and ideal for travelers and the like.

name: Jenna Bot
review: I absolutely love my Chase Freedom card.  The cash back rewards are great, it's easy to pay, and the Chase customer support team for this card is always responsive and helpful.  Out of the 5 credit cards I use, this one is definitely the most rewarding and convenient!

name: Ryan Brinkman
review: I really like my credit card.  I bank through Chase and it's really nice to be able to see my balances and most recent purchases online.  Not to mention I can make my payment on the same page immediately straight through my bank account.  Overall the best thing is I can combine my points with all my chase cards.

name: Renee
review: This card is pretty good. I'm satisfied with it, and would probably recommend it to a friend.

name: Cindi Hounton
review: I really like the card.  The Chase people on the phone are helpful.  I signed up for it for a signing bonus, but I kept the card because the 5 percent revolving categories are good.  Also, it allows you to redeem your rewards for a statement credit instead of gift cards.

name: Kayla Sheehan
review: i love the Amazon card. i'm always shopping on amazon, so it only makes sense to have it. And upon signing up you get 10$ instantly taken off your current purchase, which is part of the thirty dollar bonus. so that doesn't hurt either! plus the points you receive for every purchase you make! the best thing is NO ANNUAL FEE! which I feel like every credit card has now days.

name: Rusty Shackelford
review: 0% APR for 15 months on any purchase! That is the sweetest part of this card, unfortunately you need very very good credit to get this one, but it is definitely worth it. I like the revolving rewards you can earn throughout different months, but I would prefer being able to pick one or two things, like always getting gas rewards or miles, but you do get cash back on all purchases made on this card. Plus, it's Chase and I've always had a good relationship with them. I used the Chase Freedom card to buy expensive gear, because it made it manageable allowing me to pay it off without interest within the year.

name: Emily Davey
review: Great initial interest rate especially since you can get 15 months with 0% interest for balance transfers AND new purchases.  Chase has great rewards programs that are fairly simple to use.  I think the $25 late fee is high but it should be.  This is a great card, if you qualify for it and want to continue qualifying for it, you should pay your bill on time.  Chase has great customer service.  I think this card is a great way to start using Chase if you’re not already.  I love the bank, I love the card, their terms are fair, clear and upfront and their service is unmatched.

name: Collin Sullivan
review: For the most part I like this card. If you're a big Amazon shopper it makes total sense to use this card because of the 3points/$1 payback that you receive and can roll into future purchase. If you don't shop on Amazon much then you might be better suited using a different card considering 100points only = $1 to spend back on Amazon.

name: anandh kumar
review: very good offer. My initial mortgage and subsequent refinancing was very smooth with Chase. I would certainly use them again.This original company allowed me to pay with a credit card (which I have learned is uncommon), and allowed me to accumulate points.

name: DENNISw T White
review: Test comment Test comment

name: Dawn Maupin
review: The Chase Sapphire Card is a real deal. It offers a reasonable interest rate and no annual fee. Users get 10,000 points for signing up and there is no limit to how many points you can earn. If you spend $500.00 in the first three months, they give you 10,000 additional bonus points! Great card.

name: Mariam Rowlett
review: I have had a Chase account for many years. I left for about four months. I checked out other banks. I returned to Chase. I felt that Chase was not only familiar, but exceptional.Now, Chase a CEO, Jamie Dimon, who runs things. My  old, grand-fathered account was excellent. Now that CEO Dimon, ELITE Dimon is in there, he is a leech, and if you do not have steady income, at a steady amount, steady pace each month, he will suck money out of us. He will charge you to have an account at his bank, of $ 10.00-12.00/month. Did it ever occur to this rich elite that we do not have this steady stream of deposits because we are in an economic crisis that was caused by him and his kind? Rothschilds, for example? Bet they love to have dinner together.Anyways, I am sickened by these greedy, power-hungry people who rule over the poor, and take from them, little by greater. It is a plot, and they tell us that we should be happy that we allow them to take our money in their stinking banks. Whatever. I am totally not satisfied with the new banking policy that charges people if they have no job. It is disgusting, and it is the NEW banking. Just average, Dimon. You are a follower of rip-offs.That is what I think of my new Chase checking account. All of the banks are doing it--getting richer by nickling and diming the poor. Since Chase is following the crowd of elite pick-pockets, it is only AVERAGE, just like its CEO.

name: Kate Pacheco
review: This looks like a really good card - I have had other Chase rewards cards in the past and this one looks like it's even better.  This Slate from Chase card, assuming you get a good APR rate, has 0% interest for 15 months on balance transfers as well as 0% interest on purchases for 15 months.  That's better than 12 months, and the balance transfer option would be appealing to me.  Chase is decent in general with customer service and online banking for their credit cards, and this card looks decent to me!

name: Bryant
review: This card seems like a great deal. The only draw back that I can see is the $4.95 monthly fee. However, if you have a checking account, it's waived, which is definitely a plus. The cash back offer for online buys is a great positive. While I'm normally adverse to prepaid cards, since they require you to constantly add money, this card seems like the positives greatly outnumber the negatives of the card. Other cards don't allow you to waive the monthly fee, if they have one, also, some other prepaid cards aren't backed by such a strong bank. Compared to other cards I've had, this one seems like one of the better ones on the market.

name: Jim Louie
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred credit card is, hands down, the best rewards credit card out there. If you are a frequent traveler then this card is a must have because not only is there no foreign transaction fee but there is also a 20% discount when you redeem points towards travel. I highly recommend this card because the signup bonus of 40K points is too good to pass up right now. Base you get 1% on everything which is pretty much standard, but the 2% back on travel and dining is also a huge plus that you have to consider when choosing credit cards.

name: Allie Bentley
review: Who hasn't stayed at a Marriott hotel?  This card is great for all your hotel needs, with options for points, rewards, and credit.  The only drawback is the high annual fee after the first year.

name: Sean Gant
review: I've had this card for about three years now.  It's pretty good, I only use it about once a year to pay for flight/hotel for vacations.  I have a decent rate with it, no complaints.  Since I don't use it a lot the 5% cash back doesn't add up for me, but that's okay.  I would definitely recommend this card if you do use it a lot because then the 5% cash back could add up pretty quickly.  All in all though, this is a decent card.

name: Kate Pacheco
review: I am a huge Disney fan and would love to have this Disney Rewards Visa credit card.  It has a great APR and has a decent intro rate on purchases of 0% for 6 months which seems pretty standard to me.  There's no intro rate on transfers which seems a bit of a disappointment; all of my other cards have always at least offered me great rates on balance transfers, i.e. 0% interest for 12 months.  What I would really enjoy would be the Disney rewards; no other card I have includes those.  I'm a CA resident and make it out to Disneyland quite a bit so I could really use those.  Also I have 2 daughters, so we are constantly in the Disney store in the mall... Those extra rewards could really be used.  I've actually seen this card advertised on the Disney Store Website page, I'm thinking about getting it!

name: Kathleen Keller
review: I have been a customer of Chase now for 8 years. I find them to be average-above average on most issues.  They have been kind enough to credit back an overdraft fee for me when I screwed my accounting up once, and I really do appreciate that. The one thing that does annoy me about Chase though, is certain branches in this area really do spend a lot of time trying to get you to come into the branch from the drive through so they can sell you something, or they try to sell you a new service from the window itself. I do like that Chase now allows me to scan a paycheck on my daughters IOS and deposit it that way, I wish they would add this feature for Android.

name: Jen
review: There is a hefty fee to use this account each month ($12) but with the price come a lot of options.  Chase is a well known and respected bank, and they are everywhere in the NYC area...  even in the Duane Reades.  They are easy to work with and give me no hassle at all if I need to dispute a charge or even waive an overdraft fee.  The best part of using this account is the convenience.  You can make deposits by photo, you can email people money even if they aren't Chase users.  You can manage your account and get balances by sending a quick text message.  I feel like they've defined the word "convenience".

name: Abraham Levy
review: Opening an account with Chase checking was one of the best decisions I've made in my personal finance history. The customer service is incredible and support is there to help you at every step of the way. Set up was easy, and every time I have a question regarding overdrafts or cash back, there is someone in the bank to answer my question in the utmost detail. I love banking with Chase, and I would never bank anywhere else.

name: Rusty Shackelford
review: Chase is definitely one of the easier banks I have had to dealt with. I'm pretty happy with my checking account there. They even notify by email almost instantly when I reach a "red alert" level of my balance that I could set and they will even text your cell at the same time. If you are not good about recording everything into your book like me, then this is a very useful tool for those sneak up on you moments.

name: Andrew Maner
review: You can't go wrong with the Marriott card ! It is issued by chase bank. Fees are sorta high even with the advance fee of 19.27.

name: Dawn Maupin
review: The Hyatt Credit Card is a really attractive offer. The card offers a very competitive interest rate, in comparison to similar offers. The interest rate is the most important when deciding on any credit offer. In addition to a great interest rate, the card offers no annual fee for the first year. Each year after, the annual fee is $75.00. This card offers a two free nights stay when you spend $1,000.00 within the first three months. It also gives its members a free night stay on the anniversary of their account. Absolutely a great offer for most anyone, especially someone who travels frequently.

name: Dawn Maupin
review: This offer for the British Airways Visa Signature Card is really attractive. It gives a competitive interest rate which is most desirable. There is an annual fee of $95.00 , which i feel is a little expensive, however this card offers rewards for free airline miles. This is a nice tool for someone who travels frequently, particularly abroad. Comparing the British Airways Visa Signature Card to most other offers of credit, this card has a reasonable interest rate and associated fees while still offering you, the customer, something back.

name: Jon smith
review: The Chase Sapphire is my favorite credit card that I have right now. With my wedding and honeymoon quickly approaching, I applied for this card because the 40,000 bonus points when you spend over $3,000 really caught my eye since we were going to book our honeymoon using this card. Also, it was very important that our card had the credit chip in it, which is a necessity for travelling overseas, like we are. Overall, I think this is a great card because it rewards us with more travelling in the end.

name: Jon smith
review: My Chase Checking account is something that really works for me. It’s not your typical checking account and it makes you feel like the company is really looking out for you. When you have a low balance (you can pick what this means for you), they will send you an e-mail telling you your account balance is low. I also like that they allow you to avoid having to pay the monthly fee to maintain the card. Since I have direct deposit I am able to do this and really appreciate this.

name: Kwame Yeboah
review: This seems like a great reward for anyone who has excellent credit! The APR rates are totally reasonable, and the $100 bonus is an excellent incentive to sign up. Paying your bills on time has its benefits, and the Chase Freedom card proves it.

name: Jay Melo
review: I like rewards cards.  They are a great way to earn 'something extra' while doing your usual shopping.  The $100 bonus tempted me to sign up for this card.  I have dealt with Chase in the past and have always been happy with them.

name: Danielle Flemming
review: I have banked with Chase for two years and have had a great experience. I was able to apply for my checking account online, and was approved very quickly. I believe I even received $125 for signing up with them. Shortly after setting up my account, there was some fraudulent activity that I was notified of immediately. The customer service representative was extremely friendly and understanding and was able to promptly take care of the matter. Also, any funds are usually available within a day after depositing money, whereas other banks seem to put a longer hold on the funds. Transfers to and from the account also take place very quickly. I highly recommend banking with Chase.

name: Tyler Watters
review: I have had this card for just under a year now and I like it My credit limit has been increased because I make all of my payments and also my rates are not high at all. I would like to see more rewards offered by them for doing well with the credit card, but I'm not going to complain.

name: Allie Bentley
review: For a traveler, the Chase Sapphire Preferred card offers some very exciting bonus opportunities when you use it to pay for purchases, something I did not receive with my Discover card.  The interest rate is higher than others, but if you travel frequently it is worth it!

name: Michael Powell
review: I love my disney rewards visa, ever since we took the kids to disney a few years ago, they've been begging to go back, this makes saving a little easier. A 6 months deferred interest is always a bonus.

name: Josh Turner
review: I've been banking with Chase over the past year after switching over from Suntrust due to being very unhappy with them. I can say that I haven't had any problems with Chase and they make me so much happier than Suntrust did. The monthly fee is low and I never have a problem finding an ATM. Online banking is great and very simple. Customer service has been great and I've always found that they are very helpful and kind, which wasn't the case for my last bank. They are great and I would never hesitate to use them.

name: Stephanie Wambold
review: The Chase Slate looks like an overall good card to have. I like the idea of a flat rate late fee. The over limit fee could be good or bad. If you need to go over for something, there's no option. But it does prevent you from actually going over. The penalty APR is about average for what most cards are now, but it would be nice to see one quite a bit lower. The 21 day grace period is great. With things going the way they are now, and with a lot of people scraping by, it's nice to know there is plenty of time to make up a payment. I am not quite sure how I feel about the cash advance. It's almost as high as the penalty APR. The fee is very reasonable though for both the advance itself and the foreign transactions. The introductory offer is a great incentive for someone to sign up, along with the 0 annual fee.

name: Dawn Aldridge
review: The monthly fee makes this card very unappealing. You can tie it to a checking account to avoid the monthly fee, but then you essentially just have a normal debit card. Commerce Bank offers a similar card, called the My Spending card, that only charges a 1 time activation fee of $5.95. Since the Commerce Bank card has no monthly fees, it is a great way to keep spending money separate from a checking account that is used to pay bills.

name: evan
review: The chase liquid card seems like a great option for someone who does not have a standard debit or check card and enables you to make purchases online and anywhere that accepts Visa cards. the benefit to having this card is it is backed by chase bank. If you have any issues you can always walk into a chase branch and talk to a human being to resolve your issue. I like my Capital One credit card better because it offers a line of credit that I can spend and then pay a portion or the entire balance at the end of the month. I also know from experience that you can not use the Liquid card to rent cars at Enterprise Rent a Car. Even if you have the funds on the card it will not go through. My Capital One standard card goes right through as long as you have the amount that the rental company is trying to run available on your card.

name: Duran Chris
review: Where will i get chase liquid card?

name: Tammy Gray
review: I like the idea of the Slate card from Chase for the introductory interest rate of 0% for 15 months.  The only way I would ever get this card was if I was in great need of funds that I knew I could pay on time and before the introductory rates were over.  The late fee is quite hefty at $35.  I like that there is no annual fee.  I would never get a card with an annual fee.  However, I like to use reward cards.  Even if the rewards are slow in coming, they do help.  I just got a free bread machine, pan and knife set that I picked out with rewards from my current card.  This seems like a card I would only use if I was in a desperate 15 month situation and yet I knew I could pay the payments on time.

name: Joshua Sipes
review: The application process was quick and easy; not a whole ton of information requested. I'm not a huge fan of the minimum balance and maximum activity (withdraws, purchases, etc) but the perks of using the account as a credit card are great. Customer service is alright, their dispute process is a little lengthy, but they work for your money like they claim.

name: Selena Edwards
review: I have been a customer of Chase with a checking account for over 5 years. The customer service is usually excellent. In all that time, I only had one issue when I called in and got a csr that was rude. I have not experienced any problems with Chase processing errors on my account. Any issues I need to discuss are handled right away because they have phone reps always available and the bank stays open until 6:00 pm every evening except the weekends but they are open on Saturday. This is important to me because I tend to stress out over money matters. So to sum it up Courtesy customer service, long banking hours and no errors processed on my account. I give them the highest rating.

name: Brett Bishop
review: I have had this card for about 2 years now and it was the first credit card I had ever applied for and gotten. That being said, as expected, I was approved for the 23% interest rate, however, Chase gives you about 18-24 months free of interest with this card. There are no fees associated with the card, and another benefit is the 5% cash back Chase offers with this card on certain purchases. Definitely an awesome card to start out with.

name: Crystal Smith-Connelly
review: I've had this credit card for a few years, and I love it!  Throughout the year, Chase offers 5% cash back on certain types of purchases, and I really like when they offer it on travel purchases (flights, hotels, etc.) at a time of year I happen to be traveling and when they offer 5% cash back at Kohl's since I shop there often.  The 5% cash back enables me to accrue points more quickly, and I get so excited when it's time to cash in my points.  You can trade your points for cash or choose from many gift cards, but I always get an Amazon gift card with my points since that's my favorite place to shop.

name: Jenny Tull
review: The Hyatt Credit Card is a great card for someone looking to earn extra rewards on Hyatt properties.  You can earn 2 free nights once you spend $1000 within the first 3 months.  This card however has some drawbacks; there is an annual fee after the first year, it is only for people with excellent credit, and it is only good for people who always stay in Hyatt locations.

name: Jennifer Lang
review: For the first year, the British Airways Visa Signature looks great. As someone who travels frequently, the rewards are stellar. However, getting the card does require a fairly high credit rating, so it might not be great for a college student or other young adult. Even though the card fee is $95 the second year, it might be worth it for someone who spends a lot of time abroad. The complete lack of foreign transaction fees is pretty awesome. Right now I have a Discover It and honestly, I'm thinking of switching over. If I kept track of my rewards right, I think I'd come out much better.

name: Brett Bishop
review: I had this savings account for the first few years of my college career. I didn't really want or need a savings account, but I was signed up for it when I opened my checking account with Chase. It did its job, but I was not very impressed. As expected, the interest return was minimal, but what I really found appalling was the amount of fees charged to my account every month. I was never told about the minimum balance fee when signing up, so I was often charged when my balance fell too low. In addition, I was charged for making too many withdrawals during the statement period, another fact which was conveniently not told to me during the sign up process. Fortunately, Chase's customer service is great, and I was able to have many of these fees refunded to me. I closed my account a year or so after initially opening it, but now that I am out of school and saving more towards the future I will probably reopen it soon.

name: Brett Bishop
review: I opened my Chase College Checking account a few years ago before I started college. Before banking with Chase I used a small, local bank, which simply could not compare to what Chase has to offer. This account is nothing special; however, it is perfect for students who are just starting out on their own. There is no minimum balance required to keep and there are very few fees. This account also offers online banking services, so it is very easy to keep an eye on and track your activity. The account also offers very good fraud protection. When my card number was stolen a few months ago, Chase was quick to discover it and even quicker with replacing my lost funds and providing me with a new and free card. I would recommend this account to any student or young adult who is just starting out on their own.

name: Heidi Landmeier
review: I have had this card for a very short time, however, in that time I have fallen quickly in love with it. It not only has a decent credit limit, but I am getting points for so many of my purchases. In the past I have used cards such as Capital One, and even Barclays. However, the fees were astronomical, and the benefits were next to nothing. I could not be more pleased with this card and the perks associated with it. Finally, I love Chase Bank. I do everything through them and they have always had superior customer service.

name: Stephanie B
review: I have been a Chase banking member, for some time now. They have always been a very ethical bank and have treated me very well over the years. Currently, I have the Chase Premier Plus checking account, along with many other forms of business, with Chase Bank. While I do feel the fees for this account can be excessive, the rewards for the account far outweigh the negatives. The customer service with Chase is great, as well. They are always very understanding and do what they can to help you. Being one of the largest banks in the world also has its advantages. I never have to worry if I will be able to find a banking location when I’m away from home. Great bank!

name: Alexandria Nicole
review: I like banking with Chase because they have excellent customer service and take care of me as a customer. The only thing that I dislike about Chase is the fact that there are not a lot of ATMs and the monthly fee is twelve dollars. The only good thing is that they do not charge unnecessary fees and you will always know exactly what charges will be on your statement. I'm going to continue to bank with Chase for a very long time. I prefer Chase over other banks because of the sleekness of the card to be honest. Great service.

name: yasmina
review: I will have to say that this has been a great experience for me as a customer of this bank to do business with. I come here so often, almost twice a week to do my banking, make deposits, and withdraw cash. The location is approximate to my residence. Conveniently located, the staff is very friendly and welcoming. I opened a Business account with them and I don't regret having done it after the horrible experience I went through BOA. Their website is very user friendly too.

name: Samantha
review: I have a Chase Checking Account and I’ve been more than satisfied. I find that they don’t charge me a lot of unnecessary fees, they will transfer my money from savings to prevent an overdraft fee, and they have a lot of different locations for me to get my money at with no charge.

name: maria steranko
review: The Chase Liquid sounds like any standard prepaid credit card, it will help you increase your credit rating if that is what you are looking for, but can get a "real" credit card. If you are specifically looking for a prepaid credit card, this one sounds like a good option, it belongs to a major chain so you won't have any problems finding an ATM, but if you do the fee is $2 which sounds pretty comparable to other cards (I'm specifically thinking of Capital One) If you are not set on your card being prepaid I would recommend the Capital One Venture card over this one. You won't have a monthly fee and you'll get rewards and stack up points.

name: Renee Geisel
review: These guys are about average. I had these guys before my USAA account and let me tell you there is a world of difference. Their atm fees are crazy and they charge you 8 dollars a month for their checking account if you do not follow certain criteria. The customer service is so so. It depended on the day sometimes they were great and others they were horrible. I could hardly ever get anyone on the phone. Forget about understanding some of the things they explained to you. You would have to tell them to repeat themselves multiple times. If you are looking for an average bank I would not suggest these guys there are better ones out there.

name: Michael Meza
review: This is a great card. The APR is low and there are no hidden fees. I have had this card for over 5 years now and love it! I recommend the card to anyone and their customer support service is excellent!

name: Donald
review: As far as account fees or minimum balance requirements go, Chase isn't the worst I've seen for their savings account. I no longer have Chase, but when I did, there weren't any fees for a Savings account so they must have changed their policy. With the fees, though, you do get convenient branch and ATM locations along with helpful service from Chase employees. It really does pay off to pay a couple dollars in monthly fees that they have for the convenience of a nationwide chain.

name: Donald
review: Chase was one of my first checking/debit accounts and at first I was happy with the bank's service, mainly because I was a student and they weren't charging me a fee for anything. That changed when I graduated. The fee and the minimum amount of money in the account to avoid the fee wasn't up my alley, so I switched banks. I will say that while I was a member, their customer service was top of the line and whenever I had an issue with anything at all, they went out of their way to help me. It may seem like something stupid to leave a bank about, but I don't like being charged for a service like that, when it really doesn't cost them anything on top of getting additional fees if there is an overdraft. It was too much for me when making too little money. All in all, though, Chase is a pretty good bank.

name: Elias Carlon
review: The Chase Sapphire card is very beneficial *if* you frequently travel. For everyone else, it's really just so so. The interest rate is quite high for a top shelf credit card but the rewards have to be recouped from somewhere. Overall, it's very good for business travelers and only so so for everyone else.

name: Kara Ann
review: I think that I would only choose this card if no other cards were available to me. It seems like a decent card, but there are a few things that put me off. First of all, and this may sound silly but, I don't like the look of the card. While the look of the card wouldn't deter me from a great offer, it would dissuade me from taking up an average offer like Chase Slate. With so many other offers available, a great credit card really needs to have something to set it apart like rewards. For now, I'll stick with my shiny red BOA card.

name: Amanda Whitley
review: Chase Liquid PPC seems to have a lot of advantages that other PPCs don't offer... I used NetSpend a couple years ago for my taxes (TurboTax had partnered with them) and wasn't super thrilled.  There is no way to link a checking account like you can with this Chase card.  Also, there were no benefits related to Social Media.  I don't use these PPC's anymore, but this might be a good one for anyone that needs to...

name: Dave Anderson
review: This is an excellent card with great benefits.  I've had this card for about 5 years now and I have never had a problem with it.  The 5% quarterly cash back is great and usually includes gas in the categories which adds up quickly.  This card also extends the warranty on most big ticket items by one year providing peace of mind.

name: Charles Jones
review: The Amazon credit card is the best card I've owned.  In addition to getting $30 off my Amazon order when I signed up for it, I earn points from shopping that I can use for further discounts on Amazon.  My interest rate and payments are also very reasonable, the credit limit is very generous and their customer service has always been great.  Plus there's no annual fee.

name: Sam Sirotnikov
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card offers some nice benefits such as no cancellation fee, as well as no fees for other benefits such as customer support. The main concern is the monthly fee of $4.95, but since it can be waived under certain circumstances, it is not so bad.

name: Josh Rouse
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card has some tremendous benefits with the initial allotment of 40,000 reward points. It's easy to rack up additional points with this card and is certainly easier to do so than many other reward cards. The annual fee is a bit high and the interest rate could be better. But if one uses the card enough, those reward points will certainly balance out those drawbacks, and then some.

name: Number TwentySix
review: I don't like the fact that this card offers no rewards. With the interest rates that one pays for this card, a person could have a different card with the same rate that pays in rewards.

name: Ashley Marshel
review: I signed up for a Chase total checking account a few years ago. At the time I was given a $150 bonus for opening an account. I've had a really good experience overall with Chase. There are many locations and ATMs in my area. Their mobile and online banking is also great. I rarely have to go to the bank to deposit checks because I can easily do that using my phone. I also haven't had to pay any fees because I keep a $1,500 balance. I haven't had to deal with their customer service many times but when I did they were very helpful and efficient. Overall I think it's a great basic checking account.

name: Sarah Liu
review: I have had my Chase savings account since saving for my wedding 6 years ago. I have never been more happy with a banking experience. I am coming from Citizens bank, where I felt faceless, and was looked down on. At Chase I was treated like a person. I have $25 every pay period transferred into my savings from my checking account to avoid the extra fees. Another plus is that transactions showed up online and on my app much faster than with Citizens. I have found it much easier to keep on top of my finances with my accounts from Chase. And I LOVE being able to deposit checks with my phone!!

name: raquel Lopez
review: When I first signed up for this checking account they offered me a $125 bonus to join which was great! Now that I have been with chase (for years now) I love their customer service, they are always very helpful. Another thing I like about Chase is that they have something called overdraft protection, so I don't have to pay $20-$30 each time I accidentally overdraw. The checks themselves are at a decent price.Lastly you can scan any check written out to you and it automatically loads to your account , how awesome is that?!

name: Robb Halbrook
review: I used to have a checking account here that I was using to cash my checks and for the debit card. The debit card has fees and you had to use the card a certain amount of times a month or you had to pay more. The service was decent while I was there and the access to ATMs and banks all around was nice. It was really easy and a friendly experience to set up an account, I liked the whole process and it was very easy to do with a short wait. Unfortunately it was just as easy for them to close my account, as soon as I lost my job and ran out of money in my account. They closed my account without notice as fast as it was opened. I now avoid banks all together and stick to Federal Credit Unions.

name: kathryn joyce
review: I've really enjoyed my Chase Savings Account. After coming from another bank I was not so fond of, Chase is a breath of fresh air. They send me alerts in real time. Literally, as soon as a transaction has been processed, while I'm still at the counter. I feel confident that I would be made aware if there was an issue with my account, such as unauthorized activity. My only complaint is that there is a fee if money is transferred from savings more than five times a month. I have two accounts and really like to cordon off certain amounts each month to be sure I have them for rent and other large expenditures. That seems to be the only fee that impacts me.

name: Andrew Kunkle
review: I've had a Chase account for a few years now, and I'm definitely happy with it, for the most part. I really like that there is overdraft protection, and that there are Chase branches on just about every corner of every major city. My only real issue is the extra fee that you have to pay at a non-Chase ATM. Most ATMs already charge you $2-4 to get your money out. Having Chase charge you an extra $2 just seems excessive.

name: Wes Kalata
review: I like that there is a max on late fees as well as a 21day grace period. I like that the intro rate on purchases is set at 0% for a 6month term, and that after that the regular rate is only 14.24, which is quite significantly lower than my current card with 22.9%. The Disney Rewards Visa Card has a fairly standard bonus program, though my current card has 1.5% back compared to Disney's 1%. But with the lower interest rate I would be more likely to earn a bonus, rather than just have the card in my wallet for emergencies. I'd be more likely to want to use the card for those big items I want but just can’t afford right now.

name: Erin Katsura
review: This Marriott Rewards card has a lot of perks. It has a lot of incentives to keep using it, and the more you do, the more you can get out of it. It really makes you feel like a valued card holder when you get little bonus points and rewards. Unlike other cards I have, the point system seems very clear and easy to understand, so you always know how much points you're earning and how much rewards you'll be getting. There are no unreasonable fees to this card, which is a definite perk. Overall a four out of five in my book.

name: Michael Meza
review: This is a great card. I have had this card for over 2 years and I have never had a problem with them. I love their cash back bonus! It is a great incentive to use the card. I use the card for everything-food, gas, etc. Whenever I have a problem with the card, I always call the customer service and they always help me out as best they can! I do not plan on switching cards anytime soon because I love this card.

name: Christopher Silano
review: The Chase Freedom card is a great credit card to have. It has a low 0%APR (Mine was for 15 months I think) and integrates easily on the Chase website with many of the other Chase financial products I use. I also was able to transfer the balance from another credit card to my new Chase Freedom and get 0% for 15 months.I have had a very positive experience with them and their customer service department and would recommend this card to my friends and family.

name: Max
review: Overall my experience with this bank has been good! I have only actually been inside the bank a handful of times, but each time I felt comfortable and calm in the environment, which is hard to come by with banks these days. The man who set up my checking account was very kind and helpful, his name was Ross I think. Other than that their services are great. I use the online banking a lot through my smartphone and cash checks through their ATM, which is really helpful. The only thing is, I heard starting in March, other people will not be able to put cash into your account, even if they have your account number. To me that is just absurd. Other than that, it's a good bank to be with.

name: Michael Meza
review: This bank is awesome. I have had many overdraft fees, and every time I call Chase customer support, they always take back the over draft fees. I love their customer service. They have really helped me out. I would definitely recommend this bank to anyone! I have had a checking account with them for 6 years.

name: Todd Poole
review: I've been using the Ink Cash card from Chase for the last 2 years. The first year was great with 0% interest and the regular rate of 13.24% is very good compared to most cards. We use it for everyday purchases with our business and that usually works out to 25-40 purchases a month. This has been a good card for me so far with no problems at all.

name: John S Dunning
review: Overall I rate this card as fair. I am really impressed with the start up bonuses. I don't care for the $95 annual fee, that is high to me. The interest rate is ok though, it is in line with other cards. The point system on this card I am most impressed with. For every $1 that you spend, you receive 1.25 points. If you use this card often, then the points will pile up, compared to other cards. All in all, this card is just fair.

name: Lakeisha Morrison
review: The Hyatt Credit Card has some perks. I like how you can receive 2 free nights after spending $1,000 within the first 3 months. You can also earn 1 point for every $1 you spend. I like the fact that it has no annual fee for the first year and is only $75 after that. The only thing that I don’t like is the fact that the regular rate is 15.24% that is pretty high for a Credit Card. I believe if you know how to use a credit card and not go overboard then you would be ok with this card. If not then it is not for you at all. Even though it is a credit card it is mainly for hotels.

name: Ginny Switt
review: The Chase Freedom card offers reliability no matter where you are. Its 0% APR for the first 15 months and no annual fee are great incentives, unlike Capital One which applies the APR with the first purchase and charges an annual fee (after the first year). The card only has a 21 day grace period, which doesn't give you much time to pay it off.

name: Brianna Byrne
review: I've always appreciated credit cards that give rewards, and the Marriott Rewards Card seems like one of the most beneficial of these cards, especially for people who travel frequently. The 30,000 points and free hotel stays alone seem enough to sign up for this card, especially if you're planning a large purchase. Not only that, but the card offers cash back for other purchases, too. For me, I'd probably still prefer my Chase-Amazon card because I don't travel a lot and make frequent purchases online. However, if you do travel a lot, then this card is potentially more appealing because of the large amount of money you can save on hotel stays. I should also mention that, like my rewards card, the fees and APR are quite high, so having this card takes a fair amount of financial responsibility. You have to time signing up at the right point, so you can take advantage of the 30,000 points, and you have to make sure you pay off your balance every month if you want to avoid that massive APR. If you can stay on top of it, though, this card seems like a great tool for the frequent traveler.

name: Joe Valdez
review: I finally decided to leave my old bank, Flagstar, and decided to try Chase Total Checking. I was not disappointed at all by it. I learned that you get points for making purchases and that they add up eventually and you can get rewards. I would definitely recommend Chase Total Checking.

name: Tyler Sharp
review: I switched to Chase from Key Bank as I wanted an account that wouldn't nickle and dime me on every little thing. There is a fee with the Chase account IF you don't have a $500 direct deposit, but since I do it's not a problem. I love the website interface, love that there aren't a ton of random fees, and I love the customer service they provide. I've been with them a few months and have been very happy with everything!

name: Jim Louie
review: I really enjoy having this United card because I frequently have to check bags. On one occasion, I was taking my girlfriend on a trip to see her parents and decided to use my United club passes. She really enjoyed the United club and I felt great because this is something that was free with the card. The benefits of this card, as a frequent United flyer, are great and I highly recommend this card, or the other versions for more frequent flyers.

name: tomeka
review: The Chase Freedom credit card offers reliability no matter where you are. Its 0% APR for the first 15 months and no annual fee are great incentives, unlike Capital One which applies  the APR with the first purchase and charges an annual fee (after the first year). The card only has a 21 day grace period, which doesn't give you much time to pay it off.

name: Brian
review: I have used both the Amazon credit card as well as a Visa card from M and T bank. I will say that I prefer the Amazon card over the M and T card. The initial $30 bonus is a nice way to get started. The reward points rack up quickly, everyone takes Visa, but the only downside of the card is that the interest rate is high. I would recommend using this card, just make sure your balance off quickly.

name: Sarah
review: I got my MileagePlus card to use for a big travel purchase – plane tickets out of the country for myself and 3 of my friends. That initial purchase qualified me for 30,000 bonus miles and over 5,000 miles for my ticket purchase since it was also through United. This was enough to get an additional round trip flight for free, from this purchase alone. I have considered dropping the card after the first year so that I don’t have to pay the annual fee starting in August. I may reconsider, so long as I am still a frequent traveler. The first bag free policy has been wonderful. I could pack more into my carry-ons perhaps, but with this card I don’t have to stress about it. I’m traveling internationally, so the lack of international service charges has also been great. I keep a low balance on this card so I always have a buffer to use for deposits on rental cards. Watch out for the late fees and possible interest rate hikes, as with any credit card, but I haven’t had to deal with any of that so far.

name: Jenny Tull
review: I recently opened a college account with chase after switching from BoA.  The account provides everything I need and has no fees!  The no fees was the number 1 reason for switching.  I did not get any rewards for opening, but I did get 10 free checks.  The debit card provided should more than handle all of my needs.  I really also appreciate the check deposit from my phone.  Overall great account and no fees!  The ATMS are right near campus and you can do all your banking needs there.  It took about 10 minutes to open my account and my concerns were all handled perfectly.

name: Jenny Tull
review: I switched from BoA to chase in order to combat the constant fees from BoA.  So far Chase has yet to charge me any fees, which is great!  The customer service is average, nothing special, but still decent.  I did not get any rewards for switching, I just opened the account with a minimum deposit of $100 and no minimum amount (as long as it is over $0.01).  Overall I am pleased with my decision to switch from BoA to Chase and recommend it to anyone looking for another bank.

name: Russell Slocum
review: My account, like many other respondents, is a result of the great WaMu failure of 2008. My Chase checking account is essentially a bare bones checking account. The only reason to open an account at Chase is the smiling faces and convenient access to bank locations and ATMs. One giant qualm I have with any bank that charges a maintenance fee, including Chase, is that in essence they are using customer money as an interest free loan and they charge you a fee to use your money. On the plus side, in-bank notary services are free. One really great thing I like about Chase is the full service ATMs that you can make deposits at; I don't think I have physically been in one of their banks in over a year.  One final note, Chase has many questionable market and investment practices that will likely affect fee schedules in the future.

name: Minsoo Lee
review: I got the Chase college checking account few months before college began. I was leaning toward Bank of America at the time but I believe I made the right choice. This checking account is nothing special. It's an ordinary checking account. However, I never had any kind of problem with it and its two-step verification is very reassuring. I think it's a safe and convenient account with no fees (which was why I chose it in the first place) and would highly recommend it. My only problem was its lack of branches in states such as New Mexico. Although I left NM long time ago, I had to make a check out every single time to use my smartphone to deposit money just so I didn't have to pay any extra ATM fees.

name: Anthony Li
review: I have been using the chase freedom for about 4 months and it has been great. I got a 200 dollar bonus cash back for spending 500 dollars on my first 3 months. Every 3 months there are great deals for 5 percent cash back ranging from Starbucks, Amazon, and gas stations. There is no annual fee and also no APR for the first one and a half year. The only downside is that the categories for the cash back change every 3 months. Overall I recommend this to anyone that is looking to start a new credit card.

name: Mary Jones Anderson
review: This has been my favorite card in terms of customer service.  They've always been wonderful when dealing with address changes or lost cards.  They've also been great about reporting unusual activity with the card.  They prevented the entire available credit from being rung up on purchases in Mexico (where I definitely wasn't!).

name: Alex Wong
review: I use the Chase Freedom for about two years now. I found that the card is very useful for receiving high yield cash back when buying items that you normally use. One of the good things to have with this card is there are no annual fees. Also, they have a recurring 5% cash back problem which yields cash back on multiple categories but it changes every quarter and you have to remember to reapply each quarter. Otherwise, the customer service is top notch and I would definitely recommend it to people who are looking for a good entry option into the world of credit.

name: Kar Chong
review: If you use your credit card for convenience and/or to track business expenses and then pay off the balance every month then you  might want to take a closer look at the Ink Bold Business Card by Chase.  It comes with a wealth of features including no annual fee for the first year.  You earn extra points if you pay for supplies and services that most businesses use like the internet, office supplies  and cell phone.  Compared to a Capital One card that I have seen this has more points so you can accumulate them faster.

name: Mark Willis
review: A great card with a great Rewards program; 40,000 points to start and double points on travel and dining is wonderful. While the $95 annual fee is steep compared to the Capital One Venture,  AmEx Blue Cash and others, you can easily make up for it--and some--through usage.

name: Steven Anderson
review: I personally prefer my Bank of America Cash Back card to this card, even though BoA can sometimes be a hassle. This card really needs some sort of incentive to get customers interested in using it, such as cash back, gift cards to specific store/restaurants, etc. I also do not care for the look of the card. I much prefer the regular landscape card as opposed to the vertical card this one uses. Although, I do enjoy the metallic feel this card has, it is very unique.

name: Iam Notacola
review: I've had this card for 10 months currently and it's the only one I have or will need in the short term. I'm new to the credit card scene and wanted to use a well-known name to get acquainted and build my credit rating. This Chase card has offered me no problems. So far, Chase has good customer service and protects me with any purchases they feel may be criminal, which I made on my own. It shows that Chase cares and that's great. It surprises how they respond so fast, I wasn’t put on hold and it took no time at all. I would recommend this card to everyone, beginner or experienced credit card user.

name: Ray Josephson
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card offers more back to its users than any card on the market.  I was a long time card holder of Capital One, however their customer service and lack of appreciation towards me as a valued customer left me looking for more.  The Chase Sapphire card let's you know immediately that you are appreciated, through their offer of 40,000 bonus points earned on $3,000 earned in the first 90 days.  Who couldn't use $500.00 extra?

name: Jake Frischknecht
review: I am absolutely in love with my Chase Slate card.  This card is amazing, I just use it and pay it off each and every month.  Here is a list of positives about it; easy management online with paying your credit card off each month.  Friendly customer service each time I call.  Another reason i really like this card, is that if i ever have a problem I can just travel to my neighborhood Chase branch and get my questions answered and taken care of.  There are however some disadvantages to this card.  As mentioned previously it does not offer any rewards incentives that many other Chase cards offer nowadays.  Also in my personal opinion the interest rate applied on this card is a bit high compared to other cards offered from different competitors.

name: Jake Frischknecht
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card, is an acceptably well card for the average american.  This card is more praiseworthy than the typical American Express Card.  Some features of this card that I personally like are the: free cancellation and also the free customer service.  However the reason this card did not get 5 stars is because of the $4.95 monthly fee that is charged.

name: Justin Endsley
review: The Chase Sapphire card offers some great incentives for individuals who travel or dine out a lot. The points reward program associated with this card provides great value in comparison to Capital One credit cards. In addition, it has no annual fee. However, the interest rate is a tad high, and there is a 3% balance transfer fee. Capital One gives you an initial 6 month 0% fee on balance transfers. Overall, the Chase Sapphire card looks like a good investment.

name: Alex Henderson
review: I've had a Chase checking account for several years now, and I have never had any problems with it.  They've always been quick to text, email or call me if there was a problem--particularly in light of the recent Target data breach.  I also like that I can deposit checks using their mobile app, just by taking a picture with my smartphone.

name: Kierra Mosby
review: This Chase Freedom Cash Back Credit Card is the best I've come across. The best thing about this card is the endless earnings potentials. You purchase however much you want and still receive 1% cash reimbursement on the purchases. Besides the $100 bonus cash isn't too shabby. The only downside is that occasionally you may have to re-register for the bonus cash to get rewards. A really simple card to use.

name: Sandra Dragon
review: I have had a savings account with Chase for several years.  Although Chase doesn't have branches in my state, I use my account when I travel to New York (on business) or Florida (for vacation) where Chase does have branches.  I have been very pleased with Chase's service.  Everyone is so friendly and eager to help.  I only wish they would open some branches in Rhode Island where I spend most of my time.

name: Brian Oxenreider
review: Anyone that gets a government direct deposit and doesn't want to deal with the US Direct Express card the government signs you up with, should check out this card. Low monthly fees, and keeping the government a bit more out of your business are both great attributes of this card. In this day and age, it's so much easier to have a card that will allow you to buy and pay online. This one is recommended.

name: Collin Sullivan
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred card is my favorite credit card to date.  You can earn 1% cash back and up to 2% on certain items. When it comes to cashing in your rewards points, there are many different options offered. You can receive cash back and use it towards your monthly statement, you can use it to earn / buy travel points, and they offer special discounts on many other things to use your rewards points against. I would say the only set back is the annual fee which is about $90.00. Depending on how much you spend and get back this might not be that big of a deal for you, but it is rather steep for some people.  Overall I think the card is worth it for the rewards given. The customer service is great also, I've never not had an issue resolved almost immediately after calling them.

name: Rob Faber
review: I am mostly happy with this card. I signed up for the Amazon Rewards Visa card because as other reviewers have pointed out, I received a $30 credit towards Amazon purchases and you also get 3 points for every dollar spent on Amazon. Besides buying things on Amazon, I use this card mainly for gasoline purchases since they qualify for 2 points per dollar. Both of these things are great and, when paid in full every month, it made perfect sense. It's got the added bonus of no annual fee, so that's spectacular as well.The only problem I really have with the card is the interest rate. The lowest rate of 14% seems a little high in my opinion, assuming that rate is reserved for those with good to excellent credit. Despite this, overall I am very happy with my decision to get this card. Well worth it.

name: Michelle Fields
review: This looks like a pretty good card overall, with generous terms as far as the initial bonus and first additional bonus are concerned. the British Airways Visa Signature Card has an interest rate in-line with some of the more reasonable mileage cards, and unlike some, doesn't hit you with an annual fee. It's kind of a bummer that it doesn't offer you any 0% or lowered introductory rate, but since not everyone has balances to transfer, it's probably nicer for most people that the intro bonuses seem to make up for this. The cash advance rate and fee are steep, but that's pretty standard across all cards these days. The $30,000 minimum to earn an extra Travel Together Ticket is a nice touch, but most folks would probably have to use this as their exclusive card in order to reach that level of spending in a year.

name: Billy Maney
review: The Hyatt Credit Card is a very good card for someone with good credit that knows how to use credit cards wisely.It has a lot of the same qualities as the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card in that the interest rate is about the same and the annual fee is waived the first year.The only downfall is that the Hyatt card is mainly a hotel card and the annual fee later on can get expensive.

name: Peter Crisafi
review: Terrible Customer AppreciationWhen i tried to book a trip with reward miles for my partner and I they would not put us on the same plane even though the plan was barely booked.  They stink and as far as I'm concerned their mile program is a scam.  When i called Chase they would not help me.  I cancelled my cards with Chase

name: Alex Eagle
review: Before using Chase Freedom Credit Card, I was using a credit card that was offered by PNC bank. I switched over to Chase after I heard about their no earning limitations and 1% reimbursement on all purchases. An obvious benefit to this card is the $100 dollar cash-back after 3 months and $500 in purchases. APR rates are also much more competitive than my prior card, and that was the selling point for me. I encourage others to look into Chase's Freedom Credit Card.

name: Lucy Morgan
review: I like the Amazon credit card because it allows me to earn points for Amazon merchandise on every purchase I make, on and off their site. Often this is the deciding factor in which credit card I pull out of my wallet. Amazon.com simply has so much merchandise that I can't get locally, that I just look forward to using my points from the card. I think they could do better with their interest rates, but it basically has an APR range similar to those of other retail stores, like my Macy's card.

name: Jeff Chen
review: I have been a big fan of Chase bank for the longest time. I had my first credit card with them since college. Since then I have been very satisfied with their service etc. The benefits of having a Chase Sapphire Card are that there is no annual fee for the first year, and no foreign fee whatsoever. In addition, they have a reward program that allows the owner to save up points and use them on other purchases. Definitely I would recommend it to my friends and family.

name: John S Dunning
review: I really like my Chase Sapphire Preferred Card. I use it on almost every purchase. That way I get the most out of the reward points. The first year has no annual fee, after that it is $95.00 per year. The interest rate that they offer on this card is also more than a fair rate. Customer service is also great to deal with. I have had this card for 2 years now and have no complaints.

name: Katie Christianson
review: I signed up for the Amazon credit card over the holidays when I was doing my Christmas shopping. They advertise the “$30 off your order” at check out so I thought I would sign up and save some money.  I don’t shop a ton on Amazon so the extra points I can earn and redeem there isn’t too appealing to me.  But if you are a regular shopper, it could save you some money. The interest rates are standard. In the end I decided to cancel this card after I got the bonus. Overall though I would say this card is good.

name: Jessica Michelle
review: I have had the Chase Freedom card for a while and it is my favorite card of the MANY credit cards that I have had. Many promise that you will earn "rewards" and yet somehow, no matter how much you spend, you never acrue anything. With the Chase Freedom Card, however, the more I spend the more points/rewards I auctually earn. Every month there are different categories to earn an extra 5% back and you can chose how you would like to be rewarded. For me, that means all of my earnings are seamlessly transferred to my Amazon account and go towards the very purchases I make with my Chase Freedom Card! It's really a great program and I am happy to say that it is now the primary card that I use.

name: Dennis Sanders
review: I have had the chase freedom card for a little over a year now and I absolutely love this card. I had an issue where I was charged for something that I had not purchased and they took care of it in no time. I was very happy with how they cared about my situation and solved the problem. I would highly recommend this card to anyone who needs a credit card.

name: Shane Eye
review: Hi, I love Disney so I had to try the Disney Rewards Visa Credit Card! The intro rate of 0% is great, unlike my bank credit card MasterCard, which was much higher. I use it where i can and enjoy the benefits. It's hard to beat the $50 bonus. If you get this card check out the Disney store rates!

name: Amy Eldridge
review: I love how right away when you sign up and are approved for your Amazon Credit card, you're given a $30 amazon.com gift card! I do a lot of shopping on amazon.com because I can get great deals and right off the bat that gift card comes in handy! It's great that you can use this card on some every day purchases and still earn points. But meanwhile, use it on amazon.com and you always earn points - score! The interest rates are, of course, a bit high, which I don't like. But the rewards (spending less at amazon.com!) makes having the card worth it.

name: Angie aluminua
review: The Ink Bold Business Card by Chase is a good card if you are the type of person that pays off your balance in full each month and wants to earn travel reward points. However, the card does come with a yearly fee and the travel reward points promotion is only applied if you spend $5000 within the first three months. I have personally used the Capital One Spark select for business and I find the terms on this card to be more reasonable. However I may consider trying the Ink Bold Business card in the future.

name: Shelly Smith
review: I have been banking at Chase for over 5 years now, and I absolutely love it there. Chase was the first bank that I ever opened an account in, and I have never had any inclination to leave them. The fact that I still have free checking is a blessing in itself; but honestly that's not why I'm still with Chase. I'm still with Chase because they care about their customers. I've had my Credit Card number stolen, and they were able to close the card, replace the funds, and issue me a new card within 30 minutes. They also periodically called to make sure everything was still alright. It's the little touches like that, that turn customers into life long customers. I highly recommend that anybody who is looking for a checking account heads over to their local Chase branch and open one today.

name: Andrew Kunkle
review: I've used Chase bank for the past roughly 5 years or so. It was the first account that I had outside of my parents, and they were extremely helpful in walking me through the process and all the paperwork and any fees associated with the account. Since then, I've used my Chase account exclusively, and have never had any problem what so ever. Their customer service is top notch and without fail has helped me in a manner that was quicker and easier than I anticipated. I would strongly recommend Chase to anyone looking for a new bank.

name: Nelly Mendoza
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Credit Card has been quite amazing to use.  From no annual fee for the first year to a low $95 fee yearly after this credit card is great to use for many reasons.  I get a huge amount of bonus points when making major purchases like pricey electronics/home appliances.  The Chase Ultimate Rewards also make this card extremely rewarding to use on most major purchases.  Also with 15.99% interest rate this card stands out from the others with much higher interest rates.

name: David
review: I love my Chase Amazon Visa card.  The rewards are great for me.  I get 3% back on all Amazon purchases, 2% on a select few other categories, and 1% back on all other purchases.  I do lots of shopping on Amazon, including all of my christmas gifts!  If you don't do lots of online shopping on Amazon, there are better cards out there, but for me, it is perfect!

name: Ramy Eskander
review: I have been using Chase 1 year CD savings account for eight months. The account does not require any fees or credit history. The thing I like most about this account is the organized web interface it has. It is always easy to deposit and withdraw money online. It is also easy to monitor the transactions anytime. I never experienced any problems in the online system. Additionally, the customer service is available 24 hours every day. The representatives are well trained and very helpful. One disadvantage is the low interest rate (0.1%), but this is the case for most US saving accounts. I am totally satisfied with Chase 1 year CD account and highly recommend it.

name: John
review: I've had this card for a decent amount of time and I have nothing to complain about except having to register for the "bonus" cash back every so often.  They are a great company from what I have experienced, missed a payment (I just forgot) and asked about getting rid of a late fee.  They took it off no problem.  I like it for the rewards definitely.

name: dana dunn
review: The Marriott Rewards Credit Card is an okay card. The best thing I like is the bonus of the 30,000 points after you spend $1000 in first 3 months. It is ideal for people who like to travel. The thing I do not like is the max late fee of $35.00. I really think it is a large amount to pay but if you plan on making on time payments, it is not really bad. All in all, this card works for people who like to travel and earn rewards.

name: Cameron Murrieta
review: What I like about this card is the relatively low fees that one needs to pay. The $0 intro rate and the regular rate of 14.14% are relatively superior to other cards.
