On top of that, if you are an avid Disney Land enthusiast, you receive extraordinary discounts. Discounts off of purchases at Disney Land stores, free special treatments, and other perks that make this card fantastic. A couple of things that I am not too fond about are the APR and cash advance fees which are a bit higher than other cards, but other than that, this card is fantastic. I can compare this card most to my VentureOne Rewards card, but I feel like this Disney card is far better and specific to Disney Land which is great!

name: Aryan Jabbari
review: The Chase Freedom card is simply the best card for earning points and rewards.  They have rotating categories that earn 5% cash back (and more if you redeem for travel) in different categories.  For example, from October through December 2013, I earned 5% cash back for expenditures on Amazon and different department stores while in January until March of 2014, I will earn 5% cash back at restaurants, gas stations, and Starbucks stores.  The points are easy to use and can easily be credited to one's account.  I really recommend the Chase Freedom!

name: Jeanette Braxton
review: I upgraded to Marriott Rewards Premier Credit Card in December 2012 because it had a micro chip.  I traveled to Israel in January 2013, and I wanted to have a credit card with a micro chip.  However, I was charged $85 Annual Fee the first year which should have been waived.                                                                                                               In addition, in December 2013, I received a Marriott Rewards "Celebrate A Rewarding Year with your Anniversary Free Night".  I telephoned Chase Bank and Marriott Rewards (800) 321-7396 for my Free Night e-Certificate in my Marriott Rewards Account.  I told Marriott Rewards' Reservation Specialist that I would like to use my Free Night e-Certificate.  I was told that I don't have a Free Night e-Certificate in my Marriott Rewards, and I won't get a Free Night e-certificate for my Anniversary Free Night in my Marriott Rewards.                                                                                                                Marriott Rewards is false advertising Free Night e-Certificate for Marriott Rewards Premier Credit Card Members.   1 star

name: Laura Kennedy
review: I also received a Marriott Rewards Premier card this year and missed the fine print that stated in very small text that I would be slapped with an annual fee and pay interest on top of it.  I have to pay and there's no way around it.  I didn't find out I couldn't even use my certificate until I tried to check into my local Marriott last week.  I feel like I've been cheated.

name: David Sanders
review: Honestly I don't like Chase in general so I'm not a big fan of their credit card products, with the exception of the Amazon.com card, Slate is no different. There isn't really any special reason to choose this card over any other and the fact that Chase is poor at customer service makes it worth avoiding. Honestly the only thing about it that I ever liked while I was using it was the design of the card itself which I thought was pretty unique and attention grabbing. Rates, fees and other features are pretty much standard, and the other big downside is that it offers nothing in return for using it. Why would anyone choose a non-rewards earning card these days?

name: Chip Song
review: After considering it for a long time, I got the Chase Sapphire card and I have to admit, it has been one of the most versatile and efficient credit cards around.  This card is perfect for people who tend to travel as you can earn points that can be allocated towards travel fares.  There is NO annual fee for this card and you can EARN POINTS.  That alone makes  this card worth it.  The APR is standard: not too high but not that low.  Overall, this is a fantastic card and this will be in my wallet for the coming days.

name: Jeff Chen
review: I have been using the Chase Freedom card for the past few years. I was a college student when i applied for my first credit card. As a result, i really wanted to find the one that fitted me the most. And i did! Choosing Chase Freedom is probably the best choice i made in my life!!!

name: Amy
review: I've had the Chase Freedom Card for a long time now. I really like the cash back, and I even get gift cards sometimes. There's also no annual fee, and even though my credit isn't perfect, they still gave me a fairly low APR. It's one of the only cards I've held onto for years, and I'll definitely be keeping it for many more.

name: Tony Sobacki
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is one of the best rewards cards on the market today.  You instantly get bonus points upon signing up, and the double points for eating out and traveling are really appealing, much more so than any other rewards cards I currently own.  I also like that there's no limit on the amount of points you can earn or redeem; other reward cards I currently have enforce annoying limitations that almost make the reward function of the card pointless.  The only downside of the card is the annual fee, but you don't have to pay it for the first year so that's nice.  Overall just a great card for earning bonuses and Chase has a great website and customer service so any issues with the card or the account are resolved quickly.

name: Rob Doe
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card is a wonderful card for anyone that can't get a bank account or just doesn't want a bank account but needs access to a card. You can pay your bills with this online and also order things online with it. You can use it just like a regular credit card or debit card it's great. There are no fees for transactions which other cards will have a lot of times. The only time you might get a fee is at a non-chase accepting ATM but that's how it is with any card. There is no fee for inactivity or cancellation which a lot of cards don't have either. It's a low risk card that if you don't like it, just cancel it, it's very easy to try. There is a low monthly fee but it's not a big deal you get charged more than that from actual bank accounts. This is a great starter card for anyone too young to get a checking account or someone that's just messed up their bank history, or maybe you just don't completely trust the bank with your money.

name: Dallas Hawkins
review: The Slate from Chase credit card is a mediocre credit card at best. There are no incentives to get the card in the first place, except for the 0% APR introductory offer. There are no rewards or cash back offered with this card, and the standard APR on this card is about average, from about 13 to 23 percent. The great things about this card are the no annual fee, and that it is backed by Chase bank. Also, the 0% APR offer lasts for the first 15 months, whereas a lot of other credit cards only have the introductory offer for 12 months. All in all, the Chase card is mediocre unless you want a card to take advantage of the no interest introductory offer, or don't have the option to get a rewards card based on your credit.

name: Rafael Maldonado
review: The Amazon store credit card is one of my favorite store cards. I shop on Amazon at least once every week and I gain a lot of points. You can use these reward points to give yourself discounts on Amazon purchases, which is really great!

name: Denis Vegas
review: I automatically became a chase customer ever since they acquired Washington Mutual. My account at WaMu became a Chase Total Checking account with no problem at all. The best part about being a chase customer is that there is literally a branch at every corner. Not to mention the fact that I could  even find a chase ATM just by walking around with my eyes closed. There is no annual fee as long as you have the minimum amount of money in your checking account so I see no reason why someone would not bank at Chase. Overall, I love the availability of my account and the fact that i don't have to pay for that privilege.

name: ryan muir
review: I have several different checking accounts, but I have been with Chase the longest. Convenience was one of the biggest reasons I chose Chase. There are at least 4 branches within a 20 mile radius of my home. Another deciding factor was the atm fee if not a chase atm. 2 dollars is a low fee for any bank. I also happen to overdraw my account frequently which can be a problem. The fee is average as far as that is concerned. I am also content with the monthly fees if my balance goes below the minimum. All in all, I have to say I am rather pleased with my checking account.

name: Nicole Bedard
review: I have had this card for years and love it. There are many great perks with every purchase that  you make with the card, including a 5% back on various types of stores, which makes it a great value. This is another great card to have for the holidays! The best part about this card is the $200 cash back reward and the gift cards that come from time to time when using the card. The bonuses are great, the APR is low considering how high many others are, and the late payment fees are not that bad if you happen to miss a payment. This is a credit card that is quite forgiving and I have always had positive experiences when contacting their customer support call center. The only thing that I dislike is having to enroll yourself in various programs, such as the cash back program.

name: Lindsay Whitehead King
review: The Chase Sapphire Card requires excellent credit so it's not for everyone, it offerssome good rewards.  If you spend $500 in the first 3 months, you get $100towards travel; which is great if you travel a lot.  I wish they offered an introrate of some kind, even 6 months would be nice.  The standard apr isn't the lowestI've ever seen, but it's not the worst either.  All in all, this card is idealfor someone who may travel a lot for work (or pleasure) and can take advantageof the travel rewards.

name: Doug Miller
review: In evaluating the Amazon.com Credit Card, the first thing I wanted to see was how useful the rewards would actually be. So many cards seem like they have a good rewards plan but when it comes time to use or redeem them. I use Amazon for a lot of my online purchasing, so this seemed like a good choice for a rewards card. The ability to reduce the price of your purchase makes the points very valuable to me. The interest rate isn’t that strong compared to some of the other cards, but the usefulness of the rewards outweighs this.

name: Lydia Whitehorn
review: I love my Chase Sapphire Preferred Card. It has lots of benefits and perks, which is why I use it more than any other credit card.  The rewards program with this card is awesome! After you open your account and spend $3000, you will earn 40,000 bonus points immediately. I do quite a bit of traveling and this credit card gives me double points on travel and restaurants. I also get 20% off on airfare,car rentals, and hotel stays. There's no foreign transaction fee with this card, so it's great to use it when you travel outside of the United States. The annual fee is kind of on the high side, at $95, which is the only reason I didn't give it five stars... but the earned rewards more than make up for that. I'd recommend this card to anyone!

name: Lindsay Whitehead King
review: The Ink Bold Business Card by Chase may not be the ideal card for everyone, becausethey require you to pay off the full balance every month, but for people who don't normally carry a balance, it's perfect.  The annual fee is fairly low and you earnreward points on every day purchases.  This card is a great way to make your money work for you.  I highly recommend this card!

name: Kitty Galore
review: I really like my Chase Freedom card for the 1% cash back on all purchases, and 5% back on rotating categories of stores. For example, From October to December I get 5% from department stores and Amazon - perfect for holiday shopping. You have to manually enroll yourself in the cash back every three months, so I'm subtracting a star.

name: Karen
review: I've had the Chase Freedom Card for many years. Like my other cards, such as American Express and Chase Sapphire, it offers perks with every purchase. What I like best though is the $200 cash back and the occasional gift cards I get by using this card. I also love the 5% cash back on purchases. This makes me feel like I'm spending less money on interest when I pay with credit. My APR is on the low side at about 13%, and there is no annual fee, which makes this a good card to use if I have to carry a balance.

name: Karen
review: I like my Chase Sapphire Card because I earn points for travel, which I do often and hotels and airfare can get quite expensive. The card has no annual fees and an APR on the low side, so I use it when I'm low on cash and have to carry a balance. I don't mind because the points make up for that. Also, when I rent a car, it's nice to know that Chase will intervene if there is a problem with damages or any other disputed issues and try to resolve it for me.

name: jason buonomo
review: If you like to shop on Amazon.com, this card is an absolute winner!   Overall, a very generous rewards program that can be applied to Amazon.com purchases, especially with the 3X Amazon points and the 30 dollar gift card starter.   Plus, the interest rate for the card is competitive or lower than most of the department store cards that I have seen.  If you like Amazon.com, this is the card you should be using.

name: Brian Thomas
review: I'm somewhat indifferent to Chase bank. Before I opened my savings account with them, I had heard decent things about them from a friend of mine who uses them. Their application process was fairly simple and painless. I've been with them for a little over a year now and I've had a couple of minor issues and one major issue. All of the minor issues were resolved pretty quickly, however, the major issue is still pending and it's become more and more difficult to deal with every single day. I have all the confidence in the world that the issue will be resolved, but for now it's frustrating. The customer service isn't bad, it's just that the disclosures aren't as clear as I'd like them to be.

name: Jeremy
review: I have had a Chase savings account now for about one year, and have no problems with it even though it does require a minimum balance. I received a nice two hundred dollar reward for opening the account, and transferred some money from my checking account to my savings account. It earns very little interest, and only pennies on the dollar each month when the interest is applied to my account. I like how I can use a Chase mobile app on my smartphone to make deposits in the form of checks into the account, which allows me to quickly build the savings account. Overall, I would recommend the account to friends.

name: Mikhail Ioffe
review: Today I looked at my online savings statement and saw 2 $12 charges for too many withdrawals from my savings. I had no idea that I had a limit on transferring money from savings to checking. Times are really tight right now and I'm holding on to every penny, so when I saw those 2 $12 charges I immediately called Chase customer service to find out what this mockery was all about. First person, they give you the same old speech. I asked to talk to someone who could get these charges reversed, I was transferred to a woman to said that the charges were valid and that there was "no way" they could be reversed. I told her that was ridiculous, and I told her that there is a Chase bank down the street and if I had to go into that branch and curse out every senior person there, I would do it. I told her to give me to someone above her and then I informed her that her customer service was really "shady". The third person I got was really nice and understanding and listened to me when I said all I needed was for one of those previous two flunkies to explain to me how can I avoid this in the future and send me a copy of the disclosure. She was EXCELLENT and not only helped me, didn't scold or look down on me. When I asked if one charge could be reversed (because I understood getting slapped on the wrist once) she said she would reverse both charges. I breathed a sigh of relief as I have absolutely no breathing room in my budget this month and she is the only reason I didn't start shopping around for a new bank.

name: Rob Taylor
review: I've had this card for years and can say that I truly love it. It has everything I've wanted in a credit card and I've utilized almost all of the benefits of having it. The bonuses are crazy good! The initial interest rate that I was given was excellent, given at the time I was a full-time student with little but decent credit. Also, the no annual fee is something that is rarely given with a card of this nature. It's definitely one that I will continue to have and use in years to come and would recommend it to anyone looking for reliability and freedom in a credit card.

name: David Marcillo
review: You have to pay your balance in full each month, and starting in year two you have to add a $95 annual fee. That's it though. Those are the only bad things about the Ink Bold Business Card. The rewards are phenomenal, and the fees are more than fair. No foreign transaction fee is one of those benefits that you don't appreciate it until you use a card that doesn't have it. This simple lack of a fee can save some business travelers hundreds of dollars a year. So, if you're okay with a card that you have to pay off in full at the end of the month and you can work in an annual fee of nearly a hundred dollars starting in year two, then this could be the card you've been looking for. Such great rewards, take advantage of them!

name: Thomas Burke
review: The Chase Ink Bold Business Card is for big spenders, basically they're trying to have a similar product to the higher end Amex cards, since the balance has to be paid in full. The thing I'd check on a card like this is what can you redeem the points for, but also do some math on the cash value of the points. I used to have a card similar to this, and in a six month period I just racked up $90 (in cash value) worth of points. With the Amex one card I put the same amount through and got $550 in actual cash back. I'd do a check on the point system, if you can qualify for this you can certainly qualify for anything else, so compare.

name: Chelsea Marie
review: The Chase Sapphire Credit Card is a great card to have. I have been a member of this card for quite some time now and have never been disappointed. In comparison to the Capital One Credit Card, the Chase Sapphire Card offers an excellent rewards system. If you have really good credit this card is the perfect one for you. I would recommend the Chase Sapphire Card to all my friends and family.

name: Frank Oz
review: This is one of the best reward cards out there. The initial bonus of 30,000 PLUS a two night free stay after you spend $1,000 cannot be beat. On top of that the fact that you can earn 3 points per a dollar spent makes this card great in my eyes.

name: Ivan
review: I have a checking account with Chase and this account is the best. It only cost me a minimum of 25 dollars to open it. It was really easy to open my account and so far I haven't had any problems with it. Using Chase Online Banking is also easy to use, I can log on and check my account when ever I want , I can also deposit checks to my account using the Chase app on my phone , I don't even have to go to bank. Using the ATM's is also cool , there is one by my house so it is very convenient.

name: Hart Epps
review: I've been a customer with Chase since they bought out Washington Mutual, where my account was before (oh how I miss Wamu). The most convenient thing about Chase is that they have so many locations and its difficult to find yourself in any non-rural area without a Chase nearby. Also, they are consistent and you can rest assured that there won't be any funny business with your accounts. With that being said, I have been spoiled by my credit union and have been thinking about canceling my Chase account on and off for awhile now, I just haven't yet because of direct deposit and auto bill-pay. The fees with the major banks (especially Chase and BofA are just getting out of hand. I mean, $34 for an overdraft???? Why? It's such a slap in the face to get charged these fees when something happens which is out of your control. Of course they may or may not reverse the fee ONCE, but you had better not do it again or there's no chance. The ATM fees are such a nuisance, many credit unions and smaller banks will never charge you any ATM fees and will even reimburse fees charged by other banks (how cool is that?) Don't expect that kind of caring from Chase, they have no interest in making the little guy happy, they are in it for profit, pure and simple. Not that that's necessarily a bad thing, there are just too many better options out there.

name: Xavier Sosa
review: One of the great things about owning The British Airways Visa Signature Card is the initial bonus you get for signing up for the card. Most travel credit cards do offer an initial bonus of milage, but the British Airways Visa will give you more bonus milage after an initial purchase. They also offer a high miles per dollar credit, which comes in handy if you are a traveler. The annual fee may be a little high, but with the bonuses and milage that you earn it can be overlooked. The 15% interest rate is a little steep, but the pros does outweigh the cons. The British Airways Visa does give the customer many advantages that can be used for traveling, or just basic everyday charges.

name: Denis Vegas
review: I signed up for the Hyatt Credit card only to get an extra 2 free nights while I was on vacation a couple of years ago. It wasn't hard spending the $1000 needed to get the free nights since I was already on vacation. Ordering room service and spa services added up and the best part about it was that I get 3 reward points back on every dollar. I was surprised at how much points I built up by the end of the vacation. I now make it a point to only stay at Hyatt hotels now because of all the points I saved up.

name: Lorenzo Alipio
review: I applied for a car loan 12 months ago, and I am so glad chase approved me for a loan. Chase have a very clear disclosures on my loan. The loan officer explained the important things that I should be aware before signing the loan documents. I have been with other banks in the past, but none of the loan officers took their time explaining about the rates and how I can save on interest fees by adding extra payments on my principal.What I like about my auto loan with Chase Bank is the low interest rate on my loan and the online account management. I can also make my payments online, schedule payments for my loan without worrying about sending it through mail. Chase is also an environmental friendly bank. They offer a paperless billing for anyone who are interested in receiving their account notifications to be send electronically.Their customer service personnel are excellent.

name: Daniel
review: I have had a rather good experience. When I was about to get my first job, my dad told me that I needed to get my own checking account to handle my own money. At the time, I had also been accepted to Ohio University, which has very few banks, but two separate branches of Chase, one within walking distance of the dorms. So, we set up a Student Checking account (connected to my father's savings account so I wouldn't rack up any fees for not having a direct deposit set up all the time), and I haven't really had a problem since. It's set up so that I won't overdraw, and before I had problems with my phone company, I enjoyed text message updates on my account, which was very convenient. All in all, I am very satisfied with my banking experience.

name: Rob Doe
review: The Ink Bold Business Card is a great card for businesses, there are a lot of benefits from getting this card. You can earn 50,000 bonus points after you spend $5,000 in the first 3 months from account opening which is really easy for a business to achieve. Unlike most cards there is no interest charges however that's because you pay your balance in full each month but again as a business that is very easy and very useful. The best benefit of this card which i haven't seen on any other cards really is being able to earn 5X points per $1 on the first $50,000 spent annually at office supply stores, and on cellular phone, landline, internet, and cable TV services. 5X points is crazy i think the most i've seen on other cards is like 3X. All in all this is a great business card and i think you should really give this one some consideration.

name: Chelsea Marie
review: The Mariott Rewards Credit Card is such a great card to have. Especially for people who often stay in hotels. After a certain amount of money you spend you can get bonuses, For example, if you spend $1,000 you can get a $30,000 bonus. This is one of the few rewards cards that don't charge a fee for signing up. In comparison to the Hilton HHonors Credit Card, this card offers a lot more and is definitely my favorite. Especially since i prefer to stay at the Marriot over the Hilton.

name: Ramy Eskander
review: I am a new customer with Chase Freedom credit card. I think the card is available to those of good credit scores and not to build an initial credit. The most important thing about the card is the amounts of offers and rewards it has. Chase freedom gives 200 dollars back after spending 500 dollars in the first three months. It also has 1% cash back that is up to 5% cash back in some stores, depending on which quarter of the year it is. Moreover, the card does not require any annual fees. The application process was very easy, but I had to wait for ten days to get the card mailed to home. My overall experience is excellent, and I feel blessed to have this card.

name: Lucas Jaeger
review: I signed up for this card before a wedding a couple years ago and I am glad I did! If you're someone who travels a lot, this card is perfect for you. I use it for almost everything and the miles quickly add up. I've been able to go on quite a few free trips already! There is an annual fee, however, it is definitely worth it in my opinion!

name: Sean Rust
review: I absolutely love this card. The best feature is the amazon reward points because they add up really fast and you can use them at Amazon.com which has anything you could ever want. I recommend this card highly, especially if you like shopping at amazon.com like me!

name: Jessica
review: Wow! This card has GREAT bonuses! The $200 after $500 spend in the first three months is incredible! Especially if you just use it for all purchases, and pay off by the end of the month! I have not seen a card with such a high bonus before. I have had Discover for several years, and have never gotten that great of a bonus. I also think the interest rates are competitive, especially on the lower end. Also, the balance transfer period is 15 months 0% interest. The cards I have seen or had have all been 12 months 0% interest. Great interest rates, great promotional period, and great bonuses! I think the Chase card is great!

name: Andrew Lopez
review: Amazon.com Credit Card must be the most used card in my wallet.  I buy so many things from Amazon these days that this card gets so much use.  One benefit of this card is the Amazon Prime Membership.  Also the points offered for purchases on Amazon.  Initially I was offered a $50 Amazon shopping spree which made me decide to get this card.  I really like Amazon and I also enjoy using this card.  Now we just have to wait for drone air delivery.  Amazon is so ahead of everyone else.

name: Bambi Jo
review: The Chase Sapphire Card is an amazing credit card. It comes with an excellent rewards program, bonus points during the first month of use, and no annual fees. Chase always provides great customer service; any issues or questions I have had have been handled quickly, professionally, and completely. I think the starting APR is a bit high compared to similar cards by other creditors, but the other benefits make up for that. As long as you pay your bill on time you can keep the rate reasonable. If you're interested in a rewards card, definitely consider the Chase Sapphire Card. I know you'll be glad you did!

name: Chelsea Marie
review: I really enjoy being a holder of The Chase Freedom Card. As a holder i enjoy a very low APR. And what specifically drew me to this card was the $200 bonus they give holders. I would suggest this card to friends, family or anyone looking for a great credit card.

name: Jeff LeBlan
review: A good credit card to have, my APR was very low. Approved without any problems. The best part about this card are the reward points. I was able to buy a large plasma T.V. by selling my amazon points to someone! The staff was always helpful. The cash back bonus is also a great way to get some change. Go with this card, trust me.

name: D.R.
review: I think that this card has the most benefits compared to any other credit card out there that offers travel miles. After you spend $1000 you get 30,000 miles and if you add say your husband or significant other to the account 5,000 miles is added immediately. There are no restrictions in regard to where you can fly as long as you fly through United Airlines. As it turns out 35,000 miles is enough for a roundtrip ticket from Portland to Panama City. So I would definitely recommend this card for those budget travelers out there. It is awesome!

name: Ashley Fraiser
review: Recently, I applied for the amazon rewards card. I shop on amazon.com a lot and had always seen the advertisement for the card but had never been interested in applying for it. What made me decide to finally go for it was the enticing $30 giftcard they stated I'd get if approved. I was instantly approved and I love the fact that I get rewards back for shopping especially getting 3 points per dollar for using the card on amazon.com since I shop on there very often.

name: Lyn Whipple
review: I find The British Airways Visa Signature Card annual fee to be a bit high for this credit card compared to other credit cards I have used in the past. The bonuses for this card is appealing however, especially if you like to travel.  Most cards I have used in the past apply an introductory rate on purchases, this card does not and it would be great if it did. All things considering, this is a pretty good credit card for travelers.

name: Cody DeLong
review: The Chase Freedom Card is great to pick up right now with a $200 cash back bonus.  Also during the holidays they offer 5% cash back on Amazon purchases and other department stores.  This is the perfect card to get all your holiday shopping done on to save a few bucks.  Plus the added bonus of $200 is a great deal.  I have used similar cards by Capital One but none have ever compared to this deal.  My rate at Capital One was much higher than the variable rate at Chase and the 0% APR was not offered either over at Capital One.

name: brian
review: The rewards on this card are fantastic. The points really add up quickly. This is my go to card. The interest rates are a little high but I keep the balance low and rack up the points. If you keep a low balance and can really take advantage of the rewards from this card, I highly recommend it.

name: Anita Garcia
review: This has become my main credit card. Generally I pay off this credit card monthly, using it for all kinds of daily expenses. I like the fact that I get cash back for everything. It is also really helpful that the extra cashback categories often include gas. When this happens, I get a major chunk of change back.

name: Jason Budley
review: This card is really hard to beat if you ask me, combining a solid APR without adding in annual fees. The great support of Chase just makes it one of the most reliable cards that anyone can put in their wallet.

name: Jack Jackson
review: The Ink Bold Business card sounds like a great card for people that would use this only in the business sense. Looking at it a regular consumer the late fees are enough to drive me away. Looking at it as a business owner though, it a great card with the 50,000 bonus points after sending just 5,000 in the first 3 months. Overall, this card is really a good value for the business owner that wants to earn extra rewards on top of buying the supplies they need.

name: Casey Charvat
review: Today i am writing in regard to the chase savings account i currently use to save money aside for school.I really enjoy using this to save up for what i need to.The interest rate is also rather generous at .05 percent i feel it is truly one of the best savings accounts i ever had.I would fully recommend it based on the ease of use and the generous interest rate.They also had good service despite my issues with some other accounts they worked well to make sure i was taken care of and that i would have no problems.So i rate their savings account a five.

name: Kathleen Morris
review: I recently opened an account with my daughter at Chase. It is a joint savings account and I am pretty happy with them overall. In all honesty, for me, the best thing about Chase is that they are literally all over NY, which is where I work. I work at different job locations, so if I ever need to get to a bank, I never panic because it seems like there is a Chase branch in every neighborhood, not to mention the ATM access at Duane Reade drug stores, which also comes in handy for me.In terms of the actual account, my interest rate isn't great, but I don't think any bank has great interest offers right now anyway. In terms of customer service, I think Chase is great. I only had one problem and Chase fixed it immediately. I am so satisfied with Chase that I am in the process of moving my accounts from other banks, and even a credit union into Chase because I feel that the other banks are taking advantage of their customers with ridiculous fees and rules. Chase doesn't do that, which is why I trust them with my money.I would recommend Chase bank to anyone that wants their money in a secure and customer friendly establishment.

name: Angela Garcia
review: I use my chase amazon rewards card more than any of my other credit cards. I have all of my monthly amazon subscribe and save items automatically charged to this card. I really like the fact that every purchase I make on this card earns me rewards that I can redeem in the form of cash back, or rather a credit, that is applied to my statement. I typically don't carry a balance, I just pay it outright, so getting this credit for using the card is a great perk that reduces my spending because it goes completely to my purchase and not interest on the card.

name: Cody DeLong
review: The British Airways Visa Card seems like a really great deal since you can make 1.25 points per $1 spent which will add up quickly if you spend during the holiday season.  I feel like that is a much better deal if you frequent British Airways!  Also that's more than the Delta card I have which is only 1 point per dollar spent.  The 50,000 bonus that you get with this card is also better than other competitors cards bonuses when you sign up.  That alone is worth the $95 annual fee that you need to pay for the card.  All in all I think if you frequent the British Airlines when flying then you would be stupid not to have it!

name: Teresa Richardson
review: This card sounds good if you are sure you can meet its requirements to pay your bill in full each month. If you have need of the perks and bonuses which all seem to be travel related this might be the card for you since the first year has no annual fee, but many cards offer an even longer number of months without an annual fee and Chase has other cards with no annual fee ever. A $39 late fee every month can add $468 to your bill over the 12 month no annual fee time frame. This is an important consideration if you are cash strapped or in a business that can take 60 to 90 days for your payments to be received, If you do not need travel perks, $625 is worthless to you. This card was not listed in the top ten business cards in the study I did and it was not listed in the top seven Chase Visa cards for businesses. My recommendation would be to do additional research before committing to this card.

name: Matt Vandenberg
review: I am truly surprised at how much people actually have rated Chase as being a good bank!  I really don't like Chase, AT ALL!  I have had multiple problems with certain fee's that have sprung up out of no where and there seems to be no way of getting around them.  I have found that there are a lot of hidden fee's(more than you think) hidden in the fine print.  To me this is not the way a business should conduct business.  With the near collapse of our banking system a few years ago and our money that helped bail them out, I feel as though there should be no hidden fee's EVER.  Bad practices=Bad Bank

name: Krystal Marie
review: I really like the British Airways Visa Signature Card, but the $95 annual fee is a bit of a turn off. I feel a lot of cards are getting rid of these annual fees and I'd like to see the same thing happen with the British Airways Card. Their reward point system is well above par compared to other cards. This card makes it very easy to earn rewards for frequent travelers and I feel its quite diverse! Their interest rate is most certainly on the low end when you compare to other cards. They also offer smart chip technology and no fees for foreign transactions! Anyone who travels abroad regularly should definitely consider this card for their exceptional reward opportunities!

name: Blair Wardolf
review: This Hyatt Credit Card is one of my favorite.  There is no annual fee for the first year and every year after that it's only $75.  If you travel a lot and often stay in hotels and eat out at restaurants this is the card for you.  The Hyatt Credit Card has an excellent point system where you gain points that you can use and redeem for hotel stays!  If you spend $1000 within the first 3 months of having your Hyatt Visa you will be rewarded with 2 free nights of a hotel stay.  This is really great for me because my husband and I do A LOT of traveling with our kids so to rack up points just for checking into our room and using this specific card is a win win situation for our family.  You are also able to use the card for cash advances and you have a 21 day grace period for paying the monthly bill.  Overall I would highly recommend this card if you travel often.

name: Travis Turner
review: The Disney Visa Rewards card is great.  I've had VISA cards in the past with no problems, but if you are a Disney fan, this one has a few kickbacks that make it extra special.  First of all, any purchases you make at Disney World or a Disney Store will be discounted.  Getting 10 percent off at Disney World is a BIG deal considering how expensive it is just to go.  As an extra perk, being a card holder entitles you to a free private photo session with some "secret" characters at certain parts of the theme park.  When we went to Disney World last time, we didn't know this at first, so I'm telling you now.  Even though they wouldn't tell us who the characters were, when we went in the secret area, it was Micky and Minnie!  So again, how much you like this card really depends on how you use it.  If you live near a Disney World theme park or are a regular visitor, you will obviously get more benefit out of it than someone who is not.  Great card, great fun.

name: Robyn Farley
review: I've been using the Amazon Visa card for all of my expenses for the last several years.  I feel this is a great rewards card for people that do a lot of shopping on Amazon.com.  I typically do all of my birthday and Christmas shopping on Amazon so I can get triple points back.  I pay off my card every month so I never have to pay any interest, and I usually redeem my points every two statement cycles for statement credit.  This credit shows up on my account within two business days and reduces the amount I have to pay on my next bill. I wish I had found this card sooner, but I am glad I have it now.  I would recommend this card to anyone looking for a rewards credit card!

name: D.R.
review: The Chase freedom card looks like a very good deal for a credit card. I have signed up for several credit card accounts in the past and I have never seen such a great cash back bonus as the one Chase Freedom offers.  I currently have a Citi card and that card does not offer such an amazing sign on bonus, however it does offer no APR for 18 months where The Chase Freedom card only offers 0 apr for 15 months. that being said I still think the Freedom card is an excellent deal and I would recommend it if you are good with keeping track of your finances.

name: Scott Bryant
review: The Chase Sapphire Card has a low APR, no annual fee, and has access to a ton of rewards. The bonus offer is completely reasonable for a card, and almost guarantees the $100 back in travel rewards. Additionally, it's really great that the points never expire, so you can accumulate and accumulate until you have enough rewards to get something really great. However, you do have to do the rewards through Chase and it's not entirely quick to accumulate the points without spending a lot. However, if you made this card your primary credit card, you could really accumulate these points quickly.

name: Roxanne Wong
review: The Chase Freedom is just plain awesome! I applied for it over a month ago and got approved for a $2,000 spending limit but what was even better was when I found out that the card rewards you with $200 worth of points for using $500 in the first 3 months. Gosh and it is so easy to make $500 in purchases in the first 3 month just on groceries, so why not get this card? Without a doubt, this offer is a steal compared to other card offers that are on the market right now. For instance, I applied for a Bank of America Student Visa last year and it only came with a $25 bonus, which was bogus but besides the point. Still, I think the thing I love most about Chase Freedom credit card is its 0% APR introductory offer. I mean most companies give you the 0% APR for the first 12 months but Chase Freedom gives it to you for 15 months! That, for me, was enough to make it a keeper. I'm just really loving this card right now! It is the primary credit card that I use for everything.

name: Olga Allen
review: At first I was using my Applied Bank Credit Card until a friend told me about all of the stuff she was getting just because of the card she was using. It was the Amazon.com Credit Card.   I am always buying stuff for myself, my husband and my daughter on Amazon.com so I would like to rack up the points from spending money on Amazon.com, gasing up my car, eating out at restaurants, and purchase I make at the drugstore.  I also love the fact that I could earn 1 point for each dollar I spend elsewhere.  My card doesn't have anything like this which make the Amazon.com Credit Card a card to have.

name: Katie Christianson
review: I have been banking at Chase for about 5 years now.  I find their credit card rewards to be awesome and if you have a checking account, you get bonus points. I can do all of my transactions online very easily and if I have a direct deposit there are no fees.  Once I got a fee on my account and I called about it and they removed it.  I also got my car loan through Chase and when I went to make my final payment, the financial account manager even sent me a personal thank you card congratulating me on making the final payment.  I’d recommend banking at Chase.

name: Connie Carlile
review: The Marriott Rewards card is perfect for people who often stay in hotels.  The rewards points can be used to stay at a hotel, converted to airline miles, and many other options.   The Marriott Rewards card even comes with initial bonus points.  The interest rate on the Marriott Rewards card is very generous at only 15.24% which is significantly less than the typical 18-20% you’d see from a higher end Capital One card in the same class.  The Cash Advance rate is pretty high comparatively which is one drawback, but overall there are a lot of beneficial features to this card.

name: Imadoki Lin
review: This is a great card overall, however MAKE SURE TO REDEEM your points monthly if your purchases are in the $$$$$$ per month. If you do not redeem them, you will LOSE THEM FOREVER IF YOUR ACCOUNT GETS CLOSED FOR ANY REASON. Chase bank can close your credit card account without giving the CONSUMER any prior notice and they will not let you redeem any of the points earned on the account. By the way, if you have a chase checking account and you are thinking about closing it, be warned your chase credit card will also be closed, even though the Chase employee says otherwise. That's what happened to me, before I closed my business account, I asked the Chase employee if my Chase Credit Card will be affected and she said "NO". Well, guess what, my business credit card account got closed few days later and I have over $1500 in cash back rebate that Chase credit card department says "The rebates are forfeited once the credit card account is closed for ANY reason". Good Luck to the REST of Y'all!!!!

name: Shawn Pennick
review: The United MileagePlus Explorer Card from  Chase, is the least expensive credit card branded by the airline, and it has so many great benefits and perks that is worth getting for any one that flies United. The card’s $95 annual fee, interest rate and rewards program are in line with the industry standard. The Card’s more best features are priority boarding privileges, free United Club passes per year and free checked bags. You can take advantage of all the card’s benefits if you do not  mind paying the annual fee BUT the benefits far outweigh the fee so it is worth the cost.

name: Ashley Fraiser
review: The Ink Bold Business credit card seems like it'd be a great option for a traveling business owner as it doesn't charge interest fees nor do they charge a fee for foreign transactions. The only downside to the card is having to pay off the full balance every month. Depending on what one's credit limit is and/or how much is spent every month I could see this being a problem.

name: Alexander Phillip
review: I have been with chase for over 2 years.They also offered me a credit card to go along with my account.I believe its really a good offer for me.Really such a wonderful customer service.The representative was very polite, knowledgeable and helpful. Always the account statements are very clear & good, its not so complicated to find out all our balance & dues.The website of the chase is pretty impressive and very very secure for online transactions. The reward program they have is better than any I have ever seen. If you are looking for an excellent banking service that will protect your money that you work for then I suggest this bank.Overall the bank is extremely professional.I am enjoying my banking experience with Chase.

name: Jenna Boone
review: I recently opened a Chase checking account because they have a branch very near to my house and I have had a great experience so far! There are always locations near where I am and each one provides superior customer service. I am able to go in and out and fulfill all of my banking needs. I have had some trouble with other banks in the past having rude employees who are unwilling to help but this bank provides excellent customer service and awesome features on their online banking. I would highly recommend Chase Bank checking accounts for their top notch service.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: This is a very good card but only people with Excellent credit ratings can get it. The rate is variable, depending on your credit worthiness, but it goes from the low range to the higher end. What makes this card really stand out in my opinion is in part due to the $200 cash back if you make over $500 in purchases in the first 3 months. Most people spend that much on groceries alone in 3 months and could easily qualify for this reward. On top of this they offer 0% APR for the first 15 months. This is a great offer! Between the introductory offer, the fair rates, and the $200 back offer, this card is one I think anyone in the market for a new card should consider.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: I am the owner of an Amazon.com Credit card. It is a very convenient card because it has very fair interest rates and because Amazon has great deals on so many different items. I applied for this card over the site last summer and was instantly approved a line of credit that I used to buy myself a work computer. Although my credit isn't as high as I would like, they gave me a fair rate in the upper teens. The fact that they give you a $30 gift card as part of being approved is a great bonus and something I missed out on unfortunately. The reward point system is something that I don't put much value on being that it takes 100 points to get $1 off a purchase. For every $1 you spend at amazon you get 3 points. Considering this, you would have to spend about $34 to get $1 off a purchase. That isn't much of a saving, but better than nothing. Overall, this card has been valuable to me and my family because we do so much shopping on Amazon and the rates (for us) were fair. I would recommend it to others that love to shop there.

name: Scott Bogle
review: The Chase Sapphire Card is definitely a great option for anyone who has excellent credit and is looking for a generous rewards program. I like that there's no annual fee and a 10,000 point initial bonus. The point structure from there looks very simple, 1 point for every dollar spent at minimum! I personally use my credit card a lot for dining out, so the double bonus on restaurants (even fast food!) is especially attractive. And in addition, travel and hotel expenses earn an extra point for every dollar spent. So if you have the credit score and are looking for great rewards, the Chase Sapphire Card is an exceptional option.

name: Taylor Cron
review: I've had my Chase checking account since 2008. The chase.com interface is very easy to use. It is very easy and convenient to transfer funds via Chase Quickpay. I was once charged a fee of approximately $10 for depositing an expired check. I spoke to a Chase bank teller, and he readily reversed the fee for me. Another time, I deposited about $1000 in cash into an ATM. The machine accepted the cash but did not record the transaction on my bank account due to an error with the machine. This was at 5:00 pm and the bank was closed. I frantically called customer service and they resolved the issue quickly. I am consistently provided with excellent customer service. The only negative aspect of Chase I can think of is the maintenance fee of $12 per month. Overall, I highly recommend Chase.

name: Olga Allen
review: I really love Chase Bank.  Out of every bank I have ever worked with they are by far the number one in my book.  Other bank in the past have charged me hundreds in overdrafts that weren't all my fault.  The customer service department is always super helpful and easy to talk to.  They are also really easy to get a hold of as well which is not always the case at other banks.  I have had a couple problems with fraud on my account and both times Chase refunded the money that was taken out of my account until the investigation was complete and both times I won in the investigation and wasn't affected at all.  I would recommend Chase to everyone.

name: AMAMA05
review: I had a chase account for about 2 years. My experience with this bank was less than satisfactory. they do not offer all the benefits that you will find with other banks for the same fee's. I wouldn't recommend this bank to anyone, not after the experiences I had with the customer service department specifically. Rude and do not even try to take time to understand the issue you are having.

name: Jeff
review: I really like the fact that you can get a 30,000 initial bonus after $1000 in charges.  Add to that 4 night stay the initial 2 nights free that they give you…that’s almost a whole week free!  If you travel frequently, this card is a no brainer.  It won’t take long at 3 points to rack up more free nights as you travel.  The 10 nights credit towards Elite status is a nice perk too.  Again if you travel regularly you will be able to reach Elite quicker, affording you the extra status perks 10 nights quicker!  Its got a really great rate too.

name: Kyle
review: My wife recently got this card (Slate from Chase) after having a Chase Freedom Card for many years. While it does not have all the bells and whistles, and fancy rewards that a lot of other cards have, it does have an excellent company behind it. We both have had several cards from Chase, and their customer service has always been helpful. They called, stopped the charge, and issued new cards the second they saw a charge in a foreign country five minutes after using it at the local store. The best part about upgrading to the Slate, is the long 0% interest, it is a great plan, just in time for the holiday.

name: Rob Doe
review: The British Airways Visa Signature Card Is alright, if you like to travel and wanna get them miles built up. The $95 annual fee is not really my favorite thing in the world because there are so many cards that have no annual fee what so ever. It's got some nice incentives though with the 50,000 bonus Avios after you make $2,000 in purchases within the first 3 months of account opening. Now, $2,000 in the first three months may seem like a lot, but 50,000 Avios is a lot as well and if you travel a lot you probably can afford it anyways and it saves you money in the long run anyways. Also, the fact that every calendar year you make $30,000 in purchases on your British Airways Visa Card, you'll earn a Travel Together Ticket good for two years. That is AMAZING and makes the annual fee a little more worth it. You can make a lot of Avios really fast with their rates as well 2.5 Avios for every $1 spent on British Airways purchases and 1.25 Avios for every $1 spent on all other purchases, adds up real quick.

name: David
review: I was a little wary about the Hyatt credit card at first because of the annual fee, in comparison to other travel cards I have.  Once I started using it on my travels, I found out it had some great perks to them and overall not too shabby.  I received enough points for a free night, and was given another free night on the anniversary date of my card.  It ended up paying for the annual fee and more.  I think it is easier to attain some of the bonuses compared to the other cards I have had, and it is good for people who haven't had extensive experience with travel cards.  It is pretty straight-forward and easy to use, and I definitely got my money's worth out of it since I like to stay at Hyatt hotels.

name: Steven Hendrickx
review: I like my Amazon reward card.  There are no fees, and it links with my bank account to make it extremely easy to make payments.   The rewards are a nice bonus as well.  I use this card for all my amazon purchases to get triple points.   Out of all my credit cards this one is the one I turn to, even if I don't necessarily need to use credit,  I still do for the points.   If you do a lot of shopping on amazon,  I highly recommend this card.  Those points add up fast.  Combine that with an Amazon Prime account, and you will save tons on your shipping and those reward points help out.

name: brookeanne
review: I needed a good bank to do my savings at. My bank does not have a good savings program, so I was looking for another bank that could give me a good savings program that would save me money.  I found Chase through an online ad and decided to give it a try. I was surprised at the low annual fees and the customer service. The application was a little lengthy, and the customer service was not top notch that I have seen at other banks, but it was still very good. I have not had any complaints, and this is your standard run of the mill savings account. I get what I pay for, and I am safely saving my money in a place I know that will keep me safe.

name: Allen Marshall
review: The chase slate seems better than it is. It presents itself as a good card that offers amazing benefits but I think it is perfectly average. There are many better offers out there including the freedom card from chase. Its interest rates are average, the introductory period of 0% APR can be matched by different cards that would give you more, like rewards which this one doesn't. Its cool looking because it is vertical when most cards are horizontal and it does give you more control over your finances so it is good for first time credit card holders who are still trying to make sense of it but for big time spenders with more credit knowledge I would go with a better card since so many are out there.

name: Jeff
review: I love the fact that the Chase Freedom Visa actually gives you real cash back for your initial deposit.  In addition to that, you get 15 months with 0% interest!  The regular rate is below what I pay on most of my other cards as well.  Another key bonus to this card is the fact that they offer rotating categories that you earn either 1% or 5% cash back on.  This is great because some cards only offer a set category that you enjoy the larger rewards on.  This way, if you happen to not spend much on a category, you will still have a chance to earn the 5% cash back occasionally.

name: Chris Opperman
review: I recently applied for and received my Amazon credit card.  So far I'm very pleased.  No annual fee, online banking is very easy, and the points are easily transferred to my Amazon.com account.  By the way, did I mention triple points for all Amazon.com purchases?!  I think this is a card that I am going to have for a long time to come.  I use it for my every day purchases and bills and get to reap the rewards later.  This is going to come in very handy for Christmas time!

name: Angela Pacelli
review: The rewards program of the Chase Sapphire Card seems very generous, especially considering that the points have no expiration date.  Unless you're someone who absolutely doesn't use your credit cards, the initial bonus actually seems reasonable to me.  (I often have health-related expenses to contend with, meaning that I can easily blow through $500 in three months.)  Of course, you need an Excellent credit score to be eligible for this card, so chances are that you'll be declined. The max penalty APR for missed payments seems kind of steep, but I guess the logic behind this is that most users won't have to contend with this considering that they already have good credit-related habits that allowed for them to receive this card in the first place.

name: Heather
review: I originally switched to Chase simply because of the promotion for the $200 sign-up bonus and I never intended to keep my account. I found that they have the absolute best customer service of any bank or credit union I've ever banked with. I monitor my finances very closely, and as a result I need to contact my bank fairly often with questions. Chase has always responded to e-mails within four hours with quality information and politely. Their customer service representatives over the phone have always been top-notch as well. They are so helpful and polite, but they don't seem fake with lots of scripts like some other banks. I’ve never been hit with an overdraft fee because they let me do ATM cash deposits and they always provide me with the correct information to ensure I never will be hit with a fee. I never expected to stay with Chase but now I’m completely loyal to them!

name: Breanna
review: I initially signed up for a Chase checking account simply because it was the rest of my household used, but in my several years with them I haven't had any major problems. The online banking is really convenient, and they have since added a number of additional features that I absolutely love. Being able to check my balance and recent transactions via text is great, and being able to deposit a check by texting Chase a picture is even better. It really cuts down on trips to the ATM (but I do have an ATM and a branch location near my home, so I've never had to use another bank's ATM). I will say that some of the fees are a bit high, but luckily Chase will waive most of them for you if you are a student.

name: Dominique Hernandez
review: I've always been really happy with my chase checking account. Because I use direct deposit, I don't pay any fees. On the few occasions that I've accidentally overdrafts, they've been kind and reversed the fees. I like that I also have credit cards with chase, and their online account management is really great. One time my landlord lost my rent check, and the customer service representatives were EXTREMELY helpful. I do wish that the account provided some sort of refund for ATM fees, but I live in NYC and there are chase banks on every corner so I never have trouble finding an ATM. Overall, it's a great account!

name: Nicole Azusa
review: British Airways is part of the One World Alliance. If often using American Airlines, Cathay Pacific or British Airways, this British Airways Credit Card is a good deal. If using this card to rake up miles, you can earn miles fast, with 2.5 and 1.25 miles per dollar spent. The annual fee is $95 which is a lot if not using this card often, but if you do use this card often, you will get more than $95 worth of mileage to be used towards purchase of air flights. The interest rate is at a modest 16%, which is a lot lower than many other cards. If you do travel a lot, there is no foreign transaction fee, which comes in handy when other cards charge a 3% fee. This card would be a 5 star rating if they offered other perks like the Asiana credit card which gives you points for purchases on gas and groceries.

name: Rbl SmartAzz
review: The Hyatt credit card is a great steal for those who travel frequently.  There is an annual fee of $75 but that is offset by the 1 free room on your anniversary of holding the card.  The 29.99% APR is somewhat high but if you are paying balances and gaining rewards this is not an issue.  There is no foreign transaction fee, which is a plus when traveling abroad.  Also, with the great perk offered you can process balance transfers and cash advances if needed. I also love the fact that you earn points on everything that you purchase and extras on restaurants, hotels, car rentals and airlines.

name: Rhianna Edwards
review: The Hyatt credit card is good for frequent travelers and even with the $75 annual fee it is still a great rewards card. If you frequently stay at Hyatt properties it will be easy to rack up points for free nights. This card is similar in rewards to the American Express Gold card which gives $500 back after spending $1000 in the first three months, or the Citi Thank you card which gives bonus Thank You points each year on your card member anniversary. I like that with the card you don't have to pay a resort fee when redeeming. Another perk is no limits to the points you can earn. The Discover card has limits as to how much spending goes towards the extra 5% bonus each quarter in rotating categories. I like the ability to earn unlimited points. At 3 points per dollar through Hyatt and unlimited points, it will be easy to rack up quite a few free hotel nights. Overall I think this card is definitely worth the annual fee. Especially since the fee doesn't kick in until the second year, so you can try it out for a year to see if it works for you.

name: Danny Demon
review: This card is awesome! I mainly applied for this card due to the large bonus they offer for using the card extensively in the first 3 months. It was a free $100 for only spending $500. Fortunately this card offered much more than this including rewards at Amazon and unlimited %1 cash back! Usually you would have to pay an annual fee with a card like this as well, but this card has no annual fee.  I also have never had any problems with this card, Chase has done a remarkable job.  I highly recommend this card to anyone looking for easy rewards and no hassle

name: Evelyn
review: I've had my savings account through Chase since they were bought out by Washington Mutual, and almost a decade before that, starting with an account that I opened there as my first personal savings account ever.  I've never once had a single problem in all the time that I've been banking with Chase, and transferring money between my checking and savings accounts is quick and easy.The website interface for managing the account and seeing past history is well done, and almost never ever has problems or downtime that prevent me from accessing the information that I need to get at.All in all, I'd recommend them to people looking for a reliable place to keep their savings.

name: Ann Raymond
review: The Slate card does not have particularly amazing rewards, but it is simple and functional. I was able to attain the card with a mediocre credit score and use it to built my credit back up. The blueprint aspect makes it very clear what you owe and how long it will take to pay off the debt. I appreciate how clear and straightforward they make it! I found it to be very easy to transfer balances, with zero interest rates, from other cards. Overall, a good experience with Chase and one I'd recommend for anyone looking for a starter credit card.

name: Mike Doe
review: I can only think of one reason why anyone would want this card, and it is a pretty damn good reason. If you are a regular Amazon customer the benefits from this card speak for themselves. Three points back for every dollar purchase on Amazon adds up incredibly fast and is the best perk this card offers, especially if you purchase multiple items from Amazon regularly like groceries and other supplies. The fact that Amazon is one of the leading online marketplaces only enhances this card and ensures that you will use it more than you might think for online purchases.

name: D. H.
review: I've had an Amazon card for years now and I've been very happy with it. Since I shop at Amazon all the time--and I mean almost daily--the rewards build up fast: you get triple points from Amazon purchases. Plus, they're readily usable. And growing a pile of rewards money in your account is, well, rewarding, somehow a lot more satisfying than if you got a comparable amount of cash back. I'm saving up so that I can splurge on a major purchase with no money coming out of pocket. About a year ago, my card was stolen, and the company was very efficient about dealing with the problem. Before I even knew it was gone, they'd discovered the theft and shut the card down to prevent further misuse. And of course they refunded the money that the thief had spent in the interim. In short, I couldn't be happier with this card.

name: Ann Raymond
review: Combined with an Amazon Prime account, this credit card is hugely beneficial. I am already shopping on Amazon, so the triple points acquire incredibly quick! Other point bonuses are offered for gas and groceries, which are the other main uses for my card. There are numerous ways to use your points each month, although I have consistently spent them on the Amazon site anyway, considering they offer pretty much everything (the subscription service is awesome.) I am extremely happy with my interest rates, credit limit, and the customer service. By far the best credit card experience I've had to date.

name: Nicole Azusa
review: The Marriott Credit Card is a good credit card for those who frequently use Marriott when booking hotels. With a no fee sign-up, and a 30,000 point reward if spending $1000 in the first 3 months, this card has potential to start tacking up free nights quickly. And when using this card either at a Marriott or for regular purchases, you can earn 3 or 1 point extra per dollar spent. And who can go wrong with a free 2 night stay at a hotel when activating this card. Now, the reason I cannot rate this card a 5 is for the following reasons. First, there is a $45 annual fee, where as other cards like Hilton do not. Also, if using a Hilton rewards card, you can earn 6 points per dollar at Hilton hotels, 3 points per dollar at gas stations and grocery stores, and 1 point per dollar everywhere else. When you do the math, the Hilton is a much better card, plus the intro reward is 40,000 points. The low APR is a bonus for this card, so if Marriott is your choice of stay, and you dont mind fronting $45 a year, then this card will not serve you wrong.

name: Connie Seale
review: I have been a Chase Credit Card customer for nearly 10 years and am very pleased with the card.  Any time I've needed to call customer service, the reps are friendly, easy to deal with, and have worked to solve the problem/give me information.  I love that there are no annual fees, and the cash back rewards system is great!  My credit card number was stolen once and they were very proactive in making sure I was taken care of and was not held liable for any of the charges.  For awhile, their fraud detection system seemed a little sensitive, but I would rather have them watching out for me than not.  But they've improved that.  I also like the flexibility in choosing my own billing cycle - it's convenient!  I've recommended Chase to others and am a happy customer myself!

name: Mark Kramer
review: I have the Chase Freedom and I use it often for dining and travel expenses. I applied for the card because they offered $100 cash back if I spent $500 in the first 3 months. I easily charge that much every month so it was a no brainer. Now that I have received the promotional cash back, I earn 5 percent back every quarter on most of my purchases. I really like that the card has a generous grace period to pay for purchases without incurring interest. My interest rate is right at 14 percent which I can live with, and there is no annual fee. I don't hesitate to use my Chase Freedom card.

name: Nicole Azusa
review: The Ink Bold Business Card is exactly that, a BUSINESS card. Whether spending thousands or millions of dollars worth of purchases each year for your business, Ink makes sure you see those rewards where you want them to go. With no annual fee, who would not love to get 50,000 points which is a $625 vouchers worth for travelling by only spending $5,000 in your first 3 months for business? And whenever using this card for business transactions, points will quickly be earned and applied to the frequent travel program of your choice. The last incentive of course is the $0 foreign transaction fee, which is extremely useful when conducting business overseas. The only thing about this card is you have to have an excellent credit score to be approved. Some people might complain about the $95 annual fee, but remember, this is a business card, not a personal credit card. And when using this card and encountering issues, you can rest easy knowing your issues will get resolved in a friendly manner. However, if mileage is your main concern, there are other cards like Capital One that give more mileage per dollar usage.

name: Barbara Baxter
review: I've had this Chase Freedom card for a while, and I like it. It's convenient, I have a decent credit limit, and the rewards have built up to a point where I can cash them in.  I've heard negative things about Chase but this card has been issue-free for me. I rarely ever call customer service, but the one time I did, they were courteous and helpful. I will say that the interest rate I'm paying is way too high. I have good credit, not perfect, and I have a feeling I can do better, so I plan to call them and request a lower interest charge. Other than that, no problems.

name: Fred
review: I stumbled upon the Chase Freedom card on SlickDeals when looking for a new card that had great rates and had cashback. I received a $200 bonus upon signing up and spending $300 so that was definitely a nice perk. The added cashback is very useful for a college student like myself that is constantly doing small purchases left and right. While there are some limitations to when the cashback perk can be applied, it is nice that there isn’t a limit to how much cashback I could get unlike my Bank of America card. The Chase Freedom card is a solid card that is well suited for young adults such as myself and others. The late fees aren’t too terrible and they give nearly a month grace period to pay it back which I find is more than reasonable. Chase is very professional and whenever I have inquired about some questions, they respond immediately and thoughtfully. I would definitely recommend Chase Freedom to whoever is looking for a new card, especially when they have the $100 - $200 bonus upon signing up.

name: Richard Monica
review: Great card,,,never a problem,,,excellent  service people,,LOVE my SLATE Card!

name: Jeremy Stephens
review: Slate is a basic, no-nonsense card for people who don't want to be bogged down by high interest and fees. What I like most about this credit card is that I enjoy zero percent interest on gas purchases, which is great because I charge gas purchases as a business expense. The long period of introductory zero percent interest (15 months) is nice as well. The credit limit I started with was a little puny compared to other cards that I have had in the past, but as a card intended to make small, every day purchases it's good enough for me.

name: Emma Frost
review: The British Airways Visa Signature Card seems like a decent deal. The annual fee of $95 is comparable to other travel cards (like American Airlines and the new PNC travel visa card.) I like the interest rate being around 15% since other cards are usually about 20% to 25%. The initial bonus miles and earn rate are attractive, but again, similar to other offers. I really like the Smart Chip technology since many destinations abroad require this chip. The only downside is that I'm not crazy about earning Avios. The Avios reward system is much more frustrating than the straightforward award system that American Airlines offers. Just make sure it's a right fit before you commit!

name: Haley Williamson
review: I love that this card is a great way to earn miles while spending money at any time. The interest rate is 15.24 (v) currently which is not bad compared to what some other companies offer. Another great perk is that there are no foreign transaction fees when traveling which it great since most people using this card like me are travelers. I also like that there is no fee for going over your limit which can easily happen while traveling. The annual fee is much higher than most other cards though which is a huge downside. I would advise against this card if you are not going to be using the miles rewards to their full potential to make up for the fee.

name: Jon Fuller
review: This is a great card for people that travel frequently, particularly for businesspeople. The free nights really start to add up if you frequently stay at hotels in the Hyatt chain, making it well worth having. You get one night for every 5000 points that you accumulate, and you accumulate points fairly rapidly just from normal travel accomodations. The big issue with this card for people that do not travel a lot is the annual fee, which is fairly high compared to the Mariott or Hilton credit cards. If you normally stay at hotels in the Hyatt line on a regular basis, however, this is a must-have.

name: Mike Mertile
review: I have had no problems with this card. I have never had any billing problems or anything of that nature. I am actually very pleased with my decision to use this card. One thing that  I am particularly happy with about this card is the customer service. I had my card stolen one time and they were very helpful in getting me a new card and dealing with the charges on the one that got stolen. I would definitely recommended Chase Freedom. Even when I have questions, from billing to simplest thing they are always very professional and always helping me. The interest rate I have is also very reasonable too.

name: Stephanie Haze
review: I’ve had experience with a few other card providers but none of them compare to what Chase offers with their services. By far the easiest and friendliest experience I have ever had with getting my card set up, which was a breeze, and all my questions and concerns answered promptly. The deals and offers they have are amazing, the 100 dollar offer in the first three months, and the rewards earned! It’s not worth having a card that doesn’t offer rewards. But what makes me a loyal Chase customer, is the ease they offer with service support, and the professionalism I have come to expect with the Chase name.

name: Quinn Carter
review: Wow, the Chase Freedom card looks like a great card to have. The no interest rate intro period seems a lot longer than a lot of other cards that I have seen, and that is something I really like. Interest rates can really kill you if you are not careful. I am also loving the 100 buck initial bonus, as well as the cash back rewards. I don't like that you can only earn 5% cash backs during select periods at select stores, but I really do like the fact that there is no limit to the cash back bonuses you can receive!

name: Shakia Giddiens-Dugue
review: I think this is a great credit card offer.  They offer bonuses and rewards which could be of huge benefit to the cardholder.  Creating this cash back could be used in many ways that help you save on additional purchases.  To the contrary I feel that one of the disadvantages is that you must have either excellent or good credit in order to qualify.  However, if you do qualify the interest rate is relatively low and there are no annual fees which compared to other cards is great.  I also like the fact that you get an initial $30 bonus after getting the card. I would recommend this card to anyone with decent credit.

name: Brett Charnell
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is my favorite card. I got 20,000 bonus points, which became $200 credit. This is the best card for traveling, especially for those who travel more than occasionally and tend to spend copious amounts of money. Every time you use points to book travel through Chase, 20% of those points are automatically refunded. This is definitely the best card I have ever had the privilege to experience using. I highly recommend this particular card to anyone that would like to earn back savings on their family’s trips or personal business trips as well. This is the card for you.

name: Jon Fuller
review: This card looks great, and has excellent features. If you have a fairly good credit rating and are looking for a new credit card for large purchases, check out the Chase Sapphire. The bonus points add up quickly on larger purchases, and are great for gift cards or hotel stays at a variety of major hotel chains. This makes it a great card for frequent travelers as well. The Chase Sapphire card operates on the Visa network also, so you know it will be accepted pretty much everywhere. My only gripe is the somewhat high foreign transaction fee, which is annoying if you travel internationally. Overall, a great card though.

name: Jonathan Flemington
