review: I really dig this card. Got it in the mail just the other day, and it's already activated less than 24 hours later. I like the features, namely the 100 dollar bonus at the beginning. Having taken a few years to dig myself out of bad credit, this is a nice little reward to myself--a comfortable safety net for traveling abroad (some countries require you to have a certain credit limit on credit cards, for emergency purposes). The cash back option is nice, and all in all, this makes for a comfortable card for a youngish adult like myself to possess (no annual fee!)

name: CALEB
review: Over the years I have had a  chase checking account on several occasions due to availability of banking in the area. It always seems like a good idea since they give you a sign up bonus good online features etc. But every time its always something. They have a pretty high monthly fee if you dont meet their requirements. You can get around those requirements with direct deposit but sadly if you lose your job and you cant meet the balance or the direct deposit you are screwed. And if they dont get you there watch out for all the other fees atm fees, etc, etc. And dont expect customer service to help you out either. Pretty much just sorry that sucks.

name: Princess Lula
review: I like that the card came with 2 free nights upon account approval. The standard apr is competitive and the annual fee is lower than many. The 3 points for every dollar spent at marriott properties is awesome and the 1 for $1 for all other transactions is similar to other reward cards. I did not like that you had to spend $1,000 in the 1st 3 months to qualify for the 4 free nights...that may not be an easy task so it appears to me to be one of those offers that marriott is counting on you never to qualify for..its just lip service to make the  offer look better. I did not like that you did not get bonus points upon first transaction no matter the amount...most other reward cards offer that. Lastly, I wish the marriott card offered a balance transfer intro offer of 0% or some other low % for a period of time

name: David Marcillo
review: The Hyatt credit card seems like a wonderful card for those who like to travel and prefer to stay in familiar hotels. Hyatt owns properties around the world, so finding a Hyatt hotel should never be a problem, regardless of travel plans. This card requires excellent credit and charges an annual fee beginning the second year, but other than that I believe the benefits far outweigh the costs. Earn free nights easily, even a free one on your cardmember anniversary, simply for keeping your account in good standing. There are no limits to the points you can earn on this account, so if you decide to pay all of your bills with this card, you can easily rack up enough free nights and points to go on an entire vacation without ever having to worry about hotels. The reliability of the Visa network helps to alleviate any worries and confirms that you can use this card around the world if your trips take you in such directions. Overall, for a frequent traveler or someone who wants to become one, this card can lead to many great memories.

name: David Marcillo
review: The British Airways Visa Signature Card could be an incredibly useful card for the right person. If you are a traveler who often goes overseas, you should take a good long look at this card and realize that you're unlikely to find better benefits anywhere. The benefits become even better the more money you spend. $30,000 charged in one year automatically leads to a free Travel Together ticket that you can use for two years. This is beyond all of the points and miles (called Avios) that you will accumulate from spending on this account. Besides the great rewards, you have the reliability of the Visa network and the added bonus that you will not incur any foreign transaction fees. You can also appreciate the Smart Chip technology that's included in the card. As with many cards of this nature, this British Airways Visa Signature card is not for everyone. Domestic travelers and those who rarely travel at all will not benefit very much from having this account, so be sure to think through your travel plans and history as a part of the decision making process surrounding this card.

name: Katie Christianson
review: What I first like about the Ink Bold Business Card is the 50,000 bonus points after spending $5,000 with in the first three months.  BUT, what do I, a small business owner, do with what those points transfers to? It transfers to $625 in travel – ya right – if I had money to spend traveling I wouldn’t be a small business owner in need to a credit card! It would be much better if it was a statement credit.  Another bonus with this card is the 5 points per dollar on charges that I do make a ton of – namely office stores and phones.

name: Sarah Steele
review: I've been really happy with my Amazon Rewards Card since I signed up more than one year ago. The point system is easy to understand and I use Amazon for so many purchases anyway that it's almost as good as cash. It's easy to monitor the reward balance since it's linked to my Amazon account. I've been pleased with Chase's customer service as well. They make it easy to pay off the credit card online and their site is very reliable. They accept same-day payments until 8pm I believe, so I have plenty of time to make the payment even if I don't get around to doing it until after work. This is so much better than my other credit card and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

name: Sean Chandler
review: The Chase Saphire Preferred Credit Card is a beautiful credit card that is made out of a combination of metal and plastic. I've had this card for a while and find it to be an excellent card with great benefits. The bonus of 40,000 points redeemable for a statement credit of up to $500 is a huge win, but I would rather transfer these points to united airlines where I could make these points worth more than $1000. The annual fee of $95 is nothing compared to the benefits you receive (covers 5 years of annual fees), and if you really don't want to pay it you can just downgrade your account to the regular sapphire card and pay no fees. This card has benefits similar to that of most American Express cards who has very high customer satisfaction. Unfortunately, I have not been able to use any of these benefits so I don't know how well that they handle the situations but I'm sure they do just fine.

name: Justin Parker
review: Thank you for this review, I found it very helpful.  The idea of down-grading the card if you do not like the annual fee is excellent.  It makes me feel like I could try this card for a year or two and, if I felt I was not getting my money's worth out of the "Preferred" status, I could easily change my account without suffering any serious negative consequences.

name: Royale Zoe
review: I wanted to get a simple card I could use for just my gas purchases. This one appealed to me the most because of the benefits you can select with the product you spend the most on. The best part about this card is the payment options. It allows you to choose a plan depending on how you want to pay it off. Then that also determines your monthly minimum which is a great way to give the owner control over their own finances. The few times I have used customer service was a great experience, no problems whatsoever. I would definitely recommend this one!

name: Krystal Marie
review: The Marriott Rewards Credit Card really doesn't stand out to me as a superior card. Their 15% interest maybe a bit on the low side of average, but not enough to stand out. They do offer an intro rate for the first year, which is great. A lot of cards seem to be getting rid of intro rates. $45 a year annually isn't too bad and its comparable to a lot of other credit cards. They have a very good rewards program, if you travel a lot. They also offer travel protection, which could come in handy for a frequently traveler. Their cash advance rate is rather high and I wouldn't consider this card as a go to card. I would only recommend for people who travel monthly.

name: Justin Scott
review: I love my Amazon Credit card. The points system is designed to my liking, and I end up racking up points fairly quickly. This allows me to either get little things here and there like movies and music, or take a $20-$40 chunk out of something larger I am buying. I do a lot of my shopping on Amazon so the points get tripled on those purchases. I buy gas every other week and go out to eat with my girlfriend every couple weeks so all those points get doubled! When I signed up they took $50 off my Amazon purchase, and using the Chase website and mobile app is a breeze. They are also very fair with regard to minimum payments if you're in a squeeze. As a 22 year old college graduate, there are few cards that could better suit my needs. If you like earning free stuff from your everyday purchases you should go with this card!

name: SilentKill Evony
review: The chase sapphire card is just amazing. I go out to eat with my friends all of the time and I get rewarded for paying. The interest rate isn't bad at all at 15% I wish it could be a little lower, but other then that, I love the card design, and the customer service is very friendly. I tried Capital One and it was alright, nothing can compare to the Chase Sapphire. I HIGHLY recommend this card to my friends and family and anyone reading this review right now. Choosing the Chase Sapphire Card was a excellent choice that I do not regret.  If you need a card, Go With Chase Sapphire!

name: Jeff
review: I really like this card because it offered me a chance to transfer my balance from another card to this one with no fees and no interest for 15 months.  It was great, because the balance transferred can be easily paid off before that 15 month period has ended.  I also am enjoying the first 15 months of purchases at 0% interest!  To me this is a great deal.  It’s very easy to keep you plan in place to ensure that the card is paid off by the end of the first 15 months, because you don’t have to take into account how much interest they will be charging.   Once the interest does kick in, it is still a reasonable rate, so it is a win-win situation.

name: Krystal Marie
review: I absolutely love my Amazon Credit Card. I use it almost weekly because I do a lot of my personal shopping on amazon. When you sign up you initially get a $30.00 Gift Card through amazon. There is no annual fee! The points program is great especially if you use it on amazon a lot. There also isn't a limit on how many points you can use on a transaction.  My interest rate on this card is probably the best out of all the cards I have used. Quite low at 15% - 22% compared to other specialty credit cards. Their cash advance rate is pretty average compared to other cards. This is really my favorite credit card and their customer service is always great! I've never had an issue!

name: Ones Eightys
review: I have received rewards on this card that I cannot use because I haven’t built up enough rewards to “win” the right to use my rewards.  I cannot have it credited back to my account, for the same reason.  Additionally, my interest rate was increased, not due to any late payment or related issue, but because this bank apparently perceived that I might, someday in the distant future, make a late payment.  Why wait for this to happen when you can simply raise the interest rate now, right?  This is the kind of credit card (and bank) that you want to pay off asap, and never look back.  I have found a much more honest one, in the meantime.

name: Robert Crisp
review: The Chase freedom card has a lot of features that I really like. The hundred dollars in the first three months is a great deal. The $35 late fee is a very small fee compared other cards I've used, and the 21 day grace period gives you a lot of time to pay it. Another plus for this card is that there is no annual fee and the interest rate is very competitive compared to other cards I have used. This card also has great rewards such as 5% cash back at Amazon.com and other department stores and unlimited 1% cash back on all other purchases. Overall the Chase freedom card is an excellent card for anyone with a good credit score

name: Braden Blaettler
review: I absolutely love my Amazon Credit Card! I buy TONS of stuff off Amazon. Even if I can drive down the street and go to the store, Amazon usually has it for less. Anyway, when you sign up you get a 30$ Amazon gift card. Amazing. Also, no annual fee. On top of that three times the points for every dollar spent on Amazon.com when using the credit card. Two times the points for gas and restaurants when you use the amazon.com credit card. Crazy awesome rewards. Points are redeemable on amazon.com purchases. It is almost like this card was meant for me. If you are like me and purchase a ton of items from amazon, do yourself a favor and get this card. Great card for those amazon lovers out there!

name: Jonathan Flemington
review: I've had nothing but terrible experiences with these guys. Informal, impersonal, and unprofessional, I've tried calling them repeatedly to only be put on hold for unacceptable lengths of time. After leaving messages and numbers, nobody ever tries calling back, and they refuse to help me with any problems, merely passing the buck, over and over and over again. After 2 months of trying to get a credit card with them, I finally gave up and decided against getting one, not just from them, but from any bank.

name: Braden Blaettler
review: I like how you get 50,000 points after spending $5,000 within the first three months, it’s a lot of bonus points compared to some other cards. I also like how you get five points for every dollar spent on normal every day bills. That is a huge perk that I don’t think any other credit card offers right now. I don’t like that there is an annual fee. Compared to the Amazon Visa, the Ink Bold Business Card has a pretty high annual fee, where as the Amazon Visa does not have an annual fee. On the flip side, this card is designed for businesses, and would suit that market perfectly with all the travel points you can earn.

name: Maddie Smith
review: I have been with Chase since my late teens years, and they have been a great bank. They have low fees, great interest rates, and great customer service. Their sign up process was a breeze (although you may experience something different if their sign up process has changed). Their fees are low if you make a mistake with an overdraft fee, or you lose your card. Their interest rates are on par with other major banks, and their customer service is excellent. I would recommend Chase to my friend and family any day of the week. They have been with me through a lot, and I hope that they continue to be my bank for a long time.

name: Mikhail Ioffe
review: I love my Chase Total Checking, excellent service and customer support. The only, problem I have with it , is it takes 2 dollars when I use other ATM beside chase ATM. Also i love the direct deposit feature on my phone, I can take screen shots of checks given to me and send from my phone, without going to the bank and waiting in line.  don’t have to worry about a service charge because of my weekly direct deposits and beingere is always a Walgreen’s pharmacy around the corner which provide a Chase ATM. The website is easy to use and helps me pay my bills, pay other people and keep track of where my money is going to. Chase is awesome and I would recommend that everyone give this checking account a look.There's another $125 cash bonus for opening a Chase checking account with direct deposit, but unlike past ones, you don't have to log into Chase to see it. The $125 Chase bonuses that are easily accessible online have been much less common than Chase's $100 bonuses. There have been other options offline. Many have reported finding $125 Chase bonus offers in the change-of-address package at post offices. Also, some have reported receiving $150 and $200 bonus offers in the mail, and these are being sold on

name: Bambi Jo
review: The Hyatt Credit Card is a good card for someone who spends a good amount of time traveling and frequently stays at Hyatt Hotel properties and seems to be a good entry level hotel rewards credit card for people who are looking to maximize their rewards potential. Compared to the Hilton HHonors Credit Card, the Hyatt card offers rewards at a lower buy in requiring only $1,000.00 in purchases over the first 3 months vs. the $2,500.00 requirement for the Hilton HHonors card. The annual fee for the Hyatt card is only $75.00 compared to the $95.00 for the Hilton HHonors card. Overall, I would say this is a great card for people who frequently stay in Hyatt properties, but may not offer as much reward to those who don't.

name: Sean Chandler
review: The British Airways Visa Signature Card is a very attractive card with a nice bonus of 50,000 Avios after $2000.00 in purchases within the first three months. The value of the British Airways Avios are at least 1.5 cents which is the equivalent of receiving a bonus of $750 for signing up! You also earn a total of 1.25 miles per dollar spent on anything which overall trumps most other airline credit cards like Delta, United or US Airways. Lastly, if you’re a big spender and spend more than $30,000 per year you’ll receive a travel together ticket making this card a steal for anyone who likes to travel!

name: Timpani Treat Puckett
review: I found the Chase freedom card to be harder to work with than other credit cards that I have had. There interest rate pops up to over 30 percent after only one late payment, and they lowered my credit rating without even letting me know they had done it. I understand if they want to lower it to protect themselves, but it would have been nice to know what was going on. I also would have preferred a website that is easier to work with. I had trouble logging on because of their complex log in system. I felt like I was having to get through top secret security to even see my current balance or pay my bill.

name: Keith Sandusky
review: I originally got this card because the $100 cash back within the first 3 months seemed like a great deal. The card only has a max late fee of $35, which thankfully because of the generous 21 day grace period, I have never incurred a late fee. The grace period is perfect because I receive my paycheck bi-weekly, so 21 days is plenty of time to pay. Every 3 months, there are 5% cash back categories, such as gas stations, online stores, etc. This is also an extra bonus, because the cash back categories are typically on purchases you would make anyway. The people at Chase are also really friendly and eager to help you out with any problems you have. I would definitely recommend the Chase Freedom card.

name: Kyle Storm
review: At first I was nervous about getting a credit card. I was told if I paced my spending, I should be fine. I applied for the Chase card and was approved within a week. I really enjoy the small 35 dollar late fee that makes it do-able. 21 days is plenty of time to pay, and the interest is pretty low compared to other cards. I never go overboard with spending, and even if I did with this card it would be very managable. The card is also very nice to look at, with it's pretty colors.Another good thing is there is no overlimit fee, so if you feel like you need to spend more (and can afford it) you will not be limited.

name: Carl Wurffel
review: This card has a number of features that I like quite a bit, the $100  cash back award for spending $500 in the first three months is a very nice perk to obtaining this card. The zero percent introductory apr for fifteen months is another, particularly if You want to do a balance transfer from another card, this can save you a good deal of money on interest if you carry a balance. And there are no annual fees which is another big one to me. The variable after the intro is a little higher than some cards I have that are compareable, but I think the other benefits make up for that especially if You pay off the entire balance every month.

name: Allen Marshall
review: The Chase Sapphire is my go to rewards for everyday rewards. I use it to eat out and get rewarded for it. You get a hundred dollars for spending 500 in the first three months which was easily doable. I love rewards cards, I pay the balance off each months so interest is not something I look at but at 15% it is not as bad as it could be. The rewards on this make it easier for me to keep track of my spending and get rewarded for it. The only other card that could compare to it was the chase slate but I ended up going with this because it offered better rewards at a slightly higher interest rate.

name: Allen Marshall
review: There is nothing to hate about the Amazon card. It has a great interest rate, and gives you 3 points per dollar on amazon purchases, which is where most of my spending is done anyways. I like that it does not make you wait to spend a thousand to redeem your rewards, you can redeem as little as a dollar, so I end up getting tons of free little knick knacks from amazon. There is no annual fee which is good and while the grace period is only 21 days I can live with that in exchange of all the other benefits, like the 30 dollars just for signing up. I know there are few other rewards cards that are just as competitive, like the Kroger 1-2-3 Rewards visa or the Capital One Venture but I prefer this since Amazon already has great deals on so many things.

name: Laura
review: The Ink Bold Business Card is a great card if you have a large amount of money to spend in order to take advantage of the rewards. It's a business-oriented charge card, meaning you must pay the full balance every month. They offer a huge amount of bonus points if you spend $5,000 within the first three months of opening the card. Furthermore, they offer points at a rate of 5x up to the first $50,000 spent in many categories. This card is additionally useful for frequent travelers, as there are no foreign transaction fees on its use. However, there is a $95 annual fee for this card after the first year of use.

name: Laura
review: If you manage to qualify for the Chase Freedom card, it offers great rewards. Since I got accepted for the card, I've enjoyed the high rewards that they offer. Making $500 in purchases within the first three months of opening nets you a $100 bonus cash back, so it's smart to open this card when you are ready to spend some money, to take advantage of this deal. Additionally, through the end of this year, they're offering 5% cash back on some great categories, including for Amazon. Get your holiday shopping done for cheaper! There are no annual fees to maintain the card, and any rewards that you gain will never expire. If you qualify for this card, it's a pretty good deal.

name: Oragsen Legendo
review: This Amazon Rewards card has seriously helped me stretch out my dollar. The initial bonus and continued rewards (which I frequently redeem) makes it much easier to shop anywhere knowing that I will get a little something back for myself and not just on Amazon's website. I mainly use this card on gas since prices here keep rising and rising.

name: Liz Buehler
review: I love my Amazon Rewards card. I use it all the time for all types of purchases and I especially love that I get rewards points to spend on Amazon for just using the card. I am a college student and It is easy to use, easy to pay, no annual fee and I even got $30 when I was approved for the card. It’s a Visa card so it is accepted almost anywhere and they are very good about getting a hold of me if there is any unusual activity on my card. I have never had a problem with this card in the three years that I have had it. I would recommend this card to anyone and everyone!!!

name: Drew Barkoff
review: The Marriott Rewards Credit Card is useful for those who prefer to stay in, and can afford to stay in Marriott Hotels.  The sign on initial bonuses are certainly attractive and the 30,000 start up points could definitely be put to good use, but the three month minimum spending limit of 1,000$ seems very high and I would not be able to meet that requirement.  The annual fee after the first year is also very high and is a complete turn off.  I don't know why someone would want to pay to have a card with which to pay them more money, doesn't make sense, but it is a good choice for those who travel a lot, but in my opinion there are a lot better cards out there.

name: Francisco Delgado
review: I got the Chase Freedom card about 3 months ago for the $100 cash back reward for spending $500 in the first three months. The rotating cash back was a huge plus as it was amusement parks for the quarter i received the card in. I ended up having a trip to Disneyland planned and this helped me get 5% back for my trip. I used the cash back reward as a statement credit to help lessen the bill for the vacation. I have been happy with this card so far and love seeing the new rotating 5% cash back rewards each quarter. This quarter it is department stores which will help for buying clothes for friends and family come Christmas time. Chase customer service has also always been great about answering questions in a timely manner and were more than happy to change my due date to help align with  when I get paid at work.

name: Veronica
review: I have been a part of Chase bank for the past 3 years now. Recently, I decided to open a line of credit with them, now that my credit has improved. The application process was quick and pain free. I got approved for a certain amount almost instantly, and the interest rates were not high at all. A lot less compared to other banks that I've looked into. Customer service is always exceptional, I have never encountered a problem with that. They know how to take care of their customers, and that's a very important quality to me. There was one slight miscommunication when it came to an overdraft, but they accommodated me in a timely manner and I was very pleased with that. Their locations are also convenient; there are Chase banks all over the place! High recommend them as a credit union and a bank.

name: Shawn Cake
review: The British Airways Visa Signature Card looks to be an alright card. The annual fee and annual percentage rates seem to be fairly pricy in comparison to the actual advantages.  This card would mainly benefit someone that travels often and more than that, travels abroad more than your average person. No foreign transaction fees would be a great perk. The Travel Together Ticket  is a great reward, but unless you're planning on doing some extravagant spending on this card alone, then it doesn't seem like it'd be a realistic goal. All in all, I think this would be a nice card to have, but if you're looking for something with more realistic rewards and for everyday use for someone that travel is not a main element of your life, then the annual fee may not be worth it.

name: Temper Nick
review: The Hyatt credit card is an exceptional value for travelers who frequent Hyatt properties. The value of many of these rewards would far exceed the cash back bonus offered by Discover card. The rates for this card seem comparable to other cards I have used. However, the annual fee of $75 would need to be considered when signing up for this card. The 2 Free Nights after spending $1,000 within the first 3 months would be easy to obtain for some users and more difficult for others. In short, only the highest consumers of Hyatt properties would get the greatest benefit from this card.

name: Gail Steen
review: I really like my Amazon credit card. About six months ago my wallet was stolen out of my vehicle. I was so upset to learn that there had been charges applied to my card before I was able to cancel it. Thankfully the people at customer service were very helpful. They were able to get the charges taken care of and issued me a new card. I didn’t think it was going to be that simple. I want to thank the person at customer service for being so nice and so helpful. I would recommend this card to all my family and friends.

name: Tom Hall
review: The Amazon.com Credit Card is a great card.  You get to earn rewards from all of your Amazon purchases to spend more money on Amazon!  More books are always great.  The initial bonus for signing up can help you make a first purchase.  Having no fees was an important feature I was looking for and makes this the perfect card for me.  The sign-up was super simple and straight-forward, you can do it during the checkout of an item on Amazon as you make a purchase.  I have recommended this card to a couple people and one of them signed up and liked it as well.  You can’t go wrong with this card if you use Amazon.com for purchases.

name: Alexis Beth
review: The Chase Ink Bold credit card has its definite advantages, but plan on spending quite a bit of money to accrue the perks it advertises! Making sure to pay your balance in full each month is especially important and it pays off. Their first annual fee is waived but watch out--second year increases to $95! Perks include no foreign transaction fee and access to a live service advisor anytime--pretty cool! Five times the points per dollar for the first $50,000 spent (on select items) may take awhile to rack up but is absolutely awesome; how many other cards do you know who have that feature? I recommend this card.

name: Andre Figueroa
review: My second(Technically third) credit card from chase. A free offer after having my freedom for a few years. I have a love/hate with this card. The one thing I dislike the most is it has no rewards. Reasons to use my money more. Having my freedom still allows me to use this card in combination with it. The main draw for me to this card was the massive intro period of  15 months. The added bonus of no balance transfer fees and the lowest APR of any card I have 12.99 for the Slate but 13.99 for my Freedom, was an obviously nice draw. Of course basics like no annual fees are icing on the cake, and I must say, Ive personally found their customer service to always be on point. In the end I feel this is a great supplemental card, something to use perhaps as a holding for balances while you earn rewards on another card. Otherwise it stands decently on its own.

name: Kenya Brown
review: I have been a chase   Customer since 2012. Overall I have been satisfied with this bank. The Chase Total Checking account has a minimum balance to open of $25 and a monthly maintenance fee of $12, which is waived with direct deposit. I love this feature because my checking account is not being deducted every month. I love the fact that I can utilize online banking. I can access my account on my phone whenever I want. And there are so many available chase ATMs everywhere. Overall chase has been the best.

name: Sarah Hall
review: I have been a customer with Chase for over a year now.  Prior to moving my checking account to Chase, I had tried three different baking institutes in town.  I found the Chase Total checking to be the best option for my financial needs.  Not only is the account free for me because I do have direct deposit, but it also offers free bill pay and a free online account.  I had found with prior banks that online bill pay was not an automatically free feature unless you used it more than ten times a month.  With Chase Total Checking, I am able to use it for just two bills without encountering a fee.  One other feature that attracted me to Chase in the first place and that has kept me as a loyal customer is their mobile deposit feature.  I no longer have to go to the bank to deposit a check.  I can do it right from the convenience of my home.  The feature is also free whereas other banks I tried charged a fee or one had to of had established service with them for over a year.

name: Carina
review: I would say the Marriott Rewards Credit Card is obviously a good card for people that travel a lot and especially use Marriott hotels. I like the initial bonus point offer, but at the same time, doubt that I would spend that much in three months to qualify. However, the annual fee puts me off quite a bit. I currently have a rewards card with Capital One that has a similar rewards setup, no annual fee and of course, their no hassle rewards system. Obviously with this Marriott card, you get the full use from it if you do a lot of traveling. I don't see it being as appealing to someone who doesn't.

name: Ben Matthews
review: One of the reasons I decided to go with Chase is because I found their mobile check cashing app really neat.  There is something just really futuristic about being able to take a photo for check and have the funds deposited immediately.  Chase also had some very enticing sign up offers such as a free $300 sign up bonus which I was able to take advantage of.I am not a fan of how their checking account requires direct deposit to be free.  Thankfully only ONE of the checking accounts needs to have Direct Deposit.  Me and my wife both have our own separate accounts linked together, and her direct deposit keeps the checking free.  Other banks I have been with required each account to have direct deposit to be free, so this was nice for them to be realistic with the requirements.

name: Donald Pinckney
review: This card looks to be merely OK. The annual fees are rather high for card that offers no promotional interest rate. I suppose if you used British Airways fairly often or liked them then this card would make sense for you due to the rewards they offer. The first bonus they offer is pretty great but seeing as I don't use British Airways it doesn't help much. The lack of foreign transfer rates is pretty impressive but with the high annual fee it seems to be pretty much a wash. This credit card also seems to have steep requirements to be approved. I personally would continue to use the Bank of America Signature Visa Card due to the lack of annual fees plus the cash back they offer is more useful.

name: Darlynn Hall
review: The fees that are charged and the interest make this card less than stellar. However I would recommend this card because the customer service is good and the reward incentives are various. All in all I would give this car 3 stars only because of fees.

name: James
review: Chase freedom credit card is excellent.  This card is great because you can receive 5% cash back when making purchases at certain stores.  Such as Amazon during the Winter season.  There is also no Annual Fee which is really great because some of the other credit cards charge you an Annual Fee. When you first get the credit card, you will get 100 dollars when you spend 500 dollars during your first three months.  The customer service is very helpful and it is very easy to make monthly credit card payments.  The website to pay for the credit card loads very fast and I never had any problems with it.

name: Brittany Lickey
review: Hyatt's credit card seems like a good card for only certain people. If you are a business man or woman or someone who travels a lot this card is a really good idea. All of the reward that you can receive have to do with a nice stay in a hyatt hotel. If you are someone who already stays in this or another great hotel I believe this credit card would be a good investment so you can get something back for all the money you spend on hotel stays. The yearly fee isn't too large and isn't applied until after the first year. I am not much of a traveler and I do not have the best credit score so this card would not be ideal for me.

name: Kevin Mierkiewicz
review: I love my Chase freedom card.  This card is wonderful.  I use it for all my business trips and have gotten cash back from the majority of my purchases.  The programs associated with this card help tremendously and the cash back feature has even helped me pay down the balance of this card faster than I ever thought I could.  I could not recommend this card anymore highly to anyone that is looking for their first or new credit card.  I plan on having this card for a very long time.  The customer support has always been great and very helpful.

name: Bela Kalinova
review: If you have excellent credit and love rewards then this is the right card for you. Your search can now end. There are so many programs and rewards with this card that it is hard to count all of them in one review. All I have to say is get this card. I was so thrilled at receiving a free 2 night stay, after I unknowingly qualified. You can redeem points for almost anything, for example you can choose between airline miles, travel or hotel stays. This card is great for anyone who loves to have a great time.  Highly recommended.

name: Lisa Baer
review: Like a lot of other reviewers here, I got suckered into the opening offer deal. I got 150 dollars for opening up a Chase checking account. I had to maintain a minimum balance for 6 months of at least 1,500 and if I went below it then they would have charged me $12.00 a month! I think that people might get angry with chase because of their high rates/charges, but I never had an issue with them, simply because I listened to their rules and obeyed them. It was all really painless and I'm glad I banked with them because they do have a nice customer service team (I only had to call them once for just basic questions) and they really are trying to cater to us (even if the fees seem a bit underhanded.) I highly recommend Chase!

name: Jason Farina
review: Me and my wife absolutely love this card. We got this card several years ago when my kids were younger. We started going to Disney World when my daughter was 2 1/2 years old. we made it an annual trip up until last year (my daughter is 12 now). We got this card for the Disney Rewards Dollars which can be used for theme park tickets, dining plans, souvenirs, at the Disney Store or any Disney location. you also get 15% off (I think) when you use it at a Disney owned store The APR is kind of high but we pay it off every month. We've put most of our monthly bills on it to get more reward dollars. We also like the pictures on the cards. So if you're a Disney fan, you'll love this card.

name: Alyxandra Ramsey
review: If you have an excellent credit rating, then the Chase Freedom card is a great deal.  There's no annual fee and the interest rate is pretty competitive.  It comes with some great rewards as well.  Not only can you earn $100 back in bonus cash for making $500 in purchases in your first few months of opening your account, but you'll also get 5% cash back on purchases made at different stores which change every three months.  If you don't shop at any of the stores within those special offers, you'll still earn cash back on all your other purchases, just not as much.  It's always fun to see what the new offers are every few months though!

name: Corey Schain
review: I just got Chase Sapphire a few months ago and couldn't be happier with the card. It's a rewards card, so the APR isn't the lowest, but it is completely manageable. If you spend 500 dollars in the first three months they give you back 100 dollars! Yes that's right, 100 dollars. They have great rewards for eating out at restaurants and even have a flat cashback rate for everything at 1%. This was the first card I tried to apply for and I got approved, so I am very greatly. I have nothing bad to say about Chase Sapphire.

name: Nick Davis
review: The Amazon store card is very good. I have been using it for over a year and no complaints. Setting up an online account is easy and fast. The company started me off with a generous amount of credit. The most i ever got from any company. They tie the Amazon Store card to your shopping account so making purchases is fast. The interest rate is low and no annual fees. The company gives you a lot of options for your card. You can ask for more credit for example. A lot of privacy settings to keep your account and card safe. I recommend the card for anyone who is a huge fan of the company.

name: William
review: I have been with Chase for several months now, and so far I have had a very positive experience both with my checking and my savings. The fees are great in that they don't happen as long as I keep a certain reasonable balance, and the access is easy and straightforward, far better than some of the previous experiences I have had with other big banks particularly in the 2000's decade. I love the user friendly layout on their online banking site, and there are many branches in decent locations as far as convenience goes. I would recommend this to just about everyone, as the savings is straightforward and the customer service is also pretty good!!!!

name: Alexis Beth
review: I joined Chase Bank several years ago after their "100 for joining" promotion. I had actually come into the bank for a completely other reason: to exchange my Euros for USD, but got suckered into sitting down with a rep. I'm glad I did! Chase is a great bank and I always have the feeling that my savings account is safe and sound. Their customer service is outstanding, their account options are great, and you can tell that they really care about the well-being of their patrons. I love that I can also take a photo of a check and deposit it through my iPhone!

name: Jenna Boone
review: The Ink Bold Business card is more of a debit card with rewards than a credit card. Since the balance has to be paid in full at the end of the month, you do not accrue interest which is nice but some businesses need to have an actual credit card because you may not have a 30 day turnaround time for your profits to pay it back. Other than that, the reward points are fantastic and the highest I have seen recently for a card. It would be worth it if you were putting all of your expenses that you had to pay anyway onto the card as long as you had the ability to pay the balance off within one billing cycle.  I would choose this card over the American Express Business Card (which has a comparable rewards offer) a much higher annual fee of $175.

name: Tyler Swope
review: This card is pretty good. They gave me a free gift card for signing up with them. You gain points for shopping with Amazon. I have used the card for six months and shop regularly with amazon. I have already built up enough points to get another 20 dollars towards amazon. The card itself is very cool. It came within a few days and activating it was hassle free. Its a blue/yellow card with vibrant colors. The interest with the card is very reasonable. Customer service has been good, and have not had any problems when I need questions addressed. I would recommend this card to anyone who uses amazon a lot, likes good service, and a low interest rate.

name: Elizabeth Madore
review: This card is awesome.  I buy things from Amazon all the time, so it's nice to gain points for doing so.  The interest is quite reasonable, but of course that is based on your credit rating.  Their customer service has been good, and I was late on my payment once accidentally, and they waived the late fee for me.  When I signed up I got an immediate thirty dollar bonus, and I do mean immediate (once you're approved).  So, I would definitely recommend this card to anyone who shops on Amazon on a regular basis, or just wants an all around good card.

name: Dan G
review: This card is a card I would stay away from unless you really want to try it. Initially you might be enticed by the chance for flight rewards and no initial annual fee, but this card is catered to the wealthy. After your first year with this card you will be forced to pay 95$ a year just to keep your service with them. During your use of this card you will want to fly as this is the main benefit of this, but to get some decent rewards you must spend thousands to get anywhere. Anyone may obtain a Travel together ticket every year, but to do so you must spend 30,000+ each year, and in my opinion that is outrageous. If you fly very very frequently for business and get compensated back, or if you just have lots of expendable money You should look into this card more, otherwise I wouldn't suggest it. I like getting rewards slowly and surely like what the Amazon CC provides, but this is just a whole different standard of living difference!

name: Dan G
review: Hyatt's credit card is an extremely specific card, and I only recommend it to a select few and I will tell you why. The Hyatt is a pretty well known hotel company with locations all over which is convenient for the traveler which is the only person I would advise get this card. I am a person who likes to stay in one location and not travel to often so this is not the card for me, but if you like getting out and about, renting hotels this could be helpful. Pros are you get an initial bonus of 2 free nights which is really nice, and there is no initial annual fee, which leads me to the cons. Things I dislike about this is the annual fee of 75$ after year 1, and that to even be qualified to use this card you need Excellent credit. I prefer more rewarding cards with a wider range of options than this one, but I guess if you really do love the Hyatt then check this card out.

name: Jonah Tanner
review: This amazon card is great. I had the Amazon.com card that wasn't a visa before and this one is far better than it.  You can use it as a normal credit card and earn bonus rewards on amazon. The bonus $30 amazon card is also a great addition.  The points really add up quickly and help you save on future amazon purchases a lot. It also has better rates which is nice as well.  With it's it great versatility and rewards program it is hard to go wrong, this is definitely one of the better credit cards out there and much better than the other amazon card. I would recommend this card, especially if you are a frequent shopper at amazon.com.

name: Lily Yee
review: I get mail about this card at least every two weeks. I know people that have this card. I figure it won't hurt to get it so I did. I liked the cash back very much. In ways this card is similar to most cash back cards. It automatically redeems the points for you. What I don't like about this card is the 5% categories, it can sometimes be home and improvement which is useless to me. My favorite is 5% on the gas station since gas is super expensive.  I closed this card once the free period was over. I end up with a higher APR and I never paid late but I didn't want to risk it. What I like about this card is that I don't have a checking account at Chase but I could still get online banking. It was easy to manage my balances. Some banks only offer online banking to people with checking accounts.

name: Thomas Burke
review: I've had one of these for a while and like it a lot. It's really geared for travel, though I use the points mostly for rental cars since I love to drive and hate the airlines. Even the cash advance rate is lower than the basic interest rate for many cards these days. It takes pretty good credit to qualify though, but they give really big lines of credit. Every time I call them, the people are really super nice and professional. The 15.24% is really great if you have the credit score to get one of these, highly recommend it. Just remember to put $3,000 through it the first 90 days, I almost forgot to in order to get the big point bonus.

name: Jennifer Oliphant
review: We use this credit card for all business travel.  The rewards from this card combined with our regular Marriott rewards has made it so that we never have to pay for a hotel.  We even went for a week long vacation last year, and covered all of the hotel need with our rewards.  The rate is a little high, but we pay it off monthly, so it doesn't really matter.  The annual fee has paid for itself many times over in free hotel stays.  I don't know if it would be worth it without our business expenses.  We get refunded for everything we put on the card.  In order for the rewards to accumulate to a worthwhile level, you really have to put a lot on the card.

name: abigail lee
review: The Marriott credit card is great for traveling. I mainly opened this credit card because they had a limited time offer that you can earn 40,000 bonus points after spending $1,000 in your first 3 months and then you will also get a $100 credit after my first purchase. I was immediately thrown away by this deal. I use this all the time to book my flights and I get so much points for hotel and airfares. Definitely a great one to have and their deals is also great. You can redeem the points to book a hotel room at all the Marriott hotels all over the world. It is a great way to spend money and get rewarded for them as well.

name: Lily Yee
review: I found this credit card through mail advertisement. I really get lured into the bonus. It is really easy for me to spend $500 in 3 months. I like to redeem my rewards for cash back or gift cards. When I opened this card I used it to pay for a big bill ( tuition) and I was glad I did. Since I got enough points for $30 and I got my $100 bonus. There is no doubt that I am satisfied with this card. I find this card to be similar to the BoA cash rewards (3-2-1) card. I wish I would get more points on gas. I mean it's okay since that's what Fred Meyers and Safeway shopping points are for.  My only complaint is this card looks very similar to my Chase slate card. I often get them confused. I do not use this card for purchases I can not pay off since the interest is not cheap.

name: abigail lee
review: The chase freedom is a great credit card. I like how they give you different types of 5% cash back categories every 3 months. Sometimes I would get 5% at starbucks for three months or sometimes it would be for select department stores. Right now they have 5% on amazon.com purchases and I can use it to buy textbooks. It is a great savings for students. I can also get my holiday gifts for friends and families and know that I am getting 5% cash back. I also like how they give you a $100 bonus if you spend over $500 in three months. Not a bad deal.

name: Tiffany Schintzius
review: I opened my Chase account when it was still Washington Mutual. I had a horrible experience with another bank and they were quick to help me out here and get me set up and started fresh with a new bank. They also offered me a credit card to go along with my account. All of the staff was super friendly and their banks were set up different than most I went in, which I liked. After they became Chase, there were some changes to the set up and how my account was, but they kept the same customer service and were quick to help me with any issues I had with my account. The only reason I closed my account was because my student account time ended and I didn't have the funds to pay the monthly fee at the time and my family was at a bank with no fees.

name: Rob Mid
review: Chase is a decent bank but I think there are better out there. I do like that they don't addon any checking account fees until 25- I think that gives a lot of younger people a break but admittedly I'm afraid to see the fees after I come of age. I've tried getting a a pre paid credit card from them but they always turn me down but never say why exactly. I've asked outright and they always seem to beat around the bush. The best thing I like about this bank isn't really anything about their customer service or whatnot, I just like that it's in a good location for me and they have a lot of ATM's nearby that I can use.

name: Jay Freiheit
review: This charge card has to have its balance paid off each month. That is an important factor when considering it over a credit card. The $95 annual fee (after the first year) is an expensive charge. The flexible spending capacity is an interesting aspect that may be appealing to some but what really sells this card is the bonus points that are awarded. A start-up business could do well making their purchases with this card because there is a bonus 50,000 points awarded if you spend $5,000 in the first month. Chase gives you the option of $20 back for every 2,000 points or it can be applied to your statement, so that is quite a substantial amount of savings if you were going to spend the money anyways and you used this card.

name: Mike Doe
review: I have used Chase checking for over two years now, and although I have never really had to visit them for an issue I have had, I also can't say I have had many issues that couldn't be simply resolved with a quick phone call. The account is pretty standard and I did like the fact that I could open it up even before turning 18 and have it transfer over to an adult account on my birthday with no additional steps needed. It gets the job done and is my only checking account, and as long as it stays the way it is I see no reason to switch banks or add another account.

name: Jordan L.
review: I signed up for the Ritz Carlton Credit Card (via Chase) a few months ago thinking it was the best credit card one could find.  While some of the concierge services they provide, the few times I have contacted them, I have been placed on delayed wait times for someone to answer the phone.  Some of the rewards are terrific though: 3 annual upgrades to Club Lounges when staying at a Ritz Carlton, up to $200 in checked bag fees reimbursed, and access to hundreds of airport lounges.  At $395/year though, you'd assume there would never be a wait time when calling the 800 service line.  Great potential, but not quite there.

name: Shakia Dugue
review: I have been a Chase Bank customer for the past 6 years and overall I enjoy having Chase Bank.  I have 5 Checking accounts with them which include an account for each of my four children, and a Savings account.  My only issue with them is the savings account.  They have the account setup where I am limited to a maximum of 5 activities in the Savings account per month.  After the 5th transaction I will be charged a fee.  I enjoy the serves for the Checking accounts, but I am considering closing the Savings.  I would recommend a Checking account but not a Savings account.  Their customer service practices are great also!

name: Ben
review: I have been banking with Chase for a few years now, and I can honestly say I've never had a single issue with them. Signing up for the account was very easy and painless, it only took about 10 or 15 minutes. Their online banking is awesome and really convenient. I use it to pay certain bills automatically so I don't have to remember to do it. They have locations almost everywhere which is nice, too. Whenever I need to go in to get something done or make an inquiry about my account, the employees are always very professional and friendly. Overall, I'd highly recommend Chase.

name: Aaron Garcia
review: This was one of the first credit cards I got. It is equipped with blueprint which  should help you pay off certain purchases faster. I haven't really looked into that however since I pay my credit card off right away. Once in awhile I get deals sent to me where if I borrow money the apr will be very low. These are in check forms and might be useful for some. I don't particularly like this card because as far as I know, I don't get any sort of points on it. I like to use credit cards that have points and then pay off my purchases immediately. The design of the card is pretty cool as the numbers aren't raised and the design is vertical versus horizontal.

name: Anita Garcia
review: I got an offer in the mail where by signing up for the card and using it, I would receive an extra amount of points. I believe it was $200 worth. We used this money to go to Disneyland. I loved being able to pick my favorite character for the card, Tinker Bell!  It would always be a discussion when I presented the card to pay. The amount of points you get for purchases thereafter is not substantial, it's about 1%. However, it is great to charge certain things on this to be my Disney Store or Disneyland allotment. I also like the discount I get at the Disney Store since I shop there anyway.

name: Stephen Marth
review: If you are a fan of Disney, you will be a fan of the Disney Premier Credit Card. While the APR is average, you can choose different disney images for the card itself, which is great. The best part of the card would have to be the point system. You can earn Disney points which can be redeemed in Disney stores, or even better, at Disneyland or Walt Disney World! The card is made by Chase, and their mobile application on my iPhone is great to use. Their customer service is great and I've never had problems. Minus the APR not being the greatest, I have to say I truly love this card and it has saved me so much money at Disney Parks!

name: Mary Stansfield
review: The amazon card is great. The points system is very useful, I use my amazon card for all my purchase on amazon.com to get the points. I like that it can be used anywhere, and that you get points for any purchase. The points vary depending on the purchase with 1, 2, or 3 points per dollar spent. It's 3 points on any amazon purchase, 2 on gas, restaurants and drug stores, and 1 one everything else. It adds up really fast. I've bought quite a few things using only points. It's basically like any cash-back rewards card, but geared towards amazon.com. It's like getting paid to shop.

name: Lisa Marotta
review: I have used this card for many years.  It is a great card, and offers 1% cash back on all of my purchases.  Every quarter they also offer 5% back in different categories such as gas, grocery stores, or certain merchants like Amazon.com.  Customer service is pretty good, I have not had to call in to them that often but the times I have, they have always been courteous and able to answer my questions.  I like that I can view my statements online, and I can pay through online banking instead of having to mail in a check.  I especially like that there is no annual fee with this card.

name: Alex Steven
review: The Marriott Rewards card surprised me with how good it was. The rewards truly are great. Marriott is a great hotel and is known by many, and the amount of points one can rack up and use is great. Just by spending $1000 in the first few months will get you 4 free nights! That's a whole weekend getaway vacation for most. Customer service is also great with them. If you travel a lot and don't mind marriott, this is the card for you. Plus, APR is pretty low compared to most other cards, and the grace period of 3 weeks is pretty typical of other cards.

name: Laurie Comer
review: I have banked with Chase since they merged with Bank One, a little over 9 years ago. I have had excellent customer service in the branch office closest to my home. I frequently use the drive-thru window for deposits, and they are fast and courteous. They have helped me replace lost ATM/debit cards on a couple of occasions. I have also used them to withdraw money and print cashier's checks. They are always cheerful and helpful. I don't have any trouble with my checking account. The terms are fair, and I have no complaints. I would recommend Chase bank checking accounts to my friends and family.

name: betheny smith
review: I love my Disney card. It has so many extra features for use with the Disney parks.I was thrilled with the 15% off on my first purchase. I shop at the Disney store a lot due to having two children.You can earn Disney points to redeem in the Disney stores. They work the same as cash. You can also save your points if you like and use them when you go to Disney and redeem them for park tickets, dine plans and much more! The card has a fun appearance. The interest rate is on the high side but I have seen much higher. Pay off the bill with each statement and avoid all of the interest charges.

name: Lily Orret
review: I've used my Chase freedom Card for about 6 years. I think this is one of the best rewards cards out there. They have the best cash back. Chase is a wonderful company with a great customer service and the chase Credit Cards are the best!!  I love my freedom Credit Card. It is my inseparable friend. It didn't have annual fee and very important: rewards never expire.

name: Alex Steven
review: I like the Chase Freedom card a lot. First off, I've been with Chase for over 5 years, since I was around 15. Customer service has always been excellent with them. I like being able to see my statement online. Also, I got $100 free for opening up with them which was great. Also I use amazon very frequently, so getting money back on Amazon purchases is a huge plus!

name: Alex Steven
review: The Hyatt credit card is great. My father has this card. While the annual fee can be steep for some, I feel this card is still worth it. Interest rate is pretty low, and cash advance is also pretty low. I also really like the rewards given with this card. Since the Hyatt is virtually everywhere, and is a luxury hotel, this was a no brainer for us as a family. We love the Hyatt, and the Hyatt bonuses are great and easy to rack up. We recently went to Europe, and had enough points to get a free time in a very high class Hyatt in Paris, France for a few days. Hyatt has always been a great hotel, and I feel it's very easy to gain points to get free nights with this card. If you are a fan of Hyatt and travel frequently, I definitely recommend this card to you.

name: Alex Steven
review: This is a decent card. I just don't like the eventual annual fees. The first year has no annual fees, but that year goes by fast. Some travel cards have no annual fees whatsoever. However, if you use BritishAirways or have a fondness toward them, then this card will probably suit you very well, since they do offer some pretty great rewards, and it feels like it's very easy to get bonus points. The initial bonus is awesome as well! But still, I just don't use BritishAirways too much, so this card isn't very useful for me personally, hence why I had to drop 2 stars out of the 5.

name: Robert Blau
review: This is an excellent card with numerous rewards for dining and travel experiences.  Cardholders receive double rewards points every time they use their card at any dining facility, regardless of whether it's fast food or fine dining.  Members also get double points for all travel expenses, allowing you to accrue a substantial amount of points when you use the card on trips.  These two benefits, combined with the 7% annual points dividend offer easily offsets the annual fee associated with holding the card.  This is my go to credit card for every day expenses (especially dining and travel) and I recommend it to anyone looking for a new option for their wallet.

name: Wendy Moore
review: We love our Chase/Amazon credit card. We pair it with an Amazon Prime account to get free two-day shipping. Every purchase on Amazon is 3 points multiplied by the dollar amount spent, and every purchase elsewhere is a point per dollar. We usually get cash-back using our points. 100 points is about a $1, which adds up pretty quickly! We have been able to make purchases simply with the money we earned from our points. It is easy to manage points and spending on our online Chase account.  I find myself encouraging our friends to use a card like this because the benefits are worth it! We couldn't be happier with this card!

name: Dan G
review: Chase has been known to have some pretty good service and deals with their cards, this one is no exception but it still has its flaws. The Ink Bold card has some good rewards like 5 times the points per dollar for the first 50,000$ you spend on select items, (this will take most a while) so you have a great deal of time to rack up points. The points are 1-1 on travel programs you might be interested which is nice for the adventurous types. On the other hand the Ink Bold has a 95$ annual fee after the first year and your balance MUST be paid in full each month. In the case of this Chase card I would suggest it almost as much as the two credit cards I love; The Amazon and PayPal cards. All three of these have some great rewards, advantages, and slight disadvantages but are definitely worth it!

name: Daniel Lopez
review: I started with Chase more than three years ago.  I could not be happier with Chase Total Checking.  I previously had three checking accounts and none of them could ever match up with the satisfaction I get from this one.  I don’t have to worry about a service charge because of my weekly direct deposits and beingere is always a Walgreen’s pharmacy around the corner which provide a Chase ATM.  The website is easy to use and helps me pay my bills, pay other people and keep track of where my money is going to.  Chase is awesome and I would recommend that everyone give this checking account a look.

name: Jaimi Guido
review: I love my Chase banking experiences. I have three accounts with them (a checking for myself, a joint checking with my boyfriend & a savings account) & would recommend them to anyone. You can start an account online, which is awesome because who looks forward to trips to the bank? On the rare occasions I have to go inside a branch, there is never a wait of more than ten minutes. You don't even have to have ID as long as you have your ATM + PIN. They also have the best theft prevention -- I went to a new bar, spent more than I usually did in *any* bar & got a text from Chase checking up on me. (Of course, I ended up being too drunk to respond & got that card locked for the night, but better sorry & safe than easy & broke, right?)

name: Anne Schafer
review: I really, really love my bank. They're very clear to me, and quick to get any problems resolved. Furthermore, everyone always dresses and acts very professionally. Whenever I come in for any of their services, they are always happy to help. When I was seeking help on rebuilding my credit, I got to sit down with an adviser and discuss my options. But the big thing is the freedom I have with my checking account - I've not once been in the negative since signing up with Chase because it's so easy to maintain my account. Also, I love the apps that I can use in order to make a deposit or get any account balance for my checking account at any time. I can even take a picture of my check and it will be deposited the same day! I love my bank!

name: Derek Stephens
review: I like the Chase Freedom card because of the many benefits it offers compared to other cards I've used.  Once I switched to this card I transferred a balance to it and cancelled my other credit card.  Why stick with a card that charges an annual fee, and doesn't offer any kind of grace period?  The interest rate is comparable or better than most other cards I've been offered, and I like that I had already earned a $100 dollar bonus within 3 weeks of opening the account.

name: Michael Staino
review: If you frequently shop at Amazon.com (and who doesn't?) this card should definitely be on your mind.  Getting 3 points for every $1 spent on the website is great.  It's also not a bad deal for Amazon, but both parties win with this card.  What's also great is that you can redeem the points right at checkout, and with the amount that you want.  You aren't forced to use them all at once.  I will say that the other rewards aren't great, and if you don't shop at Amazon.com often enough, you can probably steer away from this card.  But if you do love Amazon, highly consider this credit card!

name: Bela Kalinova
review: I really like the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card. I use it for daily purchases. Although this card has many upsides, such as ease of usability (it is accepted at most places I go to), there are a few downsides. The grace period is only 21 days. I have had cards with grace periods up to 30 days, so 21 just doesn't cut it for me.  Also, the max penalty APR rate is a bit high. All in all, a good card. Not the best though. I would recommend it to those still in the process of building a good credit report.

name: Justin Voss
review: I have been banking with Chase since 2004 and could not be any happier.  I started when they ran a free checking account promotion where they gave me $100 for opening the account.  Since then I have opened up an additional savings account and gotten an auto loan through them.  They do not tend to charge me lots of fees or require anything out of the ordinary.  They keep their mistakes minimal and their customer service is top notch, correcting any errors or issues that I have had with them.  I would certainly recommend checking out a CHASE bank if you are in the market for a new institution.

name: betheny smith
review: I do not like the $75 annual fee after the first year. I also think if you are charging such a high fee the interest rates should not be so high. This card requires an excellent credit score but no incentives/ rewards worth applying in my opinion. After reviewing my other credit cards I do not think the rewards or the percentage is saving enough or have enough perks to switch over. If there wasn't an annual fee I would definitely reconsider. The Hyatt perks for staying at a Hyatt would not be beneficial to me in anyway considering I do not travel enough to take advantage of it. I have reviewed every pro and con for this card and have come to the conclusion that this just isn't the card for me.

name: jesse
review: The British Airways Visa Signature credit Card is an OK credit card. I do like the zero annual fee for the first year. It going up to 95 dollars a year would make me cancel it the next year though. That's way to much! This card doesn't have a low intro rate but the credit card rate it self is some what low. It really has some great travelers rewards though. If you fly a lot this is the card you might want to get. You also have to have high credit score to get this card. It doesn't have foreign transaction fee at all, so that's great. I have the Capital One Venture One Rewards Credit Card and it has very similar rewards. It doesn't have a annual fee though, at all. That really is the big fall for this card. This is a decent credit card but I would not recommend it. There are much better travelers credit cards out there.

name: Takela Bellamy
review: Sadly...you cant apply for this card online,  There are no CHASE banks here in Columbia, SC.....TRULY dissappointed :-(

name: jesse
review: The Ink Bold Business Card is completely awesome compared to my U.S. Bank Business Cash Rewards credit card. I have a very small business and these rewards and perks would be great for me. You do have to have an excellent credit rating to get the Ink Bold Business Card though. This card has no annual fee for the first year and 95 dollars after that. Which is reasonable for what it offers. It also has no foreign transaction fees. My card has a 12.99 APR on it which is kinda of low, which is great and you can pay it off at your pace. This card you have to pay the balance at the end of every month. I would recommend this card if you can qualify for it.

name: Nadia Hickerson
review: The Disney credit card is great.  I made my first purchase with this card on the Disney Store website.  I got 15% off my first purchase and the card took 50 dollars off my purchase also, which was perfect since it was Christmas time.  You are also rewarded with points for your purchases on the card.  For every 100 dollars you accrue, you receive 1 point in Disney Rewards.  One point equals 1 dollar.  These points can be redeemed at the Disney Store and specific places on Disney property.  I used my points to take my daughter to the Bippity Boppity Boutique.  I also love that there are no annual fees.

name: Rob Doe
review: The Amazon.com Credit Card is great! I mean really this is amazing, I shop at Amazon.com all the time so this is a wonderful thing. I mean I'm going to be shopping there anyways i might as well start earning some points in the process especially at these great point rates. Three points for every dollar spent is great I'll earn so many points so quickly this way. Then add on top of that 2 points for every eligible $1 spent at gas stations, restaurants, and drugstores. I'll be getting so much extra stuff just from these things. Like i said i'll be buying from Amazon.com anyways now i'll get even more out of my shopping experience than i ever did before. Defiantly recommend this card.

name: Jeremy Arotsky
review: I love Chase Sapphire. I myself have Chase Sapphire Preferred, and it's currently my go-to card. I eat out a lot from fast food to restaurants, and the two points per dollar thing is what really drew me to this, plus I'm already a Chase customer so payments are incredibly easy. Would highly recommend.

name: Shawn Pennick
review: I am "credit card" adverse since the biggest thing with credit cards is they make a lot of money because you do not have money to pay for something when you buy it and they usually makes tons off people because of that BUT, this is a great card.  If you shop on Amazon (and who doesn't) this is sure to be worth it. Sure you get points when shopping with certain merchants, or 1 point in general, but it is on Amazon where the 3 points per $1 really stack up fast. The card is linked to your account so that you can apply the points as a gift card easily.  The APR is the grace period and fees are all very reasonable.  Nothing too high or outrageous so if you want to get a card for improving your credit history this is definitely one to get.

name: Rob Doe
review: The Chase Freedom card has many perks that has drawn me to choosing it over other cards. The no annual fee is a big one, i never understand why anyone would choose a card with an annual fee when there are great cards like this with no annual fee at all. Also the fact that the rewards never expire when with other cards they do, why would you choose anything else really? Earning the $100 bonus is super easy too because who doesn't spend at least $500 in three months? It's really a free $100 because there is no way you can't get it really. The APR is pretty good as well, not the best but not the worst and besides it's 0% for 15 months anyways. The  5% categories every 3 months like gas stations, restaurants and Amazon.com is amazing because these are all useful things unlike some cards that offer things to places i would never shop at or need anyways. All in all this is a great card that i recommend to the fullest.

name: Kyle Irving
review: Chase is a great bank, they don't charge that many fees and they're always willing to work with you if you get an overdraft charge, or if there are faulty payments made on your account. I have a checking account with them and their agents are always on the ball and ready to assist me. Whenever I go into one of their branches, they always feel like they make me at home and that i'm part of the chase family. For one of the big banks I think they arent deceptive and generally an overal great company to have a checking account with.

name: Alex Davis
review: I like banking with Chase. Signing up with them was an easy process, and as I college student was free. They have the most ATMs available in the city of Chicago, which makes depositing and withdrawing cash and checks easy for me no matter where I go. Their Quick Pay feature makes it easier than ever for me to send and receive money with my family and friends. It's probably my favorite feature that they offer. I enjoy using their Chase iOS app to check my funds, and also easily deposit checks or check the status of my Quick Pay receipts. They also offer a good fraud protection system that will immediately alert me when they fear my bank account has been comprised (it never has been). All in all a good experience thus far with no hiccups.

name: Sidhu Ram
review: I was drawn to this card due to the reward I saw on the first page of the T&C - "Earn $100 Bonus Cash Back after you make $500 in purchases in your first 3 months from account opening" and last year when I wanted to buy a lens for my SLR which would cost about $600, I decided to apply for this card as well, so that I might save big on the lens. I had a good credit rating then, so is now, and so I was eligible for the card. I simply love the cash back feature of this card, which offers $1 on other purchases. The reward points never expire and what more can i ask for!

name: Corrina Hillegeist
review: In my opinion the Marriott Rewards card is one of the best available rewards cards on the market today for those with good credit. The rewards you can earn make using this card more much more affordable than most, especially for frequent travelers. You can earn 3 points for each dollar spent at Marriot locations, 1 point for each dollar you spend everywhere else, and more. I also really love that there is no limit on the points you can earn. There's really nothing I don't like about this card. The only other card I would recommend for earning maximum rewards for frequent travelers would have to be the Marriott Rewards Premier card.

name: Christopher Jarrett
review: I love the perks.  Chase Sapphire offers 2% back.  I am not a fan of the interest rates but that is what you sacrifice for having a credit card from such a big bank.  I hadn't received my $100-travel rewards after spending the $500. I called in and they credit me right away. Chase overall is a great bank, but I try not use credit often.  I am definitely more comfortable using my Chase Sapphire card, than any other card I've had.  It is very safe and I love the bonus points. I have over 90,000.  They are pretty quick to send you gift cards if you redeem them.  I would definitely recommend Chase Sapphire to others.

name: jose ortega
review: Ive been with chase for over 3 years now, I cant say anything good really, the customer service sucks and it just feels to me like they want to hang up the phone on you rather than solve an issue. i had money in my account accidently deposited in my savings that's linked to my checking and it caused me to go overdraft instead of them reimbursing me i had to pay the 35 dollar fee even though it was clearly their mistake in putting the money in the wrong account. I do however like that fact they offer free checking if you have direct deposit but then again a lot of others do that now. I really wish I could stay with this company however the bank is a little out of my way about 30 minutes drive and I cannot find another one closer to me.

name: Jordan Webb
review: The Ink Bold Business Card is really only worth it if you’re able to spend a huge amount of money. Spending $5,000 in the first three months awards you with a substantial amount of cash back, but that’s a huge amount of money to spend! Maybe these rewards can be feasible if you’re making a big purchase, otherwise you may want to avoid this one altogether! The lack of an annual fee is pretty nice, and there is a pretty nice spending limit. However, like I said you have to spend an absurd amount of money for this card to be worth it.

name: Lily Yee
review: The card itself is not bad but the customer service is terrible. I was attracted to the balance transfer deal. Most balance transfers cost 3% of the transfer amount. This card is 0%. However to do the balance transfer I had to call chase customer service. They told me that they don't send credit card checks for this process. Which I thought was strange since BoA and US Bank has credit card checks for customers who want to do balance transfers. When I did my balance transfer the agent asked a lot of information and they told me they never heard of keybank.
