They asked me a lot of strange verification information like where did I lived in 1998 and what was my first car. This whole process took at least 30 minutes and it was 9PM. I like the 0% APR since that allows me to pay off any outstanding debt without the interest charge.The design of this card is quite unique. It is easy to identify from the back and the front. I wish there was  a cash back services associated with this card. The other benefits of this card seem useless to me. Zero liability and fraud protection is what all credit cards offer.

name: Sidhu Ram
review: Whooping $95 a year for holding the credit card is a touch too high! Though there are quite a few bonus offerings being made, they are all only for purchases above a certain limit which would never fit my bill anytime soon! However, it does seem like a decent option for those travelling abroad, as there are no transaction fees being levied for foreign transactions. However, I still prefer to use my Chase Credit card as that offers better value for money! I get better points for the Chase card for far fewer purchases and the price for holding the card year on year is really really low compared to the British Airways!

name: Jonathan Doebly
review: The Hyatt credit card is a great card. I was a little put off at first when I saw the 75 dollar a year fee after the first year but then I looked a little deeper. Compared to my Capital one card even with a 75 dollar fee it's still a better card. The interest rate is lower at 15 percent and the cash advance is lower then 20 percent and you almost never see that. The bonuses are even better on my Hyatt card. Altogether it makes for a great card that I almost skipped over due to the fee which doesn't even happen until the second year.

name: Jennifer Foster
review: I have been a member of Chase bank for five years now with a checking account. I really like the bank because it was very easy to set up an account. I only needed to deposit $20 to open the count. I do think that there is a downside because they do charge you a monthly fee if you don't have "enough" money that is deposited. I like the security feature. I am contacted if any fishy behavior is happening to my account, and have been reimbursed immediately whenever I had an individual steal money from my account. I would definitely give them a thumbs up.

name: Fritter Foof
review: At the very same time I had decided to leave my previous bank, I received a flyer in the mail advertising Chase would pay new customers $250 to open a checking account.  Additionally, the checking account was free if you have a direct deposit, which I did. For me that was a no-brainer, I knew right away I would change to Chase.  When I opened my account they couldn't have been nicer or more thorough.  It is an absolute pleasure dealing with their customer service/support representatives.  I received the $250 credit to my account in about 60 days, what a great deal. The $250 deal has passed, but I recall seeing one not long ago that they were giving $200 to open an account.  It is definitely worth watching Chase's website for deals such as this, I've not seen such good deals at ANY other banks.

name: Ric Rogers
review: The Marriott Rewards Credit Card is a great certified Visa card if your credit rating is in good standing.  This is a great card for the traveler, due to the bonus incentives it affords.  I am a frequent traveler, and usually stay at Marriott hotels, so based on the points earned, I can even earn free nights!  I had a similar card with incentives like this, but it took an exorbitant amount of hotel stays to even get half of what this card is offering as a bonus!  The penalty APR is something you need to keep tabs on, but otherwise I would recommend this card!

name: Janice Krone
review: My favorite credit card to use is the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card. It has many perks and benefits, which is why it's my go to credit card. The rewards on this card are great. After spending $3,000 after opening my account I earned 40,000 bonus points immediately. I do a lot of traveling and this card gives me 2x points on travel and restaurants. Not just that, but I get 20% off on airfare, hotels, and car rentals. I spend several weeks out of the year in different countries, and this credit is great to use outside the U.S. because there is no foreign transaction fee. The annual fee is rather high, at $95, but the earned rewards more than cover it. I'd recommend this card to anyone.

name: Ben Matthews
review: The Chase Freedom card have some perks that make it stand out from other credit cards out there.  They have a nice sign up bonus of $100 for simply spending $500 within the first three months.  This is relatively easy to obtain just by making every day purchases.  Where this card shines is the rotating categories every quarter that you have to sign up for online.  For example, 5% back at Amazon during the holiday season of October, November and December!  You really can't beat those type of deals when they come up, so it's worth having in your wallet so you are ready when a good one comes up.

name: Ben Matthews
review: The Chase Sapphire Card is great for spending money on your groceries and restaurants, as they offer 2% back every single day which is great.  The card has no annual fee either, so you don't need to worry about spending enough to justify an annual fee which is really nice.  On top of that they have a $100 sign up bonus when you spend $500 within the first 3 months which is a nice perk.  Personally I think that the 1% back on every day purchases is kind of low when Capital One VentureOne offers 1.25% back on all purchases.  You'll need to look at your purchases and determine how much you spend on food and if this card is worth having.

name: Lucas Jaeger
review: This is a wonderful card! I received the $100 bonus after spending the required $500 and used it to get ahead on bills. I love the cash back feature that this card has - I typically use is for gas for my vehicles. I also love the Chase customer service team, as they are always willing to help out with any issues that may arise. I recently had my credit card number stolen somehow and Chase was quick to take care of the fraudulent charges and make sure my account was back in good standing. By far my favorite card to use and it is accepted almost everywhere!

name: Ben Matthews
review: If you shop at Amazon then this card is a no brainer.  The Amazon Credit Card offers 3% back at all purchases made on Amazon.com which is huge.  None of the other cards I've seen give this much back at Amazon.  You also can get 2% back at gas stations, restaurants, and drugstores, and 1% everywhere else.  There is a small sign up bonus of $30, but where this card shines is being able to redeem at checkout with Amazon.  No more ordering a gift card, waiting for it to arrive, and remembering to spend it.  You can use your rewards immediately.

name: Ben Matthews
review: The Chase Ink Bold Card has some nice perks if you own a business or simply spend a lot of money.  This card has one of the biggest introductory bonuses I've ever seen.  If you spend $5,000 in the first three months they'll give you $625 worth of rewards.  That's just insane... this card is almost worth it for the sign up bonus alone if you have the high credit score to get it and spend almost $1,700 a month on your credit card.  They also offer 5% back on office supplies, cellular phone, landline, internet, and cable TV services.  Keep in mind that this card does have a $95 annual fee which is very high, so you might want to take a closer look at your credit card bills and see if it's worth it.

name: Alex Whitehouse
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card has many perks that certain types of people will find very valuable.  I myself was looking for a card with no international usage fees as I make frequent business trips to Europe and Asia.  This card perfectly fit the bill.  No more international fees, and the concierge service comes in handy as well.  The reward points cover the annual fee in my case, so it’s essentially a free account.  You can cash in the reward points to help pay the balance, or as a cash deposit into your bank account.  I would definitely recommend this card to others.

name: Richard Thompson
review: I love my Chase Sapphire Preferred Card. The introductory 40,000 points is a great deal, especially when coupled with the 20% rate reduction on things like plane tickets and car rentals when you redeem the points via their ultimate rewards offers. Their APR is fair, and their annual rate is relatively low for a card of this time. I like accruing double points on travel and dining. Also, an unimportant note, but the card itself is metal and has a solid feel to it that makes it seem impressive. I'm looking forward to using this as my primary credit card from now on.

name: Ben Matthews
review: This Hyatt Credit Card has some nice benefits if you are staying at Hyatt hotels a lot.  One of the benefits include 2 nights free after spending $1000 within the first 3 months for example.  You also get 3x Hyatt Gold Points for spending money at the hotels, with 2x points on all purchases relating to your travel (airfare, restaurants, etc.).  The bang for your buck all depends on how good of a hotel you want to stay at, but I'm guessing if you can afford to frequently visit Hyatt hotels you are not exactly worried about stretching those reward points as far as you can.

name: Ben Matthews
review: I personally am not a huge fan of the British Airways Credit Card and would recommend Capital One VentureOne over.  Quite simply, the British Airways card has annual fees, VentureOne does not. Both give you 1.25% on your every day purchases, and both have no foreign transaction fees.  While you get a small bonus of 2.5% back on British Airway plane tickets, you have to buy A LOT of plane tickets in order to break even with the annual fee.  You might even find a cheaper deal going with a non British Airline flight, so you may feel obligated to use them just to get the points.  I would avoid this card, get VentureOne instead.

name: Eric
review: Overall the Amazon.com credit card is great for a frequent shopper of Amazon, because of the triple rewards points.  Plus the $30.00 gift card that is applied to your account is a nice incentive.  The other thing I like about this card is that there is no annual fee, unlike other cards I have used in the past like my Chase Sapphire card which charges me $95.00 a year.  However, the one thing I dislike the most about this card is that the interest rates are a little high in comparison to some of the other cards that are available out there.  This is a turnoff for me.  As well as the foreign transaction fees.  If you travel abroad frequently then this is not a great card to take with you because other cards out there do not charge for foreign transactions.  However this is a great card for your domestic shopping on Amazon.

name: Jonathan Doebly
review: This is a great card and my second favorite to my USAA card. When I signed up for my Chase freedom card I got the 100 dollar bonus for spending my first 500 dollars. The same day I got my card I used it on my bills and basically got a 100 dollars of my rent by using it. The cash back bonus only tops out at five but with a lower interest rate than most cards I think it's a good balance. I try to use my card when ever I can to save a little money and then pay it off at the end of the month. One great surprise I had was the 5 percent back worked on Amazon and I've never seen a card with that.

name: Brian Moon
review: If you have to have a credit card and carry debt, this one seems to be a decent one, considered in isolation. No annual fee and offers reward points, including a bonus for use in the first 3 months of ownership. On the down side, there's no introductory interest free period, and they're charging 15.24% APR, so if you carry a balance be prepared to pay a lot in interest over time. And, holy crab, the grace period is only 21 days, not a full month? On a closer examination of the details, I would not recommend this card.

name: ptosis theseus
review: I first got the card because I had a $30 credit  for signing up. The 2 points for every dollar spent at gas stations is not just for gasoline but for any bought at 7-11 or Circle K including beer and cigarettes.  The best part is that you get cash back for ALL purchases and not just for restaurants or hotels like other cards.There used to be a $50 minimum in order to get the cash back. Now can use any amount to use towards credit in paying towards your card balance.

name: Pamela Scheerer
review: Love my Chase card! It has come in handy more than once! I have a great interest rate. None of my other cards compare. I've had my card for about 5 years now and love that there's no annual fee.I also like that they give you reward points on travel and restaurants. I go out of town quite a bit for work and this card definitely comes in handy. I'm able to use it for hotels, restaurants and airlines without feeling like I'm racking up a lot of interest. I certainly recommend this card for those that travel.

name: Andrea Leonard Targonski
review: We've had a Disney Rewards Visa Credit Card for at least five years and we love it. As frequent Disney World visitors, we know we will be able to use the points when on vacation. I put almost everything on this card and then pay it off each month. We have used the points towards our dining plan and annual passes, paying very little out of pocket. This card is a must-have for anyone who plans to travel to Disney. You can even get a rewards card at Downtown Disney once you arrive. The Chase app is super easy to use, too, making it even more convenient.

name: Alex Steven
review: I decided to get the Chase Sapphire card after having Chase as my primary checkings account bank for a few years. I have not looked back yet, this is a fabulous card. Bonus points are very easy to rack up, and I love that you can redeem points for cash back or gift cards! It doesn't have to be for travel. I've earned numerous rewards from this card. Since I eat out a lot this card is especially great for me. No annual fees are another plus. I recommend this card to those who are familiar with Chase, especially those who travel or eat out frequently and purchase many items.

name: Early Nineties
review: I regret using this credit card.  I was using Amazon.com quite a bit for shopping and that's why I got this card.  The thing that troubles me the most is that there only way to pay is through a chase quickpay account.  There are no other options on the amazon FAQ sites.  This was a problem because I already had an existing Chase QuickPay account.  And it was not simple to customize a new one just for this amazon credit card.  Plus, I believe that the interest rates are high, and this card has just been a hassle for me.

name: Andi Robb
review: The Case Ink Bold credit card has a good bonus for the sign up (50,000 points) but you need to make large purchases to get this ($5000 in the first month). The first year there is no annual fee but after that the fee is high at $95 per year and unless you can make large purchases throughout the year it will be hard to cover this. The credit score needed to get this card is high(above 720) so really this card is aimed at people who have a large spending budget and not for the average joe. Overall if you have good credit and spend a lot on supplies then this card is good otherwise look elsewhere.

name: Melanie Campbell
review: I selected the Chase Freedom card when searching for a new credit card because of the flexible cash back option. The TV commercials were clever and brought me to the website where I was impressed by the flexibility of the Chase Freedom Card. I have been able to accurately track my purchases online, and my rewards grow each time I use this card. I love it!

name: ND Cshuoo
review: Chase Freedom is a great credit card to use. 5% cash back on certain items and store and the list changes quarterly. You also get 1% back on EVERYTHING which is awesome. I pay with my card wherever I go and I save 1%. The rewards are great as well, they are not too over priced but it will be a little over priced compared to buying it with real money, but all rewards from credit card companies are like that... The customer service is great as well, I never wait long and when I lost my credit card, they sent me one within 2 days every time!

name: Alan Vincent
review: The Chase Slate Credit card is okay. The 0% APR for 15 months is much longer than most credit cards. This card has all of the regular features that most entry level cards have. This was my first credit card so I was very limited on my options. The only drawback is the lack of rewards that can be received from this card. There are no rewards whatsoever. If they were to do just a 1% cash back, that would be great! Overall, I am a student and this was my first credit card and I have had no problems yet!

name: Lauren Dupps
review: I have only been using this card for several months, but I have gotten a lot of use out of it.  I find the rates to be very reasonable and I love that I have no annual fee.  The cash back is great and proving useful even when I don’t use the card often since the points don’t expire.  The changing rewards categories have their ups and downs.  I have greatly enjoyed getting 5% cash back on gas for example and find it unfortunate that except for this quarter I will only get 1% cash back on gas.  Some of the categories are more useful to me than others so this will vary greatly by individual.

name: Sheryl Papageorgio
review: The Chase Sapphire Card is a nice card to have in your wallet for your every day purchases. Where this card shines is the 2% you get back on travel, dining and restaurants and the 1% you get back on every other purchase.  On top of that you will receive a 7% bonus on all points you earn at the end of the year, even points you redeemed already.  There are also a significant introductory bonus of $400 in rewards when you meet spending requirements.  if you don't mind getting your bonus points at the end of the year you might want to consider this card.

name: ursula kafka
review: Like Chase's other reward cards, the Chase Sapphire Card is one of the best out there. No annual fee and no limit on reward earnings.The interest rate is a little high but who says you need to carry a balance? Your points never expire so what you earn is what you get, and there are plenty of opportunities to earn rewards. You get a nice bonus after your first three months if you spend $500 and twice the points for what you spend at restaurants. Your credit has to be excellent to qualify, though, which can be a bummer for some people.

name: ursula kafka
review: Chase Freedom is a great rewards card. First of all, there's no annual fee. Second, rewards never expire! So many rewards cards out there sound great and then you find out you have to accumulate rewards faster than the speed of light to use them. That's not the case here, you keep what you earn. They also start you out with a nice bonus of $100 and there are lots of categories to earn the 5% cash back in. Rewards add up quickly. The only downside is you have to have excellent credit to qualify, which is hard in this economy.

name: Keith Ham
review: I shop on Amazon quite a bit and thought to check this out. Though I love Amazon's site, the interest rate on this card is extremely high - especially for a cash advance. While I was in Canada, I was used to rates along the lines of 6-10% and that was high for me. The point system is a nice addition, however, this is something you can also get through many other Credit Card Companies.  I'm sure there is great customer support and benefits (such as Apps etc) that would really put this up there with the big-dogs but still, not for me.

name: Jon Fuller
review: This is one of my favorite rewards cards on the market. I love using it for pretty much everything, and since it's a Visa I know it will work everywhere. The rewards points build up pretty quick, and I usually save mine for vacations. They work well for hotel stays, not sure really what else you can use them on aside from hotel stays (I've heard about airline deals but never tried them). Overall I would say this card is an excellent choice for anyone that needs a new card, and specifically for those that love to travel or stay at Marriott regularly.

name: Nic Bishop
review: I shop at Amazon all of the time and usually use my debit card.  However I thought I should open an Amazon card as I can gain points and I am so glad that I did!  No annual fees, I get to shop on Amazon, earn points to buy more items from the site and I also received a $50 gift card!  Anytime I use the card outside of Amazon I also receive points so it is a win win situation for me.  Chase makes it easy for me to make payments on my PC and my iPhone.  I can gain access to my rewards immediately when my statement prints.  This card is a must have if you love Amazon and do a lot of shopping there!!

name: Allen Marshall
review: I love this credit card. My wife and I use it on everything we purchase throughout the year and pay it off each month. At the end of the year we have always saved enough rewards for our family of four to go to Disney for free. All we pay for is the travel (guess what credit card we use then!) and food, hotels, park tickets, and souvenirs are paid for. The interest rate could be lower but honestly I do not keep a balance so it has never been an issue to me. I like the 5000 dollar credit limit because we can spend comfortably throughout the month and not have to worry about having too great of a balance.

name: Travis
review: The Hyatt Credit Card is a great card for someone that does a lot of travelling. The 3 points per every $1 at Hyatt properties is a quick way to rack up points quickly. The initial incentive of 2 free nights after spending $1000 in the first 3 months is a fair deal, as well. However, if you don't travel much or don't utilize Hyatt properties when you do travel, there are likely better options out there. The 15.24% variable rate isn't terrible, but it definitely isn't great either. If you plan to roll any type of balance over from month to month, you should probably think twice about this card. All in all, it's an appealing card for the traveler. For non-travelers, there are much better options out there.

name: jake wine
review: The Chase Freedom card is great! The $100 I received a little after getting my card was awesome and helped a lot. I'm really looking forward to the 5% cash back when I Christmas shop this year (Which I use Amazon for everything). I've had very little problems with my chase card, but when I do have a problem, their customer service is great with helping. It's really helping me up my credit score as well since the monthly payments aren't very much. The cash back is just great, I make sure to always use this card when I'm getting gas or getting groceries. All in all, I would definitely recommend this card to anyone looking for one.

name: Sheryl Papageorgio
review: Before you get the Case Ink Bold Business Card I would consider looking at where you make purchases for your business.  While they offer as much as 5% back, it is only for the office supply category.  The biggest downfall with this card is the $95 annual fee, which is very high for a business credit card.  You will need to be purchasing a lot of office supplies simply to break even with the annual fee on this business credit card.  On the plus side though, they offer a very nice sign up bonus worth $500 ($625 on travel), and combined with waiving the annual fee for the first year, could be worth it for the first 12 months.

name: Josh Kreidler
review: I love my card very much. The 100 dollar bonus I got when I signed up was unexpected and a very nice surprise. The 1% cash back on all purchases is a very nice feature of owning this card, but the best part is earning up to 5% if you use it on the right items. I tend to try to only use this car on items I get at least 4-5% cash back. the 0% APR for the first 15 months is something that I really couldn't pass up on when deciding what new credit card to open. Overall I would say this a great card to get even if you are getting it as your first and only credit card.

name: Sheryl Papageorgio
review: It's hard to judge how good the Marriott Credit Card is because of the variable cost of hotel rooms.  The basics of the card are for 3% back spend at Marriott hotels, and 1% back spend everywhere else.  For signing up and spending $1000 within the first three months, in total you'll receive 6 nights at a hotel for free.  Since not all of us are frequent travelers this might not be the card for you. That's because there are additional perks such as earning your way towards Marriott Elite status, which gives you benefits such as late checkout and free internet access in select hotels.  If you frequently stay at Marriott hotels you might want to consider giving this card a go.

name: Stephen Marth
review: I absolutely love the Chase Freedom card. I had a lot of credit from student loans but they accepted me without any issues. I love the 1% cash back feature it offers on top of what it offers quarterly. The card has special genres it focuses on each quarter and then you get bonus cash back if you use the card then. These categories include gas, restaurants and other fields. Their customer service department is phenomenal and are very helpful if you ever have any problems. They also don't spam me with nonsense and junk like other banks do. I highly recommend this card to anyone who is looking for a new credit card, it won't let you down!!!

name: Kenneth Woolley
review: I really like the Amazon.com credit card. One of the main reasons for getting this card was the $30 Amazon gift card for joining. The rates and fees are competitive to other good credit cards. One downside may be the 3% balance transfer fee. If your in the habit of transferring credit balance you may look elsewhere for cards with zero balance fees. The rewards are great however and build up quickly as you use the card. It's nice to get that and it is really a significant amount. Since I use Amazon for online purchasing this card is really great.

name: Tiffany McLean
review: If you're going to be traveling a lot then the Hyatt Credit Card might be just right for you. You can receive two free nights after you spend $1000 within the first three months. If you're doing a lot of traveling and staying in hotels spending that probably won't be hard at all. You also get a free night every year you have the card. It's a nice incentive. The interest rate isn't too high, but make sure you keep in mind the annual fee. The cash advance rate on this card is much lower than say the Chase Freedom Visa. That'll be helpful when traveling as well. Looks like a good card for the seasoned traveler.

name: Alex Steven
review: I really do like this card. I was initially attracted by this card when it said I would get a free $30 for just choosing this card. You also get money back for your purchases which is really good, especially for those who are constantly ordering items off amazon such as myself. I was able to raise my credit using this credit card which is great as well. My only gripe with this card is that the interest rate is rather high, and the grace period is rather low. Still, I will continue to use this card since I use amazon so much.

name: Tiffany McLean
review: I love airline rewards cards because who doesn't love to travel! The British Airways Visa Signature card seems pretty decent if you're one to travel a lot. It offers a great initial bonus of 50,000 miles unlike that Southwest Credit card that only offers 25,000 points and those don't add up to the miles you'd get. You can also earn miles with the British Airways Visa on other purchases you make every day. This card has the advantage of not having an annual fee for the first year, but I've found that most airline cards have them at some point. The interest rate seems pretty low or if you're going to just pay off your purchase right away that’s even better. Overall this seems like a great card if you plan to travel often.

name: Tiffany McLean
review: The Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards card is a great card to have if you're looking to earn towards flights or if you travel a lot. The signing bonus reward is pretty nice because you get 25,000 points to put towards flights after you spend $1,000 in the first three months. If you're going to have to pay bills and such then that isn't too hard. The only part that drives me crazy about this is the annual fee. It's pretty steep. You get extra points if you use the card to buy your Southwest airline tickets so that helps rack them up even faster. Overall I'd say this card is only useful if you're planning on taking some trips. If not then it won't be much good at all and the fees aren't worth it.

name: Sarah Conroy Bordeaux
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is a pretty awesome card but really it has to be right for you. You've got to travel a lot, so you can put those earned points to good use. You've got to have a really good credit score, just to get it. If it's a good card for you then you're golden because the card starts you with 40,000 points. Which is great and you get a point per dollar you spend. Which is also great. The only this is to only keep the card for a year because once that $95 annual fee kicks in, it's bad. So, I would really recommend this card to folks who can use it.

name: aadff bdaf
review: The Chase Sapphire is a pretty sweet rewards card. Although there is not intro 0% APR like a lot of other popular credit cards, the double point accumulation at restaurants makes it pretty nice for a dining out-only card. The initial bonus is nice too, and makes this a nice traveling card, since the points will likely not be a 1:1 ratio for actual cash. Also, no annual fee makes this pretty nice as a backup card if you're maxed out on rewards for others. The APR is kind of on the low side compared to most credit cards, so that's always a plus. Also, with Chase, you'll have incredible customer support always available, which is awesome.

name: chris
review: The Amazon.com Credit Card is a great card to use if you do a lot of online shopping.  First off, the $30 visa gift card you get just for signing up is a nice perk.  Then, for every purchase you make on the amazon.com website, you get 3% back for your next purchase on amazon.com.  Every time you use your card for anything else, you get 2% back towards your next purchase.  The only reasons this isn't a 5 star card is there's only a 21 day grace period to make payments, and the interest rates are just OK.  Still, if you're a frequent online shopper it's a very easy way to get a competitive cash back percentage towards future purchases.

name: abigail lee
review: The amazon credit card is great! When my application was accepted, I received a $30 gift card. I buy textbooks a lot on amazon and $30 off a textbook is a great saving. The points do add up pretty fast and you can redeem your points for gift cards. Sometimes I use the points towards my amazon purchases. I also have amazon prime, so I get my order within 2 business days. Overall, the amazon credit card is great for students. I do wish that they give more than $30 gift card. Chase sapphire and bank of america credit card, both gave me $100 for signing up.

name: Chris Bova
review: I love this card. I got it first when I was in school to get $30 off an Amazon order for the holidays. It was a great card to build credit with, as they automatically raised my credit over the years without any badgering. The rewards are great if you use Amazon a lot. You can use your rewards points at Amazon at any time, which is nice because a lot of similar cards require a minimum amount to withdraw your rewards. The interest rates are not too bad, especially considering I got the card when I had very little credit history. Chase's online payment system and customer service are also both top notch- when I lost my card I had no problem talking to them and getting a new one sent out for no cost.

name: Tiffany McLean
review: The Ink Bold Business card has a really decent initial bonus for first signing up. You get 50,000 points if you spend $5,000 in the first three months. If you are planning to purchase quite a few things for your business that's a pretty good deal compared to other cards like the Capital One Spark Select Business Credit Card that doesn't offer any bonus points up front. It is a bit of a hassle that there is an annual fee after the first year, and it's pretty high, but if you factor in the bonuses it would probably make it worth it. It's also great that you can earn 5X rewards points on things like cell phones, office supply purchases and more. It's a great card for a company or business looking to up their payoff.

name: Carisa Bishop
review: I really like this card. I got it with a low limit initially, when I was trying to rebuild my credit. They accept lower credit scores, which was great. It was the perfect opportunity to start rebuilding credit, and it has gone really well. The cash back options are awesome, and every time I've contacted customer service they've been helpful and courteous. I recently was able to up my limit a bit because my credit score is slowly but steadily increasing! Also, its obviously great that its a visa, because you don't have to worry about ending up being somewhere that doesn't accept it. Right now, I use it for gas and groceries. Love this card!

name: aadff bdaf
review: The Chase Freedom Visa card is the best cash back card because it always has 1% cash back, and every quarter rotates between other vendors for extra bonus cash back. The bonus is five times the normal 1% cash back, and Chase partners with some very popular vendors so that they can offer you the best cash back at the best stores. Other cards are similar, but their 5% bonus cash back rewards are with unpopular, or rarely used vendors. Chase Freedom has done it right.

name: aadff bdaf
review: This Slate Chase Credit card is very nice! The intro 0% APR lasts a few months longer than the typical twelve months like on other cards. This is great since there's no balance transfer fee, meaning if you get approved for this card, you can get an extra 0% APR on your balances for over a year! There's also no annual fee, which is great for these kinds of cards that are usually just used for taking the balance from another card. I think it's a lot better than the Capital One Classic Platinum Credit Card which only has 0% APR for less than a year. The only drawback is that you need excellent credit for this card, which may be a pain for many. However, if you do need to transfer and have excellent credit, this should be your target card!

name: aadff bdaf
review: The Chase Liquid Card is just like any other prepaid card, like AmEx's Serve. You load in money, and then spend it. It's just like having a debit card. However, I like that it's with Visa, which is accepted almost worldwide. It's a lot better than American Express which is sometimes not taken by smaller mom and pop shops. This card is great for teenagers who want to buy stuff online on their own without going through mom or dad first. The fact that you can only spend as much as you have makes it even better to teach younger kids money management. The customer service is also great with Chase! Definitely recommended for young adults and teenagers.

name: Lisa Baer
review: HOLY COW this is the best credit card available right now! They offer simply the BEST rewards for their customers. Chase Sapphire Preferred Card offers a huge incentive bonus to join- the equivalent of 500 dollars in travel is just wonderful and no foreign transaction fees? Simply divine. The only thing that I raise my eyebrows to is the 95 dollar annual fee. That hurts. I suppose it might be worth it, but that really cuts into your savings when you have to spend 95 dollars to continue using it. This card reminds me of the Capital One credit card during their Double Miles Challenge. They doubled all the points from the previous year, and that would probably equal out to what the Sapphire card gives you in just a few months. Anyway, I think this card is great and I see what Gary Shaffer says about the negative aspects of the card, but if you have excellent credit then I don't think that you'll be using the features that have additional fees like the cash advance or balance transfers. Hope you enjoy this card!

name: abigail lee
review: The Disney credit card is great if you love disney. I got this credit card and I bought a dooney and burke purse with my first purchase. I received a 15% discount on my first purchase. It was a good deal, specially because the purse was kinda pricey. Also, Disney will send you a $50 disney gift card. You can use the gift card at the store and buy more disney products. It was around Christmas time when I got this credit card, so I was able to buy my younger cousins a lot of disney store products. Overall, a great credit card.

name: aadff bdaf
review: I firmly believe that the Chase Ink Plus is one of the greatest business credit cards that you can get your hands on. Their 5% cash back on office supplies, cell phone payments, landline, internet, and TV service make it really worth the $95 annual fee. And there's even a nice bonus for spending $5000 in the first three months, which shouldn't be hard to reach if you're running a business anyways. This card is so useful that I use it the most out of all the cards I have! I love Chase's customer service and their secure online banking. They make it really easy to keep track of all the stuff I do with this card, and make me feel really safe. This is a great card to get if you have the credit for it. It's essentially free money if you always pay off your debts!

name: Rich Douglass
review: The Chase Freedom Visa card was the second credit card that I ever received. I received an instant approval online, and I received my card in about 5 business days. I was extremely pleased with the $100 cash back reward that I received (after spending $500 in qualifying purchases). One time I had an issue with a suspicious charge, but customer service fixed the problem right away. The 0% intro APR was a major reason why I applied for this card, but I also take advantage of the rotating cashback categories. The cash back is great, and I have a myriad options to redeem my rewards. I have no complaints about this card! I pay every month on time so I have no issues.

name: Spot Ify
review: i needed a line of credit to book a hotel in vegas a few months ago and i needed a credit card. after seeing all of the commercials about chase freedom, i figured it would be my best bet since i already have a debit card from the same bank. the cash back that i received was great, but not only that, it  has a super long intro period and lowest APR after the introductory period! this has actually been a great if not the best credit card ever! about two of my friends have applied for this card since! great card!

name: Chantel Lynn
review: The Amazon.com credit card looks like an awesome card! I think the automatic $30 amazon gift card upon your acceptance is really cool. It's better than an amazon prepaid card because it can be used anywhere Visa cards are accepted. You can use points towards your purchases at amazon.com or you can get cash back rewards. The interest rates vary but the range is actually pretty decent from 14 - 22 %. My other cards are all somewhere close to and around 20%.  I always like when credit cards have cash advance options because you never know when you'll need a few extra bucks. Overall, I really like the looks of this card and I'm going to apply for it.

name: Chantel Lynn
review: I like that this card gives you reward points for purchases at restaurants and travel. The Chase Sapphire Card also has a very reasonable interest rate. Much lower than what I am used to with my other credit cards (they're usually around 20% or so). I like that there is no over-limit fee but this seems to be more and more standard with credit cards. The only thing that I don't really like about this Chase Sapphire card is the excellent credit rating required. My credit score is good, but not excellent so I might have a problem with applying for the card which is a bummer because the interest rates are so good.

name: Justin Time
review: This is my primary credit card, after having used American Express's Blue Travel and a regular bank account Visa card. I shop at Amazon very often for a lot of my needs, and so it is very easy to rack up points. The system to pay off the card on Chase is great, with auto-pay, text/e-mail reminders and amazing customer service. The website is simple to use and very functional.I like that I am able to use my points to buy rewards, get Amazon gift cards (immediately!) or even get statement credit. But the best thing is the customer protection and service- I always am immediately connected to a person when I call in about the card, and if I need to dispute a charge, they have always resolved the issue quickly and kept me posted. I lost my card once and received a replacement in two days. This is great service for a great card.

name: Daniel Lopez
review: The Hyatt Credit Card seems perfect for a person who is always traveling.  The introductory offer of a free two nights stay with the first $1,000 of purchases seems easily attainable but there really isn’t much to offer after that point.  Hyatt hotels aren’t hard to find but the fact that it’s specific to just that chain could be a little cumbersome.  The points system they have in place to earn you more days seems a little arbitrary and unnecessary.  For the traveling man/woman I would consider the Capital One Venture Card or even an American Express Premium Rewards Gold Card if you can get your hands on one.  These two cards can probably give you a lower APR if you have qualifying credit.  If you are a regular Hyatt customer, the Hyatt card is worth a look.

name: Andi Robb
review: This card is a great card if you travel a lot and can make use of the great rebates on miles but if you are just an occasional flyer then the annual fee might make this the wrong card for you. As british airways flies to many different locations you can use this card almost anywhere you want to fly so racking up the points can be achieved easily and quickly and if you can spend $2000 in the first 3 months you get the bonus 50,000 points which is a great start. The other great thing with this card is that there is no foreign transaction fee so if traveling abroad you can really take advantage of the benefits of this card. There are other cards out there for other airlines (delta etc.) But if you like to fly B.A. as I do then this is a great card to have in your wallet.

name: Erin
review: As an avid traveler, I generally use my VentureOne Rewards Credit Card for purchases. This card, the Disney Rewards Visa Credit Card, just might take it's place! The interest rate is set at 14.24%. My Capitol One card's interest rate fluctuates, and therefore I sometimes end up paying more each month. Although I will not earn frequent flyer miles with this card, the benefits of this Disney Rewards Visa Credit Card would be useful to me. I have children, and we make purchases from the Disney Store. The discount offered with this Disney Rewards Visa Credit Card at the Disney Store locations as well as the Disney Store online, could make this card pay for itself! Additionally, there is no limit to the 1% reward I could earn and redeem in Disney Dream dollars. I think I'll use this card and build up my Dream Dollar account! -I'M GOING TO DISNEYLAND!

name: abigail lee
review: I had the Chase Sapphire card and I called Chase if I could upgrade to the Chase Preferred. Luckily, they agreed and now I have this preferred one. I use this credit card mainly for travel and booking hotel rooms. I like how they give you the promo of spend $3,000 in your first three months and then you'll get 40,000 points. This credit card is also similar to the Chase sapphire because you get 2x points on restaurants. So for people who like to eat, this is the credit card for you. The number that you call for the Chase sapphire preferred is a direct number that leads to ACTUAL people who can help you right away. No automated messages, just straight people who will help you trouble shoot about your issues. The Chase sapphire preferred is a very good card to have!

name: Karen Van De Bogart
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card is easy to use and convenient to use, because I live really close to a Chase branch. I used to use the BuyRight Prepaid MasterCard, but didn't like it as much one of the main problems with the BuyRight card was the price per month. Chase Liquid is much cheaper. I also really like the no activation fee and no fee if I want to cancel it. If I had to say one thing I don't like it would have to be the fee for using a non-Chase ATM, because sometimes you can't find a Chase ATM. Other than that the card is handy and pretty cool to own.

name: Grant Allen
review: My family and I travel a lot so this is the Hyatt Credit Car is the card for us. We get tons of perks and since my husband and I have high credit scores we get low interest, pay our balances off quickly and are able to get great rewards for when we travel. This saves us a lot of money. We have been able to take some great vacations in part because of this card. The annual fee annoys me a little bit and we have been tempted to shop around to see if we can find a card with similar perks without that fee. We have yet to find one that will offer us the same opportunities for free nights at great hotels so we have stuck with this one but would be happier if they lowered their fees. Great customer service and love the perks for our family. If you travel it is a great card.

name: Christopher Hopper
review: I like the fact that there are bonuses for using the British Airways Visa Signature Card, but I don't like the annual fee. It reminds me of the annual fee on the Delta Airlines Mastercard. Personally, I like receiving the bonuses for using my card, but as a student, it is difficult to justify spending so much to just get the bonuses that leave me breaking even at the end of the year after paying that annual fee of $95. I also like that there is no foreign transaction fee like the Delta Airlines card. I think it is in line with British Airways to allow unrestricted spending across the globe as they are an airline, so I'm very glad they've done better than Delta in that regard.

name: Pavel Zarzhitsky
review: I have been using this card for more than 10 years now. This is my main credit card. It is convenient, accepted almost everywhere. I could use it abroad without any problems. Amazon.com rewards points are nice and convenient. They improved reward system over the years and now you can use any amount of points you have towards your amazon.com purchase and do not need to collect certain amount and buy gift certificate. Points are easily converted into cash as well. I do my account management online. The website is convenient to use and easy to track your purchases and rewards.  I had a problem with unauthorized transaction and it was solved fast, customer service was friendly, no expenses on my side.

name: Stephanie Hughes
review: I applied for this credit card because I needed a line of credit for reservations for a vacation  this past July (rental car, hotel, etc.).  I wish I would have known about this card sooner and bypassed other cards I've used/paid off in the past.The cash back option is great.  Rather than all paying separate, my vacation companions and I charged our rooms/total rental car fee on my Chase card, then I collected the total cash to pay down the balance.  When I went to pay off the card I discovered with our cash back points, almost all of my portion of the room/rental car fee was paid for!Before getting this card I had looked for a card with the longest 0% interest period, and Chase was hands-down the best value - longest intro period and lowest APR after the introductory period.The application process was easy and fast and my card arrived very quickly - even being on a time press to get the card in the mail.Don't waste time with other cards - if you need a line of credit, Chase should be your first choice!

name: alex
review: Having the Chase Freedom credit card was the smartest decision I have made. I was nervous about choosing a credit card, as this was the first one I have ever had. I have been incredibly pleased with it thus far. The cash back feature was a huge draw for me when choosing the card. The incentives for using the card are great. Every purchase I make, I get some sort of reward or points. Being a huge amazon.com user, this card allows me to save on those purchases while getting rewards as well. Aside from rewards and points, the interest rate can't be beat in relation to its competitors. A couple months ago, I had some problems with my card, but customer service was attentive and prompt to fix an error. I have been very pleased with Chase Freedom, and encourage anyone interested in a credit card to apply now. You will not be disappointed!

name: Chip Song
review: The Chase Slate card was the first credit card that I opened and it has been one of the most versatile and dependable cards I have had.  The biggest advantages of the Chase Slate is the 0% intro APR for 15 months along with the no annual fees.  I started with a very good credit limit of $1500 and I was able to build that up year by year.  Though the Slate card doesn't reward you with points, I haven't had any issues with fraud, declines, or any other problems with credit card use.  Also, Chase customer service has always been helpful and very responsive.  Overall, a great credit card.

name: Dallas Hawkins
review: I have been using this card for several years now, and it is probably my favorite credit card. You get points for everything you purchase, and extra points when you purchase from amazon and some other retailers. The best part is the points show up when you're checking out on amazon.com, and you can apply them directly to your cart, it couldn't be easier. I buy almost everything on amazon anyway so I basically get 3% back on all my purchases! Also, when you sign up you get a $30 credit for your account, which is free money! I would recommend this card to anyone that loves shopping on amazon.com.

name: Pat Esswayne
review: The Marriott Rewards Credit Card is another choice for travelers who need a foreign travel card, and also stay in hotels frequently. With regards to the rewards program, it specifies that if you spend $1,000 in the first month, you get enough points to earn 4 free nights, which is a pretty decent offer. Beyond that, you earn 3 points at Marriotts, and 1 point otherwise. Good deal, assuming the rewards program is up to par in payouts, and assuming you use Marriotts and their associated hotel chains. The APR is also quite excellent, which would make this a decent card overall.

name: abigail lee
review: This credit card is great for people who like to eat out a lot. The Chase sapphire gives you 2 points on restaurants and travel. Every first friday of the month, Chase gives you 3 points on restaurants. I was bummed that the offer ends by the end of 2013. I wish I knew about this offer sooner. This credit card is great because they have no foreign transaction fee. My other Bank of America credit card has foreign transaction fee, which is horrible. I use my chase sapphire if I am buying a merchandise from a store based in the UK or somewhere else. Overall, a great credit card for people who like to eat out a lot.

name: Eric
review: Rewards cards can be great if you use them to their full benefit and my United MileagePlus is no exception.  I applied for this card after it became apparent to me that I was going to be traveling a few times a year for business and vacation.  One of the perks of this card is that you get priority boarding when waiting for your flight.  This may seem like a trivial perk, but after going through security and waiting at the airport you just want to get on your plane and not be hassled. This card allows me to do just that.  The rewards points are competitive with other cards out there, but they are not the best you can get.  The annual fee can be a deal breaker if you don't use this card to build up the points.  However, this is a great card to have if you are like me and are constantly flying United.

name: M H
review: The Amazon.com credit card is a great rewards card.  The rewards, initial discount, and interest rate are all a little bit better than my Walmart card.  I do not like how high the max penalty APR is, but that’s just one small hiccup.  Even if you never use the card a single time, it’s worth getting this card for the $30 discount bonus off of your purchase.  I plan on applying for this card as I am a frequent shopper on Amazon.com and this card would end up saving me a lot of money as well as continue to help my credit build.

name: Chantal Danielle Santiago Cato
review: I have had Chase Freedom for more than a year now and I have great experience with them. The cash back is amazing. The quarterly rewards from different company is really a great advantage. There is no regret for getting this card. This is my main go to credit card for all my necessities. I always ALWAYS use my chase freedom visa card for my groceries and gas purchases. I have stopped using my other credit cards because the Chase Freedom is all that I need. The customer service are very helpful with checking transactions and acts promptly with any fraudulent transactions on the card. Overall, the best credit cards I've had and will continue to use.

name: M H
review: The Chase Sapphire card has an incredibly low interest rate compared to most cards.  I don’t prefer this bonus system of this card over my other cards such as Bank of America or Capital One cash back cards, but it may be worth the switch to save on interest since I do tend to carry balances.  The penalty rates and fees are a bit high for this type of card.  I’m considering applying for the Chase Sapphire so that I can transfer my balances from other cards and save money each month on interest.  Overall I think this is a good card for people who don’t mind the reward system.

name: M H
review: The Chase Freedom Visa is a great rewards card that is leaps beyond my other cash back cards such as my Capital One and BOA rewards cards.  The $100 cash back bonus plus the potential to earn 5% cash back are great features of this card.  It also has a 0% intro rate for 15 months while most intro rates last for 6 months or less.  The interest rate is also pretty low for a card of this type and is much lower than my other cards.  This is one of the best cards that I have seen and I will definitely be applying for it.

name: Pat Esswayne
review: The Disney Rewards Visa Card seems like a pretty typical rewards card with some standard features. Firstly, it comes with a 0% intro APR for 6 months, and 14% after that, so not too shabby. But the real benefit is if you shop at the Disney Store, of course. You get 10% off $50 or more, which is an obvious benefit to anyone into buying a lot from them. I have an Amazon rewards card and I wish it gave me 10% off like that! There's also 1% rewards on everyday purchases, which is nice, and a $50 gift card immediately. So, for the Disney shoppers out there, this is a good card for you.

name: Gary shaffer
review: This Chase Sapphire Preferred card has several negative aspects : Credit score must be EXCELLENT; it costs $95/year starting in the 2nd year-too high!, 15.24% is TOO HIGH interest rate;Balance transfers cost 3%-too high/excessive; $10 minimum-5% fee for cash advance-way too high!!; cash advance 19.24% too high! Its rewards are decent-20% off of hotels, car rentals is nice but I don't rent cars or travel much at all. My American Express card had NO yearly fee, no fees for balance transfers, a 12% yearly interest rate, 2% fee for cash advance with no minimum fee; very liberal credit score acceptance and its rewards was outstanding! For every $500 spent on their card I received $10 towards an American Express travelers Check !!! And, after 5 years of card use in good standing a $50 yearly American express Travelers Check bonus was issued to me!! Chase has a bad reputation over the past decade and American Express has remained solid. I choose American Express without question!

name: Aaron Olbrantz
review: Just because you don't have an excellent credit and need one to get the Chase Sapphire Preferred card score doesn't mean that this card should be rated 1 stars. It just means that you most likely are not financially responsible enough to be granted a card with such great benefits. Also if you got into the habit of not over extending yourself and paying off your credit card balance each month then the APR shouldn't matter. Also, anyone who uses cash advances is not probably that financially responsible either and should stay away from credit products. Just because you don't qualify for this card and that you can't pay off your balance each month does not mean this card is 1 star. It is a 5 star card for people with 5 star credit histories.

name: Michael M
review: A Chase Liquid Prepaid Card is an alright prepaid card if you do not mind paying a monthly fee. It is great that you can quickly get the card instantly from any Chase bank and for free with a $25 deposit. Unlike most prepaid cards, this one allows you to deposit more balance for free, which I really like. This is probably the best feature about the Chase Liquid Prepaid Card, and more cards on the market should adopt that policy. The $4.95 fee every month for just having the card is a huge negative to me and if you do not plan to use the balance right away, can eat at your funds when you least expect it. Such as your card being rejected when you try to buy something, but forget about the monthly fee. If your looking for a prepaid card that you can quickly load money on, then this is a good one to have.

name: M H
review: Slate from Chase is a great card based on the terms.  The 0% intro rate for 15 months is a huge deal as most companies offer intro rates for shorter periods.  This card is similar to my Bank of America Visa card as both have similar interest rates and fees.  I am considering applying for this card as I could definitely use the 0% interest for some big upcoming purchases that I’d rather pay for over time.  I could even save a lot of money by transferring my other card balances to the Slate from Chase card and avoid interest for the next 15 months.

name: Alex Whitehouse
review: If you can spend the $2,000 minimum within the first 3 months of opening the account, the bonuses are really nice.  50,000 bonus miles is a great way to start in this reward program.  In addition, the annual fee doesn't begin until the second year, which makes it essentially free to start.  I find the APR a bit on the high side, but with reward cards you generally see this.  I chose a different card based on cash-back, but for those who travel frequently this is an intriguing offer.  All in all, a great deal that I would definitely recommend.

name: Chris
review: The Hyatt Credit Card is very good if you use Hyatt a lot. Otherwise, it really isn't that great. The rewards are fairly ok, but nothing to brag about honestly. There is a $75 annual fee which I think is unnecessary when comparing it to other cards of this same type. I just don't like ridiculous fee's that companies attach to their cards. I feel like I'm being nickel and dimed and they are trying to get every little penny out of me. I guess if you travel and stay at Hyatt a lot this card is worth it, otherwise, probably not.

name: John Ramirez
review: About 2 years ago I was shopping for a new computer on Amazon. They had this special on this credit card. It was perfect for me at the time because my other credit was getting a bit high. I went for it and got a $30 Amazon gift card which I used for my new computer. I am really happy with this card. The points I make from buying from Amazon is well worth it. I use it all the time now and can buy so much more now than I used to. I just recently got a prime membership which will be so good when I use this card. I've had no problems with this card. The APR is a little higher than my other credit card but it's not bad. If you do a lot of shopping at Amazon this would be perfect!

name: Kitty Galore
review: The Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Credit Card is a good option if you like to travel and live in a city that Southwest services. When you sign-up you receive the equivalent of 2 round-trip airfares, albeit after a few months. I signed up about 6 months ago and just now received the bonus. Yes, there's an annual fee of $69 or so, but that is offset somewhat by Southwest rewarding you with a $50 flight credit every year. If you like Southwest as an airline, I strongly recommend this credit card. It's one of the better airline rewards cards out there, and I've had a great experience with it.

name: Amber Johnson
review: This credit card is great. The interest rate isn't too bad and it was very easy to obtain. The rewards program is great and so is chase. I used my card to purchase a 3DS system and I have absolutely no regrets what so ever. I love the cash back program, especially the %5 cash back on gas. Overall, I would definitely recommend getting this credit card. Especially if you normally purchase gas on your credit card, or even groceries. The cash back you'll get every month from using this card to purchase groceries will out way any of the negatives you can find with this card.

name: Dann Day
review: The Ink Bold Business card is a decent option for those who have a lot of routine expenses each week, as well as some very good perks for those just starting a business and in need of a card with a high enough limit to help fund the start up costs.  I really like the reward component that's available for $625 worth of travel if the card is used for up to $5000 in expenses during the first 3 months after opening the account...a pretty generous offering compared to most cards of this type.   One customer-service perk that is also unique is the ready access to a service adviser that one has if you get the card, a real plus for busy people that need answers.  The $0 intro fee is appealing as well, though that fee increases to a bit uncomfortable $95 annually thereafter.  Overall, the card is well above average in the small business credit card arena and I would seriously consider it as a possible option.

name: Chris Smith
review: I have only had a Chase Freedom card for about a year now, but it’s definitely a choice I do not regret. I was looking for a card that was easy to obtain without having a substantial credit history, and I was approved with great ease. The rewards are also extremely appealing, especially to somebody who’s new to credit, and doesn’t have an established history. The rewards on gas is extremely appealing since I spend at least $40 a week on gas alone, so being able to be rewarded for filling up my tank is a nice incentive to have when it comes to using this card. Overall, it’s a GREAT first-time credit card for somebody who is looking for one, or it’s great for even a seasoned veteran of the credit world. You won’t regret it! I haven’t so far.

name: Chris
review: The British Airways Visa Signature card is good if you want to rack up many many miles easily. You get 1 and a quarter mile for ever $1.00 you spend with the card, which is not bad at all. One downside I see to this card is that there is an annual fee. There is no annual fee for the first year as it is waived, but after that it is almost $100 a year. Depending on how many miles you rack up, it may or may not be worth it. There are other cards out there without the annual fee that will probably save you more in the long run.

name: Alexis Beth
review: Like many of the other customers who have reviewed this card here, I agree that the Hyatt credit card is mainly beneficial if you're a die hard Hyatt customer. People who travel a lot and stay at the Hyatt hotels will enjoy the rewards that this card has to offer. The lack of a foreign transaction fee is a plus though, as is the grace period. I would like to know if there are any blackout dates for use of points; this is somewhat similar a frequent flier program, after all. Overall, I would recommend this card for people who will use this as one of their main credit cards.

name: Katie
review: The Marriott Rewards Credit Card is a fantastic choice for the frequent traveler! Not only do you get a huge bonus for spending over $1,000 in the first three months, but you get rewards points for every single dollar spent. Of course you get more points for spending money at Marriott Hotels, but it's still nice to get rewarded for non-Marriott purchases. The free hotel options for being approved is always a nice bonus too! Obviously this card isn't ideal for anyone. It's actually rather targeted, but if it suits your needs then it could definitely be worth it for you.

name: Nick Martocello
review: $95 annual fee? No thanks Chase Sapphire Preferred Card, it doesn't make you really feel preferred if you need excellent score for an annual fee. There are tons of perks though, 40,000 bonus points after spending $3,000 in the first 3 months which equals $500 in travel points. You earn 2X points on travel and dining at restaurants and 1 point per dollar spent on all other purchases. Receive a 7% Annual Points Dividend on all new points earned on purchases which is pretty nice for a yearly bonus. Then it takes you to the APR for a annual fee card, it has a 15% APR, my Capitol One Quicksilver has a 12% APR and cash rewards, while this card can be some, its definitely not for me.

name: William Reyes
review: The Slate From Chase offers great benefits such as a lower than average interest rate (as low as 120, and more than a year of free interest rate purchases  (15 months). In addition, it comes with no annual fee, and $0 fraud liability as standard features. They even offer an additional charge for another user for free. A similar card like the Wells Fargo Platinum Credit Card offers less time interest free, and a higher regular rate. I feel that Chase offers a good value with the zero balance fee offer, and excellent customer service.  Quite simply, this card offers attractive characteristics with low risk.

name: Nick Martocello
review: First off with the Disney Rewards Visa Card you get Get a $50 Disney Gift Card after first use of the Disney Rewards Card, which is pretty awesome if you shop at Disney a lot (especially for the younger kids!)Earn 1% on everyday card purchases which equate to 1 point per $100, which can add up. Then on top of that you get the nifty little discount at Disney stores. It offers a decent APR after the first year, so regardless if you pay off your balance you won't have to worry about it, as well as no annual feel. This is definitely a good card to have if you are obsessed with Disney or have younger children!

name: Lydia Whitehorn
review: The Chase Liquid Prepaid Card is one of the best of the prepaid cards I've checked into. The monthly fee of $4.95 is lower than most, and there is no transaction fee! Only a $2 ATM fee, and that's only for NON Chase ATMs. Chase ATMs are free also! And no activation fee is amazing! The Rushcard has a $14.95 fee just for activating, and then $9.95 for monthly fees, and $1 for each PIN transaction. That's hardly worth the "cute designs" you can get from Rushcards (And some of those cute designs are an additional $14.95. Yikes!). I'll take the standard blue Chase Liquid Card with the Chase name and Chase reliability ANY day.

name: KC Graff
review: I have had this card for almost a year. I signed up because of a promotion to get several free nights. I didn't have any problems redeeming the certificates and used them to stay at two different hotels. This card is great if you travel a lot as the points accumulate quickly. I have had good service at all of the Marriotts I have stayed with. The APR with this card is higher than some other options. This card does have an annual fee, but if you are able to accumulate enough points it makes it more than worth it. I have had to call customer service a couple times, and it takes less than a minute to be connected to a real person, which is a great plus.

name: Chip Song
review: Chase Freedom has one of the best rewards program to date.  I have been using the Chase Freedom card for the last couple years and I have nothing but good things to say.  First of all, you get points on every purchase you make.  Second, you get bonus points if it is in the bonus category.  Every 3 months, there will be a bonus category (e.g. gas purchases, Amazon purchases, restaurants, etc.) and you will get 5 additional points for each dollar spent.  This is far superior than other credit card brands.  Plus, there are no annual fees and the APR is within a reasonable range.  I have been cashing in my rewards every other month and they can be a pretty decent amount, especially if you are paying bills with the card.  The Chase Freedom card is great for the average user, the heavy spender, and even the credit builder.  You won't regret this card!

name: Tiffany McLean
review: I've only had this credit card a short time but I love it! I love the rewards that come when you first sign up. I was able to take a couple trips with the bonus miles that the Southwest credit card offers. It was a bit of a let down that you had to spend some money before you receive the bonus miles, but if you are already going to spend the money it's easy. I'm also able to rack up more points anytime I want by simply making a purchase. The annual fee is a bit of a pain but if you use the card enough it's worth it for the miles you can earn. I'm also able to easily keep up on my expenses and keep track of purchases. I'd recommend this for anyone who is looking to earn some flying time through their purchases. It helps me take more trips and Southwest already has such cheap flights so it's an added bonus!

name: Francisco Delgado
review: I have had this card for 2 years now and I'm glad I got it. originally I got this card for the $30 off my order from amazon. Being an amazon prime member with this card is great, I get 3% off every purchase I make from amazon which is quite a lot. I also use this for my eating out and gas, the 2% on gas makes this better than anything else i currently have available. I love that you can use the points to shop directly on amazon. I have amased about $250 cash back in the 2 years i've been using

name: Chris
review: I just got approved for the Amazon Visa credit card a few months ago, but I already love it. Especially when I shop at amazon. Shopping at amazon has been great because you can find such low prices and this card compliments that perfectly. When you get approved for the card they give you a $30 gift card, and on top of that you earn 3 points for every dollar spent at amazon. Each point is equal to 1 cent, the points definitely add up if you spend a lot on amazon though. This is a great card and is highly recommended if you spend a lot on amazon, but can't yet get approved for some of the higher end rewards cards on the market.

name: Chris
review: The Chase Freedom Visa rewards credit card is my absolute favorite card. It's by far the best card that I own. It wasn't that hard to get approved for either, I would say I have average credit at best, and I was approved. The cash back on it is fantastic. Sometimes you can get 5% at amazon which is very nice, and 5% at gas stations and some other places as well. No annual fee, as well as a base cash back of 1% if you are spending at a place where the other 5% bonus options aren't available for. This is a great card and it's what I use the most when I go out shopping.

name: Chris
review: The Chase Sapphire credit card is one of my most favorite credit cards that I own. The bonus points you get on it are very very nice. I've had it for years now and I use it regularly. It's quite easy to rack up a nice amount of points, and the points don't expire or have to be spent within a certain time frame either, where as with some reward credit cards you have to spend the points quickly or they will expire on you. The no annual fee and very decent APR this card offers is fantastic as well. I highly recommend the Chase Sapphire credit card.

name: Nathan Gerard
review: The Continental Airlines OnePass Plus Credit Card is a very nice card for those who travel frequently.  It starts out by giving you 25,000 miles after your first use then will give you extra bonuses if you add an authorized user and 1 mile for every dollar spent.  The miles on this card never expire either which is nice. Also with bag fees its nice to have this card and not have to worry about paying for your first checked bag.  If that wasn't enough you also get 2 passes each year for the United Club.  If you fly these airlines why wouldn't you want this card?

name: Jon Fuller
review: This is my first card with Chase, and so far I am loving it. The rewards program is excellent and easy to manage, even though I only use my card for groceries every month. I enjoy the cash back, especially with the occasional online purchases that I make.  So far this card has been great, and I anticipate using it for even more expenses in the future - one thing to remember if you decide on this card is that the billing date is adjustable, so you can change it to suit your needs. I had mine switched to the 26th of every month since it always falls after my payday, and won't interfere with other bills.

name: Albert Phan
review: The HESS Credit Card is a Visa Card that has no annual fee which is a huge plus. This is a card that would benefit people who often buy HESS products or on the road a lot. There's rewards with no initial bonus and a average base/max earn rate of 1%/3%. You can get 3% rebate after the first 60 days on HESS products up to $500. There's no reward caps and you can get varying levels of rebates. The purchases, balance transfers, and cash advances are pretty much average and not worth talking about. Comparing this to other cards such as the Chase Freedom Card, the bonuses are a bit lacking since the Chase Card has a $100 bonus cash back after $500 in purchases after 3 months. You also get unlimited 1% cash back on all other purchases, which is a place. I'd get the HESS Card if you're in a area that has a lot of HESS gas stations.

name: Albert Phan
review: The J.P Morgan Credit Card is a card for those who are frequent travelers. There's not many redeeming features of this card and there's an annual fee of $95 after the first year. There's no initial bonus reward and the base/max earn is on a 1:1 point/$ ratio. Also you need to spend $100,000 a year on this card to get 25,000 bonus points. The upside is that you can get through blackout dates and no restrictions on future booking and multiple leg trips. This is basically a card for business people who need to travel a lot. The benefits is that you are protected with a lot of insurance for whenever you travel. In comparison with the Marriott Rewards Premier Card, the Marriott offers more in rewards with 7 free nights at a Marriott resort just as a starting bonus. It also has an initial bonus of 5,000 points. The J.P Morgan Credit Card is something you should use as a last resort if you're a frequent flyer.

name: Michael M
review: The Chase Sapphire Credit Card is an excellent card to have. The reward points built up very fast from my purchases and especially on big purchases, with was a very nice bonus because I could redeem cash back. Dealing with Chase's customer service for this card was a pleasant experience, I was accidentally late on a payment, so I called up Chase's customer support service and they were able to wave the late charge for me. When I had a Chase bank account, the online combined the two making them very easy to manage and pay every month. I highly recommend the Chase Sapphire Card if you are looking for a great rewards credit card, it is one of the best, just remember to pay the balances quickly!

name: Calvero Danger
review: The Continental Airlines OnePass Plus Credit Card is a decent credit card if your in the market to build up airline miles and travel a lot but that's about all the card is good for. If you do not travel much or just an average person I would skip this card.  With a 95$ yearly fee and other small fee's tacked on this card is almost double the price of what similar cards will cost per year. Really the only benefits it does offer that are worth anything are really only geared to very frequent flyers who spend a lot of time on a jet or in an airport lounge.

name: Aaron
review: Fantastic card. I signed up for the card because I was out of the country and needed some extra spending cash just in case of an emergency. The fact that this card has 0% interest for over a year makes it one of the best cards out there. Their customer support team is also fantastic; I can't say enough good things about them. I'm generally not a big spender but the few times I have used this card I have had no problems. I have not used the Blueprint option yet but it is nice to know that the option is available.

name: Odysseas Papadimitriou
review: If you want a free balance transfer it does not get any better than this.

name: Owen
review: As someone who frequently purchases things from Amazon, I love their credit card! I got an instant $30 credit with it, which was great. Their rewards program is great. It's three points for each dollar spent on Amazon's site and up to two points for all other items. I accumulate points pretty quickly because I use my card so much and pay it off very quickly. My APR is really low (I have great credit) too. It's probably the lowest of all the cards I've had. I haven't had any problems so I can't speak of their customer service. If you buy things on Amazon a lot, I highly suggest looking into this card.

name: Chris Sellek
review: This card was excellent. I felt very valued as a customer while using this card, and Chase seemed to go out of their way to ensure that remained the case throughout my entire time with this card. The rewards were excellent and if you used their travel agency, you could even save an ADDITIONAL 20% off of the flights they offered! That's in addition to the money you save by using the credit card points to pay for the flight in the first place! I used this perk to help pay for my honeymoon flight! I highly recommend this card. The only reason I didn't give it 4 stars is because the annual fee was a little too steep for me (the first year came free). Otherwise, it was excellent and I wish I could go back to having it again!

name: Pat Esswayne
review: This is a great card if you meet a few criteria. Firstly, you need to shop on Amazon, otherwise the rewards just won't be worth it. Sure you get points when shopping at certain places, or 1 point in general, but it's the 3 points per $1 on Amazon that really stack up fast.
