I personally have Amazon Prime and supplement a lot of my consumerism there I like it so much. The card is linked to your account so that you can apply the points as a gift card easily at the checkout. The APR is pretty standard, the grace period and fees too. Honestly, I went for this card because I had little to no credit, and yet somehow they accepted me. Though the required score on here says you need good credit, give it a shot, you may be surprised!

name: Richard Ascot
review: This is one of my favorite cards. I run a fast business that needs to move capital around fast. The 0% transfer fee is ideal as I work to keep my business growing and solvent.  The card also has 0% for over a year.  This would also be ideal for people looking to consolidate credit from multiple cards. I highly recommend.

name: Nick Martocello
review: Great gas card to have, being on the east coast, there's tons of Hess stations to use the HESS Credit Card. 10% cash back for 60 days is pretty insane for a 60 day introductory period. There is no 0% period for the first year, so that is a downside, and maybe the 19% APR is risky if you're bad on your payments. You also earn 3% rebate up to $400, then 1% after all those wonderful rebates from 10%-3%. I would recommend this card solely for buying gas when you need it and paying it off quickly, earn some free gas while spending on it.

name: Nick Martocello
review: The J.P. Morgan Credit Card is basically a card if your a business person or a frequent flyer/traveler. You get points for every $1 on travel purchases,1 point for every $1 on all other purchases, and 25,000 bonus points when you spend $100,000 annually and make other purchases. These bonuses don't really seem to pan out unless youre in a corporate position and flying almost weekly. The shining factor for this is its low interest rate and transferring your points 1 to 1 per airline and no blackout dates.

name: Chris
review: The Continental Airlines OnePass Plus Credit Card is a pretty good card if you like racking up frequent flyer miles, that is if you like continental or united airlines. As for how good of a card it is by itself? It's not that great... The annual fee is waived the first year but after that it's $95.00, which isn't really high, but it is an unnecessary added cost that a lot of other cards have done away with all together. You will definitely rack up the miles though, and depending if you travel a lot it could be very worth it. For me it isn't, and I prefer a normal rewards card any day.

name: Nancy Johnson
review: I love love ,love,love this card. The main perk for me is being able to deposit checks at the ATM and getting cash back right away even if the check is not drawn on a chase account. I think it's the only prepaid card that you can do that with. It's better than having to run to a check cashing place and check cashing places don't take personal checks so if someone writes you a personal check your SOL if you don't have a checking or saving account.

name: Ben
review: If you're one who flies Continental Airlines, then the Continental Airlines OnePass Plus Credit Card is a great choice. 25,000 bonus points for making your first purchase with this card is a great bonus incentive, plus the extra 5,000 for adding a user is easy to obtain. The annual bonus for this card is high too - 10,000 certainly beats my Southwest Rapid Rewards Plus Credit Card's 3,000 points. And you get perks like a free bag checked in, and some passes to the exclusive priority lounge club. 2% back for purchases with the airline and a few select travel accommodations plus the standard 1% for all other purchases is great too. Plus the APR is reasonable at less than 15%! If I flew Continental, I'd consider applying immediately; the perks are too good to pass up!

name: Albert Phan
review: If you're a frequent hotel goer and use the Marriott a lot, then you definitely need to get this card. The initial bonus of 30,000 points after a grace period is coupled with a 6 Free Nights at a Category 1 location. You also earn points from every purchase towards Marriott commodities such as hotels, airlines and more. The purchase rate is alright. The balance transfers is nothing to scoff at, and the cash advance rate is also on par with cards such as the Ink Cash Business Card. The Marriott Rewards Business Credit Card is also great for employees and able to keep business and personal spending separate. In comparison to the Ink Cash Business Card, the Marriott card doesn't have an initial bonus of $200 and 0% introductory APR for 6 months and no annual fee, whereas the Marriott Card has the first year fee , but $45 after the first year.

name: Craig Gugelmin
review: I really like the idea of the Honda Rewards Visa card.  The rates are good and are pretty close to the Chase Freedom and the Capital One cards that I have.  I like the competitive fees too, especially the balance transfer fees and that you get three to six months of 0% interest on balances.  I don't think the rewards program is very competitive though.  There is nothing to entice you to start using it, like a new member bonus.  The actual bonus program is normal too, there is nothing really that sets this apart from another program.   However, for someone building credit, this would be good.  No annual fee is the best about this.

name: Ben
review: The J.P. Morgan Credit Card is definitely an all-purpose traveler's card. I don't think the rewards program is as good as my Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Plus Credit Card, since this card does not give an anniversary bonus point gift, nor does it offer as good of a bonus for spending money each year. I don't think many people can spend $100,000 a year on belongings to redeem the 25,000 points. One unique feature of this card is the ability to transfer your points to any airline at a 1 to 1 rate. But the Starwood Preferred Guest Credit Card from American Express has the same perk, but gives you a 25% bonus upon transferring your points over! If you have loyalty to a particular airline or hotel, you should consider getting their specific cards over the J.P. Morgan Credit Card.

name: Ben
review: This HESS Credit Card is another gas station credit card, offering a very decent 3% back on purchases at Hess, which is great. The TrueEarnings Credit Card from Costco and American Express offers a similar rate for gasoline, although it also offers better cash back bonuses on other purchases. However, that card has an annual fee and this one doesn't. The first 60 days, you also get a 10% rate of cashback, which is absolutely amazing. You do want to note though, that the interest rates is nearly 20% and is pretty high, so you might want to stay away from this card if you have trouble making payments on time and in full.

name: William Reyes
review: I fly often, and the Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Plus Business Credit Card provides excellent features and perks. I like that this card has a low interest rate compared to similar offerings. However, this card does have an annual fee, which could be an inconvenience to some. One of the main benefits is that your bags are free when you are a member, a reward that the United Mileage Plus does not have. I love that your points do not expire and you can also use them for car rentals and hotel stays. The initial bonus points are perfect to start savings, and there is no limit to how many points you can earn.

name: Corrina Hillegeist
review: The United Mileage Plus Explorer Business Credit Card really is a great card to choose for earning unlimited travel points, and all the other features are great too. There is really nothing negative  to say about this card compared to the others that are out there. I also have a Capital One Venture Rewards Credit Card, and think that The United Mileage Plus Explorer Business Credit Card is a little better as far as the miles you can earn. At least it has been for me. I would highly recommend checking out this card to anyone looking to earn maximum miles, because it really is one of the best cards out there, if not the best.

name: Jordan Webb
review: If you’re a shoe addict, then the Zappos card may be the ideal niche credit card for you! Most website credit cards are pretty standard, and this one is no exception; a mediocre interest rate without an intro rate is the norm for this type of credit card. However, it does have a nice rewards program, including a $25 bonus on Zappos when you sign up. If you are using Zappos.com a lot anyway, then this card is a profitable way to build your credit and earn back rewards toward more shoes. If you aren’t a frequent shopper, however, I would just probably stay away.

name: Edward David
review: If you fly with Continental Airlines, this is the card for you to have just so you get those amazing free miles. Continental Airlines OnePass Plus Credit Card has an amazing 30,000 initial bonus and 2 miles per dollar on Continental or United flights, 1 dollar for everything else. Another awesome bonus is you get priority boarding for any of the flights you take with Continental or United and you get your first bag checked for free. So if you fly a lot with United which is a huge airline across the US, this is an amazing deal for you. Just the money you save from checking your bag will make it worth your while to have.

name: Mike Greiner
review: Frequent travelers might find themselves favoring one airline over another, and if you like Continental and United this might be the card for you.  The main perks of this card come in the form of all the benefits you get in the airport.  First checked bag free, complimentary passes to the United Club, and priority boarding are the main perks you would normally be paying to get.  This card’s annual fee of $95 and slightly higher max of 2% cash back makes this card one to avoid if you are not a frequent flyer or are simply not interested in the perks that come with it.  There are other cards that have 5% quarterly bonuses on airfare which will get you a better deal if you only fly once a year.

name: Reylin Bates
review: The Marriott Rewards Business Credit Card is a great credit card to have. One of the best, in my opinion. Marriott has amazing hotels basically everywhere. They are nice to stay in, great customer service, nice rooms, dining, etc. I like getting a point for each dollar that I spend when I use this credit card. If you're someone that travels a lot and/or stay at Marriott hotels, I'd recommend this card for you.There are other cards that are similar, gives you a point per each dollar spent such as the Honda Rewards Card, but I'd say this one is better. There's not really anything I dislike about this card. It's a great one to have.

name: Reylin Bates
review: The Honda Rewards Visa Credit Card does very much seem promising. I like the rates a lot. Reminds me of Slate by Chase a little; which is also another good credit card. The rates on the slate are a bit better though. I do like the rewards opportunity but I do not like how limited it is. Now, it is great but just comparing the Honda Rewards Visa Credit Card to other credit cards, the rewards aren't that great. This credit card, however, is very simple and straightforward. Having no annual fee is a plus. If you are a Honda fan, I'd say go for this card, but otherwise, there are better options.

name: David Bishop
review: Another "just ok" rewards card here, this time it's the Zappos Credit Card. However, it does find its niche with those of us who happen to have an addiction for shoes. There is no annual fee, and the regular rates are ok, but for every upside of a rewards card, there is the down. There is no introductory rate, either for purchases or for balance transfers. Again, if you have a shoe addiction, then the Zappos Credit Card MIGHT appeal to you, but you have to wonder if that 1-3% off is worth all that you have to give up to earn it.

name: Marilyn
review: This card offers a lot in the way of rewards and benefits. One reward that seems particularly attractive is the $400 in Wanna Get Away Fares. Also, one can earn bonus points for all purchases, and even better rewards for Southwest purchases, purchases from car rental partners, etc. Then, these points can be used to travel to over 800 destinations. Another thing I find appealing is the fact that points don't expire, there are no luggage check-in fees, no blackout dates, etc. This is in contrast to some reward programs, which include policies restricting travel to unpopular travel dates, unpopular locations, etc. Southwest Airlines Rapid Reward Plus Business Credit Card has a lot of things going for it. The small annual fee would be easily recouped in savings throughout the year.

name: Jordan Webb
review: The J.P Morgan Credit Card is a great deal that you should jump on if you can get it! This card is well-known for its great points rewards program, which can be redeemed for a variety of products and savings. This program is especially good if you are a frequent traveler, as points are doubled for travel purchases. Even better about this card is the regular interest rate of 13.24%, which is extremely low for a large bank to offer for such a great rewards program! If you have the credit for it, I would highly recommend trying this card out.

name: Jordan Webb
review: As far as gas based reward credit cards go, you may want to stay away from the HESS Credit Card. While the card does discuss rebates of up to $400, keep in mind that this is only for the first 60 days that your card is open; after the 10% intro period, you will only earn rewards at a 1-3% rate! Another things that may get overlooked is the lack of an introductory interest rate, and the relatively high 19.24% standard rate! This high rate pretty much negates the cash back you’ll be earning when you make purchases. Be a smart buyer and stay away!

name: Michelle Fields
review: The annual fee ($95) is the first thing about this card that jumps out at me. Since there are other miles cards available with lower (or no) annual fees, I wouldn't rank this at the top of my list of choices.It's nice that they give you 30,000 miles right off the bat; this does help offset the sting of the fee a little, but given that the miles are a one-time deal, and the annual fee is recurring...well, you'll just have to weigh those two factors for yourself. If you use this card A LOT, then I could still see it being worthwhile. But if you're a more average user like me, who just charges a grand or two a month and pays it right off, I can't see it being worth your while.The 3 miles per $1 spent on United airfares is good, but still about normal for single-airline travel rewards cards. The consistent 2 miles per $1 spent on gas, home improvement purchases, groceries and dining is what I see as being this card's greatest advantage over others. Other rewards cards sometimes bonus these, sometimes don't (or if you're talking about a weird one like Discover, they'll bonus them one month, and not another...sheesh), so getting them consistently over the life of the card is great.It's nice in that it doesn't charge you a premium rate for balance transfers, but they still nail you for cash advances (which, admittedly, is standard practice). That said, I've seen lots of cards with worse rates than this one.Bottom line is, if you're a dedicated United flyer who flies a lot for business, this will probably be a reasonably rewarding card for you.

name: William Reyes
review: I am actually very interested in the Continental Airlines OnePass Plus Credit Card since I fly with Continental often. I really like that this card comes with rewards and perks such as the checking your first bag free, and the priority boarding on Continental and United flights. The initial bonus miles are definitely a nice feature. I also like that the miles don't expire compared to the United MileagePlus card where they do expire if you are not longer a member, and there is no limit to how many you can earn. Another convincing feature is that you don't pay annual fee the first year. I will definitely look into applying for the OnePass Plus credit card from Continental Airlines.

name: Bryan Radcliffe
review: The United Mileage Plus Explorer Business Credit Card is the best card you can get if you travel a lot. For every dollar you spend, you earn a mile towards your next flight, which is great compared to the Capital One Venture card. They also have a good interest rate, which stays at roughly 15% as long as you stay current with your account, which is great because some cards go to 19.99% after the intro period. They also give you 30,000 miles for spending $1,000 if your first 3 months of card opening which is great. The annual fee is kind of high, but it is worth it in my eyes because of the many benefits this card carries. I recommend this card to anyone who travels a lot, due to the discounts on flights, free bag checking, and other perks such as room upgrades.

name: _rking58
review: My major problem with this card is its abysmal customer service. I recently spent 2 hours on the phone with the customer service and security departments because they couldn't fix a security hold. It caused major embarrassment for me and actually caused the lock out of a merchant's system because chase erroneously reported that my card was unlocked and ready for use. The merchant, a small business owner, was very gracious but that didn't take the edge off of their list of cc processing capability. I was transferred numerous times while on the phone with chase and at one point waited on hold for 30+ minutes (despite an estimate of 10 minutes). As of this moment, they still have not fixed the problem. I consider this the worst customer service experience of my life. I discourage anyone from applying for and using this card.

name: Patrick  Murphy
review: Did you get that straightened out? I really like the specs this card has.

name: Mike Law
review: Twice now I've contested a charge (and in 20 years I only lost one case with my other cards, when British Airways luggage broke down and they wouldn't let non-first class passengers on the flight, making them wait overnight and only reimbursing them an arbitrary 100 pounds total for transportation to a hotel in London, the hotel itself and two meals  -- you try to get something for less than 200 pounds total for all of that in London, much less 100, which is why I never fly Brit Hairwaves ever again).  The first time a theater company falsely advertised, and the Chase rep wouldn't let me contest the charge for my wife and myself, saying we hadn't contested before we entered.  When I went up the chain with the company, they admitted the problem and refunded the entire cost.  Now, Boston Park Plaza lied to me about a Facility Fee being already included in our pre-paid hotel (and I trust the person so did not record on my iPhone, a mistake I'll never make again with other places), and as a result I accepted the optional wifi.  Then we get a charge a week later.  When I contested it, the Chase rep said I had to prove the rep told me the charge was covered.  How do I do that without having time-travel?  I am finding another card, that gives the consumer at least a fighting chance against unscrupulous merchants.  I just closed my Chase savings account also.

name: Aaron Cesar
review: I have the CSP version of this card and it is well worth it. I also get components on it since it's made our of some sort of metal.

name: Merlyn Galt
review: I have had this credit card for about 2 years now.  I really do love it for the great cash back I get on every purchase and also for the 5% cash back offers as well.  It is very easy for me to pay online and I use that function every month to pay off my bill.

name: Shaquana Broadnax
review: I had this card for almost two years and it was fantastic. I didn't switch for any negative reasons because really there weren't anything. For the first 15 months, I had a 0% APR. I was still able to accumulate rewards points which was nice. Not having to worry about interest really is great, especially when you have an large, unexpected expense. I stayed with Chase when I switched credit cards and I only did that for the points. But all in all, this is a fantastic credit card for those looking for 0% APR.

name: Torrie Shelton
review: I have this card, and I do love it. However, I am going overseas to Italy, and was curious, can I use this overseas? Or only in the US?

name: WalletHub
review: You'll be able to use the card overseas at any location that accepts VISA.

name: Ivan
review: Chase in my opinion is the best bank in the U.S. I just purchased a checking account in Chase and I love having an account there. At the time I also got 100 dollars free for creating an account. The customer service was really good I got excellent service, everything was explained to me clearly and they were really helpful. So far I haven't had a problem with the bank, I haven't gotten any weird charges or anything. The only thing I don't like is that they don't have the same amount of ATM's as Bank of America. But this bank is still one of the best, I recommend it to anyone that has a Chase near them.

name: Joyce Ogenche
review: I have had a chase credit card for 3 years now and so far have not had any major problems. Their customer service is wonderful and they are always quick to resolve any minor issues that I have. In the past, I have had bank treat me horribly, but chase bank is one of the few that stays true to their customers. I recently took out a loan to purchase a new car and the interest rates were very reasonable. Overall, I would definitely recommend banking with Chase.

name: Andrew
review: I am a senior in college and recently opened a checking account and credit card with Chase. It was very easy to get started, and the employee I worked with was very competent and capable of explaining all the features of my new accounts. Since Chase is a larger bank, I felt very secure banking with them, and they are in many more locations than my current hometown bank. Once I graduate, I plan on leaving my home bank in order to bank exclusively with Chase. Since I have started banking with them, I have called multiple times about credit options and such, and have always found them cheery and willing to help. Their introductory 0% APR for 15 months has been useful, as this is my first credit card. Anyone looking for a convenient way to bank should definitely look into Chase.

name: Aly Sabin
review: I have been using the Chase Freedom credit card for almost 3 years and I absolutely love it. My favorite aspect of it is the cash back bonus. Not only did I get $100 cash back when I signed up, but you have the opportunity to earn even more money with every purchase. It’s an automatic 1% cash back for every purchase, with an opportunity to earn higher percentages depending on the bonus category for the quarter (i.e. gas or restaurants, etc.) The cash back bonus goes as high as 5% which is amazing compared to other credit cards. I am amazed every time at how quickly I’ve gotten to $50 cash back or even $100. I also really appreciate the fraud prevention. Chase in general has always provided great service for me. Just last weekend my card declined twice at a WalMart store due to credit card machine malfunction, but it wasn’t long before I got an email and text from Chase wanting to verify those purchases in case of fraud. It only took a minute to verify, but I really appreciated the response time. It makes me feel really secure if my credit card was ever stolen in the future. I honestly have no negatives about this credit card and would recommend it to anyone searching for the perfect credit card.

name: Niesha Oczon
review: I have used this credit card for more than 5 years. I am pretty happy with what I got out this card – with everything I put on this card, I get 1% back. What is more, they have rolling categories every quarter that gives me more rebates that returns at 5%. My rewards have been built up pretty quickly. It is true that other credit cards have similar rebate program, but here is the difference: Discover – the rebate amount is tiered from 0.25% till you reach some spending limit and it will eventually become 1%. For AMEX blue cash card, the first 5000-6000 is a pathetic 0.5% as well. This card takes all the gimmicks out of the cash back and gives me consistent incentives to continue using it again and again. I also need to say that I pay off my balance on this credit card every month, so I am not paying any high interests rate for the purchase I make on this card. So I do not mind this card having a relatively high APR. In addition getting cash out of this card, I also used this card get some tickets to Seaworld, and Universal Studios etc. By using the points to redeem on the tickets, I actually can save a few more bucks than buying those tickets at the gate.

name: Izzy Pieniądz
review: I just got this credit card and I love it already. After I spend $500 I'll get a hundred back into my account which I think is awesome. Besides that I earn 1% cash back on everything and 5% cash back on certain categories throughout the year. The rewards are awesome since they are things that I would do normally, like go to restaurants or movies. My only problem with the card would be the low limit, but I think once I have it long enough it should go up. I would definitely recommend this card if you're just starting to build your credit.

name: Joline Vanschoor
review: Probably the best well-rounded card there is out there. Chase Freedom is easy to qualify for; I've had it since college 6 years ago and I still use it for general purchases. The 5% rotation cash-back is excellent; I find myself purchasing groceries more often when groceries are on sale, going to the movies more often when 5% CB on movie theatres, etc. In addition, you'll get 1% CB on everything. If you bank with Chase, you can spend these reward points on a variety of different things, including cash deposits back into your account. Another good point that isn't emphasized enough is Chase's customer service. They are extremely easy to work with, widely available, and super helpful. I called to inform Chase that I was leaving the country for vacation, and not only did they help me set up the dates, but they also raised my credit line! Awesome customer service is really really important for credit cards in case fraud or theft occurs. Highly recommend this card to everyone.

name: Ryan Hannigan
review: I have had this card for three years.  I use it since I travel at least twice a month for my job.  I have traveled as much as 40 weeks out of the year, so I understand the benefits of having a card that offers rewards for hotels. As I get reimbursed for all of my travel expenses, it’s really nice to have benefits from work that extend to private use.  I accrue tens of thousands of points each year and use it for family vacations and once for an anniversary get-away for my wife and I.  When I consider the annual fee, and that I get reimbursed for so much of my travel expenses, the yearly fee, really is worth it for me.  I get lots of personal trips from the points so the annual fee, is really tiny compared to the benefits.  However, it is something for people to be aware of if they aren’t getting so much of their costs covered.  Great card for business travelers.  Amazing perks for the cost if you have a good work travel program.

name: Jason Radtke
review: I have banked with Chase since I first opened a checking account and have always found it a good place to be. I live in central Illinois and they have ATMs conveniently located throughout the area. I almost never have a hard time finding one. Not only are they convenient but the customer service has always been great. I recently had an accidental charge that over-drafted my account and I was able to contact Chase and explain the situation. They refunded the overdraft fee as well as the amount of the accidental charge (after I explained it). Also I lost my debit card not long ago and they sent a new one out to me quickly and without personal expense. My only complaint is the monthly service fees but the reasoning for those are explained if you inquire and usually are dependent upon how much money you have in your account.

name: Michael
review: Opened my first bank account ever with Chase when I was 18 years old, I knew nothing about banking but I went ahead and tried it anyways. Filled out a five minute application and got approved instantly, they were always so nice to me in their office. I had a problem one time with overdrawing which was indeed my fault but still an accident, I explained to them what had happened and they fixed it almost immediately. Saving me over $100 in overdraft fees, I was very grateful because I am a college student and money is always tight. Overall, Chase is just an amazing bank and I would recommend them to anyone looking to get a checking and or savings account.

name: Jamal Tyron
review: I applied for this credit card in December of 2012. It was advertised as giving a $50 Amazon gift card that would be deposited into your account once your application is approved. Since I also frequently purchase things from Amazon as well, this was really a win-win situation for me. I love that I get points back from my purchases on Amazon. I tend to buy a lot of things there, such as mp3s, household items and food items. There is also no annual fee with this card either. I would definitely recommend the Amazon.com credit card to anyone else that is a frequent shopper at Amazon.

name: Joey
review: Chase has been wonderful for all of my banking needs. My family and I travel a lot during the summer and winter seasons and there hasn't been a single place that we've traveled to that hasn't had a Chase location nearby. There is no hassle withdrawing from a different location as long as you have your info and the bank tellers, in my experience, have always been very kind when dealing with me as a customer.I have had a Chase bank account for several years and opening it up was a very quick process. It only took a few minutes to get my account activated and get my online bank account set up so that I could monitor my funds to make sure I have enough wherever I'm at.

name: Troy Ruhmann
review: I applied for the card because I wanted to have another card as a backup, and I shop a lot on Amazon, so the points for buying things on Amazon (as well as at other places) were a huge perk. The offer of a $30 gift card also didn't hurt. I've never had any problems with it (save for one, which I'll explain), and the payments are processed promptly. Furthermore, very recently I was the victim of credit card theft (most likely due to the major Schnuck's hacking) where someone else tried to use my number. However, Chase (the bank for the card) suspected it wasn't me and stopped the charge, notifying me of the usage. After a short phone call, I had my card canceled and a new one sent to me in 2 days. All in all, I am very satisfied with my Amazon.com Chase credit card, for the points it offers me for buying things, along with the excellent fraud protection I received. The only thing I could think of being improved is how long it takes for the rewards points to show up on my account. Otherwise, the card is great.

name: Stacia Beniquez
review: I was able to recently do a balance transfer to my Chase Sapphire from another credit card at a much lower interest rate.  I could not believe how much less I was being charged in interest fees each month.  It was over a $45 difference.  I actually kept paying the same amount until the balance was paid off.  It was just that now this $45 was going towards principle instead of the interest fee.  Another nice thing about the card is their cash back feature.  This has come in handy on occasion when I was low in funds at the end of the month.

name: Becki Ruhbusch
review: The Chase Bank in my area is wonderful!! They are always willing to work on any problem and find a quick and satisfying solution. I had someone charge my account a large amount of money without my permission, I had never heard of this place before, but they refused to return my money saying that I had ordered from them. So I went into Chase and the manager called them herself, they were quickly agreeing to return my money. I am very thankful to Chase, they have wonderful customer service, their internet banking is easy to use, and I will always be a Chase customer.

name: Diana
review: I love my Disney Visa! First of all, it has Ariel on it. It's a beautiful card. That's really the reason why I got it in the first place. Second, the introductory 0% that I got a few years ago was great, and the current APR is relatively low. The rewards program is very simple and quick, and it's nice to use the points. I also just recently booked a Disney Cruise and received a $50 onboard credit, as well as having 0% and getting a discount for thing I buy there. The customer service reps are very helpful and efficient, and I've never had any issues with fees or hidden costs.

name: Jessica Berenguer
review: I'm fairly new to banking with Chase, although my family has been banking there for years, so I knew about them. Applying there was very simple and straightforward and they have a great customer service. I have both a checking and saving account with them and the only thing I have a slight problem with is the saving account which, unless you have a huge amounts of money (which I don't), you're not going to get a great interest rate. Also, you have to be careful about your overdraft charges, although I have called them about it and they were extremely helpful with my transaction and questions.

name: Robert Lam
review: I signed up for this card because I wanted to take advantage of the 0% APR for 15 months as well as the 0% interest on balance transfers. I already have a Chase Freedom card and I got this card off of the reputation of the Freedom card. I had a few credit cards with some balances on them and wanted to consolidate the balances onto one card. 0% interest on balance transfers made this card attractive. The only gripe I have with this card is that there are no rewards for purchases. I have yet to take advantage of the Blueprint feature. I've read up on it and think it's a pretty neat feature. I'm pretty satisfied with this card. I was able to sign up with ease and got approved within 30 seconds of application submission. My Chase Freedom card will be my go to card because of rewards, but it's nice to have a backup.

name: Julie Petersen
review: Chase Bank has been very good to me over the years. Each time I go into the branch the tellers are welcoming, polite and go out of their way to assist me. Since I had relocated, I had switched this as my primary due to location.I would give it five stars but I'm disappointed that it has started to charge a fee with the checking account. Nonetheless, I make my minimum six transactions per month to avoid those fees. Finally, I highly recommend this bank as they have several products not only for consumers, but for businesses as well.

name: chris copernicus
review: I have had Chase banking for about 4 years now, I first got it when I turned 18 in order to put away some money in the bank and save it up, or if I didn’t want to always carry a bunch of cash on me. The fact that it is free checking is awesome, there are really no fees, hidden or obvious. The fees are passed on to the institution who allows the card to be used, which is like 10 cents per swipe or something miniscule. I have had no problems with my account. ATM's are super fast, especially to some other companies where it takes 5 minutes to make a withdrawal or deposit and I can do it in 30 seconds. Good customer service, always friendly, always helpful. They even have online customer support which is handy. My only problem is that fact you can’t withdraw anything lower than $10 bills, expect to have a lot of 20's. Overall awesome.

name: Erasmo Snyders
review: I had another card for a while and then they changed some of their policies. Since I had it for so long, I didn't realize that I had a lot of other options so I started to do some research. This was definitely one of the best ones out there! I was able to transfer my balance without incurring any interest, was given a cash back bonus, had an APR of 0% (it runs out in another couple of months, but my APR will be minimally low) and get reward points! I had really good credit so I was able to get this card and I'm so lucky! An excellent card if you can get it!

name: Timothy Proctor
review: As far as travel cards go, the Chase Sapphire Preferred card is one of my favorites, if not my most favorite. I got a 40,000 point bonus, which translated to a $400 credit, how awesome is that? This is the absolute best travel card, especially for those who travel frequently and spend a lot.  Every time you use points to book travel through Chase, 20% of those points are automatically refunded. For example, 50,000 pints becomes 65,000, and $500 becomes $625. Again, awesome.  You earn 2 points per dollar spent on travel and dining and one point per dollar elsewhere. Once a year every year, Chase pays out a 7% rewards dividend. The annual fee is $95 but was waived the first year. Having the card for about a year, I’ve had to deal with customer service of course, and my experience was about average. It was what one could expect from dealing with a big bank.

name: James Kerry
review: I opened with Chase while studying at UC Berkeley. Being a UC Berkeley student, it was quite easy for me to open my account here. They gave me an extra $125 just for opening a new account, which was nice, specially for a student moving to a new place. I liked the idea - it made me a loyal customer. I never had any issues with them. The debit card was accepted at all stores in the area, so I never had to worry. Once I lost my card, was easy to report it and they took swift action to protect me from theft. I have since recommended them to a bunch of friends who have enjoyed similar service. I would recommend to one and all. If you really need a reason - open and get $125 for free for that exquisite date you always wanted to take your gf to, and you'll love it!

name: Marina Clobber
review: I've had this card for FOREVER.  The rewards are really great, and they are easy to use.  The website interface is also easy to use.  I can see all the statements and monitor my spending.  It also works well with things like Mint.com.  The credit limit probably depends on how good your score is - mine is pretty high.  When I was out of town I was able to use it with no problem (some card companies will hassle you about it).  I just put all of my expenses on this card and pay it off monthly– there really isn’t a better one for rewards.  It’s a good deal for the consumer if you can pay it off every month.

name: Ruth Hillbrant
review: I can only say good things about Chase and this credit card. I do all my banking with Chase. Personal and Business. So, when I decided it was time for a credit card, Chase was the logical choice. The customer service is always great. Very knowledgeable. They are also always willing to go that extra mile for the customer. I like the fact that I could select my due dates and everything. Also the promotions that go along with the card are well worth it. Its a great advantage and stretches your money. Using the cash back for bills that I normally pay off every month has allowed me to gain many points. The more points the more perks. Great company. Great card!

name: Pamela Hillebrandt
review: They were one of the first credit cards to give me a chance after my husband died and I had very little credit. It started at $1000.00 credit limit and is now higher. I would highly recommend this card. It came with 0% APR for one year. I have now had it about 5 years. It comes in handy for emergencies. The Blueprint feature comes in handy as well, it lets me keep track of all my purchases. I really like the lack of a yearly fee. I tried once to buy a computer online with it and they denied the purchase, at first. They wanted to make certain it was me, because I've never bought anything that expensive with this card before. Once I confirmed my purchase, it went through no problem. I'm glad to have them looking out for me, especially on a large transaction. What more could a person ask for? If you are starting back out on your own, this is the perfect card!

name: Patty Chang
review: I have this card in addition to my Chase Freedom, which I tend to use a lot more often, because the two cards are better when used in different categories. This Sapphire card is more geared towards high spending travelers. Though there are a lot of benefits and dividends, unless you really spend a lot, it will not outweigh the $95 annual fee that you will incur after the first year. Also, if you do not dutifully pay your balance each month, the interest rates would be pretty hard to swallow. Haha, but the best thing I like about this card, is that this card is made from a much heavier material than the typical cheapo plastic, so it feels pretty cool!

name: Phoebe Suben
review: This credit card was one of my first "real" credit cards. The intro APR and the 100$ cash back (although I think when I got this card, it might have been 150 or 200$) was definitely what enticed me to sign up and hope to be accepted. I've had this card for well over five years and am still using to this day, along with my other Chase credit cards. The benefit of the 5% cash back offer on my daily basic purchases helps me feel better about my expenses. When I was approved for this credit card, they gave me a pretty decent credit limit. About half a year later they increased it substantially due to my good history. Definitely a great "starter" credit card after the initial "$500 credit limit" credit cards. Sign up now!

name: Sean Forde
review: Recently my mortgage was moved to Chase Bank and although I was skeptical at first it seems to be a good transition. I was previously with MetLife Home Loans and they had their advantages but the system in which I had to pay my bills left something to be desired. Now the transition had its hiccups, I could not sign up for bill pay through my checking account for some odd reason however after talking with customer service they were able to resolve this problem and the next day I was able to sign up. Ever since then things have been super easy. My notifications come on time. I can see everything through the website. There are no annoying separate windows that pop up when I need to pay a bill. The worst thing I hated about the met life system was the fact that sometimes it would forget my information and I would have to type in my routing and checking account number again. So far there have been no worries about this happening. I definitively like Chase. I may even get a checking account with them soon.

name: Evon Abts
review: I have been using this card for quite a while now, and really enjoy having it around. I used it to go on vacation to Disney with my family, and having this card was simply amazing. To start out, that $50 Disney Gift Card was quite awesome. The rewards for taking a trip to Disney, was even more awesome than the $50 Gift Card they already gave. Since we were already planning a trip down there with this card, it meant we got a lot of great perks when we got to the park. Such as the meet and greet with Disney Characters, the kids loved it. They got to have a photo with Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck. They have that picture framed on their wall now and will probably never forget it! If you or your family is planning to have a trip to Disney, this card is a must have in my opinion. It is awesome and shows you are a big fan of Disney!

name: Wilhelm Vain
review: I become a Chase client back before JP Morgan bought it out. It was my first bank account and definitely left a lasting impression. The bank manager--an elderly woman--was an extreme stickler when it came to details. She walked me through the application process, and always stopped to point out an error in her own communication. She even referred me to a nice deal they had running where I could get 100 dollars for free. Overall I would say that this was the best banking I had, and still have, experienced in my human existence. Sadly, I had to leave this bank when I moved to Maryland.

name: Nilsa Felux
review: I really like this card, not only do you get cash back but the rotating 5% every quarter is really helpful.  If you can get the bonus it's obviously worth it.  Make sure to sign up for the rotating 5% however or you don't qualify, the good- you can get text reminders for this!  Then with your "cash back" you can get gift cards as well, sometimes you can get really good deals on them- also I don't believe the points/rewards expire although I never know that as I cash in constantly. Highly recommended, no annual fee and have never had an issue.  I also like the website they have, it makes the cards easy to pay as well and all your information, including your points, is right there.  So if you have more than one Chase card for example they will all be listed.

name: Zulema Mcgue
review: This is a great credit card for me.  I got $100 cash back after I spent $500 by my second month using it.  I had a big purchase, so the $100 helped a lot.  I also get 1% cash back on all my purchases and 5% if I spend $1500 in bonus categories (every quarter, I believe).  With this card I get even more cash back for shopping online, which is mostly how I shop.  That was a big selling point for me.  There's no annual fee and no APR for the first 15 months, and I'll have the balance paid off  by then.

name: Genny Ilic
review: I have had a Chase Visa for several years now.  I like the no annual fee and the fact that I got $100 cash back after spending about $500.  My interest rate could probably better, but I have never ask for a reduction.  Since I pay off my credit card balance each month, this is not an issue for me.  Their online site makes it easy for me to pay it off since I have it linked with my checking account.  At the end of each year, you have the capability to run a report of everything that you have purchased throughout the year.  It is also broken down into categories such as food, gas, entertainment, etc.

name: Stacey Rucker
review: Me and my family got an offer in the mail for this credit card we thought it would be perfect for us since we were going to Disney World for the first time.We applied for the card and got approved right away I like the sign up bonus they offered on this card and the fact that I can earn rewards each time I use this card and the points add up rather quickly. I also like the fact that we get 10% off in the Disney store since we have 4 kids it a good bargain for my family we did look at other cards but when we got this offer knew we had to have this card.

name: Stearns
review: I've been with Chase Bank for about 4 years and they have been wonderful. Any time there has been a problem I go into my local branch and it gets resolved to my satisfaction. ATMs are easy to use and don't require deposit slips - a big plus because who carries those around with them all the time? I will say that I have found the customer service better at branches than over the phone. Overall, Chase has been very fair with me, allows you time to replenish your account if it's overdrawn and doesn't crush you with excessive fees to bank there. I'm glad I joined them.

name: Cliff Widdoes
review: I love this card!  All I have to do is spend money and I earn points towards a free flight, it doesn't get much better than that.  Both my Mom and I fly Southwest because they're the most economical way to travel to where each other lives.  We both got this Southwest card so we can see each other more often!  Being able to earn points towards a free flight means we can see each other one or two more times during the year.  Aside from that perk, it's a good card to have.  They monitor transactions so when something looks fraudulent they let you know quickly.  If I've ever had an unauthorized charge or a dispute with a merchant, they've helped fix the situation.  Customer service is easy to get to, online banking is easy to navigate.

name: Toby Greiner
review: I have been with Chase for a few years now, and they continue to impress me over all the other banks I've been with.  I love that I don't have to worry about tons of fees with them.  We only have 1 direct deposit set up between me and my wife, and it covers the direct deposit requirement across all our accounts. We also get free checks whenever we run out of them, and other benefits like 1% back on our mortgage payment.  The mobile app has also been amazing for when my wife cashes her checks at home since she no longer needs to go to the physical bank to do it.  Out interest rates are good, but not amazing as opposed to what some of the credit unions are offering.  But the lower interest rate is worth it for all the benefits I just listed.

name: Andre Figueroa
review: Amazing bank for the New York area. To start, they're everywhere, which is one thing that concerned me the most. I don't want to travel just to go to a bank. A Chase can be found on almost every street corner practically. As for the bank themselves, I've been a customer for many years, since my high school days and they've never steered me wrong. Customer service was always quick and spot on, even their phone assistance was perfect. They were also generous if you are a good customer, overturning small offenses such as accidental overdrawns if it’s your first time. They're also helpful in various sectors, helping me with both of my first two credit cards. My first having expired and them guiding me to their Freedom card with a higher limit all while keeping me informed as to every little detail of the card itself. Service for things such as losing your card is stellar too, giving a new one instantly and offering delightful protection against fraud and other unforseeables that could happen with a lost card.

name: Andre Figueroa
review: What's there to say about this. I'm a college student and been with chase for many years. As an entryish level credit card, its been great for me. I've only had it for a little over half a year but its been everything they've stated and more. Its quite easy to use, as any credit card should be, and the added internet interface makes paying it off quite simple. All my accounts are linked so payments are quick and simple and by using this card for everything I've rolled in many bonus points which in turn is extra money for myself. 1,500$ limit makes this card amazing for me and one I'm glad to use. I've yet to use it for anything other than purchases, but even the 15 months no interest made this extremely attractive, doubt I'd use this for cash withdrawals however.

name: Thomas Anderson
review: The Chase Sapphire Rewards card is the best credit card I have ever had without a doubt.  The customer service that this company gives far exceeds the standards set by its competitors and has won my business despite being asked to apply for many other cards.  The rates are great for my personal needs which include grocery shopping, traveling, gas purchases, and gift purchases.  If you have a Chase account then the experience is just made better because you can combine your accounts to make it easier to reconcile your accounts at the end of the month.  Definitely recommend to new credit card users.

name: Abby Sullivan
review: I have used this card for about a year, it's a good card, but not the greatest. It's just average. There's nothing wrong with it, but it's not fantastic. Customer Service is wonderful, they are knowledgeable and quick to answer. I use it to buy basic amenities (food, gas, etc). The perks are about average for a card, maybe a little better than average. I'm rather unfamiliar with Chase as a whole, but I do like this card.  I'd recommend it for basic purchases but I'm not too sure how it would be for larger purchases. As a whole I rate it 85/100.

name: Oliver Cueva
review: I first signed up for this card because I often stay at Marriott hotels throughout the year. I figured that I could use the card for some large purchases I had planned and earn points in return. What I found is that I often used this as my primary card for ongoing expenses. I have used several other rewards cards in the past, but this one has been the most satisfying for me. Overall I have been very happy with my Marriott rewards card. I did find that my APR and cash advance fee was relatively high. So if that is something that concerns you then you might be better off applying for a different card.

name: linda michaels
review: I signed up for a Chase Slate Credit Card to help purchase a new vehicle. They let me finance the car for 15 months with no interest so it made sense, especially because I would have been charging the card regardless. It was easy to pay off the amount over these 15 months and the online banking made everything very easy. From here I opened a checking account with Chase and everything was seamless. I can easily make payments from my checking account to my credit card same day. Also I’ve been able to use the credit card to make balance transfers at 0% APR!

name: Kapil
review: I like banking with Chase. There are a lot of ATMs around my area. I also love the reward system they have in their debit and the credit cards. I have 3 credit cards from Chase and all are excellent card for different reasons. I always had a good customer service experience with this bank. Once I saw transactions that I did not do in my statement. When I called the customer service, they immediately cancelled the charges, cancelled my current card number and sent me a new card. They also sometimes have certain cash offer to open checking and savings account. I got $100 just for opening the account back in 2009. I always had a great experience with Chase Bank.

name: Ariana Morris
review: I am one of those people who can't stand to spend money to use my money. I don't go to ATM's where I am charged to withdraw cash, I don't have credit cards or bank accounts that charge me a fee. Every penny counts. I find that if I responsibly pay off my credit card bill every month, using a credit card for every single purchase is a great way to earn extra cash. And this is the card I use to do that. Every 3 months they change categories that you earn 5 percent back on. Sometimes it includes gas stations, or grocery stores. Sometimes all restaurants. The rest of the time, every purchase earns you 1 percent. I haven't had another card that earned cash back so quickly. It's also accepted everywhere, being Visa. You can even cash out your points in any increment-- you don't have to earn a certain amount before being allowed. The money can be applied directly to your statement. The customer service people are always friendly and eager to help. Hands down, this is the rewards card for the person who is saving every penny.

name: Kelly Farrington
review: I would highly recommend this bank to others. The employees are very nice and extremely helpful. Whenever I have had a problem or just did not understand something with my account someone was always there willing to help. One of the best features is the overdrawn protection.I had not made it to the bank to deposit my check in time and I had bills that automatically withdraw money from your account. I thought I had another day before the phone bill came out. I was mistaken, they pulled out the money and left me in a negative. I was upset because that meant I had to pay the overdraft fee. I contacted the bank and they told me I am protected and that there will be no extra charge. I was so relieved and thanked them over and over. This bank is one of the best I have used.

name: Kirk Miller
review: I applied for this card because I'd seen an ad saying they'd give me 30 dollars credit if I did, and after I did some research I found that it was not a bad card, so I decided to go ahead and get it.  I feel like I made the right choice, I’ve never once had any sort of problem with either amazon or chase, and the points I get have helped me out a lot.  I just wish there was some way to get more warnings that the bill is coming up.  It’s snuck up on me a couple of times.

name: Monica Figueroa
review: I started banking with Chase when Wachovia went under, and at first I wasn't sure to expect. But the service I have received since then has completely sold me, and now I'm a Chase customer for life! I have a college student account, which is fantastic because it has no crazy fees associated with it. I love being able to Quickpay money into my families accounts at the drop of a hat, and the fact there are so many locations available makes it super convenient to withdraw or deposit cash. I would highly recommend Chase to those looking for a reliable bank!

name: Tess Rooney
review: I have banked with Chase for years. I have both a checking and savings account with them. My checking account is a Chase College account, which is a great service that I would recommend to any college student.  Every time I go into any Chase bank in town they are always courteous and friendly. My last experience was especially pleasant. Everyone went above and beyond to help me out! I had to change some of my information and it took no time at all, which is great when you're busy like I am. I have yet to have a bad experience dealing with Chase bank and I will definitely stick with this bank!

name: Maria Lemon
review: I have only had positive experiences with my Chase Slate card thus far, and I've had it for around three years. I was initially attracted to the lack of yearly fees and start up fees. After all, no one wants to pay just to have a credit card. I have to say I have never been hit with hidden fees or anything sneaky. Chase seems to be a good, upstanding company. I really like that you can make payments online. The website is very useful in that it keeps all your purchase and payment information well organized. My friend also has a Chase Slate card and about a year ago she had her wallet stolen and unauthorized purchases were put on the card by the thief. Chase did not hold her responsible for any of the charge and they didn't make her jump through hoops to get them taken off either. When I first got my card I  spoke with a representative on the phone for help getting started and she was very polite and helpful. I would recommend doing business with this company and I would also recommend using this specific card.

name: Justin
review: I have a business account with Chase, both a checking account and a credit card account. Every time I go to the branch location, I'm greeted promptly and never wait in line for more than 2-3 minutes. Most times I'm helped immediately though. Getting everything set up was relatively painless. We got our debit and credit cards within just a few days of signing up. We also got starter checks to use immediately while we waited for our ordered ones. Our business banker is usually quick to answer questions and the manager helps when he's not available. All in all, I'd say they do a good job, although I haven't had any tough issues for them to handle.

name: Cindy Ranfranz
review: I have had this chase card for a long time - not sure how many years. They converted it to the freedom card a year ago with no hassle at all. I find them very easy to deal with when I call with a question. The website is very user friendly. I can find payments, history and tax information readily. Making online payments is easy! I can maneuver in and out, making changes as needed and am given a chance to review before makinga final submission. I love the rewards program and am updated by email when new reward options become available. Reward balances are easily accessible as is the site for using rewards as cashback or purchase. Is the best credit card I have had.

name: Jake Nelly
review: When I was in New York for college, my friends and I all used Chase as our go-to checking and savings bank for all our needs. Chase was perfect for us because it has so many branches within NYC that it was easy to withdraw money at anytime without any huge surcharge from an ATM or some other bank branch. Chase helped us with any problem we had, and was honestly one of the best banks I've ever dealt with in my life. My time with Chase was very enjoyable, and me and my friends recommend Chase to any college student living in the city.

name: Brian Palm
review: I've had this card for a while now, and while I don't have any complaints, I don't have any reason to recommend this card either.  The rewards are ok; not really that different from other credit cards that are out there.  The interest rates are pretty good for a credit card, but with me paying the $95 per year, I suppose it evens itself out.  I don't use it that often, really just enough to keep my account active.  I generally use it for gas and grocery store runs.  I haven't cashed in for any rewards yet, so I can't comment on those, but the customer service reps have been very helpful with any issues I've called them with.  Overall, this is a good credit card for basic purchases, but it's nothing special.

name: Johnny Mitchell
review: I applied for this card on a whim to get the 30 dollar gift card, expecting to get declined because I didn't have any credit (be it good or bad). I was accepted with a 1500 dollar credit limit and I've been using it in place of my bank card ever since. It doesn't charge any annual or monthly fees so long as you pay the balance at the end of the month (I always do) and then you accumulate the standard points to earn a percentage of your spending back. They try to make you use them on amazon but you can actually just get a credit toward your statement where each point equals one cent. Or if you would be ok with waiting, you can have them send you a check. I just save my points until I get 2000 points so I can get a 20.00 dollar credit on my statement. Definitely worth a look if you use amazon at all.

name: abigail lee
review: Chase is a great bank! I often get emails about the debit card cash back deals that they have and I use it all the time. Before, I have used my debit card to redeem 5% cash back at California Pizza Kitchen and Macaroni Grill. I do not even have to enroll for the cash back program, all I do is use my debit card. Chase Bank also offers cash back programs for numerous online retailers. I have used my debit card to get cash back at Sunglass Hut. Whenever I go to the Chase banks, the tellers are very friendly and helpful. Chase has numerous branches all over Southern California. This is very helpful for me as I never have to worry about finding a Chase ATM. The locations are easily accessible and easy to find with their Chase App. Overall, Chase is a great bank!

name: Stephanie
review: Chase bought out Washington Mutual, that I had an online checking account with at the time. Once my account converted to a Chase checking, I got to enjoy the great features of no monthly fees and absolutely free checks. The only downfall that I had was that at that time there were no nearby branches, so the ATM fees were $4 at least ($2 to Chase & $2 to the ATM owner.) I usually chose to get cash back, but there were a few times, when I had to use an ATM not affiliated with Chase. Ultimately the lack of a local branch led me to switch to a local bank, but I cannot say that I was unsatisfied overall with my experience while banking with Chase.

name: Glennis Vernaglia
review: I've had the Chase Slate card for about two years.  I signed up to take advantage of the 0% intro APR.  I have been very happy with this card so far.  I've never come across a place where it wasn't accepted.  I spend a lot of time in Europe, and it is very convenient for me to pay my bill online through my chase account, as well as keep track of my purchases while overseas.  I've also found that the card is extremely easy to use and widely accepted overseas.  Although I have two other credit cards, this is the only one that I use.  I've had problems in the past with other credit cards, where I felt that the companies were trying to take advantage of their customers.  I find that this is not the case with my Chase Slate card and everyone I've dealt with at Chase has been helpful and informative.  For a person who is very picky about credit cards, I'd highly recommend this one.

name: Alexa Sklar
review: I remember when there were other banks and Chase bought them. I was a Washington Mutual customer. Then Chase took over. The only good experience I had with them was, it was easy opening a second checking account with them online. The main problem I had with them was, I owed them money on two credit cards. I went bankrupt in April 2010. All my debt was discharged in BK. However, I still had one checking account with them. In January on 2011, they transferred out all the money from my checking account. I spoke to Chase and was told it was to payback the credit card debt I owed them. I informed them it was discharged in BK. After faxing a number of documents and being insulted by their employees. They finally put the money back in my account. The money was gone for 5 days. They made it appear it was gone for only 2 days. Then two weeks later, they did it again. This time to pay off the money I owed for the second credit card I had with them. After another fight and 5 more days, that money was put back. I then sued them for violating the Fair Credit Act. I won and will never have anything to do with that bank again.

name: Mike Brandt
review: This is the card I currently use. I can’t say that I’ve ever had any problems with it, and have no problems to report. I use my card predominantly for buying small items, gas, and other things that are low-price expenses. It’s easy to pay off and I keep my balance low. If I’ve ever had any questions, I’ve been able to call up customer service and get an answer to my question with a couple seconds. I really have nothing but positive things to say about my experiences with this card and CHASE in general. I can highly recommend this card!

name: Lorretta Kirkbride
review: I applied for this card because I spend a lot of money on Amazon -- it's probably where I make most of my purchases.  I like that there is a 3x reward bonus (points) when you make purchases on Amazon and a 1x bonus when you make places other places.  To my knowledge, you can't do anything with the points besides applying them to your future Amazon balances, but that's really not such a bad thing.  They gave me a pretty low credit limit ($500) but it might increase with time.  My husband wasn't able to get a card when he applied (he doesn't have a well-established credit history), so this card may not be available to everyone.  All in all, I don't have any complaints!

name: Beatrice Renee
review: I've had my Amazon card for about three years now.  I originally applied for it because I would be given a $25 discount off of a first purchase, and it is a rewards card, which I didn't have at the time.  I had decided that since it had a higher interest rate this would be a great card to have if I paid it off on time every month.  I would get 3 times the points for every purchase I made on Amazon.  I have accumulated rewards in the several hundred dollar range by this point in time.  I cannot say  I have always been able to pay it off in time every single month as life happens, but during the times I couldn't I felt like in the previous months the rewards I had received helped offset it.  At one point I had my credit card information stolen, or skimmed from a retailers computer that a thief had hacked.  I was able to work with Amazon and Chase, who the card is serviced through, to make sure that no information of mine had been gained by the thieves. They locked the card down immediately after noticing suspicious activity.  I would highly recommend this card but remember to watch the interest rate.

name: Sherrill Bitah
review: This is one of my favorite credit cards. It was 0% interest for one year and I was able to get $100 dollars cash back after I spent $800.  They have a great choice of rotating categories each year such as supermarkets, drugstores, and amazon.com where you earn 5% on each purchase.  I can also obtain points without having a minimum value.  The card also allows you to earn extra points by shopping online on certain merchant sites such as the Apple store and DSW.  The Chase credit card has wonderful customer service and they immediately notified me when there was suspicious activity on my card.

name: Tiffany McGuire
review: I have loved this card. I was able to get a $300 sign up bonus just by showing customer service proof that I knew it existed in the past. I love the rotating categories and payout is really easy, with no minimum like Discover and no tricky values like Citi. Ultimate Rewards Mall is awesome for online shopping, but it's probably the second best in the industry compared to ShopDiscover. Interest rates aren't great, so you want to make sure it's paid down by the time the introductory rate expires. I like how it easily incorporates with my bank account as well. I can see all of my bank information with one online visit. This really might be my favorite card.

name: Randolph Granieri
review: I originally got the Amazon when Christmas shopping and wanted the $35 bonus sign up money. I wasn't planning to use it for anything else. I wasn't concerned about the points in the beginning but now for the last few years I put all my purchases on it everywhere I go. No privacy as far as my whereabout – yes I know but I get $50 credit on my bill after 5000 points. Can turn in points much lower than that to buy or use as credit for your card bill. There are other cards that say 5 points per dollar put they are very restricted - this card always gives you at least one and up to 3.

name: John Lee
review: Well I've had a Chase Checking account for about 2 years now and so far so good. Checking is very easy with them, they have one of the best online services I've experienced so far, and customer service is usually very helpful and great. Adding a secondary account holder was an easy process and getting the extra cards were easy as well. The only thing I didn't enjoy about this bank was the constant $10 they kept charging me every month even though I had met the requirements for no fees. I went into a branch to talk to someone about it and they gave me some confusing policy where a bunch of requirements had to be met in the month. Well, the solution was easy but I wish I had known about it when I signed up so they didn't charge me about a year's worth of fees. Living in the NYC metropolitan area, finding a Chase bank is just about as easy as hailing a cab or finding a hot dog cart. It's great for convenience.

name: Rami Doas
review: I feel so comfortable to be with Chase. Many people believe that it is the best bank in the United States. The most important aspect of Chase is its being trustworthy and stable. A lot of big organizations have their money in it, such as MTA in NY. No doubt, Chase branches and ATM machines are everywhere, you can find them easily, easier than finding the machines and branches of the other banks. A good aspect of chase is that it has a very good website, from which you can manage your checking, saving or credit card account easily. It is very user-friendly. I use it to monitor my checking account and make transfers in addition to paying my bills in a very smooth way. Customer service there is great and the staff is very decent. They are well trained on fast problem resolution. I like everything about Chase and always invite my friends to enroll in it.

name: Annberlynn Belle
review: I have only currently had Chase Sapphire for about six months, but it has been a very good six months. I had seen an ad on TV about it, and it almost looked too good to be true, but I decided to try it out. It ended up being one of my best decisions yet because it is simple to understand and  you receive points to cash in for money or other good things that your points qualify for. So far, I have had a wonderful experience with the customer service and an even better experience with the actual ease of use with the card and the points system. I am never looking back!

name: Izzy Pieniądz
review: Chase has been nothing but awesome since I joined them. I started with a student account at I am still with them. The customer service at the branches I have been to has been nothing short of amazing, they are always willing to help. I use their direct deposit and I have never had any problems with it. The online banking app is fantastic and easy to use. They have been helpful in getting me the necessary loans for my car and we are currently working on securing me a credit card so I can build my credit history further. I plan on staying with them for the long run.

name: Charan B. Ramireddy
review: I have my checking account with Chase for the last 6 years and they do an exceptional job in handling my money. I have checking account and also credit cards with Chase bank. I also have other BOFA account and I can easily transfer money from Chase through online. I found it very convenient. One of the first banks to introduce mobile deposits and I think they are always in the forefront of using modern technologies. The only issue that I have seen recently is more down time of their website. Other than that, everything is easy to use at chase.com.

name: Jason Hall
review: I've had the chase slate card for about 3 years now and is my primary credit card at the moment. I had originally got the Slate to replace my old card but soon found the blueprint feature to be one of the main draws of the card. If your the kind of person that's afraid to have a credit card because they might get caught up in the payments and end up paying out way more than you should then Slate with Blueprint is what you need. It keep you on track with payments and lets you set up your own automated payment methods. I personally have found this feature to be the most use full on a credit card yet. So for anyone that wants a credit card with little hassle then you just might want to look into the Chase Slate. Chase is my go to bank for any credit card due to there great quality in service.

name: Ammie Konicki
review: I must say this has been a great card to use, first of all it has no annual fee, which these days is a requirement for me! You also get a $100 cash back after you spend a measly $500 which I do easily alone with bills and groceries. APR isn't the greatest, it can get rather high but I tend to pay my bills in time so I don't have to worry. You also get 5% cash back on certain things such as Gas and Restaurants, not to mention a steady 1% cash back on all other purchases. If you get an offer with a card such as this don't hesitate to sign up!

name: Samantha A.
review: I started banking with Chase in 2008 when I moved out of state and my regular bank was not local to my new state. I went in and got set up quickly and even to this day, I remember the gentleman who helped me was extremely kind, quick, and efficient. He made sure I understood how everything worked and got me set up with a temporary card that day! He even put a rush on my new debit card, since I really needed one immediately. I got the card two days later in the mail and was on my way! Every time I went in to cash a check or withdraw money, the employees were friendly and personable and thanked me for my business. I never had any issues with them, and even later opened up a credit card because I was so pleased with the experience.

name: Samantha Archibald
review: My Chase Freedom card is one of my favorites! Unlike my other two cards, there are NO annual fees! You might not think an annual fee matters much, but when you add up how much you spend year after year on those fees it gets expensive. I got one of the lowest interests rates as well, so this is one of my go-to cards especially for gas. I have to FILL UP my tank every other day or so due to how much I drive for work, and getting the cash back for gas is probably how I get the most out of the card. I have not had to call customer service for anything, even though I have had this card for awhile now, but I have been into the bank and know that if their customer service is anything like it is at the local branch, they are doing an excellent job and I know I would be taken care of quickly.

name: Rachel Bolter
review: Chase has always been courteous and responsive whenever I had a problem. Branches are always clean with smiling faces ready to help you. I have been with Chase for 5 years now and have only once had a problem. Several online transactions that I had not made were processed through my account. I called and reported it, the charges were reversed immediately and I have had no problems since. Their online access is easy to understand and allows you to access your account 24 hours a day. Rather you need to make a transfer, pay a bill or check you records, it’s all online and ready when you are. If you are considering opening an account please consider Chase banking!

name: Melissa Williams
review: I really like my Chase Freedom card. I've had it about a year and a half, and love that it has no annual fee and a decent interest rate. I've earned probably about $100 in cash back rewards, which doesn't sound that impressive, but is pretty good considering I don't use the card all that much. The special categories for 5% cash back are pretty good, especially 5% on gas and restaurants (the categories rotate quarterly). I have found that the rewards get processed pretty quickly--usually within a few weeks. I had one incorrect charge a few months ago, and Chase was really quick to do an investigation and reverse the charge. Overall I've been really happy with this card and don't feel like I really need any others.

name: Sheryl Papageorgio
review: Chase has been really good to us for a variety of reasons. When me and my husband signed up we came in with a promotional offer for $350 for signing up for a checking and savings account. The guy that signed us up let us know that that promo was per person, and my husband could add a checking account for himself and get another $200 sign up bonus, he didn't have to do this for us, and we walked out that day getting more money than we expected simply for signing up. Other than that, their accounts are really simple with no hidden fees. Only one of us had to have direct deposit set up with one account to get free checking on all our accounts. Other banks wanted a direct deposit from both of us. The reason we even went to Chase in the first place is because they have the mobile check cashing app, and with me getting paid in checks I was simply tired of going to the bank every other week. So the fact that I didn't need to have direct deposit as well was a huge bonus.

name: olivia dobson
review: I've had my Chase account for 4 years now. I opened my account as a student and received excellent rates. As a student I was entitled to overdraft protection and no minimum account balance. This was extremely helpful when I was a student because I didn't have much of a cash flow at the time. As a bonus when I opened my account they matched my first deposit.
