This was such an excellent incentive that I wish that still had! I have watched their ATMS change over the past few years. They updated their ATMS to deposit checks directly into their machines and print a copy of the check you deposited. I can also use my iphone to deposit checks into my account in as little as a few minutes. Their customer service is excellent! There was a fellow who had helped me set up my bank account and later became friends with me. He was able to help my partner and I get a mortgage for our new home. He was so helpful that he would even take trips to visit us with updates at our work. I absolutely love Chase bank and have had such a great experience with them. The only thing that I wish was different is that they had more branches throughout the country. I travel to Rhode Island frequently and have yet to see a Chase bank nearby.

name: danielle
review: Chase bank has been very good to me, but I definitely don't know if I would be with them if I had a choice. I had some credit issues and I needed to open a new account for a job. I was very glad that Chase took a chance on me, but their service sucks. They charge a fee for every account I have with them and there are no perks for the most basic accounts. It is like those banks you see on the commercial where they are those super corporate giants and you feel like the tiny tiny little guy. It is like that, I don't feel like a valued customer and just another number.

name: Kiera Poland
review: This is a wonderful credit which I have been using for many years, it always gives me 1% cash back and many times it offers higher rate.  No annual fees.  And you can use it almost anywhere.  And I have to mentiion here that its service is very good too!  I have found a wrong purchase once which turned out made by my husband who did not tell me, the customer service immediately correct it for me after I had called them.  I highly recommendate this card to a person who is currently shopping for a credit card, it is a great card with wonderful service.  You can get your cash back fast and it will be directly deposited into your checking account.

name: Richard Astleyton
review: I’ve had this card for about a year now and I’ve been pretty happy with it. The initial cash back reward was generous and was posted to my account very shortly after my first purchase. The rotating 5% cash back categories are great; especially since six months of the year gas is included, which comes out to about 20 cents off per gallon! I haven’t had any reasons to interact with customer service other than one incident where I needed to perform a chargeback, but Chase’s customer support got back to me within a day, accepted my claim, and posted a credit to my account. That’s what I like to see!

name: Matt Clark
review: My wife and I have had the Chase Freedom card for well over four years now and have had a great experience. Their customer service supporting the card is EXCELLENT. About two years ago, we had our credit card number "skimmed" at a local store, and unfortunately it was fraudulently used to make a purchase at a Walmart out of state. I received a call within minutes from Chase questioning the purchase, as they tracked our spending habits and knew the purchase wasn't typical. The customer service agent was so patient and understanding and ensured me from the moment I spoke with her that we wouldn't be responsible for the amount. Chase cancelled the card immediately, and we received brand new cards in the mail within 2 days. Additionally, the rewards program is hands down the best out their for a card that doesn't carry an annual fee. The quarterly rewards categories are for everyday type purchases and over the course of using the card we have accumulated well over a $1,000 in rewards cash back.

name: Laura Rogers
review: I signed up for this card a few months ago to take advantage of the 0% intro APR. Then, I set up an automatic payment through my bank account to prevent defaulting. So far, my dealings with Chase have been very hands-off. (I guess this is a good thing because it means I haven’t had any problems with them.) I called them a few days ago to ask when my promotional rate ends. The person I spoke with had a British accent but spoke clearly. He was very friendly and very helpful. My only complaint about this card is that their website isn’t as intuitive as the sites for some of the other cards I’ve had. But, overall, my experience with this card has been a very positive one.

name: Bradley Jacobson
review: I’ve had a Chase Slate card for approximately four years now.  It is very convenient and comforting to know that I have this card in my wallet with me at all times.  I primarily use the card for very large purchases, in cases of emergencies, or when I just don’t have enough funds to purchase an item or service that I need.  I especially like their new feature online, where I am able to pay off specific charges instead of just paying towards the total balance.  This is particularly helpful with gas purchases, and allows me to avoid paying more interest than I need to.  All in all, my Chase Slate card is there for me whenever I need it, and I’m grateful to have it!

name: Jules Esper
review: I have used Chase Sapphire for almost three years now. The customer service is pretty run of the mill, not excellent, but not atrocious. I find that whenever I have a question, I can usually get Customer to respond to a message (sent from within my account) within 3 days, if the message is sent on a week day. By phone you can generally get a problem resolved very quickly. The rewards offered on this card are pretty standard. On my card, you cannot redeem cash rewards until you have enough points for $20.00. On other chase cards, you can redeem cash rewards whenever you have any amount of points. All in all, my experiences with this card seem to indicate that it's a good card for students and young professionalism to build their credit history with.

name: Jessica
review: Chase has been a fantastic bank for me. I love their mobile app through which I usually access my accounts. I have a checking, savings, and credit card with them. My favorite feature is probably the mobile deposit. I can take pictures of a check, and literally deposit it right there from my phone! It's incredible. Making a deposit becomes so easy! They're also really helpful with direct deposit. I pretty much never have to physically go to a location! Their customer service is also fantastic. I've never had any problems. It can be a bit of a hassle actually getting someone on the phone, but once you do, it's smooth sailing. I'll definitely be a customer for life!

name: Cory Grant
review: Before I had a dedicated business credit card and needed to fly constantly when setting up my business this was a great card.  I'm a loyal Southwest airlines customer so why not save on flights.  Some credit cards make it difficult to redeem travel points but this was always a simple process and I've already used it to receive quite a few flights.  They frequently have opportunities to accrue additional points like when redeeming for airport services, rental cars, hotels etc.  There is an annual fee but if you're looking for a card to redeem for Southwest air travel you can't beat this great card.  Online banking is easy to use and customer service has always been friendly and helpful the few times I've contacted them.

name: Kelle Scott
review: I have been banking with Chase for the previous four years, and while I don't have a credit card with them, I do have a checking and savings account. They have always been extremely helpful when I have a problem, with the exception of when I was travelling overseas. While in Costa Rica, I lost my debit card and while I was able to cancel my card while there, I was not able to find an affiliate of Chase or access my money in order to get home. This created a big problem and I would hope that Chase would partner with more international banks to avoid this for travelling customers in the future. With that being said, my experience with Chase in the US has been stellar, and I have really enjoyed being a customer of theirs these past years.

name: Brittany Brake
review: I have had a Chase Freedom credit card now for 2 years and had 0% APR for one year. I find the credit card company to be very responsive to needs. It is extremely easy to get in touch with a "real person."  I have called and gotten a lower APR. I also accidentally forgot to make a payment, and Chase waived the late fee. They are very easy to work with! I have used this card and gotten the cash reward from points. I would highly recommend the Chase Freedom card to anyone opening up a new account or looking to switch to a reliable card.

name: Willow Kmith
review: I have had this Amazon card for a little over a year now and I love it! I have had no fraudulent charges or any transaction errors on this card, which previous cards I have had.  I love how this card offers cash back and you are able to earn points back for shopping on Amazon which I primarily do.  You also get 2% back for using this card at Gas stations and restaurants.  You get 1% cash back on anything else. This is one of the best reward cards that anyone could have in my option.  Its easy to get approved even for a small amount.  Once you make payments on time after a few months they will raise your credit limit.  Definitely recommend anyone who is thinking about getting a credit card to look into Amazon Rewards Credit Card.

name: Leeanne Ruesch
review: I have had my Chase Sapphire preferred credit card for about a year now and I have not had any more satisfaction with other cards than I've had with this one.  The features are fantastic and the mobile app makes everything incredibly easy. My brother recommended it to me, as he has had a really great experience with them over the years. I have a very low rate and with the reminders for when due dates are coming up, I have no issues paying my balance. It certainly helps that Chase encourages me to spend wisely on things I need rather than spending aimlessly. The customer service is really fantastic, as they always remember who I am and take the time to make sure everything is taken care of for me. The customer service on the phone is also really fantastic, and if there are issues, they often have them resolved incredibly quickly. I highly recommend this card!

name: Morgan Lee
review: I've been incredibly satisfied with my Sapphire Card.  The interest is low, the signup process was minimal, and of course, everywhere takes Visa or MC.  I have Chase as a checking account as well, and I like that I can pay my bill directly from the checking account.  Additionally, in the event that I run out of money in my checking account, the Sapphire card overs whatever overdraws I might have without Chase charging me the $35 fee.  I also like the generous and useful travel rewards the card comes with! The card is also very, very useful to have overseas, as their international customer service is stellar.  If you're traveling abroad, it's really advised that you take a credit card with you in case of emergencies.  And this would be the card to take!

name: Aurelio Stuble
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred card is really incredible. There is, at certain points in the year, a very large bonus for signing up. Without even taking this into consideration, the card is an excellent card to use. There are lots great reward points that can be earned which can be redeemed for cash, gift cards, and an assortment of products. I've never had any problems with their customer support as they are always friendly, helpful, and willing to go the extra mile to help me sort out any technical problems I am having with the service. Their online features are very user-friendly and always remind me when I have a due date coming so that I never miss a payment. If you have the opportunity and get approved for this, I definitely recommend it.

name: Morgan Lee
review: The Chase branch I bank at is the one on Wilshire Blvd. and Yale in Santa Monica, CA. Everything about opening the account was easy, and took less than a half hour in total. It has been about a year, and I am very, very pleased with the bank's service, product availability, and the number of locations that exist. For example, anytime I want to withdraw money, I can be almost anywhere in the country, and there's a Chase ATM within about 10 miles of where I am. I believe the only place where it's difficult to find a Chase bank is in the South. I know that all over the West coast, and east coast, they exist. I'm very happy to be a customer there!

name: Hank
review: Where do I start with how bad these guys are? First, whenever I entered the branch they would try to sell me a loan or an 'upgrade.' I had to fight off the sales tactics every time I went there. Then the fees. It got so expensive to just have a checking account there; one fee after another with no end in sight. I finally sat down with the branch manager and asked what they could do to lower my fees. Basically, nothing, he said, then he tried to sell me more loans and 'services' for even more fees. Bye-bye Chase, hello credit union. I have switched and will not look back. So long, Chase.

name: Jayvee Gustilo
review: I have been with Chase Bank for over 12 years and it’s been mostly a great experience. I love the many branches available close to where I live. When I travel around the country, I never have a problem finding a local Chase branch or a store with the branch ATM. I have a savings, checking, auto loan and credit cards through Chase. I have not had a single issue with any of the services. Though I wish the savings account would have a higher return, what they offer is standard to the industry. I have been recommending Chase to all my friends and colleagues who are looking for a different banking institution. I love banking with them and will continue banking with Chase in the foreseeable future.

name: Ashley Hickok
review: The option to deposit checks over the app with Chase is so convenient. No more trips to the ATM! I can also use the app to transfer funds between my checking and savings account instantaneously. Their online interface is also great and I can view my checking, savings and student loan accounts all on one screen. If I ever have a question about one of my accounts, I contact them via the online secure message system and they get back to me within a day. I feel safe knowing that wherever I go in this country, there is usually a Chase and I won't have to pay ATM fees somewhere else. Banking at Chase is convenient for people who don't have a lot of time to spend and don’t want to waste it at the bank.

name: JASON MATHIS
review: I absolutely love Chase bank. I have been using Chase bank ever since I got out of college and moved to NYC. They were very personal with me when I opened up my checking, savings, and business account. They explained that I should use my business account for all my work expenses since I was a real estate agent and that it would be great for taxes and for my accountant come tax season. During my 5 years with them, I have never had one problem. I had my identity stolen once and they were very accommodating and took care of everything immediately. Another plus is that Chase banks are literally everywhere and I have yet to find a branch that I didn't like. Definitely the best bank out there. I recommend it highly.

name: Mike Broemmel
review: I have been a Chase customer for over 20 years. Through that time period, I have used the Chase personal and business banking services, including checking and savings. Overall, I have been highly satisfied with my experiences at Chase. When I have had account related problems, I have always had the issue resolved promptly and to my satisfaction either through a personal banker at a branch or through telephone customer service. In this day and age, this is not a small accomplishment. I cannot even count the number of times I have needed customer service assistance at other companies only to end up completely frustrated and my problem remained unresolved. Chase offers a good array of different types of checking services, both for personal and business accounts. As I mentioned, I deal with specific bankers at Chase. The local branch assigns to me a personal banker and a business banker, which is a great resource on many different levels. I have recommended Chase many times to family members, friends and professional and business colleagues. I will continue to do so into the future.

name: Travis Chapman
review: I had Chase for many years (since I was about 16), before I made the switch to SAFE. Over the years of having Chase, I didn't have too much of a problem. It was always easy to deposit/withdrawal money, but I eventually switched due to some hidden fees I didn't know about that I found when I did some money management (like maintaining a minimum balance, and if you fall below that balance, you get tacked on a fee...), and the overall feel of the bank. Granted, Chase did what they were supposed to do....it was your bank, nothing more. Customer service was there, but there wasn't a nice, warm feeling when you walked into your bank. Overall, they are a good bank. I never had any real big problems with them, but they’re kind of like your first car...you still love it, but eventually upgrade to something better.

name: Andrew
review: To be perfectly honest, I think almost every college student is suckered into credit cards one way or another, be it free pizza, a rad t shirt, a frisbee, or one of the many inanely obnoxious mail stuffers that overwhelms us during this period of extreme growth. Nonetheless, I was suckered into a Chase credit card by a rep who bought me pizza. So I signed up, used it for a month, decided I didn't really need a credit card and cancelled it. I didn't have any real problems, but I'm leaving 3 stars because of the sleaziness of their marketing tactics.

name: Boris Shekel
review: Chase bank is honestly one of the best banks in the country. I have used Chase since I was a 17 year old college student and I have had nothing but positive experiences. I first had a Chase checking account and never experienced any fees or issues with this account. If you are in college, you can have a balance of a penny and still not be charged a fee!Recently, I have opened up a business account with Chase and it has been wonderful. I have been earning many rewards with my credit cards which helped me finance my business. Everything has been smooth in general with my business checking account.

name: Christina Gonzalez
review: WHY cant there be an authorized user for this card? That would make everything about this card perfect. I don't need to use it myself, but my authorized user who doesn't have a card would be able to use this (think college/High School kids?) and I can deposit however much is needed into the account... Disappointing. :(

name: William Mnatly
review: Because this is not a credit card in any way shape or form!

name: Michael Karpay
review: I've had this card for several years now and I have no complaints about it. They have seriously never done me wrong. I had two fraudulent charges, and both times I was informed immediately by phone and had the issue cleared up quickly and painlessly. My card has been damaged twice and I received my replacements in the mail the very next day. The customer service is not even the best part. They gave me $30 to spend on Amazon just for signing up, and I've accrued several hundred dollars of Amazon rewards (which effectively work like an Amazon gift card) in the time I've been using it.  You get 1 point for every dollar spent, 2 points per dollar on gas, restaurants, and drug stores, and 3 points for every dollar spent on Amazon. What I tend to do is use the card all year and then buy gifts for the holidays with my rewards points. It makes my life so much easier (particularly during the holidays). This is an amazing card if you use Amazon a lot.

name: Travis Chapman
review: I have always liked Chase, they have been a great bank to me over the years. A while ago I ended up getting a Chase Sapphire card, and I'm not sure exactly why I waited this long to get one. The customer service rep who walked me through the process was amazing, and she helped me every step of the way. When I first received my card, I went out and did a little shopping for myself and I fell in love with the interest rate I was getting. I was also racking up Chase points on the card, and before I knew it, I had 70,000 points. Overall, with all my experience with Chase, and the interest rate/Chase points, I am more than extremely satisfied.

name: Jay Melo
review: I got this card about a year ago.  You get 3% for Amazon purchases, 2% for gas stations, restaurants, and drugstores and 1% for all others.  I have been very happy with getting cash back in the form of Amazon points.  I don't charge very much so I takes me a couple of years to accrue enough points to redeem with most cards.  The usual minimum is $20 to $25 dollars worth of points.  The Amazon card is great because there is no minimum to redeem the points.  So I can use whatever points I have whenever I buy something.  I would recommend this card to other small purchasers as well as those who buy from Amazon.

name: Stephanie K
review: I recently applied for the Chase Sapphire card after nearly 7 years of being a client with checking and savings accounts. I walked into a local branch and received great customer service from their bankers. However, the application process was a little tedious since they told me that they couldn't approve my application right away due to the fact that I was living in another city at the time and that they needed to “verify my identity” first. I understand that this is for security purposes, but it took nearly 2 weeks of me sending my driver's license over and calling their customer service line to finally get approved.Since then, I have come across one incident where there was a fraudulent transaction on my card. Chase was very prompt in canceling out the transaction and issuing me a new card the next day. I appreciate their customer service and loyalty to their customers.

name: John Kelly
review: The customer service wasn't really all that great; the teller I dealt with was more interested in talking to her colleague about gossip in front of me rather than deal with the transaction. This is very unprofessional for a bank. However, that was the only major negative issue I dealt with from time to time at the branch I go to. Otherwise, it was easy to get my account there, and I got my bank card within a week of being approved. They've handled easily any questions and issues I've had without skirting around any issues. I can safely suggest using Chase bank if there's one in your area.

name: Mark Hodges
review: I have been a Chase Freedom member for over a year, and I have been very pleased with the service from the company.  I have used the rewards program to pay back to my balance, which is very convenient.  I have also utilized their balance transfer option to transfer a balance from another credit card company that I was having customer service issues with.  I also like their online customer account access, because I can manage all three of my Chase cards at the same time. Overall, I am very pleased with Chase Freedom, and I would certainly recommend using them if you are not already a card holder.

name: Nate
review: What drew me to Chase Bank was the opportunity to get $200 just for opening a checking account. I needed a local bank, and this sealed the deal. Although the $200 offer may be gone, it isn't difficult to find bonuses for opening an account with Chase. What also made me want to use Chase was the high density of branches and ATMs in the area. I never have a problem getting cash through Chase. I also love being able to deposit checks with just their smartphone app. It is super simple. So far, there have been zero problems. I'd highly recommend a Chase checking account, especially if you can get a decent bonus for opening one.

name: Alyssa Seideman
review: The best thing about Chase is that it's so convenient. I love the mobile app that lets me deposit checks the same day that I get them! But even if I had to go to a physical bank, they are everywhere, so it's not difficult to find one. For students there is no monthly fee for checking and savings which is great. The customer service is awesome although the website can be kind of hard to navigate. They send me texts about any purchases that seem suspicious and I can approve or deny the payment going through. The only complaint I have is that it gets expensive to move money from your savings account into your checking account too often. Otherwise everything is great and I plan to continue banking here for a long time.

name: Barbara Barnes
review: I got my Chase account several years ago and I have very few problems. Here, where I live, the workers are so nice. They explain exactly what is going on with my account and help me clear up problems. Every time I call about a problem, whoever answers the phone is nice and helpful. One time my bank card would not work at my neighborhood grocery store, I called the number on the back of my card and was told that there was no reason that my account was fine and the credit system for the store chain was at fault. I left and went to another store and had no problems. Recently, I got a text message from Chase that my account was overdrawn. I looked at my account and I had a charge at Amazon for something I had not ordered.  I sent a message to Chase from my online account. I got a message back giving me the number to Amazon. I called Amazon and they started a refund. I asked Chase if I would get an overdraft charge and they said since I was not at fault, there would not be a charge. I have no desire to change banks. I will stay with Chase.

name: Vincent
review: I've currently been with Chase for the last year and have enjoyed interacting with them on several occasions. I initially applied because of the “Deposit $100, Get $100” promotion, as well as, Chase's mobile app for online banking. I attend college in Southern California, so there are multiple banks and Chase ATMs conveniently placed near or around campus for students. The customer service remains exceptional and friendly, but the prime reason I am planning to stay with Chase remains the multiple bank locations and convenience. In the end, I am happy to say that I would consider myself a satisfied customer and am planning to stay with Chase for quite some time.

name: Noella Mortellaro
review: This is my business credit card.  I use it mostly for purchases over the internet.  What I really like about it was that on one day I ordered multiple items from 3 different countries.  I really did not think about that fact much, but the people at Ink Cash Business Card thought that these transactions were suspect.  They called me within a few hours asking me if I had been to these countries.  It took me a few seconds then I realized that the places I ordered from were outside the US.  I told them that these were internet purchases and that they were all legitimate.  I was so happy that they were watching out for me like this, I feel a little safer using this card.

name: Coco Lolo
review: I have a Slate card from Chase.  I have had this card for a few years now and have never had any problems with it.  I enjoyed the initial 0% for the first year or so (now it is for sure 15 months). There is no additional fee for this card which is a huge reason I like it. Also, when I had gone to Chase a few months ago and asked if there was any way to lower some of my interest rates, they did say that this particular card has such a low interest rate already that they were unable to go any lower. That is always good to hear.

name: Tom Garrett
review: The Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards card is the main credit card that I use. If you spend $2000 in the first 3 months, you get two free flights to just about anywhere in the continental US! I actually found that I had enough points for 3 round trip flights, so it was a pleasant surprise to get more than was expected. With this card, you are always earning points when you spend money and they have special partner programs to help you earn points even faster. Though there is a $69 annual fee, they help offset that by giving you an extra 3,000 points on your anniversary. Points can be used for more than just flights as wel. They have a great redemption program for car rentals, hotel stays, gift cards to all sorts of places and much more. This is one of the absolute best cards on the market, hands down!

name: cori
review: I have been with Chase for nearly 2 decades, back when it was still Bank One. I have had a car loan through them, multiple credit cards and various checking accounts. I have shared accounts with multiple family members and Chase always remains on top of my different accounts. There have been few mistakes or errors and little confusion or mix up during my years with Chase. I have always found them to be very helpful, patient and knowledgeable. I have also stop by a branch quickly to use a notary and they are great with that as well. I know I will continue to work with Chase in the future.

name: Lila Heatherly
review: My experience with Chase has been a good one. They've always been easy to work with, polite, and seemed to know what they're talking about. Their application was pretty standard for any bank, but the whole process was fairly easy. I've been with them for almost 4 years now and have only had one major issue: One time my card number was used in Paris. They spent quite a bit of money and overdrew my account. When I called Chase, they turned off my card and refunded the money and fees right away. I will keep using them as long as there is a branch in my area.

name: Gregory Hays
review: One of the good things about Chase Saphire card is that if you already have Chase Checking/Savings accounts with them, they will give you a.1% bonus on your points earned.  It's small, but it can all add up.  They also have rotating categories every quarter which you must activate that have bonuses for things such as restaurants, gas, airfare, etc.  So it is always important to keep up to day on those things to make sure you're maximizing your rewards.  I would recommend this card in general though no annual fee and some pretty good reward options you can take advantage of.

name: Daniel Lopez
review: I was recently approved for the Amazon.com Chase Visa and I have been pleased with the experience.  I like that my account automatically links with my Chase checking account so there is no need to register and login onto another website.  Since I do a lot of shopping on Amazon.com, the rewards program has really come in handy as I have already accumulated over $100 in points.  I have started using this card as my primary to get more points and have some extra spending money for online shopping.  My credit limit is reasonable and so is the APR.  With no annual fee, I give nothing but praise with this one.

name: Leilani Bryton
review: I’m relatively new to the Chase Sapphire card but was eager to take it, and so far so good.  I took it for the bonus of 10,000 starting points towards some traveling plans.  A fairly large purchase was coming up so I figured I'd put it on this card.  It was like saving $100 bucks. There's no annual fee so it works perfectly in that respect.  My experience with customer service has been good.  I've found if you work some of these points cards they cay really pay off. As far as rates and fees with Chase, they are a little high.  I try to pay the balance down quickly. With earning points and no annual fee to worry about it works out.

name: Kathy Cook
review: My husband and I have had our Chase Freedom credit card for 2 years and have found the company to be accurate, dependable and easy to work with.  Typically, our family only uses credit cards for vacations and other large ticket items.  However, we starting using our Chase Freedom credit card for groceries, gas, and other monthly expenses in order to accumulate "cash back" from their rewards program.  We earn between 1%-5% on the purchases and pay the credit card balance each month (this is important because their interest rate is higher than their rewards program rate).  Although our original goal was to accumulate enough cash/points for kayaks, we ended up purchasing a riding lawnmower with our Chase Freedom cash back rewards.  This is a great incentive if you are able to pay off your charges each month.  Maybe this time around we will get the kayaks!

name: Mukesh Jethwani
review: I really Love my Chase Freedom Credit Card. When I applied for it, I got a lot of points in reward that I converted to Cash. I really like it that I get points on stuff that I purchase and then I can convert my rewards anytime. The best thing is that there is no expiry date. I normally use my credit card and pay it in full. However, once I just paid the minimum and I called the customer service and they reverted the interest on the remaining balance. What I don’t like it is that every quarter I need to enable 5% cash back manually rather than it doing it automatically but that is a minor inconvenience. I tend to use my Chase Credit Card more often than other credit cards just because of the rewards. Initially, it does not look like you get a lot of rewards but overtime it grows and can be applied to my credit card or in the form of a check.

name: Nga Knezovich
review: I really adored my Chase Freedom credit card during the promotional 0% APR period.  It has been a few months after that now however, and the bliss of 5% cash back on select purchases and 1% cash back on other purchases has been replaced with annoying fees for no apparent reason and annoying emails back and forth to the company.  I really liked this card and the plethora of rewards that were available.  I pay my full balance EVERY month and have never EVER been late on a payment with them, however Chase thinks they can throw penalties on your account saying you didn't pay in full the month before and call it "interest"! What a crock.  They resolve the crappy fees after I contact them, but it really is a royal pain to go through month after month.  Each month it is some new fee to pay.  It has gotten so annoying I am considering closing my card.  I also had a issue with security within my first year of being a customer.  When it boils down to it Chase really can't be trusted with your personal information and will try to pull a fast one on you and charge you left and right for petty things, even if you are a responsible cardmember.  They'll act like it is your fault when you contact them, and then remove the fees anyways.  It is a nice reward card, but be sure to check your statements for accuracy and be willing to put up with their ridiculous ploys.

name: Hayley Maxwell
review: I've had the Chase Freedom card for about two years and have been happy with it overall. The 1% cash back on all purchases is nice, but what's really nice are the quarterly 5% cash back items. They actually set the schedule to be extremely convenient - airlines and hotels around the time that you're booking flights for the holidays, department stores around Christmas, and 5% cash back on places like gas stations, restaurants and Starbucks throughout the year. The only qualms I have are that my plane tickets are typically my biggest purchases, and I try to plan them during the 5% cash back quarter, but I typically book through travel sites, and you only get the points if you book directly with the airport (something to keep in mind!).

name: Heather McGraw
review: I LOVE my Chase Freedom card. It was my first "major" credit card, and I specifically chose it for the cash back rewards program. I had done my research, considered several different options, and ended up going with the Freedom card. Excellent decision on my part! This card is particularly ideal if you pay off your balance each month, which is what I do. (If you carry a balance, then it might not be your best bet because of the interest rate.) The rotating 5% categories tend to be relevant and useful, and you can choose a number of different ways to redeem your points, including good 'ole cold hard cash. I also love Chase's customer service. Every time I've called the customer service phone number, I've gotten a person who speaks impeccable English and is polite, intelligent, and eager to help. It's very refreshing!

name: Debbie Mack
review: This is the best Visa card for anyone who is a true Disney fan.  First, you get several different card designs to choose from so you can pick your favorite character.  Second, you get 1 percent of your total purchase to use for anything from park tickets to a Disney Cruise!  If you book a Disney packing using your Disney Visa, you get 6 months interest free on that purchase.  They also send you a newsletter once a quarter filled with great information and coupons. Keep shoppinsg so you can get that free trip!

name: Donna Pagano-Stott
review: got it

name: Margaret Wallace
review: I find the reward points do add up over time and these are useful for either paying off one's balance or putting towards purchases on Amazon. Amazon has great customer service anyway and I’d be purchasing items from Amazon.com regardless of whether I have the card or not. So, the benefits that I enjoy being able to use the points is basically icing on the cake. As far as other competitive credit cards out there, it’s really a good deal.  The Amazon card also makes it very easy to pay and manage your account online. Useful card to have, especially if you are smart about using the points wisely. Also, because I trust Amazon as a company, it seems like a good deal.

name: Sheli Carr
review: I had this card for several years.  The key to this card, as with any reward cards, is to pay off the balance every month.  Otherwise, the interest fees eat up any rewards you may receive.  I earned a total of three free flights just from my travels to and from Boston.  I only used the card to book travel.  The renewal rewards are great because they defer the cost of the annual fee (which they waived for me my last year because I was going to cancel the card).  Customer service is extremely friendly and I have noticed now that it is even easier to redeem your points right on the Southwest website.  I closed the account when my husband lost his job in 2010.  When our credit rebounds from a rough patch since then, I will definitely re-apply for this card.

name: Brian Detweiler
review: I've had my Chase Freedom card for almost a year now and so far, no complaints. Got a few cash back rewards checks which is nice. Granted, the cash back is probably negligible compared to interest rates, but considering you get the first 18 months with 0% APR, if you're in need of quick access to some decent credit, it's not a bad way to go. I needed a little boost to help me get to a music festival, and I needed another credit card. I was approved fairly quickly since I have a decent credit score, and the card has been no hassle. Also, their website doesn't suck, which is something I can't say for a lot of credit card companies (ahem - Wells Fargo).

name: Nick E Reynolds
review: I live in Chicago where Chase Bank is headquartered and I'm glad to do so. Chase bank's customer service is second to none. They are very eager to satisfy clients big and small and do so with a smile. The headquarters' banking room is filled with young and old managers that are very helpful and nice. I've read that Chase has had to vastly reduce their employee numbers in banks across the country, but they seem to have retained a very bright, helpful cross section of America that can answer any question I might have or solve any problem save overdrafts. Actually, I have friends with personal bankers that were able to have several overdrafts waived with a phone call, which is amazing. Through my experience with Chase's customer service I see that there is a welcoming personality to the company that I rarely see with any company.

name: Agustina Machey
review: I’ve had my chase freedom card for a few years now and I have absolutely no complaints. There have never been any issues of fraud or excessive fee either. One of the things I really like about the Chase credit cards is that their customer service is beyond excellent. There were a few occasions where I lost my card and all it took was one, three minute phone call to deactivate the old one. A few days later I would receive a brand spanking’ new replacement in the mail. I use my card for almost all purchases and pay it off at the end of the month to build my credit. Matter of fact Chase has raised my credit limit several times over the past few years.

name: Rick
review: I did not enjoy working with Chase bank. I opened an account with them because of one of their “Deposit $100, get $100” promotions. However, when I signed up for the account, I was told I didn't qualify for that promotion, with very little explanation as to why I didn't qualify. I opened the account anyway, only to find out that it wasn't free checking and that there would be a monthly charge on my account. Whenever I had questions and needed to call customer service or go into a branch, employees were always short and rude with me, despite the fact that I tried to be as polite and considerate as possible to them. I closed my account after only a few months simply because I am fortunate enough to live in a city where there are multiple banks and multiple options. I will never bank with Chase again.

name: John Jones
review: Chase has been a decent bank overall. They are good but nothing special. They charge some fees, but those are easy enough to avoid if you are careful. The employees tend to be friendly and good about waiving fees if you need them to. They try to sell you new banking services, but aren't overly pushy. Mostly, Chase is convenient because it has so many locations. It is a good bank to go in and get your business done quickly, not the type of place you spend a long time chatting in. It is a fairly solid bank that gets the job done.

name: Kraig Lasher
review: I was introduced to Chase when I received a debit card from them for direct deposit payments at a place I worked a few years ago.  At the time I had poor credit but I built it back up over time and was happy with Chase, so I decided to get this card to help maintain my credit.  This is the first card where I can receive rewards but I don't currently spend enough to get much back.  If my overall financial situation improves I could see my self making use of this card a lot more frequently as paying it off before balances are accrued will only help my credit.  My only issue is you have to actually do things to maintain its abilities like bonus points.  Those should be automatic and not require me to do anything.  I have not had any late payments so I cannot yet speak on that.  I do like the random discounts I get with it as they usually pertain to things I purchase anyway.  That's what needs to be activated and you need to keep up on though.  No annual fees is also a great perk.

name: Daniel Benjamin
review: The Chase Freedom credit card is an excellent option for a college student who has established credit with (hopefully!) other Chase cards. The 1% cash back option for each purchase makes the small purchases seem like a better idea. In terms of design, the Chase Freedom card is not as impressive as the vertical Chase Slate card. As goes with any card, this Freedom card should be used responsibly. This card is interest-free for a promotional period, but Chase representatives are open 24/7 for questions and comments about the Chase service. Using this card responsibly opened my eyes to the benefits of responsible credit card use. At every bill payment in full, the limit increase made me want to spend less.

name: Tess Wentz
review: I'm unimpressed by any Chase credit card. We have three, one of which is this so-called "Slate" one. I guess "Slate" is just a marketing gimmick because I see absolutely no difference between Chase's "Slate" "product" and their other credit cards. The interest rates on all our Chase credit cards are at or over 24% interest which is pretty much highway robbery as far as I'm concerned. We wound up with Chase as our credit card company after our bank (Washington Mutual) was absorbed by Chase years ago. When we'd first gotten our pre-Chase credit cards, our interest rates were doable. Now Chase has increased our interest rates and made it more difficult to pay down our debts on them. Chase's customer service is one of the worst in any industry, as well. Basically, Chase is yet another faceless, heartless corporation unwilling to negotiate with their debtors. I cannot recommend them for anything.

name: Tim Shaw
review: Chase is an excellent bank. The checking account has no fees as long as you maintain a minimum balance of $1,500, or have a minimum monthly direct deposit. This checking account is good for people who have their pay checks directly deposited into their bank accounts. Chase provides access to many ATMs, although they do charge a fee for non-approved ATMs, on top of the ATM's fee. Online banking is simple and makes it very easy to transfer funds and make payments. Chase also has an app for smartphones that you can use to deposit checks.

name: Joana Delmoro
review: The Chase Freedom credit card is an excellent card if you purchase many items in the quarterly promotional categories, which earn 5% cash back. It typically has gas stations in 2 different quarterly promotions and grocery stores in one. It also has holiday shopping. This card would not be good for people who would not pay the full statement balance off every month because it does have a high interest rate. There are no annual or monthly fees. So if you are looking for a card to use on everyday purchases and will pay it off each month then this is the card for you.

name: Stephanie Russell
review: I love my amazon.com credit card! The credit line is appropriate, as is the interest rate. I really love the rewards points and how they accrue. They’re a huge perk-especially since I do a majority of my online shopping through amazon and can apply my rewards points to my payment at checkout. If you have an amazon prime account, you’re golden! Also, last year someone got a hold of my credit card number somehow and Chase Bank noticed the fraudulent charges before I even did-and I check it at least twice a week! They handled the whole dispute process for me and kept me updated on what was going on. It was resolved within two weeks, and all I had to do was verify with them (over the phone-5 minute call) that I did not make the charges in question!

name: Pedro Phipps
review: I have been using this Disney rewards card since 2005 to present and it’s been very useful. For a family that visits Disney a lot with friends and by ourselves, it’s a must have. I haven’t had any real problems with their service so far but it is a bit of a troublesome road to getting my rewards. We have moved about three times now and I once went off for work. They were informed about it and they responded to me timely and correctly. I've been told by a few people that it’s possible to get better deals by not using the card. Which somewhat makes sense because of how these companies operate. I’m planning to give other options a go, but still I’m enjoying using this card and would easily recommend it to others.

name: Joel Alexander
review: I have had the Chase Freedom card for about 2 years now. The card has been fine for me because I don’t carry a balance. The rewards are average. About every six months I accumulate enough points to make it worthwhile to apply the points towards the balance of the card. I dislike having to ‘activate’ the bonus points every quarter as it is easy to forget to do so. It would also be nice if the late fee wasn't so unforgiving. If I miss the deadline by one day they charge a $25 fee. That seems excessive to me, and I would appreciate a grace period. All in all, this card is nothing special and I’m sure I could find a Visa that is just as good at any bank.

name: Gregory Hays
review: The main redeeming quality of using Chase for a checking account is their mobile banking. It's just been far superior to any bank or credit union I've worked with. The reason I have an account with these guys is purely their check cashing iPhone App. You can take a picture of both sides of the check, and within a few hours it clears and the funds are available in your account. It makes you feel like you are living in the future. If you frequently have to cash a lot of checks from your job and simply don't want to be bothered with going to a bank and waiting in line, look into Chase and their mobile App.

name: Megan Richardson
review: Chase Freedom's points program is okay if you are very conscious about your purchasing decisions and make regular purchases with the card, such as gasoline or groceries, that fall under the umbrella of the points program. The higher interest rate makes it inpractical for people who do not use their cards regular and cannot pay the full balance monthly. I have had this card for several years now, and while it suited my needs at first, I now feel that I need a different kind of card that would be more compatible with how I prefer to use my card.

name: Tim Keyes
review: I greatly enjoy having and using my Amazon Rewards card from Chase. Since I regularly shop on Amazon, being able to earn a lot of extra points is quite beneficial.  The extra points from restaurants and gas stations don’t hurt, either!  I’ve never had any problems with paying online, or with their customer service, but this is most likely because I always pay the card off in full, each month, so there are never really any issues.  I also don’t really care what the interest rate is, since I don’t pay any!  So, for me, this card is a great way to get free rewards, as long as I don’t carry a balance.

name: Ciara Laroach
review: Chase overall was an obvious choice for my first bank. They are literally located everywhere, on almost every corner, which is very convenient because I travel so much. Getting started was amazingly easy: I went in to my local branch and talked with a real person. He explained all my choices for opening an account and helped me choose the option best for me and did not try to up-sell me on an account I did not need. As far as I know you can open an account online and it can be even easier! You can deposit checks and cash in their ATMS, quickly and conveniently. I have only had one problem with Chase and it was handled immediately. Every time I have a question (it may be big or little) I can easily call and their wait times are surprisingly short, maybe 5 minutes or less. If I were to ever recommend a bank, it would obviously be Chase.

name: Dan Brownlee
review: My initial mortgage and subsequent refinancing was very smooth with Chase. I would certainly use them again. There was a little pressure for me to get locked in when it seemed the rates were still going down but that was seven years ago. No issue on the refinance which was as easy as possible. The closing process was smooth for both but extremely easy on the refinance, as it should have been. I suppose my biggest complaint was the closing cost seemed to be a big mystery up until the day of closing for my officer. I feel he should have had a better handle on it. But in the end, it was right in line with what I was expecting. From an online perspective, Chase makes it really easy to pay and service the loan. You can also elevate your account status when all your accounts with them are from Chase. This makes many of the nickle and time charges disappear. Overall, I'm a happy client.

name: Katie
review: I've had an account at Chase for a few years now, starting when I was in high school, and I really appreciated their options for college students (no fee checking and savings accounts) because I'm trying to save every penny I can. If I've ever had a problem, it's usually fixed on its own in a day or two, but the customer service has been great as well. Friendly, kind and helpful people have answered my questions and assisted me in solving my problems. I also love their online banking and the website. It's very well set up, and I rarely have to go into the bank anymore because the majority of things I need out of a bank, I can usually do online. I would wholeheartedly recommend, and have recommended this bank to my family and friends.

name: Jeff Babad
review: I originally just got this card to buy stuff on Amazon and used another card for all my other purchases. When I realized that I got double points for gas stations, restaurants, and drug stores, I started using it for those as well. Now I accumulate so many points with my Amazon card that almost all my purchases at Amazon.com are made with rewards money and I don’t need to spend money on Amazon anymore.  Because of this card I also tend to try to make all my online purchases through Amazon so I can either get more points or pay for it with points I already have. Great card for dedicated Amazon.com shoppers.

name: Winterlich Feather
review: I applied for the Chase Sapphire Preferred card last week and was applied instantly on the spot. The person at the branch was even kind enough to have it overnighted to me, so I had my card the NEXT day after I was approved! I mainly signed up for the travel purposes (20% off, no foreign exchange fees, etc) and the 40,000 bonus points with 2,000 spend in 3 months. Not bad at all. This card is very great looking as well. It has a lot of benefits that I had no idea it had (return protection, price protection, etc). Needless to say, I am very happy I signed up for this card and will continue to use it for many years.

name: Monica Macchietto
review: Chase Freedom is a very user friendly card that allows you to accumulate points to purchase rewards.  The best thing that I enjoy is that I can access my account on the same page as my Chase checking and savings account which makes it easy and convenient when paying bills.  The grace period is also very generous.  Being linked to my Chase checking account also allows to pay directly to Chase as a transfer from one account to another with no fees.

name: Richard Sittel
review: On a recent trip to Central America to enjoy the Carnival celebration in La Ceiba, Honduras, my wallet was pick-pocketed and my only credit/ATM card was stolen. Luckily with Chase's international call-in number I was able to reach their client services, even though it was after midnight, and cancel the card. No fraudulent charges were ever made on the card, thank goodness. Then, Chase was able to expedite a new card to my home address (took only 24 hours!!) and my daughter then forwarded the card to my hotel there in Central America. Total elapsed time: 5 days. Amazing. I had already paid for my room and had some cash on hand, then was able to use the new card, after a quick activation phone call, and never skipped a beat on my great vacation. I still recommend the Carnival, but leave your wallet in the hotel safe, LOL. Anyway, what could have been a disaster, turned out to be just a minor glitch thanks to Chase's customer service people.

name: Tom Correa
review: I have been using Chase since I was of age as my bank. I signed up for Chase Sapphire Preferred® Card as my second credit card. I have been pleased with the card. I got a ridiculous amounts of benefits as a big spender. This card gives if you use it! The points have an extreme amount of value for somebody who wants a variety of options in terms of redemption. For example, I got free plane tickets once using my points in a pinch. It bailed me out so much! The interest rates can vary so it depends on you. Of course, the fees can be a bit much as well. This card is for big spenders, I feel like! Overall grade : B.

name: Jennifer Ingalls
review: I applied for the Disney card because I was recommended it by a friend who is an avid Disney goer, such as myself. So far I am satisfied with the quality customer service received, but it seems when I want to actually cash in on my rewards I have to go through every obstacle possible to get what I need. I wish they made the process easier on the customer, and maybe I would use the card more. I will say, WHEN I do finally get the benefits I receive great deals on my hotels and purchases made inside the park. I will also say it is my highest paid interest card, so if you are interested in the credit card...pay it off immediately, or you will regret it. I do recommend this for any person who takes a Disney Vacation often, the benefits will pay off in the long run!

name: Kjell Pedersen
review: I applied for this card last year at the recommendation of a friend.  My wife and I had been planning to go to Hawaii and the opportunity to get some of the trip paid for through a credit card offer sounded great.  The application was quick and easy, we received the card within a couple of weeks and quickly spent the $1000 to qualify for the 50,000 Avios.  I will say that the booking system took some time to learn, but there are a lot of discussion groups on the web that give great tips on booking flights with Avios.  We were able to book a flight with American using our Avios, and including the $95 annual fee for the card, we spent $105 on two round trip tickets for LAX to Maui.  As a great bonus we were not expecting, we each were able to check up to 3 bags for free, and we received Priority Access boarding passes so we bypassed the standard security line, and boarded right after the first class passengers.

name: Katherine Schell
review: I have had a great experience so far with my Chase Freedom credit card.  The rewards are incredible. I have had my card for just a few months and don't use it too frequently and I have a $117 check coming this week. I got to choose the companies I use to gain rewards, and have been getting rewards almost every single day from Starbucks! I highly recommend this card, but I would warn potential users to be sure that they are aware of the APR rates which can be a bit high after an initial low rate. I would be sure to research and make sure that this a commitment which they are willing and able to handle.

name: David Kauffman
review: If you buy a lot of stuff on Amazon I definitely recommend getting the Amazon Credit Card for a couple of reasons.  First of all, there is no annual fee associated with the card, so you'll not have to worry a reoccurring charge just for having the card. But the main benefit is that they offer 3% back on all purchases from Amazon!  Amazon already is a little bit cheaper than retail prices, so the 3% back is just a bonus!  And you can use the points you earn instantly at check out.  They also usually offer a $30 sign up bonus if you sign up when checking out online, so you might want to wait to take advantage of that before you sign up.

name: Ja Christopher
review: I used to have a variety of reward-based credit cards, but after time, the Chase Freedom card became the only credit card that I used and continue to use for all of my purchases.  Even though having to enable the special bonus categories manually every few months is a bit of a hassle, being able to convert the reward points into money and apply it directly toward my bill is the absolute best no-nonsense way to run a reward system.  The only thing that I wish the card offered is feature to generate the temporary virtual credit card numbers that I’ve seen from Citi.  Otherwise, I am more than pleased with Chase Freedom.

name: Amber Spadafora
review: My experience with a Chase Checking Account has been nothing but great. Whenever I have a check to cash I can count on going to Chase to have it cleared immediately, while other banks would only clear a portion. I really enjoy using Chase’s mobile alerts and appreciate how easy it is to check my balance. Once I had an issue where a website was charging my debit card and I was unable to cancel the charges. I went to Chase and worked with a banker who was very helpful and gave me the customer service number for the website. After I was unable to contact customer service, the banker went ahead and cleared the charges. He also cleared the overdraft fee that was charged to my account, due to the website. My only complaint with Chase is that it seems costly to open a regular account with them once my college checking account will have expired. You must have a minimum deposit that I cannot afford at this time.

name: Domo Victoria
review: This is currently my only bank for many great reasons! First, Chase Bank has very convenient locations in the New York/Long Island area. E.g. If I am hanging out far away from home, I don't have to worry about searching far for a Chase Bank to take cash out if need be. The customer service is great as well at every bank. Last and most importantly, it was very easy to open up an account at Chase. My only problem with Chase is their phone customer service. They use out of the country people to help you over the phone and half of the time they don't know what they are talking about. I highly recommend going to the nearest bank if you have any inquiries. Other than that, 4/5 for Chase Bank.

name: Randy Anderson
review: I’ve really enjoyed the experience I’ve had with my Chase Freedom account. I’ve been a member since 2007 and I have had almost zero problems since then. This card’s best feature is the rewards program. I use my card to pay for my purchases at every opportunity simply because the rewards are that great. Over the years I’ve been able to purchase several large ticket items from the money I’ve received in cash rewards. The only problem I’ve noticed with the card is the interest rate on the card is pretty high. However, I make sure to pay off the full amount each month so this has never been a problem. It’s a good credit card with a great rewards program.

name: Kyle Hermann
review: I think this card is not bad at all. Really, it's like anything else. You get what you pay for and there is always the time and place. For me, it's great since I really just fly for sport trips. A dive trip can really add up, so I like to keep it with me when I go away. it's also perfect for life's little things like a forgotten lunch or costly repair bill. The miles are great and I've never had an issue with black out dates. Maybe that is because I'm a student too busy to really do much.

name: Emilie Jordan
review: I love my Chase Freedom credit card. I chose this card because of its reward program. It seemed like the best one in my opinion. I pay my card off at the end of each month so the interest rate on the card doesn't effect me. I wait to redeem my cash back till the end of each year for something fun! Usually it's a shopping spree for new clothes. I love how the 5% cash back categories change every so often. And aside from that, I get 1% cash back on everything else I purchase. It makes this a great choice for a credit card and I would recommend it to anyone.

name: Elizabeth Loynd
review: I have had my Disney Rewards card for about eight years now.  When I first got the card we used it to pay for a Disneyland vacation. We got some great deals and discounts plus a lot of points for this trip which we used while we were there.  The reward points can only be used for items in one of the parks or online so when not planning a trip they aren't as useful.  Also, they are hard to redeem. If you are ordering online and need to return something you lose the points so you can't get a replacement item.  I think there are better rewards programs out there. I will continue to keep this card as a backup for emergencies, but I very rarely use it.

name: Fiona Heitzman
review: This was the first card I signed up for with help of my father. I've had the card for a little over years and have had absolutely no trouble with it. This is the only card that I use and it hasn't been a chore to stay debt free so far. The rewards program is decent and provides a good incentive to use the card. It's been easy not to over spend as I'm not the only one watching my numbers. I have recommended this card to others in my family as well as friends. For anyone that is able to spend a little extra cash on the items they like, this card will provide you with decent rewards.

name: Jeff Kontak
review: I signed up for Chase Freedom as my first credit card and have to say that the rewards program is a blessing and a curse in the same. It is set up to pull people in to spend higher amounts of money with the thought that they will get a free cash reward at the end, but sometimes this causes people to overspend, thus helping the bank make money! But hey, that’s going to be the same with any credit card/rewards program you have. Overall I have enjoyed the card and the freedom it brings – Have had it for about 3 years now.

name: Weston Tariq
review: I have had my Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Visa card for several years. It doesn't take very long to build up points. I have flown for free on Southwest three separate times. I also enjoy the shopping rewards that my Southwest points can go towards, such as Lowes, Best Buy, and many other retailers. If you need to make a purchase and if the retailer is one of the rewards retailers, you can get as many as 4 points for each dollar spent which can really add up on a major purchase. I have had only good experiences with the customer service department as well. I  had a bogus charge on my card and they took care of it immediately. I highly recommend this credit card.

name: Akeela Tanis
review: Whilst enrolled in college I needed a college checking account that would be accessible to me at any time. I applied for a Chase college checking account which was free for 5 years. I couldn't say no to that. I like the idea of being able to travel anywhere in the US and be able to use my debit card at any ATM, shopping store or restaurant without any restrictions. The mobile app keeps me up to date with weather alerts and how they would impact my area if I can't access the ATMs. Paperless billing is another plus, because everything is in the palm of your hand with the Chase mobile banking application. Also I'm happy there are branches close by and not miles and miles away.

name: Jessica Jensen
review: I have had an account with Chase for over 8 years now. It started out as just a student checking account while I was in school, and now all of my banking is done there. The tellers are always polite and often inquire about my family, and the lobby of my local branch is always clean. The few times I have had an issue with my debit card, customer service was prompt and almost always able to help me without delay. When there was a delay they were able to help me withdraw some money until I would receive my new card in the mail.

name: Mike Kaduce
review: This was the first hotel rewards card that I got. Since I was traveling more with work, I wanted to pick a hotel to remain loyal to due to the large benefits this industry offers for people who perform repeat stays. This card had no introductory fee for the first year, and after that the rewards basically paid for the card's annual fee without an issue. I have had to call their customer service once - when I looked online and rewards that I had earned were not posted. They were very friendly and explained to me why this discrepancy occurred, and their customer service did not keep me on hold very long either. This is a great credit card!

name: Chris Hornbostel
review: I've had this card for at least five or six years and have not had any sort of problem with it whatsoever. The interest rate is decent enough, and no annual fee is fantastic. I've found that any time I've had a question or concern with my account that customer service has been courteous and very helpful. When I misplaced my card a few years ago, getting it replaced was pretty much a non-hassle, which was nice. Finally, I've always found my account's website to be easy to negotiate and  manage things online from. Over the years I've canceled other cards due to problems with customer service or rising interest or adding "bonuses" I didn't want and asking me to pay for them. My Chase card is now the only non-debit credit card I carry.

name: Matt Frost
review: I have been with chase for over 5 years, it's really the only credit card I have ever used.  Over the years the service definitely seems to have gotten better and better.  I really enjoy the blueprints cash back service, all I have to do is use my card like normal, and within a few clicks the points are converted directly to cash off my credit card debt.  I have also found the customer service and fraud protection to be pretty good.  There have been a few questionable purchases in the past, due to my own negligence, and they were all taken care of right away, with no hassle.

name: Tyler Day
review: I love my Chase Amazon Rewards Visa, my wife and I use it for all medium and large purchases. The rewards are simple to earn and simple to use. I have never had a problem with reward points not showing up, nor have I ever had a problem using my rewards points towards purchases on Amazon.com. I also love the interface of the chase.com website for viewing my account. It is very easy to navigate, view account history, transactions, and even view the rewards points. Paying my balance on chase.com is also extremely easy and processes very quickly. I would recommend this rewards card to anyone.

name: Claire Jones
review: I love my Disney Rewards Visa Credit Card. My husband and I take our four children on vacation two times every year, once in the summer time and once in the winter time. We usually end up at Disney World at least one time per year. I was so happy when I first received my Disney Reward Visa in the mail and it has not let me down. I use my card to get discounts on all of my Disney purchases but the best part is that I save money when we visit the theme parks and stay at Disney hotels. This card really comes in handy for families that travel often. Not to mention the adorable selection of card designs that the companies offers! So cute!

name: Horton Paul
review: My wife and I have had the Chase Sapphire card for some time know and are thoroughly satisfied to this point. We have had a myriad of credit card over the years which has given us a lot of experience with credit companies. Having consolidated our debt a few years ago we paid off and closed most of the accounts at that time. Deciding that another card was needed we applied for the Chase card. The rate was good, but it has been the service that keeps us loyal. Anytime there is a need to contact customer service the experience has been pleasant and helpful. We had no problems when questioning charges or for any request. I would recommend this card and this company.

name: Marie
review: This is a good bank. It has locations everywhere and anyone who I have ever dealt with has been very pleasant. Checking and savings is straightforward with multiple options such as basic, premier and platinum accounts. Each one has unique benefits so you don’t have to pay for something if you don’t need it. I have the Chase Premier Plus Checking and like it a lot. You get free money orders and travelers checks and also get two additional Premier Plus checking accounts with no monthly service fee. The online bill pay is easy to use and you can also do mobile banking on your iPhone etc. One other plus is they are the leader in small business loans, which is nice just in case you ever need to take that step.

name: Nick
review: I have a checking account with Chase which comes with great features. There is a $12 monthly service fee which is waived off if you opt for direct deposits of $500 or more, or if you keep a minimum daily balance of $1,500. I got a free Chase debit card with my checking account and their online banking and mobile banking are also free of any charge. I refinanced my existing car loan with Chase and this in fact lowered my rate. I got a reasonable interest rate and also received some discounts reserved for Chase checking customers. So, overall I noticed a marked reduction in my monthly payments. Their representatives are very service-oriented and prompt in handling your queries. I must say that Chase is a very reputable bank which understands your financial needs and offers you quality service.

name: Ryan Hannigan
review: We have a Disney Rewards Visa and have had it for going on 4 years now.  We are planning to take a trip to Disney World or Disney Land when our two boys are older.  The card gets paid off each month so we don’t have to worry about the interest rate, which isn’t the worst for our cards anyways.  It’s distinctive even half-hidden in a pocket in my wallet and my kids know which one it is(my oldest, 3, sometimes fetches my wallet so I can make an online purchase for him).  While I can’t say the card gets a lot of usage, it sees some use and I have had zero issues with it.  So in terms of cards it is pretty reliable.

name: Junie Gutierres
review: I've had this card for a number of years without problem. They have a very good web interface, which makes it easy to schedule automatic payments. I find the interest rate to be a tad high, but if you make payments on time, it's not a problem (I schedule automatic payments for the minimum, then usually make an additional payment later in the month depending on what I can afford. This way, I'm never late). The cashback bonus is certainly a nice plus.

name: Alona Anschutz
review: Also, keep an eye out for the 5% bonus categories that crop up occasionally -- you have to enroll in them manually, but the bonus points can really add up. All in all, a good card for everyday use, provided you pay your balance off.

name: Megan
review: The first “major” bank account that I had was at Chase, and it was nothing short of great. Their savings and checking were easy to use, they have locations practically everywhere, including multiple locations in my town on opposite ends, their online banking is easy to use, they offer texts alerts (which is great for those who don't have a smart phone), and their customer service is incredibly friendly (if not the friendliest one I've come across). The only complaint I had was their hours in my area are a little different compared to the others banks I have used, but it's not a huge issue.

name: Lauren
review: A couple of months ago I received a text message from Chase saying that my card may have been hacked and someone had tried to use it. I called customer service and they told me they would cancel my card right away; I was thankful but worried because this was a Saturday morning and I was leaving Monday night for a 9 month trip abroad. I NEEDED my debit card, as it was my only way of having money available for my use. I told the customer service agent this and she said that she would need an address in the country I was going to, just in case they needed to send it there. I was worried but I gave it to them, knowing that it was possible it would never arrive. On Monday, however, at around 5pm I received a package from UPS saying URGENT on it. Lo and behold, it was my debit card. They had sent it out quickly and it arrived to me in ONE business day. I was extremely grateful, and I know very few banks would do that for customers! All in all, I don't always love Chase's fees but their customer service is usually fantastic in my personal opinion.

name: Consuela Shammah
review: I have had the Disney visa card for some time and the kids love this one.  It came with a few sign on perks and benefits which were great. We spent them on Disney store goodies.  There’s something of a playful nature about the look and feel of this card.  It feels like fun.  When I got mine there were a lot of different faces to choose from, we chose the most animated one.  Of course it can be used anywhere other than the Disney store or Disney land.  I would also say the customer service is a notch above average maybe because they bear the Disney name. They always handle my issues promptly and I never had any trouble getting through.  The interest rate is somewhat high but there is no annual fee to worry about. Outside of the famed Disney persona, just keep in mind that it's still a regular revolving account with high fees and penalties if you miss a step so keep up with payments and you'll be fine.

name: Ivory Ledin
review: I’ve had my Chase Freedom Visa for a few years now.  They are always very helpful when I have called with a problem or a concern.  I have participated in balance transfers and have had a 0 balance on my card many times.  It is not my primary card but I still use it often.  I have always been able to access through the Chase website with no problems.  My only complaint was that one instance when I had a zero balance, I asked for my APR to be lowered, which they refused.  Other cards had lowered the APR or raised the credit limit.  Chase actually lowered my credit limit, even though my account was in good standing.

name: Rubie Dickins
review: I have ended up travelling a lot for work lately, and this card had really come in handy.  I got this card because I was staying in their hotels a lot of the time when I was out of town, and figured I should go ahead and try to earn some free nights while I was at it.  I love the card, the points are adding up faster than I expected, and soon I'll have several nights’ free stay at a Marriott for my vacation! I couldn't be happier with the card, and now I am recommending it to all of my associates.

name: Brendan Beardnn
review: My wife and I use our Amazon card for all our big purchases. We avoided having a credit card for years, but when they were offering a free sum of money, I think $50, it seemed like there was no reason not to. We were right. There was no reason not to. We already used Amazon to buy various goods, and now we get free money on a regular basis to do it. We've never had to pay any fees or interest. We even get to offer to be the ones to cover everybody's dinner (and they can give us cash later), and then it's even more like free money.

name: Shayla Gigler
review: The United Mileage Plus Explorer card is a great airline credit card offering many benefits. I always earn miles when I fly on United and get miles even for my daily spending and this has at times reduced the cost of my United flights. Spending $1,000 in the first three months after signing up made me entitled to 30,000 bonus miles straight away. If you buy your United Air tickets directly from the airline or through their website, you will earn 2 miles for every $1 that you spend. You also earn 1 mile for every dollar you spend while making purchases with your card. Their annual fee is waived for the first year but after the first year it is $95. You may find this a little high but if you compare it with the many rewards that you get all year this would not seem much. Basically if your preferred airline is United and you are a frequent traveler, this card is a must have to cut your travel costs.

name: Dortha Blando
