review: I have had this Chase Freedom credit card for over a year now and am completely satisfied. What initially drew me was the cash bonus for signing up as well as the rewards program. To date it is still one of the best cash back rewards programs available. I especially love the 5% bonus categories, especially when it is gas as I have a long commute to work each day. I would recommend this card to anyone looking for a name brand, high rewards, fairly low interest rate credit card. I have no complaints whatsoever, the website is very user friendly and secure. I actually appreciate the way it asks you for extra information when you are accessing it from a new computer as know several friends who have been identity theft victims. Although I do have other credit cards that I use regularly as well, I have no plans of cancelling this one anytime soon.

name: Howie Tchen
review: After being to Disneyland multiple times due to living in Socal and having friends that want to go several times a year, I signed up with the Disney credit card. The main reason being is that I wanted to acquire points and reward dollars back since I'm already spending money at Disneyland, especially when it comes to food and restaurants. While the card isn't spectacular outside Disneyland, the main appeal for me is the benefits while being at Disneyland or shopping at Disney. I mean how could you say no to an extra 10% off on stuff at the Disney store? That alone makes the card worth it.If you are a fan of Disney, or go to Disneyland often I would recommend the Disney premier visa credit card. You will definitely save the money in the long run and the benefits will outpay any of the cost or fees.

name: Ian Macfarland
review: Chase is a very average bank. They have standard check and savings account and are pretty friendly. I only used them for a short time though. There were a few reasons. First off, if you use a checking account and spend over your balance, instead of just not working, they will charge you a fee. Why do they even allow you to spend more than you have! It is just another example of banks being greedy. Second, their savings accounts give very little interest. You might as well invest your money into gold. That is how slow it is! I also find their customer service to be average while I have found banks like Wells Fargo and Bank of America to be much friendlier. Lastly, they charge you a monthly fee which most banks other than Bank of America do. Banks already make a ton of money just off you swiping your card, having money in your accounts and signing up. I don't feel it is fair to charge me just to hold onto my money.

name: Justin Dack
review: I got my first Chase card in 2005, and another when they took over Washington Mutual. The second card was the Sapphire. The interest rate initially was excellent and their online tools were very useful. I made the mistake of using the cash advance feature too much and ended up in a bit of a bind, but Chase worked with me on it and we set up a payment plan, so I can’t really complain. The card itself is pretty cool, being vertically oriented, though I did have to think about it a little harder than you really should have to when figuring out which way to slide it through a machine.

name: Michelle Hudak
review: I have had my Chase credit card for quite a few years now (I think 5), and overall, I am very happy with it.  I have had no issues with payments (though I have always paid on time), and have always been able to easily access my account via the Chase website.  I especially like the rewards program with the card.  For everything I buy on the card, I earn points, which I could use, either to pay myself back, or for goods and gift cards.  I always make sure to register for each quarter’s special, which gives you 5% back on purchases in that category, and this has helped me earn more cash back.  I have been very happy with my card, and the company overall, and would recommend it to anyone looking to get a new credit card.  There is no minimum purchases, no annual fee, and you earn cash back on everything you buy!

name: Michael David
review: First off, the fee on this card is a little on the high side but with Rewards cards it's always best to weigh up the fee against the benefits you'll receive from using it and in my case it's certainly worth the investment. I do a lot of domestic flying and the fact you can use your miles on basically any United flight without restrictions is really handy. The fees are a little on the high side when compared to others so it's best to pay back what you owe asap though the staff on the end of the phone are generally very helpful. Really good card for it's intended audience.

name: Jessica Trivalia
review: I absolutely love my Southwest Airlines Rapid Rewards Card.  I have to travel by air at least once a month and have been flying on Southwest for the last 3 years using this card. I have earned 7 free flights with it. I get double points when I purchase my tickets with Southwest and every year they give me 6000 points for renewal. The rate is pretty high but as long as you pay off your card every month, the rate is irrelevant.  Although this card might not be for everyone, if you have to travel frequently within the United States and enjoy flying on Southwest Airlines, then this is the perfect card. I think Southwest allows you to use your points on other purchases like hotel rooms and rental cards, but I only use them for free flights.

name: Tessa Cauley
review: I opened this just before Christmas 2011, drawn in by the 0% on purchases and balances transfers. I'll start paying interest on the remaining balance last month, but I'm happy to say I've never encoutered any issues at all with the card. Customer service has been excellent, and the Chase website is very easy to use to read statements and make payments. I've never had a bad experience with Chase--this is my second card with them. I like the tap to pay feature that's available at most stores. I don't have to swipe the card or worry about the magnetic strip wearing off, and the Slate card is easy to find amongst my other plastic. It's the only one that's vertical!

name: Phuong Heft
review: The Ink Cash Business Card is what I currently use for my companies funds.  Until something better comes out on the market, there really isn’t any other way to go.  I get 2% cash back on the money my delivery trucks spend at gas stations and that adds up to quite a bit.  We make a ton of deliveries every single day.  I use it to pay our Internet and phone bills as well, since I get even more cash back for that.  There is nothing better on this planet than getting paid to spend money, and that’s just the way I like it.  Thanks to the Ink Cash Business Card, we’ve been soaring in rewards!

name: Jessie
review: I have been with Chase for quite some time now and I absolutely love this bank. The products are good, their fees are relatively low, and they have a great website that is really user friendly and intuitive. In the past when I had problems with someone stealing my credit card information and making a bunch of purchases the problem was addressed immediately and the money was returned to my bank account right away. They even followed up the next few days to make sure everything was ok on my account. Another plus about this bank is that there are locations everywhere, so you will rarely be out of an option to make a transaction. I am very happy I decided to switch over to Chase.

name: Howie
review: I first took a look into Chase last year during their offer of $100 for signing up for a checking account. So, I walked into my local Chase branch and I have to say their customer service was top-notch. They treated me really well, gave me all the details I needed and answers to all the questions that I had. It was their customer service plus their bonus that sold me over, and since then I have enjoyed my decision with signing up with Chase banking. What I like most is their online banking features, where I can check my spending and gauge how much I have in my checking. I definitely recommend Chase for those that are looking for a great banking experience.

name: alexis lu
review: Chase Bank feels like a more customer friendly version of the typical large banks. I find that your experience largely depends on who you get, but personally I haven't had a hard time finding good representatives, so I'm (mostly) happy with my experience. Sometimes when I call in, if I get an unhelpful rep I just make an excuse, call back in, and typically I get somebody helpful the second time around. Online banking feels very polished and modern. My only complaint about that is sometimes it feels like they're updating it too often! All in all I'm pretty happy with Chase!

name: Alex Wingard
review: Overall, it was a very pleasant experience. The online banking is really great, because I have Chase credit cards and a Chase bank account. So, it’s really easy to check my balance and pay my credit card at the same time. The only problem I have is that there are no locations where I go to school at, and they seem to be more of an urban bank. The customer service is really great. I went overseas to Australia and really did not have any problems accessing my money. I just had to call and let them know I was going to be overseas. Overall, a pretty great bank with free checking for college students.

name: Scott Johnson
review: I have had a Chase checking account for about six (6) years. I use my Chase checking account as a secondary account since my primary account is with another bank that does not operate in the state I currently reside in. Since becoming a member, I have been very happy with Chase. Their process to open a new account is quick and easy. Their customer service is great and they are very helpful if you need assistance with any of their services. In addition, they have more locations in my area than any other bank. I can easily find an ATM within 3-5 blocks at any given time. Overall, I highly recommend Chase for your banking needs.

name: erin p
review: I have been using Chase for years and after a while they asked me if I wanted to open up a Chase Freedom Credit Card. They have a special student option which is great because I am college student and I don't have any accounts connected to my parent's accounts. They started me off with a small limit which is totally sufficient because I am not spending that much money a month and I pay off the card whenever I need to without any problems. A few times I had to call up customer service due to questions that I had about my account. Every representative I have talked to has been extremely helpful and has resolved any problems or questions I have had. I love the Chase Freedom rewards points because they allow me to get cash back after spending a certain amount on particular items, which is a great added bonus to having this credit card. After a few months of constantly paying it off they have already doubled my credit limit. This is something I was planning to ask for if they did not do it automatically, which they did.

name: Ariana Morris
review: I hear all the time that big banks don't care about people, and my friends would rather do business with small banks I have never heard of. Well, I never had a bad experience with Chase. In fact, when my credit card payment is late – entirely my own mistake – they forgive the fee and let me pay without penalty. I don't have thousands of dollars in this bank. I'm lucky to have $100 at any given time. They still take the time to treat me as a valuable customer and don’t use every opportunity that comes along to drain me of money. They have forgiven penalties like the above.

name: alex J
review: I recently opened a new bank account because I wanted a bank that was closer to me. I decided to go with Chase since I have heard lots of good things about it. They also have a branch right down the street from me. Not only did I hear great things, but it’s also so close by that I couldn’t say no. I opened a checking account and I’m very pleased with their services. I get free bill pay, free debit card, and the monthly cost is reasonably low. I feel like I have found the perfect partner to take care of me and my finances. This bank has a great reputation and they also treat their customers with a great amount of care and respect. You can’t beat that!

name: Todd M Di Benedetto
review: After my divorce the options were very limited. They helped me out and got me back on track. I lost my wallet and had no way to get new ids or gas to get there but they made it happen. A friend steals my ATM card and was denied. There was no loss to me. All in all it’s a good bank. The tellers are kind of cold though which is something I dislike. I grew up in town where everyone knew each other and I’m used to the personal touch. The managers and phone service are excellent. The online site is easy to use and has tech support to back it. Once I was back on track they took the time to increase limits and decrease fees but never did so without asking first.

name: Cynthia Zaglinski
review: My husband and I opened a Chase checking account when we were first married and that was two years ago. I know that is not a long time but since then we are on first name basis at our branch with the employees there and the service has been phenomenal. I am inclined to go in to our branch rather than attempt to call to get routed to a customer service rep that I do not know. It makes a lot of difference and usually when we are there the thought of pursuing another idea comes to mind and we get more done than we anticipated. We really like our Tualatin branch Chase bank.

name: Moreland House
review: I switched to Chase Bank while I was in college in Columbus Ohio. I had previously been with 5/3 Bank and had several problems regarding overdraft fees and customer service. With Chase I have never had any of these issues. Their representatives have always been able to provide me with the information that I request and have been very professional. Their policy changes have always been very clearly outlined to me in mailings and in emails. The only complaint that I really have against Chase Bank is that there is not a branch anywhere close to where I live in South Central Michigan. Because of this, I have difficulty depositing checks directly into my Chase checking account. Therefore, I usually deposit any money that I may have into another bank account and then I transfer money to my Chase account. This generally works out well, but I would still prefer if I had a branch closer.

name: Ahmed Backshai
review: I have used quite a few banks over my years in the workforce. The one that has satisfied me the most in Chase. Not only are they customer friendly, but they also have provided lots of services that other banks will not even think twice about offering. With my traveling, it’s easy to find a Chase Bank or one of their ATMs wherever I’m at in the world. They don’t charge outrageous fees when using the ATM as well. The free online banking and the protection I get when it comes to fraud were invaluable to me. These are just a few of the things that make them my number one choice when it comes to taking care of me and my finances. Go find out for yourself if you don’t believe me.

name: Daniel Lopez
review: I have used a few banks over the years but I’ve been the most satisfied with Chase. I opened an account around 3 years ago and it has been the most convenient bank ever. One of the things I like is that it’s not too hard to find a branch or ATM wherever I am at. They have one of the most user- friendly apps out there and although I don’t use the photo check deposit feature, it is nice to have that option. Once I was in a bind where I had lost my debit card and needed some cash to hold me over for a few days. I was able to transfer money from my account to my wife’s linked account. To anyone looking to try out a new bank, I highly recommend Chase. The service they provide is the best around.

name: Jeff Kontak
review: I switched from First Merit to Chase bank years ago, and know it was the right decision. There is a small complaint I have, but I will get to that in a bit. I would like to say that since I have been with Chase, I have really had no issues in dealing with the banks features or customer service. One of my favorite things offered is the rewards program through my Chase credit card. It used to be Chase “debit card rewards” which was an annual “pay for” service, now changed to a free service through a credit card.When I signed up with the bank, I was given $100 for switching over as a promotion at the time, and later signed up for a credit card. At the time I was younger and had not established as much credit, so the card I signed up for has a higher interest rate that, to this day cannot be changed. I knew this up front, but years later being unable to lower the interest rate is irritating. Chase has offered me different solutions to this, including starting a new card and transferring the balance to the new card in different ways, but some of the methods involved in doing this are too high risk for me at this time.Overall, I would recommend this bank to anyone.

name: Jenny Wauson
review: I have always been pleased with my dealings with Chase Bank. Recently I applied for a loan to buy a new vehicle. The representative that helped me apply for the loan was very educated and knowledgeable on everything. She answered all my questions and walked me through the process. She took the time to explain the interest rates to me and laid out my options for different payment periods, listing the pros and cons on each one. She also informed me about an insurance I could purchase so that if the vehicle was totaled and my auto insurance did not cover the full amount of the loan, I wouldn't be responsible for the difference. After applying for the loan and getting approved, another Chase employee helped me set it up so payments were deducted directly from my checking account and I did not have to worry about mailing a check each month and it getting there in time. Chase employees are courteous and helpful and always happy to assist you in whatever you need.

name: Adelaida Coppes
review: I have had this card for about 2 years now. Overall, the card is great. There was no annual fee, to top it off, when I opened the account, within the first three month. They will give you 100 cash back once you have made $1000 purchases in three months, which is a great deal if anybody is planning to buy something expensive. One of the things that I really like about the card is the reward program that Chase offered. Each different quarter, Chase offered great (5%) cash back deal on categories such grocery store, gas purchasing, and online shopping, etc. The reward would be redeemed in the form of gift card, check, or for the goods that you desired online. Overall, the card is great for the reward that it offered.

name: Scott Clemmons
review: I love the Slate card because it has so many options for how you pay your card.  I am able to set up payment plans so that I can pay off the different balances on my card (my balance transfer, my purchases, and my other promotional balance).  I just recently paid off my purchase balance, woohoo, and now I am getting ready to pay off my balance transfer balance that I have had for years!  I do not know of any other company that has allowed me to do this which is why I really love Chase.  It feels so good to be in control of how I pay my card.  Most companies that I have dealt with have not allowed me to do this.  This is what I love about Chase.

name: Laraine Malcik
review: I generally like my Southwest Rewards card. I use it as my principle credit card and enjoy redeeming points for miles. Last year I was able to travel to California using points! I also was recently rewarded with 4 drink tickets for Valentine's Day. Although Southwest doesn't fly everywhere (especially internationally), it is great for domestic travel. The annual fee usually pays for itself because you get 9,500 free points each year (which will usually cover a one-way flight). From what I've heard from other Southwest card holders, the longer you are a loyal Rapid Rewards member, the better the perks get. It's my favorite credit card and I won't be switching anytime soon!

name: Jennifer Leighton
review: We've had the Marriott Rewards card for a couple of years now and in general have been happy with the experience.  The Marriott Rewards card has some pros and cons.  The pro is that, if you use it as your primary card, the points will add up quickly and you'll soon be on your way to earning free stays at Marriott hotels.  The con is that there is an annual fee that pops up not long after you are using the card.  In our case, we would rather earn points and rewards on a card that doesn't charge us a fee.  But, some might find that the perks of the card offset the annual fee.  The few times we've needed customer service to question a charge we've done so through the internet - communication was quick and professional and we were happy with the outcome.  Overall, we’ve been happy with the card, but I think we are happier with credit cards that let us earn points and rewards without any charges.

name: Janene Argueta
review: I have used this card for many years.  I use it often and try to build up rewards for our frequent WDW trips.  However, I'm sure it isn't the best card out there as far as earning rewards goes.  I do get a lot of comments on how cute my card is almost everytime I use it.  I may switch cards in the near future if I can get a deal on a card with better rewards and a lower interest rate.  My interest rate is high as of right now.  I would love if they would double the rewards from 1% to 2% at various times throughout the year.

name: Alayna Osmundson
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred® Card is an ultimate rewards card which offers you great benefits. Signing up for this card and spending $3000 in the first three months made me eligible for an awesome 40,000 bonus points. I had the option of using these points for getting airline tickets or for cash back, gift cards and merchandise. What I like the most is that even after redeeming my points, I am still able to earn 7% Annual points dividend on my earned points each year. You can also opt to get your points transferred to leading frequent travel programs at a 1:1 value. I once encountered some fraudulent charges on my account and was very happy with the way their customer care representative understood my concern and reversed all charges very promptly. For all my other queries also I have found them to be very professional and service-oriented. Overall I am quite satisfied with their services and will continue to use this card for a long time.

name: Herb Merriott
review: I've had this card for 15 years, starting out as a Yahoo logo card, back when Yahoo was hot stuff.  In that time, I've used all over the world, in Japan, China, and Europe, with no problems.  The on time my account was stolen, they took care of it and got me a new card very quickly.  It has a cash-back feature, and that is good, but I like knowing that I've got a reliable line of credit if I need it.  The online support is good, as well.  I don't want to wait for the mail to know what's going on with my account.  And it's secure with a call back to your cell phone when you log on.

name: Michael Venne
review: The Chase Freedom card is a great card because of the amazing introductory offers and cash back rewards that change every quarter. This quarter it has bonus cash back on gasoline, and knowing the prices are just going up and up, I'm getting over $0.20 off every gallon. Plus if you have a Chase checking account it's really easy to pay your bill automatically. It's great having everything in one place. The grace period is amazing too, especially because I just moved and have put quite a few purchases on the card that I cannot immediately pay back. Overall a great card that has great synergy with a Chase checking account!

name: jason buonomo
review: The Chase Slate card I, in my opinion, is a pretty good credit card.  Of the cards that I own, I would say that I use this one the least, but that is only because the APR on it is a lot higher than the other cards.  I haven’t really tried to use the “Blueprint” option on it either, but that only because it seems a little like a “no-brainer” to me.   I use automatic billing with my bank to pay off my balance when I have one, and I’ve never really had any problems with it so far.  In all, a great introductory card with great customer service and billing departments.

name: Nadene Gourlay
review: My favorite credit card is definitely the Chase Freedom card.  I use it as my primary credit card and the rewards offered are unbelievable.  The regular cash back is great but they also send offers to sign up for additional rewards on everyday purchases like groceries, gas, entertainment - movie theaters, and restaurants.  I also can not say enough wonderful things about the customer service associated with this card.  I was on vacation in Miami and my card number/information was stolen.  I received a text message notifying me of the fraud and a phone call from the fraud division. They immediately removed the fraud purchases and shipped me a new card via overnight delivery.  What is typically a traumatic experience was next to zero stress and I did not have to do a thing to resolve the issue other than review my most recent purchases.

name: John Johnson
review: I have had my United MileagePlus Explorer Credit Card for quite a few years now.  I do a lot of travelling for my job, so I thought it would only be smart to get a card that I can get rewards for.  I use it everywhere to get rewards.  I also always use it to book my flights for work, which are often and usually expensive.  My job reimburses me for my flights, so I am able to charge it and get the rewards still.  This allows me to save a lot of money when it comes to vacation time.  Overall I am happy with this card.  The couple times I've needed to talk to their customer service, they have been very friendly and helpful.  Overall I am happy with my card.

name: David Kauffman
review: The Chase Freedom card should be a must have if you are also a Chase Banking/Checking member.  One of the reasons is that you get a small bonus in your rewards for having other accounts with them.  I get 1.1% back instead of the standard 1% on all purchases with this card, which might not seem like much, but it's something.  Also, Chase has rotating rewards categories every quarter that you need to activate each quarter.  For example, right now you can get 5% back at Gas Stations through March 15th, then next quarter is Restaurants and Movie Theaters.  And around Christmas this year is Amazon!  If you spend a lot in those categories, then this card might be for you.

name: Martin Poles
review: This Chase Sapphire Preferred® Card was the second card I ever applied for and received. The $3,000  needed for the bonus points was easily enough reached simply by paying rent and other bills and then paying off the balance at the end of the month.  The reward system is great and a very good incentive the annual fee is a bit high though and my only real compliant but one could easyily rack up enough bonuses to make up for that cost. Over all I highly suggest this card to anyone out there looking for a new credit card.

name: Griselda Telfair
review: The Marriott Rewards Premier Card from Chase is very nice. I signed up and just after my first purchase, I received 50,000 points, plus a free night's stay at a Marriott. I used these points to stay for a 4 night vacation and I still have 12,500 points left! The cards interest rate is fairly low, compared to other cards. I've never had to deal with their customer service, so I can't comment on that. Overall, I'm very happy with this card.

name: Rocio Mccaster
review: I have a love/hate relationship with this card. It was great when I got the bonus for signing up and using my car. I liked that.I also like that there is no limit on how much I can earn or how much I can redeem. It's nice getting a discount when I buy things from the Disney Store. Using this card when we go to Disney has helped us earn even more rewards. I enjoy being able to earn rewards on all of my purchases too. When I've had to contact customer service regarding any issues, they've been extremely helpful. The problem I have with this card is the annual fee. I use my card a lot, but I also pay off the balance every month. Also, for someone with a credit score as high as mine is, the APR is kind of high. I think this card has the highest out of any other card I have.

name: Jennifer Cohen
review: I absolutely love my Chase Freedom card. I use Chase as my primary banking, so adding the credit card was super simple. I love that you get regular cash back, but also are able to sign up for specific cash back rewards, like movie theaters, gas stations, restaurants, and more. Also, since I use Chase banking, I can pay my card by simply transferring money from my checking to the credit account. And, I love the new design of the card – it is sleek, blue-ish green, and absolutely adorable. Best part about this card is that the rebates change, so around school time, there are discount on supplies, and around the holidays it is more gift oriented savings. Lastly, this card is accepted everywhere! I have never been in a situation where a place of business did not except my card, and can’t think of any that would.

name: Mike Brandt
review: The Chase Freedom Visa is my only credit card. It was my very first card that I got in 2005 and have never needed anything else. Chase has habitually bumped by credit limit up over time, although I have never needed to access much of it. On the rare occassions that an automatic payment had an issue or if something caused a problem, Chase dealt with everything wonderfully and I have legitimately never had any problems. While I fear that I'm coming off as a shill, I really have no complaints about my card. I pay off the card every month, I earn cash back through rewards, and it's a great relationship.

name: Loma Giacolone
review: I have a Chase Freedom Visa card. It was my first credit card, and it's been nothing but a good experience. I love earning rewards, and doing so easily and without any fuss. I typically am not a credit card user, but I got this one to build my credit and so far the company has never done me wrong. I'm able to easily use it anywhere I go and also easily access ATM's, as others have said. Chase has given me a higher credit limit than I had initially expected, and it keeps growing the more I build my credit. I'd highly recommend both this card, and this company, especially if you're like me and you're just starting to use credit cards, if this is your first one, or even for a backup or secondary card. I really can't praise it enough!

name: Melanie Makin
review: I love this card!  My husband and I chose this together after much research into a good rewards card.  The rewards values are great- we're not big spenders but we still earn very well with it.  I really like that we've got the option to redeem the points at the point of sale at Amazon.com, or we can take a statement credit instead.  And since most of our online purchases are from Amazon.com, we're earning more for these purchases.  We've got a baby at home so her items add up.  I can't speak to the APR since we never carry a balance.  We make all of our payments online and the interface is easy to use.

name: Kathy Fitzgerald
review: I use my Amazon Visa for every possible purchase for the rewards points.  At $25.00 for every 2500 points, it doesn’t seem like much initially, but the rewards points stack up quickly when you use the card for everything from groceries and gasoline to utilities, things you would normally pay cash for, especially when you get double or triple points for specific items, like Amazon purchases, gasoline, restaurant purchases, and others.   I also save a little extra when I buy Walmart gift cards and use them for gasoline – you get rewards points for your purchase, then you get 3 cents off each gallon of gas purchased through Murphy USA, the fuel sold through Walmart and Sam’s Club, when you use your Walmart gift card.  Rewards points can be redeemed for several things, but I usually plow my savings back into payment of my bill and occasional Amazon gift cards for friends and family.  I don’t use them for purchases though…don’t get those 3 for 1 points for using my Amazon card for Amazon purchases if I use rewards points to make the purchase.  We even paid for our vacation one year by saving our points, then using the card to pay for everything and paying the balance in redeemed points.  The key to realizing the savings, though, is making sure you pay it off in full EVERY month, and NEVER carry a balance.  Additional benefits are no annual fee, relatively low interest rates (providing your credit is good), and excellent customer service.

name: Danielle Gallagher
review: This card is great! It gets you rewards at places most people frequent on a daily basis (Starbucks and gas stations), and in the process saves a lot of money. I'm not a big fan of credit cards, but Chase is a very good company and the card is accepted almost everywhere. The customer service department is very helpful and friendly, and the website is very user friendly. Overall, it's a great credit card and I have not encountered any problems to date. I even traveled overseas with it and found that the rates were not over the top, and I was able to take out money from most of the ATMs I encountered along the way. If you have a chance to try the card, I highly recommend it.

name: Timika Redfearn
review: I use my Chase Freedom Card as my secondary card.  By way of background, I generally pay off the entire balance of my credit cards every month, so I am really only interested in rewards.  The Chase Freedom Card is adequate for these purposes since it offers a solid 1% back, which is well within the median of credit card rewards in the current economic environment.  The revolving categories can be great for earning as much as 5% back, but I have seldom found it to be too useful unless the bonus is given for  staples such as gasoline or groceries.My primary card is still a 2% back AMEX card, but since AMEX is not necessarily accepted everywhere, I keep this card as a backup.  It serves this purpose, but there are likely to be better cash back cards available to be a primary card.

name: Teodoro Shodunke
review: The Marriott Rewards Premier Credit Card is a great hotel rewards credit card for people like me who travel extensively and prefer to stay at the Marriott hotels. I earned an awesome 50,000 bonus points after spending $1,000 on purchases in the first 3 months. I have the option of redeeming these points for 6 free nights at a category 1 Marriott hotel which is a great offer. I also got 1 Free Night Stay e-certificate upon opening my account which is valid for 6 months from the date of issue. Not just this, I also earn points for every dollar I spend at Marriott locations, on dining, car rental and airline tickets purchased directly with the airline and on eligible purchases everywhere else. These really add up to a lot of benefits. Moreover, their annual fee of $85 is waived during the first year but one must pay it after the first year. Trust me, this fee is worth your money if you travel frequently and avail the many additional benefits that this card offers.

name: Delsie Spengler
review: Chase overall seems to be pretty good about offering high credit limits as long as you keep the card in good standing. This card started out for me with a really tiny credit limit, but before I'd even had it a year, it started going up and did so at a much faster rate than some of my other cards.I wouldn't rate the customer service from Chase as being quite as helpful as the people over at Discover, but they are probably better than the Capital One customer service agents. The experience you might have with a credit card is often based upon experiences with their customer service agents. And for Chase.... they're okay, but it's hard to negotiate with them on anything.They are quite punitive if you have any mishaps with payments - it is nearly impossible to negotiate down an interest rate if you are late on a single payment for any reason. They will bump that rate up so fast to 30% it will make your head spin.

name: Federico Devincenzi
review: I use my Chase Freedom Card for all my purchases.  Any bill, any purchase ANY item I want I purchase with this card.  I've had my card for many years and Chase continuously provides great customer service.  I used my card to take trips, buy gifts, electronics, just about anything!   I use my card for groceries, pay my cable bill, pay my real estate taxes, my insurance policies, even my hospital and veterinary bills.   And, what do I get in return for using my card?  A discount on my purchases by growing my points.  I've received  gift cards for gas, restaurants, and retail stores.  I even get back CASH.  The card is handy and easy to use everywhere and if you pay your bill off each month there are no finance charges.  Can't beat this deal.

name: April Hobbes
review: I love my Chase Visa Freedom card! I also have a checking account through Chase bank and I have never had any issues of any kind with Chase. I love the bank and I have 2 credit cards through them (this one being just one of them). I absolutely love and use the rewards I get from using my Chase credit card. I get 1% cash back for every dollar I spend and then for certain things purchased during certain months of the year I get 5% cash back on each dollar I spend. I couldn't ask for a better deal. Redeeming points is a piece of cake and I feel that I have plenty of different options to redeem them for. I would recommend this card to anyone who has the self control to pay off their credit card each month.

name: Simon Cook
review: I have built up my credit rating over the last ten years. I saw the details of the Amazon credit card including the offer of $25 off a purchase and decided to apply. As my credit rating was high I was accepted quickly and was given a high credit limit. The application process was very easy. I have found Amazon credit card services to be very good – I particularly enjoy the ‘cash back’ feature and the fact that the balance is automatically offered to me every time I purchase on Amazon – often these cash-back schemes make you jump through loops to get the money back.I have never had a problem with Amazon’s card. I have had limited contact with customer services, usually when they are reviewing my account annually. They have always been courteous and knowledgeable. I do not have a complaint about their excellent service or credit card.

name: Charis Leconey
review: I have greatly enjoyed using my Chase Freedom card.  I have a checking account through Chase bank, which gives an additional 0.1% + $0.10 per purchase.  This benefit means that the card cannot be beat when it comes to multiple small purchases throughout the day.  I have been pleased with the online payment options as well as the general layout of the website.  In addition to the regular 1% cashback, the rotating quarterly categories that give 5% are usually much better than the categories offered by competing 5% cards (Discover More, Citi Dividend).  Plus the Freedom card allows for rebates of any amount above $20, rather than the awkward $25 or $50 intervals required by other cards.  Redeeming the points was easy both times I have tried; Chase simply mailed me a check for my points balance.  I recommend this card to anyone who makes small purchases every day, like coffee or lunch, as the rewards will quickly stack up.

name: Eddie Liang
review: This was my second credit card. My first bank was hsbc and they made a monthly fee while I was with them. When I left to chase, they gave me a credit card after opening the new account. The card hasn’t given me any issues so far and the limit is more than enough for me. As a student this card is excellent and I would recommend it to others. The rewards aren’t as good as many other cards. To be honest, I don’t even notice them. At any rate, the interest and fees are practically non-existent and work the way I need.

name: Lenny Corman
review: Great card if only for the incredible introductory bonus of 50'000 Avios, though bear in mind you do need to spend $1000 using it within the first 3 months. That said, the points alone have gotten me a couple of short-haul flights out of New York thus far with some left, though there are a few destinations where the points are unusable due to relevant airlines included in the promo not operating in the area. Can't comment on the Inter-continental issues others have mentioned below as I've not looked into using it outwith the USA. Only downside is that the $95 annual fee is a bit higher than most but you'll probably get your money back if you use the card with the Avios in mind.

name: Brandon Geist
review: I'm a huge fan of this card.  I've had it for a little over a year, and it has lived up to everything I have expected.  I accumulate points very fast by using it to by my groceries and gas, and anytime I overnight somewhere I make sure it's a Holiday Inn property so I get extra points.  You also get a free night once a year plus automatic upgrade to platinum if you are a Priority Club member.  That will get you room upgrades, free drinks, etc. at most of the hotels.  I even used it overseas and had no problems.  I made sure to call them prior to my travel, but the fact that I was making purchases around Europe no problem made me a believer even more.  I would never use another card and plan on using this one for a long long time.

name: Darrell Vanbenthuyse
review: A Disney credit card was a must have for me considering that we live in close proximity to Florida and my kid is a big time Disney fan. Its a wonderful card for a family who often holidays in the Disney World as it offers you great discounts at the theme parks and upon booking Disney tours at certain Disney resorts. It does make your Disney vacation very affordable and enjoyable. These discounts even extend to any Disney merchandise you buy at certain Disney locations. Signing up for this card and spending $500 in the first three months entitles you to a $100 Disney gift card. I also benefit a great deal with the 2% cash back that they offer on purchases made at restaurants, gas stations, grocery stores and most Disney locations, and 1% cash back on all other purchases. I found it pretty cool when they asked me to choose a credit card design for my card from 8 different options. The only negative I have known so far is the $49 annual fee which again does not seem much if you compare it with the perks and cash back rewards you get. Basically it is the best card for families who are frequent Disney visitors.

name: Katharina Wegman
review: I have been using Chase as my only bank or years now, and it is just a delight. The customer service is prompt and knowledgeable, and their card is one of the best I have ever seen around. They do send quite a lot of mail if you don't select the paperless option, but the card is still great. It links to my primary bank account which is also helpful; and the card itself is very flexible to my needs. I try to use it mostly as a debit card and Chase seems to have been able to get that done on their own.

name: Carrie Stevens
review: I got this card because I was frequently flying and wanted more ways to save up miles. But now that I'm unemployed, I just have a credit card bill and not enough miles to use for anything. Chase is a good company as far as communication goes -- they give me plenty of notice about billing, for example. Beyond the fact that I believe their maintenance fees are a little high, I don't have any problems with this credit card. I simply can't use it anymore for the purpose I originally got it, so it's just another credit account at this point.

name: Matthew Paradis
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred Card is the first credit card that I have ever owned. I had some extra money to spend after receiving graduation gifts so I spent the first $3,000 relatively easily. I ended up going on a trip to Bermuda with a couple other classmates that I graduated with. I definitely racked up some serious points while on that trip, including hotels, car rentals, etc. Overall, I am very satisfied with it as my first credit card and don’t really have any complaints with it. The only thing that bothers me is the annual $95 fee which is kind of annoying but it isn’t a huge amount.

name: Madelene Brodey
review: I’ve had a United Mileage Plus card for the past 5 years or so and it is by far my go to credit card. I was a little skeptical about get a credit card that gave you airline mileage points because it takes so long to accrue a significant amount of points. I was wrong. Within 2 months I had already spent a couple thousand dollars on the mileage plus card. You gain 1 mile per dollar that you spend. From the day that I picked up the card, we have taken several family vacation and paid zero dollars for air fare. Considering the fact that the average domestic flight cost almost $200 this card has been a godsend.

name: Kit Lix
review: I originally got this card because I wanted to transfer money from a high interest credit card to a card with a 0% balance deal.  I was able to transfer $3,000 for a 12 months no interest deal.  As an added bonus, I got 30,000 miles on United airlines  after I spent $1,000. (I spent the money on Christmas shopping).  So I wound up with $4,000 in debt.  But, I got a free ticket on an airline and set up paying the card back $400 a month before my interest ran out.  I cancelled the card once I paid it back and avoided the annual $95 fee.  So I feel like a I got a low interest loan, a free airline ticket and got myself out of debt.  So it was a win win for me.

name: Brenda Price
review: I really love my Amazon credit card.  My online shopping go-to place is Amazon.com, so it has been really handy for me to not only earn extra points when I shop at Amazon, but to be able to use those points later to make purchases at Amazon.  It's an easy process, and the points automatically show up in your Amazon account.  I pay off my card every month, so I honestly have no idea how the interest rate stacks up against other cards.  I do know that if you are late on a payment every once in a long while, they do extend grace, and will take off the late fee.  That only happened to me one time, but it was nice to know that they were willing to do that for me.

name: Cory Grant
review: This is a great card for small business owners.  I shopped around extensively before signing up and was surprised to discover how little incentives exist with big name cards.  This card is terrific, what you see is what you get and they always deliver.  You don't have to mess around with points, you just get great savings.  The savings on gas was actually a lifesaver as a start up company that involved incessant travel throughout the state.  Customer service is friendly, personable and always willing to help you solve any problem or just answer questions without being tied to  a script.  I am so pleased I will use Ink services to sign up for any additional personal credit cards I need and I won't hesitate to recommend them to all my fellow small business owners.

name: cai  Sia
review: Thanks for the recommendation and honest review. If I am to begin a small business after graduating college, I will definitely consider this card. The savings on gas sounds like a huge plus!

name: Elguendouz Soukaina
review: I applied for my Chase card on February 2012, I’ve had this card for a year now benefiting from an unbeatable deal. When I first applied for the card after receiving an ads letter from the Chase Bank, I was offered an amazing deal whereof I was urged to make a balance transfer of up to 5000 USD, and benefit for a year and a half of interest free transaction.  Thus far, I have not paid a single penny as interest on this card which makes me very grateful since the bank of America platinum card I had transferred a balance from was costing me a hefty 14.9 percent interest fee.

name: James Rotiroti
review: I have had my Chase Sapphire card for probably close to 10 years.  I first used it for 3% back on gas, but then they switched to a points system.  I now have accumulated almost $500 worth of points which is awesome.  I am hoping to accumulate even more so that I can use the money to pay for my honeymoon someday.  What I really like is they give you double points for restaurants.  I also like the website which is very easy to use and I setup automatic bill pay so I never have to go to the post office ever again.

name: Hannah Myers
review: This was my first credit real credit card after I got out of college. I decided to apply when I received good reviews on the card from some friends, as well as received an offer in the mail. I do really like the card because it does offer cash back. When I first received the card, I used it a lot and so I got back over $200 in cash in the form of a check which was very nice. I do also like the low monthly payments. It seems like even though I owe quite a bit on the card the payments still seem very low. For someone right out of college and struggling to make ends meet, low payments are important to me. However, as far as the interest rate goes I feel like it is quite a bit higher than other cards that I have seen recently. Most likely, I will be trading the card in soon to apply for one that offers a 0% interest rate on balance transfers as well as a lower interest rate on purchases.

name: Andrew Moskowitz
review: As a frequent traveler, I was looking for a credit card that offered me great rewards. After doing some research, I finally decided on the Marriott Rewards Premier Visa card. For the first year, the annual fee was waived, and I received 50,000 bonus points as well as one free night. In addition, for every year anniversary, you receive another free night. Although the $85 annual fee is rather high, the free night is easily worth more than $85 so it's definitely worth it. In addition, I had a few issues with fraudulent activity on my account and Chase was extremely good about removing the charges and filing disputes.

name: Howie Tchen
review: In the past few years I have noticed that a lot of my money goes towards to Amazon, so after thinking about it I concluded that it would be a smart thing to get the Amazon credit card, and I can surely say I have zero regrets about it. Amazon first entices you by giving you a gift card for signing up upon approval and offers extra points if you were to buy anything from their online shop. Needless to say, you can buy just about anything on Amazon and I racked up so many points which saved me even more money. I mean in the past month alone I spent more than 300 dollars on Amazon, which equates to 1200 points, which means more money for me to buy things that I want. I would highly recommend the Amazon credit card to people who shop on Amazon often, just make sure to pay off your monthly bills and everything should be good.

name: Bbqphx Tracy
review: I am lukewarm about this card.  Not unlike other reviewers, I have found it a bit of a challenge at times to use my reward miles.  More often than not, dates are blacked out for no apparent reason such as holidays or special events.  If you do by chance find a range of dates that actually qualify for use with the rewards program, the fees charged add up and you don’t really end up saving as much as you’d hope.  Whatever happened to a truly free ticket rewarding you for your business?  I guess those days are long gone, unfortunately.

name: Sean Chandler
review: This is a great credit card, especially for building your credit. If you have no credit you may not be able to get one, but if you do the cash back benefits are one of the best out there. After three months of using your card, you get $100.00 back so long you spent $500 or more during this time period. Can get it as a check, or towards your bill; Unlike some companies who only let you use the points for travelling, or gift cards, etc. The card also features 5% off on categories that change. Right now I’m enjoying 5% off of gas. This card is saving me about 5 bucks a month and for the next 2 more months. Great card.

name: Steve Raul
review: My first and still preferred credit card, as a young graduate student. You of course never run into any issues trying to use it anywhere you go. Online banking with Chase makes my life a breeze. It is extremely easy to track your purchases, and pay off your bills. The cash back program is also great. They offer a ton of great deals from a number of different stores, or simply add money to your account in case you have other needs to spend on at the moment. Getting rewarded to use this card is another great incentive to use it more often, unlike the lackluster rewards programs offered by others.

name: Jean Fields
review: I have used only two other credit cards in the past and I will stay with the Chase Freedom VISA!  I am 60 years old and my finances are an extreme importance in my life.  The rewards with this card are better than any I have reviewed for my purposes.  Chase's customer service is above and beyond and you feel like family.  I read a comment here that someone believes these reviews are fake.  Let me assure anyone reading mine, I am for real.  Thank you Chase for what you do!

name: Jason Hudson
review: I've been a customer of Chase Bank for six years. The application process is quick and easy. Their ATMs are available everywhere so I do not worry about fees. Their online banking system is particularly helpful. The interface is well organized and vibrant. Customer service is excellent in America and abroad. The local branch near me provides quick service and knowledgeable bankers. I don't wait in line for a long time before a banker helps me.Their checking accounts suit my needs. I love the fact that their smartphone applications support check deposits. Once I take a picture the application sends the check to the bank electronically. This saves time and effort.

name: Afsal Ismail
review: The Chase Freedom card is probably on of the best all around cards out there. The rewards are much better than other point systems I have seen although if you're applying for it as your first credit card, it is probably best to look elsewhere. Approval is prompt if you qualify and you can add on a second authorized user. Watch out for high APR's (especially if you have lower credit scores) but you can often call and negotiate within several months of receiving the card. In essence I highly recommend this card for first use. Customer service is also an A+.

name: Alicia Frisone
review: I have been with Chase for about 4 years and have had nothing but a good experience with them. When I got married, we went into a branch and had both of our Chase accounts merged, which only took about five minutes. Whenever I go into a branch or call their support line, they are always very friendly and help me with whatever I need. A few months ago, there was a suspicious transaction (my card wasn't stolen, I just accidentally typed in the wrong zip code at the gas station) and they called me within thirty seconds to verify that the transaction was made by me. This experience made me feel very secure with them and that my money is in good hands.I would definitely recommend Chase to my friends/family.

name: Brianna Byrne
review: Hey all... I've had the Amazon credit card for about five months now, and wanted to share my experience. Like a lot of others on this site, I'd seen offers on Amazon for their credit card for years. I saw a particularly good offer one day ($50 Amazon gift card upon sign-up) when I also happened to be low on personal funds, so I decided to give it a try. Although I've had credit cards before, I've never used them... They were “emergency-only” kind of cards. For this card, though, there are rewards if you use it (up to 3 'points' a dollar; 100 points=$1 credit), so I figured this was a nice opportunity to start building up my credit rating, too. So far, everything's been very smooth. Though APR rates are high, if you pay the card off every month, you get some nice perks. Also, you can pay online; it's very easy and intuitive, which I appreciate. As long as you're responsible with your payments, I don't see any drawbacks to this card.

name: Todd Bryson
review: I started banking with Chase about five years ago. Actually, when I first started banking with them I thought everything was a big hassle. The tellers seemed rude and when I called they seemed very unconcerned. They have however been getting better all the time. I had an issue recently where I had an emergency expense with a pet at the veterinarian. Those of you who have a pet know that can be expensive. I had two checks bounce because of it. I called the bank and explained the situation to the branch manager. She refunded all of the overdraft charges and told me to call if there were anymore and she would refund them. This is a great bank and I would highly recommend them to anyone.

name: Ajay S
review: I have been using Chase for about 1 year now. I originally picked their credit card because I wanted something with excellent cash back bonus. I use my credit card for a lot of purchases, and it has paid off thus far. Their online service and customer service have both been excellent. When I have needed questions answered someone has replied almost immediately to any concerns. I find their online selection of bonus cash back merchant's to reflect where most people shop online nowadays. They haven't let me down thus far and I wouldn't expect them to. Also, the fact that there are no fees is a huge bonus that isn't always easily found anymore. I would recommend Chase to anyone.

name: Donnette Cheong
review: I like the Chase Freedom card very much. The application was promptly processed and the rewards are promising. I felt the need for getting a visa credit card because some stores refuse discover. It is almost equivalent to discover rewards card and the rewards points are very handy. I will certainly recommend the card to anyone who has accrued a decent credit.  I hardly had a problem with this card and they gave me add on card to my spouse as well. The customer service is good and once your account with chase is finalized, the credit card adds to that automatically so that you do not have to make a separate account for your chase banking and credit card.

name: Kjell Pedersen
review: I have had this card since 2007, I would give Chase and the Chase Freedom card a very high recommendation.  The APR is better than other credit cards I have, and has not gone up in the five years that I have had it.  Three years ago, the window to our car was broken and my wife’s purse was stolen, with her Chase card in it.  We called right away to cancel her card.  The customer service rep was compassionate and understanding.  She confirmed my wife’s identity and canceled the card before anything could be charged on it.  Three days later our new card was in the mail.  After calling to cancel all of her cards we felt that Chase was the most professional and gave the best service.

name: Steven Metzler
review: I frequently shop off of Amazon and they've been mentioning their card for what feels like years. The sign-up perks are great and this is definitely a card fit for frequent Amazon users. If you have an Amazon account that already has money than the interconnection between them is wonderful and convenient. I've only had the card for half a year but I use it when I purchase off of Amazon or anything small and the bonus points have been worth it. They help pay for some of my textbooks and gifts for friends. Amazon is a great site in general and finding another way to utilize it has kept me a customer for years to come.

name: Chris Holleman
review: I have had my Chase Sapphire card for about 6 months and so far so good.  Reward points are credited as they should be and the online banking service is great.  The rewards mall is huge and the payout options are very flexible. They are primarily why I chose this card in the first place.  Not being locked into a certain type of reward is great.  I can buy airfare, items through the rewards mall, or get cash back on my statement.  I have not had to use customer service, but I understand they are one of the better operations in the industry.  The card doesn't disappoint and I'm sure you won't be either.

name: Jesse Hepperly
review: I got this credit card when I made an online purchase at amazon.com. They enticed me with a thirty dollar off discount. I use this credit card for any purchase on amazon because I get 3 points   back. I also use it for gas stations because I get two points. I am saving up the points to use on airline tickets. When you get 25000 points you can get four hundred dollars off an airline ticket. As far as I can tell this is the best credit card that I have because of the amount of points that I can accumulate, and the rewards that I get back.

name: Mellie Rudi
review: The Chase Sapphire Preferred card is great. They usually give you a very large bonus for signing up. Beyond the great sign up bonus, it is an excellent card to use. They give great reward points that are redeemable for cash, gift cards or other items. I've never had any problems with their customer service, they are always friendly and helpful and willing to solve my issues. Their website is really easy to use and I believe they have mobile applications for all the major phones. If you have the opportunity and can get approved for this card, I would recommend it.

name: Mana Mccart
review: I've had this card for a little under two years and I've never hard a problem with it! This was my first credit card after graduating, and I've found it very hassle free to use. Customer service has been great when I've needed it. I get emailed notifications whenever I need to activate my quarterly bonus rewards, which is great because I often forget on my own. I've converted my rewards into cash to help pay down my bill. It takes a couple of days, but it always goes through. I'd say the rewards page is a little tough to navigate, but inasmuch as I always pick the cash option, I don't really have a problem with it. I'm sure there are better cards out there with a better rewards structure, but as a starter card, I have literally no complaints.

name: Leonor Fetter
review: I have had this card for a while now, and it has been quite useful to myself. I originally got the card after doing my banking with chase for a while and seeing several commercials for the card. I have used it to get by on certain weeks where I may be lacking on funds, and thus far haven't had any issues paying it off. This is a great starter card for people new to credit cards in general and want to build their credit, or if they're in need of a credit line to fit their daily needs.

name: Eneida Eberting
review: This is a great credit card. I had been hearing about it and seeing commercials for it for some time and finally talked to someone about it. It was recommended so after a little bit of research, I applied and was immediate accepted. I use this card to build and maintain good credit by paying my cell phone bill and the occasional grocery store or dinner bill with it. The cash back rewards are great and I got my promotional money pretty quickly too. I'm glad I took the time out to look into and apply for this card. Excellent for people with decent credit looking to maintain their rating with making minimal purchases.

name: Mary
review: I was having trouble with my old bank and my friend recommended that I try Chase since they had a promotion for new sign ups. I transferred my money and opened an account with Chase and then set up my direct deposit with them. After a month or two, I received a $75 bonus for linking my work's direct deposit to my account! Overall their rates and policies are pretty fair. I don't have any investments or anything... just a normal checking account that I keep in good standing. They treat me well and I've never had any problems. Their app is easy to use and I rely on that a lot since I check it at least a couple of times a day.

name: Carole Calabro
review: TThis is my main card that I use. I have had no problems with it whatsoever. I tend to travel a bit so this card fits my needs perfectly. I've used my points on this card to travel to Florida twice already and am planning on taking another trip in the near future. I have never had any problems with this card in any store or for any service, it's always accepted. I also like how it's different from many other cards that my friends have. I pull it out and people tend to ask me what it is and of course they like it after I describe it.

name: Carolyn Crandall
review: I started with the Amazon.com rewards card only because of the $30 credit for sign up. Since that time I use it for all my everyday purchases because I get $50 for every 5,000 point. Recently they have changed that and I believe you can use any amount of points towards Amazon purchases. I really like the 3 points for gas because when I buy beer every single day at the gas station – I get three points because for some reason – it comes out as for car expenses. Wow, it's like they  are paying me to drink beer. The beer is cheapest at the gas station I go to everyday and so I rack up points much faster than any other rewards cards I have read about. I just want the points to pay off card. I don not fly anymore.

name: Michael David
review: Something for anyone who may be interested in applying for this card to bear in mind is that you really need to have a very good credit rating before doing so - without it, you'll be turned down out of hand. I was pretty lucky to get it I think. The Pros are that there are no foreign usage fees, you get points for pretty much anything travel-related you can imagine (including staying at the Marriot, obviously) and the intro points when you are accepted are very generous. All that said, the amount of points you get for each activity is somewhat stingy and the annual fee is a bit higher than comparable cards. Definitely worth considering if you are a traveler.

name: Jonny
review: I received a flyer in the mail to open a Chase checking account and receive a bonus as long as I made regular deposits to them. I decided to try them out having been a Washington Mutual customer years ago before they were eventually taken over by Chase. The checking account is up to par with what I've come to expect, but their fees, and stipulations for avoiding fees, are more complex than what I feel is necessary. Online banking and bill pay is a breeze and you definitely get the feeling all activity is secure do their multi-factor authentication system. I also liked the design of their mobile application for Android. Checking for updated balances after a recent transaction is also very fast. I did not receive a lot of extra features, but they paid the bonus, and the account has definitely been useful, which is why it's an easy recommendation for anyone looking for a new bank. If you haven't yet, give Chase a try.

name: Victoria
review: I originally had a Washington Mutual checking account, but when Chase took over in CA, I was absorbed into their regular checking. It was a bit difficult getting used to the new website, and the way Chase did things. After all, I just kind of got a letter saying “hey, yeah, btw, we're taking over.” Depending on what branch you go to, you can have a bunch of nice, helpful people, or alternately, some of the least professional, grumpiest people ever, who probably shouldn't work in a bank. Generally though, if you stick to one branch for a long time, the people start warming up to you. However, there is still no concept of a “personal banker” like there are in other banks, just a friendly person behind a desk. Overall, the actual Chase computer and banking system itself is pretty easy. I can check my balance on my phone or computer. The only thing that's bothersome is when I log in from the same computer or cell phone, but with a different browser. It acts like it's never seen me before. Over the years, after many different banking experiences, I've tended to stick with Chase, because I feel that my money is safest there. Not that anything bad happened to any of my money elsewhere, they're just much more understanding of a student lifestyle than other banks.

name: Leah
review: I have been with Chase since I got my first job when I was 16 years old. I have never had any problems with them and have always felt very safe with this bank. I really like all the possible alerts that I can set up with them. They contact me whenever the slightest charge, even just $5 spent at a gas station in the middle of nowhere during a road trip, doesn't make sense to them and I really like that. To some people it might be annoying but I really like how closely they are monitoring my debit card in case of theft. When I was only 19 I studied abroad in Europe and completely forgot to call Chase to let them know that I was leaving. They cancelled my card right away after my first expenditure but one quick 30 minute phone call later, I was okay to use my card again. I also like how there are Chase ATMs everywhere. I am originally from the Chicago area, where there are Chase banks every two blocks it seems, so I was worried when I moved away to grad school in another state whether or not they would have much of a presence there or even a decent office. Turns out they did. All in all, I am happy with Chase's customer service and I plan on using them for a long time.

name: sarah smith
review: I have been with Chase Bank since high school using a college checking account and have been using them ever since. I've never had any problems or complaints about them. Every time I walk in to make a deposit the teller always works fast and is helpful and friendly. And their ATMs are efficient and easy to use. The first time I did overdraft when I was younger they were nice enough to waive it and I didn’t have to pay them the fees. I was once even given advice by a banker when I could have gotten scammed on the internet back when I was younger.

name: David Kauffman
review: One of the main reasons I decided to go with Chase is because I heard of their mobile check cashing which has been amazing so far! I absolutely love that I have very little need to go to a physical bank. I can just take out my phone and take a picture of my check to cash it, and it clears within an hour and the funds are available to use. When you do need to use a branch or ATM though, they are plentiful and easy to find. If you have a smart phone and can take advantage of the mobile check cashing, I would recommend Chase. It's a game changer in the world of banking.

name: Gohan Katana
review: I have had the Chase Slate credit card for close to a year now. This credit card is truly exceptional in every sense. The rates on the card are excellent and it is great for any kind of purchase. Also the ability to use the Chase features online to setup a “Blueprint” is invaluable. It allows you to map out your card activity with expert precision. Also, this card is excellent for anyone looking for a card to help manage multiple account balances. For any type of finance endeavor you embark on, I highly recommend you take the Chase Slate with you.

name: Lori McEntire
review: I love my cash back Chase Freedom Visa card! I love being able to earn up to 5% cash back on all of my purchases. That's higher than the 1% I was able to earn on my old card. I don't travel so the miles I was earning on my old card were useless to me as well. But I use the extra cash all the time! It's almost like a mini savings account I don't have to put my money in to, but can cash out on for a little extra money when I need it for something. Because there isn't a limit to the amount of cash back I can get I can save it up for as long as I want to. If I don't need it I don't have to take it and when I do need it there is even more there than I expected to find. That's amazing!

name: Stephen
review: I've been with Chase Bank for many years now and have had absolutely no problems. As a 20 year old college student it's helpful to have a bank which will cooperate with me in terms of transferring tuition money to various accounts. Sometimes it can be very chaotic and frustrating to get the tuition to go through, and Chase has been very helpful in making these transactions extremely smooth. I also have a savings account which I have been using for even more years through my mother who has had much experience at Chase. I am definitely satisfied with the services provided by Chase and will continue to work with them for the foreseeable future.

name: Where's John Osis?
review: I started using this credit card several years ago and have had absolutely no problems. The rewards system is excellent as long as you make sure you pay your bills on time. I've used it for many purchases and have had a very smooth and fluent time. My credit score has increased tremendously with this card as it works with you and is very flexible and understanding. For a student of my age this is sometimes hard to come by and I'm thankful that I found this card which has been quite useful to me over the years. I will definitely continue to use it.

name: Lisa Stafford
review: This is my and my husband's one and only credit card.  We basically just got it because we realized we needed a credit card to rent cars when we’re on vacation.  We use it on and off for purchases, and just immediately pay off the balance so we never deal with any interest and I wouldn’t even know what our interest rate is on it - but it’s still nice to have as we’ve racked up the points to buy a 60 inch LCD HGTV for my husband without even really trying.  The 5% categories are nice and seem to fit in with the kind of stuff we purchase and what seasons we purchase them in.  I think the biggest problem for me is trying to remember to sign up for each of the categories when they first begin so that I’m not buying stuff that falls under that blanket without getting the points for it but overall I like it and we’ll keep it around.  Especially for those times we travel and need to rent a car.

name: Michael Horne
review: I have this card and it works out great for me. Sure, as some have mentioned below, if you want to go all out and buy a ticket with Avios points for flights from the US to UK/Europe you will have to pay a lot in taxes, to which I also say, NO THANK YOU! However, what I do use my Avios points for is to upgrade my seat. I can buy an economy seat, use 50K in Avios and be upgraded to business class and then get the bonus miles from the flight as I am now in business class, win win! So, if you are looking to use Avios points that you will get from this card to get free tickets, then steer cleer. But if you want to use them to upgrade then go right ahead!

name: Melissa
review: Until a few months ago, I had an account with Chase for several years. The bank progressively worsened in its customer service skills, and increased in its fees and impersonality. Though banking was reliable, it was inflexible, expensive, and not personal. Chase offered no leeway on overdraft charges of any amount. The last straw that had me terminate my relationship, finally, was the following: unauthorized multiple Internet charges (of identical amounts, in rapid succession) forced my account into overdraft, and I was charged multiple fees. Attempts at resolution were unsuccessful. Chase is rigid and its interests are not in favor of the regular, non-corporate customer.

name: Cindi Mengle
review: I picked up this card mainly because it said it had no annual fee for the first year. It was pretty important to me because I have been tired of fees all around everywhere. I was also fairly interested in the points system, but not a main reason to just solely pick up the card. Anyways I had one problem in which my card locked up at a store, and I contacted customer service about it and had gotten it resolved fairly quickly. I was really surprised at how fast I was able to get it cleared up, as most of the time I end up having to wait on the phone talking to customer service for a long time. Outside of this I haven't had a single problem with the card, and use it only on a need to use basis. Basically to help me establish my credit score going up. I recommend people to pick this card up!

name: evan wade
review: This was my first bank account for many years before my local branch moved and I switched to a credit union to try something new. My financial needs have grown a little bit since switching (through no fault of Chase's), but for a basic, free checking account they were absolutely wonderful. It was also nice having the same bank anywhere I was, so I could expect the same level of care pretty much across the country. People complain about Chase a bit but those reasons alone were enough to make me happy. Their ATM fee system to this day is far better than what my local credit union provides, too. For basic checking service, I'd definitely recommend them.

name: Nicholas S
review: I just opened my Chase checking account about two weeks ago, but so far everything seems to be going smoothly. They made a mistake when I opened the account by telling me that the temporary ATM card was actually a temporary debit card, and I did not find out that I was using the wrong kind of card until I was at the grocery store trying to use it to pay. Chase's customer service has been pretty good though. When I wasn't able to use my “temporary debit card” I went into my local branch and the teller explained what was going on. It was not too much of an inconvenience because I ended up getting my real debit card in the mail about three days after I opened the account.

name: Quentin Williamson
review: I have been using the amazon rewards card for four or five years, and have had besically zero issues with it. I shop with amazon a great deal and the triple rewards points you get for every dollar spent at amazon make it a really good deal for me. The closest thing to any problems that I have had with the card are fairly frequent fraud flags (I travel a lot, and I buy a lot of kind of strange stuff from web sites in foreign countries so I get fraud blocks a lot), but even these are addressable via their automated IVR system and can be cleared up in a couple of minutes.

name: Sharmaine Bastin
review: The Chase Freedom card is a nice card to have. They have a very good rewards system. You can use points for statement credits, merchandise, gift cards, or other things. The possibilities are almost endless. Sometimes you can even get a nice amount of bonus points just for signing up. Using the card is quite painless. Visa is accepted by almost everyone who accepts credit cards. It's easy to switch over some cash spending to this card to get a lot of money back in points.
