Just make sure that you pay your bill on time and you shouldn't have any problems! I recommend the Chase Freedom card.

name: Tyler Smith
review: I recently upgraded to the sapphire from my standard chase card. Line was maintained; interest rate dropped to 6.74%. Pretty solid if you ask me. Experienced some fraud due to online use in the first week of having the card, and customer service was OUTSTANDING. They took care of everything. Very professional. The other amazing things is that if you call the secret number on the card, you speak to a person on ring number 2. no machine answering; no annoying prompts; no ridiculous CSR rep from India; no hassle. I highly recommend this card, if you can qualify for it.

name: Aaron Sass
review: When I first opened my account with Chase I thought "This is going to be a nice thing..." WRONG... To my surprise, once they had me as a customer it was an uphill battle to make a simple car payment with them. I was repeatedly told to pay my car payment over the internet or phone by 2 of the tellers. I felt like a child being scorned by my mother. I did not have internet at that time. Then every month I went in there for 3 years I would be sent to one of the assistants so they could help me with "MY PROBLEM", for a simple car payment. The two older teller ladies just don't have the time to deal with anyone's questions. In the process of being "helped" I somehow signed up for paperless statements and billing that no one could fix. It almost made me late with some payments. Again "my problem". When I first opened my account I was told I qualified for a credit card with a 500$ limit. She had looked at my credit information and my car loan information, (21.5% interest rate for a 09' Ford Focus) and said I already qualified. I received my denial paper pretty quickly though. When I went down there to close my account because I was lied to, all I got was line after line of all the things I would have to go through to close my account and fees (don't forget the fees), which would tie up my money for the next two weeks, or so I was told. No help from no one not even over the phone, just the runaround. I tried to get a credit card each year, but NO, NO, NO. Told me my credit was too bad. I refinanced my car for 6.99% at another bank and got approved for a credit card just days after I went to Chase and they denied me for a refinance and credit card again due to "poor credit". The other bank told me I had "good credit" and they would love to have me as a customer. I am happy not to have to deal with Chase anymore. They don't help. They just take and take and take.

name: Brian Smith
review: I've been a Chase customer for several years now and have never dealt with a bank that was so caring toward its customers. Whenever I visit my local Chase branch, I feel like royalty, as everyone welcomes you inside and is willing to help. Chase has been the best bank I've ever had. They don't charge me any fees and were willing to sit and talk with me to find the products that best suit my needs. I've also opened a credit card with them and the process was painless. I would highly recommend Chase because they truly do care about their customers. Combine that with their no/low fees, advanced ATMs and seamless online interface and you have a winning company.

name: Nams
review: I have been a Chase customer for several years and I maintain a checking account with them besides possessing a credit card. So far I have had good experience with them. They offer a wide variety of credit cards with great reward programs fitting for almost every customer's needs. Their cash back rewards are also very attractive and really help you save a good amount. Moreover their cards can be managed through your online Chase bank account. This way you can access your credit card and bank account at the same time and keep better track of your expenses and payment due dates. Their customer service is one of the best with courteous and knowledgeable staff and reasonably speedy service. The bank executives are also very helpful and committed to serving all their clients. I mostly access their online banking and often use their ATMs, but whenever I have approached their physical locations I have been mostly pleased. Although it is a busy bank, the executives offer speedy service and ensure that they get to everyone as fast as possible. All in all their extremely good customer service oriented approach has made my life easier.

name: Dana Meldgaard
review: I recently switched over to Chase after maintaining the same account with a local service bank since I opened my first account. I am amazed at the differences in service offered. My local bank only had a few ATMs available, was open only for a limited time during the day, often had problems with their online checking and employed some of the rudest people I have ever had the displeasure to deal with. Chase has hundreds of ATMs available (many of them accept deposits and every Walgreens I've been to has one), Chase is open longer hours, I have never been unable to access their online banking site (which seems accurate and prompt) and I am consistently impressed with the customer relations. Bankers in the locations are able to make decisions and inform me immediately, and I've never experienced rudeness from Chase staff.

name: Jennifer Weingartner
review: I have started using this card again recently. I changed over from the Chase Southwest card in order to get cash back. I really like the blueprint payment option. This helps with budgeting for food and gas. It has been great to get cash back each month. Also, their gift card options are on sale at times.  However, I do with that the 5% categories included grocery stores more frequently. A lot of the categories are super specific stores that people may or may not shop at. Other than that, I really love the card. I think that we will probably stick with this one for a while.

name: Ryan Weingartner
review: wow jen, quite a comment. you worded that very articulately. i've never seen you so passionate about something on facebook!

name: Kristy Terrell
review: Hahaha I really didn't get it at all

name: M
review: I've dealt with several different banks over the last several years. In terms of an overall rating, Chase falls in the middle of the pack for me. Their basic checking is pretty straightforward and like most other banks, the application process is painless. Their customer service is decent and I can't really say that I've had any major issues with them. The fees are relatively comparable to what other banks charge for checking. You need to either keep an average minimum balance of $1,500 in order to avoid the monthly fees of $12. The fee is also waived if you have direct deposits of $500 or more within the month. The latter is pretty much a given if you are working. Overall, I'd say that this a solid account with a big bank that has decent customer service. Ever since I left the banks and joined a credit union I've been biased about paying any “service fees”, but as far as banks go, this is pretty standard.

name: Ajay S
review: I have had this card for months now and it has treated me well. First off, customer service has been fantastic. Whenever I've had any sort of issue, I've contacted them and they have been prompt with their responses. I got the card initially because of the $100 cash bonus. It took me too long to activate the card, so I missed out on it but it wasn't a huge deal. The 1% on everything is pretty nice. I use my credit card for virtually every purchase, and I view the 1% as free money essentially. The rotating 5% cash back categories is a huge bonus as well. My discover card does something similar to this (although their categories are less practical for me) so having a card like this one comes in handy. I've been able to buy several presents with what I've earned with cash back. Finally, the ability to use the card to get more discounts online has been a great perk. All in all,  I can't recommend this card highly enough both due to the customer service and the fantastic cash back options.

name: Christine Harris
review: I had a checking account with Chase for a little over a year. While banking with them, I had several issues with cash deposits not being credited on the same day, which ended up causing overdrafts. When I pointed out the issue and even backed myself up with receipts showing the deposit and that it was a cash deposit (which by their policy should have credited the very same day), they still wouldn't do anything about it, for the overdraft fees that THEIR error caused. Banking with Chase is what ultimately turned me off of big corporate banks and made me return to small town credit unions instead. It felt like no one at Chase really cared about me as a customer. To them, it just seems like you're just another number, another commission for their paycheck. I would never go back to Chase Bank, even if they were the last bank available in my town.

name: Alicia Walker
review: I've had my card for a little over 2 years, and it has not disappointed me yet.  Their customer service is very friendly and have been very helpful in a number of manners.  My husband and I took a trip for our anniversary and one night he lost his credit card.  The next morning he called, and they helped him go through his previous charges and then helped him cancel the car.  We received a replacement within days.  I was very impressed with how nice and helpful they were.  I also really love their reward system.  Just for getting the card I got 10,000 points within the first 3 months! And after that you get 1 point per 1 dollar, and in some cases 2 points.  They are easy to redeem and they have a ton of options to redeem your points for.  I recommend this card to all of my friends.

name: Kate Gomann
review: I have had my Chase Sapphire Preferred card for about a year and a half, and I have always been very happy with their deals, customer service, and the card in general. Signing up for the card was extremely easy, and it was a very fast process. During my 18 months having this card, I have had a few outside issues that Chase was eager to help me with. I had my wallet stolen and some fraudulent purchases were made with my card before I had the chance to call in and report my missing card. The customer service agent was extremely helpful and fixed the issue immediately, and was able to issue a new card to me within just a few days. When it comes to their rates, I believe they are very fair and straightforward. There are no surprises as I have had with other card companies. Overall, I would definitely recommend Chase as a credit provider. I do not plan on changing any time soon!

name: CarolAnn VandenBerg
review: I frequently shop at amazon.com for almost everything I need. So when I found out I can use a credit card anywhere and earn points to use towards my purchase, I was thrilled. I jumped on the idea and I love my amazon.com chase card. I am not thrilled with the APR since my banks is much much lower. I just make sure to pay the balance quicker and it definitely works in my favor to use this card over my banks.  Because of the higher APR I do use my banks credit card for higher purchases or for balances that I my need to let ride for a couple months.

name: Herman
review: I have had a checking account with Chase for about a year now. They have always been reliable for me, and I haven't had any problems. I have a Visa debit card for the account which is very convenient. I can also scan checks with my smartphone to automatically have them deposited in my account, which is great. I live near 3 different Chase locations (one is just an ATM), which is yet another major convenience. I have been with small banks before, but it was always a hassle to use their account. I wish I could afford to support small institutions, but I can barely support myself, so I need every savings and convenience to work in my favor.

name: Tomika Hollett
review: My Amazon Chase card has been amazing. I usually pay off the balance completely, so the reward points I get back are always piling up. I shop at Amazon quite frequently, so that extra cash is nice to spend for xmas gifts, for myself, or for any emergency necessities for school that I don't otherwise have the money for. I haven't had a single issue with this card, and the fact that it's directly linked to my bank account makes it easy to make a payment without having to go to two different websites. I don't worry about interest because I pay off the balance. Definitely recommend this card if you shop at Amazon a lot and like to have a zero balance every month.

name: Aiden Perez
review: My experience with Chase has been mostly positive. I'll begin first with a negative aspect: the overdraft charges are absolutely ridiculous. When I was a struggling student, having such a high overdraft fee made it difficult for me to find the funds to replenish an empty account – and they've only been getting more expensive! Thankfully, I don't have to worry about that anymore these days.Customer service has always been great. Whenever I'd had an issue with fraudulent charges on my account, it was almost immediately resolved. Dealing with a bad flower vendor that tried to replace the premium bouquet I ordered with a cheap balloon and a small pot was also resolved. They've also been great at helping me freezing all of my credit cards related to Chase when my wallet was stolen.Customer representatives have also been helpful. Even though I was trying to close an account because it no longer made sense to keep it open due to minimum balance requirements, they found a loophole that allowed me to keep it without the minimum balance requirement.Also, the Chase app has made banking convenient as hell when I have to transfer funds or deposit a paycheck via mobile phone. The online site is a little confusing though, but they're slowly designing it to parity with the mobile app, so that's good for visual consistency.

name: Andrew Jensen
review: I have been with Chase for several years now. I did not become a Chase customer on purpose, but rather by default when Washington Mutual went under and Chase acquired their customers. Nevertheless, I have found Chase to be perfectly adequate for my needs.The primary interest I have in a bank is the checking and savings accounts. I do not want to pay unnecessary fees for the checking account, and Chase has proven adequate in this regard. On the savings front, I really do not care all that much about interest rates, which is good, because I make much less at Chase than I could elsewhere. I mostly care that it exists, and that it is easy to transfer money between savings and checking. Chase is good in that regard.I like having an option for online bill pay. Chase accomplishes that, although frankly their bill pay system seems like it was built as an afterthought, and maybe 10 years ago. It is a clumsy interface. But it is nice not to have to pay for stamps for my bills.I also like that Chase is everywhere. It makes it easy for me to find an ATM when I need one.All in all, I would not say that Chase has wowed me, but I guess I do not really need a bank to wow me. It is just a service, and Chase provides a good service.

name: infinite read
review: I really enjoy using my Chase Bank Checking and Savings account. Need to pull out money? There are branches and ATMs EVERYWHERE. Need to go in and perform a transaction, cash a check, pull out a bunch of $1 bills? Branches EVERYWHERE. The staff is always quite friendly. I've never had any sort of problems with Chase bank. A lot of people complain about fees and overdraft charges, but I have a pretty simple solution for that. I keep money in my account and make sure that I don't spend more than I have. That results in not getting charged any fees or having any sort of trouble with Chase bank. I'd recommend them!

name: David Hung
review: I've had my fair share of bank accounts opened through various banking institutions across the United States and closed many of them. However, one bank which I've always stuck with is JP Morgan Chase bank. I opened an account with them nearly four years ago, and have been a satisfied customer ever since. Their friendly bankers and tellers, great customer service, and pleasant atmosphere have always been to my approval. Their low fees and easy phone and online applications make trips to the bank few and far between. Nowadays you can even submit a check through your phone! All in all, I'm very impressed with the bank, and I will definitely continue using them!

name: Rudolph Banko
review: Every cardholder that signs up for a Disney’s Premier Visa Card will receive a $100 statement credit after first use of the card.  The statement credit should show on your account no later than 8 weeks after your first purchase.  The $100 promo is pretty solid when compared to other credit card offers these days, especially when you take into consideration the rewards program this card has to offer.A 2% bonus ($100 spent = Two Bonus Dollars)  is earned for every purchase at gas stations, restaurants, grocery stores and most Disney locations. Save 10% off on select merchandise purchases of $50 or more at Disney Store.com and Disney Store locations, and earn 1% bonus ($100 spent = One Bonus Dollar) for every dollar spent on all other purchases and Disney Dollars can be used to redeem almost anything Disney AND used to reimburse travel purchases using your Disney’s Premier Visa Card. Unfortunately, your Disney Dollars do expire per this statement directly from Chase:I used to have it its great.

name: Herta Sayed
review: One of the things I love most about my Chase Saphire Preferred Card is that it has no annual fee for the first year. This was very important to me because this was my first credit card and an annual fee was not in my budget this year. I love how easily my points gather, I feel like I am getting paid every time I gas up my car, which is such a relief considering how much gas costs and how frequently I need it. I would recommend this card to anyone who is new to credit cards and doesn't want to be to overwhelmed with information but still wants to reap the benefits that a credit card entails.

name: Harry Kim
review: I've been using this card for years. I had been looking for a rewards credit card for a while and the nice signup bonus and the 1% cash back /  5% in rotating categories is great. And 5% is pretty hard to come by. I use it for most of my credit purchases these days. Lately I've found that the quarterly 5% categories have been a bit lacking for me *personally. But there always seem to be some that I can use, and they always seem to be seasonally appropriate. No bad experiences with this card. The online payment tools are easy to use and the rewards come quickly. It comes highly recommended from me.

name: Ellen
review: This is the first bank I went to shortly after turning eighteen. I went with my father and I mentioned how I wanted to open a checking account. One employee quickly served me and talked to me in detail about the different accounts that are available. She was very enthusiastic but not overly so; it seemed like she really did want to help me (even if it's only for the money). She made sure I understood everything and gave me plenty of opportunities to ask questions. Every time I went back, whether it was to deposit money or if I had questions about my account, the employees were all very attentive and made sure to answer every question I had. Several months ago, they even were in the process of improving their customer service and made their bank seem friendlier by providing a big bowl of candy.

name: Beatriz Steinhouse
review: I have only had my Chase card about 6 months, but I am really happy to have it. My sister recommended it to me, as she has had a positive experience with them over the years. I have a low rate and am able to pay them off on time with little hassle. While I do have a Chase near my home, I generally just use my smartphone to access everything for them. Their mobile app is amazing! The customer service at my branch is terrific, as they always remember me coming in. The customer service on the phone is also great, and if there are issues, they generally have them resolved fairly quickly. All around, this is a good place to bank with.

name: Nicole Mullins
review: I bank with Chase and so far I have had no complaints. I have banked with them for about the past 8 years. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. I have had a service fee on my account once for not having enough money in it. I went in and talked to one of the Chase employees and he had it taken care of for me. They are very reasonable and willing to work with you. Another bonus of banking with Chase is you get extra money back if you have the Freedom credit card. I definitely recommend this bank.

name: Nicole Mullins
review: I have the Freedom Card and I have been so happy with it so far. First of all, if you bank with Chase you get 10 points back for every single purchase you make, no matter how small. On top of that, for every purchase, you get at least 1% cash back. Then quarterly, they have categories that they pick such as gas stations, restaurants, hotels, flights, Starbucks, etc. where you earn 5% cash back for using your card at those locations. The cap for this card is $1500, but for a starter credit card it is great. I have no complaints.

name: Denisse Millan
review: I requested an auto loan from Chase around 3 years ago for a car I wanted to purchase. The loan was for $7000. I was already a customer with Chase and I was having trouble looking for a loaner. After exhausting various other loaners I tried with Chase. The process was very easy. Since I was already a customer of theirs they had all of my info already. All I did was sign a few papers, got the info I needed and I was good to go with my loan. I highly recommend if you are already a Chase customer, and have decent credit.

name: Sreenivas Rajagopal
review: Wow! Where do I begin with this wonderful credit card. Chase Freedom has been a boon and a wonder to me since I got it 4 years back. I saw this on some website and it was probably one of the first cards that started cash back. I tried to get this instantly. I got approved and since then I have used majorly this for most of my transactions. you earn 1% on everything and the thing I like more if about the 5% you get every quarter. They keep changing the areas and its so nice. I wish they just didn't cap the amount to $1500 :) It's a must get for everyone. And now they are offering referral bonus as well! Its time to make more money :)

name: Michelle Mugnaini
review: I was given this card after my original credit card company was absorbed by chase, and I have been very happy with this card every since.  I enjoy the rapid rate in which I gain points, and love the fact that these points can be redeemed for cash back, allowing me to choose whether I use this money for recreational purposes, bills, or even return it back to pay my monthly credit card statement!  My favorite benefit of this card is the quarterly bonus that allows you to earn 5% back on purchases in select categories.  Some examples are quarterly pairings such as gas, grocery stores, and Applebees, or retail, restaurants, and Amazon.com.  The only drawback to this is that you have to sign up for the quarterly benefits of 5% cash back, as opposed to being automatically enrolled.  That being said this is still the best credit card I have ever had!

name: Stephanie Bardales
review: I have been with Chase since I got my first job at 17. Their customer service is exceptional compared to other banks. I was offered this credit card from my bank a while back. At first I said no, but I was convinced otherwise. You get the same great customer support from Chase plus awesome benefits. I have used my points for stuff that I actually need. This credit card is better than using cash or an ordinary debit card. Once I lost my credit card and I was flipping out! I called Chase immediately and explained the situation. There are no robot calls, just real genuine caring customer support that helped block unwanted purchases and helped me replace my card. Chase even changed my credit card number to prevent thieves from using my card again. In fact, Chase was able to track the thieves! It felt great to know your bank is on your side.

name: Cassey Blomker
review: I recently graduated college and this was the first credit card that I signed up for. I think it is the best card out there! It offers a nice sign up bonus when you are approved and then you receive up to 5% cash back every quarter in certain categories. The cash back is so awesome and I think I earn about 300 dollars in rewards every year since I max out the rewards. The customer service is awesome too. One time I lost my card and they immediately cancelled it and sent me a new one within a couple days. They also do a good job monitoring your card for any illegal activity to make sure you are protected. This is my favorite credit card and I recommend it to all my friends!

name: Julie Alafa
review: After my divorce, I needed a checking account of my own. I had a joint account with my ex husband at B of A but wanted to go somewhere else because of all the fees that B of A has. We were actually charged a fee to go inside the bank and talk to a teller there. I decided to give Chase a try. I'm glad I did. They were more than happy to help me. They offered me a checking account with no monthly fee, even without direct deposit, if I opened a savings account also. They allowed me to keep as much or as little in my savings and I got free checking on top of that. I eventually signed up for direct deposit also which is very convenient. They gave me a visa debit card so I no longer have to carry cash on me because the debit card is accepted just about everywhere. I can even talk to a live person without being charged for it. When I go inside the bank, the people that work there are always very friendly and seem happy to be there. They go out of their way to help in most situations and that is very impressive.

name: mom sears
review: I have been a Chase free checking customer for years. I have always received great customer service. The best part is the customer service hands down. I have only once been unable to resolve an issue and the issue was my own fault! lol I appreciate that I can call 24 hours a day and talk to a real person. Thanks Chase!!

name: Al
review: Chase has worked out pretty well as my bank. I've had a savings account and checking account with them since I was in high school and have very little to complain about. I got a student checking account in college, which was great because there were no monthly service fees while I was taking classes. Chase banks and ATMs are all over the place, making it easy to access deposit or withdraw money. Their iPhone app makes it easy to deposit a check simply by taking a picture of it (although if the amount being deposited is a lot, you have to deposit it at a bank location in person). Another reason I like Chase is because they have great customer service. Probably one of my best experiences with Chase has been their managers' willingness to reverse debit overdraft fees. Because of some automatic bill payments, I ended up having a negative balance and Chase charged a $35 dollar fee for it. I called my local Chase branch and after speaking with the manager, was able to get the fees reversed. This happened two times actually, and I think it's great they were able to reverse them even after the second time.

name: Jarvis Orr
review: I have been using the Chase Freedom Visa card for more than two years now and have been more than satisfied with it. The 5% cash back is one of its most enticing features. This has helped me get quite a few bucks back to my account when I purchase grocery or dine in restaurants. This has encouraged me to do most of my purchases using this card only! To top it, they do not have any annual fee unlike most other similar cards which have such rewards programs. Also, the website is quite user friendly and is hassle free for setting up payments and hence I have never been late in paying my bills. Once I lost my card and was very tensed. However, their customer service was very prompt and I got a new replacement card within a week's time. New customers are also entitled to a $100 Bonus Cash Back when they sign up and spend $500 in the first 3 months and trust me this target is quite achievable. To sum it up, I would rate it one of the best in its category. A big thumbs up to the Chase Freedom Visa Card!

name: Ariel Phomsoukha
review: I got the Amazon Credit Card last year with a twenty five dollar credit.  It was easy to apply for and I have had no problems using it.  I got it in the mail and used it for a twenty five dollar purchase.  I was nervous at first that it would not work or that there would be some sort of catch or loop that needed to be jumped through to activate the credit.  It worked great.  It makes using Amazon quicker and makes shopping on Amazon more efficient.  I would recommend signing up if you are looking to purchase something from Amazon.com.

name: Aaron Hammond
review: I've been with Chase for over 5 years and am a loyal customer thanks to their service. I've never had any problems with Chase. If you lose a debit or credit card, they immediately cancel it and will have a new one send to you right away. If there are fraudulent or questionable transactions on your account, they'll call and ask you to verify them. What's more, if there are fraudulent charges, they'll undo them with no cost to you! Time spent in the bank is often short, as they're so efficient at their branches. Also, the new ability to deposit checks from smart phones is incredible and super-convenient.

name: Malinda Running
review: I recently changed credit cards and am happy to say that the Chase Freedom card has been absolutely a thrill to utilize. From its multiple money rewards to the cash back on certain purchases, I've saved a bit of money here and there. Chase's customer service has been wonderful to work with and their website remains easy to navigate, as well as, intuitive. I recently had a purchase error and they fixed it immediately when I brought it to their attention. Overall, I would highly recommend this credit card to anyone and the extra $100 when you sign up truly puts the icing on the cake.

name: Charlyn Conmy
review: You have taken the time over the years to be smart with your money, and even managed to start a successful business.  Yet it seems that most credit card companies take no notice of that.  Luckily, Chase has decided to reward you for that great credit score and business that you run with this Ink Plus Business Credit card.  The rewards on this are great, as you can earn up to 5 points per dollar (office supply, phone and Internet charges) and they even give you 50,000 points right extra if you spend $5,000 in the first three months (and what business owner can’t do that?).  There is no limit on the amount of points that you can earn, and the interest rate is only 13 percent (after an intro 0%, of course).  All of this, of course, is backed by the great service you’re used to from Chase.  Now, not everyone will qualify for this card, but for those who do, let Chase reward you for the wise choices you’ve made by making another one.

name: Paul Nobrega
review: This card is by far the best rewards card you could have.  I used to use Blue from American Express but the reward was a constant 1%.  This rewards card has categories throughout the year at 5%.  Right now it's 5% back on all gas purchases, which is great!Basically, I pay for everything I possibly can on this card and pay the balance off right away.  It's sort of like a buffer between my expenses and my bank account.  Using it this way I rack up points faster and basically get paid to use the card.  The points are redeemable for a cash (technically a check or a credit to your account) or towards purchases through their on-line portal.I highly recommend everyone get one especially right now, where you get $100 just for signing up.

name: mike kaduce
review: When I was trying to build up credit, no one would issue me a credit card. I was stuck in the paradox of needing credit to get a credit card, but needing a credit card to get credit! Someone recommended a pre-paid card and back when I obtained this card, in about 2009, this was the only card I remember seeing that was prepaid (where I loaded money into the card and was never able to spend more than what I had) but also had a concurrent cash back rewards program. I signed up for this card online, never having banked with Chase before, and was impressed at how easy it was to load money onto the card. I felt better knowing that I was building up credit, and I was going out to eat about once a month totally for free, just based on my rewards! Since my only experience with the bank was because of this card, I am going to give them a good review. I don't have much information on their checking and savings policies, but I am impressed with this card and would recommend it to anyone in a similar situation as me.

name: Lisa Taylor
review: I love my Chase Bank on Congress St. in Austin, TX. They have the best customer service and are very helpful with any problems or concerns. There is always someone available to help you and will sit down with you for hours if necessary. I opened a checking and savings account with Chase Bank and also applied for a credit card. I did not get approved for the credit card, but will be getting a secured credit card with them. I know when I go back in, they will remember my name as always and spend as much time as necessary. I always look forward to banking at my branch.

name: Hillary
review: I have been banking with Chase for the last six years. I currently have two checking accounts, three credit cards, my mortgage, and a student loan through them. I'll be honest; I did work for them for two years, which is why I started banking with them in the first place, so I probably have a different insight than a lot of other people. That being said, I feel that a lot of times when someone is upset, say about an overdraft fee, it's the customer's fault not the bank's. You can't expect nothing to happen when you spend more money than you have, don't check your balance, and don't take the time to understand how online banking works. That's not to say of course that the bank doesn't make mistakes, because they definitely do. My most recent experience with them, however, and the reason I gave them five stars, is because of something they recently did for my husband and I that they most certainly did not have to do. My husband recently joined the armed services and decided to invoke our rights under the SCRA (Servicemembers Civil Relief Act) and request a reduction in our credit card interest rates. We have three cards with them but only requested the reduction on two of the cards because my husband is only an authorized user on the third card, not an actual owner. Because of this we didn't think that it qualified under the SCRA. Our mortgage would also technically be covered but we did not request that either because our interest rate was already less than the maximum rate allowed under the SCRA. As it turns out they reduced the interest on the third card as well, without us asking for it. A few days later we received a call from the mortgage department at Chase. They noticed that we had changed our checking accounts over to military accounts and asked if we had invoked our rights under SCRA. We told them about the credit cards and we were informed that they were in the process of reducing the rate on our mortgage as well. We told them that the rate was already under the maximum rate under SCRA and they told us that they were just going to reduce it even further and give us back the difference. Part of the SCRA provisions are that the request has to be initiated by the service member. We only initiated it for two credit cards but Chase went ahead and covered another credit card and our mortgage without us asking for it. If the accounts are included under SCRA Chase has to give us back the difference, so they basically gave us back money that they didn't have to because we didn't ask for it. I know people have their issues with banks but this just blew me away. In total we got back around $800 which I know is just a drop in the bucket for them, but it was big for my husband and me. The fact that they didn't have to and did anyway, I think says a lot.

name: Julie Provost
review: We have had a Chase Freedom card for about 4 years now.  They have always been a great card company to us.  They do not bother us with a bunch of phone calls trying to get us to add services to our card.  They have a great rewards program as well.  I enjoy the choices they have as far as what you can redeem your points for.  Their website is easy to use and it is very easy to see how many points you have, what you owe and what your balance might be.  We have not had any major problems with them and will continue to use them in the future.

name: James Higgins
review: My Amazon card was the first store-associated card that I ever had and it is still my favorite. I originally signed up for it because they were offering a gift card when you signed up with them and points promotion. I was a little skeptical of the points reward system because I have been through that before, but Amazon credit card is different. Every point you get is worth 1 cent and on top of that, you get bonus points for using it on certain things such as shopping with Amazon.com. The points can easily be access when checking out on Amazon.com and subtracted from your purchase instantly. I highly recommend this card if you shop at Amazon.com at all.

name: Adam Brixey
review: I've been with Chase Freedom several years now and have been completely happy with their service. The different reward categories that rotate each month are awesome and help inform my purchase decisions. I had issue of identity theft about a year after getting my card and Chase customer service contacted me promptly and made sure everything was taken care of - color me impressed. Their website is one of the easiest to credit card sites I've ever used and getting my rewards has never been an issue.  This is actually one of two Chase cards that I own - their introductory cash back offers are generally great deals, so grab them when they come up and just keep up on your payments.  You'll be golden.

name: Gladys Weerts
review: I started banking with Chase about 3 months ago and decided to switch cards because of it. I found out about the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card through a friend and decided to get it. I have to say that I really like this card. It fits all of my needs. The best part about this card is the points system. I’m currently at 42,000 points after only 3 months and trying to get more. Hopefully these points will turn into something good in the future! If you have great credit, this is the card for you. I highly recommend it.

name: Forrest Bowlick
review: The best part about this card isn't the rewards or customer support (which are great), but that fact that the credit card number is on the back of the card. I have had countless confused expressions from people about this card because the numbers aren't where they are supposed to be! I think this is great because it forces the cashiers to pay attention to the card and really check that it is legit, that I am the authorized user, plus it's a fun way to start a conversation with people. The rewards are awesome, and Chase's online system for credit card managing is the best I've worked with. I haven't had any fraud issues but have heard that Chase is great for resolving them. Hope this helps you figure out the best card for you!

name: Frida Puffenbarger
review: I signed up for the Chase Freedom card at the beginning of the year, and I was approved pretty easily. This is a standard credit card. After the initial 15 months no interest, my APR will default to around 11%, which is not a terrible rate. My credit line is only $1000, which might be a drawback, but who really needs more credit than that? It's a good way to build your credit without getting into heavy debt, so I recommend it to college students who need a little spending cash but can afford to keep up with the payments. Chase's customer service is great, and I've had no major complaints.

name: Jennifer Scheiter
review: My husband and I just got our Sapphire chad card and are so pleased with it. My husband was preparing to travel for work and needed a credit card that did not have any international fees. He has been abroad a couple days now and has had no complaints. After completing the application online we received our new cards in a timely manner. I am excited about the travel dollars we will be accruing and the bonus program that they have for our first few months. The system used for spending the "points" we earn seems extremely user friendly and I look forward to using it.

name: Matthew Magee
review: I have had my Chase card for a couple of years now - I got it when they were offering a fantastic 18 month no interest balance transfer. We have been very satisfied as everything has gone as we have expected with no surprises.The website is easy to use for payments and checking up on your account. However, I think I have used the iOS phone app more! I don't think I've logged in to the website - even to pay my bill - in several months. From my years of experience in managing retail; I feel it is important to make it easy for people to pay you...don't give them an excuse to not give you money! Overall, using Chase has been a good experience. I think everyone's needs and desires are different; so you may find something that works better for you, but it would be hard. Chase has worked hard to keep me happy and provide systems and services to make their card easy to use. This is how it should be...keep the customer #1.

name: Šteph Kurin
review: I signed up for this card not too long ago.  After my first three months of use, I'll get $50 back, so that makes it a good use for this card.  I have another card I use, but this will make a good second card.  I always pay my credit card bill on time, so I'm not racking up debt or bills.  I use the credit card throughout the month and then pay the bill.  So far, this has been a good card for me,  but then, I’ve never really had issues with any of my cards.  I like the cash back feature as well—wouldn’t get a card that didn’t have one!

name: John Johnson
review: I have had the Chase Freedom Card for many years now and I use it quite often.  When I got the card, it was great that they offered a 0% interest rate for the first year.  Also, I took advantage of the 0% interested on balance transfers for a year.  That was very helpful since I was able to transfer my high interest rate card over to this one, and was able to get my balance down faster.  But the best thing, which I didn't realize until quite sometime after I got the card, is the cash back rewards that they have.  I couldn't believe the 5% reward they offer on certain categories every three months.  I can't find too many other cards that will give you that much back!  The Freedom card is a great way to save money when buying everyday items!  It is also very handy to just be able to get my bills emailed to me, and then be able to pay them online.  This card is very convenient.

name: Keri Rangitsch
review: After much research and reading many reviews I decided to go with the Chase Freedom card. It was the best decision I've ever made in regards to choosing a credit card. The incentives are amazing. After I received my credit card I went on a shopping spree, spending more than $500 and in return was rewarded $100 Bonus. The thing I love the most about this card is the cash rewards I receive just for spending my own money. I opened a Chase checking account which allows me to easily transfer my cash rewards to my personal account every month. The Chase Freedom website keeps you up to date and informed of new incentives, and is very user friendly. I have no complaints since I've got this cad three years ago. I highly recommend it!

name: Amanda Martinez
review: I have only had this card for about 6 months, but it is great. I have no interest accruing on my account and I get a generous amount cash back to do more with my money. I would definitely recommend this card to those with good credit. The downfall, you have to have good credit. It took me almost 3 years to get approved for this card, but it was worth because in the process I made my credit outstanding and I am very happy with that. Credit is very important and Chase can really help you keep good credit with only paying what you spend, never having to pay fees or anything. That is the great thing.

name: Hillary Flannery
review: I have had this credit card for over six years and have yet to have a problem with it.  I've always received the rewards I'm entitled to and their website gives ample opportunity to make sure you earn as many rewards as possible.  Truthfully, any fees I've incurred were a result of my own actions.  I'm actually very impressed with the company.  When my husband and I invoked our rights regarding interest rates under the SCRA due to his military service, we didn't initially include all of our credit cards.  The company quickly processed our request including those that we didn't initially think we qualified for, and we received our refund very quickly (within a few days).  The company has yet to do any wrong by me so I would definitely suggest this credit card for anyone.

name: Nadina
review: As a student, I've found Chase to not only be dependable but a great resource as well. I really love how simply and user-friendly their website ¬is—sometimes I just don’t have time to run out to a branch. From the site, I can manage my transfers, my checking and savings accounts, set-up monthly payment plans for things like car insurance and schedule wire transfers. I also really love their phone app. I can deposit a check through my phone while I’m studying. For me, the convenience of Chase really puts it at the top. None of this is to speak badly for the customer service I encounter when I do visit a brick-and-mortar branch. I feel that every single time I've gone in, I've been more than a number to the associates I've dealt with. All were extremely helpful and informative, making sure I was using my accounts optimally and suggesting ways that could make banking with Chase more efficient. In short, I’m really happy with Chase Bank and would heartily suggest opening an account to anyone who asks—I even got my boyfriend to switch over from his old bank!

name: Rob Isho
review: I chose Chase bank because my family has been using them for years. I can always withdraw and deposit money into my bank account without any problems. I can also transfer money into my bank account electronically with no transfer fees. The customer support is amazing and they are available all the time. I lost my debit card and they were able to cancel it right away without any problems. Chase has a lot of locations and I have a Chase bank less than 5 minutes away from my house. I can also get help from the bankers that work inside the bank. Lastly, I really enjoy having an ATM available to me all the time and get money quickly.

name: Evelyn Oak
review: I trusted Chase with my money for a mere five months before I absolutely could not allow it any longer. Their monthly fees are absurd, their tellers are complete imbeciles, and their ethics are, without question, questionable. There is truly a fee for anything. They think of anything. The statement for my fifth and final month with them seriously had more transactions due to fees than actual deposits or purchases made by me. MY money. With contempt, I reminisce over the long evenings spent on the telephone listening to a representative give me nothing but a maddening loop of slurred nonsense: “Ummm, uh, yes. I see that. I'm not sure why that's there. Ummm, uh, yes. I see that.” They have ATM locations on every corner, their sleek logo and omnipresence draws you in, but I ask you, fellow humans: What is the price of 'convenience'?

name: Alex Hoekstra
review: My parents had opened a Chase savings account for me when I was younger and I never thought much of it until I was moving away to school and wanted to move money into another account. The process was simple enough, but Chase's customer service was unreasonably difficult about the matter – apparently taking offense to the notion of me moving any money outside of their bank. I continued to maintain my Chase account over the years, but the quality of service I received was never the same. I was once turned away from an attempt to get a document notarized at a Chase branch, since I did not have my account information on hand at the time to verify my membership. I found the staff to be inflexible and rude. The infrastructure of the bank itself, though, is sound and simple, but interacting with it through a staffed Chase branch hasn't been a pleasant experience for me.

name: Andrew Grubbs
review: I've had my Chase checking account for just over a year now. I have been highly satisfied with the services provided. Their banking has been much easier and has worked much smoother than all the past banks I have worked with. They have no monthly fee and no minimum account balance. This is a very nice thing to have. I was also very surprised to learn that they have very extensive fraud monitoring services. The branches all have incredibly friendly tellers and everything is done in a timely manner. Overall my experience with Chase has been fantastic and I plan to bank with them for quite a few more years.

name: Merry Turnley
review: I've had the Chase Slate card for several years now. While I can't say there's anything spectacular about it, I appreciated the introductory 0% interest rate at the time I opened the account, and it has remained one of my lower interest rates over time compared to other credit cards I have. I really like being able to use the Chase app to get my account information, much better than making a call or having to bring up my smartphone's browser. Although I haven't experimented with it much, the Blueprint service is interesting. With it you can create a variety of payment plans based on what your financial goals are. That kind of customization was a pleasant surprise.

name: Margo Dollard
review: My amazon visa was the first credit card I've ever got. I buy everything on Amazon, my supplements, books, video games, gadgets, you name it. It only made since that I got a credit card in which my rewards would actually be used. And now I get points for spending on Amazon with it! I use those points to buy more stuff on Amazon! It's a fantastic cycle. I also get bonuses for buying gas. As a college student this card has been extremely helpful. I would recommend it to anyone, especially those that love Amazon as much as I do! It also doesn't hurt that it has low interest rates too!

name: Beulah Wehrly
review: I have three or so other credit cards besides my Amazon credit card, and some of them might technically offer better “rewards,” but I have to admit, when I pull out a credit card, more often than not, I’m pulling this one out. I love the Amazon reward points, and I love that if you don’t have enough for a $25 gift certificate (or don’t want to wait to either accrue one, or wait for one to come to you in the mail, which I rarely do) you can link your Amazon card to your Amazon account and use your points that way.  Instant gratification! I had somebody tell me once that it would make better sense to use my Amazon card to shop on Amazon, but accumulate cash rewards. This is because, in theory, you would be buying what you buy on Amazon.com anyway, plus get three points for every dollar you spend on Amazon.com with this credit card. I suppose that is true – for some people. However, for me Amazon points are like free money. I buy things that I otherwise wouldn’t – it is the source of my “mad money,” so to speak. As far as everything else goes – interest rates, credit line, and customer service – I don’t think this card is anything particularly special, but I haven’t had problems either.  That, combined with my love of Amazon.com, makes this card very worthwhile. For people who aren’t quite as addicted to Amazon.com, there’s always on the cash rewards, though they might (and probably could) do better elsewhere. I love getting my Amazon rewards though for buying the mundane things I would anyway. My only sore point is that when I signed up for this card, I only got $25 to spend on Amazon!

name: Armanda Hennings
review: I got the Chase Freedom card when I was 19 years old. I enjoyed many aspects of the card such as the unlimited 1% cash back on all purchases, the 0% introductory APR and the $100 bonus after making $500 in purchases. I also really liked and took advantage of the 5% cash back on groceries, gas and restaurants. The credit card is great for someone new to using credit cards, such as college students, with no fees for going over the limit and the late fee is not much compared to other credit cards. The APR after the introductory rate is not bad compared to other credit cards and being a Chase customer it is easy to make setup and make payments via their website. To this day I’d still recommend Chase Freedom to anyone new to the world of credit cards.

name: Arcelia Pryer
review: I have had the Chase Freedom card for a few years now and it is the best credit card I have owned. I use it for all of my daily purchases and pay the balance off every week. I have had no problems with the card or no extra fees. I get 5% off of select categories and 1% off of everything else. At the end of the month they convert your cash back into points that you can use to purchase gift cards or they will send you a check for the amount. I have received over $1,000 cash back since I started using this card and I would recommend to to anyone.

name: James Higgins
review: The Chase Slate card is one of the absolutely best cards I have ever used. The online features of this particular card let you pay off particular purchases or amounts and really make it easier to get the remaining balance paid down. It also keeps track of how you are spending your money and keeps all of your statements online so they are easy to access. In addition, the nifty new design of the vertical card gets compliments from everyone that I show it too. Finally, the customer service with Chase Slate has been nothing short of phenomenal. Every time I have had an issue, they were quick to resolve it and make sure I was a one hundred percent satisfied. I would suggest this card to absolutely anyone that is looking to get a new credit card.

name: Walnut Bee
review: I needed a card to sort of help me with rewards and spending since I travel a lot, and I came across The Marriot Rewards Premier Credit Card. It's an absolute beauty with all the perks that it comes with and the fees aren't bad at all. You don't have to pay anything the first year, but every year after that is $85 annually. It isn't bad, only if you travel a lot, because the rewards overshadow that. I enjoyed my first 7 free nights when I went to Miami over the summer. This card is great for you if you plan to travel a lot, if you shop around in hotels (restaurants also) and if you use airlines and car rentals often. I recommend this card, only to people that love to travel because it is absolutely great for that.

name: Elizabeth Mitchell
review: I have had my amazon.com rewards card for awhile now. I first applied for it while I was in college because of the 30 dollar gift incentive, but even now that I’ve graduated, it’s still my most-used card. I love that I can use it pretty much anywhere, that I get points back towards amazon.com purchases, and free shipping on amazon.com as well. I also really appreciate Chase is always reliable about sending me statements and other updates when they make changes to anything that might affect me. I’ve even developed a pretty generous credit limit over the years, although thankfully I’ve never needed to get very close to it.

name: Justin Gilmore
review: I've had this card for a few weeks. I originally got it to do a balance transfer from another card. I was highly satisfied with how quickly I was approved for the card. The interest rate is also very good. 0 percent for 15 months. Also no balance transfer fee. Currently I’m not making active purchases with this card because it was just for the balance transfer. However, in the future I will definitely use this as my primary card. It was also very easy to set up the online banking linked to the card to pay statements. I have no major complaints about the card. I’m very satisfied with it.

name: John Johnson
review: I have had my Chase Slate Card for probably a good six years now.  I originally got this card because of the great deal it had on balance transfer.  My old card had a big balance on it with a high interest rate.  So I transfer all of it to this card and it allowed me to pay it down a lot quicker with the 0% interest rate for 12 months(at that time).  Although, they do charge you 3% of the balance transfer, that was definately fine with me, since my other card had a way higher rate!  They have a great website where you can just go on and look at your account, which makes it easy to make sure no one is making fraudulant charges.  Paying on it is also nice and simple since you can just do it on their website.  What is also nice is periodically, they send you checks that you can write, in case your in need of some quick cash for anything, with there usually being no interested for 15 months or so. This card has been great for me!

name: Conception Portley
review: The Chase Freedom Card is the first credit card I got when I was 20 years old. I believe this card offers some of the very best rewards. With a 1 percent cash back on all purchases, and a 5 percent cash back on various types of goods such as gas, groceries, and etc, this card almost encourages you to buy more stuff. Furthermore, when you buy more stuff, you get more reward points that allow you to redeem free goods from the Chase shop or get cash back on your card. It is nice to know that Chase offers a card that rewards you for spending money and gives you an incentive to actually use their card.

name: Feef Salama
review: This is a great card. I signed up for it about a year and a half ago, and I still use it for my purchases. The intro 0% APR rate is fantastic, and who could argue with getting cash back from purchases, and 5% cash back on gas? I already have made deposits from the cash back I received from this card, and Chase deposited it directly into my account! What a great advantage! Also, payment is very easy. I can pay my bill so many different ways. It's really convenient. This card allows you to pay by phone, mail, or at any Chase bank branch. Definitely worth it to check this card out.

name: Mammie Bowlick
review: I'm very happy with my Chase Slate card. I decided that I wanted to consolidate some of my cards into one with a better rate and no balance transfer fees. As a longtime Chase customer I was excited to find that they were offering the best option for my needs. The Chase Slate card offers me a good rate, no cost to transfer my balances and the ease of use that comes with a credit card issued by my bank. It's so simply for me to login to the chase website to handle all my banking and credit card needs. Paying the bill is as simple as transferring the money straight from my checking account. I was especially happy that I was able to call chase and ask them to lower my rate simply because I had been a member for a while. This is a card worth getting.

name: Nathan Walasek
review: I've had a Chase Freedom rewards card now for a couple years, and make all of my purchases using it. I get 1% cash back on everything I purchase, as well as 5% cash back on some categories that change throughout the year (grocery stores, gas, department stores, etc.). I get enough rewards to earn a $50 reward a couple times throughout the year which can be sent to you via a check or gift card, or you can use those rewards to shop online or as a credit for your Chase bill. It takes an annoyingly-long time for the points to show up in your account, but so far it has been worth it for me.

name: Joe Fruland
review: I signed up for this card a couple years ago and it is the best credit card I've ever owned. The quarterly rewards make this one of the best cards out there. Usually at least 6 months out of the year you get 5% cash back on gas, which is amazing with how expensive gas can be. Also, at least a few months out of the year you can get 5% back on restaurants. With as much as I go out to eat (and to bars!) this adds up to quite a big check each month when I cash in my rewards. Plus, the discounted gift cards in the rewards mall can make your points go even further. Look no further for your next credit card!

name: Eric Phou
review: I signed up got mines used $500 first 3 months Never received my $100 initial promo. Contacted chase and they said it was not offered... They wanted to show proof so if you decide to sign up... Just be aware

name: WalletHub
review: Did you point them to their online application? If you click on the Apply Now button above it clearly states that you get "$100 Bonus Cash Back after you spend just $500 in your first 3 months". I suggest you call them again and let us know what happens so that we can see how we can help you further.

name: Jessica Juarez
review: I love it! ive had it for 5 months now and I shop and pay bills online hassle free. the only problem I have is that it overdrafted which I found weird since its prepaid. other than I love the low fee and free withdrawals at the chase atms. and the other free services.

name: Robert Ryan
review: This is the second card I've ever owned. The initial perks are fantastic. If you spend more than $500 within the first three months of ownership, they give you $100 cash back. It's fairly easy to spend $500 if you just put all of your purchases that you normally buy in there. In addition to that, it's easy to rack up a lot of cash back just from the credit card use alone. You can get 1% cash back on all purchases or 5% on select categories that cycles every quarter. If you use a credit card for all of your purchases this can add up to a lot. I've already gotten about $300 cash back this year alone.

name: Andrea Hollander
review: The Chase card was my first credit card.  I received it when I was a senior in high school (under my father's watchful eye) to help me build credit.  I found they gave very clear statements and expectations however the information was very confusing for someone new to credit.  Later I had some problems paying the bills after college and ran into trouble trying to make payments.  They did try to assist me in that and were willing to accept a payoff after a charge off, so that made it much easier. I would recommend a chase card for someone who is not a beginning credit card holder however and education on credit is a must before getting any credit card.

name: Mary Lopert
review: I have had my Chase checking account for close to four years now. I have always found them amazingly helpful on all fronts. I make an hour and a half drive to continue to use them where I currently live. I've rarely had a problem with my account and the few times I did, I had quick resolution by someone friendly. The local Washington State branch would call and check up on how things were going with the account. I have few good experiences with banks, but Chase has been amazing and had low fee checking for someone with poor credit.

name: Josh Heckroth
review: I am relatively new to the chase freedom card, but I have been very pleased with the card after one year. The points are easy to accumulate and easy to spend. Unlike other cards it seems like the rewards are achievable under normal spending circumstances. My wife and I seem to have enough for about $50 worth of gift cards every month or two and the selection of places for gift cards is huge. Also their fraud monitoring is amazing. They called us after the account was charged in another state and by the next day we had a new card and absolutely no hassle in overturning the fraudulent charges.

name: Julie Samples
review: I have had both my personal checking and savings accounts with Chase bank since 2009. I absolutely love them. They make banking so much easier compared with any other bank I've had to deal with in the past. Their ATMs are great and allow you to deposit money without even going into the bank! When I do go inside the bank everyone is always very helpful and I've never encountered nothing but a great attitude from anyone. I also love to use the online banking and the app they have for your smartphone. It is great to be able to check your bank account balance and see what the last transactions were from anywhere in the world!

name: Michael Lamb
review: I have been using Chase Ink for a number of years now and I have got to say it is one of the best deals out there. Not only do you get the sign up bonus of a couple hundred bucks, but since I use a cell phone a lot (and the bill can get huge at times) Ink makes that more affordable by rebating 5% of the total cellphone bill. Got to love that! Customer service is also fantastic. If I have any sort of issue it takes only one call to deal with the problem. Very nice people to work with! Do get this card.

name: Josh Heckroth
review: We have had a Chase business account and a personal checking account for 9 years (originally with Washington Mutual). They have always been very diligent in customer service without being pushy. I was also very impressed with their fraud monitoring. Last year we signed up for a credit card that they offer and twice they have notified us about fraudulent charges and took care of the charges for us so that there were no headaches or extra work on our account. Their online banking is very intuitive and offers everything that I personally need from a bank. I would highly recommend Chase for banking needs.

name: Deborah Domer
review: I have a Chase checking account.  Attached to my checking account is a debit card, which I use often.  This debit card is processed through MasterCard.  I have often heard that it might be better to use a credit card than a debit card.  I would appreciate it if you would provide a list of pros and cons for the use of a credit card as opposed to continuing the use of my debit card, other than the obvious affect that using a credit card has on my over all credit rating with the three major credit reporting agencies.  Thank you very much.

name: Shelley Dyk
review: NO CREDIT UGH

name: Zella Petaccio
review: I've had my Chase freedom card for about five years now, and I've always been so pleased with it.  For me, an important part of banking is ensuring that I can do my banking from the comfort of my home, and Chase has a useful app (available on both iOS and android) that lets you pay bills, pay off your credit card, and even deposit checks. I rarely actually have to step inside a physical Chase location, but when I do, the staff has always been friendly and helpful. The big draw to the Freedom card though is Chase's point reward system. I use my credit card so often simply because of it. Normally, the rate of earning points is fairly low--something like 1 point earned per each $10 purchase (with 2000 earned points equaling $20). However, each quarter of the year, you can activate a special 5% back reward on various types of purchases (gas stations and movie theaters, for example), which Chase selects depending on the season. You can also use Chase's "Ultimate Rewards Mall" online to earn additional points while shopping online--so it's a great bank if you like to do most of your shopping from home. You can spend your earned points in various ways--you can pay yourself back (ie. Chase will literally deposit the amount earned back into your account), purchase gift cards from various stores, or use the points to make a donation to a worthwhile charity.Of course, there is so much more to say about Chase -- like it's great protection services (eg. customizable alerts about money being withdrawn from your account or spent at stores, overdraft options, etc.) -- but these digital features plus the amount of money that can be made back from the rewards really make this bank stand out for me. Given my overall positive experience using my Chase Freedom card, I don't think I'd ever want to use a different credit card.

name: Tara Sloan
review: This card is my absolute favorite! I am usually weary of opening new credit cards but this one is a must! There is only a $69 annual fee but it is worth it if you include the free flights from southwest! I used my points on this card to book a flight to Disneyland with my sister and even used the points on the hotel! I also love the fact that I can get more points with my regular purchases. Southwest is initially one of my favorite airlines due to the value and quality of service. I think that this card is excellent for college students who want a free flight home on break.

name: Skye Leigh-Kernia Belizaire
review: To me Chase is one of the best banks out there. Even though I was not fortunate enough to open a new account with the $125.00 offer, I would still say this is one of the best banks I have ever had an account with. You are able to go online and view your bank statements, the amount of money you have on your account, pay bills, and request customer support if needed. You are also alerted via text, call, and email if they detect fraud on your account, if money over the amount you would regularly spend was taken out. For example, let’s say you set your spending limit on your alerts up to $100.00. If more than that was deducted from your account they would contact you to have you either confirm the transaction or deny it in order to resolve the issue. You can also set up high school and college checking accounts for kids or a sibling and teach them a bit about responsibility (you can go online, and see how much they have been spending, and limit it too). All in all, Chase is a great bank to have an account with so I would recommend it.

name: Roark Fisher
review: I got my Chase Disney card in 2003 but am getting rid of it now.  I got it to earn points to spend towards a Disneyland trip for my family.  I spend about $2500/month on the card.  After 4 years I was able to afford City Passes for my family of 5.  I decided to save up again and hoped to get a hotel reservation this time.  However, after weeks of looking through hotels I have found that I can get a better deal if I don't use my Disney Visa.  I get charged full price for anything I purchase with my points while I can get significant discounts if I use an agent or call the hotels directly.  I have found that I have a lot more choice on what I want to do (and can do it for a lower overall cost) if I just use a cash rewards Visa.  I have changed to a cash rewards visa and am only making a few purchases on the Disney Visa to keep it active until I use the points to purchase my park passes.  I am much happier with the cash rewards visa.  Also, Disney has started putting a big push towards its Premier Disney Visa and I am getting tired of the constant mailings about upgrading.

name: Matt Whitesides
review: When I first got my Chase Slate credit card, I have to admit I was expecting just a no frills, nothing fancy card that wouldn't have many bells and whistles added to it as time went by. How I was totally wrong! After not more than a year of owning and using the card, Chase introduced several new features to help with automatic bill pay, as well as BLUE to help keep my interest rates in check. Color me surprised. After a couple years of keeping it paid off and keeping the balances down, they raised my spending limit automatically. I did not even have to call them! Overall I just did not expect this level of quality service. I am very thankful that I found out about this card when I did, and I have no doubt I will be a customer for many years to come.

name: Amy
review: I've always been satisfied using Chase bank. For me, an important part of banking is ensuring that I can do my banking from the comfort of my home. Chase has many digital features that make banking easier. For instance, using the Chase app (available on both iOS and Android), you can do a lot of your banking from your phone even--paying bills, paying off your credit card, and even depositing checks. Yes, you can deposit checks right from your phone! I rarely actually have to step inside a physical Chase location, but when I do, the staff has always been friendly and helpful. Chase also has pretty decent customer service. I believed I had some issues with credit card fraud, so they promptly took action, canceled my card, and sent me a new one that arrived in under 48 hours. Additionally, they helped make sure that my funds weren't lost. Aside from the ease of digital banking, one of my favorite Chase features though has to be the points I earn by using my Debit card as a Credit card and just using my regular credit card. Normally, the rate of earning points is fairly low--something like 1 point earned per each $10 purchase (with 2000 earned points equaling $20). However, each quarter of the year, you can activate a special 5% back reward on various types of purchases (gas stations and movie theaters, for example), which Chase selects depending on the season. You can also use Chase's "Ultimate Rewards Mall" online to earn additional points while shopping online--so it's a great bank if you like to do most of your shopping from home. These points can add up and be spent in various ways--you can pay yourself back (ie. Chase will literally deposit the amount earned back into your account), purchase gift cards from various stores, or use the points to make a donation to a worthwhile charity.Of course, there is so much more to say about Chase, such as its great protection services (eg. customizable alerts about money being withdrawn from your account or spent at stores, overdraft options, etc.) or how they always provide clear communication about updates to policies via the website's secure messaging system. However, these digital features plus the amount of money that can be made back from the rewards really make this bank stand out for me. Given my overall positive experience with Chase, I don't think I'd ever want to switch.

name: Carol Bieniek
review: I really like using Chase and I feel that the Chase freedom card is well worth the money.  The fact that there is a 100$ bonus is the reason that I chose this card.  They basically give you 100$, no questions asked.  Other major credit card companies usually only give you cash back if you buy alot of gas or food.  This one at least makes sure that you are satisfied by immediately giving you your money back.  I have told my family about this card during the holidays and they seemed to agree that this card is well worth the money.

name: Ty Bennewitz
review: I generally like to stick with Visa credit cards.  They are guaranteed to be accepted everywhere.  I have never had any trouble with this card.  The $100 bonus is a nice perk that is easy to get if you use the card for everyday purchases and pay the balance off at the end of the month.  Plus getting 5% back on certain categories is always a nice perk too.  I have used other Chase cards and have never had an issue with the backing bank.  I would definitely recommend this card to anyone that is in the market for a new card.

name: Margherita Schmucker
review: We have used the Chase sapphire credit card for a couple of years now and it has worked out fantastic for us. The customer care is very efficient and any problems are dealt with immediately. We lost the card a few months back and we received a replacement in just one day which was absolutely fabulous. The day we lost it, we found that somebody had already swiped $200 off the card even before we reported it. The bank was very considerate and decided to waiver the amount away as they knew our case was genuine. The card also does not charge us a huge amount when we transfer money to our country which is a bonus. We absolutely love this card and wish to use it for many years to come.

name: joe dowling
review: I have used Chase in the past and really had a great experience. I always received my statements on time, never had any trouble getting a hold of customer service and always had a wonderful experience with the tellers. I started a savings account there for my son when he was born and he still has it to this day. Sadly, I have moved and had to switch banks since the closest Chase bank to my new home was over 30 miles away and it just wasn't convenient anymore. I have nothing but great things to say about Chase and if they ever put one in my city, I will happily join them again.

name: Estella Scaff
review: The perks are good but be careful.  This card is just ok for me. The interest rate is relatively high and you must read the fine print. I have used for quite some time.  My advice is stay on top of it pay on time.  I once missed a payment in error and not only did I get charged a fee which is understandable, but my interest rate went up.  Ouch. Monthly payments could be subject to going up as well, its based on APR I was told. Other than that it's like any other typical card,  easy to use, accepted widely and has a few good perks. I have redeemed points and it works fine.  The website is easy to navigate and you can seamlessly pay online. Just pay careful attention to dates and rules of this card and you should be ok.

name: Walnut Bee
review: Chase is a wonderful company to bank with no matter who you are and what you do. I go inside the branch often and there is always a variety of different types of people that appear in the bank and they are all satisfied. I've been with Chase for a couple years now, and all of my payments have been on time since I've switched with them. A couple weeks ago, I was late on my very first payment, and since this was the first time, I kind of panicked. I called the branch and asked them would this affect my credit, and since they said I had a good history and that I called the same day, that it would be solved and my credit wouldn't be affected. I really love the service that Chase provides me with.

name: Jason Fontaine
review: I love the amazon.com card. I initally signed up for the $30.00 instant credit upon approval. I filled out the short application, and had my amazon.com credit ready to use within minutes! What a grea sign-on bonus. I do not use credit much anymore, but will definately use this as my card of choice. I use amazon.com for a large percentage of my non-food shopping, and the points I accumulate plus the free shipping makes it a real deal! I can earn points with gas and food purchases, and I get even more points when I use the card to buy things on amazon.com. Great rewards card for useable things that we all need with no blackouts or restrictions to worry about! Get one!
