name: Carmela Monhollen
review: My experiences with using the Chase Liquid card have been okay. It's a little weird to me that I cannot use this card to pay my bills online (I can do that with my other cards why not this one?). Though it does have a somewhat low monthly fee (positive), and the minimum deposit is around $25 (that’s good). But can also close your account after three months if it thinks that the information you gave them is bad (negative). I am inbetween cancelling this card or just giving it one last chance to secure itself back to my good side, because it does have some potential.

name: Deborah Domer
review: I had been a customer for years with Washington Mutual Bank in the Portland OR area where I held a savings and 2 checking accounts. Several years ago they were bought out by Chase. For approximately a year, there seemed to be no difference in the terms of service. Then I began receiving information in the mail about new fees, etc. My original checking accounts were no fee accounts with no minimum balance requirements. When I received notice that Chase would be charging a $10 fee for my accounts, I went into the local branch to close one of the accounts. I was told by the representative that I could be “grandfathered in” and would never be required to pay the fee for accounts holding under the minimum balance, so I was convinced to retain all my accounts with Chase since they were agreeing to keep my terms as originally agreed. After a period of time (I don't recall whether it was 6 months or a year later) I began seeing service fees posted on my bank statement. When I contacted Chase, I was told it was an error and they removed the fees. Then a bit later, it occurred again. This time I was told that the fees would be applied and that they were revoking their original stance that I was “grandfathered in.” I reluctantly accepted this, since it was explained that they are a very large bank and must adhere to their standard policies. I simply closed 1 account and have continued to swallow the $10 fee. However, I also noted that they were charging an overdraft fee if a deposit and a withdrawal were made on the same day. They began holding off posting the deposit until the day's end, after all debits had been posted. They have since ceased this practice after a class action lawsuit was brought against them.I still have accounts with Chase because I have been traveling a great deal. However, I am planning to change my accounts to another bank soon, not only because of the above issues, but also because I am finding that there are several large cities like Baltimore and Buffalo, where there are no banking branches, which creates a great inconvenience to me when I need to make a cash deposit. Overall, I would rate this bank as more of a big money bank and not equipped to serve the middle class. In fairness, I have not used them for loans or mortgages.

name: CW Hilton
review: I have a had very positive experience with my Chase Sapphire Preferred card. The bonus of up to 40,000 Ultimate Reward points is quite good, but I was not able to meet the minimum spend required to gain. The points are worth 40,000 miles or $400 cash via check. The minium spend was $3000 in the first three months of having the card. Other aspects have been quite good. The Ultimate Rewards points have accrued nicely. I had earned points on many items via the Ultimate Rewards mall. I have used this card in Asia, the UK, and the Middle East without issues. The lack of currency fees is a big plus for a traveller. Overall I highly recommend this card.

name: Cassie Walters
review: My Chase Freedom card is my go-to card. I have had it for over five years and I use it for everything. I mean everything! I won't even try another card.  I love it because I get cash back on my purchases which I use in turn to pay on my bill, so it's like free money! I have never had any problems with this card and always have good service when I use customer service.  The interest rate might be a little higher on this card, but that doesn't affect me since I pay it off every month.  Do you know what that means?  They are paying me (points), to use their card!  How amazing is that?

name: Akilah-ma Love
review: I suggest for anyone and everyone that is thinking about getting one of these beautiful laced liquid cards don't do it. Read all the comments regarding this card! JUST READ EVERYTHING!

name: Nakaji Mitchell
review: Thank You!! I got my little sister the "Blue Bird" Card (NO MONTHLY CHARGES, PAYBILLS, ATM WITHDRAWALS, DIRECT DEPOSITS & WITH CHECK PHONE APP, DISCOUNTS ON TICKETS, THEN GET THIS THEY PROVIDE FREE ROADSIDE ASSISTANCE) and its great but she runs into problems. This card has a American Express logo and has limitation sometimes. Reading all of the above comments made me chose not to get this "Chase Liquor" Card. I agree with Ms. Zskyla what's the purpose if you cant use it online. This is 2013 HELLO!!! I'll just stick there for her.

name: Tara Mills
review:
really lol I love it no issue here !
akilah lol

name: Antonio Reyes
review: i hav so far no probz either so far with chase liquid, and i also like tara, the western union,i hear no  prob, as i am too with both.

name: Akilah-ma Love
review: I had a Chase Liquid acct for abt 3 mos. They closed it stating I gave them the wrong information. How could I possibly do that when I use to have a checking acct. with them for 3yrs or so about a year ago. When I applied for this card they used the same exact information from my previous acct. they still had in their system. It doesn't make sense...I' happy to hear that both you Antonio and Tara are doing good with your accts.

name: Amy Sullivan
review: This card is the BIGGEST SCAM ever! I have so many points with them and they will never be able to get used. There is always some excuse! This time they say there is no room for a Mileage Plus person on that day. Well I just made my real reservation with cash and there seemed to be plenty of room! I would recommend staying  clear of this company/card, go for the cash back on American Express. You can't go wrong with cash!

name: Leonarda Pigford
review: I have had my Chase Sapphire card for many years now. What keeps me using the card is the fantastic rate I get. I really love this card. The company is very easy to deal with. There phone systems are also very easy to navigate. I had some fraudulent charges on my card last year and they cleared them up right away. I barely had to do anything they took care of it all. They made sure that the charges did not affect my credit score. I would recommend this card to anyone who needs a good credit card to rely on.

name: Nancey Ferkel
review: I love everything about this card. I primarily use it for gas since I travel a lot for my job. It's accepted everywhere and have never had an issue with it. The points you earn are amazing and can be used for really good stuff, not just garbage like a lot of the other cards. My credit was a little low so I pay a higher interest rate, but that will change as my credit is repaired. Any time I have had to call customer service they are always friendly and willing to answer any questions. Not to mention they are still one of the few to offer a cash bonus with purchases made in your first three months.

name: Joshua Scazzero
review: My wife and I recently go this credit card 6 months ago and my wife especially loves this card.  She has an $8,000 credit limit on it.  We also got the 40,000 point bonus that came with getting the card which gave us two free flights in the U.S.  We use this card every time we book flights or hotels because we get 2 points for every dollar on these purchases and the points rack up quick!  The website to book the flights or hotels is okay at best, it is a bit frustrating because there is never an option for us to use our government discount when you try to book on their site.   Another thing we absolutely love about this card is that there are no foreign transaction fees! This is huge because we got travel a lot and frequently purchase items with our credit card in other countries and its nice peace of mind knowing we aren't getting slapped with a foreign transaction fee every time we buy something.  We also love the solid weight of the card as well, it makes us feel special.

name: Bradley Ruoff
review: First off, Chase is a great bank. Second, I know a lot of you probably see big lines at the Bank of America ATM and you are thinking, “Wow a lot of people bank at Bank of America, it must be good”. Well I'm sure Bank of America has its perks, however, one thing I can say is that I had an account with them for a month or so and the ATM was very slow. The software is very slow and not responsive, thus the long lines at the ATM. You never see a long line at the Chase ATM because the software is quick, responsive, and you are getting your cash, depositing your checks, or whatever it is that you need to do, you are doing it more quickly than everyone else around you. I know people will say that Chase has a lot of fees, and that may be true there are fees for certain things, however, I just think that everything is so convenient with Chase that I am willing to pay a little more for things. They don't offer free checking unless you're a college student or maintain a minimum balance, which for me personally isn't a problem but for others it may be. Their online banking is superb, you can use Chase Quickpay to transfer money for free (the other person doesn't even have to be a Chase customer). Their software is fast, the customer service is friendly and helpful. Not to mention the Chase Freedom is one of the best credit cards out there. Honestly I can't say enough good things about Chase.

name: Jason Kidd
review: I use Chase and its online Checking option. I really like the interface and it is easy to navigate. It is very user friendly and it displays my balance at all times. On top of this I also like the fact that I can trade money throughout my accounts. This means that I can have more than one checking and savings account. I really like this and think that it’s better than some banks that don't allow this option. Chase also makes sure to call me whenever they feel that someone put a false charge on my credit card. Even though it can get annoying times I still really like that they go out of their way to call me. I would say that Chase is a great bank, and I haven’t had any problems with them yet.

name: Geoffrey Schop
review: I have had this card for a little over two years now. It is by far the best credit card I have ever owned. I have redeemed points and earned points in almost every fashion that they offer without  having any issues or hiccups. I've redeemed points for items offered through Chase's website, received those items promptly and exactly as described. I have also redeemed points straight into my Chase checking account and that transaction went through by the next business day. You can also redeem points for gift cards. Sometimes these cards can be lower than 1 to 1 (ex. redeem 900 points for a 10 dollar gift card).   Everything you purchase through this card you will at least earn 1% cash back. They also offer 5% on a variety of things every quarter. These aren't garbage offers either. During the summer it was gas stations and travel. During 2013 they will gas stations twice (1st and 3rd quarter) and during the last quarter amazon.com. You can also earn extra points by shopping through their ultimate rewards website. I bought an iPad through the apple store, earned extra points. This website easy to navigate and I've never had any trouble.The only thing that might not work for some people is the interest rate, mine is 9.99%. However, I pay my card off in full every month, so it doesn't effect me at all.

name: Denise Sutherland
review: We banked at Washington Mutual and absolutely loved them. Then, Chase took over. Our favorite tellers were moved, which was sad but understandable, as merging companies sometimes requires people to be moved around. But, the new people were not as helpful. When we closed one of our accounts it took many days to close, and we encountered added fees. They then allowed a withdrawal from our only opened account that we had not authorized, which resulted in some overdraft fees. The withdrawal was eventually reversed, after several long and heated phone conversations, as the branch manager was of no help. However, they still expected us to pay the fees. Needless to say, we no longer bank with Chase.

name: Debrah Gutt
review: I can't really say enough good things about this credit card.  As long as you use it responsibly you can really add up the money you earn very quickly.  There are 5% cash back categories rotating every 3 months but half the time those categories are gas, which is great especially if you drive around a lot like I do.  Also the other half of the time you get great categories like Amazon.com or restaurants, so if you eat out a lot or shop online this is a great card as well!  The only limitation is that the 5% bonus only stacks up for the first $1500 spent per 3 month period.  However, don't forget you get 1% cash back everywhere else which is unlimited!  This is not like other points where the value of a point isn't equivalent to 1 cent.  You can straight cash out points for CASH!  100 points is 1 dollar.  No catches, no gimmicks, straight cash.  Also if you're a Chase checking customer you get a bonus 10 points for every purchase (big or small!)  So if you get a small coffee for 70 cents you just earned OVER %10 cashback (around %15 to be exact).  In fact on any purchase under 5 dollars you will always earn at least 3% cash back as a Chase checking customer.  Also as a signup bonus you can get anywhere from $100-200 dollars just look for good offers online.  I would highly recommend this card to anyone as long as you are responsible!

name: Ian Walsh
review: I very rarely use this credit card but when I do I have no problems with it. It is simple to use and I have never reached a limit. This year only a few weeks ago I used this card to put over 400 dollars in one day for Christmas shopping and had no problems. If it wasn't 400 it was at least 300! I paid it off pretty easily paying the minimum. I believe it took me about 20 weeks to pay it off but if you keep on your payments you shouldn't have any trouble. The rates on this card are very good too, my mother was the one who recommended it because she loves it!

name: Sarah Turner
review: I've been checking with Chase for about six months now, and I couldn't be happier. To begin with, they offer you $125 (variable – sometimes more or less) to sign up with them for a checking account. While this was a nice perk, I switched banks because I was unhappy with my prior bank, as well as for ease of access in managing funds with my fiance, who had had Chase for several years and was quite happy with them. Our accounts had the option to be linked, which was fantastic. I can see his checking balance online, he can see mine, although we both have separate accounts and debit cards. This allows us to have our own funds, manage our own money, while still having the benefits of a shared checking – we can transfer funds easily between accounts when needed.When you have overdrafts or missed payments with Chase, they have a policy where they will refund a certain number of those fees every year; for me, at least, it's $100. That is so convenient whenever one of us writes a check and forgets to tell the other. Moreover, you have 24 hours to correct a negative account as well. Overall, it's a fantastic bank for someone who's poor, or careless, or in college. Customer service has been pretty great as well, although I'm much less concerned with that than with the bank's actual policies. Calling them has been helpful and quick, and the bank tellers near me made sure to learn our names, and greet us, remembering things about us e.g. “how's the wedding planning...” Very personalized.

name: jason buonomo
review: This is easily one of the best, if not the best credit card I have ever owned.  The cash back options are awesome!  I like to use my card for gasoline purchase, and with all the driving I do, the 5% cash back adds up rather quickly.  I have accumulated quite a bit of swag over the past two years redeeming my points, and my interest rate is a little bit below average compared to most cards for my credit rating which is actually a bit spotty due to the housing bubble.  Their website is also easy to navigate, and setting up payment alerts to go to your email inbox is a breeze.  Great card!

name: Rob Mak
review: The Chase Freedom card is my go-to credit card for 90 percent of all my purchases. It is a fantastic rewards card that allows you to accrue points every time you use the card, and redeem those points for items, gift cards, or even cash. I’ve never had any issue redeeming the points, which I typically redeem to help pay for the following month’s bill. Such a great idea! I also like that with the Chase Freedom card you can redeem the points for cash at any time. I have another rewards card that can only be redeemed in increments of $50. Another cool feature of this card is that every 3 months there is a new category of merchants where you can earn 5% instead of the usual 1% on purchases. I highly recommend this card.

name: Walnut Bee
review: I travel a lot due to family and just the overall thrill of going to new places. I'm not really that old and I haven't really been flying for a long time so I actually looked up any way that could help me fly more for cheap and give me a better overall experience as a flyer. That's when I stumbled across this card, I get awarded and get great perks just for doing what I know I will be doing a lot of. The perks and rewards aren't just from buying airline tickets but also for any purchase that I make, which is pretty cool. They have low rates, and the yearly fee is kind of a lot to me, but I truly believe that what you pay is still not enough for what you get. I really love this card.

name: John Davis
review: Considering I live in Atlanta which is a hub city for Airtran, and my parents live in Charlotte, it was only natural for me to get the Airtran Rewards Card.  I fly home atleast 5 times a month to visit my family and the rewards I receive using this card for everyday purchases and shopping add up quickly.  The introductory offer is a nice bonus to the sign on and the interest rates are acceptable to me considering the perks I get using this airline on a regular basis.  Their online services are top notch, and any time I've had to deal with customer service, I have had positive experiences.  If you have the option to fly with Airtran often, then this is a great card to pick up!

name: Kristin Lawson
review: I have been extremely happy with the credit experience I have had with this card. The only problem I have had was a security breech at my place of work where I had to cancel my card and apply for a new one. The people I talked to were extremely helpful and discreet with my information and helped me get a new card almost immediately. I have never had any other problems with it.  I would recommend this car to someone who needs reliable costumer service along with reliable banking. I will be sticking with Chase Blue Sapphire card for a long time!

name: steve wright
review: To start off, I used to bank at BB&T down the street. This ended when they started charging me fees for anything and everything they could think of. Needless to say the fees killed me and I had to close the account and move onto a better bank. Chase was a shining light at the end of the tunnel that offered me an answer of a better bank. At first, I loved Chase. Easy to get along with, nice people, convenient location, etc. When I used to go out of town sometimes I'd have trouble finding a BB&T ATM. This was a problem of the past with Chase. Everywhere I went I was sure to find a Chase ATM so that I could avoid any pesky surcharges. Alas, the good times could not last. I recently graduated school with my Master's degree in Civil Engineering and since then Chase has been crushing what little money I have left in my bank account. I've had this account for six years and never have they charged me any type of fees. I was astounded to see that they were taking $6 out of my account every month because 1) I had no job so I had no direct deposit; and 2) I did not have at least $5,000 sitting in my checking account at all times. This didn't make any sense to me. In college I barely ever had more than $100 in my account and most of school I never held a job for any sort of direct deposit to be an issue. After weeks of emails, Chase finally responds to me and tells me of these two specific guidelines and that after five years of college they start to take effect. Ok. I was in school for six years though. Why did you give me an extra year? That was a mistake they said. That shouldn't have happened. So, as the months of unemployment raged on, my bank account became less and less saturated with cash and savings due to the fees. This month I am now -$0.87 in the hole. I have kept all the money I've earned and saved from odd jobs in a cup next to my bed because I can't risk Chase taking any more of it. Yesterday, I was informed that my account has been closed and I have a week to pay them their $0.87.I am much more disappointed and upset than I am angry. The shining white knight I once believed Chase to be has faded into obscurity. I am left now with a greedy money hungry bank that has taken every penny I had (little as it was) and has now closed my account because they are not getting compensated anymore while I wait for a job to come through.

name: Nicholle Scarbro
review: This is my first and favorite credit card.  The cash back options are my favorite part.  Every 3 months, new categories are added which give owners a bonus 5% on items purchased in those categories.  I drive a lot for work and when I am getting 5% cash back on gasoline, it is a HUGE deal.  I was actually able to use my points, this past year, to buy a brand new TV.  The website for the card is also extremely easy to use, I have never had a problem in accessing the site or requesting my cash back rewards.  Chase has also an excellent customer service department.  One time I was erroneously getting charged for credit protection, not only did Chase cancel it right away, but they also refunded me the months that it was charged for. I could not be happier with the service.

name: Jessica Voight
review: I have been with Chase Bank for 15 years and I have had nothing but a positive experience with them. We currently have checking, savings, a 529 college savings plans, and a car loan with Chase. They are always helpful and quick to solve any issues that may arise. I have always been pleased with the services they provide and have recommended Chase to several friends and family members without hesitation. My friends and family that have switched to Chase have been equally satisfied with their services. Chase ensures I have quick access to my money and allows me to do most of my banking online. With online bill pay, I am able to schedule all my payments and have confidence that they will be paid on time and accurately.

name: Sean Akers
review: A great card to use, but be careful with the credit card. This wasn't my first credit card, I had previously got one through Amazon, but I had regretted that one. This one is very simple to use and there are no hidden fees. I rarely ever use credit cards because you should never buy things you don't have the money to pay for unless it is an emergency. The interest rate is rather decent, not being too high or too low. Just remember to keep it paid off, because being in debt is no fun. I’ve been in debt before it is not a good place to be.

name: Kate
review: I have had quite a few different credit cards. Mostly I have relied on my bank's reward card.  Recently I decided to try the Southwest Rapid Reward card. I was impressed with the easy application and approval process. I was also impressed with the immediate credit to my southwest account of my free flight miles.  (After an initial purchase).  I have already booked and confirmed my two free flights.  I plan to use this card as my primary card in order to earn additional bonus miles.  I have heard many great things about the potential to earn miles with this card above all others and did my research before signing up.  I only have one major issue with the card so far: I do not like having to pay an annual fee.  I have never payed an annual fee before and I want to be sure that it is ultimately worth my time to use this card to balance out this fee.  I have heard that the card issues a sign-up birthday bonus.  I have not had the card a year yet to verify that.  So far I am pleased with the card benefits.

name: Lynnette Stubblefield
review: This Slate card is now the third card that I have opened with Chase Bank. I finally gave in last time I visited my local branch and applied for the card. They asked me every single time I went it, and let me know that I was pre-approved when I was in. They informed me that the Slate card had a 15 month 0% APR introductory rate, which I found fitting to use right in time for the holidays. I was approved for an 11.99% rate afterwords as well, which is definitely the lowest APR our of my other cards. I've been using the card with no issues and it appeared easily on my online account access. Payments are easy to make, the card has great terms, and it looks cool too! Overall, I'm happy with the card and recommend it to anyone looking to pay off large purchases with a low (to no) rate.

name: Razors Dripblood
review: I switched over to Chase from Bank of America because Chase was running a deal where you got fifty dollars if you opened an account with them. Seeing as I was frustrated with the fact that there were no Bank of America branches near my home, I saw no reason not to make the switch. I received my fifty dollars no problem and ever since then I've had no problems at all with Chase Bank. The branch near my home is always clean, the lines are never long, and I've never had any problems with their customer service. I'm no banking expert or anything but I'd recommend Chase Bank to my friends and family.

name: Shirley Seibert
review: Recently I decided to get a new credit card, and I found that Chase offered a competitive rate.  I was offered a rate of 13.25% with a credit limit of $15,000.00.  Considering that I have filed bankruptcy within the last 5 years I was excited at an opportunity to reestablish my credit score while paying only a moderate rate on the card.  This card offers many features that fill my specific needs as a consumer.  I love the option to earn rewards, and have several other offers throughout the year.  I plan to have this card as my primary source of credit line for the extended future.

name: Russell
review: I was a customer of Fifth Third Bank when I got an offer in the mail from Chase Bank to open a new checking account and receive $100 when you have at least one direct deposit per month. I thought to myself, who couldn't use an extra $100. So I went to the nearest Chase branch which was pretty close. I did not have to go far. I opened a checking account with the offer. My direct deposit is a Social Security deposit so I qualified for the offer and the checking account was free. There were no monthly fees. Plus while finishing the application, the branch account person who was doing the work for me, contacted Social Security and sent the information needed to have my direct deposit sent to my new Chase checking account. So I did not need to contact SSA myself. I am very happy with the bank. They have ATMs at convenient locations so I don't need to go far to get some cash. I will be a long term customer with Chase.

name: Rosalva Giorgianni
review: I was pretty nervous about getting a credit card, to be honest. I'm not really big into them, but they seem like a necessary evil these days, seeing as you need to have a good credit score in order to apply for loans if you want to buy a house or car, etc etc. However, I was surprised how comfortable Chase made me feel when getting this card. I didn't feel like I was being strapped directly into a long term commitment; there are no annual fees which is great for someone like me who rarely uses a credit car to begin with. I also like the cash back option, especially because you get 5% back on various rotating things like gas or groceries (which I already have to buy, so why not save some extra money?) I think that all things considered, the freedom card is a pretty okay credit card if you have to have one, and as long as you keep it paid off, you really won't have any problems. Chase is very straight forward and they don't try to sneak around and scam you with hidden charges. My biggest complaint is not with Chase, but with credit cards in general: a lot of places make you feel like you really have to use credit cards, rather than cash or debit cards, which can get people in a lot of trouble.

name: Alex Reynolds
review: I’ve been with Chase for about five years now, and they’ve been wonderful. It’s great having so many locations; I can always get cash if I need it. Recently, my wallet was stolen, and not only did the agent sympathize with my situation, but he was able to get my account closed, and a new one open, within 30 minutes. I was able to use the ATM in that same branch before I left with my new card. The agent even called me a few days later just to make sure everything was working out right. Definitely a fan of the customer service I’ve received through Chase.

name: Lisha Neyhart
review: I applied for the Chase Slate card this past summer. To take advantage of the introductory 0% rate on balance transfers and purchases, I immediately transferred any balance I had on other cards to the Chase Slate. I then used the Chase Slate exclusively for purchases until I reached my limit. This allowed me to clear out all my other credit card debt and save quite a bit of money on interest payments. Now I make a monthly payment to the Chase Slate card. Each month I pay the same amount in order to have the card paid off completely before the introductory period ends and the interest rate raises. My other credit cards have a lower APR than the Chase Slate will have after the introductory period ends. Due to this, it is not a good card in the long run. However, it is serving a great purpose right now.

name: Jenn McCormick
review: I've used my Amazon.com credit card for probably 5 years and love it! The low interest rates are definitely a plus and keeps me coming back. I also like the transfer offers that are offered several times a year. I have transferred several balances to my card with zero interest for over 2 years. I also enjoy the paybacks I receive through Amazon for using this card. Rewards build up fast if you use your card regularly and you can just put it towards an online purchase. I love seeing my discounts pop up when I wasn't expecting them! I'd recommend this card to anyone!

name: Retta Engles
review: I recently opened an account with Chase. I also enrolled in their Chase Freedom Visa credit card. This card is a great one to have, and is a perfect example of the prime services and products Chase offers. There are many different benefits to owning one of these credit cards. One great benefit is that there is no annual fee. That means you don't have to worry about paying every year for something you may seldom use. There is also zero percent interest for the first fifteen months of owning the credit card. Also, you are eligible to receive one hundred dollars in cash back once you spend a total of five hundred dollars or more. They also offer great customer service. I had a problem with a transaction going through, and they were very helpful.

name: Jordan Selin
review: I have just recently within the last year received this card and I decided to get one because my wife has had it for a while and has had nothing but good things to say about it.  I used the low balance transfer percentage when I first applied and that alone has saved me so much money coming from a higher percentage card the balance was previously on and allowed me to pay the balance down much quicker.  I have also found the customer service to be outstanding I made a call because there was a purchase I was curious about and during the call the representative I was dealing with noticed that I also have a mortgage with Chase and while I was on the call not only did he take care of the charge that was in question but also managed to reduce my cards interest rate byt 1.5 percent because I have my mortgage with them.  I was completely surprised by this honesty and amazing customer service to go above and beyond for me.  I have had many credit cards and dealt with many reps in the past and I never recall a customer service rep just randomly finding out that he can reduce my interest rate, This was an experience I share with others and will keep me a Chase customer for years to come.

name: Troy Hurlburt
review: Chase is an exceptionally good bank. I prefer them over other bank firms for many various reasons. One reason is that they do not require a minimum balance. This means you can have any balance and do not have to worry about fees. They also do not have a monthly fee, which is very nice. The application process is very easy to complete. It does not take long to create an account with Chase. Also they have extremely convenient online banking. You can access your accounts, make transfers and even pay bills all online, and in an easy to navigate format. I would recommend this bank to anyone who is looking for a cheap and easy way to manage their finances.

name: Michelle Lynn
review: I always fly on Southwest or Airtran because they have the best rates, so this card is perfect for me. I travel for business and pleasure, and I get to pay with my own card and get paid back from my employer so it is a win win using my card. The rates are low and the yearly fee isn't bad for what you get. It is great to get rewarded for things I do already. I have gotten quite a few free flights so far, and hope to keep earning more! It's nice you get rewards for all purchases, not just airline tickets.

name: William Warf
review: The features and the monthly fee for this card is great, but certain Chase branches will run you through ChexSystems.  Some branches will not.  I'd keep this card open for at least 3 months and make free cash or check deposits at a Chase branches or ATMs.  The reason I say this is because Chase may close your card (stupid, I know) after three to four months and say "the information you gave us is bad".  If they don't close your card, then you can switch to direct deposit for this card.Free loading at Chase ATMs and branches, along with free withdrawals make this a better card than most.

name: Tara Mills
review:
omg seriously?CHEX "horror systems i didn't yet experience such invasion"so far for almost a long six months no prob.but i m favorable more to a GREAT WESTERN UNION GOLD mastercard/debit  and or the visa one,or check on i also got W.UNION MONEYWISE so great.
fair fee,per month
even upload money transfer if i have one.etc.
just a great card NO Fret about chex horror system.

name: WalletHub
review: While it is true that you can be rejected for the Liquid card and that you can have your card closed, that only happens in a very small number of cases.

name: Courtney Allen
review: Overall, customer service at Chase has been excellent. I was abroad in Asia about to withdraw money from an ATM when the machine malfunctioned and shut off. Fortunately, I was able to get my card back. Unfortunately, I immediately checked my balance online and I had been charged without receiving the money. I then called Chase customer service to explain the situation. They understood completely and refunded me the amount while I was on the phone. Other times I have called customer service have been fine; my only complaint is they sometimes sound irritated and or robotic on the phone. When I go inside the branch, everyone is very polite and friendly.

name: Tyler Hess
review: My wife and I needed a new car as an emergency when our other car ran over an orange cone in the middle of the freeway. We walked in on a Saturday morning and we were able to get a car loan approved within an hour. The loan officer was a really nice young man who helped us get approved for more than we needed. We found a car we liked later that evening and we were able to get the loan processed on Monday without any problems. We just signed the paperwork over the course of another hour or so and we were all finished!

name: Casey Terp
review: Overall, I think I am pretty happy with this card. I got it mostly because I do a good deal of shopping on Amazon.com (I have Amazon Prime, so it makes it super easy). The points are rewarded depending on what you use the card for. 3 points for Amazon purchases, 2 points for restaurants, grocery stores and gas, and then 1 point for everything else.100 points = 1 dollar. You can use the money pretty much however you want, but I think you have to reach $25 in order to withdraw money. It is tied to you Amazon account, so you can also just use your money right there. Having no yearly fee is a pretty great thing, especially for my first credit card. I would definitely recommend this card, especially for big Amazon users!

name: Effie
review: Chase is great. It is extremely convenient. The ATMS are always working. They are fast and easy. Customer Service is great all the time at any time. Also, I love the fraud detection service if they see something weird or unusual they will place a stop. It can be inconvenient but safety first. I signed up for Blueprint on the credit card. It allows you to pick certain categories where you spend, like entertainment, shopping, and have you pay that upfront with no interest charge. It’s been great because I tend to spend a lot in certain areas especially since I get cash back on the credit card. And that is great and I use it more often because of that. it just makes me feel like they care to keep you as a customer

name: Bruce Tayon
review: Overall my experience with Chase and its employees who oversee their day-to-day operation has been pleasant to say the least. My banker actually takes the time to sit down and have an honest to goodness talk about the certain rates applicable to my account. I have been a member at various other banks and have found my experience with Chase, even a rather large bank to say the least, to be the fondest. The branch in Arizona that I frequent has always had a personable attitude present in all of the employees. I had my first foray into banking as I reached the age of 18 and I was presented with a laid out format about checking rates and student loan options. I even experienced a withdrawal error and was quickly advised with customer service. The issue was resolved until the day's end. In general Chase is a corporate bank with a small-town heart evident in its employees. I would highly recommend their banking service to anyone.

name: Corrina Amedro
review: Not necessarily the best credit card there is, but the Marriott Rewards Premier Credit Card hit the jackpot, in my opinion, with the initial bonus. Points are not worth very much and they don't pile up too fast either, so the 50k points bonus is more than welcome.Okay, next issue. I've had this credit card for about six months now and I don't have too much to complain about it, except for, sometimes, the poor customer relations department. Then, about the bonus system itself, there's not much to be said. You earn between 1 to 5 points per dollar spent, with the mention that you get 5 points only if you shop at Marriott locations, which is not necessarily convenient, but it's alright I guess. All in all, do I recommend this credit card? I'm not sure. I guess it depends on your needs - if you need a credit card with reliable customer service and a strong bonus system, search more. If you just need an 'OK' credit card with an 'OK' bonus system, the Marriott Rewards Premier card is probably the one for you.

name: John Wie
review: I am not a huge credit card user but whenever I need to - I like to use my Chase Freedom Visa card because of the number of benefits that you will get using it.  One of the biggest points of interest is the easy cash back and the rewards that come out of using the card.  They are simple to understand and are very useful - utilized in most stores you probably already frequent.  These points are also very easy to see with a simple log-in.  The rates are not too bad compared to other credit cards and should not be that much of a problem unless you have problems paying off your debt.  If you're a user that is pretty consistent with their credit card payments and want a no-hassle card that doesn't try to confuse you with long-winded terms, I think you'll be a big fan of the Chase Freedom Visa card!

name: Ty
review: I have banked with Chase since I started using one of their credit cards years ago. It made sense to combine my accounts together, so I did so. I haven’t had any trouble with their services, so I definitely don’t have any complaints. They are a large bank, so you aren’t going to get as personalized service as you would with a smaller community bank. However the amount of products and locations that they offer is fantastic. I would highly recommend this institution for anyone that needs basic banking services. Their credit cards are also fantastic. I will continue to use their services in the future.

name: Tyler Hess
review: My wife and I have been using this credit card together for the past three years and I absolutely love it, I don't even use other credit cards because this one works so well for me. I do sometimes carry a balance and the rate is so low I forget it even exists most of the time.  We also get rewards whenever we use it, so I can get movie tickets or gift cards, but now I just connect my rewards straight to amazon and use the money there, which is always exciting. Chase is a trustworthy company that I have been with ever since they took over Washington Mutual, which I had been with since 2000, so I trust them to take care of my needs every day.

name: Sean McTaggart
review: This card is great! I initially signed up for it when I was making semi regular trips from GA to CA. I have gotten two flights for very cheap (you still have to pay the security fees, but they're only like $10 round trip). The initial bonus was great, and the rapid rewards program makes it very easy to rack up lots of bonus points. Customer service is great, and the online banking is very easy and user friendly. The only downside is the annual fee, which is negated once you consider the amount of points that they give you every year for being a continuing card member. It also seems that the very friendly Southwest Airlines employees treat you even better than normal once you have this card! Bottom line is that I love Southwest Airlines, and this card has really been amazing when it comes to saving a ton of money on travel.

name: Sally Ball
review: signned up for this deal..rec'd card , but no mention of 50,000pt reward, inaddition the annual fee was lissted as $99.

name: WalletHub
review: hmm - maybe you applied for another Southwest credit card because if you click on the Apply Now button listed on this page it shows a 50,000 bonus with a $69 annual fee.

name: Todd LePine
review: likewise when I click on the link it is the same offer .....you need to check this out

name: Kate Roumbos
review: While I try not to use my credit card frequently, the Chase Freedom card is a nice one to have for emergencies. It offers good rates for cash-back on various purchases (changing categories quarterly) and has no fees when used properly. I also received a sign-up bonus of $250 cash six months after I started using the card. You can use this cash to pay off your balance, or have it sent to you in check form. I found this perk to be especially appealing because, in theory, you can eventually pay off parts of your credit card balance each month with cash back that you've earned through the 1-5% cash back rewards program. You also earn extra points for shopping on their 'mall' site but I have not personally used that option.Again, as long as you pay off your balance in full each month, this is a great card to have.

name: Sunshine Burch
review: I really like my Amazon.com credit card. I do a lot of shopping on Amazon and I love the fact that I get points with every purchase. You can buy just about anything you want or need on Amazon and getting points for buying toilet paper, groceries, clothing, or anything else is quite helpful in this economy. You can then turn around and use their points to buy something fun or something you need. It’s super easy to use the website, too. I can pay my bill, find my balance and do just about anything else I need to do that relates to my Amazon card.

name: Anthony Arbaiza
review: I've used this card for the past year and it is by far my favorite credit card.  Even though I have recently closed this account, it had the most rewards and returns out of all the cards I had.  It was very easy to log onto my account and see how many points I had and what I could use them for.  I waited awhile to use my points and ended getting both an amazon gift card as well as using the extra points that were left as credit towards my remaining balance.  Overall, considering that most credit cards don't give such high returns or any at all for that matter, I was very satisfied.

name: Michael Johnson
review: The United MileagePlus Explorer Credit Card si an okay rewards card. I hate cards that charge an annual fee but I guess that happens with rewards cards. In reality are the rewards ever worth it? I would say no but if I would say that the United MileagePlus Explorer Credit Card is one of the better cards to get if you want to save up miles. The interest rate is pretty decent and there are no hidden fees to have to deal with. After the first year you have to pay the annual fee and that's it. Customer service is easy to deal with and they actually know what they are talking about!

name: Joe Costello
review: Chase has been my primary bank since I got my first savings account (probably about 18 years ago). Chase has a lot going for them, they are a huge, national bank that is about as stable as they come. They offer every product imaginable, can offer very competitive rates, have ATMs on almost every corner, etc. To me, the best thing that's happened to Chase is online banking. The Chase website is very easy to use, is very helpful in organizing and tracking your finances, and researching products. The only thing I find frustrating (occasionally) is the spotty customer service at the branch. Often there are long lines to see the tellers or the advisors and they have definitely been trained to sell you on all they're new products. This can be annoying when you're in a hurry. It's a small price to pay for what I consider to be the best bank in the land though.

name: ashley white
review: Chase bank has been so good to me and everyone that I know that has this bank. I have been with Chase bank since my very first banking account and I love them. Every time that I have a problem their customer service is great and always there to help me and go above and beyond when doing it. I have a credit card with them and also a checking and savings account. Their credit card is the best out there. With $100 back after the first 3 months of receiving it, you cannot beat that. Also there are so many other great rewards that they have to offer. I have a premier banking account and all of my fees for cashier checks, money orders, etc are waived and the account is free. Any issues that I have ever had they have resolved immediately and I never have any concerns about contacting them when I do have any issues regarding my three accounts. Chase most certainly has a lifelong customer in me.

name: Kent Trombly
review: I got this card about 2 years ago and it has replaced all of my other cards and it the only one I use now.  I originally got it because I wanted a card from a bank I trust and I also heard that the customer service with this card was top notch.  The sign up was quick and easy and I got my card with a week or two.  You get free reward points upon signing up (I can't remember the exact amount) which was a nice way to start.  I have found that the reward system is easy to use, points are easy to earn and redeem, and they have rewards that I actually want/use.  I dealt with customer service one time, when I lost my card while traveling.  They handled everything quickly and efficiently and I had a new card before my trip was over.  All in all, while the rate is only average, the rewards program makes this card worth giving a shot.

name: WalletHub
review: While the initial points are easy to earn, you do have to spend at least $500 to get them.

name: Rachelle Williams
review: I have been banking with Chase Bank for more than 8 years, and their customer service department is excellent....that is, their âbranchâ customer service. I experienced a horrible banking mix-up, and when I called their toll free customer service number, I got a call center agent who was unhelpful, robotic, and even downright rude. They actually cancelled my account, yet it was their fault. This banking issue caused me to have two delayed pay periods. If I didn't have another source of income it would have been devastating because I did not receive my pay until a month later. I was about to just walk away and join Bank of America, but I decided to visit my branch location (Rural & Broadway, Tempe AZ) and give it one more try. The branch agent, Karen Chase (her real name), reinstated my account, she apologized for the bank's mistake, and her overall level of customer service went well above and beyond. From that experience I have learned to visit or call the nearest Chase branch whenever I have an issue, and I know they will take care of me. Chase has a lifetime customer in me because of the professionalism of their branch teams.

name: Mike Yee
review: I have had this card for more than 5 years. I need to first state that I pay off my credit bills in full every month. I know there are lots of financial experts telling us we should avoid using credit card. But I am of the opinion that if you can use your card responsibly, and pay off your card every month, not using this card is like throwing free money away. Also, I really don't have a habit of carry too much cash around me -- tend to lose the track of them where they go. Charging almost everything to my card is a great and convenient way for me to track my spending in one place.Each quarter this card has several categories of 5% rebate. The upper limit you can charge in those categories is usually at 1500. Some very useful categories are Gasoline, Travel or even online shopping. So if you use it wisely, it is like having a discount of up to $75 on the service you buy. I usually redeem my points with check which is mailed to me through a letter. Sometimes, I redeem my points for other stuff. Last Summer, I had some relatives visiting me and I opted for Sea World tickets which were offered at a discounted price than at the gate. So that saved me even more money.In all, I am pretty happy with this card and the service Chase offers.

name: Alex Hoekstra
review: A great card to start out with.  Simple and straightforward, I have never had trouble staying on top of my credit.  I make my payments on time and slowly but surely generate cash back.  I don't go out of my way to make qualified purchases, but the cash back program is nice to have when I do.  I took this card out principally for the purpose of building credit, and also because I had a large purchase to make which qualified me for the cash back incentive associated with this plan.  It all worked out and I've been pleased to keep using the card ever since.  I'm not a big spender by any means, and I feel like this card fits well into my paradigm, since Chase seems to reward responsibility when it comes to spending.  That seems unique and uniquely cool.

name: Bradley Buchanan
review: They. Approved me then after three months use closed out my account because said all my info was bad even thought I gave them everything they asked for loved card horrid customer service

name: Al Roker
review: I have used the preferred card since February while traveling through Europe. Besides the point accumulation, the foreign conversion fee waiver is a major positive point. The card is a Visa, which hasn’t been a problem so far, but there is a downside as the card has no embedded chip. So have cash ready on the toll roads of Austria. Up-side is when a clerk gets hold of it they really look it over since it must be made of metal due to the weight and stiffness. They seem to smile a bit more unless their French; they lower their nose just a bit. And if you rent cars, the rental insurance is really helpful and can go a long way to covering the $95 annual fee.

name: Chris Davis
review: I have had a Chase Checking account for 5 years. The account was easy to open and I was able to do it completely online. I like the Chase online account services because I never need teller services. The account options for those with primarily ATM and online uses are pretty good. The accounts has changed since I first opened it, there were no fees but now there is a fee if your average daily balance is below a certain amount and varies depending on the account you have. My favorite thing about Chase is that it has a lot of ATMs. This means it's rare to not be near one and thus have to pay the fees for using a non-chase ATM. Another nice benefit of Chase is they have a many account alerts that you can set up to monitor deposits, withdraws, and virtually everything concerning your account. You can have immediate alerts sent to your email or via text message to your cell phone or both. Beyond the account alerts to monitor your account, Chase has strong security for online account access. If you login from unfamiliar places you will have to go to additional security checks of access code sent to your email or cell phone. Chase is the best of the big banks in my opinion and I have had accounts at BofA, Wells Fargo and Citi in the past and none have been as good.

name: Fred Kabibil
review: I initially opened a free checking account because of a promotion Chase had running and cause of the convenience of the location with respect to my house. Big mistake on my part. I had nothing but trouble with Chase. The customer service inside my branch was just awful. For some reason they wouldn't ever let me just go to the teller and get out of there. I always had to sit down with a banker and confirm different information about myself. Very annoying!  Then they got rid of free checking like most banks but of course Chase's fees were higher than most and there was no loyalty to existing customers who signed up specifically for the free checking. It doesn't end there unfortunately. They always seemed to find a way to get another fee tacked somewhere for any service. I'm now with a different bank and I couldn't be happier. Stay away from Chase if you have any choice in the matter.

name: Mikhail Ioffe
review: This is a great Credit Card , I Love every aspect of it. Not only its free , but you get cash back for rewards, isn't it great? I do like that the card is basically fee-free and I can earn cash back bonuses ranging from a minimal 1% on up to 10% when shopping at certain online retailers through Chase. Perhaps surprisingly, I have found several good deals through the Chase network of online retailers and look their first when shopping online. 5% cash back bonuses are given on categories that rotate every three months and I can usually manage to snag a good amount.There are a few different Chase Freedom Visa offers available, so the first thing you need to do before applying for this is make sure you have the right one. This $100 cash back + 0% Intro APR version offers a little bit of everything though so it can be kinda hard figuring out exactly what kind of consumer should get it. This’ll become clearer as we take a look at its terms.

name: tony george
review: Chase bank has always been there for me since I moved to NY in 2011. I initially opened with a Chase checking account and later used their credit cards. Their service is always top notch and the people they have working for them are extremely friendly. In addition whenever I had a problem with overdraft fees or a bounced check they were always able to assist me in the fastest most pain-free method ever. The features they have at their bank are really beneficial to all people regardless of their income or their age. I highly recommend them and all their branches.

name: SheriLee Butte
review: Chase bank has always been very helpful and courteous to our family. I highly recommend Chase for all your student account needs. They have helped with setting up student accounts for our children to learn the responsibilities of budgeting. They make it easy to monitor all the account activity and transferring funds is an easy task. Chase always has someone available to assist us if we have a concern or are looking to set up any kind of account. We have used Chase Bank through-out our children's college years.

name: Dann Day
review: I really like the checking  accounts I have at Chase bank and the way I am treated by this company as a customer.   The account I have is in fact FREE, there is no monthly fee or minimum balance that I must maintain and the overdraft protection is linked to my savings account, a feature I have only used once in many years, but provides peace of mind that I like.  My personal banker has always been very helpful and professional, whether I needed a new debit card or help with a question on my accounts.   As a result of the great experience I've had there, I do all my personal and business banking with Chase.  The tellers are also highly professional and courteous and know me by my first name there.  I always go into the branch, often to say hello and do business face to face.   Not everyone these days has a positive view of the larger banks, but my experience with Chase has always been positive and I like and recommend their products.

name: Stephanie Wolgat
review: I first started banking with Chase when I moved to a new location and wanted a bank that was widely known so I would not have issues finding a branch location no matter where I would go. I went into Chase and the bank staff were all very helpful, explaining the application process, rewards, benefits, specials going on for the month, and all that they have to offer. The bank itself seemed well organized with waiting areas stocked with coffee and cookies. The teller lines moved quickly and had many lines open as it was midday and the traffic from everyone wanting to bank on their lunch hour. That was encouraging to see that wait times would be minimized during peak periods. No less than three people greeted me and asked if I was being helped and all with smiles on their faces. Customer service seems to be number one priority.

name: Angela Cramer
review: I have been a customer of Chase since they took over Washington Mutual. Whenever I have gone into a branch, the staff has always been very friendly and helpful. I do most of my banking online, and find it very easy to do so. If I have a question or problem, the customer service over the phone has always been very good. The representatives are very friendly, and take the time and effort to help me how ever they can. I also never have a problem finding a branch or ATM when needed. I have noticed many new branches around my area, as well as ATMs now in Target, which is great for me!

name: Shaw
review: Chase has been very good to me in the past! I once had a spree of overdrafts that I was drowning in and they knocked off 3 out of 7 on the spot when I went to a local branch, although they said they wouldn't do it again for another year. I'm unhappy with being billed six dollars for not using my debit card 5 times a month though. They've been friendly every time I've gone in and usually prompt about getting what I needed done. Mobile alerts when your account is below whatever limit you set is a life saver. These are texts that can go to any phone. And the app on either big platform will let you deposit a check by taking a picture. Satisfied over here.

name: Darren
review: Two years ago, I opened up both a checking and savings account through Chase. The checking account was free and in regards to the savings account, I was only required to keep at least three hundred dollars in to avoid any penalty fees. This all changed when Chase implemented new revisions on its existing checking accounts. Without notice I was being charged $12.00 on my “free” checking account because I did not meet specific requirements.The positive aspects about Chase are its customer service and online banking. Twenty four hours a day I can talk to someone about my Chase accounts. Online, I can setup wire transfers, transfer money between my checking and savings accounts and apply Chase rewards to my account.

name: David kaban
review: I've done business and held checking accounts with a wide variety of banks. I've settled with Chase bank for the past 5 years. Previous to these 5 years I had been with Chase before but had ventured out to see what other banks had to offer. Chase's friendly service and ability to fix problems quickly, as they arise is a big reason I came back and have given them my loyalty. Chase has Banks and ATMs all over the country and I have found it easier to get my money without paying fees, due to this fact. Chase also has a smart phone app that allows me to transfer money to family or friends instantly. I can also deposit my checks straight from the phone into my bank account using this App as well. Chase just makes my life simple and I love them for that.

name: Rob F
review: I have had a secondary checking account with Chase for almost a decade now and my experience has been pretty hit or miss. Banking with Chase offers some nice features, mainly the availability of no fee ATMs in most parts of the country. Many ATMs also let you deposit checks and print a receipt with scanned pictures of your deposit, which is also kind of nice. Beyond that, I found that the fees charged by Chase to be exorbitant – especially for their rewards checking. When I had a problem with fraudulent activity on my account, someone was available to help at my local branch, but he had a confrontational and off-putting demeanor which I found offensive. I can't say if that's common or not, but it does seem like they don't care much about individual customers. It is also quite a hassle to send money to people/bills via their online interface. I prefer my credit union to be honest.

name: Michael Horne
review: So far so good with this card. I applied for this card and was approved. One of the main reasons for getting it was that I wanted to do a balance transfer from another credit card that I had a balance on. Once I received the card I had the option to do a balance transfer and I transferred the entire balance. It transferred over fine, with just a small fee for doing so (a whole lot better than paying 21% or so APR). The balance that I have on the card is 0% interest until 2015, so that is wonderful, saving me a whole bunch of money for sure! I also have used it since to make some purchases and I have earned some rewards which is an added bonus. Every quarter they have an offer on the card and you have to ‘Activate’ the offer, whereby you get 5% back on purchases on select areas, such as groceries or travel, whatever the offer is for that quarter. All in all, a great card!

name: Toya Zenz
review: I was so thrilled to get this card! I needed a credit card to help me recover from student loans, and what better than Disney to help with that? I buy tons of Disney movies, especially on Blu-ray, which can get pretty pricey. But now I can use the points I get from using this card to buy them from the Disney Rewards website. The only drawback would be the rewards website itself. When you order something they tell you it can take up to six weeks for the purchase to arrive. So far it has taken about three to four weeks to get the stuff I ordered. But all in all, the card is pretty wonderful, and I definitely recommend it if you have kids or tend to buy a lot of Disney merchandise.

name: Alice WTurney
review: We have had the Disney Reward card for years. It has been a great experience. We have used the rewards to purchase holiday and birthday presents for years. The rewards do not expire quickly. This enables us to gain additional points for bigger purchases. The interest rate has always stayed low. We have been very pleased. The customer service is very helpful as well. When redeming the points they are so nice and helped us understand the card prossess. We really like this card due to several factors such as it has a low interest, easy to use, a nice and helpful customer service, and not to mention that you get to pick your own design, which is a hit with my youngest who is a mickey fan.

name: Johnny Last
review: I've been Using this Disney card for awhile now and I don't really know how I feel for it. On one hand, if you're a big Disney buff, I think this card is for you. You can redeem the reward points that you get for varous things, but mostly Disney related items. If you spend $500 within the first couple of months, you get a free $100 Disney gift card. I believe that is pretty cool. If you don't want any Disney products, you do earn 2% when shopping at gas stations and places of that nature. I believe it's an OK card, but If you are a Disney fan it might just be worth it.

name: Clarence Jr
review: Having had enough of a credit upsurge to be eligible for this card, I have to say I have been thoroughly impressed with it. From the moment I got it (3/12), it has a godsend thanks to the low APR and the double points I have frequently accumulated. I would say the big drawback is the $100 annual fee, but it could be a lot worse. Believe me, having had a credit hiccup when I was younger, there's nothing quite like getting a reputable card that actually delivers the goods for you! The offer I signed up for also came with a 50,000 point sign up bonus after spending $3,000. When I got to that, I was able to transfer the points and took a nice trip to the U.K. Oh yeah, it is a STYLISH looking card! Seriously, what a beautiful piece of plastic to show off when you're paying for something. Sounds really superficial, but it's awesome.

name: Princess Parkhurst
review: Nightmare experience for me involving this card! Will never use Chase bank or cards again after what they put me through. I had been an unfortunate victim of credit card fraud. Chase made it so difficult for me. They seemed to be creating obstacles for me instead of trying to help me out of this horrible situation. Eventually all was resolved but only due to my undying diligence. Outside of that event they were rude and difficult to deal with on several other occasions. They raised my interest rate for no reason and refused to bring it back down after numerous objections on my part. I highly recommend looking somewhere else for your credit needs or banking needs for that matter.

name: Vanessa Hamann
review: I got  my Amazon card about a year ago. I saw the promo  where you get 30  dollar bonus  upon  approval.  Sounded good to me especially at Christmas time.  I  was  approved  right away with out any  trouble and the  bonus was immediately  added to my  account. I was able to use it on the  purchase  I was about to make.    This card really comes in handy when I need a  last minute gift  that does not fit into my budget.  It is  great to be able to  order online, have it wrapped and sent to person   if I   want to.  So  fast and  easy. Most of the things I buy  qualify for the  free shipping as well. That makes it even more  valuable to have an Amazon Card!  I save so much!  I love my Amazon card!

name: Nila Deprofio
review: We got an offer for this card in the mail and my wife really wanted it (mostly because she is a huge Disney fan). We have annual passes to the theme park and try to go at least twice a year to make a weekend getaway out of it and also to visit family in the area. At first I thought this was just going to be a novelty card but it has actually ended up helping us out tremendously. We've earned a ton of points good toward all sorts of Disney related rewards and travel, as well as theme park perks that we wouldn't have gotten otherwise.  There's an annual fee, but for us it makes sense because we get major discounts on the purchases we make at Disney stores and affiliates (10% and more), and we got a $100 bonus after making $500 in purchases (so that essentially paid for the fee for 2 years in and of itself). The points earned on other purchases (like gas, groceries, etc.) are comparable with other cards and nothing to brag about necessarily. But if you are a Disney fan and make regular trips there or to Disney stores (especially if you have little ones) then this card definitely pays off. If not, then this card probably won't work for you.

name: Zach Stephens
review: I got the Chase Freedom card a couple years ago and I absolutely love it! First, I got an amazing deal when I applied the card, $300 cash back after spending $500 in the first 3 months. This was incredibly easy to do (especially since I got the card in November, so all my Christmas shopping went on the card). But even without that cash back offer, I think I still would have got the card because it is so easy to understand and use. I get 1% cash back on everything I buy, with the exception of a few specialty purchases that get 5% cash back each quarter. Nothing complicated or confusing about the rewards program. No “You get a percentage back if you make X kind of purchase from Y store, but not if it’s from Z store.” Simple, 1% back on everything. I’ve made hundreds of dollars back on this card, and with the website so well laid out, bill pay is fast and easy. I’ve been able to avoid a single interest charge in the entire length of my card usage because of how quickly the card updates my purchases, and how quickly my payments go through. I love this card!

name: Libbie Quintard
review: I love my Amazon.com Credit Card. What got me hooked was when I was on the Amazon check out page, it showed me how much lower my bill can be this time if I use the card by applying right here, right now. After that I have been using it ever since, due to the fact that I purchase many things on Amazon.com. I get points for buying gas, food at restaurants, and I even get points for purchases made at the pharmacy. The greatest thing of all is that the points are so easy to use since I am so familiar with Amazon and their customer friendly way of doing business. The fact that there is no annual fee also seals the deal.

name: Kyle
review: I have been using Chase Freedom for several years and I have never had a problem. It is one of the two credit cards that I currently had. Their customer service is excellent, I have had to call them a few times. Once to order a new card that I misplaced, they were more than helpful on getting me a new one and suspending my old card number. The online interface is very navigable and I use it to schedule my payments all the time, even one time when I forgot and had to make a same day payment. The APR is very fair as compared to other cards, and my minimum payment is always low. I will continue to use this as my go to card for years to come.

name: Ty Bennewitz
review: I signed up for this card because of the $100 bonus cash back.  I have no complaints about it exactly.  The rewards are nice and getting 5% back on certain categories is a nice perk.  However, the 5% cash back rotates from category to category, so sometimes you can’t take advantage of the highest cash back option.  I didn’t use this card for very long because other cards pay a more consistent cash back rewards bonus.  Still, it’s a decent enough card if you happen to shop in the category that gives the 5% cash back bonus.  I didn’t regularly, so it wasn’t the best card for me.

name: derrick rex
review: I have had a credit card with Chase bank for about a year now. I love the customer service. As soon as I call in I rarely ever have to wait to speak to a representative. The customer service line always helps me with my problems and fixes them very quickly. I like that the payment options are very easy and when I send my payments in it goes in right away. I love having a credit card with Chase Bank and do not regret it at all. I would definitely recommend Chase to any of my friends or family looking for a good credit card or bank account!

name: John Jameson
review: I am a new customer at JP Morgan Chase and so far no compliments. Their customer service is quite impeccable. The employees are nice, courteous and very helpful. Setting up my accounts was as quick as it was easy. Not to mention the user friendly online banking. Unlike Travis Credit Union (my previous bank) there are no noticeable glitches in the online banking system. All of my banking transfers work smoothly and quickly. At the moment I am very comfortable as a chase bank client and I plan on remaining a customer for the foreseeable future. I can’t wait for the new credit cards!

name: Dr Galaxy
review: One of the best featured cards out there.  Customer service is awesome, benefits are awesome when you stay at their hotels.  I didn't use for a while and missed out on some rewards.  Other than that, its pretty much the same as any other credit card.  Interest rate for me was lower than most others so that's a plus.  I like to use it for hotels and use my other card for airfare.  Not sure why its listed as having no promo apr.  Mine came as 12 months 0% interest.  The points also grow fast which is a great plus.  A few free rooms a year is good by me.

name: Kathy Patterson
review: I am lukewarm when it comes to Chase. I have been a customer for over 10 years, dating back to the old Bank One times. In truth, I have been lucky in that I have only truly needed extreme assistance one time, a few years ago, when my debit card info was stolen. I was really impressed with the customer service I received, and how quickly and efficiently Chase took care of the issue. In fact, after one phone call and one report submission, they took care of the rest. That being said, it often seems that unless you are a business, or have a huge bankroll, the little guy gets overlooked.

name: Chris Wilson
review: I have been a Chase bank customer for several years. I have had this particular card for about 3 months and so far I am happy with it. I am a cardholder at another big bank that I will not bother naming, but regardless, I was unhappy with the service I was receiving in recent times. I had several big purchases that I was paying off at a ridiculous APR. This other company was completely unwilling to work with me to lower the APR. I thought I was out of options until I found the Slate card from Chase. I was able to transfer my balance over for free. And, of course, the icing on the cake was that Slate has no annual fee.

name: Traci Carson
review: I got this card because I fly Southwest Airlines a lot, and I figured hey, why not. It'd help save me a little bit of money on flights, since I travel so much. The problem is, the customer service this company offers for this card is absolutely terrible. I have never had a good experience talking to a customer service representative on the phone when I have a question about anything to do with this card. In fact, some of them (read: most of them) are just flat out rude. And even when I get one that isn't rude, they still don't know what they're talking about. On top of that, I have been charged far over the amount I should owe almost every month since having this card, so I wouldn't recommend it for anyone. I don't want to work with this company anymore, and I am thinking about closing my account with them, honestly.

name: Shannon Johnson
review: Sometimes I regret getting a card after I have done so. The interest rates get me down, the "fine print" comes through in the first or second statement, etc. But not with my Slate card from Chase. There was no fine print. There were no hassles. The interest rate was low. This card is cut and dry. No crazy strings attached to it. I got a great credit line that makes Christmas shopping easy and affordable. I pay it all back when I get my income taxes back. This card definately makes my life a lot easier.  I don't know what I would do without my Slate card from Chase.

name: Tara
review: EVERY time I have called either Chase on line services, Chase Debit Card Services, or (and especially) Chase Freedom Services, I have NEVER received help with any issue I have encountered, being the reason I am calling in the first place. “Customer Service” is grossly misleading when it comes down to what they actually provide their customers with. “Customer Service” employees of Chase can be equally compared to, and are just as helpful as automated customer service recordings. I think most of us can attest that if you are taking time out of your life to call customer service, it’s not going to be for something solvable through a voice recording. For any question, concern or issue that may require a thinking brain to figure out, do not expect ANY intelligent or helpful assistance from the employees, specialists, managers of Chase Bank.

name: Ty Bennewitz
review: This card came highly recommended and came with a good points system, so I had to bite.I use this for my every day purchases that I otherwise would have normally made.  Why others don't use credit cards, and especially this one, to buy groceries and gas is beyond me.  As long as you pay it off at the end of the month, this is a great card.I have used this card for several months now and I have no complaints.  I love looking up my point balance at the end of the month.  I have tons of free stuff from using this card.  This is one of the best cards I have had.

name: Kelsay Allen
review: My husband began using Chase before we were married. After getting married, I started using them too. I have absolutely no complaints. They have quickly resolved any issues we have had (including someone stealing our card number and racking up about $300 of charges)I especially like the Chase drive thru ATMs. I know not all banks offer them and that they are not offered at all locations, but I drive to one that I know has one. The convenience of being able to quickly deposit checks and money is awesome. I normally have my daughter in the car with me and it is so nice to not have to take her out of her car seat to go into the bank for 2 minutes to just deposit money. I love Chase!

name: Lauren Grossman
review: I was so psyched when I got my Disney Rewards card from Chase.  I love the fun designs I was able to choose from when applying for my card, and I love all the perks I am able to enjoy not only at the Disney Store, but also at Disney World.
