My family and I are planning a trip to Disney, and I am very excited at the prospect of saving using my Disney Rewards card.  Also, my girls are excited because my  being a Disney Rewards member means they get an opportunity to meet and have their photo taken with the Disney Princesses at the exclusive Chase Disney Rewards Member area!  Being a Disney Rewards cardholder not only increases my buying power, but provides me with extra incentives that make using this card a real treat!

name: Doug Miller
review: I’ve had the Priority Club card for about five years now, and it is the card I primarily use. I have yet to find another card that’s rewards added up and were as useful as this card. I travel for work and we are reimbursed for our hotel stays. I always stay at a Holiday Inn (IHG) property and use this card to pay for it. The end result is I get a ton of points on my account and they are actually useful because I can redeem them for free hotel stays for vacations. On top of the points you get a free night voucher every year, so even if you didn’t spend almost anything, you’d still get a reward worth at least $75, which is much better than most rewards cards. I have no experience with their Customer Service other than an occasional call from them verifying the charge was valid, but that is because I may charge a room in Seattle one day and a few days later be in Boston. I appreciate their effort to protect me.

name: Wolfie L
review: This is the only credit card that I've owned and it was very easy to get. I need money to get two and from work before I first get paid, so this credit card is a lifesaver for me. I have very little credit, so I was having a hard time looking for a credit card that would approve me. But they did. It came very quickly in the mail and I it's definitely been great. I haven't had any problems using the credit card and I have enough credit. I would definitely recommend this to a friend who was in a tight spot.

name: Courtney
review: I've been using Chase for a few years now and have encountered no problems with them. The service is good, and the people working at the bank are always friendly and willing to answer questions. Although I only have a checking account with them right now, I have had a savings account with Chase in the past; both have worked just as I wanted them to, and the man who helped me open my account made sure to find a service that would work best with me and what I wanted. All in all, I can't complain, and plan to continue using them in the future.

name: Robert Neville
review: I have been a member of Chase for a year now and I have been satisfied with the service and so far have not really had any problems. The only time that I had to contact customer service was when I received an overdraft fee but after calling that was quickly resolved and the fee was waived. They have also contacted me when there is a possible problem with my account such as stolen bank information and they quickly resolved the problem. I have been happy using Chase for the one year I have been with them and will continue as a member and will likely recommend it to a few more friends.

name: Meeshi Lil-Bit
review: I opened a Chase checking account because some agents came to my job offering $125 incentive to do so. Who doesn't like free money? Plus, I only had a prepaid debit card at the time.I am happy to report, it was a great decision. You can definitely feel that they strive to make their customers happy. Anytime I had an issue, I would write a message from my online banking inbox, and it was promptly responded to within a few hours. When I had an issue with fraudulent activity, a few simple questions and my new card was on its way along with a credit for the fraudulent charges. I love that they make transfers and bill pay so simple as well, and sending money to a friend via their email address is an awesome perk. Their online customer service center almost completely eliminates the need to go into a branch. And if indeed I did need to go to a branch, there is practically a Chase everywhere in my area. Very convenient! I honestly cannot think of any downsides to having a Chase checking account and I have been banking with them for over a year. Great bank!

name: Mark
review: I've had my chase credit card for 5 years now, and it's been my primary spending card for the whole time because of the rewards and very low interest rate. A year after I got the card, they decreased my interest rate by 1% just for using automatic payments. The rewards have remained competitive compared to what else is on the market, though they’re not what they were a few years ago. The quarterly 5% cash back promotions have decreased from broad categories of stores to individual stores, which makes them harder to take advantage of, and it’s not really worth the effort to remember at which stores I can save a few pennies during each quarter.

name: Lauren Grossman
review: My relationship with Chase bank is something to brag about. I live in a small town, so even though I am receiving all the benefits and security of banking with a larger chain, I receive small town treatment. The tellers all know me by name and go out of their way to provide personal, professional and friendly service. Even the bank managers say hello and offer personalized service every time I come in. I enjoy many of the services at Chase as well as their rewards programs. Great service and products are just part of the experience at Chase Bank. I would recommend banking with Chase to anyone looking for a bank.

name: Jamy
review: I have had my Chase Credit Card for over 7 years now. We haven't had any big problems overall, but we have had some minor inconveniences. For instance, if you schedule an online payment after a certain time then it doesn't go through the same day. This could cause some payments to be considered late and that goes against your credit score. Again, this is a minor inconvenience and it only took me doing it one time to figure out not to do that again. I have a Chase Rewards card. Our Interest rate is on the high side, but we try to keep this for emergencies and for purchases that we have the money available for. The rewards are a nice advantage. We don't use the card that much, but an extra $40-50 a year is great (especially around the holiday times).Overall I would recommend Chase for a credit card. I haven't had any major problems in over 7 years. That is a great track record for me to recommend a company!

name: John Rea
review: Chase was one of the last banks I ever thought about when first choosing a place to open my first account. I had never really heard anything about the quality of service, but it turns out that the quality is one of the highest I have experienced from a traditional bank. I opened a checking account with Chase, and am happy I did. Like some of the other banks, I have no monthly fee for using a teller instead of an ATM, and there are plenty of Chase ATMs spread throughout my city. Chase is a bank I don't think I will ever leave.

name: Walleed Hamid
review: My god this bank is amazing when it comes to simplicity. I signed up about a month ago and right off the bat they gave me a student account that is free for 4-6 years. Its basically free until 2016. No fees or anything as long as i use my direct deposit or my debit card 5 times a month. Very simple and elegant. Thought the very annoying part is the constant spam on my email and my phone. I have yet to find a option to disable it but so far that is my only concern. So far the debit card is free with no hidden fees. I also have an option to get some low interest rate loans but i have no need for them but will get them soon. Awesome bank.

name: Aj Winters
review: There is no 100 % approval this is suppose to be a prepaid card they run your credit and they run your name thru chex system they don't approve everyone its a scam

name: WalletHub
review: If you go into a Chase branch to get this pre-paid card, and they run a Chexsystem check, that is because the banker is trying to figure out how responsible you have been with your debit and checking accounts in the past.  It is possible that you can be denied for this card though.

name: Mary Donaldson
review: if its a prepaid card then how can you get denied sounds like a scam to me i was going to get this but since they do all that forget it how stupid is that

name: Adan Hernandez
review: they run your checksystem to figure out whats the best account they can set u up in im in the chexsystem for 2 banks and i just told the banker i want the liquid thats it not interested in the second chance banking account which is more expensive at 11.95 a month, and thats it they set me up took like 15 minutes

name: WalletHub
review: While it is true that Chase might check your prior banking and credit history, there are very, very few rejections for the Chase Liquid.  Like other pre-paid cards issued by major banks, a Liquid card represents a relationship with Chase, rather than an anonymous pre-paid card.

name: Dulce Bentzen
review: I pay my credit card off every single month.  My wife and I strictly use it for set bills we get every single month.  We do not pay for anything such as groceries or entertainment.  There are about 5 bills total I pay it with and then I just pay it off every month.  I do this because I know for a fact I will have to pay those bills anyways so I don’t have to worry about spending way too much.  We are very strict with our credit card spending.  With the Chase Freedom card, I get 5% cash back if I spend up to $1,500 at area hotels.  When I have to go somewhere for business, my employer allows me to use my credit card to get the points and they just reimburse me with the money they normally would of paid.

name: Jason Noble
review: I've had this card for about 3 years and really only got it because of the bonus incentive Amazon was offering. By the time I received it, used it, paid it off again I had managed to buy several more things that helped me out in school. Since nearly everything on Amazon is cheaper than in a retail store this card only saved me MORE money than I would have believed. I would definitely recommend getting and using this card, especially for purchases with Amazon. My interest rate isn't really that great but is definitely offset by the savings from buying on Amazon.

name: Rashana Hicks
review: After building up my credit through various other secured cards I was able to get the Navy Federal Credit card. I have a bank account with them as well so being able to transfer money from one account to another is very easy. What I like about this card is that I get points each time I use my card. I have already received a $25 gift card from Navy Federal from using my card. I think that is great especially for a business because it enables me to be able to buy more things that I want. I love my interest rate with this card. It is the lowest one that I have had so far. I also love the support that they have with this card, I have only had one issue when I started with the card and it was immediately solved. Thank you Navy Federal for having a good card that I can depend on!

name: Omar Otteman
review: I really do like my Chase Sapphire Preferred Card.  It is the only card I use for both online and in person purchases.  I especially use it for making travel plans because I earn 2 points for every dollar spent.  I’ve had to call Chase a few times to talk over some issues and they’ve always given me very good customer service.  I have never had a problem with Chase.  The only thing bad about this card is an annual fee after the first year.   Despite that I would still highly recommend the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card or any Chase credit card to anyone shopping around.

name: Doug Miller
review: I've had this card for a few years and honestly, I'm not sure if I want to keep it or not. Overall, it is a little expensive since I don't use it enough to justify the annual fee. I'm tempted to call them and see if I can get the fee waived since I've been a customer for so long, and if they don't give that to me, then I will likely just cancel the card. The rewards add up eventually, but really aren't enough to get me to keep the card. If I went to the parks more often, then it would make more sense because those discounts are immediate and tangible. I haven't used their customer service so I can't comment about it, but I'd figure it is the same as everywhere else.

name: Thomas Santell
review: I have had the Amazon.com Credit Card for a few months now and I love it. The initial $30 gift card that comes with it was GREAT. It has a great no interest policy and I have already taken advantage of that. The rewards system is one of the best I have used before. You recieve one point for every dollar you spend, however if you are paying for gas then you receive double this amount. Also every dollar that you spend on Amazon you get 3 points for. If you use the card at restaurants you get 2 points per dollar. These points add up pretty quickly. For every 100 points you get a dollar back. I will continue using this card as my main card for awhile. I recommend it to anyone that uses Amazon frequently.

name: Joe Miele
review: I do not use this card very often but I signed up for it when they were offering  a promotion of $200 in gift cards. They followed through with it and I was really pleased with that offer. I live in Florida so I also get discounts when I am in Disney. With all of the out of town family and friends who come here, I end up at Disney at least once every year. The discount really helps because Disney can be pretty expensive. I am a fan of Disney, but I am a little bit burnt out on going there and it makes me feel better that I get discounts when I have to go.

name: Toby Sharer
review: The Disney Reward Visa card is an amazing idea for those who love Disney. It definitely perfect for those who have young children. I got mine awhile ago, and now that my children are older I do not see use using the points as often. The only problem I have is that the point system is a little confusing to understand. I do enjoy however the regularly mailed updates that show all of the cool things your family can use the Disney Dream Reward Dollars to experience and enjoy. I never used the points for a vacation so I am not completely sure how that works, but I assume it would be as easy as everything else you can do with the card. It really is a great idea, especially for the kids!

name: Traci Carson
review: I have had this Chase credit card for about nine months now, and have had nothing but an amazing experience both with the card and with the company itself. I pay my bill on time, and if there are ever any questions for charges on the bill, whenever I call customer service the problem is handled promptly and with care. The service reps are all very nice people and very helpful. I've never had a single rude one, which is pretty amazing considering how bad some of the reps are for other cards I've had. The fees on this card are pretty decent, as well, and I like the little perks they give you for using it. I also was given a boost on the amount I could use within just a couple of months of opening the card, which was a nice little bonus.

name: Frank Thomas
review: My wife and I discovered the Disney rewards card after we got engaged and decided to use this card for all of our wedding planning expenses and any other major purchases we made leading up to our wedding.  We did this as we both really wanted to spend our honeymoon at Disney World, and by using this card, we were earning points that we could use during our honeymoon at Disney World.  After our wedding, we were so surprised and happy with the amount of points that we had earned and felt it was completely worth the effort to insure that we used our card for all the purchases.  We were rewarded very nicely and also were able to enjoy many different perks by using our Disney Rewards card during our visit to Disney World.  It was a fantastic honeymoon and after all was said and done, we were very thankful that we had discovered this card and were able to benefit from it while on our honeymoon!

name: Jake Nguyen
review: This seems so fake. Everyone's grammar is perfect when writing the comments. Everything is positive and just doesnt seem legit to me. When EVERYONE writes perfect grammar and never says anything negative about anything then it seems too fake to me.

name: Rob Eyers
review: This is a great intro credit card for post-graduation college students or someone trying to get their credit in order. Limits are low, and it is easy to manage. The rewards have been thoroughly discussed, and while they may not be the largest out there, they can add up fairly quickly. Make sure you keep an eye out on what the quarterly 5% bonus is. Usually it will be on gas, groceries, or travel. What I have been most impressed with through Chase is their usability. The mobile app is incredibly easy and intuitive. At one touch you can see your rewards and how much the balance is, at two touched you can pay it off from your checking account, and at three touches you can deposit a check from your living room. The most customization feature however is the alerts. I like to pay may bills through automatic payments, but I get worried they didn't go through. With the alerts set up, chase will send me a text whenever my credit card registers a charge for certain amounts. That way I know exactly when the cable gets paid off! Over all a very user friendly credit card with a decent rewards program.

name: Jessica Buonanno
review: Chase is a great credit card to have as a student. I pay my payments on time, and they do their part to make sure everything is done fairly. One time, my credit card information was stolen but they did their best to restore my credit card and gave me a new one. I was so worried that my credit score might be ruined, but they caught the suspicious activity before a real problem was created. It was one of the best experiences I had with them. Chase is a credit card company that I would recommend to my peers in college.

name: Hermila Paredez
review: After a long time user of Capital One credit card services, I have finally switched to Chase, and I have to say so far its has been amazing  My credit limit is higher than I was expecting which is always a plus.  The rates are high, but you shouldn't have a balance on it at the end of the month anyways (that's how they get you :D)  I have never had any major problems with the card and the rewards are awesome so far.  They have bonus points for certain purchase and  a reward sections to use the points you accommodate.  If you want cash rewards you should probably go get a capital one credit card, but if you don't mind surfing through reward options than this card is for you.

name: Marilynn Sannon
review: I originally signed up for the Amazon rewards credit card last year so I could receive the $30 bonus; it was really helpful for finishing up some Christmas shopping!  The fact that you get double points for groceries and gas eventually moved this card up to the front of my wallet, while other less generous cards were shoved back, rarely to see the light of day again.  However, what impressed me the most about this credit card was the result of an incident that happened just a few weeks ago.  Somehow a hacker had gotten a hold of my card number (probably through an online purchase.)  The thief used the number to try and purchase about $2200 worth of computer gadgets.  Within the hour, I received a call regarding this suspicious activity.  The card was canceled immediately, and the hacker’s online purchases were dropped.  One day later, I had my new card delivered to me via UPS next day air.  Not only is this a great card for shopping, but it is also a very SAFE card!

name: Bill Fuller
review: I have has this Chase card for more than four years and have to say that I have been pleased with my experience. One of the top features of this card is the ability to change your payment date. My Chase bill used to come about two weeks before my other bills and it was a hassle to always remember to pay that bill at a separate time for the others. I really prefer to sit down and pay all of my monthly expenses at one time. So, I called customer service and they were very happy to help me by moving the payment date back to the end of the month. In fact, the date was changed the very next pay cycle. This has made life much easier for me. When the bill was due earlier in the month, I was late with one payment, and they charged me a large fee, but it was my fault for missing the payment, and they were gracious enough to change the pay date without any penalty or extra expense.

name: Paul Michalski
review: I was initially hesitant to get the Amazon rewards card because I already had three other credit cards, but the $30 initial reward was just too good to pass up.  Now I'm really glad I signed up for this card.  I do a lot of shopping on Amazon, and the 3% cash back on amazon purchases is by far the best reward of all my credit cards.  The card offers 2% cash back on gas, which is also better than my other cards.  The card offers 1% on everything else, which is pretty standard but still adds up fast.  There are no annual fees and the interest rates are reasonable.  There's really no reason to pass on this card.

name: Stephen Samuels
review: I find Chase to be one of my preferred banks to deal with when it comes to Credit Cards.  Their rewards are always in line with competitors, but their customer service seems to be better than most.  With Chase the cards serve their purpose and don't get in the way.  I don't have to worry about rate changes, or hidden fees on cards.  I used this card to switch over from a bank that I was no longer happy with.  I transferred a balance so I could deal with Chase instead of the other bank, and I have not been disappointed at all from doing so.  If you have a bank you no longer want to do business with this card is a great option for an alternative.

name: George Fand
review: I have this card for a month and a half now. The reason I issued it in the first place was because I found myself in a tight spot and needed some cash ASAP. There was a problem with delivery and someone from the main offices of Chase credit department was in close contact with me the whole time. First thing I used it for was to take out a cash advance of $500 I desperately needed for my rent. Also, they have a promotion where if you spend $500 in your first three months they give you $100 cash back, although I found out it doesn't apply for cash advances. So what I did was to transfer a balance I had on a different card (from wells fargo) into that card. I transferred $720, it took a few days and they charge me a small fee, but I'm going to have $100 deducted from my Chase Freedom card! My limit on this card is $1500 so even after all these transactions I still use it in my day-to-day life to ease some pressure from my paychecks, mostly for cellphone bills and groceries. Thanks Chase Freedom you have been a great help!

name: Nick Dimmick
review: In general, we have been very pleased with our Chase Freedom credit card.  We’ve had it for a few years and used it as our primary credit card.  There have been a few times when Chase has called us to ask us about what they considered suspicious activity.  In each of these cases, everything was fine, but we were appreciative of their watchfulness.  The only problem we’ve had has been something that is likely unique to us.  I have led many mission trips for church, usually consisting of multiple vehicles driving long distances.  I use my credit card to fill up the vehicles each time to make it easy to keep records.  On a typical trip, I’ll swipe the card at three or four gas pumps at our first stop.  This sets off an alarm for Chase, and they freeze the card.  I then have to call them and explain that everything is fine.  While I appreciate their diligence, I wish they would learn from past experiences and stop freezing the card in these situations.

name: John Johnson
review: The best card ever.  A+++++

name: Lorean Sodek
review: I have had this card for many years. After losing my job 2-1/2 years ago, I recently fell behind on payments.  Chase lowered my maximum balance to below the amount I owed them.  Now they charge me late fees, over balance fees, and badger me by phone daily.  They call at least 4 times a day every single day of the week including Sundays.  I have fallen on very hard times and am struggling to keep a roof over my family's head and food in their mouths.  Chase is relentless in their pursuit.  I cannot afford to pay them right now.  So they also have jacked up my interest rate.  I am fervently pursuing employment but due to my age am having trouble getting a full-time position.  I cut grass and watch kids to help feed my family and really do want to pay them but cannot do so at this time.  It is so discouraging to continue getting calls when there is nothing I can do right now to pay them.  I have been unable to refinance my home and have been turned down for many jobs. I continue to go on interviews and try to stay positive. I cannot wait until the day when I can start paying  them back. Once it is paid off, I will NEVER again do business with Chase Visa.

name: Kathleen Morris
review: I have been a Chase customer for quite some time, and I have held different cards over time. I had signed up for this particular card just after I had some settlements with another bank on other cards. I was approved and given a $1000.00 credit limit. I wanted to work on getting my credit score up, so I tried to be very responsible with this card. I did tried to take advantage of any cash back offers and points that I was given, unfortunately, for some reason, I was making what I thought were 'smart' choices, only to find out that many of my purchases didn't qualify for points or cash back because I didn't use certain merchants or use my credit in the right category. Chase was not too kind in dealing with my issue and did nothing to remedy the situation for me.As a result of my bad experience, I decided to give the card a rest and try to not use it unless I absolutely had to. So, after about six months or so, I had to use it to get my car fixed, and I was rejected. I couldn't understand why since I had no balance. I called Chase and they told me that due to inactivity, my credit limit had been reduced and that at that time I did not qualify for an increase, for reasons they did not give to me. Ultimately, I cut the card up. It was not worth it to me to keep the card even though I was working on my credit. I ended up further hurting my credit score a little by closing the account on my behalf, but I am glad that I did it.

name: Denise Lobosco
review: thanks for the info

name: Piper Boedeker
review: After several months of building credit through a secured credit card I soon became eligible for a unsecured credit card and instantly applied for the Chase Freedom card because it offered cash back rewards and a $100.00 bonus to those who spent. I have been using this credit card for 6 months now and have always paid all of my credit card bills in full each month. The 1% and 5% cash bonus along with the $100.00 cash bonus have added up and has been very well worth it having cost me nothing. I think that this is an excellent credit card for those who pay their bills on time, in full each month. If you don’t think that you can do this, this card can be risky for you and may end up costing you money.

name: Brooke Milde
review: I have been using the Chase Freedom card for over 5 years.  When I initially got this.card, it gave 5% cash back for gas, and the reward was paid directly towards the total.bill.  This was nice, and we always used that card for gas.  They eventually changed the.rewards system.  Now, every quarter we get 5% back for certain categories, which works out well too.  However, you must reply to a text to "activate" the rewards, which seems unnecessary to me.  I plan to use this card to buy airline tickets soon, which is one of the current 5% back categories.  I also have quite a reward built up, which I can apply to my balance.

name: Rachel Feltman
review: I loved using this card. For one thing, the card itself has a really unique look and texture-cashiers always commented on it! Small issue, but it's nice that it feels so good in your hand. Accepted everywhere, and never had any issues using it. I also really liked the rewards system. With most credit cards, you know you're supposedly earning rewards-but where are they? How do you get them? With Chase I always knew how to access my rewards points. Other high points: No annual fee, 15,000 bonus points after first purchase, and 0% on all balance transfers for six months. Fantastic card for personal or small business use.

name: Michelle Sykes
review: I have a PRE PAID CHASE. I like it, but you CAN overdraft. I  have NO idea even though they explained.  I paid my cable bill by phone. It was a pending charge on Chase.  I continued to use the card over the weekend, everything was approved. I ended up 100.00 NEGATIVE. It Baffeld me...The lady at the CHASE told me, Anything after a certian time on Friday will be approved.

name: Xeridian Darkmoon
review: The only other card I would use is the Western Union card, though they cost 4.95 to load the card with no monthly fee. So if you get paid once a month, it's the same thing. If every 2 weeks, then it's not as good, but you can get direct deposit and then the card is virtually free except for withdrawing from an ATM. Though you can always get cash back when making a purchase from stores for free. It can also be fed into a Paypal account. Walmart's card is similar, and is free with a loading fee. I will keep using western unions for personal and probably get the liquid card for my business.

name: Lauren Penny
review: I've had a Chase Visa credit card for 5 years now.  It's been a great way to make those big purchases (new sofa, school clothes for the kids, etc.) without hurting my savings.  I've always been prompt with my payments and have enjoyed the many perks of using my Chase Visa.  When I consolidated my cards, I chose to use this one as my only credit card because the customer service has always been polite, prompt and super helpful.  Our next purchase is our Disney vacation, and I'd like to thank Chase in advance for making it an easier, stressfree trip.  And the cash back option always makes for a nice treat.

name: Chrissy Bruce
review: The Disney Rewards Visa card from Chase has helped our family realize our vacation plans. We currently earn 1% in Disney Dream Reward Dollars on purchases we make with our credit card. For every $100.00 spent on & purchases on the card, we earn one Disney Dream Reward Dollar. One Disney Dream Reward Dollar is worth $1.00 when redeeming it for Disney products and offers.In addition to earning Disney Dream Reward Dollars, the Disney Rewards Visa card from Chase comes with many perks. If you take your card to any of the Disney Parks, you are entitled to discounts at some of the park stores and also a "meet and greet" and photo opportunity with some of the Disney characters. You can get credit on a Disney Cruise and also interest free Disney Vacation Club financing. You can get discounted Broadway tickets to Disney shows and discounts on Disney magazines as well.Redeeming your Disney Dream Reward Dollars is easy. You can request a Disney Rewards Redemption Card as soon as you have 20 Dream Dollars. A Disney Rewards Redemption Card is accepted at most Disney locations. Instead of paying by cash or credit card, you're redeeming the Dream Dollars you've earned. You can get a Redemption Card by mail or at one of the Disney Parks.It took us a while to earn as many Dream Dollars as was needed for our Disney vacation. However, by using our Disney Visa card for everyday purchases, Chase is certainly helping us reach our goal of another Disney vacation soon.

name: Lawerence Ambert
review: When took over my family's business we were looking for a way to maximize rewards and bonuses for our employees. Being a small engineering firm we needed a way to give incentive to our employees, and the Chase Ink Bold card has the best program we could find for a business charge card. Since we are an engineering firm, we have large supply, internet, and phone bills that we need to pay each and every month. Within the first month we hit the $5,000 requirement for the initial bonus of 50,000 points, allowing us to essentially pay the annual fee for the annual fee for the next 5 years. It's a wonderful card that allows us to redeem the travel bonuses and pass the benefits on to our employees. We really enjoy using it and haven't run in to any issues with VISA or Chase bank when paying the bill or using the card for basic expenses. We highly recommend this card to any business looking for a charge card with great rewards.

name: Sean McKillion
review: Just got this credit card 2 months ago and I'm extremely satisfied.  The initial draw for me was the promotion to transfer balances without any fees and 0% APR for 15 months.  I ended up moving some money of my 17.99% APR card and am now saving a significant amount of interest.  In addition to this offer, the chase seamlessly integrates with my pre-existing Chase online account making checking balances and making payments a breeze.  While I've only had the card for a short amount of time I couldn't be happier!  Now I just need to pay off this balance before the 0% offer drops.

name: Gary Elliott
review: I have been pretty happy with the chase sapphire card since I have had it. The rate is not the best but it is not the worst either. It was very easy to apply and I got my card pretty quickly after I did. The rewards program is pretty good, I was awarded a good amount of points upon sign up and they have a good program for a few different airlines to gain points. The few times I have had to call customer service they were pretty fast and friendly. After 2 years I have nothing bad to say so I would recommend this card for people looking for a no annual fee card.

name: Lacy Edgemon
review: One of the best cards I've ever used. As someone who frequents the parks (and at times would like to, but can't quite afford it), this card is perfect for helping me pay for a lot of those trips. It can be used at any of the Disney parks, however I've only used it in Florida. As I buy things on it, the reward points stack up quickly and can be used at the parks as Disney currency. I also love that with this card, I can get access to special events or even special discounts for things at the park, like a hotel room. It's perfect!

name: Frederick Hein
review: This was the first credit card. I have always paid on time so I have not yet to see what happens if you are late. The first week I lost my card and Chase was very helpful in getting me a new card and cancelling out my first one. I went on using the card about three months before I found out that I had to set up the rewards account, but one of the times I called customer service, they notice that I didn't have it set up.SO they let me know and helped me set it up. It is a great first card and I will recommend it to anyone who banks with Chase.

name: Lala Reese
review: I got my Chase Freedom card for the balance transfer feature. I was able to secure a 0% APR for the first year and I’ve been hooked ever since. My card has a lower interest rate than many other comparable credit cards. I also get great rewards for using my card. I like to cash in my rewards for gift cards that I give away as gifts for birthdays and other special events. I also like that Chase Freedom has promotions for zero-balance transfer every now and then. This is an easy way to get a no-interest short term loan. I would recommend this card to anyone.

name: Peter Anka
review: Basically, an excellent credit card. It's really difficult deciding how to even know which credit card is right for you, but I got a letter in the mail from Chase saying I may be eligible (they always say that!) but as it turns out, I was. I've always been scared of credit cards, my father always said they're a bad thing....but the truth is, they're a necessity in the modern world. This card is great for two reasons: 1. the rates are reasonable and 2. it's a good credit builder without being extortionate. I confidently use it for some small stuff, like movie tickets, and then instantly pay it off. That said, I like that I could fall back on the card in the time of an emergency.

name: Tuyet Fane
review: Visa has been the only credit card company that I've used since I started using credit cards and the Sapphire Card is one of the very good ones. The card is good for people who are familiar with the perks and point system on credit cards, but it is also a very good credit card for a new credit card user, such as a teenager. It's easy to get used to and the rewards are a major bonus. I kind of got the card out on a whim, because I barely knew anything about it, but the card just kind of grew on me. The no annual fees is nice, and it has a very low interest rate. I recommend this card for anybody who wants a solid company owned credit card with great service and function.

name: David Allen
review: Although I have had some trouble with my credit card in the past.  It came in very handy when I was in emergency situations and had no other alternative.  Now that I have it under control, I use it for things like groceries and gas to get more reward points.  I have it paid off within a month or two, and don't pay much on my balances.  When I had someone use my credit card in France, they contacted me immediately and we got the matter resolved quickly and with little hassle.  Chase helped me when I needed it most, and I will continue to bank with them in the future.

name: Ty Bennewitz
review: I have been using the Chase Amazon Visa for the past year or so.  While it may not have the best rewards program out there, it does suit my needs quite well because I shop so much on Amazon.  The interest rate is rather high, but it doesn’t matter to me because I pay off my balance in full every month.  I consistently get at least 25 dollars a month in Amazon credit using the card for my every day purchases.  I use the points to get items that I would have already purchased on Amazon anyway, so it is really a win-win.  You even get a bonus for signing up for the card, which varies depending on when you apply.

name: Annie Waugh
review: I love my Amazon.com rewards card. I've had it a couple of years and have gotten a lot of stuff for free with points. A while back I started hankering for a really good food dehydrator and saw that Amazon.com had it. I've been saving my points for almost a year and am now only $30 dollars away from getting a $149.99 Excalibur for free. I'm getting pretty excited!

name: Annie Waugh
review: I forgot to mention that I have not signed up for Amazon Prime because I'm not interested in purchasing the kinds of things that would be a good deal (mostly digital toys I think). BUT, I almost always get free shipping by shopping carefully, saving up my "cart" until it has the $25.

name: Annie Waugh
review: Also, for those of you that balk at the APR; pay the silly thing off by the end of the billing period and you'll never have to pay interest. Buying what you can't pay for is a bad idea anyway if you want to keep your hard earned money. Why turn it into vapor for the use of rich people anyway?? I make a payment once a week on half the balance. It's a habit. I never pay interest.

name: Mariah Shepard
review: I first got my Chase Freedom card about a month ago, and despite my feelings about having a credit card, I really like it. If it weren’t for the card there would have been a lot of things I wasn’t able to do and bills I wasn’t able to pay because I had just started a new job and hadn’t gotten my first paycheck yet. I love the 5% cash back offer, though to be honest I’m not too crazy about the categories for this three months. The limit on the card starts out low, only $500 but I like that as well because it can help keep you from going credit crazy. I would say that this is a very good card for first time credit card holders.

name: Arletta Borling
review: There's a reason people gush about this card, and it starts right when you pick it up. I see here the signup is still the staggering 40,000 points it was when I got in, and the perks don't end there. This isn't a must for all travelers, but it's pretty close. While I'm not an expert everything I've read has told me the additional Preferred fee is worth it, and nothing in my experience has told me otherwise. It's always best to tread lightly with your credit card usage, but if you're a responsible person this one is almost assuredly going to treat you well. This is a long term card, if you plan on sticking with it for a while you'll be better off for it.

name: Burt Strietenhofer
review: I opened this card back in college and have been using it for about 8 years now on and off.  I think the rewards program of 1% cash back all the time is pretty decent, but I find that the 5% offers that are good for 3 months at a time could be better.  Sometimes they are for movies, department stores, and home improvement stores which I don't visit frequently enough to value the rewards.  Other times though, they will be for gas, hotels, and flights, which is really helpful in saving money for large transactions, even if it is only 5 cents per dollar.  I think this credit card is decent and the APR isn't terrible, although I do pay off the card every month.  I wouldn't necessarily recommend this card over others that I have used, but if you just want some easy rewards and are willing to keep up with the payments, then this card should work just fine for you.

name: Christopher Olive
review: I absolutely adore this card.  I originally got it earlier this year since my family is going to Disney early next year, and flight costs were absolutely going to kill out budget for the trip.  The initial standard offer was fifty thousand points for signing up, which would have gotten me pretty much two of the three tickets I need for my family to fly from BWI to Orlando.  The day after I got my card, I received a different offer of eighty thousand points if I spent three thousand dollars in the first three months.  I was a bit sad at the timing, but when I called customer service, they gave me the updated offer immediately!  With this, I was able to purchase the tickets I needed completely on points with Southwest, and am nearly able to afford to rent the van my brood needs on points as well.  Excellent customer service, and very valuable rewards.

name: Antonina Redko
review: This card is a grand rip-off. Agree with the previous - Won Buddy Lee's - comment. I have 60,000 avios points at my Chase British Airways credit card, which won't give me any advantage to use. If you book a flight from U.S. to a destination in Europe be ready to pay with your Avios plus HUGE TAX. For example, to go to Barcelona from Washington, D.C. costs 55,000 Avios plus 700$ tax. You can find the regular ticket for about $800. I don't forget you have to pay $95 annual fee for the card. So you don't save anything. I wonder if a law suit could be filed against the card for false advertising (for not disclosing how high the tax is). I tried to find tickets inside U.S. (Las Vegas), but was given a message that BA or partners do not fly to this destination.

name: Jason Freund
review: When I first switched to this card a few years ago, it was because it was rated the highest value in terms of miles redemption.  That was the reason I joined, but the reason I plan to stay with them indefinitely is because when you call customer service, a live person answers the phone (not a phone tree).

name: Michelle Kellum
review: I decided to get this Disney credit card after a trip to Disney World.  The kids were begging to go back as soon as we got home.  When I saw this offer, I figured it would be an easy way to save a little extra money towards our next trip.  At first I wasn't that impressed with the amount of rewards earned, but I'm surprised by how fast they seem to add up.  I love the benefit of the 0% financing for 6 months when I use the card to book a Disney vacation.  I recently booked our second trip, and that is helping me spread out my payments to make them more manageable without having to worry about paying interest.  There are several other rewards, such as shopping discounts and restaurant deals that are available at times also.  I've only had reason to contact customer service once since I've started using this card and the representative was friendly, helpful, and was able to resolve my problem quickly.  If you plan to go to one of the Disney parks and/or shop frequently at the Disney store, I definitely recommend this card.

name: Sang Renfrew
review: This card is one of the best card I have ever owned. I use this card on almost all the purchases I make. The APR on this card is not bad at all as compared to the other cards. The first year there is no fee but after that there is a fee but it is less than $100. I have never had to call the customer service for this card but I have heard that the customer service is very helpful and solves the problems as efficiently as they can. I have used this card on my international travels also and there are no transaction fees when I used it overseas. That is a plus. They also have bonus points  so the more you use it, the more bonus points you get and can take advantage of it.

name: Terisa Spiry
review: I initially got this card for the zero APR for two years. This is pretty much money for free… It’s even more of “free money”, than rewards and points and miles and such.  I don’t know how people don’t see this. Just calculate how much interest you paid over two years and compare it with the cash back deals others cards are offering. In my case it was much much more. Anyway, as I said, I first got it for the zero APR, but now this is my main card, although the free period has ended. Pretty simple, the APR the give is currently the lowest, and again, this is much more money, than all cash backs and miles combined.

name: Cooper Ong
review: The chase sapphire preferred card is a great card, especially if you travel a lot.  For just signing up, you get 40,000 points or 40,000 miles that can be transferred to any airline, and on top of that, they give you a 20% bonus when you redeem them on travel through their website ($500).  You get 2x points for travel and 1x points for everything else.  The card is also metal feeling and heavy and makes you feel like a VIP.  Also, the customer service for this card is great and helps you with whatever issues you may be having.

name: Michael Johnson
review: I have had my Chase Slate Card for almost a year now. Maybe not enough time to give an accurate review of the card. But so far I have had no issues. The customer service is top rate, very willing to help you and assist in all your problems and concerns. They will explain any charge or fee, etc that you have on your account. and I don't have to struggle to understand what they are saying. They don't make you feel like you are dumb and should have known the answer. The interest rate is comparable to most credit cards. I like the blueprint schedule that they give you the option to use. If helps you to know how much you have to pay each month in order to pay off the balance on the purchases. This card couldn't be more perfect for me.

name: Kristi Dalton
review: I applied for this card back in 2009 and have been with Chase ever since.  The attractive interest rates, and low rate balance transfer fees are the main reasons that I applied for this card.  I like the fact that I am given different categories for the cash back rewards. The main reason I chose this card however was the Blueprint program.  I really like being able to select how my payment is distributed each month. This feature allows me to pay down monthly purchases without accruing interest. All in all this is a good card that I am pleased to have.

name: Clement Reichardt
review: I began as a regular banking customer with Chase, and was eventually offered the Slate card a couple of years ago. The card had a zero balance transfer fee, so I used it to pay off another credit card with a high interest rate. It was a great card for paying off the balance. I set up automatic payments on the Chase website and it was taken care of each month. I found the website simple and easy to use, compared with the websites of some other cards I have used. But then something strange happened with the card. I was traveling overseas and planned to rent a car. I presented the card to the rental car company and they refused it because the design of the card would not fit into their card machine. For some reason, the name and numbers on the Slate card are printed in a different place than on most cards, and this made it impossible for them to imprint my information at the rental car place. It caused quite a bit of unexpected problems for me, for a seemingly silly reason. Just something to watch out for!

name: Michael Bellamy
review: I've had this card for about 9 months, it has its benefits and it has some drawbacks. The biggest benefit is that this card lets you accumulate points whenever you stay at a Marriott Hotel. Marriott owns Courtyard and Residence Inn hotels as well, which may be more economical. Of course you get bonus points for flying as well when you use this card but not at the same rate as Marriott Hotel spending. Outside of this the credit card is very much like other credit cards I have, which means interest rates, grace periods, etc. The bottom line is if you travel a lot you can accrue lots of bonus points with this card, it's very good for business travel.

name: Joseph Dowling
review: I have had a really good experience with chase credit cards. I really like that I got zero percent interest for the first year. They also gave me a lot higher credit limit than I was expecting. I had a charge that I did not know about and they were very helpful with figuring out where the charge came from. I have to say that I am a very happy chase customer. I would recommend Chase to anyone looking for a good credit card. I like all of the reward points for using my Chase card also since it adds up fast.

name: Sung Kensinger
review: My favorite business credit card is the Chase Ink business card. I have the Ink Cash card, which I chose originally because I prefer cash back to rewards points, although I understand they have a points card too. I love the cash rewards because they never expire. It's exactly the right card for my business. There's never been an annual fee, which I love. What I like most is the consistency: I know exactly what to expect, and that's exactly what I get. My business is very small, so I can only recommend the card based on my experiences, but I would recommend it to any small business owner. As far as Chase is concerned, I'm a customer for life!

name: Joseph Dowling
review: I was in the market for a new credit card because the interest rate on mine went up. Someone had told me about the Chase Freedom Card so I decided to look into it. I like the 0% for 15 months and the 100 cash back after spending 500 in 3 months. I pay everything on my credit card and pay it off each month so this was easy for me.I got the 100 cash back pretty quickly too. I was a little disappointed with the customer service aspect, but luckily I have only had to call them once and it wasn't even anything important. I just wanted to update my phone number and it seemed to take forever. Other than that, I am completely satisfied with this card and the company. Will recommend to anyone.

name: Christian Pautsch
review: Good credit card that I have been using for some time now. Picked it up when Amazon offered me a gift card if I signed up. Never regretted it. I have been saving up my points since the beginning, with plans to buy a new computer monitor for myself. Good website, easy to pay, easy to use (especially on Amazon.com). What more could you ask for? The only thing missing is a better breakdown of where my points are coming from. Other than that, it's perfect! I would highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a new card, ESPECIALLY if you frequent Amazon.com.

name: Veola Manni
review: I haven't had this card very long, but it has proven to be pretty good so far. I have several credit cards that I use for specific things, but this card has become my everyday use card. The rewards system they offer is an added bonus to this card and I love the fact that I build rewards off from everyday purchases rather than only at specific locations and stores like I've dealt with in the past. When I first opened the card, I was offered a deal of 50,000 bonus miles if I spend $3,000 in the first three months. It's been easy for me to do that, as I said, I use the card for all of my purchases and then I just pay it off in full at the end of the month. Well, I got my 50,000 bonus miles and didn't have to follow up with anyone or fight with customer service to get it. Those miles are awesome and as I build more rewards, I know they will come in handy. Customer service at Chase is outstanding. I've called a few times with questions regarding my card and everyone I've spoken with has been great. They answer my questions, make sure I understand and are always pleasant with doing so. Never condescending like with some companies I've dealt with.

name: Eddie Chow
review: I really love this card. I use this card to pay for rent to get the points that I need for free flights. Being a college student, this card as really helped me to fly back home. It's nice how you are given so many points when you first get the card. I have flown 1 round trip flight this year and planning another for my winter break. So far so good, I have really enjoyed getting the points to fly. I would recommend this card to anyone who wants to fly for free. Southwest is a great airline and I've had nothing but good experiences with them.

name: Elmer Thivierge
review: This card is one of my newer ones, replacing a card that I had for years and was no longer happy with.  So far, I'm very happy with the switch and find their rewards program to be one of the best that I've ever used.  It didn't take long at all to earn the initial bonus, and through regular use (and payments!) the points just keep adding up.  I've had rewards cards in the past, but it felt like it took forever and use after use after use to be able to earn any worthwhile.  Not so with this one.  The starting rate and credit limit was also very good; better than some other cards I've used in the past.

name: Kyle Way
review: I got this card back in 2006 at age 22 with zero credit. Only a $500 limit which has grown to $2500 in 6 years. I have never missed a payment but the interest has stayed around 23%. The rewards however are great. 3% back on Amazon purchases adds up quick along with 2% on gas and 1% on everything else. Back then they mailed you a gift certificate for rewards but now you can do it all electronically. It's automatically added to your Amazon account. They have other rewards but that's all I ever use. Customer service has been fantastic and even waived a fee once when I accidentally went over my limit. Overall this card has just did exactly what it's supposed to without hassle.

name: Marcus Kaplan
review: This is a great credit card. In terms of purely cashback rewards, I don't think there's a better card available, particularly when you add in the bonus cashback upon initial sign up. I always pay my bill fully, on time, and have never had any issues with late fees or high rates, or anything of that nature. I frequently check my online account to be sure that there's nothing suspicious (relatedly, the online and mobile application user interfaces are both pretty good).There was one instance when I had a pair of suspicious charges that weren't mine - so when I called customer service, they immediately removed the charges and sent me a new card with a different number. Customer service is very good with Chase.All in all, the 5% categories are worthwhile and the cashback is easy to acquire and use (statement credits, checks in the mail, or use it to buy gift cards or other rewards). The customer service is great, and I've had no other issues. I would certainly recommend this card to anyone interested in good cashback rewards.

name: Jessica Hodgkinson
review: I have had a chase freedom credit card for approximately 4 years now, and I have been pleased overall with my whole experience with it. Thus far I have had my credit limit raised three separate times, which is a nice surprise when it happens. I had my information for this card stolen a couple years back, and as soon as I informed them of the unauthorized charges they immediately removed them from my account, returned the stolen funds, and began an investigation of the charges no questions asked. In that respect and many others, the customer service is absolutely excellent. You can't beat getting 5% cash back on different categories every three months  and 1% cash back on everything else, either. It is a great card, and Chase does its best to provide everything its customers need.

name: Zona Souders
review: I've had this card for just over a year now but have been a long time customer of Chase.  With this specific card, I've been able to accumulate reward points to use towards cash back, movies and other free items just for using a credit card I was going to be using in the first place. I receive 1% cash back for every purchase which is a big plus for me as I tend to use my card every day.  Every 3 months they have this system where they give you 5% back on all of your purchases in certain categories and that certainly helps you rack up points faster.  You can earn even more cash back while shopping online through them which is another big plus for those of us who like do a lot of purchasing online  While I enjoy the rewards program, my only gripe is the interest rate.  While mine isn't bad, I've never been late on a payment in the many years I've been with Chase and for no reason they jacked my APR up by nearly 6%.  Overall, I've been happy with the rewards offered by Chase Freedom and have also been satisfied with the customer service.  They've always been so helpful with mystery charges on my statements and when I travel cross country.

name: Kelsey Nadig
review: I have had a great experience with this card -- the high credit limit gives me the peace of mind that my card won't be needlessly rejected if I have to make a couple of big purchases one week. This has been a problem for me with other cards that won't raise my credit limit for reasons they can't explain, but the Chase card starts out with enough so that this wasn't even an issue. The rewards system is really easy and convenient, including the cash back when I first signed up, the 5% special categories, and the 1% everything else. You get points for these in an "Ultimate Rewards" account, which I always just apply right back to my bill. Love that feature. You cannot schedule payments closer than 3 days apart online, which can be annoying but has not caused me any problems. I also pay my CC bill early or on time every single time, so I cannot comment on any experiences with carrying a balance or interest rates or any of that. For people like me who want great rewards, a high credit limit, and who pay off the balance each month, this card is a great option.

name: Adrian Laudermilk
review: I used a sapphire card for a little over a year before switching to a different Visa.  I will sadly admit I switched over to the Sapphire after having seen a commercial for it on tv and was pulled in by the seemingly very inclusive points program.  I travel a lot and the bonus points that can go toward your airfare and other expenses was very enticing.  While I never had many issues using the card itself the points bonuses were just not enough of a reason to keep a card (this may stem from me not using it as often as my debit card) so I decided to cancel it.  The few times I dealt with their customer support were very positive they handled any problems I had very well and I would definitely recommend their card to a friend.

name: Lorita Erick
review: So far, I'm quite satisfied with this card as a first or "starter" credit card. The 15 months at 0% APR introductory offer, 0% balance transfer (only a small fee for the transaction), along with the web tools and auto-pay, have really made my experience a positive one. The one downside I see is a fairly high APR (relative to my credit rating) set to kick in after 15 months. Despite this unfavorable rate, they've been very clear how long I have until it kicks in, and what other conditions (late payments, etc.) would force it to kick in. Transparency, especially in a market that can often try to trick consumers, is very much appreciated. I'm not aware of any rewards program on this card, but I don't charge enough on it to make a difference.

name: Adrian Półtorzycki
review: Chase Freedom Visa Credit Card is another stellar credit card from my favorite bank Chase. They have an awesome offer of getting a $100 cash back if you spent $500 in the first three months. This wasn’t a problem at all for me because I got this card to help me out in getting a new TV. With this card not only was I able to purchase the TV that I wanted I also got a $100 back. Another awesome things about this card are the rewards for staying in hotels so I always take this card with me when going on a vacation. The APR isn’t stellar but it isn’t bad either, I would definitely recommend this card.

name: Alexander Insco
review: This credit card is mediocre at best – the features it offers barely balance out the problems. It’s really only worth getting if you are a frequent customer of Marriott hotels (obviously), since the majority of the rewards are Marriott focused. I had a few issues with the card not registering points properly, and when I attempted to call their customer service lines it was a huge ordeal trying to get them to properly give the points I should have earned. The $85 annual fee is a bit steep, but assuming that you fly frequently and accrue enough points, you could end up getting a free night at one of the hotels, so it balances out.

name: Devin Brennan
review: I applied for this card mainly because of the initial sign up bonus points.  Since then, I have been using it for everything.  International travel is a breeze and there are no fees.  Also, if you dine out or purchase anything travel related (hotel, car, etc.) you also get 2 points per dollar.  Just for dining out in one year you can easily make back in rewards points what you lost from paying the annual fee.  Yes, the annual fee is expensive but the points and the customer service is worth it.  I had to call them internationally to get my card approved for the country I was in and I literally was on the phone talking to a representative in less than 30 seconds.  My card was approved and confirmed working in under 2 minutes.  You never have to wait for their customer service and you always get to talk to a professional.

name: Jennifer Carlyle
review: I have had my Chase Slate Card for a couple years now. Although my credit limit is not that high, I always paid the minimum if not more and I did pay it off occasionally as well. I never let it get over $700. Just recently, it was set to expire. I had used it two days prior, and wanted to know what my balance was as I was planning to pay it off in full. I called and the representative said my account was closed. Closed? How could it be closed? She said that because of my Bank of America card balance being high, Chase cancelled my card. Needless to say it had a balance of $440 and was not at the limit. I had been paying on it. The representative said I could call back when I pay more on my Bank of America card and they would reinstate my account. Sorry Chase, but you just lost a customer.

name: Christin Dine
review: love this card!  so easy to book plane tickets and other trip and hotels.  Also they have amazing fraud alert- they contacted me within a couple hours of charges that did not look like our and put a hold on my card until they got ahold of me.  The online statements and payment are super easy to use and the bonus points are great.

name: Whitney Thompson
review: what are you trying to win, eh?

name: Johnny Last
review: The card is great for those consumers like myself seeking to get the most out off their rebates. With the Chase freedom card the perks are similar in that with certain categories you get a certain percent back ( aka every 3 months you receive 5% back in a category) but the VISA logo is accept virtually everywhere.Bottom line, the Chase Freedom card is a great for my family because it's widely accepted and as long as I pay of my balance each month, I won't accrue interest and my rebate will check will get bigger! Note: In order for any rewards card to make sense, the balance must be paid of each month otherwise, this would be a crapy card for those consumers with balances. A great card to recommend.

name: Kayla Robbins
review: I always hear rave reviews of this card. Nearly every site praises it as like, the best card that ever was oh my goodness. So, I have to assume that it's fairly nice, haha. No annual fee is always great, and it’s with Visa so acceptance rates are high. The current cashback promotion is great if you’re going to spend that much in a month anyway, but obviously don’t use it as an excuse to go on a wild spending spree.  Cash back rewards never expire! Which is good because you certainly have every opportunity to earn a lot of it. You need time to decide what to do with alllll that money. =p

name: Meagan Boucher
review: this card seems really awesome, I think I'll go get one :)

name: Travis Longenbach
review: I got this as my first credit card in order to build a credit history when I turned 18.  I pay the balance in full every month, so I have never had any reason to care about the interest rates.  I enjoy getting points using this card and have redeemed them for kitchen items that I wasn't able to rationalize spending money for.  Specifically, I got a griddle and a very nice Chicago knife set.  As a college student, I don't have the luxury of spending very much, so the points are pretty helpful and just build up over time.  Overall I've found the Chase Freedom card to be very useful and I've never had a problem using it or dealing with Chase.

name: Thomasena Penister
review: To all those considering getting this card. Get it.Having used this card for almost 1 year now, I can say that this card is absolutely wonderful. With cash back on signup and cash back on many essential products, this card has saved me so much money. Also, with this card you get Chase's perfect customer support, having protection on the card to prevent any sort of fraud. And if by some unlucky chance you do get scammed, Chase will clear everything for you quickly. Chase's service along with the rewards for this card were enough to win me over, and I've been building my credit ever since. I've had no regrets getting this card, and everyone else should get it too. As long as you pay your bills on time, you'll love this card and never regret anything.

name: Vincent Grove
review: I've been using this card for a few months now, and I have to agree with the other comments, this is a solid credit card. I was recently traveling abroad when my luggage along with my chase card were stolen from my hotel room. After returning to the states I was able to contact a representative over at Chase and let them know of the situation. They were very helpful in helping me close the card and the whole process took no more than 15 mins. All in all their great customer service and the rewards featured with this card will keep me a happy customer in the months to come.

name: Sybil Alloway
review: The major issues I have with this card are the very low regular rewards points and the annual fee, which is slightly high considering the benefits of the card. I think the fee is honestly an average cost attempt by them to recoup the initial bonus after a few years from people who never pay interest charges because they always pay on time. The bonus points are well worth getting the card for if you plan on spending that 3000, which is honestly a very easy thing to do if you use it as your primary card. I've personally never had a problem with the card thankfully so I can't really comment on how they handle things like identity theft or unwanted purchases. There seems to be a mileage/bonus point account shuffling trick mentioned lower down on this page which I honestly wish I knew about earlier. All in all, worth it for the initial bonus, if nothing else.

name: Michael Lamb
review: I have had this card for some time now and I can honestly say that it is one of the best deals going. The sign up bonus is for real too! I cashed it in right away by applying it to the balance I had charged up the month before. It only took a fast phone call. The rebates they offer on purchases is pretty nice too! 5% on many things that change each annual quarter and 1% on everything all the time. So I charge everything now. Cash is obsolete for me any more! The categories change every 3 months so keeping up with what the current one is is a bit of a hassle, but definitely worth it! I figure I have racked up hundreds in cash rebates so far just buying the stuff I used to pay cash for. Sure there are other cards that do something similar, but Chase makes it easier to get that free money. Just be sure to pay off the balance each month!

name: Kate Tracy
review: I got this card for a couple of reasons. First of all, I’m addicted to Amazon Kindle and MP3 and the thirty dollar bonus was a major incentive to sign up. The interest rate was also low, and since I’m still young and building my credit, it seemed like a win-win situation. I’ve been very happy with Amazon’s customer service over all. The card came quickly in the mail, and it’s really convenient to use it when I’m purchasing books and other products from them online. I like being able to keep track of these purchases separately, especially since I use Amazon to buy or rent most of my text books and need to be able to see exactly how much I spent on them at the end of the year. This is a great card for building credit and for established users, in my opinion!

name: Buddy Stier
review: I got a Chase Freedom credit card after college because I was going to make some big purchases moving into my new place and starting my new "post-college" lifestyle.  The 100 dollar cash back initially and the other cash back bonuses were great for me starting out without too much cash.  I have never had trouble getting too far into debt with credit cards, but this one allowed me a little flexibility to get over that initial hump as I newly entered the workforce.  To this day, I use this credit card for most of my purchases and I love the cash back rewards it offers.

name: Chris Greer
review: I really like this card, especially because it is linked to my amazon account.  I thought about using another card that would have rotating benefits so that when I bought gas or went to restaurants I would get more points, but I realized that I use amazon a lot.  Also, even though gas is expensive, it costs much less than things like restaurants and grocery store expenses.  All in all, I think my amazon.com purchases and restaurant expenses make up the majority of my spending each month.  That's why this card is good because I will get either 3% or 2% on every dollar I spend unrelated to rent and bills.  The other cool thing is that you can automatically use your points from the card and apply them to any purchase on Amazon.  The "dollars" you spend via applied points will also give you 3 points per dollar - at least that's what the amazon customer service reprasentative told me.

name: WalletHub
review: It's good that you've been so happy with your Amazon.com Credit Card, but if you're still interested in saving on gas and groceries, you should check out the Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express.  it offers 6% cash back at supermarkets, 3% at gas stations and department stores, and 1% on everything else.  While this card does charge a $75 annual fee, it also offers a $150 initial rewards bonus when you spend $1,000 during the first three months, so you're covered for the first two years.

name: Mike Water
review: My long-time girlfriend uses this card often for travelling, because she stays at the Hyatt whenever possible. That part of the card is great! She earns extra nights, and then we go on vacation! Apart from the Hyatt rewards, however, this card doesn't have much going for it. There's no intro period, which isn't too big of a deal. The rate isn't too bad, maybe under most rates out there, but you just don't get many perks other than with the actual Hyatt hotels. This is the type of card you want to use while you're staying there, but other than that you'll probably be better off with a different card.

name: William Catapano-Cooper
review: I have never had a serious problem with this card. I don’t use it as often as most people would but in an emergency, it’s great to have as a backup. I have made purchases with it overseas and I have received calls to verify that I am the actual cardholder making the purchase. My rates are not outrageous and I can’t recall a time when I ever had to dispute a charge to this card. It works everywhere and I have never had it declined. If you are looking for something to keep as an emergency assurance card, this is the one.

name: Asha Delgardo
review: The Chase Freedom card was the first credit card I’ve opened since building credit with my student credit card from Bank of America. I must say, I’ve heard many horror stories about credit cards and I’m lucky I went with Chase. Their cash reward always seems to rack up faster than my other credit cards and I use them the same amount. They have been helpful whenever I’ve called; especially the time I had my wallet stolen. Just recently when my payment date fell on Labor Day and I was unaware until it was too late and they waived my late fee. I’m very lucky to have chosen Chase Freedom as my first official credit card.

name: WalletHub
review: So what are the pros and cons in your opinion of this Chase Freedom card?

name: Austin Winner
review: A great card for me since I do almost all of my online shopping through Amazon.  Using the card daily everywhere else allows me to get most of my purchases through Amazon for free using Reward points.  The initial $30 bonus snagged me in, but the rewards keep me using it over my other credit cards.  It's very simple to use the reward points and check on the point balance.  The only gripe is that the credit limit is a little low but that might be just for me.  The card is picked up nicely by Mint.com which I use to track my expenses.

name: Derick Doria
review: I got the Hyatt card thinking that it would be a great card for my husband and I seeing as how much we like to travel. We always enjoy staying at the Hyatt when on vacation so we thought it would be a great perk to have available and rack up free nights to help in cutting our expenses. It was proving to be beneficial at first seeing that we received two free nights after we made our first purchase. It didn't go well from there. I hadn't paid attention to the fact that we only were getting one point per dollar on our transactions outside of the Hyatt purchases. It was a little disappointing. It is a decent card, however unless you frequently go to the Hyatt, it's not as great as competitor cards.

name: Kellie Lamphere
review: I just got my Amazon.com credit card a few months ago but I am already extremely pleased with it. I use amazon.com for most of my online shopping so the $30 signing bonus gift card went to good use. I was surprised at how quickly the points added up as well. I had only used the card sparingly over the last 2 months but was very pleased to find that I had earned enough points to completely cover the shipping on my last purchase. One feature of their service that I have been really pleased with is their texts. I can text them with "bal" from my phone and will have a text back with my current balance within a minute or two.For what it's worth, this is my fourth major credit card that I have tried, and this is the one I plan to stick with.

name: Bob Hanson
review: My wife is the one that mostly uses this card because she travels a lot for her job. At first I was concerned about the $85 annual fee; but, once I realized that you basically get a free room at a Marriott hotel every year, it really made sense to have the card. And the bonus point are great since she gets them at 5 times the normal rate when she stays at a Marriott. Add in the fairly low interest rate and the fact that it is a Visa and not some brand of card that isn't taken everywhere, and this is a pretty good card to have.

name: Adrian Półtorzycki
review: Marriot Rewards Premier Credit Card is an ok card to have. The customer service is pretty terrible and the application process was a real big hussle. It took over two months for the company to get me the card after applying for it, it felt like forever. After getting this card I really haven’t gotten as much as I expected out of it. The interest rate is pretty bad and there is no rewards like any most of the other cards out there. I really would not recommend this card for anyone, it is average and it has a really bad delay after the application and also a horrible customer service line.

name: John Rea
review: The Disney Premier Credit Card is something my daughter wanted me to get. She saw it one day and urged me to get it. Living in Florida, I thought it would be a good idea to try it out since I only live a few miles from Disney World. I have owned the card for a few months now, and I am glad my daughter forced me to get it. The rewards, although not astounding, allows me to save up money for trips to Disney World without having to think about it. Ever since I've gotten this card, I have made monthly trips to Disney World, and my daughter couldn't be happier.

name: Deborah Tigner-Strong
review: I got this card from my local chase bank that I do all my checking through for my personal business. I have always paid on time and never had any issues with them saying it arrived late or anything of that nature. I have had this card for about eight years now and have never had them over charge me or add on extra fees like many other cards. The rewards cash back is great since I put many expenses for my business on the card I earn a lot of rewards through out the year. I use them to purchase office equipment and gas for my business. Helps with these smaller expenses. I would recommend any Chase card as my experience has been excellent so far and I enjoy banking with Chase as well.

name: Megan Wentworth
review: They are always wanting you to sign up for this at the airport and I thought I'd check it out.  Turns out you can accumulate enough points right off for a flight so right there it's worthwhile.
