It's always best not to carry a balance on your cards but this one has a pretty standard APR if you don't pay it each month.  It is easy to redeem the points online or by phone and you can get tickets for yourself or others with them.  Southwest is a great airline so it's nice to get rapid rewards points buying the things I would normally get anyway.  I like flying them best because they don't usually have hidden fees and they seem to be the best at taking off and landing on time.  This card is worth considering.  I've never had any bad experiences with it.

name: Lean Swiderski
review: I have had this credit card for almost 2 years now, and I have nothing but positive things to say about this card. One of the best things I love about this card is probably the 5% cash back program that they have. The 5% program is good in that it gives 5% cash back for some of the things you're most likely to buy during that quarter. For example, during the summer it gives you 5% cash back on airfare or gas. And, around Christmas, the people of Chase know that you'll be more likely to shop more, so you get more cash back on department stores and the likes. For items that do not qualify for the 5% cash back, there is always the 1% cash back. Also, thought it's always better to pay your card in full, sometimes it just doesn't happen, in those cases, this card is awesome in that, in comparison to other cards, the interest rates are not nearly as brutal. Another plus, is that there are no annual fees for all these great benefits!Something else I should probably mention (yes, another positive!), when you sign up for the card there are always bonuses! When I signed up, there was a $100 cash back for $500 spent in the first 3 months. But, on sites like Slickdeals, I've seen offers of as high as $300 cash back for $500 spent in the first 3 months. So, look out for those!

name: Glenn Hoyt
review: I have been a loyal customer with Visa for 15 years now. I enjoy my card and have given up having any other logo's , like MasterCard, and  Discover. Whenever I am required to provide a credit card, I know that I can count on my Visa to be there when I need it. I have had other cards that some retailers do not acknowledge and it leaves me scrambling to figure out how to remedy the situation. Thank you Visa for being there for me and my family when we have needed you. You have found a loyal customer in me for the rest of my life.

name: Andrew Augustine
review: I had this credit card a few years ago and ran it up like an idiot. But when I did have it, along with others, Chase was one of the few companies that worked with me to lower my interest rates and tried to help me get back on top of my expenses before I was completely out of my credit. I also did enjoy the reward points as well, especially after having the card for nearly two years, using it like crazy, and not having any idea that they were there. Needless to say, it was a nice bonus to find when I did get to it. I like Chase overall though. They are much better then the one I had in high school which shall remain nameless.

name: Victoria Lee
review: The Chase Sapphire card is a good card- as long as you don't mind paying the annual fee. You do get good customer service- you get through to a REAL person on the line. You get treated decently and don't get put on hold. You do get all the points and rewards they promise you. The card itself is kinda heavy though, like 3x as thick as a regular credit card. Also, the card info is typed on the back of the card, so some people get confused when you hand them the card.  Yeah, that part is annoying, when people take your card and takes them a while to realize how to swipe it and such.

name: Bethany Cantrell
review: We applied for and got a Disney Credit Card last year just before Christmas. They were offering $200 in gift cards for signing up and are we ever glad we did. We used the gift cards to help with Christmas gifts and have used the credit card ever since. We are very pleased with the credit card and the terms of the credit card. It is accepted most places and easy to stay on top of my account and the payments owed. We have never had to pay an annual fee and are able to check up on our account on the internet which is a bonus.

name: Milissa Sarnowski
review: I’ve had a number of credit cards in my time, but this one is my favorite. First, I was able to get in on this card while Amazon was offering a $50 store credit (as opposed to the usual $30). In addition, I am a frequent Amazon shopper, so the triple-point credit for Amazon purchases is a huge plus for me.I pay off my balance every month, so the points are just free money. I’ve bought a couple of nice computers  thanks to my high credit limit, and paid off the card immediately for a quick cash bonus.One tip I’d offer that some people might not think about: This card gives you several choices for redeeming points. You can redeem them for an Amazon credit, apply the points to your credit card balance, or even have a checked mailed straight to you. At face value, those options might seem pretty equal, but they aren’t! If you take the first option, you can buy more cool stuff at Amazon, but you won’t get bonus points for the purchase. Therefore, it’s actually better to take the cash (or reduce your card balance) and then use the card itself to buy your Amazon merchandise. Same amount of money spent either way, but using the card you get the points.

name: Megan Lynn
review: I began using the Amazon credit card, like many other people, for the sign up bonus of $30. I was debating whether or not to continue to use this card, and thought I was would it out for a bit and see if I liked their rewards program. As it turns out, I love using this card and plan on using it for a very long time! Getting three points for every dollar you spend when you use amazon.com is an AMAZING deal, many other places hardly even offer two points for every dollar spent. I used it most often when I was away at college, but definitely have used it beyond that point as well. It was super fast, super easy, and definitely a decision I do not regret. I’d recommend this card to absolutely anyone who asks! I still use this about once a week, whenever I make an amazon.com purchase especially.

name: Abir Bhattacharjee
review: I came from India to US in 2010 and right after a year of credit history building I applied for this card and got it with a credit limit of $1000. This card has awesome cash back feature. When I opened the credit card in a Chase Bank branch they gave me 1000 points (100 points=$1). For every $1 spent, it gives 1 point. For every transaction, it gives 10 point. For every $10 spent, it gives 1 point. What I try to do is use this for all sorts of transactions, preferably small transactions like buying eggs, milk which are typically $2- $3 transactions. For that I get 12-13 points. In this way if you spent about $100, you will get about 400-450 points from such small transactions. That is approximately 4% cash back. Also there are select categories, which change quarterly, from which you can get 5% cash backs. They contribute a lot to your total points. In a month I typically get about 20-30 points. Last month I went to Niagara and spent about $1900 that month. I got 4000 points and $40 as cash back. Oh and did I tell you, that if you spent $500 in the first 3 months using this card you get another 10000 points($100). This card is awesome. I recommend everyone to buy it.

name: Oui Ma
review: Ever since I received my card I've made this my primary card over my AMEX and Mastercard.  I guess the biggest draw for me is its reward program.  I like exchanging points for giftcards, and it has a good selection of giftcards for redemption.  Every now and then they have a discount on some of the cards and that's icing on the cake.  I also like that the Chase site is easy to use.  This didn't seem like a big deal at first but it's nice to be able to "one-stop shop" from the same site.  Comparing to my AMEX, it's very easy to see your balance and redeem.The rotating categories of 5% back kept you always trying to remember when to use it for what.  As a result, I suspect most people just make this their default card like me so that they never have to miss out on the 5% back when they shop for the quarter's chosen categories.In my 5-6 months of using it I've only have to contact their customer service once regarding a small dispute, and they were quick to resolve the issue so that makes me a happy customer.As a bonus - the card itself is also quite attractive - that makes it a joy to use even though a dollar is a dollar =).

name: Jordon Mon
review: I got this mainly because of the 100 dollar reward after 500 spent. It's similar to a lot of other cards, not as much of a reward as some of the more exclusive cards offer, but it's definitely a nice bonus because that 500 was reached in the first two months of using it on purchases I had to make anyway. The incredibly cool thing about the card is that every quarter they change what the 5% reward applies to. If you're at all familiar with cash back rewards you'll know that 5 is exceedingly high and other cards approach 3 or so on specific purchases. The only drawback is that if you're juggling a lot of cards this is just one more card to have in mind and know what card you have to break out for whatever which purchase you happen to be making. The only drawback is the below average rate this card gets on purchases that aren't the favored 5% types currently going, which is why if you're good at juggling card balances this is something that will add to your tool kit of cash back cards, but definitely won't end up replacing all of them. Overall a simple card that is good for the specific things I got it for.

name: Kaelan Williams
review: Chase Sapphire is the best credit card that I have ever used.  When I was around 20, I applied for my first credit card, which was a big mistake. My interest rates were jacked up every single month, and I was in debt over my head. After the incident, I spent years not owning a single credit card. The only card that I used was a prepaid one, that didn’t require a contract. In recent months, I had a yearning to try out an actual credit card again. I can honestly say that I am now a proud customer of Chase Sapphire Visa. One of my favorite benefits from this card is that, when I travel to other countries, I get no transaction fee. I am a frequent traveler so I really benefit and save some cash this way. I get lots of bonus points as well, so that is very helpful, especially when I travel and need some extra cash. I am a fan for life, of this amazingly benefited card.

name: Sherilyn Spivak
review: I have been using my Amazon Credit Card for years now and I really love having it.  I always stay on top of the payments, so I use it very often to build up the points.   I personally think they have the best points for dollar system of any other credit card I’ve used.  Not to mention when I shop on Amazon it’s really so easy to just select the points as a payment method during check out.  In addition they are always updating their services for their credit card so I can manage it just through my Amazon account!  It really is so nice to avoid having to go to a separate website to deal with it on a regular basis.

name: Matt Butler
review: I've had the Chase Freedom Visa for a while now, and we've been fans of both the bank and this specific card.  It definitely allows us to earn back rewards, and gives us plenty of options as far as redeeming them.  We love Chase's online interface, too, as it lets us check on our balance, pay for the card, and get plenty of good information that might be hard to find from other banks.  We've been happy with our ability to get cash advances as well, when it has come to emergencies (like a vet bill), along with when we were a little short for our vacation.  I like the terms they offer for their cash advances, and they're reasonable if you're having a tight month as well.  I'd definitely recommend this card to anyone.

name: Natisha Donnellon
review: I have had two variations of this card over the last 5-6 years.  I absolutely love this credit card.  The rewards are fantastic, and I love the fact that they are all tied in with all of my Chase checking accounts.  I definitely could not choose a better card.  It's great the fact that they give you 1% cash back on all purchases, and 5% cash back on purchases that are the quarter categories.  I am glad I was able to gain credit with using these cards, and am excited to use them in the future.

name: Nita Zoda
review: I have multiple credit cards,  but I keep coming back to my Chase Visa Freedom card.  The rewards program is simple and easy to understand.  Keeping track of my points is easy.  I can check the Chase website, and on every statement there is a listing for my rewards points.  Redeeming the rewards points is an easy task.  I use it to choose from a huge assortment of gift cards they make available.  I pay my full balance every month, which in turn has helped me get a better credit score, and I have been able to get a larger line of credit. Also their customer service is top rate.  I lost a card, called them and within 2 days had a new card delivered. I highly recommend the Chase Freedom Card!

name: Deangelo Leonardis
review: As a huge Disney fan, I found this credit card to be both extremely useful and handy whenever my family travels to Disney theme parks. Comprised of four individuals, my family has found that this card saved us quite a sum of money whenever we frequented Orlando or Anaheim's Disney property every year. From the cash back benefits to the numerous awards for frequent dining or accommodations, this card has truly made Disney trips both affordable and rewarding. Also, the special rates for hotel rooms and rewards make this a worthwhile card worth investing in. In the end, I would highly recommend this credit card if you or your family wants to enjoy Disney to its fullest.

name: Lisa Evony
review: I've had my Amazon card for a number of years. Now, I use it almost exclusively to shop on Amazon. I like the points I get for shopping (3 per dollar for Amazon.com purchases). I use Amazon's Premier service so I don't have to pay for two-day shipping. I like that I can pay off the balance without a penalty, and the one time I had a problem with a purchase being charged twice, Chase resolved the issue immediately. Since I buy my textbooks online from Amazon, by the time the holidays roll around, I have enough points to use on Amazon to do a lot of my holiday gift shopping.

name: Mirtha Tattrie
review: I have a couple credit cards and the best one by far is my Chase Freedom card.  I have never had a problem with it and I am a big fan of the decent rewards and cash back program.  I find the rewards program to be better than most because it is pretty flexible compared to the last credit card that I had.  It also without a doubt lives up to its name.  Also I had problems with my card and bills so I called customer service.  They were speedy and did a great job of answering my questions and taking care of my problem.

name: Stephanie Hughes
review: I love this card! I too initially got the card because of the $30 sign up bonus. Over time it has really proven itself. Three points are given for gas and Amazon purchases and it is very easy to build points. The first time I got on Amazon and purchased something after using this card, I was shocked to see that I had almost $10.00 applied towards my purchase. I do not have fabulous credit and all things considered, the rates on this card are not terrible. I have been saving my points for Christmas time so I can buy my kids toys off of Amazon. This is also great because a lot of times Amazon has great deals on bulk products (diapers, toilet paper, etc.). So I am additionally getting extra rewards on everyday items. This is the only credit card I have been using and it has been nothing but a positive experience.

name: Stephen Samuels
review: If you have kids and are looking to gt them presents or treat them to a trip with your rewards then this is a must have.  I have two little ones at home and we don't always have the money for trips to Disney but with this card we are able to save up to help with the trip.  This is a huge plus and gives us something to look forward to.  If you don't have kids or like Disney then don't waste your time as there are better reward cards out there for you.  I've never had an issue with customer service on this card and would recommend it to any one that wants to take their family to Disney.

name: Dan Isbell
review: I recently got an Amazon card.  It was time to buy textbooks, and the $30 Amazon gift card you get for signing up was the main draw.  So obviously you get a pretty nice reward right off the bat.  I was also able to choose from a couple different card designs; I chose a color that made it stand out from my other cards.  The card is run by Chase, and I was able to get a pretty nice interest rate and credit line.  The ongoing rewards for the card are also quite good- the standard 1 point for 1 dollar spent on most things, with double points for gas and restaurants and then triple points for Amazon.com purchases.  I use Amazon fairly frequently, so I think I'll be able to get a lot of benefit from the rewards.

name: Corrine Equihua
review: Getting this credit card was big bonus for our family, as we frequent the Disney theme parks quite often each year. Our kids have a great time and this card is a perfect way to build rewards. The percentage back is a little lower than we would like, but it still is nice to get the rewards to apply towards our Disney trips. The card and the rewards make eating out and accommodations more affordable and give you that extra little bonus while on a trip that comes in handy. We have been to both California and Florida several times and will continue to go back, especially with this highly useful card and the rewards it offers. Highly recommended.

name: Donna Trosclair
review: I have had the Chase Slate card for about 3 years now. It has become the only credit card, out of the few I have, that I will use. Surprisingly this Card has a lower APR than a Credit Union Credit Card I own! I always thought Credit Unions would always be lower than a bigger bank card. I really enjoy using the Blueprint option for Chase. It lets you set up a schedule of paying off the entire balance or certain purchases. Blueprint will show you how much you will need to pay each month to achieve your goal. But, if you do not adhere to the Blueprint schedule that you created for yourself, as long as you pay the monthly minimum amount, it will not have a negative impact on your Credit Score.

name: Rodrigo Piccolomini
review: I’ve had this card for about six months now, and I love all the features it gives me.  The extra miles on sign up, of course are great, and the fact that they’re on United is even better.  Since I do most of my flying from Ohare in Chicago, these miles are great, and I can use them to fly directly almost anywhere in the world.  But the side perks are at least as important.  Priority boarding for my flights, free checked bag for me and a guest, and free United Club passes?  This all adds up to make for an amazingly enjoyable and comfortable trip, not to mention fact of having a great credit card from a reputable bank and airline.  I highly recommend this card to anyone looking for a new airline rewards card.

name: Beth SIim
review: My husband and I decided to get the Hyatt credit card after realizing how much we travel to see out of state family. We were so ecstatic about the idea of getting a couple of free stays at the hotel as part of the sign up deal that we didn't pay attention to the fact that the hotel is a far drive from where most of our family lives. We don't use the card as often as we had expected to, but our experiences with it have been positive. The company honored our free stays, and customer service was helpful in answering my questions about the reward system. We hope to get more use out of the card this holiday season!

name: Patty Macho
review: I have this card because it started out as a card from another company, that no longer exists, a number of years ago and eventually the account ended up owned by Chase after a few different mergers/buy outs.The terms are fine, on par with most non-secure cards for people with good credit. It has a rewards program (Ultimate Rewards). Base reward is 1% on all purchases, but there are quarterly categories that will earn 5% cash back on up to $1,500, though you have to sign up each quarter to get the 5%. You can get rewards as either cash back, or as gift cards or items. 2,000 points gets $20 cashback, gift cards seem to use the same ratio (2,500 points = $25 gift card). Not a bad rewards program at all if you're one to pay the balance in full each month. I've never had any issues with my card, although I've also never had to call customer service for anything other than activating new cards and have never payed late or anything, so I can't comment on that.

name: Elayne Varcoe
review: I will admit that the only reason I signed up for the Amazon credit card was for the store credit.  However, I have found myself using the card more and more mostly on Amazon.com, but I have used it elsewhere as well.  It would be nice if the interest rate was a little lower, but it is about the same as most other cards.  What would really make this card useful would be if you got a credit deposited in your Amazon account based on how much you spent that month with an extra bonus if those purchases were made on Amazon.com.

name: Alex Bandas
review: There are many reasons that I use this card but the primary one is good quality service that it provides me. I have been using this card since it was released and have never had any major problems with it. If I did have some problems I contacted Chase and was able to fix the problem almost instantly. When selecting a credit card customer service is very important to me because if I have a problem I don't want to worry about calling them and trying to resolve the problem. Instead I want someone who is there to help me and provide me with the help that I need: which Chase Sapphire Customer Service does well.

name: Vanessa Bonita
review: I have had my chase card for some time although it did not always start out as a slate. Anyhow for the most part I have been very satisfied. They have the best customer service reps and best of all they are very easy to understand. I don't think they contract out to foreign countries for their customer service reps. They also have a good fraud division. There have been a few times when my card number has been compromised and once they called me to ask if I was in possession of my card. Well it turns out I was not. Someone had stolen my card from work and used it to pay cell phone bills and get gas. Luckily they called me before too much damage was done. I was not held liable for any of the charges and thanks to cameras at my job the person was caught. It was the clean up lady.

name: Kristy Joy
review: I currently have only one credit card, offered through Chase. The card offers "points" from Amazon.com. I believe the rate for points is one point per dollar spent on all purchases, which would be roughly 1 percent back. Gasoline purchases reward a higher rate, perhaps 2 or 3 points per dollar spent. Purchases on amazon.com itself, however, reward something like 5 points per dollar spent. The points equal a penny each and can be spent only on Amazon. I think the system is adequate, since there is no annual fee. I would like to see a lower interest rate, however. I've had the card for over 5 years and have had my limit raised a half dozen times, but the rate is still something around 15 percent APR.

name: Flark Flarkson
review: I really enjoy banking at chase, I have my other accounts set up through them as well and they work really well. I hear we are getting a check cashing app now too. I never had any problems using this card as its Visa and almost every vendor takes Visa. It is really as simple as just paying your bills on time and you have nothing to worry about. Since I have a long commute I rely on the cashback for gasoline purchases to blunt the how much it costs to fill up my tank (I drive an SUV). I didn't like how much my interest rate jumped after the "introductory period", its to be expected and anyone who reads what they are signing up for should know that already but if you glossed over its really important you know. All in all I am happy I picked this card and I have no regrets.

name: Kelsey Nicole
review: This card is great for anyone who has frequent access to the parks, or for a family saving up to go on a couple of trips. It can also be used with many (if not all) of the Disney Global Adventures. If you use this card for everyday things that 1% Disney dollars cash back adds up quite quickly. Having the bonus perks for hotels and dining is also very helpful. I would highly recommend this card to parents of toddlers, because the points last for five years and that puts you right at the ideal time to take your little 5-8 year old to visit the most magical place on earth.

name: Annie Swink
review: We've used this credit card for several years and love the great rewards that come from using it for our every day purchases and then paying the balance in full.  It's like getting free things just for paying our bills.  Because we use it in this way the APR, although better than most, doesn't really apply to us.  We use the points we accumulate as they're going to expire and save the rewards for birthdays and Christmas purchases.  We have never had any problems with customer service.  The only issue was when we didn't use our card for a period of time and then began o use it while on leave from the military and it was frozen. While it as aggravating, it did make me feel safe as far as security of my account is concerned.  I just had to call and confirm we were who were and where we were.

name: Jason Walker
review: I've had this card for over a year now and it's the only one I will need in the near future. I wanted to get familiar with credit card use and build my credit, and this card is a great option. Chase also has excellent customer service, once in the Oakland airport I was charged for wifi access which did not work, when I arrived home I called Chase and they explained that this happens a lot and they said they would remove the charge. It surprised me that they responded so fast, I wasn’t put on hold or anything. I would recommend this card to people who maybe aren’t so familiar with credit cards or want a backup card. The card also is aesthetically pleasing; the front is very minimalistic and crisp looking.

name: Fredericka Pastrana
review: I have had the Slate card from Chase for about 3 years now. I love that you can go on the cards website and figure out how to pay everything off in a certain amount of time. I had an issue with bill delivery once and was charged a $25 late fee because it was not paid on time. I called and spoke with customer service and the manager was able to override the fee. The girl in customer service was able to see that somehow an extra number was added to my address so it wasn’t mailing out like it should. It was dealt with quickly and efficiently and I have all the confidence in the world that they can deal with any issues that come up.

name: Augusta Andrada
review: I have had no problems with the Amazon credit card since I first signed up for it about 4 or 5 months ago.  There are no hidden fees and they do not try to sneak anything by you.  The incentives for using it are phenomenal and build up rather quickly.  I would recommend this card to anyone, assuming that they can qualify for it.  The initial 30 dollars off your next Amazon purchase is a great way to start out a relationship with a credit card.  You earn 1 point per $1 you spend and up to 3 per $1 spent.

name: Chan Harjochee
review: The Chase freedom card has to be the best continuing experience I have ever had with a credit card. I have been able to take advantage of the cash back program offered by this card. This is the first card I ever had that offered a cash back program and it has been wonderful. I have found the interest rates to be fair for what this card offers. I also really like the credit limit on this card, it’s much higher than cards I have had in the past. Overall if you pay your bill on time and use your card responsibly you will have a good experience with this card. It is probably one of the best, if not the best credit card available.

name: Greg Takeshima
review: I applied and received this card recently because my fiancee is a HUGE Disney fan.  One of her girlfriends works for the Hawaiian based Disney Resort called Aulani so that's where we mainly use it.  It's pretty cool to bust it out and people instantly always say "Ohh, it's Mikey Mouse!".  The card itself is not much different than normal rewards cards.  1% back and you can mainly use it on Disney stuff but that's okay, we're still trying to renew all our blu-rays of Disney Classics.  The special rates on hotels are a plus but as long as we travel with her girlfriend we get in to the parks for free!

name: Lindsay Fishman
review: This card works very well for people who are just starting out building their credit, but be warned. I got $100 cash for signing up for this credit card and a decent balance as a new college student a few years ago. The low, low interest rate really helped me buy and pay back in a timely matter. HOWEVER, after they get you signed up and spending, they will not be there for you. Customer service is not very understanding and they are quick to hike up the interest rate on any and all late payments, even if you call and discuss things with them first. I was disappointed that, although a college student and struggling, my credit card company didn't care at all, unlike they initially seemed.

name: Flora Zhang
review: I have used Chase Freedom card for almost two years now. I like it because of its rewards program. Each quarter the card gives up to 5% cash rewards to different categories: grocery, gas, restaurant, movies and travel etc. I have earned quite a bit rewards since I pay off my credit cards every month. On top of that, if you have a Chase checking account and have this credit card link to your checking account, you will earn additional 10% bonus points each time. Also since this is a Visa card, it is accepted almost anywhere. With no annual fee, I am sure this is one of the top cards in the non premium card categories.

name: Carrol Kotey
review: I am a frequent United traveller and has been using this credit card for the last 8 years.I think its a best air travel reward card.It is very easy to accrue rewards on this card.I get triple miles when I purchase  tickets with this card on united flights.In addition to that  I get  double miles on gas, home groceries and dining purchases, and one mile per dollar if I use it at any stores including superstores like walmart , target etc.I also get 5,000 bonus miles each year on  enrollment date anniversary. And there's no limit on how many miles you can earn.Overall, I think this is a best choice I have made.

name: Man Magalski
review: So far I have not encountered any issues with it. Any time I have had to call customer service they are really helpful and seem to go above and beyond. I think the monthly payment is a little on the high side but then again I tend to let my bills pile up so a little always seems to be a lot to me.. I use the card for back to school shopping and at Christmas time. The only bad experience was when the annual charge hit the card before I had even had the card a year. It was never corrected but I survived.

name: Jack Manni
review: This credit cart was my first card and I have had it for a few months. Being only 20 years old, I had no idea if I could even get approved for a card but I wanted to start building my credit. To my astonishment, I was approved while sitting in Chase bank and was thus able to have a chat with the banker about the details of the card. After, my lesson I felt confident with my credit card choice. Since day one, I have been utilizing the cycling bonus point rewards for shopping at specific stores or general places like gas stations etc. So far, I haven't saved up enough points to really get anything but there are great rewards that are not too point heavy. Another great feature of this card it the $1000 limit. I never spend more that $200 a month with this card but just having the option for charging up $1000 in emergencies is a great safety net.

name: Heather McGurrin
review: I love my Freedom card.  I got the card just over a year ago, after they stopped the Ultimate Rewards Debit Card.  I had sworn off credit cards, but I find this card very easy to use and being linked to my bank account helps make it easy not to spend too much on it.  The rewards are great!  I put everything I can on this card and have redeemed over $375 in "Statement Credits" since December! My contact with customer service has been great.  I had to dispute a charge and it was handled quickly and efficiently.  Reporting travel and putting a hold on the card when it's been misplaced or left behind somewhere is incredibly easy.  My only consideration is upgrading to the Chase Sapphire card to earn more rewards, but I'm sticking with Freedom because there is no yearly fee.

name: Xion Blargeg
review: I have had this card for a few months now and I love it. The cash back option is great if you are responsible with your money and never spend more than you can pay back. I have also been using this card to increase my build up my credit score and so far I have not had any problem with them. I initially attempted to get this card because I saw the promotion where if you spend a certain amount in three months you get a bonus and I was able to successfully get the full amount. I have not had any negative experiences so far and I hope it continues this way.

name: Alexander Insco
review: This is a great card with a very good rewards system, with many cash rewards options (that do not expire). If you are responsible using this card, which you should be with any credit card, you can get a pretty good amount back from Chase simply for using the card (while paying back the card quickly). It does require you to have very good credit, so it may not be available as many people’s first option for a credit card, but it’s a good one to work towards while building a credit history. The lack of annual fee is a nice plus as well, and fits the “rewards theme” that the card is based on.

name: Marva Rombach
review: This card is really cool. I often go to Disney when I am visiting my relatives in California and Florida, so this is good to build up some free disney currency just from making ordinary purchases. It builds up as I buy my regular things. This way by the time travel times rolls around, I have some points to spend when I make the trip. Additionally, it helps with hotel, parking, and other things disney related. As a result, if you often find yourself going to disney while on vacation, it's worth picking up this card because it will help you out quite a bit.

name: Kristy Pruitt
review: I am a frequent shopper at Amazon.com, so this card is perfect for me. You get 3 points for each dollar spent on it at Amazon, 2 points for each dollar spent at gas stations, restaurants, drugstores and office supply stores, and 1 point for each dollar spent on all other purchases. If you're an avid Amazon shopper like me, that can add up in a hurry!So far I've redeemed all my rewards on Amazon purchases. The great thing about it is that there's no minimum - you can apply the rewards to a purchase whether it's a penny or a hundred dollars. You can even choose how much you use on any given order if you don't want to use up all your points. You can also redeem your points for cash back, gift cards or travel.

name: Frank Papageorgio
review: This is one of those cards that you really have to look at the rewards and see if they benefit you for what you spend on.  I use this for my small business, so a lot of company purchases go through it and we primarily use the rewards for paying for company travel.  The 20% off on airfare is huge for us when we need to book a couple tickets to a convention.  You normally get 2% back on dining and other travel expenses, and a standard 1% back on all other purchases.  If you travel a lot, this might be the card for you.  But if you don't, then you might be better off getting another card that will give you more cash back on stuff like groceries.  It also has an annual fee, but you'll easily save that in travel if you use it often.The initial bonus is also huge!  Be sure to use your card a lot to get that $500 Bonus!

name: Joe Draganowski
review: I love my Chase Sapphire card. The main thing I was looking for in a new credit card was rewards. I figure why not get something back. I was really suprised with the low APR. I honestly thought any credit card that actually offered good rewards would charge an outragous APR or they would hit you with some random fees to cover it, but they didn't. The security on it is very high which is need these days to protect yourself. Also their customer services is awesome. To me there's nothing worse than having to be on the phone hours with customer service just to find out the guy your talking to doesn't know what he's talking about. They are very knowledgable and curtious. The representive that I talked to knew exactly what was wrong and how to fix it, I was off the phone in fifteen minutes. Chase definatly gets my vote.

name: Rebecca Humphrey
review: yea if you had one.

name: Bob Hanson
review: Until very recently I had a Chase Preferred Card. I was very happy with it and especially enjoyed the good rewards program. The very low interest rate was also appealing, even though I typically pay off my balances each month. The few times that I had a reason to call their customer service, they were very helpful and professional. My only reason for very recently choosing to go with another card, was that they started charging an annual fee. Somehow I missed this when originally signing up for the card. I'm sure it was my fault. Either way, it no longer made sense for me to keep this card.

name: Chad Fisher
review: The Ink Bold card is my go-to card.  It has 5% rewards for communications purchases (cell phone, TV, and Internet).  It has 2% rewards for gas purchases.  It has 1% rewards for all remaining purchases.  I also got in on a promotion where I received 50,000 points (equivalent to $500 cash back) after my first purchase.  Being part of Chase Ultimate Rewards, there is virtually no limit to the type of products or gift cards or cash back you can receive as reward.  You also get 5 points per $1 on the first $50,000 in eligible business purchases you make a year.  Overall, this is my favorite card to use for all of my business needs.

name: Patty Macho
review: I have a Chase Freedom credit card. I have this card because it started out as a card from another company that no longer exists a number of years ago and eventually the account ended up owned by Chase after a few different mergers/buy outs.The terms are fine, on par with most non-secure cards for people with good credit. It has a rewards program (Ultimate Rewards). Base reward is 1% on all purchases, but there are quarterly categories that will earn 5% cash back on up to $1,500, though you have to sign up each quarter to get the 5%. You can get rewards as either cash back, or as gift cards or items. 2,000 points gets $20 cash back, gift cards seem to use the same ratio (2,500 points = $25 gift card). Not a bad rewards program at all if you're one to pay the balance in full each month. I've never had any issues with my card, although I've also never had to call customer service for anything other than activating new cards and have never payed late or anything, so I can't comment on that.

name: Jason
review: I had a basic checking account with a debit card from Chase. I was originally a Washington Mutual customer and loved it, so I had some reservations about Chase taking over. However, either due to their warm advertising campaign or the fact that not much really changed, I quickly trusted Chase and felt even more confident with them than with Washington Mutual. The products and services stayed the same, just reissued as Chase instead of Washington Mutual, the branches I used had a facelift, and most of the staff stayed the same (from what I could tell).It wasn’t until just enough time went by after the takeover that I received information about changes to my account, that maintenance fees would now apply if I couldn’t meet specific guidelines. I visited one of my regular branches to further discuss the changes and a representative was happy to speak with me and explain the need for the new fees. I could see where the company was coming from and I wanted to stay with them—but I couldn’t afford to because I was an unemployed student at the time. The representative understood my situation and kindly closed my account.Would I return to Chase? Well, their branch locations are always convenient for me and their customer service is great, though not without peer. Chase also isn’t the only bank to have strict guidelines to avoid maintenance fees, but I’ve since found another bank with guidelines I was able to comfortably meet—and they have excellent customer service as well, along with many locations nearby. So, I’m going to stick with my current bank, which I’ve already formed a strong relationship with.

name: Cris P
review: I particularly like my Chase credit card above all of my other credit cards because of the awesome cash back bonuses they give out.  I started using it exclusively everywhere I go to earn as much back as possible.  Every few months they change what kinds of businesses will give you even more cash back, so if you like to eat out a lot, you'll be getting above the 1% on the months when they have restaurant as the bonus.  After the intro period the interest rate is extremely high, so I just make sure to pay off the balance every month so it won't start adding up.

name: Todd Kaser
review: I use my Disney Rewards Visa for everything! My spending adds up quickly and comes right back to me as 1% back in Disney dollars, which I put towards my next Disney vacation! We use this card to pay for the bills and all of our expenses, then pay it off in full each month to avoid interest. The reward dollars add up fast and we get great perks with Disney. It's saving up money without having to earn anything extra! The points don't expire until five years after you have earned them, so we plan on going about every five years and using our points toward and extra-special dinner or a more luxurious hotel room! I wouldn't trade this credit card for another one - it's my life!

name: Jennifer Weingartner
review: I have two credit cards with Chase and this is definitely a great pick. We love this card because of the perks and the customer service. I love the cash back option and I use it frequently. Also, there are quarterly specials for 5% cash back on certain purchases. These options include gas stations, restaurants, grocery stores and other department stores. The customer service is great as well. When we decided to start using this as our primary credit card, we called to increase our spending limit. Within a few minutes they had increased our limit and we were on our way. In addition, they give you the option to choose your own payment date. This is so helpful when coordinating bill payment.

name: Alycia Peguese
review: Years ago, I walked into my local Chase branch in an attempt to increase my credit line on an older credit card.  The representative offered a Chase Freedom card instead and I was sold on the concept of earning rewards just for using my card where I regularly shop.  While I did find myself using my card more often (using my card to fill up gas in my mother's car, even if she did give me cash), I still would pay the amount in full after the billing cycle completed.  Not too long after, I had built up $200 in rewards and at the time, Chase offered a $50 bonus if you cashed out $200 in rewards, earning me a nice $250 check.  Cashing the rewards out is just as easy since you can do it right from your Chase Online account.  They will even deposit the funds the very next day!  Rewards AND convenience?  You really can't top that.I didn't have to do anything different, I didn't change any of my shopping habits, I wasn't spending more money as I was being reimbursed for additional charges from other people... and Chase rewarded me for it.  Granted, the additional $50 bonus is no longer available, but I'm still happy that I can still earn rewards for doing the same thing I have done for the past 7 years and hope to continue to do for years to come.

name: Lettie Serl
review: I have had the Chase Freedom credit card for over three years and out of the 4-5 credit cards that I own it is the only one that I use several times a week. I use this instead of cash for all of my everyday needs. I pay the balance off at the end of every week and earn up to 5% cash back for the things that I would be buying anyway. I have never had a problem with the card or payments going through. I would highly recommend this card as long as you pay the balance off on time.

name: Neos
review: I got this card only a month ago at the recommendation of a friend. I hadn’t really heard about this card before, but my friend said they’d been using it for quite a while and hadn’t encountered any issues. I think everything is going very smoothly with it, so far. The rewards are good and I haven’t had to complain about not getting them. My favorite feature has got to be how open the points are—meaning that I can use the internet to keep track of my rewards at any time. Compared to my previous card, this credit card is wonderful and I foresee no issues with it in the immediate future.

name: Rob Oliver
review: I've got to admit that I've become dubious of Chase's financial dealing of the last year; so having this credit card in my wallet seems to be borrowed time as of late. The 5% cash back perk is great, but we don't live in a vacuum, nor do I maximize my incentives; so getting the 5% back really only equates to pennies on the dollar.  So, what do I use this credit card for? Usually, not too much; I prefer to use cash on hand instead of using "borrowed" money. This card comes in handy around the holidays when money is tight, otherwise, it stays nicely tucked away in my wallet. I prefer to have a balance of ZERO; it's just the way I like it.  I do, however, like that you can use your points when you sign up for travel accommodations through their website and they give you a 1 to 1 ratio of points to dollars used towards future reward purchases. I can certainly vouch for that.

name: Lekisha Koppinger
review: I have had a the freedom card for sometime now. I have never had any big issues with it. I do not make any purchases with it however. This was a card I have had with my chase checking account and they would send me balance transfer checks every now and again. I used 2 of these checks at different times to take advantage of low rates and fees. At this time I am still paying off those transfers. The interest rate seems a little high compared to my other credit cards, and my limit is very low. I am not sure if that is because they way I have been using this card but those are just things I wanted to point out. I have have never had any issues customer service wise and if this card is the best choice for you then I would say sign up.

name: Brett Farmer
review: This card is by far the best one in my wallet! Rapid rewards points accumulate quickly and the points are added to your account quickly. The 50,000 bonus points gain by spending $1,000 in the first 3 months is a great deal, just make sure you have enough money to pay it down each month. The annual fee is paid back in points, which is a nice bonus. I have never had problems using the points I have accumulated with the card. The bonus reward partners with Rapid Rewards make it even easier to gain points using this card. All things considered I have gain 3 free flights with this card in just under a year! I will definitely be sticking with this card for a long time.

name: Laramie Miller
review: I got this card after the United and Continental Airlines merger and I must say as far as a credit card goes this one is pretty run of the mill. Nothing about it is bad but the miles you earn aren't fantastic either. I plan on canceling this card as soon as its paid off because I've found better offers out there. This was the second credit card I've ever had and for that the online tools made using it incredibly simple. I've never had problems with customer service when I've had questions. All in all I would give this card a 3/5 because the rewards just aren't that great but the online management is extremely simple.

name: Steve Burell
review: I absolutely love my Disney Rewards Chase Visa. As a regular traveler to the Disney theme parks in both Orlando and California, there is nothing better than getting free Disney dollars just for using my credit card throughout the year. I tend to use this card for all of my purchases as well as monthly bills. This really helps the reward points to add up quickly. In addition, there are some really good perks for card members as well including special rates on hotels, park tickets to special events like the Halloween party, plus discounts at retail purchases in the park and some of the dining locations as well. This is a great companion to our Disney trips and really helps us save up money.

name: Dacia Grimes
review: This is by far my favorite credit card. I have it for three years now and I have never had any problems with it. One time my card number was used in Malaysia, obviously fraudulent activity and unbeknownst to me, and Chase called me immediately to discuss the transaction. My card was immediately cancelled and I received a new one within a few days. Also, I love the low interest rate and the cash back reward promotions throughout the year. Usually, I pay my balance every month but sometimes life throws a curve ball and I have to carry a balance. With my low interest rate and the payment protection plan they offer, the fees are reasonable. My primary purchases are gas and food. One quarter Chase offers 5% cash back on gas and restaurant or grocery purchases. This bonus program is fantastic because the points add up quickly which you can redeem for awesome rewards. Some rewards include gift cards which I have used for Christmas or Birthday gifts or "life experiences" such as Learning to Fly or Rock Climbing.I am very pleased with this card and would recommend to anyone.

name: Brandon Terry
review: As someone who travels quite a bit, I was discouraged that I could not find a type of card to suit my needs. Many credit card companies claim to give rewards to travelers, most deliver, but I’ve found that the rewards they offer are somewhat small. Luckily, coming across the Marriott Rewards Premier credit card was the best thing that ever happened to me. This credit card offers fantastic awards for those who travel, giving users a way to get perks, while simultaneously keeping the functionality of a credit card. The application process was extremely easy and I couldn’t be happier. Recommended.

name: Delia Nagle
review: The amazon credit card is very useful...if you shop on amazon.  I have several subscribe and save subscriptions as well as prime, the charges for which I all put on my amazon card. This gets me triple points while saving money on the items purchased.  Then, when it comes time to buy fun things like video games, I can get them for free with my points.  Additionally, with prime I can get free shipping on items like the Rhoomba or shoes (at prices that can't be beat) while getting triple points.  It feels good the get the best price while getting triple points to spend on unnecessary items.  If you don't use amazon often then the card isn't better than any other.  However, as I said, if you shop in the amazon ecosystem, it is excellent!

name: Ownedby Tamater
review: Thus far in my experiences with this credit card it has been very pleasant. I am very happy with the Company and the cash back ability. I use this card for my frequent airplane travels so it adds up rather quickly. As far as the rates go, I have no problem with the rates they have. Nobody likes to have to pay them, but they seem fairly ordinary compared with the other credit card companies

name: Ownedby Tamater
review: I want to start off by saying this is my one and only credit card. I initially got this card for the rates for the first fifteen months. The option to get Cashback was also I nice selling point. My initial fifteen months are about to be over, we will see about the rates then.

name: Tasha Caulley
review: I will admit I am addicted to Amazon! So, one day last year when I was Christmas shopping I saw the banner about saving money if accepted for this Amazon card. I clicked on it and applied and you get Instant Credit if you are approved - so that was a bonus to me! I liked that I could use it right away. I had a fairly okay interest rate, since I had the lowest that they offered. Though wish it was LOWER. I investigated this card more and I liked the rewards that they offered in their "shop." You get 3 points for every $1 you spend on Amazon. If you use the card at gas stations or other places like eating out or shopping you get 2 points for every $1. You can redeem you points for so many things! I cashed out for a few gift cards, you can even put some credit towards your bill! They have a variety of things to cash out for, so there is something for everyone! I did get the $30 Credit to my account after approval. So that is not a scam. It was a nice bonus to see! I make sure to keep my balance paid off on this card, because of the interest rate. I had no problems with their customer service when I had to call to ask about something I saw on my account. It was all answered in a quick manner and professionally. If you are an Amazon addict - I do recommend this card, but don't let it rack up because the interest will hurt you in the long run. However, the rewards are pretty fun!

name: Russell Starbird
review: In today’s economy I and my husband are constantly on the lookout to cut corners and save some money, and since we are young we have a lot of time to make some savings. But no matter what we did the bills kept coming and it was becoming increasingly difficult to save money. Until we applied for the Chase Freedom credit card, the idea of getting cash back on purchases seemed too good to pass. And chase has been true to its words we have no complaints. We received $100 bonus after spending $500 in our first 3 months. Finally we have a bank that thinks of the needs of its customers.

name: John Blascovik
review: This card has been great, I always used to shy away from credit cards but decided to try this one to see if I could actually get money back.  I started using it to purchase everything I would normally purchase with a debit card and at the same time paying back the full balance at the end of the month.  Well wouldn't you be interested to know that I did in fact get $100 dollars cash back.  As long as I only use the card when I know I can pay off the balance at the end of the month then I will be set.  Also the 0% interest rate for the first 15 months is a nice help if you are not able to pay off all of your balance at the end of the month. Here is to $100 free dollars in my piggy bank.

name: Brian Bentley
review: I have a Chase Sapphire and it is a good card with decent rates.  I use it as my emergency card with something happens and I don't have the money.  The customer service that they offer is top notch and the best I’ve ever seen.  They have always been helpful and friendly.  I have had someone steal my card and my wallet and it was easy to call and get it de-activated and the money refunded that was stolen and get a new card.  They were understanding and were willing to go above and beyond to help me and get everything back in order after that happened.  I was so appreciative of Chase and everything they have done for me.

name: Stephen Samuels
review: I love the customer service I receive from Chase.  They have always treated me with respect and explain all problems or questions well.  Their online website is great for card maintenance making the card very easy.  The rewards on this card are good, but there are better cards if you are only interested in the rewards.  The main advantage for this card is the great customer service from Chase and being treated like you are important.  If you have not experienced Chase before it is worth getting this card for the experience.  If you do have Chase already then you know that having another card from them is well worth it.

name: Justin Sisley
review: I have one of these cards for my business, ScooterCabs.  We've had the card for about 9 months now and have had 0 problems.  We got a promotional 6 months no interest, which was great to put all the startup costs on.  We got it paid off and now use it for all our ongoing expenses.  The point system is great; the cash back is extremely effective for helping to pay off the balance each month.  Our business uses a lot of gas (we're a designated driver service) so it's great to have an extra percentage there.  We also get more back when we use it for phone bills.  Our drivers all carry a company cell phone so this is great for us!

name: David Brooks
review: This is a great card just for getting rewards. I have had it for about 6 months and got a bonus reward just for spending what I usually spend on gas. The reward was $200 if you spent $500 which can be credited toward the bill or use it to purchase whatever you want. This card has a 5% cash back on purchases that are being promoted at a given time. Some months it will be grocery stores and sometimes gas stations which is where I mostly use my card. This is definately a good card to get if just starting out with good to medium credit.

name: Cindy Robinson
review: For the last few years I've used my Chase Freedom credit card almost religiously. It has a low interest rate, no annual fee, and you can get rewards just by using it. I know its not important as having the cash back option, but I also like the bright blue design of the Chase Freedom credit card. If I have any questions regarding my account there are several ways I can contact them, and since I've had the card, I have used quite a few of the ways they mention. I've called in, I've emailed and been given a prompt response and I have accessed my account online, also. They also send checks every so often just in case I'm doing a big purchase, but the card is just as easy to use. Chase Freedom is a good card for basically anyone to have and it seems like they truly care about the customers they serve and it shows.

name: Brian Martin
review: I have had a number of credit cards in my lifetime, and the Amazon credit card is by far my favorite. The initial $30 is a nice bonus, and the points really add up when you shop often on Amazon.com like I do. I treat credit cards as if they are debit cards, meaning I pay off my balance every month. Using this method, it essentially gives me free money to use to shop on Amazon. Paying your bill online is really easy as well. I would recommend this to anyone I know that frequents Amazon. Obviously, your mileage will vary depending on just how much of your purchasing you do on Amazon.com, but for a frequent shopper like myself, I can’t think of a better card!

name: Priscilla Cocola
review: I have the Chase Sapphire card and I think it is pretty good. I first got this card because I thought that I should be using a credit card for things just other than buying. So I got this card because I thought it would be a great idea to buy things but also earn things so I can travel. I also was recommended it by a friend who uses it for the same reason and I was convinced because he also said it was very secure and had a low rate. The card is also very easy to use and nothing really confusing about using it. And even when I did have a problem it was easy to fix it.

name: Shannon Johnson
review: I got this card because Chase offered a rebate after spending a certain amount within a certain period of time. Chase has always been good to me. I had some fraudulent charges a few months ago and they handled it quickly. I had been on vacation and used my card at a little shop, apparently they had kept my information and then purchased items using my card. All I had to do was call them and they investigated and figured out what had happened. I didn't have to pay a dime of the money and felt relieved that I didn't have to go through huge issues and red tape. Thank you Chase! You are amazing.

name: Jennifer Cobos
review: I have had my Chase Slate card for a few years now. I keep it around mostly to build my credit, but I am not that impressed with it. My interest rate is close to 30%, while my credit limit is only $300. I have several other credit cards with much lower interest rates and higher credit limits. It is a good card to start with; I mostly keep it around because I bank with Chase and they have never done me wrong. The credit card is connected to my bank account, so if there is ever any overdraft, Chase will pull the funds from the credit card without charging an overdraft fee. I wouldn't recommend this card for anyone with a good credit history, but it is a nice starter card.

name: Chery Mcgowin
review: Working in the airline industry allows me to travel almost on a weekly basis, and this credit card has turned out to be a very useful one, indeed. One of my friends in the airline industry told me about this card and I thought I wold give it a try. One of the nice things about the card is that the first year you pay no membership fee. There is a fee after that, but it is reasonable in my opinion. I have been able to easily earn free nights at one of my favorite hotel's, the Marriott by using this card. Surprisingly, points can add up quite fast making the card very functional in that regard. Overall, good card, good customer care, and good rewards. I highly recommend this card to anyone who travels a lot.

name: Winifred Trevey
review: The Marriott Rewards Credit Card is an awesome deal! I got two free nights when I got approved for the card. How great is that? And to sweeten the deal even further, I got another four free nights when I made my first purchase. It's such an awesome card. I am a frequent traveler and love staying at the Marriott. It is one of my favorite hotels...every one that I've been to has the same level of quality. I have yet to go to one of poor quality. I thought that those were great benefits..but I also got 3 points for every $1 I spend at Marriott and I also get 1 point for every $1 I spend anywhere else. You would think it couldn't get any better, but they even offer the premier credit card which gave my husband 50,000 points when he signed up! We used it for 6 free nights! I love my Marriott Rewards Credit Card. I have never gotten such great benefits and perks that I was actually able to use.

name: Willow Hondorp
review: I have a Chase Sapphire Preferred card and it provides me with everything I want in a credit card. It has great cash rewards. It also has no limits on cash rewards. Being as how I make the majority of my purchases using this card, I can easily rack up points to redeem. The card also has a great fee schedule, as well as a fair APR. It also does not have a foreign transaction fee, which comes in very handy when I travel abroad for my job. Chase also offers top-notch customer service if I ever have to call in with any issue concerning my account.

name: Lambert Tash
review: This is my very first credit card and - let me tell you - I'm not disappointed. First and foremost, the offer with which I got the card was exceptional - if I spent $500 in the first 3 months, I would receive $250 cash back. That's almost too good to be true! Of course I jumped on it, because I could spend $500 on groceries alone; with the $250 cash back, it's virtually like you spent $250!Moreover, the customer service is excellent. Once I had an unauthorized charge and the company worked with me to have it removed and my money refunded.I would recommend anyone get this card if they're looking to save money AND get cash back.

name: Susan Emory
review: I travel quite a bit for my job, and usually stay at Marriott hotels. I knew I should get a card that would allow me to earn really good rewards and free stays, so I applied for this card after a co-worker recommended it. The initial reward after I was approved was really nice - the best I have ever gotten. I actually used the free night I received within 2 weeks of getting my card, for a quick working-vacation trip. The points can accumulate very quickly when you use this card for everyday purchases, and I have quickly earned enough points for high-value rewards. Their customer service is fantastic, and anytime I have called I have been treated as though I am their most important customer, something I appreciate given the business industry I am in. I highly recommend this card for frequent travelers, and even the infrequent traveler.

name: Jordan Selin
review: I love the Chase Sapphire card I have been using it for almost all of my purchases over the past few months.  This card allows you to earn great rewards and build up points very quickly.  I loved the fact I didn't have a fee for the first year, along with the fact that I managed to hit the 40,000 point bonus for spending over three thousnad on the card in the first three months I had the card.  The customer service has been outstanding.  I prefer to speak to a live person when discussing my points and validating that I have met requirements to recieve them.  I have always been directed to a person very quickly when calling and they have so far been able to answer any questions I had quickly and pleasantly.  I have found that this card is accepeted just about anywhere even whin I am on travel for my job which can take me just about anywhere inside the states and beyond.  I would recommend this card to anyone who enjoys a good points and rewards program and the best part is your just paying for things like you normally would.

name: Brent Larson
review: This has been a good card card for me.  When I signed up I got the $100 cash back after spending $500 in the first 3 months.  However, I saw offers later for $200 cash back for spending the same amount, so if you wait or look around you can get a really good introductory bonus.  After that, the rewards are still about as good as you'll get on most other cards (1% on everything, 5% on rotating categories).  They also have good customer service (at least that has been my experience), as they rushed me and my wife new cards after I lost my wallet and had to get the number changed.  Pretty wide variety of gift card redemption options, or just cash back.  No problems for me with this card.

name: Heather Giuffre
review: I really enjoyed using my Amazon.com Rewards Credit Card. I'm a frequent Amazon.com shopper. I live in a major metropolitan area and find shopping online not only competitive, but very beneficial. Often I will choose to buy my day to day items such as razors and toiletries online instead of from the local drug store. Knowing that I will receive three points per dollar (3%) by choosing to buy these products on Amazon validates that choice.I'm also an Amazon Prime subscriber. My Amazon.com Rewards Credit Card, when coupled with my Amazon Prime membership, equals a great way to shop and save.

name: Emily Parker
review: Are you posting these, or have you been hacked? I've seen several postings, all with different cards and captions.

name: Valeria Niebergall
review: I travel a lot for business and pleasure so I wanted a credit card that would reward me for staying at hotels. This is exactly what this Marriott Rewards credit card does for me! Once I signed up I got free points right off the bat which can be used right away to stay in hotels for free. Not to mention every time I use the card I can get more and more points allowing me to stay on the road for free. This is essential in a tough economy and I am very happy that I got myself this card. It has already been well worth it and my family is amazed that sometimes we can go on the road and stay somewhere without paying a dime. The fees and APR aren’t too bad either and I would highly recommend this card to anyone who travels or stays in hotels often.

name: Adam Clark
review: I initially got the Chase Freedom credit card when I was younger and was trying to build up a credit history.  I didn't use it for many years and just let it sit in my wallet.  Recently however, I have been using it in order to take advantage of the various cash back opportunities that are presented on a rotating basis.  Basically I pay it off every month and simply collect the cash back rewards as a bonus.  All in all this is a great, no hassle card that serves it's purpose.  I also took advantage of a sizable sign up bonus when I got this card as well.

name: Daniel Destefanis
review: The Chase Sapphire card is a rather popular credit card, and for good reason. You start out with a fair amount of rewards points and earn rewards quickly.  I recommend this card for business owners, travelers, etc. Most the points and incentives are tailored towards who travel through work. I’ve earned myself a fair amount of free flights which has come in handy. Any disputes or issues I’ve encountered (which haven’t been many) have been sorted out right away. The customer service behind Chase’s credit cards is far superior to their banks. Generally, this card is straight forward and you really can’t go wrong!

name: Tonia Syer
review: I started using this card about 4 years ago and honestly I have had 0 problems with it. It serves me well not only in the US but also when I travel abroad to many different countries as required by my job place. The benefits are pretty fantastic as well, I love getting rewarded for something that I like using. The few times that I have had to call customer service, it was nothing but a pleasure. They work hard to resolve issues.

name: Carmela Ellrod
review: I’ve been a Chase customer for about 4 years now, but it wasn’t by choice.  I was originally with Washington Mutual before they sold out to JP Morgan Chase.  I wasn’t satisfied with the takeover, but I stayed anyway because I didn’t feel like researching and switching over to another bank.  I’m ended up being so satisfied with them that I decided to get their Chase Freedom card, which was 0% APR and balance transfers for a year at the time.  Now, I’ve been a cardholder for about 3 years and I have no major complaints.  My credit limit hasn’t been changed except once when I called a credit extension, for which I was approved.  My APR has fluctuated or gone up for no unfair reason.  Also, customer service is pretty reliable.  Once, I made a payment on the due date after 8PM and didn’t know that it must be before 8PM to not be delinquent.  I was charged a late fee and called chase customer service.  The representative excused the late fee since it was my first time.  The whole matter took about 7 minutes maximum.  Overall, it’s been a credit card that doesn’t have me pulling my hair out every month.

name: Karen Cruz
review: I have been banking with Chase for 4 years now and have had the Slate card for 2 years and love it. I have auto pay set up so there is no missing a payment and their customer service even guided me through getting that set up. I had a dispute 2 months ago with my internet provider double billing me and Chase contacted them on a three way call and corrected the situation. I even got the extra payment refunded and another month credited for my troubles.  Whenever I use my card somewhere for the first time that I don't normally shop at, I get a courtesy call to be sure that I did make that purchase. I also use the Chase app to view my bill on my iPhone and to check my balance. Great card with rates that work for me.

name: Sam Monce
review: I got the Chase Freedom as my first card initially due to the 0% intro APR for the first year. I also appreciated a lot of the helpful discounts and deals you get along with the card such as the 5% Cash Back deal for gas, or the initial $100 Cash Back  for $500 in purchases.  It was a little disappointing when the interest jumped up to 12.99% , but I made sure to pay everything on time and I never had a single bad experience with this card.  The online payment feature is easy to use, and the email reminders help you stay on-time, even if you ever forget. Overall, I am fairly happy with my use of this card and the flexibility they offer.

name: Barney Jones
review: I originally got this card when I was entering college and had to order many textbooks from Amazon. That was probably one of the best decisions I've made as the thousands of dollars of textbooks I've ordered has led to a good amount of Amazon Reward points. Amazon is also one of the best places to shop online and you can find almost anything on there. Through the years with all my online shopping and textbooks, I've made a good amount of money back from the awards system. It's also awesome that you can get request your awards at anytime. I didn't have to wait until I reached $25 or $50 just so I can receive the money I've earned from shopping online. In conclusion, this is a great rewards card and one that should be owned by everyone if they like to shop at Amazon.

name: Kraig Lasher
review: I do not currently have this credit card but for unrelated matters.  I was pretty happy when I did have it.  I need to build my credit back up to even be accepted for this card again I believe now.  Anyway, when I had this card I enjoyed no annual fees because it was the first card I had with that benefit.  I also liked gaining reward points because it was also the first card I ever had with that option as well.  The low interest rate is also great!  Ahhhh, I miss having good credit but I assure you this card is not the reason why my credit fell into the bad realm.  I won't be able to get a card with this card's type of interest rate for quite some time I believe.There was a few times I was annoyed with having this card but it is good that they annoyed me because it shows that they are on top of things and making sure nobody stole my card.  They called me a few times to make sure I had made certain purchases, each time when I was out of state.  At the time I was just annoyed because I was young and thinking they were spying on me and not trusting me with my own card, but in reality they were looking out for my best interests.

name: Debora Westerfeld
review: I have had the Chase Freedom for 2 years, I have had no issues with it and have been able to get help with the few questions I have had, for example.  A friend of mine had gotten a reward program for his card usage, I called and had asked if a similar program was offered for my card.  It turns out that I wasn’t eligible for that program(it was offered on a higher limit card) on my card and I didn’t want to apply for the other card, I like to keep my open credit accounts(and potential spending) down.  While I was not eligible for that program, I was able to add another program to my account which I have since used frequently when away on business.  I have had zero issues with billing or customer service, and even received a phone call when my wife used our card on an unusual purchase(a new bed, which was a gift for her mother) right after, we had bought one.  As such, while I have dropped another credit card to keep my open credit lines limited, I have kept this account open, because of the exceptional service.  It’s not a flashy card, but it’s very functional.

name: Erika Burgess
review: I signed up for the Chase Amazon.com rewards card at the beginning of April, and I could not be happier with a credit card. I always pay my card off every month, so I am actually making money. On average, I am getting between $25 and $40 cash back every single month because I use it for all of my purchases. You get 3 points per dollar spent on Amazon purchases, 2 points per dollar on stuff like restaurants and gas, and 1 point on everything else. For example, if you spend $100 on an Amazon purchase, you’d get $3 back. For “found money,” I find it hard to beat that. I have used Discover cards in the past, and they are great, but the different categories that only come out for short periods of time makes the rewards inconsistent. I use Amazon to purchase as much as possible, so this card has worked perfectly for me. Chase has an excellent online interface for seeing statements and paying off bills as well, and their customer service was great when I was first signing up. If you’re a loyal Amazon customer like me, you should definitely consider this card.

name: Randal Basurto
review: I travel all the time and my hotel of choice has always been Marriott. I was so excited when I first heard that this card existed. After doing a little research, I had to apply. The card has no annual fee for the first year. I love that! It gives me time just to see how beneficial the card will end up being for me. On top of that, I got 30,000 free points! The free points I got and the points I was accruing from using the card has afforded me some very nice accommodations. I am a big stickler for customer service and they have done an excellent job in providing me that. I'm always kept aware of the latest news or changes regarding my card. The fact that I do travel so much really helped me to appreciate the travel insurance and car rental insurance that comes with the card. I have relied upon those benefits numerous times and really enjoy having that available for m when I'm away from home. Fantastic card to have...especially if you're a Marriott lover.

name: Chelsea Clark
review: I love this card for all of the reward points I collect with every purchase. The points never expire and can actually be put toward great things like free flights and hotels, which is great for someone like me who travels a lot. Chase also provides a lot of things during the travel experience, such as emergency legal help, auto rental insurance, cancellation and delay reimbursement and a bunch of other things. I would recommend this card for anyone who likes to travel a lot and wants a card that can help them do that. It sure has helped me save a lot of money on airfare. Not to mention Chase's customer service is great!

name: Princess Sally
review: I got this card about  8 months ago because I needed a card that offered rewards. After doing some research the Chase Sapphire Card seemed like it would be the best deal. They offered me 10,000 points to sign up and there is no annual fee. I have not had to contact anyone at the company yet, so as far as customer service, I really do not have any information.
