At this point in time I have no negative comments.  Some of the positives about this card are that I can go to their website and check my points balance at any time. Also on purchase at restaurants, I earn double points. I have made a habit of using this card exclusively when dining out to take advantage of this.  The points really seem to add up quickly when doing this. So far, very positive experience.

name: Cathy Thompson
review: I have been with chase for 8 years now and love the chase freedom card.  It is a great card if you are paying the balance in full every month.  It helps you build your credit back up after bankruptcy.  I love the cash back rewards.  This is extra money we earn every month and every little bit helps in this economy today.  The $100 comes in handy and you can make payments over the first 15 months. Chase also gives you credit increases right regularly as long as you make your payments on time every month. I also have my car loan with Chase that I just made my last payment on. I love being with Chase and will continue to be with Chase.

name: John Georg
review: As a subscriber to Amazon Prime, it seemed like a no-brainer to spring for the Amazon card -- after all, points back on every dollar seems like an incredible reward! And... it is! It provides a great incentive to use your card, and as long as you're responsible with it, it'll serve you very well. I've been working toward building my own PC, so having my Amazon points saved me a ton of money on parts and also allowed me to get even MORE cash back! Cannot recommend this card enough -- though the interest rate is a bit high, if you can handle the responsibility it will definitely pay for itself after a while.

name: Jose Flores
review: My wife and I use the Disney Premier Credit Card,  basically, for the kids. I live in Miami so we go to Disney frequently. If you have kids,  I can highly recommend this card for the rewards and its ease of use. It gets much better for you if you have kids and you have to buy presents from  the Disney store. You will get a 100 dollar credit after first use, earn two percent in reward dollars on card purchases at gas stations, grocery stores, and MOST Disney locations.  Like I said before, you save 10 percent off on select merchandise purchases of 50 or more at Disney store (online) and normal.  I  have to say that I don’t use this one for every day purchases though. I mean you can get much better rewards from any number of cards.

name: Merry Berdy
review: This credit card is solid. I've had it for a couple years and it's been pretty much no hassle. The customer service has also been very nice, they've managed to reverse a couple double charges without a problem and also they reversed a couple finance charges when I forgot to pay in full a couple months.  Overall, I've had pretty good results with this card.  The rewards are fairly ok.  The main complaint is that the 5% categories rotate every so often so there are certain quarters I barely get rewards because I don't do much shopping in the categories.  It also is a pain to 'sign up' for the categories every quarter; I believe you should just be enrolled automatically. besides from that, ive been very happy with this card.

name: Meda Keirstead
review: We have one credit card that we've recently gotten. We signed up for it because of the deal where you get $100 back after you spend $500. This by itself is a great reason to sign with this card. We also get points back on all our spending. Every dollar spent gives us 1 point, and certain categories give extra. It varies month to month on how much you get back. For instance this month and next month, there will be 5 points per dollar spent on gas. This is another reason we signed up for this card recently. Getting extra points for something we have to purchase is a great bonus. As people who are on top of our bills every month, it was silly of us to not have had a credit card for so long. The benefits from this are too good to pass up.

name: Heath Googe
review: I love the Chase Freedom credit card! I've never had any problems what so ever with it, and obviously, it's accepted everywhere. The bonuses are amazing as well. Simply for being approved for the card I received an extra $300 through a special offer. You can't beat that! Chases customer service is awesome as well. I had a problem with a charge and called them up, they fixed the problem immediately. No issues at all. Since I've had this credit card I have recommended it to friends, family, and co workers. Also, because my credit isn't exactly top notch, it isn't that difficult to get approved for it. What more can you ask for in a credit card?

name: Gracie Noggles
review: I use a Chase Sapphire card and I think it’s great. I use it for everyday purchases and sometimes for some larger purchases. Customer service at Chase is great; they are always helpful and pretty nice people. I have never had a problem with them, and they are pretty timely when it comes to getting back with important information. They also have a really good rewards program, so if you want to get some additional perks this would be the card to get. Great card to use if you’re looking for a low APR and some bonuses. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a new card.

name: Shannon Johnson
review: I love my Disney Dollars... Who wouldn't. The 100 sign on bonus was pretty cool. I pay my bills and stuff using this card and then pay off the monthly balance.. woo hoo... more disney dollars for me. I am planning a family vacation for next year, we are going to Disney! works out perfect and I can use up all my rewards there. Save me and my family a bunch of money. I don't really care for cards that charge annual fees, but the rest of the card and what it offers make up for it completely. With a low interest rate of 14 % I like this card. Yes you have to spend a lot to get a lot, but when in life do you ever get anything for free... If you are going to use a credit card you might as well use one that gives back to you.

name: Sami Siddiqui
review: I've gotta say, this card is nice. I'm a fan of the design (but Chase cards tend to have nice designs) and the fact that it has low APR is great. I also like that, because it's a Chase card, I can manage it from my Chase account site and don't have to use multiple sites to manage my finances. My biggest problem was a fraudulent charge to Amazon when my card was stolen. I called and asked told them the charge was fraudulent, and they fixed the charge on my account quickly. Other than that, I've had no problems for almost two years with this card.

name: Rhoda Fatora
review: I love my Chase Disney card! I use this card for all of my everyday purchases, as well as my bills. It is so easy and fast to earn points for Disney. I mostly use my points at Disney World. They give you a fun credit card to use when you redeem your points. Plus you get a discount on merchandise at Disney World! They also are always doing special offers like discounts on tickets, resorts, and double points. They also have special events like members only photos ops at Epcot. The card designs you can choose from are awesome everyone always comments on my Finding Nemo card.  They also have more manly looking cards if that is your thing.  This card is a must for any Disney fan!

name: ellen wallace
review: I started with Chase Bank over three years ago. I really haven't had very many problems, except for the overdraft fee being so high. I recently got an overdraft fee of thirty four dollars for overdrawing by twenty six cents, wow, I was shocked. Other than the overdraft fees, Chase Bank is really good with savings programs and a lot to offer with different types of loans. Trying to get a loan or mortgage requires great credit scores so I would recommend another bank for that. Overall, I continue to trust and keep my money at Chase Bank. It is a trustworthy bank.

name: Derek Rasmussen
review: I have this card and it perfectly suits my needs. Great rates and service options,  but what was really impressive to me was when it was stolen and chase quickly reversed all charges. After that they started checking on suspicious charges, actively notifying me of anything suspicious to make sure I was protected. On top of the fantastic customer service and protection this card comes with, it also has great perks and rewards. I feel like a valuable and protected customer, and it's great to know that if something happens, they'll sort it out without skipping a beat and I won't have to worry about anything, and that's priceless.

name: Chelsea Spence
review: My husband and I typically have only one credit card in our wallets at any one time. We used to have an American Express skymiles card, but then we got tired of paying the annual $90 fee. After doing some research I applied and was approved for the Chase Freedom card. I liked the idea of being able to earn 1% cash back on all purchases and 5% on certain purchases. I didn’t think it would be very much at first, but because we put all of our monthly bills on our credit cards, the 1% cash back added up very quickly. We saved enough reward points to purchase over half of our Christmas gifts the first year we got the card. I pay the card off on time every month so the interest rate didn’t affect my decision at all. Actually I’m not even sure what the interest rate is right now. Overall, my husband and I have been very happy with the Chase Freedom card and do not intend to switch to a different card anytime in the future.

name: Herbert Snow
review: I was enticed to signed up for the Amazon.com Visa card because of the $30 gift card deal back in 2007. A free $30 gift card was a great way to start off my relationship with this card. It's my default card for everything I buy at Amazon; I've never seen a reason not to use it. As for the Reward Points, I get three points for every dollar I spend on Amazon, two points for every dollar spent on gas, in drugstores and restaurants. And I also get one point for every dollar spent for everything else I use the card on. For me the points really comes in handy for shipping and handling charges, my only complaint is that I can't use my reward points to buy EBooks or online music. But over all it’s a great card and I'll continue to use it happily.

name: Rj Wong
review: The Amazon.com credit card is really a great card. I signed up for this card during one of my recent checkouts to take advantage of the $30 bonus start up. I thought I would never use this card again and would cancel it once I paid it off. It wasn't until I read more about the rewards program that I started paying more attention to this card. Most of the time when I shop online, I do it through Amazon. When I found out that you get 3 points for every dollar you spend on Amazon, I made the decision to keep the card. Soon enough I was using this card for all my online orders and got back a lot of points. Amazon's customer service is also always available so anytime I have a problem with this card, I can rest assure that an Amazon representative will be ready to help me. This is a great card and I would recommend it to anyone who does a lot of their shopping through Amazon.

name: Ebony Keomuangtai
review: I have this Chase Sapphire card. I have had it for about 6 months now. I use it all the time. For anything from grocery shopping to taking our summer vacation. Obviously is is accepted everywhere. I have never had any type of situation or complication with this card or with Chase at all. I think Chase is a great bank and they are always there to answer any question I may have about my credit card or payments. But this is not necessary since my monthly statement explains everything perfectly. I really enjoy the auto pay! It makes it easy not only to remember to pay by balance but also keep my credit awesome! I have really enjoyed my Chase credit card! I don't know how I ever survived without it before!

name: Shelly LeBlanc
review: I got this credit card because I wanted to transfer a balance from another credit card with a higher interest rate.  The customer service was great concerning the transfer transaction.  I was a little disappointed that there was an additional fee for transferring the balance, but overall I believe it was a good investment.  I would have paid much more in fees/interest had I not transferred the balance.  I really like the rewards program because I am all about getting paid to make purchases.  I am hoping that this card with the reduced interest rate will really help me to get my debt under control.  I hope that I will continue to have great customer service experiences and be able to keep my debt on this card and pay it off in a reasonable amount of time.

name: Kevin Michael
review: The Amazon credit card has been a relatively good addition to my financial options. In comparison to other cards, the rewards offered (points for use on Amazon.com) are greater than any cash back options that other companies provide. Since I do the majority of my shopping on Amazon, the card itself is wonderful. I get additional points due to my use of the site and, as a result there’s a discount in the long run. The credit limit is reasonable and the APR is competitive. I’ve never missed a payment, so I can’t speak to how well they’re able to resolve issues, but I have been extremely satisfied with my Amazon card.

name: Eric Johnson
review: I only got this card to save some money on a book I bought, and I didn't think I would use it much. But it's become one of my main credit cards, and I use it almost everyday. The $30 gift card was very useful, and the rewards program is great too. I am an Amazon Prime member and I buy a lot of things on Amazon, so the 3 points per $1 helps me out a lot. What's great is I can redeem these points for Amazon credit as well, so I can buy more things for free! However, there aren't many other ways to redeem your points, so if you aren't an avid user of Amazon, this card might not be that useful. Overall, this is a pretty good credit card, and if you use Amazon to shop a lot, you should definitely give it a try.

name: Sharvan Johnson
review: I have had a Chase Slate for about three years. It is not the best card and the only reason I keep it is for emergency purposes. The limits they grant are really low and they do not offer rewards. No rewards are the big reason why I do not use this card. I typically use my cards to buy gas for the month and pay them off but because the chase card does not offer rewards it is collecting dust. I would only recommend this card for someone who is just trying to start building a credit history. If you already have a credit history just stay clear of this card.

name: Tyler Hankins
review: This isn't a bad credit card, and if you're the kind of person who buys things on Amazon often (like myself), then I would definitely recommend it. You get a lot of cash back (anywhere from 1-3%) and then can use it on Amazon, so that’s always nifty. No monthly fees either. The only thing I’m not a big fan of is the high APR. 13.24%, really? I find that to be a little excessive for this type of card. I try to pay off my balance in full as soon as I can, so it hasn’t affected me at all, but it’s still a little scary nonetheless.All in all, it’s pretty nice. Not the best kind of credit card out there, but it does its job.

name: Elvis Dallas
review:
yup - same thing - you can send and receive $ via email. limits on how much until you verify an account, but unlike paypal (which made me wait a day for verification even with my bank login info), verification is instant for most online banking services. 

enjoy!

name: Rocio Goers
review: The customer service with Chase Freedom is fantastic. This is pretty important to me and I find that I can get somebody that speaks NATIVE English on the phone very quickly if I have an issue. The rewards system is very straight-forward, and usually offers a signup bonus of sorts - they really push you to have a checking account with them which helps accumulate points. The rewards system is still one of the best, and although they have failed to do the "extra" promotions which I was very excited about (sponsoring festivals such as Outside Lands, Coachella, Bonnaroo), I wish they were more geared to this demographic again. Overall, fairly satisfied with this great card.

name: Brock Alexander
review: This is a company I would recommend avoiding at all costs.  I keep a card in case of emergency, and actually opted to get rid of this one because they're so terrible about that.  As another poster here mentioned, my credit limit was slashed because I kept paying off my card.  That makes perfect sense for them, since I'm not the customer that made them money.  The ones that make money for them are the ones that make the minimum payment each month and end up paying more to Chase in interest than the original cost for their purchases.  There are plenty of better companies out there to deal with (Capital One is one, in my experience), but Chase is best left alone.

name: Michelle Bui
review: I first wanted this credit card after seeing my mother having it since it was so pretty, a sapphire blue, who wouldn’t want it! But after getting it I was extremely satisfied with having it. It gives you such superb rewards, like getting 10,000 bonus points after the first three months and you spend $500. Also, if you spend a certain amount of money you can get that money back which is pretty awesome. You can also get offers relating to miles, which is about 20% off the airlines that are partnered with it. I was really worried at first about the interest rate, but after having it for a while I realized that it was nothing I had to worry about at all, I didn’t even notice the annual fee or interest rate since it is really small anyway.

name: Nick Mann
review: I got this card based on a recommendation from a friend and can't say I've regretted the decision at all. Aside from having a nice little reward system, it also has barely any fees whatsoever to speak of. Not to mention, the customer service here is some of the best around. They've always helped me with my issue, been very polite, and acted as if they actually cared about my inconveniences. It's also worth mentioning that the online service they have in place is very easy to use, highly efficient, and has a solid amount of security behind it. I honestly don't see myself changing my card ever again and absolutely recommend it to anyone (especially any college students) looking for a new card or alternative to the one they already have.

name: Pablo Supremo
review: I have had a Chase Freedom credit card for the last few years and I have to say that I’m extremely happy with the rewards. I like that it does not have an annual fee and that it is on the Visa card network. It is very rewarding, especially with 2 young children and the choices of bonuses you can get and use. Amazon's bonus in the first quarter of this year was amazing since that is where we get all of our diapers from. I have to say that one of the better things of this credit card is that It has an auto rental insurance, witch covers collision, damage and loss of a rental vehicle.

name: John Tanne
review: I got  this credit card because I wanted to improve my credit.  This credit card gives you  great rewards. It has a nice introductory incentive, you  can earn 10,000 bonus points after you spend $500 in the first 3 months.  The Points  you gain never expire and there are no limits on how many points you can earn.  You can redeem points for travel, gift cards, merchandise, cash back and more.  I have to say that I am a big fan of this credit card and this one is definitely solid and a nice reward to have for anyone.  It also has a twenty four- seven dedicated service advisor. I love that. I hate to talk to machines.

name: Shawn Hetman
review: I had this card originally when the company was Providian Financial and over the course of the economic downturn, the company kept changing hands until it came under Chase and now Chase Freedom. Ever since then I had noticed Chase bumping up my monthly interest rates every three months. I didn’t have much on the card and have always paid on time. Also, my father is a veteran currently serving overseas. As such he falls under the Military Relief Act, which allowed him to send out notices of his deployment, in which case the credit companies must lower their interest rates. Chase complied with this law as if doing him a favor, only to cancel his account one week later based upon a “review” of said account. I don’t know what Chase has against servicemen but before this they also tried messing with his mortgage while he was in Afghanistan. Needless to say my personal card now sits in a shoe box as I don’t find the company to be reputable or respectful. I will probably cancel the card the next time they change the agreement.

name: Kathy Anne
review: I just recently applied for this card around last Halloween when we were booking a trip to Disney World. I liked that I got a $100 statement credit after first use. That $100 helped a lot with ticket purchasing for the parks! Another perk, since I am a big Disney fan is the ability to earn 1%-2% in Disney dollars. I was able to choose my design for my card, too. There weren't too many designs, but it was fun being able to pick my own. Another benefit is that since I am a big Disney fan is that I saved 10% off when I shopped and spent over $50 at Disney stores! It is like using a "coupon" by getting 10% back and I love my coupons. Disney World also has Card member locations for Meet N' Greets! There are other rewards, too that can be beneficial to others. However, the ones that I mentioned are what have made me enjoy this card when I use it. I try to pay my balance off every time there is one, so I don't use this card very often. I also recently called Customer Service and was able to get my question answered quickly and not given the run around. If you are a Disney fan and can make use of the rewards, friendly customer service, I definitely recommend this card. However, if you are looking for just basic rewards card, I would look else where as I have another card that offers better rewards for gas and other shopping trips.

name: Han Kozma
review: I’ve really enjoyed using the Chase Freedom card.  I pay my card off every month and this card has given me a very large limit to use.  I have this card for about two years and have gotten a lot of use out of it.  I’ve taken advantage of a lot of the different 5% cash back reward offers like Amazon.com, gas stations, movie tickets and restaurants.  In the few times I have had to call about my balance or another other questions I have always been treated fairly and with respect.  Currently this is the only credit card I use, other than at warehouse stores that do not take Visa.

name: Matthew Seitz
review: Have you ever wondered if you could get free stuff from using your credit cards responsibly?  Well you can, my wife and I both are very strict with credit card use.  However her parents use them for as many purchases and bills as possible and make sure to pay them off every month.  This is great for responsible people, but what about the others.  Well a great way we found to manage this is to move any money we spend from our checking into our savings during the month.  This brings our balance down still and makes us feel as if we are still spending from our checking.  The rewards we like to get and have for the past year are free movies(Lisa's Favorite), gift cards, and even paid off the bill towards our Hawaii trip.  If you can find a way to get free stuff now days you have to take advantage of it.  Chase rewards us and we reward our self by being responsible.

name: Beth SIim
review: I signed up for the Chase Freedom card back in college just to get my credit going. I've used the card for over four years now. I haven't had any negative experiences with Chase other than they were a little slow to increase my credit limit. The terms of the card were easy to understand so I didn't have to play the game of having to figure out which credit card to use for gas and groceries. The Chase card is simple and it makes me life a little easier. They don't send a lot of paper mail either, which is great for the environment.

name: Dan Bowne
review: My wife and I have had our card for about 6 months now.  We haven't had to make a purchase until recently in June.  For some reason we did not receive our statement in the mail nor were we signed up for the e-Bill.  We then received a call last week regarding our account letting us know it was past due and now has a $25.00 processing fee.  I called up and spoke to a representative named Mary and explained we never received our first bill and felt it was not our fault.  I was willing to pay well above the minimum payment and let her know that.  She said that she apologizes that we didn't receive the payment and promptly eliminated the $25 late fee.  I then made a payment over the phone and settled the issue.  She then told me when the next statement should come in the mail and if I don't receive it by a specific date to call and make a payment and they will look into the statement delivery issue.  All in all I was satisfied with the customer service and was very happy dealing with Mary.  She was very kind and courteous and would love to speak with her again if I have another problem, but I know that wouldn't happen.  Hopefully all the reps are like her.  Other than that Chase gave us good rates with a good introductory period.  I would recommend Chase and their cards to people looking.

name: Qing Lu
review: I had this card for a while several years ago. The incentive for me to get this card was that Amazon provided some discount for my first purchase on Amazon with this card. I was not a frequent buyer on Amazon at that time, so I did not use this card very often and for almost two months I did not touch it. A few months later when I was trying to get a loan I got a copy of my credit report, and surprisingly found that I had an unpaid balance on this card, which significantly reduced my credit score. I was very sure that I had not received any bill from this credit card, and I totally forgot the money I spent with this card several months ago (which was only 20 something dollars). The late fee penalty was higher than the initial discount I got. I called the credit card customer service and tried to ask them to waive the late fee since I had not received a statement from them. Apparently they sent the statement to a wrong address. However, the late fee was not waived and my credit score was lowered. Being very pissed off, I canceled the card immediately and so have never wanted it again, although I am now shopping more frequently on Amazon. Currently there are many other credit cards that provide higher point return than this card, such as the Chase Sapphire preferred card. I am happy with other cards and don't feel the need to get this Amazon card.

name: Wesley Downs
review: My sapphire card is the favorite on in my wallet. I changed from using my Citi card to this one for my everyday purchases as well because of the better rewards structure, the low APR also makes it convenient if I need to carry a balance for a larger purchase (this is the only card I'll carry a balance on). The one factor that really sets this card apart from all others though is the instant live customer service, it is such a relief to call for help and an actual person answer the phone.

name: Rudolf Machinsky
review: I currently have 3 credit cards, and Chase is by far my favorite.  I love the cashback bonuses, and I don't feel like you have to jump through hoops to receive your money.  I do have to remember to log on every three months and click the link, but that isn't a problem for me since I pay the bill online.  You can get a check after earning only $20, which is much better than the $50 that my Discover card requires.  Additionally, my minimum payment is much less than my discover payment, even when the cards hold the same balance. I have never experienced a problem with my card.

name: Greg Harris
review: I have owned this Credit Card for several years, being upgraded to Chase Sapphire a couple of years ago.  Normally, I would keep a small balance, and sometimes I would pay it off entirely.  Overall, I have had positive experiences with this credit card.  Two examples jump immediately to mind.  First, my wife was traveling in Asia for school and she used the credit card to purchase something.  I immediately received a phone call from their fraud detection unit asking me if these charges were authorized.  Second, I have occasionally used the automated systems with operators' assistance.  The bank's customer service has always been wonderful.  Finally, and most importantly, I have enjoyed the rewards I have received.  I have mostly taken cash back, but a long time ago, I would seek travel benefits and electronics and never had a problem.  I would strongly recommend this bank for credit card usage.

name: Wendi Taylor
review: First of all, I never intended to do business with JP Morgan.  I was banking with WAMU, when JP Morgan bought them out with tax money stolen from me by the gov't & given to them as part of the illegal and unconstitutional 'bailout' program.   Immediately after the hostile takeover of my bank, I received a letter assuring me that all agreements I had with WAMU would be honored for the life of my account.  I doubted that would be true, but decided to give them a chance.  I stayed with them for a while to see how things would go, and one of the first things I noticed was declining customer service, more and more confusion about the accounts, fewer branches because they were closing all of the WAMU locations, etc.  I was not happy and looking at other banks.  The final straw came when I got a letter stating that I would be charged for my 'free' checking account, regardless of my agreement with WAMU or the letter I had from Chase stating they would honor that agreement.  I immediately closed the account and will never do business with this company again.

name: El
review: I signed up for a Chase high school checking account three years ago and have recently cancelled it. It was one of the worst checking accounts I have ever had the displeasure of using. The bank branch closest to me is a nice enough location and the people are competent enough, but their phone service is horrible. Additionally, I didn't use the debit card they gave me for a few months and they charged me something ridiculous like $10/month because of it. I paid almost $70 in fees for NOT USING an account. After contacting customer service I wasn’t reimbursed, despite the fact that I wasn’t supposed to have been charged the fees in the first place. I promptly withdrew all of my money and cut up my card. Maybe their other accounts are better but I’ve had a savings account with them too (separate) and it was nothing but painful. Wouldn’t really recommend.

name: S
review: I had a Chase checking account for about six months as a direct deposit account for my paycheck. When I signed up for direct deposit, I was given $100 to start out in my account. However, after I read the terms and conditions regarding the fees for the account, I decided that I wanted to close the account, but I was not allowed to until a six-month period passed because they gave me $100. I did not encounter any problems with the account, but I was concerned about the fees for not having enough money in the account or making too many withdrawals.

name: deidre wilson
review: When I turned 18 I was looking to open my first Checking account and I chose Chase. It was sort of a family affair, both of my parents banked there as did my older siblings. 13 years later and I am still a loyal customer! They have one of the best checking accounts that I have found. Yes, there are ones that are cheaper and with lower fees but they do not beat the security and the wonderful customer service that Chase offers. I has noticed an item on my back statement and called the bank. It was not an ATM charge made by me. With no questions asked and within 10 minutes the money was replaced into my account. No paper work, no hassle. When I called my bank about an overdraft fee that I had received, I never use my over draft, it was waived. I think that I would rather pay a few dollars more a month in order to assure that when I really need help it will come through

name: Jenny Cobos
review: I switched over to Chase from Regions and could not be happier. Chase never fails to alert me when there is a potential problem with my account. Our bank account information was stolen and they immediately contacted us when someone attempted to charge a $1400 plane ticket. When my husband went to Saudi Arabia and tried to buy groceries, they put a hold on the card for suspicious activity and contacted me within 5 minutes of the attempted purchase to clear things up. I will continue to bank and Chase and recommend them to my friends and family.

name: Melinda Varney
review: I have been with Chase through multiple moves (having had an account with them since my mother helped me set it up at the age of sixteen), and they have always made the process incredibly easy. Being so young when I first had my bank account, my spending definitely was not perfect, but Chase has always worked with me to ensure quick resolutions to all my problems. I remember when I had to get my ex-fiancee off the account, and he was less than cooperative. Chase went above and beyond to find a way to successfully do this. They really do care, no matter which branch I end up at.

name: jebb
review: I have had very good experiences with Chase Bank.  I was being charged a service fee for my checking account.  I received a telephone call from a customer service representative from the bank.  The rep from the bank invited me to come by and meet him and see if we could look in to a way of getting rid of the monthly fee that I was paying.  I agreed to stop by and talk with him. I set up a time and went to see him.  He was very courteous and asked me some questions and then explained a variety of different options that I could use to avoid getting these fees.  I never felt like he was pressuring in to anything.  I ended up not having to pay the $3.95 every month.  I would recommend this bank to anyone.

name: Zach Soliz
review: While I was a minor my parents setup a Chase Bank account to save for my college funds. Now that I have access to the account I am able to make direct interaction with Chase bank. So far I have not ran into too many problems with them, I get a decent interest on my account. I have had some problems when it comes to personal communication with the bank, I had some charges come from my account that were not from me and while Chase did handle it, it took a long time for them to refund the money. When I was with a  small credit union the money was refunded much faster. So overall, use them if you must.

name: Patricia C
review: I absolutely love Chase bank. They seem so cutting edge with their technology! The overdraft fees are a little steep, but all their staff is super friendly and helpful. I absolutely love the check deposit from your phone! I do it ALL the time and it almost always clears and posts to my account the same day! I'm pregnant with three kids and going to the bank is NOT convenient. Taking a quick picture of my check and putting in a few small details is a much better way to go! I've never had any problems with it.When I was in the hospital having my last baby, their was a fraudulent charge of over $600 that hit our account. I spent about an hour on the phone between Chase and the place the charge was made. Chase immediately refunded the amount while it was being disputed and resolved the actual problem quickly. I'd highly recommend them to everyone! Just be sure not to go over what you have so you don't get fees!

name: T
review: Our mortgage was sold to Chase about a year after we moved into our home. It turned out to be a blessing in disguise. Unlike the original holder of our mortgage, Chase kept us informed of all information dealing with our account. We received prior notice when there were changes with our payments due to escrow account changes. Each escrow notice came with a detailed, easy to understand breakdown of each deposit and withdrawal from the account. Chase also offered chances for us to skip a payment but we never took advantage of these offers. Overall, having Chase hold our mortgage has been a good experience.

name: Amanda House
review: All I can say about this bank is simply STAY AWAY. Chase has provided me with the absolute worst experience with any money or banking system in my entire life. At first glance, the staff looked great. They were more than willing to help me and made me very comfortable with opening up an account with this company. However, that is where the positive aspects all ended. I at first thought that the whole application process was very simple and fast and easy. However, within days of opening my account, it was closed. I called to inquire what had happened. After waiting on the telephone for more than an hour, all they told me was that I should be receiving a letter in the mail with all the information that I needed. So I had already gotten my card and soon after received another letter from them in the mail. The letter basically told me they closed my account because they had the right to do so. My only way to then solve this was to go directly to one of their branches in person. I went within the next couple of days. Finally I was able to resolve everything, and with no explanation. I got all of my money back and switched banks. If I were you I would stay away from this bank, or at least wait until they get their act together.

name: Ashley Burgos
review: I have had a checking account with Chase bank for two years.  I have never had any problems with them.  Any time my account has been charged unauthorized charges, they have put the funds back in my account within 4 hours.  They have never given me any issues or argued with me about whether the funds were authorized or not.  Once I had a hotel charge my account for a room two times.  Once the mistake was realized, the hotel manager sent a fax in to Chase to reverse the charges immediately.  We were on vacation in New York City, so this was a big deal.  I recommend Chase bank.

name: Samantha Valdez
review: When it comes to Chase bank, they are one of the most well known banks around. When I go into deposit a check, they are always very friendly and helpful. There have been a few times where I have had issues with them, and it has seemed like they were reluctant to help me out. I once had an issue with owing the bank money and had tried to work something out where I could make payments on the account, and they said that wasn't possible. That was one thing that did tend to turn me off with the bank.

name: Kristee Acavado
review: When it came time for me to find a credit card that is easy to apply for, easy to use and has awesome benefits I looked at several banks before deciding that the Chase Sapphire card was the right one for me. It was a simple choice, really. Chase had one of the lowest annual fees and great rewards for things like dining and travel, which are my two favorite things to do. Since I use my credit card to pay off bills it was easy to earn 40K points in three months, not including any of the points I earned in the meantime. I have used this bank for three years and had this card for about two. I have already taken advantage of the points I earned and booked a few nights at a hotel during my vacation without a hitch. Customer service is great too; I have never had a problem with them and they always answer my questions down to the point. I would recommend this bank to anyone!

name: JANICE
review: Iâve had the same Chase credit card for several years now. Their customer service is great from talking to actual people on the phone to quick responses through email. Customer service is a big deal for me because there are so many companies out there that donât value customer service anymore.A few experiences Iâve had: finding fraudulent charges on my card and Chase was very quick in sending me a new card and taking off the fraudulent charges without any complications.  I do most of my inquiries through the message center. Responses are sent within 24 hours and theyâre very nice and cordial.Every experience Iâve had with Chaseâs customer service has been pleasant and Iâve never hung up the phone angry or frustrated neither have I sent angry emails or read rude replies from them.  I donât think Iâve had any negative experiences with their service and I hope it stays that way.Iâm thankful there are still companies out there (though they may be few) who values our relationship and appreciates my business.

name: Tony
review: When I first applied for a mortgage, it was with a company that (I didn’t realize at the time) sold mortgages to other companies. This original company allowed me to pay with a credit card (which I have learned is uncommon), and allowed me to accumulate points.My mortgage was sold to Chase, and they don’t allow credit card payments, which is the only reason for a 4-star review instead of a 5-star review. Aside from the upsetting ~$10 fee for paying with a credit card, Chase gave me no troubles with my mortgage. I was able to pay online with a bank transfer for free, which saved me the hassle and cost of postage every month.Overall, I had a pleasant experience with them, but just be careful about the nickel-and-dime tricks that all banks use.

name: Mona Verona
review: What IS it with banks these days? Do they REALLY have such disdain for their customers...the ones who keep them in business? Chase SUCKS! We had two checking accounts...our personal and our business account...(as well as a couple of credit cards) with Washington Mutual, which Chase gobbled up a few years ago when all the big banks seemed to be taking over the small ones. Washington Mutual was GREAT! Their tellers and customer service employees were helpful and courteous, and we NEVER had a problem with them. Then Chase muscles their way in and BAM! EVERYTHING did a 180! Suddenly their tellers were all replaced in our branch and they were sullen and curt (they probably hated working there). The one time I had need to call customer service was an absolute nightmare! On hold for over half an hour and being shunted from one person to the other...it was ridiculous! By the time I finally did get to the person who could help with my problems, she was rather snotty and would not listen to me. She just kept jabbering on and on and on whatever the corporate line was, cutting me off in mid-sentence and telling me that the problem I was having couldn't possibly exist. That was the LAST straw. We pulled BOTH our checking account money out (but are still stuck with Chase for our credit cards that originated with Washington Mutual). When we did, the branch manager wanted to know why and who we were transferring to...in detail. I told her my story about the customer service debacle and informed her in no uncertain terms that WHERE we were taking our money was absolutely NONE of her business (we moved it to a GREAT credit union that, sadly, can't be reviewed on this site). AVOID CHASE!!

name: Amanda Sanders
review: I have been with Chase for about a year now. I recently had to make a visit to one of their branches because I had a suspicious charge that I did not authorize come out of my account. The gentleman that helped me was very nice and very helpful. He even went on the internet and looked up the charge by the name in the description. He immediately found numerous people who have had this exact same charge come out of their account and it was always unauthorized. He immediately set up everything for me to be fully returned all my lost money and set up an investigation as well. He also canceled my debit card (after verifying that the charge did indeed process through that number and not my bank account number). He gave me all the instructions I would need when I got my new debit card and he advised me on what to look out for on my account. He was so very helpful. I feel very confident that Chase will protect me and my money.

name: rex
review: I have relied on Chase Bank for a number of years now.  It's great here on the west coast because just about every corner there is a bank or an ATM machine available.  I run my business with Chase and I am totally satisfied the way they take care of me.  My funds are assessable 24/7 and I totally have faith in them.  Being a customer that checks their account everyday, Chase always provides up to date information on what transactions are going on with my account.  This is very important for my business. I would highly recommend them for running your business.

name: Jane Bernard
review: I do not like Chase Bank. They have some of the rudest, worst customer service I have ever experienced. I went there one day to deposit a lot of change that I had acquired. Chase used to have a counting machine where a person could get a ticket and use that to deposit their money. Not only did they get rid of that but the bank teller would not take my change. What kind of bank refuses to take a persons money! It wasn't even as if I had a ton of change either, it was one small bag. The woman was very rude to me and seemed derisive and told me that I had to wrap it myself. As if I just spontaneously have the ability to wrap change. Take your money elsewhere.

name: Greg Takeshima
review: I've had Chase as a bank for a while but I decided to go with one of their rewards credit cards because I didn't have a Visa rewards card (I have the Costco AMEX and the Discover More card).  They were a decently good bank, not too much praise but a bank none-the-less with normal banking issues and catches.  The card I signed up for was the Chase Sapphire Preferred card.  After spending $3000 in 3 months (I think) I received 40,000 points to use how I saw fit.  That was nice, but after a year I was hit with a $95 annual fee.  I noticed that the annual fee was only for the preferred card so I switched over to the Chase Sapphire and haven't looked back.  Good card with decent rewards and more accepted than AMEX or Discover.

name: Michael Johnson
review: Chase is a great bank to have.  They truly do care about their customers in every way. Questions, comments, concerns??? They answer to them in a quick fashion!! Online banking is a plus for me since I travel so often. Making it easier to bank for me. I have never had an issue whatsoever with them. Customer service is top notch, I have never had any hidden fees that I needed to worry about and I am quickly made aware of any changes that will be taking place to the bank or my account. . Chase gets 2 thumbs up in my book. Anyone looking for an honest, professional banking experience, and kind caring representatives...Bank with Chase.

name: Charlie Hampton
review: I first opened my Chase checking account joined to my parents when I was 17. I am now 19 and still have that same account. For the most part it has been handy - easy to transfer money, pay bills, and the online banking is awesome. There have been a couple times when the website has been down but I was able to get my balance via text (vs calling). The customer service has also been amazing. I was able to get an overdrawn fee wiped away (since it was my first time) without a problem. The main "cons" would have to be that 1. I don't earn any interest on my money (that's why I currently have a checking account with a different bank as well). and 2. There are fees if you don't meet a certain criteria.

name: Todd Landerson
review: I first signed up with Chase in 2007 when they offered a $100 cash incentive for new accounts. I later learned that they required 6 months of account activity after opening to keep the money, but that was alright I guess since I've now kept the account open for five years. Chase has been a reliable place to keep my modest savings, with a few hiccups along the way, mostly from me keeping a low balance and not having this as my primary account, but they've been helpful when they can. I'm trying to build credit right now so I'll probably apply for a card through Chase soon.

name: Theresa r Edgerton
review: I've been a member of Chase since 2006.  In general I think Chase is a pretty good financial institution.  I have my check direct deposited into my checking account and have never had any issues with that.  I pay about 90% of my bills online through their online bill payment system.  I've never had an issue with that either.  The only thing that kind of gets me upset is the ridiculous overdraft fees.  Lately I have been in a financial crunch and have gone over on my account.  I realize this was completely my fault and accepted that the overdraft fees are my responsibility.  What I do not agree with is the "extra" overdraft fee for the extended period in which my account was in the negative.  Obviously I am broke because my account is negative so why charge the extra fee?  Fifteen dollars extra for being negative?  Pretty lame in my opinion. I plan to call them and request the fee be refunded.  I hope they will help me out.

name: Jose Flores
review: I have used Chase bank for a long time now. They simply provided me with exactly what I needed. They donât have hidden fees. This bank make things as easy as possible for those that use their services. They have a great website and online service. You can communicate with a representative whom will be very helpful. They have a lot of ATMs, so you donât have to worry about getting money from a far away ATM.  I think it's a no brainer to use this bank. I would recommend it for any one who is  looking to join this bank

name: T.M Thomas
review: I have used Chase bank ever since they merged with Washington Mutual. Overall, I am underwhelmed with their customer service practices, fees, and problem resolution. Of the three areas where I am underwhelmed, I am most disturbed with their problem resolution practices. They have a "pass the buck" mentality in the physical branches, relying too heavily on the 800 number in order to assist customers. This, to me, proves a lack of ownership for customer concerns. Any time I complain with the phrase, "It wasn't like this when I was using Washington Mutual," I always get a response of "Your account is still with Washington Mutual; We are just servicing the account." I would have transferred my account to another bank over a year ago, but I have found that all banks are basically the same, and I would just be selecting between the lesser of two evils.

name: Elaine
review: All in all I use Chase ONLY because I have some direct business deposits attached to my checking account. I opened a Free Checking account while in college with Bank One which was taken over by Chase. First off they stopped Free checking unless I had a direct deposit per month which I did. Next they stated I needed over $500 in direct deposits per month or I would be charged for my checking.With all the competition they have with other banks which offer Free Checking I have no idea why this bank insists on charging it's customers.I like their customer service yet dislike their money grabbing policies.

name: stephen samuels
review: I had a mortgage with Chase Bank for about 8 years.  They were not the original owner of the mortgage so I can not accurately describe how helpful they were with applying.  I can say that once they obtained the mortgage the maintenance, paperwork, and paying of the mortgage was very simple.  The online site for Chase allowed me to get all access to my mortgage any time I wanted.  If I had any questions a simple click and I was talking to a representative online who was always knowledgeable and helpful.  All documentation of  the mortgage I ever needed I could get online or order and have within 2-3 days.  Their service was always quick and easy.  If we had more banking locations of Chase near us I would highly consider switching my full banking to them, but at this time location is an issue.  I would highly recommend working with them due to their professionalism and ease.

name: Barbara Alvacado
review: I have been using my Chase Disney Credit Card as my primary card for about 2 years. I am able to enjoy a good interest rate and I have a good credit limit on this card.  This gives me the freedom that I need, but the biggest benefit of the card is the ability to earn Disney dollars. My son goes to Disney world every year with his high school band and we are able to give him a prepaid debit card with the Disney dollars on it that I have earned.  It provides him with plenty of money and is much safer than giving a teenager cash.  We are also able to use the Disney dollars when we go Christmas shopping at the Disney Store.  It is a great card for our family to use.

name: Dragon Wagon
review: Unlike other rewards based credit cards, Amazon’s card is top notch. Other offers and cards I’ve had in the past took ages to acquire points. Once you finally had enough points, the rewards were few a far between. Luckily, Amazon’s credit card is quite the opposite. As a student I am constantly buying items on their website to save money. Besides school related costs, my only bills aside from rent are gas and groceries, which both count towards points. Plus, you also have Amazon’s fantastic customer service if a problem were to arise. After a year and half, this card has been nothing but great!

name: Robert Jr.
review: My wife and I have over 25000 miles available since we have gotten this card.  We have been card holders for about 2 years now.  The interest is really high, but it is important to pay off whatever you charge at the end of the month.  We do not plan to close the account because of the benefits it gives us considering the fact that her family lives overseas.  We probably purchase tickets about once a year for 3 people, so the miles don’t rack up as fast as other people, but it is fast enough.  We are very happy with this card.

name: Amanda Campbell
review: I have really enjoyed being an Amazon.com credit card holder so far.  I enjoyed the $30 bonus that I got for signing up.  It seems like it is very worth it to become a cardholder.  It is a breeze to purchase items off of Amazon.com too because I don't have to enter in my payment information over and over again.  Amazon has made it incredibly easy to make purchases and that makes me happy as a consumer.  It has been the best credit card I have signed up for in a long time.  I would recommend to anyone to get this credit card if they are looking to get a credit card.

name: Graciela Morger
review: I originally signed up for the cashback offer which was awesome.  I don't use the card that often and always pay the bill on time.  I had a low interest rate...when I got my bill this month the interest rate skyrocketed!  Better read the fine print before you sign up!  I find that this happens with most things that you get for "free".  If you don't read the fine print, like the guy below says, keep your eyes peeled or they will peel them for you.  also, if you are looking for a points card, read the fine print on that as well...does add up as easily as it sounds!

name: Jennifer Weingartner
review: This card is the only one we use. We loved the free flight with the initial purchase. It's crazy how fast points add up. Also, you can use the points for more than just flights. The payment is really easy. Since we were already banking with Chase, it is just added to the bottom of our online account information. The card has great customer service and many other ways to get points. Since there is an annual fee, it is beneficial to use this card often. In our opinion it's totally worth it because we love Southwest!

name: Stephen Samuels
review: If you travel then having a hotel points credit card like this one is great.  You earn points on all purchases and extra points on Marriott stays.  While the points thresh holds seem monumental at first you will find they add up quickly and will be redeeming for hotel stays and upgrades in no time.  The interest rate and fees on the card are not always ideal but the points for stays more then make up for this if you travel and use them.   A must for the hotel goer, but would not recommend for people who do not stay at hotels much.

name: Greg Takeshima
review: I jumped on the chance to get 40,000 points from Chase when they offered it a few months ago.  So far the Chase system and credit card is a relatively good credit card that offers a prorated amount of miles, approximately 20% off partner airlines.  After earning your points you can also cash them out for cash if you so prefer.  I've only had to contact Chase once to inquire about a charge and the customer service rep was kind enough to delete the charge as it was on their fault of their system.  The APR is normal (~14-18% depending upon your credit worthiness) for a rewards card.  Great card with a few perks that make it worth it.  My Chase Sapphire is branded a visa so when the vendor doesn't take AMEX or Discover I whip this guy out to keep my rewards coming.

name: Paula Hall
review: I must agree this card is wonderful. When I signed up a year ago I however was not required to spend $1k to get the 50k in points, I just needed to make one purchase in any amount. These points have definitely come in handy, it is essentially a free flight. The point system is very rewarding in that you are awarded points for purchasing SW travel and again for using your card. This applies to car rentals, hotels, dining, etc. I have almost 80k in points and they reward you on your anniversary with bonus points and SW has no blackout dates, points don't expire and no baggage fees. My only issue with this card is that I use it more then I pay it off! Totally worth having in your wallet.

name: Roxy Mow
review: The reason I chose the Chase Freedom Card is because the gave me a terrific 0% offer for the first year, and zero cost to transfer a card balance. I took advantage of this offer and it was easy to pay the card balance off in the first year. Then I negotiated with the company to offer me a lower interest rate due to my good credit scores and the fact that I had just paid off the balance. I have never been late or had any reason to incur any weird fees. So I can't write about that, but I did lose my wallet once and I had to report my card missing. Luckily, the person who found my wallet returned it and never tried to use my card or anything like that. But the Chase company was very nice. They cancelled my old card and had my new card to me within days. I just can't think of anything bad to say about them. I use their online bill features to track my spending, pay my bills and download statements. I feel like the site is secure and I never have had a problem with the posting of my purchases. Everything is a pleasure with this credit card.

name: Randy Mesa
review: I have this credit card for over a year now. So far I like it have not had any problems with it. It does not have a high APR so I really like that about it. Right now this is my main card that I use because its my favorite. I've called customer service when I lost my card and the service was just great and they send me a new card instantly. Also I constantly check the balance online and also to make payments. I like that because I like to be in control of my finances, you know you can never be to careful.

name: Seth Jones
review: This was my first time with a rewards card of any kind. I can’t believe I waited this long to give it a try. I guess it was all the mumbo jumbo about flight points and blackout days. The fact that this is strait up cash made it much easier to take the chance. The initial 500 in three months was nothing. I send more then that on groceries alone. Like they said I got 100 in cash back after passing that 500 mark. It was actually kind of exhilarating to get something back from a credit card company for the first time. It’s actually like a game now to see what category I’m getting my cash back on and spending just a little bit more there knowing I’m going to see some of that money again.

name: Ashley Davis
review: I've had this card for a little over 2 years now. I've had absolutely no problems with it and find that it's a good credit card to have. I was transferred my balance from my old credit card (for free) so I would have all of my accounts at one bank. This card doesn't have a crazy interest rate and there are frequent promotions such as no interest for 12 months for certain purchases. I think this is a good credit card to have as a "main" card. One of the good things about the card is that you can go to Chase and make a payment the day it's due and it's automatically applied. You don't have to wait a few days. This is good if you're having a tough month or the bill kind of slipped your mind! I would recommend this card and give it a 4/5 stars!

name: Michael VanDyke
review: I've had this card for a number of years and it's a good one.  The web interface has gone through a lot of changes and it's gotten a lot better.  Viewing rewards points and redeeming them is easy, and Chase has always been quick about sending my rewards in the mail.  On the downside, Chase is kind of a mixed bag when it comes to customer service.  I've never had any big issues with their help, but once in a while I get someone on the line that I just cannot understand despite my best efforts.  If 100% American customer service is a selling point for you, then look elsewhere.  But if you can see past a small language barrier for the few times that you'll need to speak with someone, then this card is a good option.

name: Al Wichrowski
review: I used Chase when I got out of college and moved out of state (my previous bank was local). I had a great experience with them. They had excellent customer service; the tellers were always friendly and trying to help me out. I really wished I could have tried their smart phone application; I think it is great that you can take a picture of a check and automatically deposit it. I ended up changing banks to the one my girlfriend uses because it was more convenient for us but I would go back to Chase in a heartbeat. I was a pretty low maintenance customer but they still treated me as though they really wanted to help.

name: Jenn Mae
review: I've had a Chase Sapphire Preferred card for about two years now and have had no problems with it as of yet. I love the low interest rate and the benefits that come with this awesome card. I also have a Chase debit card and they make it easy to use them both together. I actually completely forgot that there was a rewards program and was surprised to find that I had 200 dollars worth of points. I redeemed them for a Macy's card and went on a shopping splurge for myself. The customer service is great about answering any questions I have and are extremely helpful. I've had a great experience with this card and recommend it to anyone looking to sign up for a new credit card!

name: Charity
review: Originally, I banked with Washington Mutual and was quite hesitant when Chase Bank took over. I am impressed by Chaseâ€™s customer centered services and user friendly online banking and mobile applications.  Since, I have been banking with Chase I have truly enjoyed my experience. The customer service representatives at the 1-800 number are extremely helpful and are always willing and ready to troubleshoot. However, some of the branches are hit or miss. The tellers in the branches are friendly, but at different times of the day I have experienced lengthy waits and unorganized staff responses to high customer demands. Overall, I have enjoyed my banking experience with Chase.

name: Danielle Pattee
review: This is the first credit card that I have ever had where I paid an annual fee.  Getting an annual 5K mile bonus takes some of the sting of that annual fee.  Overall I have been very pleased with this card.  I love that I can pay my bill on my iPhone. I religiously use this card when I'm at the grocery store and gas station.  The miles can really add up quick!  Customer service people have always been super professional and courteous too!  I've unfortunately lost my card several times and have always been send a replacement card in no time!

name: Richard Thompson
review: I originally got this card due to an offer of a $50 gift card from Amazon if I signed up for it, and I'm very glad that I took the offer. I make a lot of purchases through Amazon, and the 3 points per 1 dollar spent there really racks up reward points quickly. Plus Amazon makes it extremely easy to use your accrued points on your purchases, so there's no hassle in redeeming them. I even end up using it at places other than Amazon, simply due to the ease with which I can use the points that I get.I'd definitely recommend this card to anyone who regularly shops with Amazon.

name: Kim Alberto
review: it is an ad ... amazon just hacked into his account

name: Shelby Maranowski
review: At the time I applied for the Chase Freedom Visa card, I had a Capital One Journey card, which I promptly closed because I found that I didn’t need any other card than the Chase card. I loved that there was 0% interest for twelve months, which helped me furnish my new apartment, pay bills, etc. We started out with a $700 limit, and since we always paid the bill on time or early, Chase raised our credit limit to $1,300. Their website is easy to navigate to pay my bill and check my transactions and balances, and I have never encountered an issue with Chase Bank or the Chase card. I would definitely recommend this card to people with fair credit or better.

name: Milly Kozusko
review: This is hands down my favorite credit card that I have in my wallet.  I was approved instantly for a high limit and I am just loving all the benefits and rewards that come along with the card.  Typically, I am not a big fan of using a credit card at all.  I don't like to over-extend my purchasing power and typically stick to cash or debit.  But I will say that given the relatively low interest rate, coupled with the ease of use/account management features, that this card is a winner in my book.

name: Frank Papageorgio
review: The Chase Freedom card is a pretty good rewards card to have if you don't want an annual fee.  While it isn't the best for making your every day purchases since you only get 1% back (which is a standard these days), Chase offers up to 5% back in select categories.  The only catch is that you have to sign in through their website and basically activate those bonus rewards every 3 months.  This card is great if you are using it only for those categories.  In Q1 this year you could get the 5% back at Amazon and Gas Stations, Q2 was grocery stores, Q3 right now is restaurants, and Q4 will be Best Buy, Hotels and Airlines.  If you are looking to maximize your rewards, this card can definitely give you a bonus in those categories.  You really just need to remember to activate the rewards every quarter and then break the habit of using your regular card for the next 3 months.  I also get an additional cash back bonus for having an account with Chase, which is originally what drew me to the card in the first place, so keep that in mind as well!

name: Marvin Grillot
review: My Chase Sapphire Preferred is my favorite card. I debated canceling it after the first year due to the annual fee but haven't so far because of the no foreign exchange fees. So far I've been very, very happy with the card because of the rewards system it has. I also have Chase Freedom and hate that you have to register every quarter for the award categories, none of that nonsense with the Sapphire preferred. Another huge bonus was being able to participate in a VIP event they had in my city through Ultimate Rewards. It was $100 for three days of dining and drinking all over the city, had the time of my life.

name: Qing Lu
review: I have had this card for several years. I got this card before UA and CO were merged, so I have another Chase credit card for Continental. Both cards offered me some sign-in bonus mileages.For one period of time in the past I traveled a lot and I exclusively took UA flights. I had been using this card for almost every purchase, simply to accumulate the mileage. However, recently I have stopped using this card for two reasons: First, I got a Chase Sapphire Preferred card which provided a generous 50k mileage, which can be equally transferred to my UA mileage account. Chase Sapphire provided the same point return for purchase as the United MileagePlus card. However, the Chase Sapphire points can be transferred to any UA mileage account for free, which is very convenient. On the other hand, if I want to transfer my UA mileage to others I have to pay a large amount of money. Second, in recent years, the UA service has deteriorated and it seems there are plenty of UA mileage floating on the market, which significantly increases the amount of mileage points to redeem a flight ticket. I remember four years ago it was easy to book an international round trip ticket with 65k mileages for any time period. Nowadays, it is almost impossible to find such a deal and usually 65k mileages can only be redeemed for a one-way trip ticket. I have stopped using the United MileagePlus card for a while, but haven't decided whether or not to cancel it, since I am still flying with UA and have a Premier Gold status. Probably before the next time the annual fee is due, I will cancel this card.

name: Jennifer Carlyle
review: I have had a Chase Sapphire Card for about a year now and use it frequently. I usually pay off most of my balance each month, and have been gaining rewards points too. The rewards program is great, and it's not something you will find with other cards out there. You can pick out free stuff with your points, and even get money back. There is no annual fee which is the best part in my opinion. I have not had any trouble out of the company or using the card, and it is definitely one I would recommend to others. You really need to have excellent credit to get this card, but it’s also one of the best cards out there.

name: Kevin Black
review: This has to be one of my favorite credit cards.  It's a simple and basic Visa offered through Chase, but I shop a lot and Amazon and have taken advantage of the card's features.  I instantly received a $40 Amazon gift card credit when I was approved.  That was an incredible incentive from the very beginning.  I was able to use that $40 to get premium grade brake rotors for my truck FOR FREE!  A seller on Amazon had them listed for dirt cheap.  I earn 1 point for every dollar spent on the card.  I use the card to pay the ridiculous bill for my cable service and cell phone service each month. I also earn 2 points every time I use the card for gas or dinner at a restaurant.  The points QUICKLY add up, and they are easily exchanged for cash back and gift cards.  If you are someone that shops a lot on Amazon, you should definitely use this card to shop.  You will get 3 points for every dollar you spend on Amazon.  This may not seem like a lot, but you'll be in great shape if you spend and pay off consistently.  I have never had any customer service issues with this card.  Payments are credited without problems, and my interest rate has always been steady.

name: William Henderson
review: I had the chase sapphire card and was really pleased and impressed with their service, I had a 10k cl but I recently changed over to the sapphire preferred  with a 15k limit even better rewards and no international exchange fees. it cost $75.00 per year but the bonus points more than cover that. I dumped American express back when I got the sapphire card. Beats American express hands down.  One of the best things about sapphire cards is no recordings when you call (ever) and if you call from a phone number registered to you the automatically have all your account info. no questions asked. I have a wells Fargo and discover just to keep my limits above $35,000 but this is my go to card. You will love it.

name: Kyle Dixon
review: This was a second credit card. It first interested me because of the offer of $300 cash back just for spending $500 in the first 3 months. Also, It is great as it is accepted everywhere and has no annual fee. Plus there is no limit to the rewards that you can earn and Chase offers a large variety of rewards to choose from including cash. I like that! This is my favorite Chase card, but I would recommend any of the cards that they offer as they are backed by Chase customer service. I have had several dealings with Chase customer service over the years and cannot be more highly impressed. In the day and age when banks are out to charge as many fees as they can to make money, Chase instead seems to be concentrating on customer service and going out of their way to keep their customers happy  and show them good will. If you pay your balance off every month, don't want an annual fee and want a variety of rewards to choose from, this is the card for you.

name: Stacey Lee
review: The Chase Freedom Visa is a fantastic credit card. I have a high interest rate, but this doesn't matter since I pay it off every month and do not incur a balance. The rewards system is great: 1% cash back on every purchase and 5% on special purchases (gas, groceries, etc) depending on what quarter it is. This makes earning rewards easy and it doesn't require extra work. Just activate your rewards every quarter and you're set. They also offer extra rewards when you buy online using your Chase card. They have hundreds of retailers in this program, making online shopping even better. I love it!

name: Michael Misch
review: I have been banking with Chase since it was Washington Mutual for about the last 6 years and have been very pleased for the most part. I have always had great courteous customer service and no hassles over disputes or problems. I enjoy all the options they provide for transferring money. From being able to scan checks in from my smartphone to doing everything via the ATM's at any hour in the day. The only real gripe I have is they changed the minimum limit on my checking account to $500. So now I'm getting charged a $10.00 fee every month which I think is unnecessary. There should be a free checking option even if your not a student as I'm going through some serious medical issues right now and just cannot afford to keep that minimum and it would be pretty hard to switch banks right now. If it wasn't such a hassle I would definitely switch banks.

name: Logan Petit
review: I initially signed up for the amazon credit card to help because I shop on amazon a lot but that is pretty much all I used it for. You get 3 points for purchases on amazon.com which is fantastic but the 21% APR makes me reluctant to use it for anything else. It is super convenient for frequent amazon shoppers and I know there are other purchases that can accrue large amounts of points as well but again the APR keeps me away from using it for anything but amazon purchases and I tend to stick to another lower APR card for everything else. Still think it is a great card.

name: Joe LoGuirato
review: Unlike most others, I did not have a positive experience with this credit card, or with this bank in general.  They offered a "bonus point" program that seemed great and worthwhile, but after the first three months, I noticed that I had not been rewarded all of the points I should have been.  In fact, after some calculations, I found that they had cheated me out of at least 50 % or more of my points, and when I called customer service, it took over an hour before I was able to talk to a representative, and another two hours until someone was finally able to solve the problem (after much confusion and arguments).  Overall, the amount of time spent dealing with the point system issue, on top of long waits and poor customer service, was not worth it for me.  I no longer use this credit card, and I have switched to one that better suits my tastes.

name: Chelsea
review: I have been banking with Chase for about 3 years now and have loved them the entire time. It's never hard to find a Chase ATM and avoid paying service fees from other banks, as there is one on nearly every corner. The feature I like the most is the ability to like accounts. Being in college, it's extremely helpful that if my mom wants to send me some extra spending money she can just open her Chase app on her phone and transfer it in under 30 seconds and it shows up fast. Also, Chase Quick Pay is a great way to protect yourself when buying things off of sites like Craigslist if you don't have PayPal or anything like that. Overall I think Chase is great because of the complete integration with technology and the great availability they have.

name: Allen
review: I had just moved to a new city over 1,000 miles away from my nearest bank branch.  I wanted to set-up a new checking account and chose Chase simply as they had a big presence in my area.  I was extremely pleased with the ease in which I was signed up.The branch manager asked what I wanted to do and gave me all the information that I sought.  At any point if I wasn't too keen on an option (like overdraft protection) he would move on without trying sell that option further.  He also noted the monthly checking account fee that would occur if I was ever below the minimum balance, and if I ever did get charged  for it to come in and talk to him and he would waive it.   Overall the manager was extremely professional and courteous and getting signed up was a breeze.  I received my debit card three days later and have had no issues or fees since getting set up.  I have been with them now for about 2 months and everything is going great.

name: Angelica Fullerton
review: I originally began banking with Chase after they bought Washington Mutual. I was pleased that the transition to the new bank was relatively painless, and have been pleased with my experience with them ever since. They have many locations, and it is relatively easy to find an atm or bank nearby any location to make a withdrawal from.I enjoy the benefits of student accounts, and so do not have to deal with any charges. They have charged me in error a few times, which is frustrating, but every time I called them the issue was resolved quickly and easily.I also appreciate the way they are constantly looking for new technologies to make banking easier and more convenient, without losing security. The ability to manage my account from my cell phone via text is especially convenient, especially transferring balances between accounts.

name: Randy
review: I ended up going to Chase because at the time their CDs had a higher interest rate than the banks I'd previously used. I have to admit, I was impressed with the overall experience. Besides the better interest rate, the staff was across-the-board helpful and knowledgeable. On the couple of occasions where the person I was dealing with wasn't able to answer my question themselves, they found the right person quickly to get me the information I needed.
