Apart from that, the staff, from tellers to other service reps to those providing investment advice were all very polite, and very patient. Thankfully, when I explained to the investment adviser I was only - at the time - interested in secure, low-risk investments, he wasn't pushy about investing in greater risk security, and helpfully explained my future options without pressure. I found it to be a very high-level of service offered, leaving me quite satisfied.

name: Joe Rickenbocker
review: I originally chose Chase Bank because it was nearby and I wanted a bank that I could go into and make deposits as needed because I was doing a lot of odd jobs over the summer for cash, but I also wanted something national because I move around a lot with the military. My only problem came over the holidays through the New Year when I was visiting home from college and some things were charged to my account way too early by several automatic withdrawals and I was charged 30 dollars for every small automatic withdrawal, ($5 dollars for razor, $22 for acne meds, and a bunch of other small automatic charges that I have that were charged 2 days early) leaving me $250 dollars poorer because I couldn't deposit money because there I only one ATM in all of Hawaii for Chase and after driving all the way there after it was falsely listed as having a cash deposit function. They were able to absorb a good amount of the charges after calling, but still I was out $60. Another problem came again here in Hawaii, my debit card suddenly became unusable and when I called to see what the problem was, they told me it would be simple to fix if I could just come into a branch to verify my identity, but I was going to be in Hawaii for 3 months, where there are no branches, upon asking them for alternatives, they said there were none. Luckily I had just received my first credit card and I can still pay my bill using my checking account online, otherwise I would have had next to no access to my money for three months. I ordered a new debit card and finally received it 12 business days after after it was expected, but upon calling the activation line on the card, it never asked me to set a pin to activate it and a pin was required to call about that card when it didn't work either so I had to call about 6 times before I could find a set of options that would lead me to a customer service representative without having to input a pin that I didn't have. Overall, I probably wouldn't have these problems if I didn't travel so much with the military, but they did give me a free premium account because of the military, and that is probably the only reason I refrain from joining the military banking system of USAA, I enjoy the perks that come with the better account.

name: Geoff Son
review: I have had a College Chase account for a few years now. I will be graduating soon and will miss the zero monthly minimum balance and the fee-free checking. I originally chose Chase because they were one of the first on the market to incorporate banking via iPhone. Being able to deposit a check with my iPhone is one of the biggest advantages a bank has ever given to me. I recently had an experience where one of the checks I submitted didn't clear because the app and I had entered the information wrong. I was accessed a charge, but I realized it was my fault, not the banks, so I accepted it. I submitted the check again and ran into further problems (they turned out to be with the other bank). I called into customer service and they not only cleared the whole thing up with me, they refunded the charges for me for the returned checks. On another note, I was a little disappointed when my United reward debit card was cancelled and just converted to a regular debit card without my full knowledge. It no longer accrues miles, which was one of the main reasons I opened the account in the first place. I also wish they had some branches in PA. Overall though, great bank!

name: Shelby
review: I have been banking with Chase for pretty much my whole life. Growing up, I had a savings account so I could save money for college. Once I got my first job I signed up for a checking account and a debit card. Over all I would say that I have had a good banking experience with Chase. Everyone at the bank is always very friendly and helpful. My only complaint about Chase is that they love tacking on extra fees, but I have found that it is easy to get the fees removed with a little bit of complaining to customer service.

name: shaina
review: I have been banking with Chase for about 4 years now and I have yet to have a problem with them. Their customer service is wonderful and they are always so helpful. Whenever I have a problem, they resolve it right away. I always get the help I need plus some. I have been with other banks and none of them have pleased me as much as Chase has. Everything is easy to use and find. Their website has everything I need which makes it that much easier since I never have that much time to call them. Whenever there's a change in anything, I am always notified. Just the other week I had some problems with someone trying to use my card and they caught it right away which I was very impressed with.I wouldn't go to another bank!

name: Joe loguirato
review: I used Chase as my primary bank when I lived in New York for about six months, and my experience was very bad with them.  They did not inform me that there was a fee for my debit card of $25 that was automatically taken out of my account.  I overdrew my account because of this, and customer service was very unhelpful.  The bank attendants were very cold and unfriendly, and the manager refused to reimburse me the money even though it was their fault for not explaining the $25 fee to me in full detail.  Overall, I was very dissatisfied with Chase and would not use them ever again.

name: Robert Ramirez
review: I have been banking with Chase for 12+ years. I had an account with Wells Fargo when I got my first job in high school. I was a little put off when they sent me a letter on my 18th birthday wishing me a happy birthday and letting me know I would now be charged a monthly fee. I immediately went to Chase (WaMU at the time). I have had nothing but positive experiences with them since. My wife and myself are in the market for a home right now. So of course our first thought was to go to Chase and see if they offered FHA Loans. We walked in just to ask questions but we immediately started the application process. Luckily we had all necessary materials with us to get the application going. The process was fast and very easy. We received a call the next day letting us know we were approved. We are currently 3 months into trying to purchase a short sale home. Our loan officer over at Chase calls us every month just to check on things and make sure we want to keep our loan active. With all of the issues of buying a short sale, the last thing we need are issues with the bank. Chase has made this a very easy process.

name: Alex Weis
review: Chase is perhaps the best bank to use in New York City because of the number of branches and ATMs. If you are like me, you never carry cash around with you so that is a very important way to judge a bank. Currently, there are 30 Chase Bank branches located in New York City in addition to 30 Chase ATM locations. Chase also offers great online banking, so to find a location in the City, just go to Chase.com. The first link at the top of the page gives you the option to find Branches and ATMs. Following that that link, search the entire city or zip code.

name: Amanda Wallace
review: I have the Chase Freedom Visa card and this is probably one of the best credit cards out there. The Chase Freedom Visa offered a $200 bonus a few months ago if you spend a certain amount within 90 days. I hit this bonus and on my next statement I was granted 20,000 bonus points, which in turn you can use as $200 cash back. You get to decide how you want your cash back, whether a check sent to you from Chase or as a statement credit. I chose the statement credit and it appeared 2 days later. I thought this was a great incentive to sign up for this card. I also love all the cash back reward programs they have. Currently I am getting 5% cash back on gas and restaurant purchases. The customer service at Chase is some of the best I have ever experienced. If I have a problem or question I email them and within hours I get a satisfactory response. So far this is my favorite card. I like Chase and hope to be a longtime customer with them.

name: Frank Bieniek
review: The Chase bank in my area of Northern NJ is very helpful and has great customer service.  As soon as I started a checking account I could tell that they were very nice and friendly people.  They put $100 in my account to start with and ever since that I have never had any problems.  They have been really helpful also in getting my money back from fraudulent charges.  For example my local gym billed me for an extra month that I didn't want.  The people at Chase made sure to talk to them.  A week later the $60 charge was dropped.  It is great when you have them on your side and they are willing to fight to keep your money in check.

name: Rickie Thornley
review: I used to bank through Washington Mutual, and I have to say since Chase took over, I have not only seen an increase in customer service and my own satisfaction, but this place is always awesome whenever I go in and need to get my banking needs taken care of. They seem to be more helpful and always seem to help me get things done quickly and efficiently. They answer questions with sincerity and always clear things up if I become confused over my checking/savings account. I have since loved Chase since I began banking with them. Chase is great, and I would recommend Chase to anyone looking for a good bank with TONS of options and ways to manage your money safely, and securely.

name: Art Siriwatt
review: I joined Chase with a joint checking account connected to my parent's account, named something along the lines of "High School Checking," and it is currently my main checking account I use right now. The process was simple when we went into our branch, and I pretty much pay no fees whatsoever, which is really nice. They have been super convenient, but I pretty much never go into their actual branches since they support online statements and checking and have ATMs almost everywhere I go. Their online site is functional, but it's pretty messy and is down for maintenance a lot. Fortunately, finding how much cash you have in your bank and your recent transactions is incredibly easy to do. Overall, they've been nothing special, but convenient and streamlined enough that I never have problems with them.

name: Paul Doster
review: I am very satisfied with Chase and all that it has to offer. It provides clear and easy to read statements every month and it is also very technology friendly by allowing me to check on my banking information through my phone or laptop. Whenever I am at my local Chase branch I am welcomed with a hello and the bank tellers help me with whatever it is that I might need with a smile on their face. I would recommend this bank to anyone no matter what your financial needs are. They make banking with them easy and not something that you dread doing.

name: Elisabeth Hawkins
review: My husband and I love our Chase checking account because it is easy to use and the customer service is great.  A family friend of mine recommended we get the account before our son was born because they really liked it and they told us about all the great features.  We enjoy using the online banking and bill pay because it is very convenient to use either with your home computer or your phone.  We also get account alerts through both our phones and e-mails if there is something suspicious going on. I feel safe knowing that our account is being monitored and that they are proactive in contacting us when something seems suspicious.

name: Chloe English
review: I have been banking with Chase for about 8 years. I started with a simple debit card, went through to college checking and savings, and have since moved up to Premier Checking and Savings. Despite banking with them since I was 16, they were unable to offer me any line of credit (not because I have bad credit, I just don't have credit yet) and also refused me any kind of car loan. For day-to-day banking, Chase is fine and customer service is pretty good, but when it comes to applying for credit or loans, I have found a new bank that is much more willing to help a young adult get started with financial planning.

name: Lisa Veras
review: I've generally had a good experience with Chase. Once my debit card information was stolen, and Chase texted me immediately saying that there was suspicious activity on my card. Within 10 minutes my old card was deactivated and a week later I received a new card in the mail. I only had one bad experience with a particular branch, which is why I give it 4 stars and not 5. When I was first opening up my account as a college student they swindled me into applying for a credit card, claiming that it was really a card aimed toward college students and "no one" was ever rejected. After I applied I overheard the representative talking to his co worker about how I would probably get rejected. I was ultimately rejected for the card but I did not appreciate being lied to. Other than this one experience, I am really glad I chose Chase as my primary bank.

name: Matthew Monger
review: I joined Chase Bank back when it was Bank One. The transition was smooth and I did not encounter any problems. It was very easy and simple to set up my checking account,and I was never charged anything that I was not made aware of. A bit more recently however I began getting a monthly service charge that I had not been told about. I am sure that had I read my paperwork I would have seen that this charge would occur, and have since taken steps to prevent these charges, such as having a certain amount direct deposited into my account. Since then I have had no problems with my bank. I, in fact, recently signed up for their credit card, the Chase Freedom card and could not be more happy with it.

name: Patrick
review: I have been with Chase for at least eight years, and have been very pleased with the products and services I have used with them, including my checking, savings, and credit card accounts. They have plenty of locations and ATMs in my area, so they are extremely convenient. Also, their website is very helpful, and their mobile app is really great too. Between all the functionality on the website and the app, I rarely have to visit a branch, because I can do all of my banking online, or on my phone. The only problem I have had in all my years with Chase was with they fees they charged on my savings account, for making multiple online transfers in a month. All in all, I am very pleased with my Chase accounts.

name: Douglas
review: I switched to Chase checking about 8 months ago after having a Chase credit card for several years and was very satisfied with it. I actually switched because of a bonus offer that came with my credit card statement. I have my checks direct deposited, but I've been in a couple branches a few times. Each time someone always greets me, and customer services gets me through very quickly and efficiently. One thing that I had never noticed before becoming a Chase checking member is how many different ATM and branch locations there are. I went to the gas station one day and while waiting in line I was planning the rest of my route. My next stop was to get cash from a branch or ATM. I exit the line and see an ATM right by the exit in the gas station! The only reason I can't give Chase 5 stars is the mortgage department has a little work to do. The mortgage process was not as clear or as easy as other banks' mortgage lenders that I have used in the past. Overall, I would highly recommend Chase checking!

name: Rebecca
review: I have banked with Chase since my college days in Indiana, and as long as they are everywhere (literally, in New York City), I will continue using them. Chase is very convenient when it comes to locations - in NYC they are EVERYWHERE, including Duane Reade ATMs. In Indiana, I was down the street from a Walgreens, and they have Chase ATMs. I have had good experiences with them over the phone - no long wait periods, and polite, friendly agents. Once my account was flagged for 'suspicious' activity - it was only me buying a Google deal, but I appreciate the fact that they actually seem to be actively policing my account. Their app is easy to use and VERY convenient to have. I do have two issues with Chase - first, I believe they have branches in every major city...except Albany, NY, which is ONLY the capital of the Empire State. I don't understand why the city where my state governor resides and governs from is NOT a major city, but perhaps some will be placed there soon. Also, since I'm not a member of the '1%' (or even the 25%), I get a $6 service fee on my account. I think that may be a repercussion from our Recession. Other than those two issues, Chase bank is convenient and I recommend them.

name: Michael Johnson
review: I have a credit card through Chase Bank. Service through Chase is mediocre to say the least. I am an easy to please individual and it doesn't take much to keep me happy. The interest rates on my credit card are equal to any other bank/financial institution. Chances are if I actually made the effort to find a better financial institution to get a credit card through I could find a better one without a hitch. I however don't use my card enough to care that much. The service department was okay the one time I had an issue. Took a while to resolve but all in all did on okay job.

name: Danielle Pattee
review: As a former credit union member, I was a bit nervous switching to one of the big name brand banks.  For a short stint I was a Citibank customer until they wanted to start charging me for EVERYTHING!  That's when I looked into Chase and saw that they still had free checking accounts!  I really like that there are several convenient locations where ever I go!  My favorite part of being a Chase customer is their iPhone app!  No more going to the make to deposit checks, just snap a picture of the front and back of your check and voila it's in your account!  Also love that you can pay people via email or phone number!  I haven't written a check in over a year, I just email my landlord my rent money each month!  No checks, no stamps, no waiting in line at the bank or post office!  I am a happy Chase customer.

name: Rory
review: I've had an account with Chase for about three years now. I haven't had any huge problems with them, but they haven't exactly blown me away either. Service in the two branches that I've used is decent, but on the couple occasions I've had to call, the people in their call center haven't been all that helpful. I can't speak for a lot of their services, as my setup with them is very bare-bones. I opened my account online (nice and easy, by the way), never even ordered checks. It did take them forever to get my debit card to me, though. Had to call in to get that fixed.The best thing they've got going for them is the mobile app. Since I no longer use my Chase account as my main account (got a better setup with another bank through my job), this is the biggest thing that I miss. The app is slickly designed and the push notifications for account events are great (I prefer that over email or SMS notifications). For someone like me who does a lot of their financial stuff on the go, Chase's app and online setup works great.

name: Chris Wilson
review: I opened a Chase checking account after receiving an offer of a $50 bonus. I already had a checking account at a different bank that I was happy with, but figured it was an easy $50. I applied and was quickly approved. The application was really quick and easy, and access to my account online was also established pretty quickly. There were some requirements associated with the account, like keeping it open for 6 months, and having direct deposit to prevent a $12 monthly charge. I changed my direct deposit with my employer to go into this account, but was still charged the $12 fee. When I called to ask about it, they basically said there was nothing they could do. This cost them a customer. As soon as 6 months was up, I closed my account and never looked back.

name: Jen Weingartner
review: I consider the customer service at our bank to be average. Since it is a very large bank it isn’t always the most personal service. The tellers seem to follow a script and have a set agenda when you come in. Also, when you call to ask questions on the automated line, you can end up waiting a long time and getting transferred many times. The other major disappointment was with applying for a mortgage. We have great credit and have been with Chase for a long time. We attempted to get a loan through them, however it didn’t work out for many reasons. The mortgage representative seemed like he didn’t really care to get our business. We had to chase him around and call him constantly to no avail. We ended up going with another company and qualified for an awesome rate. It seems that once again the smaller company was more satisfactory.

name: Steven Belman
review: Chase Bank is pretty good. I first got them when I moved from California to New York, and I discovered that my normal bank (Wells Fargo wasn't on the East Coast). Chase is very convenient; they have branches and ATMs all over the place! When I went in the first time, I set up both a savings and a checking account. The agent was pretty friendly. I was even able to get a couple free tickets to the US Open. The savings account and checking account, however, don't offer the best interest (less than half a percent). This is worse than online banks such as ING Direct. I prefer to use Chase for a portion of my liquid assets (about $5000), so that I can take care of all the purchases I need within a month. However, for long terms savings - such as a house or car - I prefer to put it in other accounts that higher interest yielding ones.

name: Elizabeth
review: This bank is great. I signed up for Chase Freedom credit card due to their no interest for two years deal and free balance transfers. Figured it would be a good way to consolidate my debt. I applied over the phone and spoke to a very nice representative. She wasnâ€™t one of those annoying ones who bug you to sign up for all this protection stuff. After a couple months of having this card I had my credit card stolen with over $500 of unauthorized charges on it by the time I noticed it was missing (3 days) I got a customer service representative immediately who was helpful and immediately reversed unauthorized charges and sent out new card. No fighting, haggling, hassling, and personal customer service. It was done so fast; there is not one negative thing I can say about how it was handled.

name: David Austin
review: Margie is obviously not a frequent United traveler.  The real benefit of this card is hidden in the club access and free checked bags. For a traveler with no elite status, 1st bag is $25, second is $35 each way. Even at Premier silver, 2nd bag is $35. Club access is $475 by itself, $450 if you are a silver Premier.  Club access is not limited to United clubs- you get access to Star Alliance clubs as well- ie: US Airways, Lufthansa, etc.As far as Southwest goes, I like my assigned seats and last time I checked, they do not have such a thing as a club lounge in their system.Just my.02

name: Marie Merriman
review: I applied for this card because of the offer of the 0% APR for the first 15 months.  However, I was approved with a $2500 credit line but not at the 0% APR for the first 15 months for my new account.  I will therefore be canceling it due to the bait and switch.  That was my whole purpose for applying!

name: WalletHub
review: There are a couple of different Chase Freedom offers from time. Are you sure that you applied for this one?  If yes, there is NOTHING in the terms and conditions of this offer that would justify you not getting the 0% for 15 months! You should call them and ask for an explanation and let us know how we can help because if this is indeed the case then it is completely unacceptable!

name: Amanda Sayah
review: My experience with Chase has been well overall. I am a college student and I opened my own checking account last year and I haven’t had many problems. There is a Chase bank that is right down the road and the people there are always courteous. The money is easy to transfer and acquire and I appreciate their quickpay feature as well as the text message alerts. The teller I opened my account with was very nice and knowledgeable and I hope to continue with them for a long time hopefully with loans and other needs. The only problems included the amount of time it took to get back the money for cancelling unwanted charges. I recommend this bank to other people because it is well-known and trustworthy.

name: Aaron Haycraft
review: My experience with the Slate Master Card has been wholly positive.  I have been the owner of a Chase card for many years, and never had a problem.  While I was in college (the first time), I racked up a bit of student loans, just like everyone else in my situation.  During that time, I rarely used my Chase card in anything but emergencies.  I made sure to keep a small balance I paid off month to month, just for the sake of credit.  My limit was high enough to serve my purposes, but I never got anywhere near it, so I rarely paid much attention to it.  Upon graduating, I was faced with what to do about paying off my loans.  This is where Chase comes in.  Over those years of school, they had been gradually raising my limit.  By the time I had graduated, I had more than enough to cover my entire student loan amount, and the interest rate was lower than I could get anywhere else.  I should also mention that this was after the deferment period as well.Beyond that, they have been more than willing to work with me in the rare case of a late payment.  When my identity was stolen, they alerted me to suspicious activity right away and allowed me to catch stuff early.Like I said, mainly positive. My experience with the Slate Master Card has been wholly positive.

name: Corene Stuart
review: I have had  this card since 2008  and first card ever. Overall , my experience as been positive, the rewards are fine , in 3 points every dollar spend at Amazon. I love buying at Amazon , they offer great services in  pricing , customer support , and free shipping at $25 plus items. So, using the card to purchase  from Amazon , has been an add bonus with the rewards. In addition, using the reward point at Amazon is easy to do. The  card's customer support  , from their service call has provide excellent service to me, in many occasions.

name: Geoff Kuhn
review: The Chase Freedom Visa card was the perfect card of choice as a student going through college. Books, food and tons of other expenses just don't cut it underneath the student approved cards. The regular rate is just below average, there are too many cards out there that sucker people like me into a card that has way to too much interest. The $100 dollar cashback was perfect when purchasing my textbooks, the books alone went over $500, allowing me to be eligible for the $100 cashback. This card is also ideal for travels that need the %5 with the amount of eating out and airline traveling they need to do. In my case, driving to class eats into my savings with the amount of gas I need, the %5 came in handy.

name: Buffy Perez
review: I love having this card!  They always run promotional transfers and purchase rates.  I admit, I am a person that transfers balances, according to the best available rate.  I always seem to go back to Chase!  As a matter of fact, it is currently where my transfers are with a 0% APR!  How much better can you get than that?  I have never had a problem with faulty late charges or something hidden that cancels the terms of the transfer that you signed up for.  I have had that with other cards, and luckily, I have not here!  I highly recommend this card!  You won't regret it!

name: Reatha Vallon
review: Hi Chalinarose, would you mind sharing your FICO score so that I can guage my chances as well? ALso, when did you apply? Does Capital one accept Credit Limit Increase requests?

name: Aleida Sturn
review: I  had only one credit card before applying for the Chase Freedom. It's the same one I've had since  2008. My hubby and I were looking into buying a house and I decided a little extra credit wouldn't hurt. Plus, we could then use the card to buy things for the house. Before jumping in, I did some research because I definitely wanted something with no fee and cash back or rewards. Call me crazy but I don't feel like I should have to pay an annual fee to have a credit card. There's too many chooses out there for that.Anyway, I received my Chase Freedom card and got $100 bonus cash back for spending $500 in the first 3 months with the opportunity to get another 5% back. Their program offers cash back in quarterly rotating categories. The 5% was given for gas stations and Amazon.com purchases during January- March, grocery stores and movie theaters for April- June, gas stations and restaurants during July-September and hotels, airlines, Best Buy and Kohls for October- December. I received this card in February and I am very happy with it so far. I'm building my credit and earning money on things I would normally buy anyway.

name: Samantha Bolch
review: I have had an Amazon rewards credit card for several years now. We switched from a Capitol One card after some security concerns. We do a good amount of our non-grocery shopping on Amazon already, so the rewards card was a good fit. We typically use the card for just about everything from gas to groceries to dining out. Then once in a while, we'll check the rewards balance and use it to buy something we ordinarily might have passed up. It is a nice way to buy something indulgent without having to feel guilty over the extra expense. I'd never use it if it had an annual fee, but as it is it is basically like free money.

name: Ronald Lunan
review: My Chase Freedom card was one of my first credit cards. I signed up when they were running the $300 cash back offer after spending $500 in the first 3 months and I have been using it as a primary card ever since. Unlike most of my other cards, I can always find a place to shop each quarter for the 5% cash back rewards offer. The reward option also has a low requirement for points needed (2000 points) to request a check be sent to you. And yes, it is cash and not limited to gift cards that some other cards leave you with. The cash back program also allows for more money to be spent (and rewards to be collected) than my Discover Card ever allowed. I've always paid my bill off in full each month and never had this card compromised so I cannot speak about that. The only thing I wish the card would allow would be to spend points directly at Amazon.com like my Amazon credit card also by Chase, or even Discover Card allow.  I'm still happy with the card and as I've said it is still my primary card even after gaining a few newer ones.

name: Anthony Aspero
review: I have had one credit card for about ten years, and through various changes in the banking world, it has changed names many times.  It is currently a Chase Freedom card.  I have no complaints about this card.  My rewards points have always been tallied accurately, and I have been able to cash them out on several occasions without hassle.  Unfortunately, because of the way my card was changed into the Chase Freedom, I did not receive the $200 bonus (which would have been nice), but seeing as though I probably would not have actively searched out a new credit card, I cannot complain about not getting a bonus.  Overall, I am happy with this card, and I have no problem recommending it to others.

name: Jeanne Katten
review: I have been very satisfied using this card. The APR rate is relatively low and very competitive, and as much as I travel, when I stay at a Marriott (which is common), it seems to get me an extra level of respect and courtesy from whomever checks me in. The free nights available came early on in my use of the card, and came in handy, from a travel-savings standpoint. The reward points add up very quickly, and are very easy to redeem, from my experience. I've run into no problems at all in that regard, and have found no blackout dates at all, nor are there any particular limited selections of rooms for which the points can be redeemed.I'm quite pleased!

name: Genevieve Rasnic
review: This has been a great card for me.  I have fortunately only had a couple of instances where I needed to dispute a charge, but they were very helpful on both occasions.  Also, the rewards are wonderful.  There are many options when you decide to cash out your points, but I always just opt for the cash check.  With this route, you get 1% cash back on all purchases, 2% cash back on select other categories, and 3% back for Amazon.com purchases.  It really does add up.  I will caution that the card issuer is a little quick to jump the gun when it thinks your card might have been stolen.  What I mean is, if you make a large purchase (say $1,000) the card might be "locked down" until you call and explain that you made that purchase.  It's a little annoying, but I suppose it's for a good reason.All in all, an awesome credit card with helpful support staff.

name: Alex Walker
review: I am a big fan of the Chase Sapphire Credit Card and it is the only credit card that I have owned so far.  With it being my very first credit card I was happy with its ease of use and that it did not contain any confusing fees that I could not understand.  I have had no trouble using it and it is a good experience for people that do not have a lot of time using credit cards and understanding how they work.  Eventhough I am new to the reward system I am happy with the amount of points I have accumalated and feel a sense of accomplishment with my total.

name: Clint Cubas
review: I only use 2 credit cards and this one has been my regular credit card for 4 years.  I've consistently paid my bills on time and have never had a late payment.  One of the great things that I like and appreciate about this card is the rewards you can get back.  Over the course of a few years I earned enough cash to spend in the Chase store as I pleased!  The only big issue that I've had is with the customer service, the physical individuals within the bank where great! But the phone people could never help me.  I would recommend this card to other people though.

name: Brian Sidewinder
review: This is the only credit card I use and the only one I have found to be worth using. I am extremely pleased with the rewards points program associated with the card, I particularly like the additional points your get for selected rewards which brings it to 5% back. They change every few months and there is always something new with an added perk. The rewards website has a very large variety with reasonable prices for merchandise and the option to get gift cards for retailers like Amazon, which is my favorite choice. There have been a few instances to call the customer service center associated with the card. They have always been pleasant to deal with and to the point, they also make you aware of any offers available for increased rewards points in case you have forgotten to sign up for that month. I have never had an issue using the card at any store and I have used it internationally with no problems what so ever. So this card has worked out great for me and hopefully it will for you too!

name: Donnetta Zlatkin
review: This card as been great to me thus far. Although it has a yearly fee (of a little under $100 a year), it has more than paid for itself after only 6 months of usage. I love the double points for travel/dining and the option to trade them in 1:1 for many different airline rewards is great. This is a fantastic card and I always get compliments on how heavy it is too! Plus, the sign on bonus gave me about $500 extra dollars in reward points which was fantastic! Definitely a great card to have all around, I highly recommend it to others!You can also shop online and get extra reward points for purchases at almost every major retailer (I use Gap, Lands End, etc. a lot) and bump up your rewards that way too.

name: Dorene Przybyszewski
review: I've had this card for a little over a year now and I've had a pretty decent experience with it so far. I'm a college student, so the 5% back for purchases at gas stations, grocery stores, and restaurants was the main selling point for me. I'm often driving around campus or driving back home every few weeks and I often need to buy groceries since I live in an apartment rather than a dorm, so the 5% back has been really nice. Besides that, the zero percent APR is obviously a nice perk as well.Overall, I've had no problems with Chase for the time that I've had this card. However, I'm probably a bit more stingy with my spending than most people and I always always always make sure to pay my bills on time, so I'm never really in a position where I might get screwed over or screw myself over. Take that for what it's worth.

name: Tim Hansell
review: With my newly formed independent publicist company I wanted a credit card I could use in conjunction. I work in the entertainment industry and Ink allows me to spend on office supplies, wireless services, landline communications, and cable services. I also am a fan of 2% back in gas since I'm on the road a lot as well as dining rewards since I'm often taking clients out. I've already earned $150 back after my first purchase and have already earned an extra $100 for already spending $5,000. I'm eating out or entertaining clients almost daily, and can't imagine using another card. Being a brand new business the 0% into APR for the first six months was a key for me since I'm a new business. If you have a business similar to mine I highly recommend Ink.

name: Lily Shansky
review: I signed up for the Chase Visa card because my mom recommended it to me. I have to say I have been very happy with the card. However, I do pay all of my balance in full and on time. I haven’t had to call in and ask about waiving late fees. Although my mom did say they are finicky about that. What I really like about the card are the rewards available and the ways to earn points. You can use the rewards for anything, like paying off your credit card balance or get gift cards. You get one percent back per dollar spent and then for every different quarter you can get five percent back on certain purchases that fall into their predetermined categories. For example, these categories include gas, restaurants, and groceries. It’s very easy to earn points because you can use your card for every day, practical purchases. I would definitely recommend this card.

name: Jaime Heflin
review: This card is amazing!  I got a $200 Disney gift card just for signing up!  I use my card for everything, from utilities, groceries, gas, to everyday purchases.  I always pay off the entire balance each month to avoid interest.  Even if I decided not to pay off the entire balance each month, the minimum payment is low and the APR is very reasonable.  I love that there is no annual fee as well.  The best part about this card is that you get $1 in Disney rewards for every $100 you spend.  In the past month, I've made $20 just for using the card on things I'd purchase anyway!  Another plus is the cute design.  There are several designs to choose from.  I ordered the same design for my husband and myself, but he decided it was a little too girly.  So, he called customer service and they shipped a new card to him with the design of his choice.  It was simple.  Customer service is really great and the website to pay our bill is very organized and easy to use.   I also love that I can check our Disney rewards balance at any time.  This has to be my favorite credit card that I've used and I would recommend it to anyone!

name: Kristin Olson
review: The Chase Amazon Visa card was my first credit card, and I still use it frequently. While I enjoyed the signup bonus for a purchase I was making, the main benefit is that points accrue quickly, especially at the 3x rate given on Amazon purchases. If you couple these rewards with an Amazon Prime account the discounts are great! I’ve also redeemed for cash as needed, which is convenient. My one negative experience was my card information being stolen (I have no idea how; I only shop at secure sites and at stores in person), and this was handled well by Chase card services. No fraudulent transaction ever went through (good!), but when I called to report a pending purchase that I didn’t recognize, the Chase representative saw that failed transactions had been going on for a month. The issue was resolved promptly at no loss to myself, and my replacement card came the next day. Overall, I was impressed with the resolution and the service I received.From my personal experience I would recommend the card both in general and especially for regular customers of Amazon.

name: Queenie Gittings
review: I am a big fan of the Chase Sapphire Preferred Credit Card, and as my work has me traveling overseas often, this is my goto card due to the benefits it has over its competition. I applied for this card so I would not have to pay foreign transaction fees, but I was also pleasantly surprised with the rewards system. However, my one gripe with the card is the slightly high membership costs, along with rates that are slightly above average. All in all, this card is my favorite card for use overseas, and I find myself using it a lot in the states as well.

name: Hamza Perwaz
review: I applied for this card four months ago and got approved. At that time, the sign-in bonus was 50,000 points as long as I spent 3000 dollars in the first three months. I used this card for grocery shopping, car insurance, traveling, essentailly everything, and my spending easily went over $3000 in three months. Last month I got the bonus points. I transferred these points to my United Airlines Mileage Plus account, and with a a little extra points, I got a round-trip flight ticket to an Asian country. Typically such a ticket cost over $1100. What a wonderful bonus. One more thing, there is no foreign transaction fee when I used this card in the foreign country, which is typically 3% if I use my other credit cards. I highly recommend this credit.

name: Cherri Shellum
review: Chase is by far my favorite of my two credit cards. I got this card for work related expenses since work does not provide us with credit cards for travel and other expenses. Since I'm reimbursed for all expenses I charge to this card I'm able to pay it off each month. When I signed up for the card I also opened a Chase checking account and was given $150 for opening these as the same time, a great start to my relationship with Chase.The rewards program is great, easy to use and really fair. My Capital One card will still not let me upgrade to a rewards card (I opened the card in college). I sometimes take advantage of the 5% cash back program to use my card at Movie Theaters, Drug stores, etc depending on the quarterly programs for the extra reward points.Overall it's a great card and I've had no problems with it. I highly recommend this card.

name: Kin Butt
review: Amily, they wouldn't cook up books. Largely because as you mentioned, if someone like you put out lawsuits, the damage from that action is far greater than cheating someone of 1-2k dollars. What often happens in fraud cases, is they will withhold ALL charges. This includes legitimate ones as well as fraudulent ones. As such, when the bill is posted, you have paid a lot less money than what you should have (since legit ones are also withheld, and doesn't reflex the actual spending). Once investigation is complete, they will remove fraudulent ones, and which they did, did they not? Chase is great at responding to your needs in this regard, and not many banks make it this easy. But after they got rid of fraudulent ones, they will post the legit ones, to which you have to pay for. This is what I suggest you go through one more time to verify actual spending and payment. You obviously summed up all spends, now go to your bank's website and see how much money you have paid in total. If that discrepancy still exists, then you should show that to Chase, and they will respond to that.

name: Chris Wilson
review: I've had several credit cards before applying for the Chase Freedom card, but never really cared enough to try to utilize cashback or rewards programs. I decided I was done living paycheck to paycheck, and was going to get my financial house in order. I read a lot of personal finance blogs and books, and one thing a lot of them had in common was the use of rewards card. With this knowledge, I did some research and the majority of people recommended this card. I had a fairly decent credit score (low 700s) and was instantly approved for $1500. At the time, there was a $200 cash back bonus when you spend $500 in the first 3 months. I had some major purchases coming up anyways, and decided to utilize my shiny new cash back card to take advantage of the offer. I've not had any issues or complaints with my card. Very satisfied customer!

name: Daniel Destefanis
review: Convenience is the single word that summarizes Chase bank. Living in Chicago, their ATM’s, locations, etc. are everywhere. There hasn’t been a single day where I’ve had an issue finding a Chase. However, convenience also comes with some hidden prices.  Don’t get me wrong, their deposit ATM’s are lifesavers. There iPhone app is a breeze to use as well as their online banking. However, don’t use your debit card enough? They charge you a fee. Don’t have a high enough balance (much higher than other banks) there is another fee. This wouldn’t be an issue if it was cut and dry. Their fees are not clear and they never tell you when they are actually charging you. A good bank would help fix the problem, Chase isn’t interested in that. Essentially, take this bank with a grain of salt.

name: Kerrie Newbeck
review: Using my Amazon credit card has been an overwhelmingly positive experience for me.  The $30 sign on bonus was a great incentive, and I used it right away for some gifts.    The points add up so quickly!  I use the card for pre-planned expenses, like vacations, and major appliances, and then pay it off in full, to avoid interest charges and late fees.  I then use the rewards to buy Christmas gifts for friends and family.  I was able to pay for more than half of our Christmas gifts with the rewards, which was a great help to us at such a crazy, expensive time of year!  I’ll never let this card go!

name: Mario Garcia
review: I have been a customer of Chase Bank since 2009 and I must say, I am very satisfied. The particular one I use has a very welcoming staff who are professional and overall very likable. They help me as soon as I walk in the door. They get me out as quick as possible. They remember things about my life and ask me every time I go in. I have had a couple overdrafts in my time there and the staff always helps me to get it resolved. I have never had problems with lost money or bad customer service.

name: Richard Roberts
review: Chase bank offers an awesome opportunity for students to set up their first checking and savings account. There are a ton of branches and there is usually one near most college campuses. Setting up an account is extremely easy and simple. No obscure fees and with some student accounts there is no minimum balance or minimum number of transactions required. Tons of ATM locations as well, makes withdrawing and depositing cash very easy. ATMs also take checks and they print an image of the check on your receipt for your records. Overall it is an extremely good bank. I would highly recommend it people who have little experience with banking and are looking to set up a new account.

name: Rood
review: Overall, banking with Chase has been a fairly good experience.  Their service is top-notch, and most of the process of dealing with them seems to be fairly well thought out.  They even have a handy dandy iPhone app which you can use to check your balance, and transfer funds.  The first time I had to take advantage of their customer service, it was so-so, but the times after that, the service got a lot better.  Overall their customer relations department is helpful and well thought-out.  Setting up an account was a no-brainer, and getting a card sent to your address was a quick experience.  The fact that Chase has the visa logo on the credit cards makes them pretty much the easiest to use anywhere.

name: Victoria Smith
review: I love Chase Bank and have been a customer since 1999.  Everyone I have spoken with has been courteous and provided exceptional, prompt service.  I primarily use online banking and have always been happy with my checking account.  I like their debit card protection, and I also enjoy getting text alerts from them.  They always provide documentation notifying me of any changes they have made or will make.  The only thing that Chase lacks that I wish they had was no fees for using non-Chase ATM's.  Other than that, I am a happy customer and hope to remain with Chase for a long time.

name: Micah Miller
review: Chase is a great bank if you like ubiquity, sameness, and reliably poor (but always pleasant) customer service. Their online banking is second to none in the industry though, which helps them out a lot. Online bill pay is easy but they make it easy to NSF and zap you with fees so... watch out... They used to have a half-decent reward system in place but now it's gone to crap.The online banking is not to be underestimated though.... it may be the best reason to get the account. Statements on demand, 24-hour bill pay, electronic funds transfer to family member's accounts for free. Their ATMs in the area are nice and up to date as well.

name: Lumière Bass
review: Chase is an interesting bank overall.  I think my specific branch has way too many security issues to count...which is obviously a concern.  Other than this the people are always friendly, and other services and fees are reasonable.  However security is obviously the main concern of banking, so this is a big issue. If you can't trust your bank to keep your money and identity safe, then what is really the point of having a bank in the first place?  The problem lies in that these places have information about everything important identity wise; personal information, address, social security number, bank account number, financial history, credit card information.  That's a lot of responsibility and it is important to find someone who can handle all of that and make sure it is kept safe.  I guess that is my only gripe, but this should really not be an issue for such a big bank to begin with.  I know several people at my branch that have had their identity stolen in the last year, myself included.  That's not a very satisfying idea.  But they do have good perks on checking and credit cards, but I'll probably be moving to a credit union in the future.

name: Samantha Jamal
review: I use this bank for their checking account services. Their application process, which I had completed in my local Chase branch, was easy and quick. I really like this bank for their customer service, but they are not as quick at solving problems as other banks that I have worked with. My debit card number was stolen and abused, so I called Chase bank as soon as I noticed something was wrong with my balance. Chase bank’s customer service was very friendly and they seemed genuinely concerned about my problem. They were very prompt at transferring me to the different departments, however, they took much longer to get my money back to me. Nonetheless, they did get my money back and I am grateful for that and so I give them four stars for problem resolution. Overall, I give Chase bank 5 stars.

name: Bo James
review: I have been using Chase bank for 8 years, it was my first bank account. I have used them in states all over the country and even overseas. I've never had any problem with Chase and haven't encountered any random fees which banks are known for (just a monthly online bill payment fee). I have used them for my main checking account and have linked multiple credit cards to it and its all gone flawlessly. My only real disappointment with Chase is that I'm moving to Massachusetts and they don't have a very strong presence there so I'll have to find a new bank.

name: Parth
review: I have a credit card from Chase for over 5 years now. The bank is just amazing. I never had real trouble with them. I have a online account and I can pay my credit card bill online! When I was incorrectly charged for service from gas station, I called up customer service and they took care of it immediately. Their customer service is very good. They are really helpful. I get points for whatever I purchase. One dollar is one point. You can redeem points for lots of amazing prizes. You can save them up and get a nice trip on a plane to anywhere.  Chase is very satisfying bank and I definitely recommend it to anyone I can.

name: Courtney
review: I have only been using Chase for about a month now, although some other members of my family have been with them for a few years with no complaints. Thus far, I can say that I have had no problems with Chase and it has been a pleasant experience. The man who helped me open my checking account was friendly and kind, and answered any questions that we had regarding the process, etc. After I signed up for everything, my debit card arrived within a week, and a few days after that, the man called to make sure that I had gotten it and that everything was going fine.

name: Chris I
review: It would seem that in my area Chase and BofA are nearly ubiquitous. Chase, short for JP Morgan Chase, is the result of the merger between the Investment Bank JP Morgan, and the deposit institution known as Chase. I bank with Chase because I was formerly a customer of WaMu, and decided to keep my account with Chase. Remembering back to how my old account at WaMu was, the terms on Chase accounts are much more punishing, but they are definitely in line with other competing banks (all the big ones).The only way to get perhaps 30% or so lower fees would be to go with a credit union. There are drawbacks and benefits to both, the main drawback of credit unions being that they aren't on literally every street corner, and the main drawback of big banks being, well, they're big banks, and they want to make money. I'm glad I stayed with Chase because it means I get to bank literally everywhere they are, which is just about every 4 blocks, and I've never run into any problems with my account. I am very proactive about checking my accounts, as any account holder should be.Read the fine print before signing anything, make sure to always stay above your account minimums, and make sure to call the bank right away in case of any issues. It's really a no-brainer to go with Chase if you want ease of access to a financial institution, anywhere.

name: chris h
review: I love this bank, it is a wonderful bank for students. They set up your account under the idea that you will be a student for several years. I have never had to worry about excess charges or being over drafted. I have had several banks in the past that I did not care for. Chase is the exception. When I have over-drafted, which is a rarity, they have helped to set me on the right path. In many cases, they will cut down your over-drafts or get rid of them all together. I think my fondest memory was my first day at college. I just got my grants in. It take 11 days for your money to pop up in your account. I needed it by the next day. Brice (my bank manager) had it approved before I left the bank that day. Next morning the funds were in my account and ready to be used. Like I said, I love my bank. Thank you, Chase!

name: William Henderson
review: First off I would like to say that I have been with Chase for six years and overall I haven't had much trouble with them. They have been able to handle any problems I have had with my account and have helped me set up all my online bill pays. Every other problem I have had they have been able to deal with easily, except they have enforced this ATM rule, that you have to have any deposits in before ten otherwise you will have an over-draft fee. Which I think is wrong for them to do, some people work late jobs, but other than that. Chase has been a great bank and I would choice them over all other banks.

name: Aidan Slisikevicz
review: I was required to go in a branch to open a Chase checking account. The man was nice and helpful, but I prefer not to do this. I received $100 immediately upon opening the account. The checking account overdrew on purpose with a debit card, and then charged me an overdraw fee. I will never use a bank that does not decline the card. I refused to pay the transaction fee and they reported me to an agency. Live and learn. This was before the ruling that banks were not allowed to do this. I also have a Chase credit card that has a reasonable rate, but beware of some reminders going into your Spam inbox... on purpose?

name: Kylie Fix
review: I did not have a very good experience with Chase Mortgage until the very end. Things started out OK with the application process, it was simple and quick. But from that point, things went downhill fairly quick. Whenever I had problems, it was difficult for me to get through to a customer service person who could actually do something to help. For example, I fell behind on my payments early on and called to try to make a double payment to make up for being behind. I was told that unless I could pay the full amount that there was no point in me paying anything at all. When I asked the reasoning behind this, the representative could not give me an answer. I will say that I did eventually go into foreclosure on my house and I did a short sale instead of a full foreclosure. This process also went very smoothly. I just wish that there had been a little more help throughout the duration of my loan like there was in the beginning and in the end.

name: Matthew
review: I have been banking with Chase for about three years now, and I have never run into any problems. Any overdraft fees I have incurred while banking with Chase were reversed after about a five-minute phone call explaining the situation, and any other problems I have had were dealt with quickly and easily, and the customer service representatives I've spoken to are generally friendly and willing to help. I recently needed a debit card replaced, and they mailed one to my area within two days and without any charge. If I had to complain about anything, there are rare occasions when my online banking account takes a while to update, but again, that's rare. For the most part I have nothing negative to say about Chase and will be staying with them.

name: Ada
review: I have been banking with Chase since they acquired Washington Mutual. During this time I have used them for all my banking needs without any problems. When I had my debit card stolen I was able to go into the local branch and gain a temporary card on the spot while waiting for my replacement card to arrive. I love that there are ATM machines available at Duane Reade's throughout New York City so that I do not need to use another banks ATM machine and pay high fees. I also appreciate the fact that they are open on Saturday, which is not a policy at all banks.The quick pay service is also very simple and fast. If I need to send another Chase banker funds I can complete it on my phone or via the internet, without having to go into a branch or write a check. I will definitely continue banking with Chase.

name: Kathy
review: While I am not a huge fan of any bank these days, I will say that I have received adequate service from Chase Bank.  When I had a scammer hit my account fraudulently, they were very good about freezing and transferring my money to a new account, and refunding me the bogus charge.  I am not thrilled with their high overdraft fees, however, that is pretty common with all banks.  One definite downside, when I go to my local branch lately, it seems they are always trying to sell me some product or service, or get me to come in the branch and sign up for this, that, or the other thing. (I use the drive through).  I don't have time for that.

name: stevie nelson
review: My husband and I opened a Chase checking account when he got a new job that offered direct deposit. We got a special bonus for opening the account, and the people at our local Chase branch were very nice. However, there are fees associated with Chase checking that seem to be more than many other banks. I was happy with the customer service I received, but ultimately we ended up switching to a different bank that offered free checking. Chase checking accounts are best for those who keep a larger balance in their account at all times because it allows you to avoid the monthly fees.

name: Aileen Bligen
review: My Chase Freedom Visa card is my main go to card for most ordinary purchases. I have a low APR on this card and used it initially to transfer the balances from a couple of high rate store credit cards and save a good amount of money while also enabling me to finally get those cards paid off. As has been mentioned, Chase can and will cut credit limits if you don't use the card consistently. I had it happen to me and after a little negotiating with a customer service rep, my full credit line was restored. To avoid carrying a large balance on this card, I make frequent payments online, usually once weekly, for purchases I made the preceding week.  In the past I found it was far too easy to use a card for all of my gas or grocery purchases and then get socked with a giant bill at the end of the month when I had spent the “extra” money in my checking account on other things. I do like that the card is basically fee-free and I can earn cash back bonuses ranging from a minimal 1% on up to 10% when shopping at certain online retailers through Chase. Perhaps surprisingly, I have found several good deals through the Chase network of online retailers and look their first when shopping online.  5% cash back bonuses are given on categories that rotate every three months and I can usually manage to snag a good amount that way as well. Big advantage to the Chase Freedom Visa is that the bonuses are unlimited, unlike many of the cash back card offers out there.

name: Wei
review: I have been with Chase bank off and on for the past 15 years and I would have to say that have treated me more than fairly. Chase has a great offering in the Chase Total Checking package. I have my salary deposited into my account every pay period and that makes it a free checking account. I have been with other banks during this time period, but have always returned to Chase. The reason for this is because other banks have now implemented mandatory monthly fees with their checking accounts. I have never had a problem with Chase. As long as they keep these features intact, I will stay.

name: Jerardo
review: I have been with Chase for a few months now and I am loving their credit card. One of my favorite things is that it has no annual charge for either the card or the rewards program. The reward system is decent considering you have to spend a lot of money to get anything good but considering that it is free you can forget about it for a few months and then use your accumulated points to get something great. The APR is at 0 for the first fifteen months and then it increases to a normal credit card range. The bank itself has been very courteous. I decided to activate the bank in person and they were great. I was helped right away and they were very friendly. Overall the credit card and the bank have been great.

name: michael bobka
review: We have an auto loan through Chase and have mixed feelings about the bank. In many ways they are quite good at getting it right for customers, but they are also at times disorganized it seems. They do try, but there have been times when they have mixed up our car loan information, and have even miss-billed us. When we called in they corrected the error, but it did take a little bit of effort on our part. Everyone is friendly and nice to work with, but it seems their level of communication could be improved. We do on occasion get outsourced phone centers which makes it harder to get things done. We would recommend the bank but with a word of caution.

name: Katelyn Neuhaus
review: I have been with Chase bank for about 2 years now. I have never had any problems with my checking accounts. They have always responded to any questions or concerns I had very promptly. Once a few weeks ago, my debit card was stolen and they knew before I had even noticed and they called me to let me know. It was a bad way to start the day, but I commend their ability to some how just be able to tell that I wasn't the one using my debit card. All in all, Chase is a great bank for a basic checking account.

name: jennifer mclendon
review: I have been a Chase customer for almost 10 years. I have had nothing but excellent customer service and Problem resolution. When there was suspicious activity on my account, a customer service representative immediately called me and asked my if I had recently made a purchase. It turns out, someone had stolen my credit card number and was using it to make purchases. Chase was awesome and resolved the problem after an investigation. I didn't have to pay a dime of that stolen money. I also love the rewards that come with owning a Chase card. Every few months I get a tank of free gas or a check for $25-$50 just for using the card!

name: Keri Banks
review: I have been banking with Chase for 4 years. I have a college checking account which allows me to have no minimums or bank fees for 4 years (while I'm in college.) Next year when I graduate, I will be converted automatically to regular checking which will mean that I will either have to maintain a minimum or receive direct deposit in order to avoid bank fees. I enjoy the text alerts, smartphone apps and the Walgreen's ATMs.

name: Susan
review: I have my credit card through Chase Bank.  Even though my interest rate isn't the absolute lowest around, it's very competitive.  I have only had to phone customer service on one occasion, but the representative could not have been friendlier or more helpful.  Most of all, he actually seemed knowledgeable and was able to resolve my issue within a few minutes.  There was an automated phone system when I first made my call, but I did not have to be passed through an unreasonable amount of choices before speaking with a customer service representative.I take advantage of the automatic payment service so that I never have to worry about late fees.  The payment is withdrawn from my checking account on a monthly basis.  If I want to pay more on the account, I can easily go online and make another payment.  The website is very easy to navigate.  It provides up to date account information whenever I need it.Overall, I am very satisfied with Chase Bank.  I would recommend it to anyone who needs to establish credit in a hassle-free way.

name: Vanessa Hamann
review: I love my Chase Bank.  I have had several incidents with my credit card. Once my identity  was stolen. They were so helpful.  Put me at ease right away as they filled out a  fraud from for me, explained all the steps to it.  They immediately flagged my account and open up a new one for me. I received my new card within the week.  They really knew what they were doing.. The charge was lifted from my account as well.  They  have the friendliest  team working for them. I never have to dread calling them. Another time I was going out of the country and called to let them know I'd be using my card. They put note in that  my card was going to be used in Canada. I had heard some people had problems when in a different county there accounts were held until they could summit proof of identity.  Chase took care of it right away  and I didn't have any problems.

name: Cassandra Jones
review: I have had great experiences using my Disney card by Chase. I love their rewards program and being able to earn Disney Dollars. Also, when I experienced an issue and had to call customer service, they were very prompt and helpful. They do not charge any additional fees if you accidently charge more than the amount of credit you have. Another aspect of this card that I love is that you get to choose your own design, and their designs are very nice. The only problem that I have come across is that they once increased my credit limit without me approving it first.

name: Dustin Gery
review: I won't go too crazy with why credit cards aren't good investments for your return. But I will leave you with a bit of information. Take the amount of interest you pay each year and tell me what you would get in Disney dollars for that. Credit cards are a business and businesses are in business to make money. Making money on you; offering you rewards points, Disney dollars, airline miles or money back knowing full well 80% of people who use credit cards dotty pay them off each month. They will always win, you will always pay more.

name: Megan Mitchell
review: Everyone knows a credit card is a credit card. It's the easiest way to establish credit, and everyone will eventually need credit in their lives at one point or another. You either choose a credit card that tailors to you, or choose one that ends up just taking your money without you getting anything out of it. Everyone who gets a card pays for it in the end, but if you get one that's perfect for you (This one for Disney fans), you still get things in return for using it. Some cards out there don't offer you anything and have an insane APR or annual fee, and this card has neither of those while still servicing you in any way you see fit. If someone thinks credit cards benefit them without any fees, well... then they have no business with a card now, do they?

name: Mike Water
review: The Slate card is easily one of the best cards out on the market right now. For people who are carrying balances like myself, the no balance transfer fee is an amazing deal. I have never had any problems with my credit limit or when dealing with payments or balances. The interest rate is pretty standard, you should always make sure that you're not overusing your card. If you're with a card that you're not too happy about right now, I would certainly suggest applying for this card to see if you qualify. If you're just starting out with credit cards, I would also at least look into this card. One thing that I have to say that I don't like about this card is the lack of internet support. I spend a lot of time online, and it really helps to be able to deal with my banking while I'm also working.

name: WalletHub
review: You can visit Chase.com to register for online account management!

name: Arlean Bloyd
review: I initially went and applied for the Amazon.com credit card because of the $30 they credit to your account when approved. That was a big help towards a purchase. The points also add up fast and I've received many Amazon gift cards to use because of them. The Amazon card has come in handy when purchasing many baby items, such as diapers. In addition to Amazon Mom, I get quite the deal on diapers and the best part of all - they are delivered right to my door, usually within 2-3 business days. I also have Amazon Prime that ships things to my house in two business days for free!

name: Rosette Nao
review: I have recently acquired a Chase Sapphire Credit Card and I have to say for my first experience with a credit card, it is very reasonable and the fact that it gives money back on purchases and a points system is only a bonus. I originally only got this to try and start to build up my credit but now it is something I can use for heavy purchases and that provides a very reasonable about of convenience for the interest rate, etc. It has made purchases so much easier and I greatly enjoy any customer service that is offered by Chase to me when I have any questions or concerns. For a first credit card, A- respectively for no current comparison.

name: Robert Craver
review: I have been a customer of chase for over ten years now and have never had any serious issues with my credit. The only bad incident so far is the ease of use with the card. My son was able to purchase hundreds of dolars worth of clothes and other luxuries online just by using my card number through ebay and other online shopping sites. I feel as though chase should contact me with every purchase of over one hundred dollars either by phone or email. besides this incident I am very happy with my credit card and the chase rewards program is amazing I strongly recommend this credit card to anyone looking to get a credit card.

name: Monty Hutten
review: This card is simply amazing.  First of all, the card looks great and has a weight to it.  Every time I use it someone comments on how cool it is and asks if I’m some kind of billionaire.  Not only does the card look awesome, but it’s got some great features as well.  You get 2 points/$ on dining and travel and 1 point on everything else.  The offer I signed up for also came with a 50,000 point sign up bonus after spending $3,000.  I was able to transfer the points to my United Airlines account and use them for a trip to Japan.  The card also has a lot of other point redemption possibilities (Marriott, Hyatt, Korean Air, etc.).  It’s definitely my go-to card for everyday purchases.

name: Erica Martinusen
review: I have actually had this Chase Slate card for two years now. I love having no annual fee and as long as I am making monthly payments, it's essentially free! I am a college student and so It's nice to have this card to help me build some sort of credit without having to worry about ridiculous fees. I also like having some sort of emergency money available if necessary. Living on my own working a full-time retail job while in school doesn't really cut it. By Chase allowing me to get a credit card even with student loans on my credit, I feel much more secure in living on my own.

name: Barney Jones
review: Out of all the credit cards that I have had, this one is by far my favorite. Although you do need to have outstanding credit to even qualify for this card, once you do, you are never going to look back. The rewards program is great, there is no annual feel, the interest rate is fairly slow, and it looks great! The bonus points are very easy to earn and I've been using it to book for travels just like what they advertise on the commercials. I would recommend this card to anyone looking for a card that offers an excellent rewards program. Another thing that I like about this card is it can be linked to your chase checking account online. It is a positive to be able to check my balance in my bank and see what I've been spending on my card. Again, that is just for customers with a Chase checking account however.

name: Rebecca Hampton
review: I got this credit card because I make enough Amazon purchases that it seemed worthwhile. I like the 3-2-1 rewards points system because everything I buy earns *something* even if some purchases are worth more rewards than others. I especially like using this card for purchasing my textbooks.Unfortunately I was not given very much credit at first, and I can not fit all of my monthly bills on this card at the same time... raising my limit has proved difficult and Amazon has been reluctant to do so. I guess it makes sense since I am a student and don't have much income, but $400 is really an incredibly low limit, no matter who you are.

name: Julie Schellin
review: I have really enjoyed using my Amazon.com credit card.  The $30 initial bonus was the best starting incentive, but the rewards that have accrued rapidly since then have been even better.  I can use this card on purchases that I would make anyway (ie. groceries, gas, household purchases) and keep the card paid in full.  I receive points for every $1 spent, and points are doubled for gas purchases.  I have used Amazon $$ to buy things like our KitchenAid mixer, a Dust Buster, books for our homeschool, and DVD's. I have had this card for over three years now, and it’s been one of the best reward cards I’ve ever had.

name: Bonnie Bird
review: a kitchen aid?!  I have always wanted one..just to sit and look pretty on my counter! What color?  I am going to have to look into this card..the one we have stinks..every now and again we get a $50 card to somewhere yuk like applebees...:(

name: Ben Pierce
review: I have had this card for about two years now after my dad switched over to Chase bank. I have to say that I have no desire to own any other credit card after having this one. I pay my balance at the end of the month and I have never had a problem with Chase if I accidentally miss my payment by a day. I have a $1000 limit on this card but anytime I make a major purchase, I just pay it back in full. I also really like the cashback benefit once you spend a certain amount. As a college student, I could really use the $100 back after spending $500. Chase Bank has been nothing but good to me for the time that I have used them thus far and I plan to continue using them for a great deal of time longer.

name: William Henderson
review: I enjoy using the slate card and I also like the pulse feature. I makes it easy to use. The only negative I have is the pulse feature makes me nervous that a person can easily swipe it because all you have to do is tap the card. I love the 0% APR you get with the card as long as you meet the payment requirement. It saved me with my college in my first year, helped me pay for text books and school supplies. I would recommend this card to anyone who want a to start building credit. It's a great card to start with. I would choose this card over many of it's competitors.

name: JeeJee Lovergirl
review: I have tried so many credit cards in the past and so far Chase Sapphire Credit Card is the best. I like the fact that you can receive bonus points over a period of time. I have this card for over two years now so the rewards are quickly adding up. You can get 20% off  airfare and even hotel packages. I have transferred some of my bonus points into mileage points, which saved me a large sum of money.  Once I had a minor problem , I called the bank and the problem was solved immediately. I would highly recommend this credit card and especially if you are looking to build your credit Chase Sapphire is the card for you.

name: Tim Hansell
review: I'm a big fan of credit cards with rewards and Chase Freedom is a solid rewards credit card. I was attracted by the $100 bonus for signing up which is one of the biggest rewards in the market right now.
