The card is designed for consumers who want to earn cash back for the spending they do and that's me. Getting 5% cash back on all my purchases and 1% cash back on my others makes it fun to use. I've only had the card for about 3 months now so as I have more experience I will share more.

name: Shiran Weber
review: I often stay at Marriott's so I had to get this card! I saw that there's no annual fee for the first year which was a plus. The best thing about the card is the 30,000 free points I receive just for signing up. With those 30,000 points, I was able to stay at the moderately priced Springhill Suites for a few nights. I don't use this card often but always use it when I'm on a business trip as my company will reimburse me and I can earn 3x the points for when I use it on a Marriott-related purchase. In the future, I'll want to stay at an elite JW Marriott so when I rack up enough points to earn a free night I'll be sure to use it on that.

name: Johna Sabella
review: I signed up with Chase about 2 years ago. I have been very happy with it. They gave me a great deal on interest rates and immediately approved me. The one thing I really love about this credit card is the fact that it has no balance transfer fees (if you do it within 30 days). I’ve had no trouble with it but I have always paid my bills on time. I haven’t experience any credit card fraudulent spending but I have heard from other people that this company is very good at alerting you right away about any kind of suspicious activity. Overall, I would definitely recommend this credit card.

name: Lashawnda Ostergren
review: I've been using my Chase Freedom Mastercard for just over 8 months now. I have not found a better credit card for getting cash back. I also have a Chase checking account, so I get 1.1% cash back on everything and 5% cash back on their quarterly categories. This quarter (July, August, September) it is on gas and restaurants. That means I'm saving about $0.15 to $0.17 per gallon ($3.00 to $3.40 per gallon) every time I use my Chase credit card! I love that the points don't expire so I'm personally saving up my points up for about 6 more months when I'm going to be taking a vacation. I received about 2500 points last month, but with the gas and restaurants categories this quarter, I could be looking at close to 5000 points this month! I do pay my card off each month so I haven't really paid much attention to late fees or interest rates, but for normal everyday purchases for cash back, this is the best card that I have seen by far.

name: Jessica Holtz-Hall
review: This is my first ever credit card, so take what I say with a grain of salt. I don't have much experience. I do a lot of my online shopping at Amazon, so this card was a perfect fit for me. Save money on the purchases I was already going to make? Sold! Gain points for the amount of money I spend? Even better. Since you can use those points to make purchases of their own, I am extremely happy with this credit card. Amazon has always had great customer service for me, so I'm sure if I ever need to get help with the card, someone will be there to guide me all the way until my problem is resolved. There's nothing really negative for me to say quite yet. If there is every anything, however, I will remember to come back and make a new post with the new points.

name: Willia Hugueley
review: I got this card because admittedly, I am an amazon.com addict. The rewards for amazon purchase are at about 3%, everything else is at 1%. The huge draw for me is the fact that I can use the points I earn to directly shop on Amazon.com without having to cash in lumps of points for gift cards. The points translate directly in to cents, where 1 point equals 1 cent. Since I use this card for everything, it is great to receive $20 a month to spend on more amazon purchases. It just feeds my addiction.

name: Sarah Bartolone
review: I opened my Chase Freedom Card to transfer the outstanding balance from my other credit card because they offered a 0% APR for a year on balances. It offered the lowest rate after the year ended and also offered a low APR on all purchases. Since the year has passed, I still use my Chase Freedom very often. Every month they offer new 5% cash back deals on certain purchases like gas and grocery, something that I buy very often. It is an incentive to use the card and earn money on things that I need to buy anyways. I also set up a pin number so that I could use my card at ATMs if I needed cash. This is extremely convenient and it is something that not a lot of cards offer. I really like their online resources as well. The bill pay is very easy to use and allows you to explore all of the recent charges to the card in order to keep track of you spending. Overall, this is a good card and I would recommend it to anyone.

name: James Cordes
review: I got this credit card in college to take advantage of the Amazon Rewards points that I was quickly accruing with all my text book purchases. Back then you had to wait until you had 2,500 points to cash out a $25 Amazon gift card. That was sort of a pain and I stopped using the card for several years. Recently I learned that you can spend the points as you earn them now. I've started using the card again and I'm very pleased. The card is a Chase Visa and any purchase I make is shown as a pending charge in my account immediately. I have a Mastercard with a different company and it takes 3-4 days to see recent charges post to the account. I really like the speed that Chase updates your account online. Also, being able to spend the rewards points as you earn them is awesome. My mastercard is 1% cash back, but I have to wait for $50 to accrue before I can request a check. That can take months! I expect to switch to the Visa completely once my Mastercard hits $50 in rewards cash and I can make my final withdrawal.

name: Vanessa Hamann
review: I have had my Chase Credit Card for almost 10 years now. I applied for it  when they were running a special promotional interest rate and balance transfer rate.  I am very glad that I applied. Chase  Card  gave me a great  deal  on the interest  rates  and has continued to over the years.   I do not have to worry about  emergency expenses anymore. Chase has given me a very  generous line of credit that  has taken a lot of   worry off my shoulders.  A couple years ago I was a victim of  identity  thief.  Immediate  Iicalled Chase and they were  on it  tracking  the  purchases  and crediting my  account back for unauthorized charges. I was issued another  card immediately and  the fraud division  took care of the  case.    I  was so  upset but  Chase took  care of it in a matter  of minutes.  I wouldn't  think of  doing business with anyone else!

name: Tyler Hankins
review: I decided recently that I needed to build my credit more and so at the advice of a few friends, I tried out this card. Needless to say, I really like it. Up to July, I was getting 5% cash back for grocery shopping, which is pretty crazy. I also got the same rate applied for movies, so even though I'm not that much of a movie person, I did see a few more in the past three months than I usually do. Additionally, 1% cash back on everything else really adds up! I'm not crazy about the APR after the introductory period, but I'm an accountant in training -- I make sure it's all paid off when it needs to be, anyways. So, basically, it's pretty nice, and I would definitely recommend it.

name: Antonette Wilkins
review: I have banked with Chase for three years now and Iâm very satisfied customer. I have two college checking accounts both are great to have. The college accounts have no interest rates. This opportunity is great for college students and a great way to start a bank account. The customer service is good, every time I visit a branch Iâm treated with respect. The tellers always answer all my questions. If I have a problem someone helps right away. If you visit a branch you wonât have to wait long for assistance. Iâm greeted every time I walk through the door. They offer reward programs for certain places you spend money. I can earn points and then cash in the points for gifts. I can also pay my bills online which is good on the go. The banking online is excellent for quick views of your account

name: Pam
review: I am always very happy with the customer service I receive at my local branch.  The branch is also located in a grocery store, so that is very convenient.  The ladys at the branch are always very nice. They thank me by name for banking with them.  Each transaction goes very smoothly and as expected.  I never know all of my account numbers, but the agents are always happy to look those up for me. Sometimes I do get annoyed by their fees, but if you call and ask about it, usually, they will work with you to take off the fee or at least split it with you.  I would also recommend Chase bank because they have ATMs in all Speedway stores, and you can usually find a branch or ATM nearby.

name: Christina
review: I joined Chase while they had the new deal of getting $100 after you made 5 purchases with the card. I remember the signup process being average (not really hard, but not amazingly easy), and I promptly got my $100 bonus. I gave them three stars because after signing up, I noticed some fees being charged that I hadn't known about when I signed up. However, I managed to get rid of the fees somehow-I don't remember how, but I know you can. Their customer service is great; whenever I had a question it was simple and easy to find an answer. Overall, my experience with Chase was good, but not excellent.

name: Sarah Fletcher
review: Chase has a very big bank feel. They are nice enough,but they don't have that local feel. The hours that they are open are nice, more than my hometown bank. Their out-of-network ATM fees are insane, (3.00 to Chase plus the 2.50-4 ATM charge) but usually I can avoid by planning ahead. My only other complaint is almost every time I'm in a hurry, someone tries to sell me something (from a script), and will not take no for an answer. The scripts seem to take forever, and are hard to get out of. They have plenty of locations and I really like that. Chase is an adequate bank for me, the hours and plentiful locations mostly make up for the annoyances.

name: Tatiana
review: The Chase customer service is amazing. I've used other banks and I've never met people as nice as those who work in the Chase branches. Unfortunately, when I first signed up for the checking account I now have I asked if there were any branches or ways to get to an ATM in Massachusetts since I was going to school there. The person I was working with told me that there were many Chase ATMs in Massachusetts, which was incorrect information. Another issue is the fact that signing into Chase on a phone or mobile device does not bring up the full Chase website. I had a problem with this when trying to find my account number while away from a computer.

name: Barbra
review: I started a Chase account a couple of years ago.  I had been through a lot of financial issues with my ex where I had good credit and everything we got went into my name and then he spent all of our money and we could never pay our bills and as a result my credit was less than desirable.  Chase gave me a second chance account and after six months of good standing with them they switched me over to a regular checking account.  I really appreciate that they do this for people as I needed it badly at the time and ever since then they have always been extremely friendly and helpful any time I've had questions or issues.  Overall I have had a great experience as a Chase customer.

name: Dee
review: I originally joined Chase when it was Washington Mutual. I was dissatisfied with my previous bank and wanted to join something local to Seattle. I was extremely satisfied with my account options and the customer service when it was WaMu. When WaMu became Chase, I decided to stick with the bank and see what happened. I have continued to be satisfied, however, I do think the bank lost some of it's local service aspect. I still find my local bankers to be very helpful and friendly every time I go in. Phone banking also provides a good level of service and Chase has really been on top of it when it comes to detecting potential and, in one case, real fraud on my account. They are cautious but not overly restrictive and haven't caused me any problems even though I travel extensively. One of the best things about Chase is its extensive network of ATMs and the ability to make deposits via a smartphone app. They seem committed to innovation and making banking easy on the customer. They are not pushy or sales oriented when you come into the bank, unlike my previous bank. I also like the online interface that integrates my credit card and bank account.Instances when my local Chase branch has been less than helpful have been when I needed foreign currency and to obtain some rather complex account documents to verify my account in order to apply for a foreign visa. In the first instance, I found the staff rather dismissive and in the second, I was referred to a private banker (not sure what they're called, but the people who sit at the desks) who had no idea what he was doing but all the confidence in the world. I ended up having to go to another branch to get what I needed. There have been some changes to my account over the years in terms of providing less free services and implementing more basic account fees, but overall Chase still continues to deliver a good standard of service.

name: Fartina Segura
review: I have no idea how I got suckered into getting an account with Chase but for some reason, I was. Any how, I thought that I would have no problems with this bank. I was wrong. There was a lot of things that they did not go over with me when I opened an account and I eventually got myself into a lot of trouble with checks, being that I had to keep a certain amount in the bank. Well, I figured, everyone makes mistakes. So I'll just see if it can be cleared up. Wrong. I felt like maybe there would be some understanding on their part being that I was not informed in the beginning and while I would not say that they were rude, I will say that they did not try to keep my business either. My recommendation is just make sure you know what you are getting into. Ask lots of questions and make sure you understand the fine print. They're not a bad bank but they're plenty others out there that are willing to work with their customers.

name: Caitlin Neely
review: I've had a great experience with Chase. They're always helpful when I forget my bank account and that happens often. They also have good customer service and are prompt and helpful. I also like that they have plenty of banks near me. It is easy to find one. The workers inside the bank are friendly and nice. They answer my questions and give helpful responses. I do not have any loans through them but I would consider it because of the customer service. They treat their customers fairly. I would recommend the bank to my friends and family if ever asked.

name: Kevin
review: Chase has never been my favorite bank but I am somewhat locked into the account until I pay my credit card off. I have found their employees to be lifeless and not really care about much. Out of any bank that I have been a part of them seem to have the biggest fees and they are the most prevalent. It seems like they have a charge for everything and an answer as to why you must have not noticed it before. The only benefit I can really say about Chase is that they have ATMs in Walgreens stores which makes it somewhat convenient when you need one.

name: Greg Thomas
review: Overall, I've been very satisfied with Chase.  As a resident of NY, ATM and branch availability is beyond excellent.  There is essentially one on every corner.  The signup process was simple and fast.  I had a few minor issues, which were all resolved.  One was an issue with a check deposit through an ATM; the ATM ate the check without depositing it.  A simple call to customer service resolved this in a day.  The other issue was with a seemingly random hold on a payroll check that lasted over a week.  This was a bit more of an issue, and took a bit of escalation to get worked out.Since then, however, it's been a trouble free experience.  The online banking service is simple, easy to use, and uncluttered.  They make paperless options easy to sign up for, which I am a huge fan of.  The first time you sign into the online banking service, it prompts you to select whether you wish to enroll in overdraft protection or decline coverage.  They're very straight forward and open with disclosure.I would definitely recommend Chase.

name: jay
review: My experience with Chase Bank was very much less than favorable and I'd urge you to go elsewhere. Signing up for the checking/savings account is very simple, but then again I've never had a problem at any bank, so I guess that just falls into the category of not being terrible. Anyway, the easy riding ended there. Chase's customer support is absolutely horrible. The staff are extremely rude (on the phone, they're OK in the actual bank). But rude is tolerable, most places you call into (except TiVo, but hey, that's a DVR company, not a bank) are pretty rude; but in addition to being rude to you they are totally clueless about, well, practically anything they should know. If you ask even the most basic question they will either transfer you or put you on an exceedingly long hold only to come back (or be picked up by) with no answers at all. It seems like their tactics revolve around spinning you in circles until you give up. Poor business practice if you ask me. A short story shorter, if you ever think you'll ever need any help from customer service, don't bank with these guys.

name: Roger
review: Recently, I was in the market for a new CD savings vehicle.  I had done my homework, shopped around online, and overall determined the top interest rates for various lengths of CD's.  I found the interest rate for a 6 month Chase CD to be quite appealing.  It was essentially on par with what most institutions are paying right now, but it was ultimately the ease of use that led me to go with Chase.  The opening and application process was very easy.  I was able to do everything online, without even having a Chase checking account.  I was able to transfer from my outside financial institution, and the entire process was very very quick and easy.  High marks!

name: Megan Wentworth
review: I have used several Chase cards and accounts over the last few years.  They are a large institution and I believe that makes them a good choice for money matters.  When I have had the need to contact them they are helpful and resolve my issues quickly.  I think for the most part they have clear disclosures but I did have one experience that would say otherwise.  I did a balance transfer from my Chase account to another and I found that the fee for the balance transfer was surprisingly high.  I knew there would be one but I didn't read the fine print as well as I guess I needed to because my understanding was for a fee that was about a third of the cost.  It made the balance transfer 0% interest for a year a lot less of a deal considering that.  Otherwise, I would recommend Chase accounts.

name: RoyStar SoundSick
review: The Bank I'm writing about is the Chase Bank in Lancaster, CA located off of Challenger Way and Avenue J. My experiences with this particular branch were nothing short of wonderful. All representatives were polite and extremely professional. Though they(this location) were always very much extremely busy, there were always representatives there to greet the patrons, making the service move extremely quickly and professionally. As far as setting up my Chase checking account, my representative was extremely helpful, and the overall process was extremely quick, professional and concise. I did not feel like an outsider, rather a member of the Chase banking family.

name: Leif
review: When Washington Mutual was bought by Chase I wasn't too pleased.  But I have been consistently surprised by the level of good service I receive from Chase.  As an example, last week I had to use an ATM because I was at a pool and they only accepted cash.  I was charged with a $2.50 fee from the ATM machine as well as another non-Chase ATM fee of $2.  I  called Chase's customer support and they were very helpful, they even removed the fee!  I know it's a small issue, but nice to know that Chase's customer service agents have the power to help their customers a little.  Also, Chase has a great website, I can complete whatever kind of bank business right online with hardly ever any type of issue.  So overall, I am pretty pleased with Chase, they appear to be trying to make the customer happy.

name: Adam M
review: I have been banking with Chase now for about three years or so. My whole experience with them has been wonderful. When first signing up, I was given a one-hundred dollar bonus after an initial deposit of one-hundred dollars. The teller was very nice and courteous. After filling out the forms and choosing my type of account I was told I'd receive my debit card in the mail in about two weeks. It arrived on time and I've never had trouble with the card itself. I was also signed up for the mobile alerts by Chase, which has alerted me of potential overdraft fees many times and saved me a bunch of money. Only once have I had to call to complain about a service fee which I did not think was fair, and they simply waived the fee and apologized for an inconveniences. Overall I am very satisfied banking with Chase.

name: Josh Wren
review: Seven years ago I was stuck with a very bad local bank that was really holding me and my finances back in the dark ages. Then along came Chase! I was starting work at a temp agency and they told me I would get a free checking account if I signed up for automatic deposit. I immediately took them up on the offer and have enjoyed nation-wide awesome customer service from them ever since. One time I had an instance were an online transaction posted 5 pending transactions on my bank account at once. All I had to do was give Chase a call in the middle of the night and they completely took care of it.

name: niccole taylor
review: I switched to Chase about 6 months ago and have never been happier with a bank.  I love the military benefits that they offered to me and my husband so we have no monthly fee.  The online access for internet banking is so easy to use and gives me the option to take care of my banking needs without leaving my computer.  The other aspect that I love is the mobile features that Chase offers if anything coming out of my account is over a certain amount that I set they send me text message.  If I need to deposit a check all I have to do is take a picture and it’s in my account.  This bank is definitely the most convenient I have ever had.

name: Cindy
review: I am very angry with my Chase Bank. I had opened a “free” checking account at this bank last summer because they had a $100 promotion for opening a new account. I set up a direct deposit with my company and their bank. I thought I would see this promotion in a few weeks like they said. It has been several months now, and I still haven't received the promotional offer. I called customer service several times and they said they would take care of it each time but I haven’t seen anything. I have ALSO received a service charge fee that I did not know about for using their checking account. I am very upset with the experience.

name: joe dowling
review: I have had a Chase Bank checking account for over ten years and have been completely satisfied with the service I have received so far.  I have no intention of closing my account to go to another bank. I think that Chase Bank is the best bank around.  I really like their online banking website because it is very easy to use and keeps me informed on my balance so I do not overdraw my account.  I have had a bank that was slow to update before and I overdrew my account and cost me a lot of money in fees.

name: Won Lee
review: This is a card that really separates those who fly a lot, and those who don't.  Why do I say that?  Well, a lot of reviewer here note that this card gives away up to 100,000 points.  Awesome  right? 100,000! wow? when others are giving away only 25k - max 50k? 100k?  are these guys insane?Hold right there.  BEFORE you proceed to spam the "apply" button, It's important to note what you can get out of Avios (British Airline Mileage term).    The fact is... Not much. It's because flying to and from europe on British Airline on award ticket (using your avios) is going to cost you ransom, both in Avios points but ALSO IN TAX!  A flight from New York City to London cost around $900 TAX when you use your points. wait? $900 dollars for tax? When I could pay for an economy seat for about $1000?   900?  really?So when is Avios good for?  It's if you are a flight connoisseur and you want to fly first class no matter what.  Then, you could drop 180,000 avios and pay $2000 in tax, and fly first class to london.  Worth it for most people? no.    (there is another trick where u can use avios to hop around south america locations, but that's not for everyone). So, my word of advice? stay away from this card.  I wish Avios was worth more, then I'd jump all over this card. but it really isn't.

name: Won Lee
review:
2 things.  

1) you are absolutely correct that with 100k avios, you can book 4 trans-continental flight on AA. Checking things on BA.com,  a round trip from JFK to LAX cost 12500 avios each way on AA metal, without any tax (on economy).  (If, and only if, saver seats are available).
2) However, reading the fine print, for most people who will apply to this card via WalletHub will only get 50k points (they would have to spend $20,000 first year to get full 100k avios. ) 

Avios, in my opinion, is best when you fly short distance (as the charge of avios is distance based), and you can find some incredible value intra South America via LAN airline.  

Award availability on American Metal with BA avios is also limited, so you would have to consider that factor as well.  

Finally, if this card was from anyone BUT chase,  i would apply in a heart beat.  Chase offers other great cards, and I wouldn't want to miss out on those opportunities by wasting a application on Chase BA.

name: jeremy
review: Chase bank has always been pretty good with me. I use their college checking account which is free of charges to own for any college student. That I really like. Treatment wise though, I have never had an issue. They also have really cool ATMs which can scan checks without entering info, and then they display the picture of the check on the receipt! Pretty neat! I moved from my hometown down to a smaller town and ATMs aren't as accessible but they are still around. Ultimately, I really like Chase bank. I give them 5/5. Check them out sometime!

name: Trudy Menedez
review: I have this credit card with Chase and do not recommend it. I checked my credit card account online one day and found out that they cut my credit limit by over half. I called to ask why they did this, and they said I was not using the card enough and they cut the limit down to close to what I had as a balance. This resulted in my credit score being lowered because my debt to available credit ratio was affected. I paid off the credit card and two months later they raised my limit back to where it once was. I feel as if this company plays too many games.

name: Lisa Baer
review: I LOVED this card for the initial startup cashback offers. That's the main reason why I signed up. They offered me 200 dollars cashback (they cut me a check!) for opening up a credit card with them and using it just ONCE. But like Pringles (once you pop you can't stop) I kept (wisely) using this credit card because it built up good miles for redemption. It has the Visa logo and I used it a good bit when I was doing some international travel last year. It was a bit slow to build up miles in comparison to the Capital One Venture Card or the Discover Miles Card, but overall, it was great and I highly highly recommend it. Who doesn't love 200 dollars in their bank account, a steady stream of miles, and the Visa logo? I never called their customer service, but I hope that it is better than Capital One. Great card, highly recommend.

name: Lanita Hintzen
review: I signed up for the Amazon credit card because Amazon had an incentive that rewarded new card members with a $30 gift card.  For the most part, I've been very satisfied with this credit card.  Frequent shoppers on Amazon.com benefit the most from this credit card, however.  That is because of the credit card's point system.  For every dollar you spend, you earn a point.  For every dollar you spend at gas stations, restaurants, and drugstores, you earn two points.  For every dollar you spend on Amazon.com, however, you earn three points.  These points can then be redeemed for credit on Amazon.com.  (For every 100 points, you get a $1.00 towards your purchase.)  Redeeming these points for credit on Amazon.com is pretty easy and you can do it any time, regardless of your points total.  If you want to redeem your points for anything besides a credit on Amazon.com, then your options are more limited.  There are other options such as cash back, but in order to redeem these offers, you have to reach a certain amount of points.  This is a drawback of the Amazon credit card.  The point system is inflexible and if you're not a big shopper on that site and have nothing to buy in particular, the points are not as useful.  The customer service has been solid.  The web site is also very easy to use. The credit card is issued by Chase, which I think is a positive.  I find that Chase has good security measures in place to protect its customers.  Overall, I do rate the Amazon credit card highly.  I would definitely recommend this card to people who frequently shop on Amazon.com.

name: Shard
review: I have had this card for just over a year now, and so far it has treated me well. I managed to save up $50 worth of rewards points and cashed them out by applying them to my statement for the month, I didn't know I could do that with the points until I actually did, and it was a very pleasant surprise. As one of my first credit cards I don't have a very high credit limit, I was only approved for $500, but that doesn't bother me as I hope to never reach even that limit. When I lost my physical card a few months ago their customer service was amazingly quick, and helpful. Luckily they were able to cancel that card before anyone had a chance to use it, but even if they had not I feel confident that their customer service would have handled it well. Overall, a great card.

name: Janice Farland
review: I love this credit card.  The no balance transfer fees caught my attention and immediate approval sold me!  I have a bank account with Chase and wanted to expand my banking products with them.  I love the convenience of scheduling payments and the tools to help you decide how to pay down your balance quicker.  The card itself is quite pretty, different than other cards out there and looks impressive.  The email alerts are helpful, as is the online banking process. My bank accounts are connected which is a nice feature.  The automated system is also great and doesn't drag out the phone experience.

name: Tyler Schritz
review: I have been using the Chase Freedom card for about four years now, and have had absolutely zero problems. Like most rewards credit cards, the rewards aren’t exactly what they use to be, but are still fantastic.  Chase Freedom offers 1% cash back on most purchases, and up to 5% cash back on select categories. These categories rotate every three months. These categories include restaurants, grocery stores, department stores, clothing stores, gas stations, etc.  Another great feature of the Chase Freedom Card is the fact that there is absolutely no annual fee. Chases’ online banking is second to none, and make it very fast and easy to pay off your card at the end of your billing cycle.

name: Janet Qian
review: If you spend a lot of the year traveling either for business or vacation, this is a great card to use. The rewards points are a nice addition and you get free nights early on with additional points accumulated for money you spend. There is a fee, but again, when you're traveling you do tend to gain a lot of points and over time. Marriott has many nice hotels and services so the perks are pretty worth it. I've only had to contact their lines once, but in my experience the representative was polite and professional. The problem was sorted quickly without an excessive wait time.

name: Monica Corpus
review: I originally got this card to save another $10 on a purchase, and I thought I would probably not use it much. I find that I use it often.  First, its cash back program is excellent. For regular purchases, it’s about average, but it has some exceptionally good deals, too.   I get 3 points per $1 spent on Amazon sites as a cash back incentive. I like to shop at Amazon, because even though I have not paid to join Amazon Prime, I usually buy the minimum of $25 of goods  to be entitled to the free, albeit slower, shipping. It also gives   generous points for purchases at pharmacies. It is very convenient to link it to my Amazon account and order items to be sent to my Kindle.  I keep track of my points earned and I usually find that my purchases of Keurig cups for the coffee maker are nearly free; I  buy a couple boxes about every 2 -3 months. Anyone who shops at Amazon or buys books for Kindles will see how quickly you can rack up points. Customer service has been polite and billing has been accurate; so there’s more reasons to like.

name: Carla Nunez
review: This is probably one of the best cards I have ever owned. There is a 4.95 monthly fee so just keep that in mind if this is something that you are willing to spend. For me I think it is worth it because most banks have a fee anyways. I have always had a problem in the past where I spend more money then I have. With the prepaid card all the money in my account is money for my job that gets transferred into my checking account.  Some of the little things I like also about this card as it is only a two dollar fee if I were to go to a different ATM. All other cards have been three dollars. I understand that it is only one dollar extra but I does add up in the long run. There are also Chase banks everywhere. The people are so friendly if I ever need help they are welcoming and ready to help. Also one thing to look into when getting a card is their activation fee and the good thing about this card was there was none. I would definitely recommend this card for those that like cards that are prepaid or debit cards. It does everything I could ask for in a card.

name: Lizzie Griffith
review: can reload at atms free of charge

name: Meagan Boucher
review: Chase Liquid has a monthly fee of 4.95 so instead of using a money pak you would just pay 4.95 a month to use the card & what she said ^^^

name: Ryanne Carter
review: How old do you have to be to get the card?

name: WalletHub
review: You have to be at least 18 years old to get this card.  And there are no reload or deposit fees on the Liquid card.  There is only a $4.95 monthly fee.

name: Apryl Constable
review: I have been a Chase customer for years and I love this company! They are always so helpful and will work with me on what ever it is that I need. I have had a few problems through out the years but they never failed to fix the issues for me. I just recently started using this card but so far I have not had any problems out of it. I see a lot of people complain about Chase but maybe it is them and not the bank.. You can not expect a bank to fix every single problem especially if you are the one causing it. For things that are not your fault, Chase will definitely fix it for you with no hassles. I would definitely recommend this company and card to anyone.

name: Frank Avalos
review: Recently got this card and was definitely impressed with the perks such as the flexible reward program, and the APR of 15%, which is low when compared to other rewards cards that charge more than that. When my wife and I signed up for it, there was even a generous signup bonus. Since we travel a lot, the fact that we get to use some of the earned points towards airfare and hotel stays is incredible. My wife and I have found it to be better to link it to our checking for automatic payments, that way we don't really worry about late fees. It has definitely been the most flexible card we've seen and used, and with no annual fee, we're looking forward to using it more often.

name: Qing Lu
review: The British Airways Credit Card is a great card. I applied for this card a few months ago and earned 50,000 Avios points after I first used it. The avios points can be used to book flight tickets and it only costs 9000 points to buy a roundtrip ticket from San Francisco to Los Angeles, which means I can take five roundtrip flights between these two locations with these points. This is very great sign-in bonus for me to use this card. Another great thing about this card is that it does not charge foreign transaction fee when I use it outside of the USA. The only thing I don't like this card is that it does not waive the first-year annual fee, which is $95. Currently many other credit cards waive the first-year annual fee. But overall, this is a great card.

name: Qing Lu
review: I applied for this card 4 months ago and got approved. I earned 50,000 bonus points after I spent $3,000 in the first 3 months. These points can be easily transferred to my United Airlines Mileage Plus account to other people's UA Mileage Plus account without any charge. I have sufficient UA Mileage Plus points, so I sold these points to someone else who needed to book a UA flight ticket. The price was over $500, which is enough for me to buy a domestic roundtrip flight ticket. I like this card.Another good thing about this card is  that it does not charge foreign transaction fee when I use this card in other countries, which is typically 3% when I use other credit cards. I highly recommend this card to others.

name: Rachel R
review: There is one thing that stands out for me about the Chase Slate card- no balance transfer fees if you transfer within 30 days! This is basically free money! The 0% interest on balance transfers is pretty common, but I have not seen a $0 balance transfer fee in a long time. I am definitely capitalizing on this. One thing I did not like, is that I did not get approved right away for the card. They had to further review my application. I have excellent credit and have never had this happen on a credit card application. They did give me a decent enough limit though so I can really take advantage of the no fee balance transfer.

name: Felice Merow
review: First, I should state that I have always paid my credit card bills on time or early. I have two credit cards: a Wells Fargo student credit card issued when I opened an account when I turned 18 and enrolled in college and a Visa Freedom card that I have used for almost a year now. I rarely (if ever) even touch my Wells Fargo card. I mainly used it to build credit, but there were no rewards or cashback associated with the card. After doing some research, I decided to apply for a Chase Visa Freedom card. I’m currently a graduate student on a tight budget, so I was looking for something with minimal or no fees and decent rewards or cashback. When I signed up, Chase was offering $250 cashback if $500 was spent in the first 3 months. I’ve seen the same deal be offered since I signed up for between $200-300, so keep your eyes peeled! Between gas, utilities, and groceries, the $500 spending in 3 months was super easy to achieve.The rewards are only 1% for most purchases, but the 5% rotating categories usually manage to hit something that I spend each month (I believe the next three months it will be for gas stations, while the previous 3 were for groceries). Additionally, since Visa is accepted almost everywhere I have never had an issue with card rejection. Between the initial bonus cashback and 1-5% rewards, I’d estimate that using the Chase Freedom Card has put an extra ~$400 in my pocket over the last year alone while not requiring me to pay any extra fees or change my spending habits.I’m extremely happy with this card. If you’re on a budget and don’t flip between using a few different credit cards, this is a great card to look into.

name: Gertie Gieser
review: I have to disclose, I used to work for JPMorgan Chase. I applied for their Chase Freedom card when it first came out and I was definitely happy with what they offered me. I was 18 at the time and they gave me a $5000 limit and 0% for the first 18 months I had the card. Now, I’ve never carried a balance on the card so I never had a chance to take advantage of the 0% APR, but the rewards program is good and something that we take advantage of regularly. When I initially got the card I really liked the rewards program: 5% cash back on your top 3 categories and 1% on the rest. I would rack up rewards quickly and redeem $50 within 2 months. However, since they changed to specified categories that rotate I have become less likely to used this card. I’ve found my AMEX to have a more lucrative reward program that we’ve started to take advantage of. Overall it's a good card and started out great, but since regulations have changed I have become significantly less impressed.

name: Jereme Taylor
review: I’ve had my Chase Visa card for about 7 years now.  They initially gave me a high credit limit that really helped me out when I needed it after a cross-country move several years ago (though I almost wish it hadn’t been so high so I wouldn’t be so in debt now!).  The newish Blueprint site is well designed and easy to use.  I personally like the option to set a certain amount to pay off over a certain number of months.  It’s nice to have a payment in the amount you choose automatically paid from your checking each month.  In my experience, Chase is a good bank to deal with, and this has been a good card for me.

name: Nat Simonetti
review: I have been using Chase as my bank for several years now. When I needed a new credit card I decided to go with Chase and get the Sapphire card. It is a very simple card to use. I have never had any problems buying anything with this card or paying the bill. Chase also has excellent customer service. I had a fraudulent charge on my card last December. Chase let me know extremely fast and had the problem resolved very quickly. The anti-fraud is a great part of this card and will really come in handy when you need it. It is a great card with a great company.

name: Erin Bjornsson
review: Since I was already a MileagePlus member I got 50,000 miles after the first use which is great. I have good flight status, so having the card always bumps me up as well as having ramped up the miles I have earned. I know that other airline cards might be more competitive, but since I was already a decently high United member, this card has a lot more benefits for me than it does for others, which I find strange. My dad has the same card, and he doesn't get nearly as many perks as I do (free upgrades, drinks, United Club access). I would suggest being a United member before applying, I got tons of emails from them, and only jumped on getting the card when they made an offer with benefits I couldn't really refuse!

name: Erin Bjornsson
review:
They send out different emails from time to time if you are a Mileage Plus member, once a month or so. It was usually 40,000 for members, but the time it came up at 50,000 I figured I would just go for it. I would reply to the emails they send periodically for the mileage plus membership, not the open offer.

It's a great card though, I'd highly recommend it! If they tell you you can't have the miles I'd call the customer service center and say something about getting emails in the past, they have been excellent every time I have needed something.

name: Kristi Simpson
review: I love this card. I have flown on Southwest Airlines for the last 10 years. If I am planning a business trip or vacation, South West is always my go to airline. Especially now that most of the other airlines charge you for everything from pillows to baggage fees. I was elated when I found out that the company now offers a Visa credit card. I love the fact that every time I use this card for a purchase, I earn points toward my next flight. I would recommend this card to any one who travels quite often and enjoys a good bargain every now and then. Using this card is the quickest way to earn a free trip.

name: Shira Coral
review: I originally started with the Chase College Credit Card, but only had a limit of 300 dollars a month for the first three years of college. I thought that was ridiculous, seeing as I was responsible with my money, and I can barely put 1 book down using my credit card without going over my limit. I applied and was accepted to get my Chase Freedom Visa, and am so happy now with Chase. I have a limit of $1,300 dollars, and am currently in my first three months of card use. I get 100 dollars cash back if I spend 500 in the first three months, so I am planning on just buying the groceries for my family this summer and having my parents pay me back, just so I can make an easy 100 dollars doing practically nothing. I hope that this is the beginning of a good and solid relationship with Chase, seeing as it was a struggle initially using my College Credit account.

name: Laura Lund
review: We have had this card for about 10 years and love it.  We earn rewards each time we use it.  The rewards can be used when we travel to Disney World or can be used online at the Disney Store.  One of the best parts of having the card is that Chase is very good about card security.  Whenever we use the card more than a couple of times in one day, Chase calls us to verify that the card has not been stolen.  We really appreciate that.  The card also has many unique designs to choose from, so as huge Disney fans, we can have a little fun and pick our favorite Disney character for the card design.

name: Susan Glachman
review: My husband and I have had this card for almost a year now, and it's been great for us. With family scattered all over the country, we end up flying at least once a year. Last year it was several flights. That can get expensive, but this card helps a lot! Why not get rewarded for the money you already have to spend? We got our annual trip to see family covered for free, and our vacation tickets are already covered. It's definitely worth the annual fee. Overall  we've saved so much money having this card!

name: David Tsang
review: I got this card after my friend told me about it. It's a really basic credit card with a minor cash back program for stuff one would actually buy. It's really nice for people who want to start building their credit without the hassle of using a card with a lot of stipulation. But of course, the main reason I got this card is for the initial cash back bonus. Luckily for me, I was able to get the $300 Bonus cash back instead the $200 cash back after spending $500. Basically that's you're spending $500 for only $200.Outside of this cash back initial bonus, the regular cash back program is really small, but not insignificant. Having a 1% cash back bonus is nice especially if you make a lot of purchases, but there are better credit cards that give a high % cash back. However, there is a quarterly 5% cash back bonus on certain purchases. For example, during this summer quarter, you can get 5% on gas purchases which is really nice. You do have to sign up (simple activation online) every quarter, but you can get email remainders. Even if you activate later than the start date, Chase will retroactively apply the cash back to eligible purchases you've made beforehand. The drawbacks is that there is no 0% interest rates.

name: Allen Thomas
review: After several credit cards and looking at all the competition, my wife and I decided to try Chase.  The benefits are awesome as we have accrued several rewards that have been very helpful.  We also had one false charge on our account that was extremely easy to dispute.The only problems I've had were when I went out of town and my credit card was temporarily disabled because it didn't recognize the location.  This was a minor inconvenience.  I had to log into my account and verify that it was okay and all was well.After having several credit cards in the past, I would highly recommend this card to anyone.  The great rewards that come with it are just a bonus plus you can't beat the customer service.  I have nothing but good things to say about this credit card.

name: Sourde Jason
review: When I lived in the area my wife and I decided a Disney Premier credit card might be a good investment, considering how much time we were spending at Disney-related areas. Thankfully we weren't let done whatsoever. The 0% on purchases for 6 months was of course a fantastic selling point and it treated us very well. Eventually we fell on harder times and had a more difficult time of paying off previous purchases, but upon calling Visa and discussing our options with them we found they were extremely willing to help us where they could, allowing us flexibility in paying off our remaining balance while still keeping a good credit rating. I'd recommend this card and definitely recommend considering Visa!

name: Greg Takeshima
review: I had always heard great things about the Chase Freedom card because of it's great rewards system.  I'm a firm believer of if you use a credit card you should be rewarded and it should be free (no annual fees, because if you have to pay an annual fee what's the point of gettiing rewards?).  The $100 "at sign up" is great, nice little $ on the side but you do have to spend a little bit in the first 3 months.  The awesome thing about the card is that it's a visa, which is practically accepted everywhere, unlike some of my other cards (*cough AMEX and Discover *cough).  All you really have to do is stay on top of your payments and this is a great little card with few drawbacks.

name: Rima Yager
review: I've had this card for over four years. At the time I signed up, the bonuses were set up differently. You would get 3% back in your top spending categories, versus the new system they have now that gives you 5% back in rotating categories. The old bonus system was much more versatile, making it a true "freedom" card, since you could use it anywhere and at least be guaranteed a reasonable bonus. The 5% rotating rewards are fine, but it is confusing to keep track of which categories are getting bonuses in a given month. It is definitely not a use everywhere card. Dealing with Chase has actually been very good. They gave me a generous credit limit and the phone support has always been helpful. I would say this is a  great card to have in you like rotating bonus category cards.

name: Charlyn Pitel
review: I just applied for the Chase Freedom card about 4 months ago. So far, I love it! This card was a good fit for me from the start. The first thing I did was a balance transfer from another card (which was charging me about 26% interest). This made a huge difference on my monthly payments. The best thing is I can look forward to paying 0% on the funds I transferred over for the next year (I qualified for an offer of 0% on the first 15 months!). The next thing that caught my interest was the $100 cash back offer. Reaching the $500 minimum in purchases within the first three months in order to qualify for the cash back was not a problem for me. I travel quite a bit (mostly by car) and rack up a lot of business travel related expenses. This is another reason the Freedom card has been great for me-business expenses! I spend so much money on gas and food and there are frequent %5 cash back bonus offers on these items. Though, regardless of what the extra current bonus offer is, I always earn at least 1%. In 4 months I have racked up a ton of cash back rewards.  I can hardly wait to check my reward balance at the end of every month.  It actually makes spending kind of fun now.

name: Ben Pierce
review: This card is great. I am able to charge anything I like and I pay the balance ASAP. One time I paid late and called Chase to let them know. Since I called ahead they were understanding and gave me an extra day to pay. I love Chase bank and I will not change banks anytime soon. I have been a member of Chase for a few years and just recently got this card and I have no complaints. The online banking app works fantastic with this card as well as I can track my spending. I would highly recommend this card to anyone.

name: Andrew Simmons
review: I've had this card for almost a month now, at first I wasn't sure if I really needed a credit card but the bank rep convinced me to give it a go. I'm not a reckless spender, so it made sense to have a fallback and something to build my credit score. I actually have been using it, about once a week because I know I'll pay it off and there are also some very good incentives such as the discounts and bonus points that have already given me significant savings on a hotel booking. I can't imagine I'd need a different credit card really, if you're at least reasonably responsible, this card is perfect.

name: Katy White
review: The British Airways credit card is a great credit card. This summer, my entire family flew to Europe from America on our miles from using this credit card. The miles you earn can be used for British or American airlines. You get 50,000 miles after your first purchase, and more if you spend over 10,000$ in one year. My family used the credit card to pay for my college tuition and housing, which is how we got so many miles. We have used this card for two years, and will continue to use it. Also, British Airways is an amazing airlines focused on customer service.

name: John Rea
review: I recently received my Chase Sapphire Preferred Card in the mail. I didn't think I'd use it all that much initially, maybe just for emergencies, but after my first week with it, it's become my go to card for all of my purchases. The reward points rack up very quickly with this card, and I don't even shop that much. I never really traveled that much, but with this card, I see myself doing it more frequently. With their Ultimate Rewards program discounting the number of points needed, I'm already very close to the amount of points needed for a well needed vacation. It's a great card, I can't recommend it more.

name: Sean Huett
review: I love this credit card...I use it constantly because I always pay it off weekly.  I have $7000 in credit, which as a student is nice to know they trust me.  I also have a very good credit history.  Over the past two years, I have earn almost $1000 in rewards.  For a free card, that is fantastic.This card is the best idea, ever, if you are responsible enough to pay it off.  I also have had it stolen three times, and each time Chase caught it, called me, canceled my card right away, and paid for whatever the thief charged on there.  I would not use any other card.

name: Nathan Pullman
review: I have had this card for about 6 months now. Overall the card is good, and the rewards are useful. However the way the rewards work is it revolves around each quarter with different 5% rewards each quarter.  Sometimes the quarter gives you good stuff like 5% on gas, but then other times its like 5% back for movies... which I don't see more than 10$ a month on so kind of useless. Everything gives you at least 1% which is nice I guess. Sometimes I wish I would have gotten a card that gave you a flat 2 or 3% back but I guess at the end of the year it equals about the same so its not a big deal. The online service is quite good actually and gives you many options to select. There is also links where you can get special rewards, for example you can get up to 10% back at kohls if you go through the link and use your card there.

name: Aundrea Stecher
review: I just recently got the amazon.com credit card because I am a huge fan of amazon and use it for all sorts of things.  When you are approved you get $30 credited to your amazon account automatically which is great!  I also like their points system.  Since I use amazon a lot this really does come in handy.  For every three points you earn you get one dollar towards your amazon account.  If you use amazon as much as I do then this is definitely the credit card for you.  One of the other positives is that there is no yearly fee like a lot of the other credit cards out there.  Overall, I would recommend this credit card.

name: Kimberly Hatfield
review: I have used this card all over and I have found no issues with it at this time. The only thing that may be negative is the interest rate. But, all credit card companies have high interest rates anymore.

name: Ryan Thomas
review: I got this card during my first year of college mostly in order to get a $30 off deal that was being granted to people getting the card. It was my first credit card and I was extremely nervous about the entire ordeal--I did research ont he matter for about 2 weeks before I started the process to actually get the card. Eventually, I decided to get it (the fact that the purchase I had been wanting to make was still sitting in my wishlist pushed me a little bit, too) and I can honestly say that it was a decision I have not regretted. For a college student, especially, this card is extremely helpful considering how often purchases are made online through Amazon when you live in a dorm room. Overall, I'd say that this card was a very positive experience for me. I've encountered no errors in any form of payments and I get a very good amount of rewards for using the card. I would recommend this card highly to anyone, but especially to college students.

name: Katie
review: I’ve had this card for almost two years now and it’s fantastic. The rates are competitively low and extremely fair. In general, I’m very good at managing my expenses so I don’t need a really high credit line. Chase has, however, offered to extend my line on two different occasions. Their customer service is amazing as well. I have had a few concerns about late payments and penalties and they worked with me in a fair and dignified way. Their follow-up customer service is also great. I hope to be a long-time customer of Chase as they have treated me so very well.

name: Kimberly Hatfield
review: This is one of the best credit cards that I have ever had. Throughout the years I have had many different credit cards but I have had no trouble out of this one. They have one of the best rewards programs for cardhold members that are currently available.  I would highly recommend this card to anyone. It really benefits those who work away from home. I have nothing but good things to say about this card.

name: Kathryn Jordan
review: I signed up for a Chase student checking account right before I started college.  While the account was ideal at first--no overdraft fees, no monthly charges, no minimum balance requirement etc.--I found that it changed with no warning.  Recently I was a victim of account fraud, and was charged a $34 overdraft fee (from Chase, not from the fraudulent transactions) for every transaction made.  This was something that never happened before and that I believed should not have happened.  My personal banker was, however, very prompt, helpful, and adept at getting my money back.One feature that I do love about my Chase checking account is that when I do overdraft, there is not a daily fee.  Many of my friends' banks charge $5 or more a day when the account is overdrawn, but I like that Chase charges a flat rate.  Since an overdrawn account in a nightmare on its own, knowing that extra charges are not accumulating is comforting.

name: Mari
review: I ended up with Chase as my bank while I was in college. They were always extremely helpful with anything that came. During my time with them as my bank I had a checking account with a debit card and a credit card. There were no fees save for overdraft or late payment fees and being able to pay my credit card online from my checking account made my life so much easier. They also facilitated my mother and father’s ability to transfer money to me including helping them set up a weekly direct deposit into my account. With the direct deposit I never had to worry about it not showing up when it was supposed to or holds being placed on my account. All in all I had a very positive experience with Chase. Unfortunately I now live in an area that does not have any Chase branches. I would give anything to have them as my bank once again; all the banks I have used since Chase have not been satisfactory in the least.

name: Amber Harris
review: I began banking at Chase when I was in high school. My father and I were drawn to Chase because of the high school checking account they offered to students. My father thought this was a great way for me to start saving money and learn how to manage my finances. As I grew older, I continued to bank with Chase because I have always been very pleased with the wonderful service I receive every time I walk into any bank. I am not treated like a customer but more like an old friend. I am asked about school, work, or even sports. The associates have a genuine interest in who I am and what is even more impressive is they remember what I tell them about myself and ask for updates when they see me! I am more likely to take their advice and sign up for the programs or accounts they offer me because I trust they have my best interest at heart and will offer something that will most benefit me and my situation instead of offering me something just to meet a sales goal. I feel that I will always be a loyal customer because I know that no matter what Chase bank I go to, I will receive the same wonderful service.

name: brian
review: I have been with Chase for almost a year now.  Before moving to Chase, my previous bank was full of hidden fees.  I even researched and still didn't find them. The customer service at Chase is amazing! I had a few issues with my account recently that were fixed within five minutes after talking with an associate.I would recommend this bank because of the customer service I received, how easy it was to transfer my account, and how fast the issues I had had were resolved. There is no other bank that comes close in comparison! I am 100% satisfied, and will not be leaving this bank.

name: Alan Phillip
review: I have been a Chase customer for the past 7 years and although there have been a few problems here and there, there isn't another bank out there I'd rather be with. The most important thing to me is that that I am able to reach my bank no matter where I am in the country and with Chase, they have branches and ATM's just about anywhere I go.Customer service has always been top notch and I've never had problems dealing with anyone from Chase. I like the fact that I can call at any time and speak with a telephone banker if I have any questions about my account.My one complaint with Chase would be that there have been two different programs they've had that messed with my account. One was that they told me I had signed up for overdraft protection and then when it happened, I was charged a pretty high premium for having it happen. I switched my account to make it so my debit card would not work if I tried to take out more than was in my account, and it still overdrafted once. The only other negative I can think of was a glitch in their online profile updating system that messed up my address and gave me some problems. Other than that, Chase has been an outstanding bank, and if you are looking for a bank that you can access anywhere in the United States, Chase is a great choice.

name: Dan Kil
review: I was previously a Washington Mutual customer that was migrated over to Chase Bank when WaMu went insolvent.  The migration was seamless as we were able to keep the original account number and routing number for my checking account.  I haven't had any complaints about Chase as a customer.  Every time I head to a branch near my apartment in downtown San Diego, I never have to wait more than 5 minutes in line.  The tellers are always friendly and courteous too.  They have never questioned me about my reasoning to get $100 in quarter rolls (we use parking meters for parking during the day and our laundry room is coin operated).  I also really enjoy using the Chase Mobile app for Android -- the instant check deposit feature works well and I have never had a deposit rejected from the application.  The fees for services like wire transfers and money orders are a bit high; and their privacy policy disclosures are a little unclear to understand to the average customer.  But overall, I have been pleased as a customer with Chase Bank.

name: Rupie
review: When I moved to the Bay Area, I needed to find a new bank. I originally chose Chase because they were really close to where I lived in San Francisco and they seemed to be everywhere. Also it was a bank my parents could also access even if they were in another state. From the very beginning the customer service with Chase has been great. Everyone is always very friendly and I don't have to wait very long. I would say there customer service is probably one of the biggest things they have going for them. The only reason I give them 4 stars is because after I graduated from grad school and was looking for work, I didnât have a deposit of $500 every month to avoid the $10 checking fee. Being unemployed and a recent grad, even $10 was too much for me. I even got charged an overdraft fee once because of this charge. Besides that Iâve been satisfied with my checking and savings account with Chase.

name: Martha Pidcock
review: I had an account with Washington Mutual until it was bought by Chase. I have always found the customer service to be high quality, but I have been upset to find abnormally high ATM fees when withdrawing from foreign ATMs, which is especially a problem since I have not been able to find enough ATMs in convenient places, and often they become inaccessible too early in the evening. There was also an unannounced monthly service fee that appeared on my credit card, which I always pay off in full. I want to like this bank, but I expect to look into switching to a credit union.

name: Jaime
review: Chase Bank is an awesome bank to do business with. They have set the bar in their customer service. Every time I call Chase, I speak with the most pleasant representatives that I've ever had the pleasure to encounter. The representatives are always helpful and provide me with detailed explanations whenever I have questions. The phone customer service is not where the pleasantries end. The staff in my local branch also possess those same customer service skills and are always friendly to me when I come in. I love all of the features they have established, especially the banking by smartphone. It's completely revolutionized my banking experience. I appreciate the longs hours they offer and couldn't imagine doing my business anywhere else.

name: Delores
review: Chase is a great bank when it comes to basic banking, lots of locations, easy check deposit via phone etc. As far as customer service and problem resolution I would not recommend them. We had an issue where a company issued a check and the check bounced (the check was over $8000) after they had made the funds fully available and charged us overdraft fees (over $700 worth) after they debited the account. It took them over a week to actually give back two overdraft fees (pointless) and I was stuck in another country (seven months) until we were able to get other things resolved. They said 'We are sorry, but you should have made sure the check was going to clear.' I am in the process of switching banks now.

name: Christopher Sato
review: I have been a long time customer of Chase and have been very pleased throughout the years.  I recently opened up a savings account in addition to my current checking account.  The gentleman I worked with was very professional and informative.  I found the whole process very quick and simple.  The Chase tellers I have worked with have been very friendly and helpful.  I also use the Chase website regularly.  It updates very fast and I am always able to find the information I am looking for.  I also use the Chase app on my iPhone to check my balance when I am not near a computer.  I have a few other accounts with other banks but I will continue to use Chase as my main bank until they give me reason otherwise.

name: Mia McCroskey
review: I'm a Chase customer after a series of mergers in the past that brought me to them from the long gone Chemical Bank. I've not left because their services meet my needs. While I'm speaking of my checking account, I should disclose that I have several Chase accounts. I use Chase's mobile application to manage all of my Chase relationships, which means my need to visit any branch is very limited. The ability to deposit checks with my phone is a huge plus. Chase's banking fees are noticeable. It hurts when I run short in checking and the bank makes an automatic transfer from savings and charges me a fee. But this does serve to make me monitor my checking balance and be proactive about it, which is to my benefit. On the rare occasion when I need to work with someone from Chase I can only report good experiences. I have found the people who take calls to be able to resolve issues, and people in branches to be very pleasant and helpful.

name: Mia McCroskey
review: I'm a Chase customer after a series of mergers in the past that brought me to them from the long gone Chemical Bank. I've not left because their services meet my needs. While I'm speaking of my checking account, I should disclose that I have several Chase accounts. I use Chase's mobile application to manage all of my Chase relationships, which means my need to visit any branch is very limited. The ability to deposit checks with my phone is a huge plus. Chase's banking fees are noticeable. It hurts when I run short in checking and the bank makes an automatic transfer from savings and charges me a fee. But this does serve to make me monitor my checking balance and be proactive about it, which is to my benefit. On the rare occasion when I need to work with someone from Chase I can only report good experiences. I have found the people who take calls to be able to resolve issues, and people in branches to be very pleasant and helpful.

name: Karla Rhodes
review: My husband and I refinanced with Chase Mortgage.  In order to get one percent cash back and a lower rate we need to have a checking account with Chase.  We were a little hesitant about it at first but we decide it would save us some money.  We have been extremely please with Chase and we are considering closing our other accounts at TDBank and just using Chase.  From their on line bill paying to depositing a check at an ATM, Chase make it simple and user friendly.  We have had no problems with their customer service and I love their mobile app.  They are definitely our new bank.

name: MM kim
review: I've been a Chase customer ever since they bought out Washington Mutual.  I was disgruntled at first, but those feelings vanished once I got a taste of their customer service.  First thing, I like that they have so many convenient locations on almost every other block where I live.  That way, there are noticeably less waiting time whenever I walk into a branch.  The tellers are always jovial and courteous, and they also make sure my needs are taken care of.  Second, is their phone customer service.  The automated service always gives me a direct option of talking to a representative, rather than pushing one key after another and wasting a chunk of my time.  The wait is not frustratingly long, and my needs are taken care of every time; there is no waiting.  Lastly, there are scarcely any mistakes on my monthly statements.  Before, I had to call in monthly about some unknown miscellaneous charge, but now, that is pretty nonexistent.  I would recommend Chase highly due to my satisfactory experience with them.

name: Chris
review: I have been a customer of JPMorgan Chase for about 8 years and have found it to be a mixed experience. Chase is always on the cutting edge in terms of technology and adopting new policies. I've used their mobile application since day 1 and have found that it makes paying bills, checking balances, and making transfers easy and convenient. The biggest complaint that I have about Chase is their fee schedule and constant changes. I have been lucky enough to have a free checking account since I became a customer, but I have not found the changes to affect morale and opinion of their customers. I often avoid preforming transactions in the branch because I feel that their tellers or bankers are constantly selling me some product. Overall the experience has been average and I've become more partial to my local credit union as they have started to advance.

name: Chelsea
review: I opened up a Chase checking account almost a year ago. I have not been as pleased with this bank, as I have been with Bank of America. I did not like that there are service charges tacked on to having an account with Chase. I also do not like the inconveniences that come along with this bank, such as locations and ATM access. There are hardly any Chase banks around. The one that I go to has one ATM, but you must get out of your car to access it. I may be a little picky, but I am a huge fan of convenience and did not like that I could not pull up to the ATM in my car. However, I will say the people who work there (bank tellers, customer service, etc.) are extremely nice and helpful with anything. They always greet you when walking in the door and are very polite. Overall, I'm not a huge fan of this bank but I would not rate it the worst either.

name: Eneasha Ackles
review: I am very disappointed in Chase Bank.I opened a "Free" checking account at this bank as they were giving out $100 promotion for opening an account (which, of course comes under requirements). After setting up direct deposit, I thought I was set to enjoy this free checking account and the bonus they promised. Well, it's been about 3 months now and I haven't received the promotional offer. Instead, I did incur a $6 service fee each month that they said I should've received a notice for. I'm upset that this bank decides to charge its customers a service fee, and I'm disgusted to know how GREEDY this bank is for charging such a high fee. We don't need banks like this that helped cause the recession. Find another bank, especially if it's just a checking/savings account. Don't give these guys a chance to hold your money you will be very upset. They act like they are an excellent bank when in fact, they are out for every penny they can get. Don't trust Chase.

name: Jennifer
review: I have been with Chase for over 10 years now and am quite pleased with the experience.  The availability of services on the web is convenient and their live customer service also can't be beat.  As far as credit cards go, we never carry a balance and always pay in full each month so I can't speak to their fees or interest charges, but I have been quite happy with the services and perks provided for being a card holder.   They do seem genuinely interested in offering special values to their cardholders, as I'm always getting email and mail notices about special programs and incentives.  I have been quite happy with my experiences with Chase and would recommend them without hesitation.

name: Will
review: I just recently got accepted into a graduate school and was looking for a private student loan. After looking around, I decided on Chase and called a representative to help me through the process and to answer any questions I had. To my surprise, the wait was not very long and I was soon connected with an agent who was very nice and seemed sincere in making sure I was happy with my loan. I asked him a few questions and during the whole conversation, he never seemed to pushy or eager to make me sign on the dotted line. He assured me that if I was not ready to commit to all the loans and if I needed more time, I could always call back directly to him. At that point, I decided to commit, and he walk me through all the necessary steps to complete the loan. The process was very easy and the agent was there the whole time making sure I didn't miss a thing. It was a very good experience and I am thankful that Chase customer service was able to help me pay for my education loans.

name: John Updegraff
review: I have had my mortgage with Chase for about the past 2 years and they have been the best mortgage servicer I have ever had. Their online services for customer accounts are very easy to navigate and keep my mortgage information balanced from escrow to principal amounts. I love the fact that I have only had to call them a handful of times for any questions over the past 2 years and I have never been made. While I do not have traditional bank services with them, I am glad my mortgage is with them. They are very organized and it shows. I only hope that my loan does not get transferred to another bank.

name: Mischa
review: I've recently switched banks to become a customer at Chase.  It seemed the logical choice because the rest of my family had Chase, as well.  I had closed my account at another bank earlier in the day and was looking for a Chase close to my apartment to go to.  I called one of the branches and the personal banker I spoke to was so polite.  Even though it was close to closing time, he helped me make a last minute appointment then gave me directions to get to his branch, as I didn't know the area.  When I walked into the bank, I was immediately greeted and shown to my banker.  It took no time at all to set up my new accounts.  He asked the general questions, "Would you like a credit card? Checks? These are our benefits |etc.", but when I said thanks but no thanks he backed off.  I have yet to experience that with any other bank!

name: Joel
review: The best thing about Chase is their website. It's very smoothly running and up to date. It's easy to transfer money and pay bills. However, I dislike Chase as a company because of the questionable investments that they've made in the past, and the fact that they've had to be bailed out by the government. I also don't like that you have to pay for things like money orders and cashiers checks. They are also pretty heavy on the spam (paper and email). They don't seem to give back to the community at all. They're mostly about gimmicks like impossible to win giveaways. It's also pretty hard to get a new card or dispute a fraudulent transaction if something happens to your card. You have to jump through a ton of hoops on the phone. There should be a way to resolve things like that online.

name: Nathan
