review: Currently I am using their Rewards card to do most of my purchases. This card overall is pretty good, but it does a monthly shift where you get 5% back on some things, and not others. Everything overall gives you a 1% which can be nice, but some months that 5% is completely useless. 5% back on movie tickets really doesn't add up to much at all seeing how I am not a movie buff. It may be good for someone people but for me it really hasn't come in handy besides the few months where you get 5% back on your gas purchases. Their online service is very well made, but it does go down every once in a while which isn't detrimental.. just annoying. If I were to do it all over again I may not have gone with this type of card simply because it doesn't give me a whole lot of use half of the time.

name: Heather Weaver
review: I joined Chase when I was getting ready to head off to college. Up to that point, I had been a member of a local credit union, and since I was going to a fairly rural school I needed to switch to a bank with a presence in the college town. I decided to switch to Chase - they definitely lured me in with promises of free money, just for signing up for an account with them. They got ALL of that money back and then some with the ridiculous fees they charge for not maintaining a certain balance. As a poor college student, Chase was the worst decision I could have made. Today, I am no longer a Chase member and am not considering switching back. The service was also never great, especially at the branch I went to in my college town. Overall, I don't recommend Chase, at least if you're a broke college student.

name: Arnold becker
review: I have been a long time customer of chase.  I like interacting with the people in their branches, and I have had good experiences on the phone as well.  The Bank inside is well kept and appealing.  When I asked questions about different options I never waited very long & the people working there are very knowledgeable and have always steered me right.  Only negative I can give this bank is that their rates are not very competitive, and are actually pretty high compared to other banks.  On their CDs, money market in specific.  I also purchased a car and had them finance it, they didn't budge much at all on the rates.  However, everything went smoothly & they did full fill my financing needs right away.  Bottom line.  Quality bank, but you will be paying for it.

name: Joy Miller
review: I have had a checking and savings account with Chase Bank for over 11 years now.  I opened a local account with them on one side of the country and thankfully, they were able to stay with me to the other side when I moved.  Anytime I have had a problem with my accounts, they were always very helpful and understanding.  They would go out of their way to explain things to me, get me the help I needed and make sure everything was resolved as soon as possible.  I highly recommend Chase to anyone looking for an honest and helpful bank that can provide an enjoyable, safe, secure and trustworthy banking experience.

name: Kris Bunag
review: So I opened an account with Chase in 2011, right before I was about to go on a 6-month travel.I have completed opening the account 15 minutes before the branch in Hollister, CA called it a day. We rushed the whole process and the lady behind the desk ended up putting in my wrong phone number, wrong e-mail address and wrong home address. Thanks, guys.Only a week later I came to find out that I couldn't do any transactions online because of the mayhem the lady got me into.Chase does not offer international services at all. If you are anywhere in Southeast Asia, where my boyfriend and I unfortunately were, and lost his card, THEY WON'T SEND YOU A REPLACEMENT DEBIT CARD no matter how many overseas calls you make to beg them to transfer you to the senior supervisor. Doesn't matter how much the calls cost, they will just have to put you on hold and transfer you back and forth until you're broke, in a foreign country. Again, thanks, guys.Fast forward to 6 months later, May 2012, I finally received my card, very useful.Bottom line is, in the U.S., Chase's services are pristine. You call, they answer, even though you're talking to a call center representative bases in a country where a Chase branch does not exist, they try their best and take their time to talk you through the process of online banking, even give you tutorials on clearing your cookies cache. For being a traveler, this is not my best choice. For being in the U.S. a few months out of the year, it's perfect.

name: charles
review: I came to Chase after their purchase of bank of New York and I have used several of their services including checking, savings and their freedom credit card.  I have rarely run into a problems that need that have required support but when I did, they were very helpful and easily understood which is very important to me as I have some hearing issues which make any real accent very hard for me to understand.  Last year they finally phased out the checking account had with from BNY and the office representative I meet with in the local branch was really polite and help me setup a new account that was actually better for me in the long run.

name: Braidon Scott
review: I have nothing but good things to say about Chase.  I have had several accounts with Chase for a few years now and everything has been great.  There are branches and ATMs everywhere, so I never have to worry about finding a bank or getting ATM fees.  Their customer service is great both online and in person.  Their website is very convenient and makes it really easy to manage all of your accounts.  I also love their iPhone app which allows me to manage my accounts as well as deposit checks just by taking a picture.  It is great to be able to cash checks without even leaving my house.  I am very satisfied with Chase overall.

name: Adrian Poltorzycki
review: Chase is a really good bank in my opinion. The only thing it lacks is good customer service. I always seem to have trouble contacting Chase about my card and checking if my balance is correct. Hopefully Chase can work on this issue because it really is its only fault. Other than that everything is great. I love this bank and would definitely recommend it to my friends and coworkers. I am a happy customer and I am glad that I chose Chase bank as my de facto bank for my credit card and my credit needs. Thank you Chase for being an awesome banking service!

name: Cerpin Taxt
review: I've personally been with Chase for around five years. During those five years, I have never experienced the banking pains that my current friends go through with their current banks. I have my checking account and credit card associated with Chase Bank as well. Chase has never once tried to scam me out of what little money this college student has. There were no hidden fees or unexpected costs and everything that I needed to know and pay was given to me to my face and not through some fine-print. Their customer service is also top-notch and I would recommend Chase bank to anyone here looking for a new bank.

name: Crista Stephenson
review: I've had this card for a year or two.  It has a good APR and I've been fairly. satisfied with their customer service.  The only issue I've ever had was when I. paid too early for their statement and then the next month I was recorded as not. paying.  I called their customer service and was able to resolve the issue with. only one level of elevation.  Recently I've had a lot of phishing emails. regarding my Chase account but I have informed the company and they said they. are aware and working to make sure their customers are warned and not affected.  Overall I have this card as a low balance card that I use just for emergencies. and to maintain my good credit standing.  I've never had really large problems. and have been successful getting the few problems addressed in a timely manner.

name: Christopher Sato
review: I have been using the Chase Freedom Visa for almost a year now and am very pleased.  The cash back program is definitely the most attractive feature of the card.  Every quarter this card offers a couple of new places where you can get 5% back in addition to the 1% for all purchases.  I believe on the upcoming quarter the card offers 5% back at gas stations and restaurants which is perfect because this makes up a good portion of what I use the card for. The other cards I use do not have a legitimate cash back program so I only use the Chase Freedom card. I believe I also received $200 cash back to just sign up for this card. I will continue to use this card until another comes out with better features but to my knowledge the Chase Freedom card has one of the best cash back programs.

name: Iyad Mansour
review: I used to have a Sony card through Capital One because I enjoyed the rewards aspect of that card. I also played the Wheel of Fortune game at Sony.com, but when I found out that Chase Freedom gives you better rewards plus have bonus categories each month I was immediately sold. The bonus cash back upon signing up for the card was a great added bonus as well. I'm very happy with this card and prefer it over my 2 other cards. I would give it 5 stars because I use it for every purchase, pay it off in full each month, and gain about $50 in cash back each month. The interest rate doesn't bother me one bit because I pay it off in full. The credit limit isn't that big of a deal to me because I don't spend that much without paying it off. With the rewards, the months that they give you 5% cash back for gas and groceries are especially helpful. I also think that Chase's website is easy to use to pay your bill, view your statements, and understand all aspects of the card. Chase customer service has also been great to me on the 4 occasions that I needed to talk to someone over the phone, mostly issues by paypal. I would choose this card over any other card any day of the week!

name: Jasmine Founds
review: Chase was having a promotion in which they were giving out $250 to anyone who created a bank account with them.  As part of the process, they issued me a Chase Freedom card.  I have had a positive experience so far using the Chase Freedom credit card.  In fact, it's the main credit card that I use.  I really like how I get points for every purchase I make, which I can redeem into cash back.  Other companies do this, of course, but I didn't find them as flexible as Chase Freedom's program.  For instance, I can only use Amazon's points for a credit on Amazon.  If I wanted to get cash back with those points, I would have to reach a certain limit of points.  With Chase Freedom, I can redeem those points at any time.  Also, there are various promotions.  Certain times, Chase offers double points for purchases at restaurants or gas.Besides the generous points system, I found the service to be excellent.  One time I splurged and treated myself to an extravagant gift.  Chase immediately called me because there was an unusual activity on my account.  Even though it was legitimate, I appreciated the security measures they have in place to protect my account.The web site is also very easy to use and allows you to monitor your account activity.  Overall, I rate Chase Freedom very highly and would recommend it to other people.

name: Tasha Stackhouse
review: Chase is a perfect of a bank that a financial institution can be. I've been with Chase for many years. I have been a loyal customer as far back as the days of Washington Mutual. The one thing that I most admire about Chase is that it stays ahead of the times with technology. Chase knows how to quickly adapt with the wants and needs of its customers. I can't explain the amount of time and effort I have saved just by depositing my check by using the Chase iPhone app. These are the small things that makes Chase a one of a kind bank.

name: Mohammad Kazim
review: I can't even imagine the time where I did not have this credit card. I used to have another one before this but it did not have any cash backs. This credit card is very useful because it has no fees and I always get points back whenever I buy something. The best part is that every quarter there are things where I receive extra points for something. I really enjoy it when it is for gas or grocery since those are the things I need the most. I end up racking extra points throughout that quarter. I have been saving all those points and I will cash them in soon to get myself a gift or pay for a vacation. The card is accepted everywhere and it hasn't failed me yet. I am a college student so I use this for everything I buy. I have pretty much stopped using cash so I can get as many points as possible.

name: Garrik Jackson
review: I've had a Chase Freedom Visa for about 8 months and it has been fantastic.  I had excellent credit to start with, so they gave me everything I asked for.  They also gave me a deal where I Spent $500 dollar in the first six months I would get 25,000 in rewards points which they were prompt about paying out.  They also gave me 12 months no interest on my balances which is nice if I want to pay purchases down over time even though I usually don't.  They remind me every time the rewards categories are about to change and allow me to change it with one click in my e-mail.  They allow me to use my points towards my credit card statement, which is my favorite feature.  I put all my purchases on my Chase Freedom Visa each month and pay it off it essentially pays me back.  They also allow me to handle 99% percent of my issues on the computer or mobile phone, so I rarely have any issues.  This is by far and away my favorite credit card that I've owned.

name: Chris Calimlim
review: I recently applied for the southwest rewards card and I got a bonus of 50,000 points after my first statement.  I love southwest airlines and I love that I get points for spending money.  It is really convenient that I get points for all my purchases.  The interest rate is kind of high for my taste, but just as long as I pay off my bill every time it doesn't bother me too much.  I use this card for everything; gas, groceries, and whatever else I need.  I've been able to book two round trip flights so fare with my sign up bonus and I still have some points left over!

name: Nikki Wheeler
review: I have had and have been using this card for a little over one year now. I am a frequent shopper of Amazon.com, so this card really does benefit me. You receive 3 points back on all your purchases on Amazon, but only 1-2 points back on other purchases. This card would not be the best choice if you want to rack up the most rewards on all your purchases, because there are other cards out there that offer better rewards accumulations. However, I like it because I shop on Amazon almost everyday, so I get the full 3%. I also like that there is no minimum required to use your reward. unlike other cards that make you wait till you hit the $25 mark, I could literally use a.50 cent credit towards an Amazon purchase if I wanted to. I also like that this card comes issued through Chase bank.

name: Sachin Dhar
review: I've had this card for about a year now and I see no reason to get another one. I am a college student, and this card has a high enough limit that I can buy everything I need, without the risk of me having to panic if I lose it. I do not have any debt or trouble paying my bill, so my use of it keeps it simple, and I don't have to worry about managing multiple accounts. Chase also has superior customer service, so if I lose my card or it is stolen I am sure that my money will still be safe. Occasionally I have been declined at gas stations far away from my home city, probably because the anti-fraud can be a little too sensitive some times, but overall this is a great card for someone who wants the basic CC setup.

name: Nikema Prophet
review: I have had the Chase Freedom card for over a year and my credit limit was increased once.  This is a great card to use if you are able to keep a low credit balance.  Personally, my interest rate is high and my card is nearly maxed so my monthly minimum payment just barely covers my interest.  I don't charge on this card anymore since I am struggling to make the minium payment. However, the rewards system is great if you are able to manage your balance well.  It's very easy to redeem.  I like that you can convert your points to cash or statement credits so there's no worry about accumulating useless points.

name: Robin Horn-Hopper
review: I have had this card for a few years now. Intrest rates are reasonable, and customer service is good.I like the fraud alert feature that I added. I recently had a problem with fraudulent charges being made on my card. I called chase and they looked into the matter very quickly. The charges were reversed and they warned the company to stop adding the charge automatically to my account. They followed up by email and kept me informed of the situation. They also let me know if any card applications have been filed. I like that I can speak to a real person quite quickly when I call.

name: Morgan McLachlen
review: With the amount of money I spend on Amazon, I figured I'd be stupid not to get this card. So, I signed up about five months ago. The approval process was fast and easy and I received my card in the the mail within a week. I've had other rewards credit cards before, but it was alway much more of a struggle for me to decide which questionable items I should use my points toward. It's much easier now that I have the Amazon card because I can use my points on the same great website I find myself ordering multiple things a month from. Overall, I'm pretty satisfied with my Amazon.com Chase card. The APR is high and my limit is currently pretty low (1,900), but credit cards are somewhat of a necessary evil these days and I'd have to say this card is one of the better ones.

name: Teodora Shearing
review: I've had this card for 3-4 years and am incredibly satisfied with it. It provides points based on how much you purchase on Amazon.com and is with a good company. Amazon.com service is always amazing and their credit card meets the bill. I don't use it for non-Amazon purchases however, only for things I purchase on Amazon. Over the course of a few years I've gotten over 150 in rewards cards from Amazon.com. Although the reward is just gift card that's redeemable on only Amazon, it's super easy to find something you need to buy. The one time I needed to contact customer support about a purchase that didn't give me points, they were super prompt in responding to me and fixing my problem politely.

name: Mike Shingle
review: I used to have a Sony card through Capital One because I enjoyed the rewards aspect of that card. I also played the Wheel of Fortune game at Sony.com, but when I found out that Chase Freedom gives you better rewards plus have bonus categories each month I was immediately sold. The bonus cash back upon signing up for the card was a great added bonus as well. I'm very happy with this card and prefer it over my 2 other cards. I would give it 5 stars because I use it for every purchase, pay it off in full each month, and gain about $50 in cash back each month. The interest rate doesn't bother me one bit because I pay it off in full. The credit limit isn't that big of a deal to me because I don't spend that much without paying it off. With the rewards, the months that they give you 5% cash back for gas and groceries are especially helpful. I also think that Chase's website is easy to use to pay your bill, view your statements, and understand all aspects of the card. Chase customer service has also been great to me on the 2 occasions that I needed to talk to someone over the phone. I would choose this card over any other card any day of the week!

name: Nessa Selez
review: I have the Marriott Rewards card and have used it in the past with no problems. The customer service is great and the rewards system is well thought out and easy to understand, but honestly, I've found there are a few other rewards cards out there that are easier to use and provide a much greater field of choices when it comes to rewards. If you are loyal to Marriott and travel quite a bit, this card could be for you. However, in my own experience, I much prefer having options on where to stay, where I get my rewards  and how I receive rewards. I only carry a few credit cards, and I'm planning on canceling this one in favor of one that offers broader options. As far as the card itself, again, I've had no problems and no complaints with billing or customer service.

name: Jenny Johnson
review: I have had this card for about 6 years. It used to be great compared to other rewards cards that I could have. However, now I think that there are cards that will earn you more in the long run. This card is decent if you are a regular Amazon.com shopper, but otherwise you can earn more cash back with other cards. You earn 3 points per dollar on Amazon.com purchases, 2 points at Restaurants and Gas Stations and 1 point everywhere else. The points can be redeemed as low as 2,500 for a $25 Amazon.com gift certificate. I believe you can also use the points on Amazon.com as they accumulate. They do have decent customer service (through Chase) and responded quickly and with lots of details when I had a question about an interest rate charge. There is no yearly fee to have it, which is good compared to some other rewards cards. I would give it 4 out of 5 stars, only because it's rewards program could be better.

name: Rafat Yazdani
review: The Chase Freedom card has definitely been my favorite card to use for a variety of reasons. The low interest rate is one great quality, with 0% for the first 15 months and then a relatively low 12.99% after that. Earn $100 Bonus Cash Back after you make $500 in purchases in your first 3 months. The cash back aspect is also very wonderful, as you can receive 5% cash back on up to to $1500 spent at gas stations and restaurants...and those are the two places I always make my expenses! And otherwise there is a 1% cash back on all other purchases! The best part of this is definitely the rewards aspect of it, so I definitely would not delay in getting this card.

name: Kenyetta Broadwater
review: This card is my first credit card and I've had it for a little over a year and I have not had any problems with it.  I pay it off every month and my limit has increased every few months.  I have however had a lot of trouble with finding out when I receive points and how many I get from each purchase, so I’ve just let them accumulate till I feel like there’s enough to do something with.  The one time I was late in paying it off I was able to call them and have the overdue charge removed the next day which surprised me as since I use chase for banking and checking I have had problems with their support people before.

name: Kensie Thomas
review: This card is awesome! First of all, it's got a cute design, which sounds silly but I like using it! We go to Disney World every summer, and the discounts this card offers make our trip even more memorable and enjoyable! I especially enjoy the points that we earn towards our annual vacations, because who doesn't like saving money? My parents have this card also and they love using it even though they do not go on vacations very often. They like that they have the option to use the card aywhere without the ridiculous amount of fees that come along with other major credit cards. I have reccomended this card to all my friends, especially the ones that have kids who enjoy spending time with Mickey Mouse but do not want to spend an arm and a leg to do so!

name: Terra Smiles
review: The Chase Freedom® Visa is most likely to be one of the few credit cards that without of a doubt lives up to its name. It is the most convenient credit card that I have ever used. The interest rate is very acceptable for me and the rewards encourages me to use it as much as possible. The fact that the Freedom Card belongs to Chase makes it all the better. The service is superior than any other that I have ever encountered. I will do my best to always stick with the Chase Freedom Credit Card. There is nothing better.

name: Donna Huddleston
review: My Marriott Rewards Visa is the card I use most.  The credit terms and payment requirement are like any other card.  However, this card includes no cost travel insurance and car rental insurance.   If a trip is cancelled or delayed the travel insurance reimburses me for expenses char6ed to the card.  When I rent a car I waive insurance from the rental company.  The rental insurance Marriott provides will cover the car if it is damaged.    I have used the travel insurance benefits on two occasions.  Each time the credit card company responded quickly and resolved the problem to my satisfaction.

name: Susan Emory
review: This was the first credit cards I ever had after my divorce, and I must say how pleased and rewarding it has been. There is the first card I ever had in my own name, and although there is a $4.95 monthly fee, that is more than worth it to me for the peace-of-mind I have. No one besides myself knows it is a prepaid, and I never have to worry about whether I have the funds available for a purchase. I just have my paycheck loaded onto it, and I'm good to go. I have talked with customer service twice since I have had the card, and they have always been very professional and helpful. There was one time when my balance did not match up with what my deposit had been, and they were able to resolve the issue right away (it was an error at my employer's, not with Chase). An additional benefit is that there are so many Chase ATM's around my area, I never had to worry about paying a fee at an ATM. I couldn't say that with my other bank, who seemed to be making money off fees hand-over-fist. I honestly can say that Chase Liquid Prepaid Card is my lifeline, and I'm so glad that I have a card with such a good name in banking.

name: Eve Apgar
review: I originally signed up for the Chase Amazon card because I liked the reward points and signup bonus. I am generally an avid Amazon user so the points are worth it to me. However, other cards do have much better reward systems for groceries and other things that I spend a lot of money on and I wish the Chase Amazon card offered more. Although it has decent interest rates and no yearly fee, I have come across at least 2 better cards that would return much more to me in the long run. There is a pretty high chance I will be canceling this card for one with better rewards.

name: Andrew Lane
review: I only have one credit card currently, and this is it. I had a visa from the age of 18-22, paid it off this past year and switched over to chase. The interest rates are off the chains, and I was approved with a very reasonable limit right when I first applied (and my credit score is very humble, nothing too high, I am fresh out of school and up to my eyeballs in student loans). Plus the rewards that come along with it are pretty awesome too. It pretty much suits all of my bachelor needs. I have made a point to only use it when I really need to, and so far I love this card!

name: Peaches WIRE
review: I got this card to be my main card. The signing bonus was really good as I basically got it with just paying my utilities and insurance. The 5% cash back is a nice thing. I waited a week to get something on amazon just because of it. The gas reward for 5% cash back was nice as that is a guaranteed buy for me. Since I use my card for everything, the online transaction history is nice for my records and saving all those receipts are not necessary any more. The online payment is very easy and the email reminders are great. I pay my card in full every month but the 0% intro is a nice safety net. I bet if I called up I could get my interest rate lowered after some time using the card after the intro time period is up. Unlike my last card, they do not charge me for online a annual fee nor give me useless rewards points. Everything is perfect with this card and I am completely happy with it.

name: Fidelia Crace
review: This is a nice card. I've had it for over a year now. Reasonably low interest rates are why I chose it along with zero annual fee. I regret that it has no reward system, but I'm sure I save at least as much in interest and annual fees. It's probably not the lowest rate available, but it's low enough. It's got the somewhat convenient payment plan setup which I haven't used extensively. This does look handy though in the event that I get myself into a reasonable amount of debt. I've never gone over my Slate's limit (not even close, actually), but I've used it quite a bit for purchases like appliances and in situations where I didn't have cash. Chase's website is pretty easy to use and makes checking my balance easy. Overall, I think this card does what is supposed to : provides me with an easy way to spend money when I don't have it with me. I'm not super-impressed, but it's alright and suits my needs.

name: Randell Murphree
review: I have been using my chase freedom credit card as my main credit card for about the last two years.  There are many things that make this card perfect for me.  The first thing is the credit limit.  It is the highest limit among the 3 credit cards I have.  I like the flexibility this offers me.  It allows me to keep my credit utilization ratio lower which improves my credit.  The rewards have been an added bonus.  I have used them around Christmas to order gift cards that we gave as presents.  Because of the special rewards that are offered on some everyday purchase, I have managed to build up a lot more points than I expected.   The interest rate on this card is fair and the customer service that Chase offers is excellent.  I like the ability to do everything I need with this credit card online and would recommend it to anyone.

name: Ryan Muir
review: This credit card is just amazing. I have had multiple credit cards in the past few years and I am done using them all. The rewards that I get with my Chase Sapphire are the best rewards I've ever seen from a credit card. Plus, when I first signed up, I got 40000 points which really came in handy. I ended up using that money towards a vacation for my girlfriend and I. There has been a few times I haven't had the money to pay of my debt. Their late fees are pretty low though. That really helped me out a lot to. I also travel a decent amount, and get a great discount on most of the hotels I go to. Great overall experience with them. Thank you.

name: lindsay
review: I have been a Chase customer for over 6 years. I have never had any problems with them. Their customer service is wonderful, especially the fact that you can call them anytime of the day to report a lost card or other issue. I have visited several different Chase branches all over town and other places as well, and the representatives in each branch are always kind and courteous. The only thing about Chase that I have been unhappy with is the fact that they got rid of their debit card rewards program! I enjoyed getting rewards for my debit card purchases. But other than that, my experience with Chase Bank has been wonderful.

name: Lana Lagoon
review: WARNING!  NEVER EVER get hooked up wiwth this awful card!   There are so many teeny rules that come up every time you want to get your rebate.   As often as you may call to make sure you've done everything right...they will tell you it's okay.  Then, you'll get your statement...and the rebate won't be applied...because you didn't buy any Hess gas that month.   Or some other new rule. Doesn't matter if you spent a million bucks...no little $25 rebate unless you bought a minimum $5 of gas.  But, nobody tells you that UNTIL...it's too late.  They get ya hanging on month after month.  The reps don't seem to know the rules.  Took mine 10 minutes (yep, I was on hold)...to find out why there was this error on my statement...and finally comes back with the reason that my purchases didn't include one at a Hess station.  If it takes Chase reps so long to figure it out...how are we supposed to know.  Look at the offer above...tricky!  Forget...don't even bother trying to figure this out...just DON"T GET THIS LOUSY, AWFUL CARD.   There are so many better ones out there.   Oh...I read that BP CHASE card is the #1 in the TOP TEN WORST CARDS EVER!   boo hiss!  It's like quicksand.  The more you struggle with getting out...you get the picture.  STAY AWAY! and have a great day!  :)

name: Lana Lagoon
review: Hess...just read about BP on the Worst Credit Cards Top Ten List.  I think it's gotta be the same...both Chase products.  In Chase's defense, however, they have some dynamite ones:  Sapphire, for instance.

name: Jackie
review: I was told by a family member about the great savings accounts that Chase Bank offers. I already had accounts with numerous other banks due to moving a lot, but decided to look into Chase Bank. They were offering a free checking account at the time with no minimum balance. You had to open the account with $20 but could withdraw it instantly if you needed to. I set up a small automatic deposit for each month. A year later, their terms changed and they started requiring a minimum balance for the account type that I had. I was lucky and met this minimum balance and was able to avoid fees. If you are serious about saving money and not touching the account, this is a great bank to go with.

name: Peggy
review: We have been with Chase for several years now, living in the Northwest we were part of the Chase banks when they were still Washington Mutual.  We were a little skeptical to keep our accounts with them once they bought our old bank but we are happy that we did.  Our accounts have been well managed and the customer service has always been helpful.  Sometimes our wait can be about 5 minutes in the bank on a busy day, but what bank isn't.  We haven't experienced any 'mistakes' on our account and they always seem to have employees that are knowledgeable.

name: farhad sanati
review: I have been with Chase for about 4 years and I could not be happier. I have my checking account and also my credit cards through Chase and their service is amazing. There are many options available for credit cards and they mostly offer points as well. The points can be used for almost anything. The banks are available almost everywhere and the clerks are very helpful. I had a problem once with my online account and I went to a local location to fix the problem. There were two people working on my problem for over an hour and they took care of everything and all I had to do was drink my coffee. I could not be happier, I really love Chase and their customer service.

name: Chanel
review: I've had a checking account and a saving account with Chase since I moved to this city about two years ago. Everyone I've worked with has been very friendly and helpful. No surprise fees, no underhanded schemes to cheat me out of the little money I have. When I went to Europe, I was concerned about getting the new currency and having access to my account overseas. It was really easy to do; the guy I talked to was very helpful. I went in at the last minute and he made it so I could access my account and told me about the fees of using ATMs overseas. I recommend Chase highly.

name: Matt
review: I opened up a checking (and savings) account with my local Chase branch about five years ago. Since day one, I have always had a great experience with my local Chase branch, as well as a few Chase branches that I have visited in other counties. When I lived abroad for a few months, I contacted my Chase bank a few times and was always met with very polite and helpful representatives who aided me in a very timely fashion. The overdraft protection and bonus rewards points on my card transactions, from this checking account, seem to never cause problems. Overall, I am very pleased with both the local representatives and the âhigher-upsâ with whom I have also spoken.

name: Robin Seipel
review: I have been using Chase for my checking and savings accounts for 2 years now and found their customer service to be excellent so far.  The Chase online banking website is also easy to use.  I use it to pay bills, check my balance everyday, and transfer money between accounts.  I love that it also links to Quicken on my home computer and downloads all of my transactions automatically.  The Chase Person to Person payment system that is available online is also fast and easy to use - it's a good alternative if you don't have a Paypal account.  Anytime we have had to go into our local Chase branch we were helped in a very short time-frame and our problems were always resolved to our satisfaction.

name: ryan Boser
review: I have always had a good experience with Chase Checking.I mostly use their electronic kiosks, which are incredible. The user interface is very intuitive and responsive, the choices are clear. I mainly use the kiosk during peak hours, when the bank is very busy. During these times the kiosk is literally an extension of the bank which speeds up service. I can deposit checks (even getting a printed photographic copy for confirmation), withdraw funds, and even make and plan transfers between my separate accounts.As an additional experience with Chase, two years ago some unknown party gained access to my account and withdrew a large amount from my account. Thanks to Chase's automatic text messaging service I was immediately notified and able to open a new account and get my money back the very next day. It was a great ending to a rather frightening situation.

name: Hynson
review: I've been banking with Chase ever since it was Bank One. I started my first checking account the day I went off to college, and I still have it to this day, along with a car loan, credit card, and multiple savings accounts. I can honestly say that I couldn't be more pleased with the service, accessibility, and perks of banking with Chase. The online features are top notch, and the customer service is unparalleled. Add all of that to the fact that there is a physical location pretty much anywhere that I am likely to need one, and you'll find me without complaint. My only reservation about dealing with a larger bank like this is that I tend to lose the personal and hometown connections that I might experience with a local bank, but the benefits greatly shadow this one flaw.  Unless something dramatic were to take place, I can see myself banking with Chase for years to come.

name: Garrett Lew
review: I have the basic checking account from Chase, as I had to switch when Citi starting applying fees on my account there.  I've actually really enjoyed banking with Chase, as they have had good ATM's without the use of deposit envelopes for much longer than other banks.  They also have an Android app that allows me to deposit checks via my phone's camera, which is quite useful if you're not near an ATM or on vacation.  Their online account management site doesn't seem as full featured as Citi, but it provides all the information you really need.  Haven't tried the bill pay yet, but that is definitely available.  Their tellers are very nice when going into branches, and it seems like they enjoy their job.  Most of the branches that I've been to also have ATM's on the inside of the doors, and allow you to use your debit card as a key to gain access to the lobby after-hours.  This is a really big plus because who knows what shady people are around when you're making a deposit or getting cash at 2am.  Or, if it is raining outside or cold, being inside can definitely be nice while doing transactions.

name: Megan Williams
review: I started banking with Chase a few years ago when I moved to a new city and my previous bank wasnât really available. I love that because Iâm still in school finishing out my bachelorâs degree, I was able to open the student checking account which means as long as I have a direct deposit I donât have to pay a monthly service fee. Even without the direct deposit, their monthly service is fee is about two dollars cheaper than my previous bank! From the moment I opened the account, I have felt pretty well taken care of. My car was broken into at one point and my checkbook was stolen; when I came in to talk to someone about it I was immediately led over to a desk and they fixed everything up and took away my worries about what could happen. Most of the time I just use the ATM but every time I have gone in, they have been wonderful to me. I would definitely recommend this bank especially if you are a student.

name: Tiffany Kilby
review: I have been using Chase Bank for my Truck loan for about a year now. I have had no problems whatsoever with them. Their customer service is terrific. I called a few months ago to change my payment date and it only took about 5 minutes to change. They are very friendly and knowledgeable. They also have online banking which is nice so that I can make my payment on their website each month. Then I can see my new balance instantly and am able to look at exactly what I am paying for. I am so glad that I chose Chase Bank to service my loan. I wouldnâ€™t want anyone else. They are great!!

name: Ryan Barnett
review: I have been banking with Chase for about 2 years now and I feel that it is time to switch to a credit union. Their monthly fees for checking are quote high and require a large balance at all times otherwise you'll get charged even more per month. I had opened my checking account while they were running a promotion for $100 but after 6 months, I no longer qualified due to having too low of an account balance. The terms of the promotion were not clear when I first joined this bank. Their customer service is helpful and friendly and they have many ATM and branch locations within my city. I also find their online banking easy to use and have had no issue with deposits being made available in a timely manner. Overall, they are just your cookie cutter bank.

name: Matt Brown
review: Chase acquired our mortgage about three years ago and I couldn't be happier. An unfortunate side effect of this is that the mortgage insurance got "lost" in the shuffle which required me to contact Chase's customer support to get things straightened out. It only took two calls to Chase customer support to resolve my issue. The best thing about having my mortgage with Chase is their online banking portal. I no longer have to worry about writing checks and making sure they get put into the outgoing mail. I can setup recurring monthly mortgage payment or use their one-time bill pay. I'm very satisfied with Chase and would recommend them to friends and family for mortgage services.

name: Joe Satriani
review: I've been a member of Chase Bank for six years, and I have to say that their service is exceptional. I have not had a single bad experience at any of the branches that I visited. Any issues regarding errors or strange banking fees were quickly resolved. Chase bank sometimes runs promotion such as receiving $100 after five months, which was actually the reason I signed up for a checking account in the first place. Chase's fraud protection is also exceptional. I made a purchase at GreenManGaming last month, which I did not realize was a store located in England. I promptly received a text and a mailed letter regarding a strange purchase outside of the country. It was very easy to confirm this purchase, and it's nice to know that Chase Bank is always looking after you. Overall, I highly recommend Chase Bank for their quality of service.

name: Aaron
review: During my first year of school at the Ohio State University I began my experience with Chase. I opened a checking account and since then I have had nothing but wonderful experiences there.The most important aspect to me when it comes to banks is customer service, and Chase Bank has been wonderful for me in that regard. Just recently, I forgot my PIN number for my ATM account. I walked in and almost immediately I had someone assist me in making a new PIN number. This is the kind of thing that I value as a customer.If you are thinking about opening a checking account or starting a relationship with a bank, I highly recommend Chase. They have served me well and I'm sure they'll serve you well too.

name: Jessi Gibson
review: Every time I have gone into the bank, I was always greeted warmly as though I was a friend. They served me promptly, and if I had to wait, they always thank me for my patience. I've always been happy with their customer service, and I know that I will be a customer of theirs for a long time. I have twice had an issue with someone fraudulently using my debit card and making large withdrawals and also large purchases. On each occasion, the issue was resolved promptly and without any problems. My money was returned to my account within a day or so, and they always followed up with me to see if everything was OK.

name: Sam
review: I have been a Chase customer for over 10 years and I have learned recently that customers are not always right.  I always deposit my checks at the Bank ATM machine because of their quick service and digital prints of the checks that I thought were great.  On my usual routine, I went in my local Chase bank and was in the process of depositing my check when it jammed and spit out a receipt that gave me an error code.  Now the jamming was not the problem, but when I went and talked to a teller he told me that they had to give corporate a call.  After an hour went by, they told me that everything should be okay and my money should be their in good faith and until they check with the ATM machine.  After several months have gone by and thinking that the problem was resolved, I see a 1820.00 was deducted from my account.  Not initially knowing what was wrong, I called Chase and they told me that they never found a check and that they had the right to reverse any deposit. Now at this point I was furious because I had lost 1820.00 from my account and they never told me about the 3 months period in which they could reverse it.  After complaining and giving them evidence, from paper slips and going back to the bank, they finally reverse after threatening them with a lawsuit.  I finally learned to never trust ATM machines, but to know that Chase does not have your interest, but to maintain a high profit margin.

name: Blake
review: I have been a member of Chase Checking for over two years now as a student and I have had zero problems thus far. I signed up in person and had and agent walk me through my new account. My agent also has called me promptly whenever I make a large transaction from my debit card to make sure that it was indeed me that did it(which I really appreciate!) I even got free checks which was really nice! I also love that with mobile banking from my iphone that I never have to go to a physical branch in order to deposit my checks.  I also love that chase ATMS are on my campus so I can easily make a transaction with no problem at all.

name: Jereme
review: I've been a Chase member for about 7 years now.  Honestly, I've never had any negative experience with them that wasn't my own fault (overdraft fees & an abused credit card I've been trying to pay off for years).  Whenever I've had to contact Chase customer service, they've been friendly and helpful in resolving my problem.Their iPhone app for depositing checks has proved to be quite useful, and has come in handy especially  for me, since I recently moved from Chicago to Nashville, where no Chase banks currently exist.  My experience with Chase has been so positive that I remain a customer even when I have no access to a local branch.My only small complaint would be their website account management and Blueprint...it could be a little more flexible and intuitive, but they seem to be working on it.

name: Jeff
review: I have been working Chase Bank for over 30 years.  I really enjoy the customer service that they provide when it comes to managing my checking account.  I would recommend Chase Bank checking services to anyone that wants reliability and competency from their bank.  The different types of checks that you can order from Chase Bank are extensive and is aimed to please every demand.  Also, the customer service at Chase Bank in dealing with errors is superb.  They will bend over backwards to help you resolve the issue that you are having with your checking account.  During the 30 years I have been banking with Chase, I have had no security violations or errors in my account.  Chase also offers an overdraft protection that is affordable to secure your shopping experience.

name: Frank Papageorgio
review: I've been a member of Chase Checking for almost a year now.  It's been really great so far!  I went down to my local bank branch and signed up in person, I was up and running the very same day.  They gave me $150 for singing up for a new account, and my wife $150 for her account as well.  The checking is absolutely free as long as one of us has a direct deposit associated with our account, which is not an issue at all.  We also get 100% free checks!  This is great, as our last bank made us pay for them, and then we had to keep paying for them when we got married and her name changed, and again when we moved.The thing I love most about Chase is their mobile banking.  I have an app on my iPhone which lets me cash my checks without going to a physical branch, and it shows up in my account within an hour!  I honestly feel like I'm living in the future.  I get so many checks in the mail for $2 or $3 for things I do online, so the time this has saved me has been amazing!  The website interface is really slick and easy to use too, I never have an issue finding what tool I need to pay a bill or make a transaction.ATMs are also plentiful with Chase.  In the Chicago-land area there are branches everywhere, and I have never had to pay a fee to use another ATM because I couldn't find one from Chase.

name: Robert Cooper
review: I have been with Chase ever since they ate up Washington Mutual up here in the Northwest.  There have been good times and bad times with them so far.  I have had my Debit Card cancelled on me three times while traveling due to me not informing them prior to traveling.  I understand that it was my fault for not informing prior to traveling but it took them 18 days to figure out I was using my card in Europe and not in Washington state before I received a declined card the first time.  I thought over 2 weeks was a long time for them to not act on what they believed were fraudulent charges.  But that was almost 3 years ago and I believe they have streamlined that now.  Last time I left the state and drove 30 hours straight I got a call midway through Colorado asking me about my last charges.As for any other issues, they are extremely quick to respond.  It is very easy to call up and get customer support, billing info, balance, etc.  And they are quite knowledgeable, at least up here, at the walk-in area and quick to help.  Although not a fan of the change to cashier's checks costing money now, preferred when they were free to make.  I had to actually order checks after that point.

name: Shannon Johnson
review: I have Chase bank for my car loan and I am very satisfied with them. There customer service is amazing and have never had a problem with them at all. I was late one time and they gave me a wave for that. They understood my problem and were very helpful. The wait time on the phone was not very long when calling customer service and when they came to the line I was greeted by a friendly voice. Chase is very much a part of my life. Without their care and understanding it is possible I would not be where I am today.

name: J Farland
review: You can't find a better bank for customer service, ease of use, and overall performance.  Chase is on the cutting edge of technology, allowing you to deposit checks via iPhone apps and ATM's.  This is a huge convenience factor for me as I have little time to spend in line.  Setting up for direct deposit and account verifications couldn't be simpler.  There is an ATM or branch always in view so I don't have to drive forever to conduct my banking. I highly recommend this bank. I switched and am so happy I did! When I did switch, Chase rewarded me with a small monetary incentive.  They gave me money to put my money in their bank.  They truly understand the average consumer.

name: Laura Veni
review: What I love about Chase bank is how easy and quickly they adapt technology and use it to make banking easier. Their ATMs are very advanced and let you deposit both checks and cash without having to fill out any forms, which really saves time. I use this feature a lot and it is always accurate. They also have a wonderful smartphone app that lets you deposits checks from your phone. This feature is extremely useful and has saved me many trips to the bank. It is also easy to do a lot of basic banking from this app, from paying bills to account transfers. I've only had to deal with their customer service department two times, but in both instances my concerns were addressed and the problem was solved. I'd highly recommend Chase bank checking to anyone looking to open a new checking account.

name: Wendolyn Schossow
review: I am not one to accrue a lot of credit- I have honestly been somewhat afraid of getting credit cards in the past. However, necessity demanded that I get a credit card, and I am very pleased with my experience with this one. Customer service has been exceedingly helpful (I had a lot of questions about how, exactly, interest rates work, how have a credit care would effect my credit score, and purchase limits). I have never had any embarrassing issues with payment being denied at the register (nothing is worse!). The card is nice-looking, to boot! I know it seems silly, but I think I would be too embarrassed to pull out one of those cards plastered with american flags and hand it to a cashier.

name: Ahmed Alsayed
review: I think it is a very good card. it carries the least possible risk and the least possible prices for services. I highly recommend this card because it is very benificial and one of the most succesful card from one of the most succesful banks. it also gives you a very much points for what you spend. so I recommend it very much. Also I think that it is great for small business , being available in many countries makes it of very high value. I think it is good if you want my opinion.

name: Won Lee
review: if you are a small business owner, i suggest you also take a look at chase ink bold.   awesome card.

name: Yurel Cooke
review: I signed up for the United Mileage Plus Explorer Credit Card a few years ago after I got a job that required lots of traveling. I thought that this would  be a great card to have to rack up on much needed miles with all of my traveling. I'n less than two years, I've earn about three plane tickets. The interest rate for this card is very low and I'm overall extremely satisfied with my credit card. This card is also very useful when wanting to earn other travel related rewards like hotels and car rentals. There are a lot of affiliate companies that allows you to earn points on your card with them.

name: Jacob Kerstan
review: This is my first credit card and I have loved it!  I only really use it to build credit, but I like the fact I am receiving "rewards" for using it too.  Instead of using my checking debit card, I use this for my purchases and add up the rewards.  Plus when I signed up, Chase gave me $100! What's better than that!  You do definitely have to watch when the bill comes that you pay promptly because if you don't the rates are horrible.  But then again, what credit card company will give a person "reasonable" rate? (Isn't that how they make most of their money anyhow?).  Overall I'm impressed and don't regret it one bit!

name: Lynn Ghiglieri
review: I’ve had the Amazon credit card for going onto 3 years now and I am completely satisfied with it.  The application process was very easy and I got a reply quickly.  I originally signed up for the card to cover dental expenses for my children. After paying off the balance through their easy online bill payment service, I have used it regularly for my online purchases.  The interest rate is reasonable and the reward points are a nice bonus.  They just accumlute and sometimes just that little amount helps take care the tax or shipping on some of my online purchases.  I give this card a definite thumbs up for its easy application process and convenient online account maintenance features.  I would highly  recommend this card to anyone looking to establish credit or rebuild their credit.

name: Enid Cogswell
review: I use my SW card for everything; gas, groceries, utilities and everything in between. I earn over 8,000 to 10,000 points a month by doing this. I have earned over 4 round trip flights this way in the last year alone. The points are quickly added to my SW account and booking is a snap. The interest rate is low, but I pay it off each month so I have yet to pay any. The yearly fee is 69.00. It is worth it, based on the savings I get  on flights! A great card to carry!

name: Jared Dimond
review: I have owned a rapid rewards card for a few years and I can say that I am very pleased with it so far.  My parents pay for its use and I have a limit on what I can spend.  The biggest benefit I find is that I can use it out in LA and my parents use the rapid rewards points to come and visit me.  Being a Visa card is also a huge plus in my opinion.  Almost anywhere I go accepts visa, and so I never have an issue when I need to put something on my card.  With my mom, dad, sister, brother and I all using rapid rewards cards, the reward points just pile up and allows for my family to take trips that keep us all as close as we were when we all lived under one house.

name: Rj Wong
review: I was originally offered Chase Freedom last year. I accepted because of the 0% APR intro for 12 months and because of the cash back offer that the card has. After using it for a year I have had no complaints about the card. When I asked for my credit limit to be increased after 6 months, I was approved for another thousand. Now I use my Chase Freedom for almost every transaction because of the cash back. It's a great feeling getting a $100 check every month or so just for using the card. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good rewards card. Beware of the high APR that the card has however so make sure you are able to pay off the balance.

name: Ellie Rampy
review: The approval process is quite simple, and the Amazon credit is an added bonus. Right now, it is my spare credit card, and mainly used for Amazon purchases, a job which is performs quite admirably. There are better cards out there for general rewards, but for Amazon rewards, 3% is hard to beat, and the pay with points redemption feature makes it super easy to convert the rewards to savings. As with all credit cards, just be sure to pay off your balance every month, and you won't have to deal with interest fees. If you carry a balance, there's really no reason to get this card, as I'm sure there are better interest rates out there.

name: Juli Audet
review: I long ago learned the value of accumulating points, miles, etc to get the things I want that would not necessarily be considered a priority...especially in these tough times.  This card really delivers with points and rewards.  The service reps are top notch and are both knowledgeable and happy to answer any questions I might have.  My company reimburses me for the cost of my room and any per diem I am allotted, so I put it all on this card and rack up rewards.  I know that there are lots of reward cards out there, but I am so glad that I stuck with this one and am reaping the benefits now!

name: Shaun-Silvia Palakiko
review: The Chase Freedom Visa Card has been our main and primary account in which my family fall on during our everyday expenditure. The zero interest on all purchases for the first year is extremely helpful in this economy. We also accrue a percentage between 5% - 20% on our purchases. The featured purchases will change quarterly. One quarter we receive incentives on using more restaurants. Other quarters, the incentive change to purchases on grocery items. We enjoy the rewards tremendously. We are very satisfied with Chase Freedom Visa Card. The speed and accuracy of transaction appearing on our online statement has been more than satisfactory. Therefore, we recommend this card and look forward to expanding our credit line through Chase services.

name: Tim Hansell
review: One of the biggest factors that comes into what bank or credit card I use is customer service. I'm from the United States but when I was in the UK my account information was compromised. They not only helped while I was in the UK but I got everything credited back. I've continuously used the rewards towards traveling and personally think the rewards of Sapphire shape up with any card up there. I could go on and on with the positives but a lot of them have already been covered. It's a credit card you can get enjoyment out of for sure.

name: Stephen Huber
review: This credit card is decent, and I use it because it is simple. I do not have any credit card debt, I simply use it as an easier way to pay for things and for the rewards.  It does have a decent APR, thought. The rewards of 1 point per dollar and a signing bonus are big plusses. I also think their customer service is decent.  They are very friendly and resolve my problems in a very short amount of time.  My only complaint about the card is also a plus.  The fraud protection is very active, sometimes it will stop purchases on the card when everything is okay and you are just spending a lot.  This would be useful in the future, but it can be a pain.  Overall, this is a decent card.  There is not many bad things to say about it, but not many good either.

name: John Rea
review: I recently just got my Amazon Credit Card. I don't have much credit so I was shocked and ecstatic when I found out I got approved for one. The rewards for this thing are a wonderful bonus. I trust Amazon more than any other company, and this proves how great they are. The interest is high compared to most, but it's your own fault for buying things that you can't afford at the time of purchase. Although I probably will not keep and use this card for the rest of my life, it's a great starter card to increase my credit.

name: Emaxily Toker
review: I got the Amazon Rewards card for "emergencies" but love the rewards program so much that it quickly became my "go-to" card. I have found the rewards easy to collect and use, and have already garnered some serious discounts and savings on necessary items from Amazon. Users should be sure that the easy rewards don't lull them into making unnecessary purchases, but as long as you're careful (as one always should be with credit cards anyway), you'll be fine. I have not encountered any fees at all, for which I'm grateful. But I do make a point of paying it off completely every month, so I don't know what happens if you use it so much that you can't pay it off regularly.

name: Hershel Riemer
review: My experiences using Chase have been mostly positive, except that the rates go from reasonable to insane in a short amount of time. The benefits and bonuses that Chase offers (such as the $500 toward travel rewards, 20% off airfare, hotels, and car rentals) counterbalance that, though. It's a great card if you have to do a lot of traveling for work because the above mentioned benefits definitely help out. I also like that when I have to call for whatever reason that I'm instantly directed to a representative rather than some automated system. Customer support is very important to me and Chase does it right.

name: Kandace Retzer
review: The card arrived around 9 months ago and I began to use it.  Within a few weeks I was notified that my card had generated unusual activity, and they wanted to verify purchases.  I was very relived that they had this level of security built in, but all of the purchases were mine.  It was a little annoying having to go through all my online purchases to confirm each one.  The good news is Chase will look out for your credit and your account, the bad is that Big Brother is watching you closely. If you do not mind the monitoring then this is the bank and card for you.  If you are like me and the thought of a bank watching over you is a little creepy, then consider another bank.

name: WalletHub
review: Hi, most major banks and credit cards come with this kind of protection these days.  It might be a little unnerving but it can really save you if your card was ever used fraudulently.

name: Kayla Brizo
review: This card has been worth every penny so far in my use of it. To start off with the 0% foreign transaction fee has been a great resource when traveling abroad. Chase gives a good exchange rate and not having to pay any extra fees when I use my card overseas has been wonderful. The extra bonus points don't hurt either - it's enough to a one night stay at the Ritz Carlton in most cities. Additionally there's a yearly free night at any Marriott hotel, regardless of price/status/star level. The free night does expire after 6 months so be sure to use it - I didn't know this when I signed up and assumed the night lasted a year. Needless to say I was disappointed when it didn't. Overall this is a good card and if you travel a lot I recommend it.

name: Adam Green
review: I have a Chase Freedom Card that I have been using for about two years now.  The APR isn’t great, 14.9%, but if you don’t carry a balance this doesn’t matter to you.  I have been pleasantly surprised by the rewards available and ways to earn.  I like that you can use these rewards for anything, from paying down your credit card balance, to using them for gift cards, merchandise and even travel.  You get one percent back per dollar spent and then each quarter there a few categories that you can get five percent back.  These categories typically include airfare, gas, restaurants, groceries, etc, so they are relevant categories.  The only downfall for the quarterly promotions is that you have to register your card each quarter to receive the five percent back.  All in all, I would say a good card as long as you don’t carry a balance and since it is Visa it is accepted everywhere.

name: Elisabeth Hawkins
review: My Slate Visa Card is awesome.  My husband and I share an account and we both have had no problems with it.  We love the fact that we get 0% interest on it right now because it is a big help.  We just had a baby about 8 weeks ago and we have used our Slate Visa Card to make several important purchases for our new little one.  We were also able to pay some medical bills with it.  We felt that it was better to use our Slate Visa Card due to the interest rate rather than using one with a high interest rate.

name: Trevor Has
review: I learned how to use credit and be good about it with this card. I paid my bills on time and never had a late fee. I used it for gas and food. I, like some other people have said, built my credit line up to $5k and then was downgraded to $500 because I didn't use enough of it. I don't think I could have used it for $4k. Unless it was a huge item, I used it solely for gas and groceries. I liked the ease of use of this card. I eventually paid it completely off and cut it up.

name: Niki Kewish
review: So, I've had an Amazon.com rewards card for a number of years now. I'm not sure why some people are giving it such low ratings. It does everything you ask it to do - charge money, pay it off at the end of the month. Don't pay in full, get charged interest. Simple. I really like my card. I love the rewards, and I think that they're fairly generous, at least compared with other rewards credit cards. So yeah. I have no complaints at all about my amazon rewards visa card. I would probably give it four out of five stars, if I could give it a rating at all. If I had any complaints, it would be that the card has shown me the 'darker' side of amazon.com. It's easy to think of amazon as a smiling friend instead of a business, with it's happy logo on my screen. This card, and the interest it charges, reminds me that amazon isn't a friend, but a cold hearted business.

name: Owen Bolls
review: I really like this card, they offer many benefits and they have offered to increase my credit line a few times over the years. I use online statement and like the convenience of that feature. I also like how customer service is always quick to respond and you are not waiting online for a long time for someone to come on and help you. I actually canceled a previous card with another company because they had phone issues, and left me on hold for too long every time I tried to call in for customer service. This is a great card and I would recommend it to my friends and family. While the credit limit may start out small, with a good payment history they will usually increase your limit quite fast.

name: Køt Smith
review: I have to say that I am a big fan of the Chase Sapphire PreferredSM Card. After having a number of points and miles cards over the years, the simplicity of a cash back card--especially one that doesn’t bother with tiered rewards or rotating spending categories—is always refreshing. And you’ve got to love the 50% rewards bonus this CapOne card gives you at your cardmember anniversary. When it shows up on your statement, it’ll be like Christmas! You gotta appreciate the little things in life, you know? And it is the little things that set this card apart from competition like the Bank of America Accelerated Rewards Card that only offers 1.25% across all purchases and has an initial bonus of only 75 bucks. Also unlike the BofA card, which offers 0% on purchases for 12 mo., the Capital One Cash provides 0% on BOTH purchases and balance transfers for 12 months. Not too shabby. And while one would have to believe there is a catch to this offer, the only thing I can think of at the moment is that if you close your card before your account membership anniversary, you don’t get the 50% rewards bonus, which would make this a rather pedestrian 1% cash back card.

name: Johnathan Mitchell
review: After being a user of MasterCard for years, I finally made the switch to Chase. I could honestly not be more happy. The customer service is excellent. When I had to call customer service, the lady I talked to was so polite and helpful. She gave me the guidance I needed so that I knew what to do and why. I am not the most tech-savvy person, but the customer service rep I spoke to helped me with everything.The interest rates can also not be beat! The bonus points and rewards program is also great. This it the best credit card experience I have had in years. I love Chase!

name: Bob Hanson
review: Well, I just got this card about a month ago. I needed to transfer some debt to a no interest card to help me out. This one was by far the best I found. The 15 months of not having interest are a great help in getting my debt under control. Not only that, but the 5% cash bask on gas station purchases was a very pleasant bonus. The 1% cash back is pretty standard but every little bit helps. I haven't really had to use their customer service yet; but, they were very helpful on working with me when I first got the card.

name: Brad Smith
review: For me, it was the bonus points and earning potential that sold me with this particular card for me, and the low APR of 15.24% was decent as well.  I signed up, which took at best a 1-week after the application was sent in, and immediately earned the 10,000 bonus points.  Redeeming those points has been easy and less time consuming that you'd normally expect, so I'm satisfied in that regard.  I haven’t had a chance to use the balance transfer, but 3% is pretty basic and useful for when I need it.  Overall, I haven't had any issues with this card, both using it, and enjoying its benefits.  You cannot go wrong with the Chase Sapphire card.

name: Sara Bokich
review: I banked with Chase for a short period of time. It wasn't the best banking experience I have ever had, though it definitely wasn't the worst either. I did appreciate the availability of the Chase ATMs and branches, and it seems like the bank has expanded in the past few years.  A new branch even recently opened up about a mile from my house! The last time I used the ATM (I am a Wells Fargo customer now), it printed out a direct deposit offer for $100 free for signing up, an offer of which I am interested in taking advantage. I have seen the commercials recently for their mobile banking application, which allows deposit of the checks via a smartphone. Neat! With my previous Chase enrollment, issues were normally resolved quickly enough and customer service representatives were friendly enough, so I am thinking about giving Chase another go. It seems as though I may be pleasantly surprised if I do so.

name: Won Lee
review: Joe Weider  So, I got this card (sorry WalletHub, not through you guys) about a month ago, and I have been using it.   Now this deals more with United per se, rather than this card, but it ties together, so I want to talk about it. United miles are extremely valuable.  They allow one way award, and as long as you bok 3 weeks out (or if you have the club card $395 per yr),  then its just $25 per route. WOW!  You look at British airlines, and to use their miles to go to Europe, fee comes out to like $800-900 bux, so United is great!The downside of this card, is as Margie pointed out.  There are other cards available that competes with this card.... Say like Chase Sapphire Preferred.  I got this card for churning purposes.  If you look around web, u can find other deals where you get full 40k without spending $25k dollars.  not that you shouldn't, if you can, because you'd still get 25,000 miles from those 25k dollar spending,  but hey.  your mileage may vary. So get this card,  get 40k points, and then hold it for 11 months.  Dump it down the drain. Unless you fly United more than 5-8 times a year, all domestic, all economy,  this card really isn't that worth it.

name: WalletHub
review:
Why not through us? :)  

BTW, if you ever spot a link that has a better deal than what we have please let us know by emailing us at products at evolutionfinance.com or just leave a comment on the respective card. We would love to let our customers know and thanks again for all the valuable tips that you offer.

name: Won Lee
review: Margie pointed out some excellent stuffs, especially the cost.  But of course, I am here to present the other side to the story.  As always, consider your situation whenever you apply for a credit card, and make a decision based on the situation that suites you best.(Also, Margie made some statements that weren't necessarily true, so I wanted to correct that). So.  Let's play the devil's advocate.  When does this card makes sense to you? If you are a frequent United Flyer,  then this card might be a life saver. why? Let's start with lounge access.   Despite what Margie wrote down, suggesting that frequent flyer automatically gets lounge access, this isn't true with US legacy airlines for domestic travel.  Yes, if you buy an expensive international ticket, then lounge is included, but for domestic ones,  even if you fly "first class"  u don't get lounge.    You will have to buy lounge access( annual fee of $495), so if you fly domestic a lot on United, and u want the access to lounge service,  this card can be great.   What makes this card more beneficial is that Amex platinum no longer offers access to United/Continental Lounge via Priority Pass.  So if you want a free access to United Lounge, this is the only way to get it. -  Furthermore,  you can have one companion go in with you, so its like getting 2 people's worth the money.Second:  Close Fee Award Waiver.   If you fly United a lot, you are most likely going to rack up some United Miles.  You want to use them of course, but unless you book 3 weeks out,  they will slap you with $75 charge. It would be great if we can plan out our trips in advance, but we can't time to time.  This card waives it. Third:  Priority Boarding. why is this important?  Although Margie can't believe people woud want to board sooner,  she can't be farther away from the truth (I know u don't fly much Margie, don't worry).  With bag fees these days, people are trying to cram as much as they can on carry-ons. This means that it's really a hassle to find a spot to put your backpack or small carry-ones, if you board late. There just isn't enough space for everyone's.  Those who board first, will have ample access to them, and this card gives that. Fourth:  Perks you don't think you need but are very useful because you  have them.  -  Hyatt Platinum  gives you late check-out, free internet,  and so forth.  You will use it, and u will go wow! -   Rental Car  Top Tier: Again,  little things makes big difference. -   Primary Collision waiver for rental cars:  If you are interested in renting a car oversea, this card can provide you free insurance (as long as u rent the car with this card).So considering all these, is it worth $395?   Make that choice yourself.  HOWEVER.... There is a way to reduce the cost of this card down to $195.   If you use amex plat's $200 airline pay-back program, then this card only costs $195.  Furthermore, there are codes floating around, that gives this card first yr free,  so do consider that as well.

name: Sam
review: I recently became a member of Chase bank by signing up for student loans. The registration process, however, took some time. I needed a cosigner and copies of both my drivers license and my cosigner's drivers licenses and social security cards. I also had to provide proof of my attendance.  Overall though, the experience has been amazing. Chase sends out the loans promptly. Once I sent my papers in, it wasn't long before they sent me my check. In addition, the loan is made directly out to me, meaning that I can use the money through any medium. (i.e buying books on Amazon instead of the student book store at my school).

name: erica cunico
review: Chase isn't the best bank I've used, or the worst. If you live in the Midwest area, it's a great bank to choose because it has convenient locations all over. I picked them mainly because they were down the street from my house. I've had a few problems with them due to long pending balances, which can cause major overdraft fees, however; their customer service is great and their bank tellers have always been friendly from my experiences. I've never had a problem getting a hold of an actual person over the phone and most of the time I've been able to work something out with them when I've had problems in the past. Although a negative aspect would be they love to charge you whenever they can....When I try to cash a check through a teller they charge a fee, even if the person or company who the check belongs to banks with Chase as well.

name: Sara
review: I have had Chase since I was 17. They are nice and have a speedy response time. I have had some problems with overdraft fees that they charged me but I didn't overdraw my account. They took care of it for me and credited my account. The application process is so long though.
