name: claudia Marmolejo
review: I have been banking with Chase for over five years. Chase is a very reputable bank that has never failed me. I love this bank and it has so many convenient features. I always use the Chase smart phone app to deposit checks. It is so easy and I save money on gas and I save time being in line at the bank to deposit. I also you Chase quick pay to send family members money straight to their email. I especially love that there are so many deposit friendly ATMs. I can deposit money at my own convenience without worry about getting to the bank before it closes or waiting in line to deposit. Overall Chase has made my life easier with their excellent service. I would not change banks anytime soon.

name: Alex Green
review: I signed up for an account with Chase when I was in college.  It's been my first real (and pretty much only) experience with a bank.  I originally chose Chase because I wanted to move to Seattle after graduation, and they had branches there as well.  I got a student checking account; there was no monthly fee and I got a debit card.A couple of years later, I opened a student credit card.  My intent was to link the card to my checking account for overdraft protection, at the urging of the banker.  I did this, but they didn't link my card properly, and I still ended up dealing with overdraft issues.This year, I turned 24, which is when you no longer qualify for student checking.  The day after my birthday, I noticed I was overdrawn.  They had switched my account over to a normal checking account without any notification, and took out a monthly fee (also with no notification).  I feel that this was a little underhanded, and I strongly disapprove of their tactics.I've always felt like a number where Chase is concerned.  I don't feel important enough for them.  I've thought for awhile about switching to a local credit union, and it's something I'm still considering.

name: King Rome
review: My experience with Chase was decent. I had set up for my monthly direct deposit to be deposited to this account. After having Wells Fargo for years, I noticed that my direct deposit took a few days longer to process with Chase than with Wells Fargo. Furthermore, I noticed that while purchases I made with my Wells Fargo card in the past would show up on my account immediately, purchases made with my Chase card took a few more hours and sometimes even a day or two. Their customer service is on point though and they are very friendly. However, I simply found Wells Fargo to be more convenient from me.

name: Shalinn Donovan
review: I have banked with Chase Bank ever since I moved to Texas three years ago. I have never had a problem with Chase Bank and it was very easy to set up and account there. Chase Bank is hassle-free and great to bank with!

name: Alex Bandas
review: I have been a member for Chase Bank for several years and for the most part I have had no complaints about them. They handle my disputes in a timely fashion and get back to me really quickly if i need help with something. Their customer representatives are nice and help me without any hassle. Their online feature is what really keeps me from going to a different back. Its reliable and easy to use and someone with little experience with computers can figure it out. It makes checking your account and transferring money to other accounts simple; the way it should be.

name: Patrick
review: I got my first ever credit card with Chase. I've never had any issues at all with them. Their website is super easy to use and very user friendly. I once had my wallet stolen out of my car while I was working out at the gym. I immediately called Chase to cancel my card. The process was super easy and I got a new card just two days later. They made a very frustrating time go as smoothly as possible. I only wish other banks were as awesome as Chase has been. I highly recommend Chase if you're looking for a great place to do some banking with. Keep up the good work!

name: Anthony
review: Chase Bank customer service was one of the best experiences I have had and continue to be part of. I opened up my first checking account with Chase a few years back. The employee who helped me was very honest and direct with any questions I had. After that, every time I go in to deposit or withdraw money, the bank tellers are always very nice and courteous. The one time I had a problem and questions about my college account closing, I came in and the employee answered all my concerns about future features of my account and assured that I would not be charged despite not having the college student label on my account. Although I have spoken to different representatives every time I come in, I still get the same vibe from each individual. Chase customer service is what separates Chase from the rest of the competition.

name: Lishya
review: I have been with Chase since they used to be Washington Mutual. First, I was skeptical when they got bought, but after banking with them for a while, I am getting used to it. I would rate the customer service with 3.5 stars out of 5, I prefer Washington Mutual customer service. Overall, the checking and saving account are pretty good. They have a lot of ATMs, plus they have drive thru ATMs which area plus, because with a baby in tow, it makes it easier for me, without having to get out of my car. The saving interest is not that much compared to ING Direct, so I don't really use it. Mostly for checking and using their debit card because of the points.

name: Nora Atanay
review: I didnât choose this bank, it was thrust upon me. I was a Washington Mutual customer with a checking account, savings account, car loan and credit card. When my bank was gobbled up by Chase, our economy was in the midst of a major meltdown. Chase was a solid name in the industry, so I didnât have too many worries when they took over. I didnât close my account like so many did. I stayed and was rewarded with a slow trickle of nickel & dime tactics. The ATM fees showed up, my checking account fee was raised and then, much to my horror, my credit card APR doubled! They just about killed me. When I called to try to get some relief, they said there was nothing they could do. Right.

name: Oluademi James-Daniel
review: Like many people, I was with Washington Mutual until they went under, and Chase took over all of us.  While it was pleasant enough for a while - excellent customer service - as time went on, I started noticing more and more random little fees.  ATM fees, checking fees, etc.  The coup-de-grace, however, was the recently instated rule that if you don't have over $5,000 in your checking, they will take $12.50 a month.  Now, I am an unemployed 20-something.  Do you know how many packets of ramen that $12.50 could buy?  A lot.  I have since moved to a place with no Chase banks, however, and I assure you: I will be closing my account as soon as I get the chance.  So if you're an established adult with a good paying and steady job, then yes, Chase is spectacular.  If not...look elsewhere.

name: Jessica Harper
review: I absolutely love this bank. Previous to this checking account I had one at another bank (which I won't name) and I was thoroughly disappointed, so when searching for this one, I went with the most highly recommended bank: Chase. Once I got an account with them, I understood why! Chase is amazing! The customer service representatives are always amazingly friendly and helpful. Every time I have a question, they answer it for me, no problem. Recently, I had a bit of a misunderstanding with a charge being on my card twice and when I called to fix it they had it removed within the hour! Chase is a great bank for anyone!

name: Robert Brasher
review: I have carried a mortgage with Chase for approximately 6 years. Currently the mortgage is in foreclosure through mutual fault, not just Chase. The overall criticism I have for Chase, as I have with many of the mega-corporations, is that they seem to be so large that the customer gets lost in the shuffle. We had a loan modification process in the works with Chase. The process alone took approximately 9-10 months and resulted in a denial. This came because we did not update paperwork with Chase after receiving 3 notices from them that our paperwork was not complete and being told that it was a standard packet and all of our documentation was fine. Apparently we were supposed to be sending updates every 3 months; however, after being told that our paperwork was fine, we did not send anything. It was confusing, and without the modification we could not longer stay in the home as we had taken a loss in income.

name: Tim
review: I was originally a Washington Mututal customer which then became Chase. I was very reluctant about the transition but it actually paid off. I am a big fan of online customer service options and Chase provides you with that. You get prompt responses, and the same goes with over the phone. I've always had pleasant experiences inside the bank environment as well. I've since moved on to a  different bank but it wasn't due to lack of customer service or support on their end. I'd definitely recommend Chase.

name: Rachel R
review: I have the Chase Freedom Visa. It was one of my first credit cards and I’ve been a member since 2007. It is one of my favorite credit cards because I get 1% cash back on ALL purchases. I have the Discover More card, and that one sometimes pays.25% on purchases. Also, Chase increases my credit limit pretty regularly which I like. One thing I don’t like is that they never have any good balance transfer offers for me. It seems Citi and Discover offer them more frequently to me. Recently, Chase changed the minimum payout for cash rewards from $25 to $20. This is a definite plus for me, since I can now cash out monthly.

name: Deborah Leslie
review: I signed up for the Chase Amazon credit card two years ago when I was doing some Christmas shopping on Amazon.com. I was attracted to the Amazon gift card bonus that I received when I signed up, and I also liked the bonus points that were offered on the card. Now, I use this credit card for nearly all of my purchases. With the Chase Amazon card, I get 1 point back for every dollar I spend on any purchase, 2 points for every dollar I spend on groceries and gas, and, best of all, I get 3 points back for every dollar I use at Amazon.com. Since I buy a lot on amazon.com including books for my Kindle and diapers for my two kids, I tend to rack up a lot of points. Then, I get to redeem the points for instant cash, or I can use them to make purchases on amazon.com. I definitely am happy that I decided to get the Chase Amazon credit card, and I would recommend this card to anyone, especially those who shop frequently on amazon.com.

name: Yunan Nie
review: The Chase Freedom Visa is my only credit card and it's never failed me. I don't usually spend a huge amount of money so it's good for the little things, like buying lunch or shopping at the mall. I've used it several times to purchase online, as through Amazon or Ebay, and I've had no problems getting it accepted. My parents and I always pay off our balance every month so there's been no problems with the APR or what have you. The 1% and 5% cash back bonuses are very nice, because we spend a lot on gas and since I'm at college, quite a bit on restaurants too.

name: Benjamin Jacob
review: Chase Ink  for Business has been my first experience with a 'business' specific credit card.  So far, it has been a very easy, pleasurable, experience.  The rewards and the points system is better than any prior card I have had in the past.  But what I am most content with is the chance to have PO numbers printed right on the receipts by the vendors, at most major retail outlets anyway.  Some of the smaller places I shop at don't give me the option, but the local driving range did which surprised me.  It keeps things organized and neat and the statements each month are another great tool for tracking the ebb and flow of the money in the business.

name: Scott Bryant
review: As a frequent Amazon shopper, the Amazon Rewards Credit Card by Chase offers me the opportunity to turn my shopping on Amazon into more points. With a 3 points per dollar rewards for products purchased on Amazon, for every $33 I spend, I'm getting a dollar back to use on Amazon. And the best part? There's no 'threshold' to redeem my points. With rising gas prices, I felt like I might as well get money back where I can, so I put all my gas and restaurant expenditures on my card, to get even more money. For Amazon Prime users and Kindle Fire owners, it's a cinch, just link the card to your accounts and get easy 1-click access to your card. Definitely, definitely recommend this card.

name: Delpha Cawthron
review: I was tired of only using my debit card and not getting any rewards to do so.  I was offered the Chase Freedom card and loved the 1% returns all year and the quarterly 5% returns.  Furthermore, there was an incentive of $250 in rewards if I accrued more than $2000 in spending in the first 3 months.  After doing so, Chase followed-through with their promise.  I have other credit cards but I continue to use Chase Freedom because of the 5% quarterly reward categories and the charges show up right away.  This allows me to immediately keep my accounts balanced.

name: Daniela Samith
review: So  I got an offer in the mail and I decided to apply for this credit card. Since  I've been traveling a lot recently, I needed a credit card that gave me good rates on miles, and this card gave me double the points when I did travel. I was also surprised when I got the same things for less points- I think it's a 20 percent discount. I have to say, after using this card for 3 months now, I've got enough extra rewards points to finance my next three trips when I fly back and forth from Japan to San Francisco. If you fly or eat out a lot, this is the card for you. It can be kind of unrewarding when you use it on everyday household living though. Fees are high and you have high penalties as well. But overall for my needs, it was good, so 4.5 stars!

name: Nayeli Navares
review: I have had this car for almost 2 years now for my business and personal purchases, I was excited about the features when I applied for the card back in 2010, I really liked the rewards that came with the car. I like the hotels that Marriott has all over the world so I thought why not get the card and rack up reward points to get amazing rooms, they let you choose from 1-4 star quality locations of course I always select the best. When I first used the card which was after 2 months of applying I got about 20,000 bonus points instantly added to my account which is huge. I used the points to stay at the Marriott in downtown miami(courtyard). For every dollar I spent I get 1 point, through my business I make big purchases so this card is perfect for me or someone who likes Marriott hotels and likes racking up points to stay at the best rooms. I'm actually surprised this card has a 3.5 out of 5 rating on this site, since I've been using it I've always liked the card and is one of my favorite cards out of all the cards I have. I rate the Marriott Business Rewards Card a 4.7/5.0 the only reason it is not perfect is because I can't earn more points per dollar spent unless I shop at Marriott hotels which I don't do very much of.

name: Ethan Gareau
review: I have been a Chase customer for quite some time. I have never had any issues with my Chase credit card. I had an incident 2 years ago around Christmas time, when someone stole my credit card information and used it to buy $550.00 work of Christmas presents and $50.00 worth of gas. Chase flagged my account and contacted me immediately. The customer service person was very helpful and they shipped me a new card immediately and they took care of the fraudulent charges. I also enjoy this card because it gives me points which I can redeem for a host of different items.

name: Kathryn Parker
review: My experience with Chase can only be described as disappointing. I cannot comment on the application process as when I started an account, it was with a bank called Washington Mutual. After several years banking there Chase purchased the company and quickly took over.The trouble all started when I started receiving unexpected checking fees. With my previous account there had been no monthly fees and Chase didn’t bother to send any notice of changed policies. When I went into the bank to sort it out, I found an entirely new staff. While I’m sure the changes were stressful, the staff members were completely unprofessional. They snapped out answers to my questions condescendingly and looked past me instead of addressing me directly. I was discouraged by this, but I chalked it up to a bad week. I later called them to check my balance and spent twenty minutes on hold. After a couple weeks of horrible customer service, I gave up and went in to close my account.Closing my account took very little time. The representative didn’t ask why I was leaving, or if there was anything they could do to keep my business. In fact, he hardly said two words the entire time. Perhaps it was simply the growing pains involved in taking over a business, but now I wouldn’t go back to Chase if they paid me.

name: Joe Watkins
review: So, I've had a Visa card since I got out of college (or maybe I got it when I was in college).  In any event, I got it because the bonus it paid was a $5.00 Borders/Walden Books coupon for every $500 I spent.  It might not seem like a great deal, but I'm a big fan of buying books (I'm a slow reader though so I have quite a back-log) so I enjoyed it.  I'd save up the certificates all year and use them on myself and to buy Christmas presents.  (My Walden Books honored the certificates even if they had expired.)  Eventually though Chase dropped the premium (even before those stores went out of business) and started a bonus points program.  I'd look through the gift premium catalog whenever it came in the mail, but never saw anything I wanted and eventually stopped paying attention to it.  It seemed like over the past year I started getting prompts from Chase to sign up for the bonus-bonus points each quarter.  (Really, if you want to give me a premium, that you claim I've "earned" for using your card, just give it to me.  What is with me having to sign-up for it?)  I ignored those as well.  Recently I bought a door from Home Depot and had to return it.  I kept checking the automated call system (that works relatively painlessly) to check transactions on my account.  When I didn't see it after several days I pressed zero to speak to an attendant.  After learning that the credit might not show up for seven to ten days (oddly, when I use the card, the transactions show up much more quickly than that), the attendant asked if I wanted to sign up for the quarterly bonus points.  I asked if it would cost me anything or cause me to be entered into a program that I didn't want to be in and she said that it would not.  So I said to sign me up.  She then asked if I tracked my bonus points.  I told her that I didn't pay attention to them.  She, (in a moment of non-scripted interaction), said "good!  Would you like to know how many points you have?"  I said, "sure."  She replied that I had over 61,000 of them.  I told her that that sounded like a lot of points, but points were not money.  She said, "Want to know how many dollars those points are worth?"  Again, I said "Sure."  To make a long story less long, it turned out that because I had been ignoring my bonus points for several years I had accumulated over $600 in points and she would send me a check for that amount.  So, while I might believe that credit card corporations are basically soulless, evil creatures (although people nonetheless) at least on that day I didn't dislike them so much.

name: Zoe Charpia
review: I have used this credit card for over 10 years and have been very pleased with it. I use it to earn miles for United air travel and, although there is an annual fee, the flights I have booked every year have covered the cost of the fee many, many, many times over. I use it for grocery shopping, for gas and for all my purchases. It is, in fact, the only credit card I use. I also love the convenience of paying my bill online, paperless statements and e-mail alerts when my bill is due.Finally, I also value the security of this credit card. If there is any unauthorized activity on my account, there is an immediate e-mail sent and everything is resolved without any additional cost to me.

name: Charline Distefano
review: I go this credit card because I wanted to transfer my balances and take advantage of the now interest for 18 months offer. Also, it said I would receive $150 cash back with my first purchase.The money was transferred to me quickly and painlessly. I was very pleased with the customer service department any time I called with questions. I am currently still in the process of my 0% intro APR for 18 months offer. My perspective of this card might be different once I start accumulating interest. However, I never miss a payment and have had no problems.Another thing I really like about this card is that it has very low monthly payments.

name: WalletHub
review: Hi Tiffany, most credit card companies ask for 2%-3% per month.  As long as your balance and interest rate aren't too high, you should get roughly the same minimum payments with any card.

name: Amanda Wallace
review: I only have 2 credit cards, the Chase Freedom Visa and a Capital One MasterCard and the Chase card if definitely my favorite. I had really low credit and started using Creditkarma to monitor and fix my score when they recommended the Capital One card. After using that card for a month, Creditkarma recommended the Chase Freedom card. I was approved with a modest limit of $1000. The credit limit didn’t matter to me though since I was only using the card to rebuild my credit. Although I do feel like $1000 is enough. I happened to sign up for this card while they were still offering the $200 cash back when you spend so much in 90 days. What they did was after I had qualified for the $200 cash back they gave me 20,000 in rewards point which I then in turn traded in for a $200 credit on my statement. You can also request a check but I just thought it was easier to get a statement credit. I have also been earning other rewards when I use my card for movie tickets, groceries and gas. So far I think this is the best rewards card around, certainly better than Capital One.

name: Stacy Czerny
review: I love this credit card!  I use it for daily purchases and let it rack up my points to earn trips!  I have had this card for a year now, and wouldn't have any other card!  The interest rate is bar none one of the best I have ever had! My only problem is that it is too easy to use!  I love the online statement, it is so easy to use.  I love the fact that it is so easy to link your southwest airlines rewards card up.  It was almost effortless! If you haven't done so already to and get yours!

name: Camille Lee
review: I've had good experiences with my Chase credit cards. My husband and I haven’t had any problems with our credit line or getting responses from the bank. This card does have a pretty high interest rate, but we have never let our balance get high enough to make a big difference. Once about a year ago, there were a bunch of fraudulent charges that showed up on our card, seemingly from nowhere. It was a little difficult to get ahold of the right people, but once we did and explained the situation to them, they handled a lot of the mess of getting out of the charges. It eventually saved us a few hundred dollars that the fraud company would have charged us.

name: Crystal Berns
review: I am a huge fan of Chase bank.  I became a customer of their's in 2004 when they took over the bank I was with at the time, Bank One.  I was concerned with the change, but within a few months they won me over.  The tellers remained the same, and continued to know me when I came to do my banking.  Even the new manager learned my name after just a few visits.  Anytime there was any concern or error on my account they took care of it immediately.  I have been completely satisfied with my experience with Chase thus far, and I would be proud to recommend them to anyone.

name: Karla Rhodes
review: We first thought WOW we love Disney and this would be a great way to help us fund our trip.  We thought is was a  great deal so we sign up for it.  Chase Disney Premier Credit Card offers a $100 statement credit after first use.  It also offers 0% on purchases for six months.    I have to say we have had this card for over two year and maybe have got for maybe two dinners in Disney World.  OK not the most ( we where thing hotel room~ yes we think big), but two dinner in Disney World will still help out on our budget.   It also offers you free things in Disney like photos. Overall not a bad card.

name: Marcin Longlastname
review: Chase Sapphire preferred can be considered to be the current flagship card that Chase offers. To get approved you need to have a stellar credit history, but if you are considering a card like this chances are that you already have rather good credit in the first place.The card itself, physically, is appealing, being very thick and sturdy. This is not your everyday plastic card, it is made of two plastic slices glued together, so the card numbers do not push through the card but instead are printed on.The card does come with some really good perks, for example when you call you instantly get a human, all of whom seem to not have an ethnic accent, but instead appear to be normal Americans in an American call center. The staff is very helpful, and always police when you ask them questions or request help.Even better, they offer perks like doubling warranty on items, but here is the catch, it has to be under $500. Another unusual thing is that they suddenly closed my account for a single day, and then unblocked it the next day, without any explanation, with Chase denying that it was closed in the first place.

name: Jess Vest
review: I have this credit card, and I’ve had a really good experience with it. This is my first credit card ever, I got it last year because I figured I should have one to use just in case. It’s been really nice to have, even though I only have a 500 dollar limit on it. I always make the payments on time, so my interest is still the 0% intro rate. Plus, when I signed up there was a special reward that if you spent a certain amount on the card in the first few months ($250, maybe? I forget) you got a $100 cash back reward. It was pretty exciting getting that check in the mail!

name: WalletHub
review: Hi Jess, currently the card requires $500 spent in the first 3 months to get $100 back.  A very doable target for most consumers.

name: Von Warner
review: I have been pleased with my Chase Visa.  The rate is not great, but it is acceptable.  I find the website easy to navigate when I need to check my balance or make a payment.  I like having my payment automatically withdrawn from my checking account on a monthly basis. This practice prevents late fees due to my forgetfulness.  I do not get solicitation calls from Chase asking me to upgrade services or add identity theft protection.  I appreciate it greatly, as I detest telephone solicitation calls.  I would recommend this card.  It has no annual fee.  Chase Visa is accepted everywhere.  I have never had a problem using my card.  In conclusion, I am happy with my Chase Visa.  I have a pretty high credit limit which gives me a sense of security in the event of an emergency.  If you need a credit card, Chase is an easy company to deal with.  The customer service has always been top notch.

name: Jameson Smith
review: Unlike the other posters I have had a very positive experience with this card.  I, too started out with a low credit limit but I would only buy gas with it and then pay it off at the end of every month.  Slowly, my credit limit was increased and I couldn't be happier with this card, and Chases' customer service.  I enjoy the cash back that I receive from using my card so often that I wouldn't know what to do with out it.  Out of all the credit cards in my wallet, this is the one that I use the most and the one with the least amount of problems.

name: Michael Charvat
review: I have used Chase for many things including checking and for a credit card. In my experience with their checking is not as bad with a credit card but it still was  bad mixed with good. They have a high cash advance minimum fee of 10$ and they have support issues when you speak to them for assistance.But the card was well and had a great late payment grace period as well as good limits. So overall I would recommend it but hesitantly do so because of the few good things it does have. So I would rate them 3 out of 4 if they improve their service and a few other things they could be one of the best.

name: Bethany Cantrell
review: We love our amazon.com credit card and use it for one hundred percent of our purchases. With no annual fee and many, many rewards it is the best credit card for us. In addition, Amazon has made it super easy to use your reward money to lower the cost of the items you put in your cart. There is an option during checkout to use your reward money toward the purchase which is a great bonus. Also, I am rewarded one point per dollar I spend and 3 points per dollar I spend on amazon.com. Amazon.com already boasts many great deals so I don't mind doing many of my purchases there and then using my reward money to bring down the cost of my total order. I would definitely recommend the amazon.com credit card to anyone looking for a great one!

name: Bethany Shaeffer
review: My husband and I both have this credit card, but instead of cash back, we get reward points which have been wonderful in redeeming for gas cards. We are very careful with credit cards and make sure we don't go over what we can afford. We've had them for over two years and we use them for just about every purchase; however, we both make sure we pay it monthly but leave ourselves about $10 in debt because we heard that's good for your credit somehow. We both have EXCELLENT credit and are finally taking steps to purchase our first home! Overall, we've both been very satisfied with this card. I think it's just really important to make sure you don't overspend. Budgeting wisely is crucial.

name: Qing Lu
review: I applied for this card four months ago and got approved. At that time, the sign-in bonus was 50,000 points as long as I spent 3000 dollars in the first three months. I used this card for grocery shopping, car insurance, traveling, essentailly everything, and my spending easily went over $3000 in three months. Last month I got the bonus points. I transferred these points to my United Airlines Mileage Plus account, and with a a little extra points, I got a round-trip flight ticket to an Asian country. Typically such a ticket cost over $1100. What a wonderful bonus. One more thing, there is no foreign transaction fee when I used this card in the foreign country, which is typically 3% if I use my other credit cards. I highly recommend this credit.

name: Bernarda Balckwell
review: I have been a card member of the southwest rapid rewards card for several year now and am glad to be a member. The primary reason I have this card is because I only fly South West Airlines. It is my favorite "no hassle" airline. The main benefit of the rapid rewards card is that you can earn a free flight, which I have done and been quite happy with that perk as I fly quite a bit on pleasure and business. I know that the real benefit comes in first signing up for the card with the initial signup points, but to me it is still a worth wild card, because this is really the only airline I ever fly. I Fly South West mainly because they have the highest safety rating of the airlines and they are as mentioned a no hassle airlines. I'm glad to be a card holder.

name: Margaret Dieudonne
review: I got a Chase checking account right before I was going off to college. That was probably one of the best decisions I ever made because of how simple it is to keep in touch with the funds on my account. Also, Chase is very stringent about security, which is always necessary in a time of increasing security fraud. What future Chase customers should also know is that with a savings account there tends to be a minimum balance that must be in the account. What I enjoyed having about this account is how prevalent it is in Texas. If you live in Texas, I recommend this bank only because it is likely to be in your workplace or college campus. In fact, when I have gone to other parts of the United States, it looks like Chase it broadening its horizons. As usual, beware of overage charges. In case of emergencies, Chase does provide options to account for the possibility of overcharging your account.

name: William Stanley
review: When I first went to switch from a local credit union to a big name bank like Chase, I was pretty nervous. However, I ended up being more than pleasantly surprised. The thing I love the most about being a Chase member is the convenience - there is a Chase branch nearly everywhere you turn in my city, and innumerable ATM's on top of that. In addition, a good number of those ATM's allow you to deposit money and checks which is a huge selling point for me. Whenever I go into a branch and have to do a face-to-face transaction, the employees are always very personable and easy to work with. Many times, at the branch nearest my house, the bankers know me by name and greet me by it. Their online account access is also very reliable, and allows you to make bill payments quickly and easily. All the way around, I think Chase is a great place to bank.

name: Ricky Morrison
review: I really like the professionalism and courtesy the employees at the bank give me every time I walk in. They always help me out right away and are always knowledgeable and able have me in and out of the building quickly. One thing I have an issue with, however, are the hidden fees I was not warned about. Other than those, however, I am quite happy with my experience with J.P. Morgan Chase, and will continue to bank with them for many years to come.

name: katy davis
review: Chase Bank is the best bank that I ever used.  I call them a "full service" bank, because they have handled all of my needs.  I had an emergency last year and applied for a loan, no problem, to beat it all-I received it within a week.  I have credits cards with Chase, not just the debit cards for bank accounts.  I enjoy my visits to the bank, everyone knows me by name and they are very personable.  Anytime I need help or advice on my fiances, the tellers are great in helping me.  One teller knows that I love "peanut butter fudge",so at Christmas time last year, the teller had saved me some-that someone else had brought in.  Chase Bank is the best bank- period.

name: david watson
review: The Chase branch located near Laguna Woods California made it so easy to arrange my finances. My Dad gave me a tip that Chase was the bank that offered the best customer service and it is the preferred bank for handling situations face to face with bankers.           In a world where everything is automated the exceptional customer service I found at Chase when transferring my funds was very refreshing. With a foundation of excellent, in person, face to face, customer service Chase backs that up with an awesome user friendly online banking program. Their online banking makes it easy to manage my account and stay up to date on my account activity. As of now I have nothing but good things to say about banking with Chase.

name: Richard Reed
review: My wallet was stolen only a few days ago, I was able to call Chase and they not only put a hold on my credit card quickly they also were able to help me track down where my card had recently been used. I was then able to go to that store and they were able to use the security film to not only catch the guy, but I also got my wallet back. They were very helpful over the phone as well as being very understanding. I will always use Chase! I highly recommend them to anyone, they were my first bank and I will stick with them!

name: Naomi Kovar
review: Chase is a bank you can count on. They make banking really easy. Every time I had a problem with a discrepancy on my account or trouble with a transaction with a merchant, their customer service department handled the problem quickly and professionally. I never had to dread reporting a problem to an inexperienced, incompetent customer service representative. Every customer service representative I had an encounter with was very knowledgeable about everything that was required to solve the problem I was having. They do have minimum balance requirements, but they are not hard to meet. There are no monthly service fees as long as you keep the required minimum balances in your account.

name: Breannalyn Pearce-Raposa
review: I recently opened a Debit account with Chase, and I personally love them. My family has been using Chase Banks since I was born. We have had then since they were Bank One, and then Republic Bank, and now Chase, and we would never go to another bank. I myself love the service I get, I feel like the people that work there actually care about me, and they have been nothing, but exceptionally kind. Chase is fairly easy to open an account with the only thing I wouldn't advise doing is applying for one of their credit cards if you have new credit, because they will not accept you. Otherwise, I think they are wonderful.

name: Sean Wilson
review: I have been a customer at Chase Bank since I got my first job four years ago. I haven't had any problems at all with their service, but whenever I have gone in to talk to them they have been very friendly and extremely helpful. My account was recently untethered and they informed me of all of the changes which would take place (i.e. 300 minimum balance in my savings, etc.) and I was able to save myself a few bucks because of that. I haven't even had trouble with using my card in Europe, where I have visited almost every year since getting my job. I use their iPhone app to do most of my banking and it is incredibly convenient. I can't think of anything else to say, but I would definitely recommend them people. In fact, I've been trying to get my girlfriend to join them for quite some time now (her bank is annoying!)

name: Cameron
review: I got my account with Chase after graduating high school, a student checking account for when I went away to college. I really like their student account option - they don't charge account fees, which is really nice since I don't have the cash to spare as a minimum wage earning college student. The application was simple enough, and the representative I spoke with was very helpful and incredibly pleasant. However, I did have one issue with it. They put in the wrong last name when entering my account information, and I didn't find out about it until they mailed me my debit card. When I contacted customer service, they ensured me that the problem would be fixed immediately, but it took more than three weeks for the problem to be entirely corrected. All in all, Chase is an excellent bank, but they definitely aren't the most timely!

name: Mikel
review: When I started college I took out some student loans from JP Morgan which led to me getting my first checking/savings account with JP Chase Bank (which I still have to this day.) My student loan process with JP Chase was relatively easy and a simple process. I had a personal representative that helped me through the loan process and any balance that was left over after my school expenses were paid, went straight to my account as a positive balance. The left over money comes in handy for a college student. Iâve always had pretty decent customer service at my local branch when it comes to making deposits, withdrawing money and other questions or services that I may have or needed at the current time. One of thing that Iâve always found helpful is the up to date tips that Iâve received from the bank tellers. For example Iâve had problems with overdraft fees in the past with Chase that has gotten me into trouble a couple of times but a bank teller told me about overdraft protection, which I was not aware of at the time. The overdraft protection was nice because it allowed money from my savings to transfer to my checking if a negative transaction ever went through to keep my balance positive. I also got overdraft protection from fees and stuff which I actually qualified through my parents because my credit at the time was not strong enough, since I was just a student. Iâve had the same account with Chase for almost six years which is still in good standing. A couple of the bank tellers know me by a first name basis which makes me feel like a valued customer. Chase is also convenient as a bank because it is so popular. I do a lot of traveling and having a Chase at almost every corner is a plus because I never have to worry about extra ATM fees or having to deal with the hassles of âawayâ banking if Iâm out of town and need to do an emergency transaction. Most people are familiar with JP Morgan Chase bank but for those that arenât I would certainly recommend them!! The application process is really easy. You can do everything online or go into a local branch to get your account set up. The minimum deposit to open an account is twenty-five dollars. If you do have bad credit, Chase does offer something like preferred checking which you have to pay fifteen dollars a month. That is quite an excellent option since most banks won't even offer that option.

name: Yurel Cooke
review: I had a Checking account a few years ago. I love all of the services Chase has to offer and the principles that the business is based upon but the customer service is awful. I was very attracted to Chase after it had acquired Washington Mutual because there were branches everywhere. Because of that I thought that it would have been very easy for me. I was always on hold for a long time while calling customer service and I would receive the most generic answers to my concerns and questions. If it was not for the poor customer service this would be the perfect bank.

name: Joseph Watson
review: Chase bank honestly gets a bad wrap, because honestly as long as I have been a customer, I have been impressed with their ease of use and service. When I first opened my checking account, my personal banker Rosie was very helpful and clear about the terms of the checking account that I would be opening with the bank. Since Iâve downloaded the Chase Bank app for my iphone, my account management and account transactions have been easier than ever to use. Along with the great ease of use, the transactions with my accounts happen in a timely fashion, which is extremely convenient.

name: Jacob Kerstan
review: Chase has been my bank for a few years now and I have been more than happy with them.  I opened my account right when they were switching from Washington Mutual to Chase, so I got grandfathered in with some of the older policy rules pertaining to me.  For instance, I was in high school when I opened this account and was able to walk right in and open it.  Now you are required to have a parent with a Chase account in order to open a high school checking account.  Whenever they change a policy I get a notice promptly in the mail and I always feel very informed with what is going on inside the bank.  The application for a checking account is very easy and didn't take long at all.  When I switched the account to a college checking account, it took less than ten minutes.  They are very expert when it comes to problem resolution.  I was having problems with  payments to my insurance agency, and I was able to walk right in, talk to a representative (he got on the phone and dealt with the insurance agency on my behalf), and walk out with the whole problem taken care of.  I highly suggest this bank and personally am going to stay with them for years to come.

name: Kathleen
review: The biggest advantage of Chase bank is that they have locations everywhere. It is very convenient to find a close location and they are easy to spot because they are lit up very brightly. The people who work there are always really nice but my biggest problem with Chase is that even though the people are really nice, they are very aggressive when it comes to their sales tactics. This is not just one location, I have entered different Chase branches on multiple occasions to be approached by someone who is going to "help my make my deposit" and then it turns into a sales tactic to get me to sign up for some special checking. One time, I left there and had apparently signed up for a checking that would get me bonus points but cost me $25 per year! There was never a mention of the yearly cost and after telling Chase that, there was no resolution of the problem.

name: Elizabeth Dutton
review: I have been a Chase customer for over 15 years.  They offer excellent customer service.  The alerts that they have in place probably has saved me several days of getting new accounts and debit cards. They alerted me on a Sunday morning at 8:00 AM when they saw some unfamiliar purchases on my account.  It came to their attention because of the location where these were made and for the amounts. This could have caused much aggravation if this was not brought to my attention at the time it was.  I have been very pleased with their efficiency and quick response.

name: Mel McKibbin
review: I have been a member of Chase Bank for 3 years. In that time I have come to realize that Chase is the best bank there is. Their customer service is very friendly, down to earth, and almost always immediate. If I submit a question to their tech support team, or customer service team- I get an answer within a few hours. The perks of the checking account are great, because when you open an account, not only do you get an opening bonus (amounts vary from $100 to $250) , you get your first order of checks free.Overall, Chase is a great option for any bank- and as long as you have direct deposit, you won’t have any monthly fees. I highly recommend Chase to anyone who needs a quality bank and doesn’t want to have to deal with the nonsense of being a cog in a wheel of another bank.Their website is easy to access, navigate, and manage. You are able to pay bills online, do bill transfers, and even order checks and overnight checks. They have a fairly lenient overdraft policy, and will generally refund overdraft fees in many circumstances. Join Chase bank and you won’t be sorry.

name: William
review: I dealt with shady bank policies for many years before finally going to Chase Bank. It was like a dream come true for me. I was assigned a personal banker that helped me get started on many different procedures. He went well out of his way to help me with any questions that I ever had and 3 years later, I'm still with them. I haven't had any issues with NSF charges or anything like that. Before coming to them, I had all but given up hope that there were actually honest people that worked in banks. I've finally gotten back on track financially and feel that if it weren't for Chase holding my hand the entire time, I would be nowhere near where I need to be.

name: Bethany Shaeffer
review: I have been a member of Chase bank for two years now. I switched from another well known bank and have had an excellent experience so far. I love the Ultimate Rewards points program they have for their credit cards. The "combine points" feature has been especially wonderful. My husband and I combine our points and redeem them for gas cards! It has saved us a lot of money on gas!

name: Sharon
review: I have been a Chase customer for about 4 years and during that time have been very impressed not only with their diversity of products, but also with the attention they give to customer service.  I recently had to open a high school checking account for my son.  The amount of money in this account was going to be minimal, but the representative took all the time that was needed to not only open the account, but to also make sure my son understood how the account worked and how he could use it.  This level of service is a good example of why Chase is the bank that many people seem to prefer and goes way beyond the idea that a bank is only looking to make money.   In my case at least they proved that they were looking out for my best interests and don't just about the money.

name: Lindsay
review: Chase is my favorite bank! I love Chase online banking. They have really nice features and I am a frequent user. I like their real-time updates and the easy accessibility that they offer. They have the rewards program where you can earn points and convert it to cash. Their debit cards are easily accessible as well. Convenience and reliability are what they offer best and I love Chase. The ATMs are available everywhere and I believe they offer more varieties of rewards program than any other banks, including Bank of America. I have been using Chase for years and it is nice to put my trust in a bank like Chase.

name: Mary Kovoor
review: JP Morgan Chase bank is great for New Yorkers -- there seems to be one on almost every street corner.  ATMs are plentiful, usually drive-through, bank hours are generous, and penalties are kept to a minimum.  For a large bank, they are surprisingly customer focused and are a well-recognized name.  They have an easy check deposit system where you don't need to fill out any forms, just insert the checks into the ATM.  I've been a customer for many years and have been very happy with their service overall.

name: Amily Chuang
review: Just wondering if this has ever happend to anyone:So someone stole my card number and purchased a plane ticket on Malaysia Airline from LA while I was vacationing in France. I disputed the charge online and they removed it temporarily while investigation was ongoing. A month later, I received a letter in the mail that they have "deemed the charge to be valid" and that it will be re-applied to my account.(I mean, anyone with half a brain can see that all my account activities during the time were made in France, except for that one fraudulent charge, and the name on the ticket is obvious not someone related to me!)So I called their fraud department to sort out the situation. The person taking my case was actually quite helpful. He issued me a new card and posted an adjustment for the charge. Since I got the card I've been racking up $7000 - $8000 on average per month, so normally I don't check my account in too much detail (it's really a lot of work) as long as the balance looks about right. But because of this fraud problem I almost didn't use my card at all during this past month (took a while for me to get the replacement card), and I was surprised to see a balance of about $2600. For some reason the numbers just don't look right. So I did my own calculation in spreadsheet and summed up all the transactions to-date. The balance actually ends up to be about $1300. I e-mailed them about the discrepency. They didn't even bother to check the numbers, just insisted that I pay the balance as shown in their system.I mean, I know credit card companies are always trying to squeeze money from the card holders, but they wouldn't go so far as cooking the books, would they?

name: Won Lee
review:
Amily, they wouldn't cook up books. Largely because as you mentioned, if someone like you put out lawsuits, the damage from that action is far greater than cheating someone of 1-2k dollars. 

What often happens in fraud cases, is they will withhold ALL charges. This includes legitimate ones as well as fraudulent ones. As such, when the bill is posted, you have paid a lot less money than what you should have (since legit ones are also withheld, and doesn't reflex the actual spending). 

Once investigation is complete, they will remove fraudulent ones, and which they did, did they not? Chase is great at responding to your needs in this regard, and not many banks make it this easy.  But after they got rid of fraudulent ones, they will post the legit ones, to which you have to pay for. 

This is what i suggest you go through one more time to verify actual spending and payment. 

You obviously summed up all spends,  now go to your bank's website and see how much money you have paid in total.  If that discrepancy still exists, then you should show that to Chase, and they will respond to that.

name: Megan Simmons
review: I switched from my previous bank because I was not satisfied with them at all. Luckily, just when I was going to pull out my hair from the stress, there was a flyer from Chase in the mail. They were running this special offer because a branch was opening close to my house. I couldn't think of a good reason to pass up $150 for opening a new free checking account with them. I went to the new branch and the lady who helped me was so friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed the experience of setting up a checking account with them and I am still their loyal customer. Although it's only been about 4 months, I'd say it's been a pretty good time. I haven't had any problems so I've never had to call customer service. They are by far, the best bank I have every been with.

name: Alanna
review: When making the move to Indiana from Florida, making sure I had a bank that I could use in both places was very important to me. The small town of New Haven, Indiana luckily had a Chase Bank so I made sure to open an account closest to me in Florida for anticipation of the move. Chase was wonderful on all accounts. I had a checking and savings account with them for about two years. The only reason I decided to close them was when they decided to start charging monthly fees if you didn't make over a certain amount (direct deposit). Since my work is all over the place, there are some months where it's not possible for me. If they ever had free checking accounts again or I was at a point in my life where I could make the requirements, I would use them again.

name: Nick
review: I think Chase banks are ok but I think they have a few things to improve upon.  I do like that there are so many branches located all over that you can always find an ATM or bank to use.  I was not a big fan of their online services though.  The website is very confusing and even more confusing if you want to use it to pay your bills automatically. Sometimes even though payments were set, I still questioned if it would work properly.  I think with some technology updates, they would have a way better website.  I do think they have very advanced ATMs though which a definite plus. Overall, it’s better than most others, but has room for improvement.

name: Camille Lee
review: My husband and I have a checking, savings, and college checking account with JPMorgan Chase. We used to be WaMu customers but were switched to Chase when WaMu got bought out. We initially were disappointed by the idea of change, but we have come to like Chase just fine. Chase employees are always very friendly and helpful with whatever we need to do, we can always find a Chase branch close to where we are, and the branches have pretty convenient hours as far as banks go. We have been dinged with a few finance charges, but those were our fault; Chase had warned us about things like overdraft protection fees and whatnot, and we hadn't paid enough attention.

name: Kraig
review: I came along over to Chase after the Washington Mutual debacle. I had been with Washington Mutual for 8 years before the downfall. I had always liked the people of Washington Mutual and was sad to hear they were going under. I was pretty happy to hear that they were being bought out by by Chase. I had heard of Chase but was never a customer. Liking the people at my local branch I decided to stick with them. The people in the north branch are great, they always have a treat for my dog or a lollipop for my kids. My real only complaint is that some of their employees don't seem to know how some of the deposits work. I had a client direct deposit a check. I asked the employee if deposits get posted before withdrawals and she assured me deposits do get posted first. Later the next day I found out that withdrawals do get posted first. Not a big deal but if I was short on cash it would have been. Other than that I really enjoy Chase and they have great employees.

name: Yvette
review: Chase is the best bank I’ve ever used.  I’ve tried other banks over the years, but always found my way back to Chase.  For me what sticks out most about them is their excellent customer service.  I remember the day I opened my Checking account, some years ago.  The young lady who assisted me was so friendly and professional.  We talked as if we’d known each other for quite a while and she made me feel very comfortable and secure in choosing Chase for my banking needs.  Each time since that first day, whenever I visit Chase, I am pleased that the associates always make me feel as if I’m in good hands and that they’re really there for ME.  I truly appreciate that.  I’m also grateful that my questions have consistently been answered in a timely and sufficient manner.  And lastly, it makes me feel good me that I’ve been able to access my account and my cash any time I’ve wanted to, without the slightest problem.  I’ve been a happy and loyal customer now for over 6 years and have no plans whatsoever of using any other bank from here on out.

name: rick lucas
review: I' ve been a member of Chase since it was Washington Mutual in 2003. I opened my first and only checking account with them and do not have much to complain about. I currently frequent the one in Pacific Beach, California and they are always friendly. The only frustrating experiences I've had with them was back in 2008 (I think they were still WaMu back then so this may not apply) when I was applying for a credit card through them. I had returned from Iraq so I had a good chunk of money in my account. Having never needed a credit card, but knowing that I needed to start building credit, I decided to apply for one with them. From what I understood, I was not eligible for one because I had no credit score. Yet, I had 20k in the bank with them. It was frustrating and I considered closing my account at the time, but decided not to. Since then, my experiences have been positive and I would recommend them to a friend.

name: Nicholas Tart
review: I'm a university student who switched from Bank of America to Chase because it's ATM's and banks were much more conveniently located to my school. Since switching, I haven't thought about going back. Signup was easy and fast, and my branch offered several incentives and rewards in the first few months. These incentives dried out a little, as expected, but it was still nice. They handled everything very professionally and everything about my account was very easy to understand, written in simple English. No problems so far, but I have had to report fraud on my account which was very quickly resolved. Recommended.

name: ryan muir
review: I have had a bank account at Chase for sometime now and I've had my ups and downs with them. Signing up was easy as it should be. I've had very few issues with overdrafts. One issue that I did not get resolved without much effort was in concern to an overdraft fee. I had sufficient funds in my account and had a check bounce. The customer service I received at first was not helpful at all. They were still very professional and courteous but could not help me resolve my issue. After a few weeks of interaction with different people, I finally was reimbursed. They apologized and assured that it wouldn't happen again. Every other aspect of my experience with them has been agreeable and I've had no other problems.

name: Patty
review: I have been customer of Chase Manhattan Bank for over 25 years..  During that time I have been through numerous life changes and my local Chase Manhattan branch has guided me through both setting up personal and business checking accounts and as my children grew, student and college accounts.  I like the fact that I can go into my local branch and they know me and my family.  I am also a customer of online banking and I like getting reward points on my debit card usage.

name: Derek Ober
review: I had a great experience with Chase Bank. I needed to open a new checking account because I was not enjoying my experience with my old bank. When I walked into the bank, the atmosphere was almost intimate. There was fresh lemonade available and someone to serve you snacks. The representative who helped me was very personable. It was extremely painless to set up my account. It was set up in minutes. All the fees and fine print was explained in simple terms and easily understandable. My only problem with the bank was the minimum balances on their savings accounts were a little too much so I just opened a savings account. But I would recommend Chase to anyone.

name: Bryan Cubbins
review: I've used the Chase Bank for over 5 years now. This is an excellent bank and have NEVER had one single problem from them. Their customer service is second to none and have helped me anytime I give them a call. I had a charge on my card about a year ago that was not suppose to be on there. I gave them a call and they removed it the next day. The reward program they have is better than any I have ever seen. If you are looking for an excellent bank that will protect your money that you work for then I suggest this bank.

name: Emily Mills
review: I have to say I have been very pleased with Chase Bank! I just recently switched from Fifth Third to Chase Bank in January and have so far been loving it! Pros: Online banking is AMAZING. There is almost never any problems with the site, it is easy to understand and gives detailed descriptions of everything on the site. I have never had to worry about a random charge that I didn’t understand through Chase. It always tells me in plain English what it is, and where it is coming from.Customer service representatives at the banks are always super nice and helpful.The online bill pay is amazing as well. You can set up all of your bills in your payments account and once a month, send out however much money you want to which bill and Voila!A lot of the times, when you sign up for Chase there is promotional deals where if you put $100 in your account, they’ll give you $100. Who doesn’t love that?Cons: There is a service fee per month to use my checking account. It’s not outrageously high, only $12.99/month unless I have direct deposits of over $500 a month.There aren’t a lot of locations in my area. This might be different for some, but when I need to actually go to the bank, it is a good 40-45 minute drive.In Summary:I have been really pleased with Chase Bank. The online bill pay has saved me tons of time and given me more ease of mind. Chase has it set up where I almost never even have to go to the bank for anything anymore. They even have a thing called Chase Quick Deposit, where I can take a picture of my check, and it deposits it for me. I can definitely see myself sticking with chase bank for a while!

name: Teena
review: I love Chase. I've tried banks like Bank Of America, Washington Mutual, Union Bank but never really liked any of them and most of them have hidden charges and fees, and there are no hidden fees. You just simply open an account with them that requires minimum balance (depending on account you open and just simply maintain the minimum balance. But if you're fortunate enough and have Direct deposit, then you don't have to worry about that. They don't charge pending charges like Bank of America. That's why overall Chase is worth it :) Open an account now.

name: Roberta Jane
review: I have had a good experience with Chase. When I lost my debit card in Disney World, I called them immediately. The representative I spoke to was very nice and patient. She put my card on hold (froze it) for 48 hours to make sure I had enough time to look for it. When I was not able to locate it, they closed out the debit card and issued me a new one right away with barely any questions asked (besides the necessary security questions). It took less than a week to receive my new one. All and all I have to saw Chase definitely took care of me when I was in need, away on vacation and I have yet to have anything negative to say.

name: Vincent Michaels
review: If you're thinking about going for the Chase Freedom credit card, I have two words for you, DO IT! I have been banking with Chase for 5 years and I have had their credit card for 2. I have experienced little hassle with Chase for my whole 5 years. Their rewards program is a pretty cool bonus, you won't receive massive cash back from it but hey, it is pretty good for a bank. Although, collecting the rewards can be a bit of a hassle because they sometimes forget to link the reward to the card, but that can be easily fixed by contacting them online or via a phone call. Do not be afraid of contacting them, their customer service staff is full of nice people, I have not ran into a rude or impolite customer service person.

name: WalletHub
review: Hi Vincent, I'm not familiar with a rewards card like the Chase card not being linked to the rewards program.  Can you shed a little light on what you mean?

name: Jennifer Darnell
review: I got this credit card because our credit was not so great and we wanted to build it back up.  The first 6 months we had a 500 balance.  Then it went up to 5,000 after we made above the minimum payment on time, every month.  This was great.  We didn't want to get in over our head, so we just kept it for emergencies or something we really wanted.  Well, when we went to use it the balance had returned to 500, when at this point we had almost a zero balance.  Chase explained that not using the credit did not show our credit worthiness so they lowered us back to 500.  This was dissapointing.  Although we do still have the card for emergencies, just now it is for no more than 500!  It will go up with regular payments and regular purchases.

name: WalletHub
review: Hi Jennifer, you were able to get this card with less than perfect credit?  For most customers they need very good credit to meet the application.

name: Brandon Terry
review: I've always been a big fan of Chase. I've stuck with them for quite some time and have, for the most part, not been disappointed with their service. I signed up for this card with the intention of using it to gain rewards and points and mostly as a backup to my other credit card. However, it has quickly eclipsed that card and has now become my primary card because it's so great! No annual fees and points that can be used toward awesome rewards. It's a great card that won't let you down when you need to make an important purchase or are looking to pay for something later on.

name: Von Warner
review: I'd absolutely advise against obtaining and using this Chase Sapphire Card.  The starting rates are reasonable; however, they quickly increase after only a short amount of time.  Conveniently, this rate increase is NEVER mentioned in the details when signing up.  I made the mistake of making a handful of purchases with this card just to get slammed later on with unfair, unprompted interest.  If you're looking for a solid line of credit with acceptable, well documented interest fees, then go to your bank and obtain a proper credit card.  You'll be glad you did.  Don't fall for this credit card scam.  That's exactly what this is.

name: Von Warner
review: Fair enough.  I'll remove my posts as well.  It's true that I ultimately didn't read the fine print closely enough.  Sorry for the childish response.

name: gessica montreuil
review: I was looking for a bank that offered college accounts with valuable benefits such as student loans at low interest rates, or no interest rates at all. Following one of my friends advice, I went to Chase to request information, got interested so I enrolled. This a a great bank. They have an extremely low interest on college saving account and a 0% interest if you keep a requested minimum amount on you saving account. So there is possibility for you to not pay any interest at all! They have accurate statements and your card is protected with them. I know the day will come soon that I will no longer be able to use the Chase college account but until then, it is the best account I recommend it to college student looking for low interest rates.

name: Matt Lozykowski
review: I have had this card for about 4 years now and am pretty happy with it.  The rewards used to be better (there were five categories where you would receive 5% cash back, no matter what time of year); now there are rotating categories each quarter (with only 2 or three categories per quarter giving 5% back).  The Chase Rewards Plus website also used to provide you with more discounted gift cards, but now there is a very limited selection.  The Chase Freedom card is probably still the best rewards card out there, but there are others that are getting better.

name: Roberta Jane
review: This credit card has not been a terrible experience for me. I have a $10,000 limit but never got nearly close to that limit. I only use it for vacations and major necessary purchases. The rewards points are great, and I usually trade in my points for cash back towards my bill which is so easy and convenient. They also offer great merchandise to buy with your points but I'd rather have it go towards the bill. I do all of my banking with Chase and making the credit card payments through their iPhone app is soo simple! I really can't complain or say anything negative about it.

name: Robert Brasher
review: I applied for this card and received an extremely low interest rate promotion to begin with. I was surprised to find that the interest rate did not jump as high as I expected based on my credit history. I know that I can expect to jump into the 20+ percent rate; however, I was actually pleased to find that I came in under 20 percent. I try to maintain a monthly balance – low balance – so that I am still seen as a viable customer. I haven't experimented with keeping the balance paid off, as most card companies see you as a deadbeat if you do not maintain some sort of balance.

name: Marc Wood
review: I have a Chase Rewards credit card for business. I use this credit card frequently to make random business purchases. What I like about the card is that for every dollar I spend, I receive 1 point. It’s not much, but I don’t have to guess how many points I will earn. Their point redemption program offers card holders many features. The point redemption products they offer are pretty cool, but I usually just redeem my points for cash.  I have owned the card for so long, they keep raising my credit line limit. I am grateful for my Chase Rewards card.

name: Shannon Cutts
review: It seems like every time I turn around these days Chase Bank is coming out with another credit card partnership. I suppose this is how I ended up with three different Chase Bank credit cards without even realizing it - one for Shell Gas, one for Amazon, and one for Continental (now United) Airlines. So clearly the application process gets five stars - it's so easy I barely even notice myself doing it! But the customer service has been just so-so - they outsource much of it overseas, which can get frustrating, and often they aren't able to help with good offers when I need to do a balance transfer. Overall, I much prefer my Citibank Visa even though I don't get some of the special perks like points or airline miles. I also am not a huge fan of some of the, shall we say, less than smart business decisions Chase has recently been outed for in the news. Because of this, I don't really trust Chase Bank the way I do my bank (Wells Fargo) or Citibank. But this is just one person's experience, and obviously I am not unhappy enough to close my accounts with Chase. They are okay - that is both the best and the worst I can say about my experiences with Chase to date.

name: Mike de Water
review: I banked with Chase for a few years after they bought out Washington Mutual where I had an account. The transition to Chase was seamless, I didn't have to do anything. However, once my account was set up and running, I began to have problems. Although the people working at my branch were the same, suddenly they had much less leeway in how they handled my problems. Fees and charges started coming from nowhere, hidden behind a vague 'it's policy'.On the plus side, the online banking was quick and easy, the tellers at my local branch were always friendly. The day to day operations were top notch, as long as I didn't have a problem. However, once a problem cropped up it was tough to actually get through it without waiting on hold for an hour or more, and going outside the local branch for help. I was finally forced to switch banks, and to be honest I don't really miss anything about Chase except the friendly people helping me in my local branch.

name: Pete Rock
review: Lots of people are against big banks these days, but in over two years with Chase, I've never had a single problem. I have my primary checking account and two credit cards with them.To start with, I signed up because of a promotion awarding $200 for new checking customers. The sign up was smooth, and the teller that helped me through was great. About six months later, I was offered a credit card promotion called "Pay and Get," or something. If, for a six month period,I refrained from using my main CC, and paid at least $150 towards it every month, I would be rewarded with a $150 credit. I did so and received my credit promptly. I thought it was a great promotion to help motivate people to lessen debt. But the point of these stories is that by using Chase, in a period of about a year I reaped $350 in cash rewards for doing very little.On top of that, I use a Chase Freedom Card, which pays 1% back on all purchases, and 5% on various categories that change quarterly. I've made about $50 back just on groceries in the last two months.As a bank, I have had no issues with Chase whatsoever. There are plenty of locations, so I never have a problem finding an ATM. The ATMs are super quick, much faster than my previous bank. I have yet to use their check-depositing smartphone App, but the ability to deposit a check via your phone's camera is pretty cool. One thing I do take advantage of is their online bill-paying system. It's super easy to pay my student loans and phone bill right from my checking account, without having to risk inputting my bank info into third-party websites.The Chase website is very well-integrated, linking all your accounts together and displayed on one main screen.I would recommend Chase to someone looking to open a checking account, and especially if you already use one of their credit cards. Just because a bank is big, it doesn't mean they're automatically bad.

name: Mar
review: I have been extremely satisfied with my experiences with Chase so far. I’ve been with them since October of 2010, so about 1 year and 7 months. In this time I’ve had to deal with a few issues regarding my checking account, including fraudulent charges made from the United Kingdom, that wiped out my entire account right before rent and bills were due. I was, of course, frantic about what I would do because I never pay my bills late, and I didn’t want to have to do that because of something I couldn’t control. I called Chase, and right away they helped me request a new card, and deactivate the old one, as well as refer me to another department which gave me enough of a balance while my claim was to be filed so that I could pay my bills. That was really great of them! It only took 2 more days to get my claim through, and get my money back, since they had to wait for the fraudulent charge to clear first. Overall, I haven’t had anything but this happen, and I love that I can, on days that I’m going to get paid, charge things on my account if I really need to and pay them before the end of the day, and not get charged overdraft fees. I will continue to bank with Chase for a very long time!

name: Ateeb T Khawaja Mr.
review: I have had an account with Chase bank for nearly a year now and I have to admit that I have not been disappointed. To start with, I only had to meet with Chase Customer Representatives once in my life, and that was when I went to open my account. I have had zero problems that with them that would have required me to visit in person, or even have any need to email/call them from home. They have one of the best banking system in which I can control most of my finances online quite easily and hassle free.The application process was quite easy, streamlined and timely. They even gave me a $200 coupon bonus for opening an account with them. I have two other bank accounts, and with each one I had to call them at least twice each to get my account opened, but with Chase Bank I had none of these problems. I went, submitted the application, went home and the account was opened in the minimum time they told me it would take.The representative was very polite, knowledgeable and helpful. He explained all charges that may or may not be levied on my account based on different services I would use, minimum balance etc. He even printed out a detailed summary of all charges that could be applicable to me. I am happy to say that I am aware of all the charged they levy, and have not had to face any "hidden" charges other banks usually charge and do not inform you of. I do a lot of selling and buying online which involves sending and receiving payments from a number of different sources like Paypal and Skrill etc. My Chase account allows me do both, at either zero cost, or a minimum one which is bonus point. I can easily wire money to anyone I need.Their have a variety of credit cards with both cash back and points focuses. I chose cash back since they have a wide range of stores and offers which I can avail to minimize my costs, and earn cash as well.On the whole I would rate Chase Bank at 10/10. I am very happy with the services I have received, would highly recommend Chase Bank to anyone looking to open a new account.

name: Casey Charvat
review: I have had a bad experience with this bank. They used to be my primary bank but there was some kind of mix up and issue that caused all kinds of problems. They submitted direct deposit forms and over drafted my account without me having any knowledge of this occurring. I had got some direct deposit information from them regarding direct deposit months earlier but opted out when my account was accidentally overdrawn. They automatically submitted my paycheck for direct deposit without my consent or knowledge. I cannot say if all chase banks are this bad but the one I did use until recently is. They did help me get some of the money back so they did help resolve the issue but it took weeks for it to be resolved.I give them one out of five stars.

name: Carl Randall
review: My father in law & I recently switched to our local Chase branch, at first for the $100 bonus to open a new account for each of us.
